Reviews.Title: “Classy Joint”
Reviews.Author: Ray P
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this wonderful property the first week of March. The rooms are spacious and the furnishings are great. The bedding and towels were luxurious. The service for all of the shops and restaurants was top notch. The food was all excellent. This is what a first class resort should look and be like. I recommend it to anyone who wants luxury in their dream vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, lots of families, expensive food”
Reviews.Author: JDC121
Reviews.Content: The rooms, the lobby, public areas, and the beach, are all fantastic. They don't call this area the Beverly Hills of Hawaii for nothing. The resort is beautifully landscaped, just as you would expect from a resort with the Waldorf Astoria badge. Just bear in mind there are a lot of families at this resort. During the day it seems there are kids everywhere. I would rate this resort higher, but the price of food and drink was so high. I understand this is a top-quality resort, but this was insane. For example, my friend and I stopped at the cafe and bought a bottle of Dasani water and a bottle of Mountain Dew: $12. A bag of Sun Chips: $8. At the bars it's $14.50 for a cocktail. Also, at the time, the reusable plastic tiki cup seemed like a good value when the bartender explained it. Don't bother. It's $22 for your first drink in a tiki cup, and the rest are $14.50. There's no discount, but the bartender will make it sound that way. Don't fall for it. Fortunately there's a mall within a 5 minute walk of the resort grounds, which has a handful of eateries. I recommend Cheeseburger Island Style (it's not a Cheesburger in Paradise, which we originally thought). I was hoping to get in a few good runs during this trip since I'm training for a marathon, but the sidewalk network in the neighborhood is incomplete. There is a nice path that follows the shoreline for about 3 miles. Grand Wailea is situated at a pretty central point along the path, so you can walk or run for about 1.5 miles in either direction.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort for Families, Business and Weddings”
Reviews.Author: Yahoodf
Reviews.Content: We were at the Grand Wailea Resort for a business rewards trip. We extended our stay after the rewards trip at the Marriott next door to the Grand Wailea. (see review) Overall the Grand Wailea was amazingly beautiful. We read some negative reviews on this hotel and overall it was a 4-star hotel. We were with an all-expense paid business group so it was all amazing - however if we were paying ourselves - the drinks ($15+) and food were expensive. The food was really great for buffet food - we had a luau and the food was really very impressive (I have been involved with the James Beard foundation, and highly involved in the gourmet food industry for many years) - great quality Ahi, and top notch tempura and sushi. All of the cooked food was close to perfect. Great morning breakfast buffet – we ate at the buffet everyday b/c it was included as part of the group – but expensive (I think $26pp) but worth it if you are a breakfast person. I've been to about 12 Luau dinners and I think this was the best one ever. Due to the weather our luau was indoors, but the fire show was outside; and all in all it was an amazing show with very talented performers. The pools are ethereal – and extensive. There are rope swings, slides, winding rivers, a grotto bar and multiple hot tubs. We did not have an opportunity to use all of the water features. There is even a water elevator – (the original owner’s son was paralyzed from the waist down and he wanted his son to have access to the slides, so he built a water elevator.) We never sat at the adult only pool. There are plenty of chairs and the staff is pretty good about not letting people put their things on a chair for several hours to reserve it while they are on a whale watch. It seemed like most people complied with this rule; and finding chairs was not a big issue. There are many cabanas that you have to rent. We did not rent one personally, but our company rented the big one by the main pool. The slides close at 4 or 5pm (I forget) but it did seem a bit early as the kids still wanted to use the water features. Specific helpful details on this hotel: * They make you pay for the cabanas – I think the umbrellas on the beach are free. * Many people put towels on chairs early in the morning to "reserve: them for use later in the day. The hotel has a 1 hour reserve limit and they seem to be good about that, so no one can reserve a chair in the morning a leave for a boat excursion for several hours - it seems to work very well -we always followed the rules and were able to find a chair when needed. Some of the chairs are broken; so be careful as I sat on a chair a fell through it. This is not what you would expect at this type of upscale resort, but I noticed several chairs with lose fittings after I fell through. *There is a zero entry sand pool for handicap accessability along with chairs for water entry in each pool area. *They have complimentary water stations with fresh cold water through-out the pool areas – very nice when you need a quick cold drink of water. * If you are looking for a “W” type of contemporary hotel this is not for you. It is basically a family upscale resort, with a great pools and slides for kids – with pool side restaurants and a grotto bar for adults who want to play and have a great tropical drink at the same time. This hotel has and elegant, detailed European ambiance; rather than a chic, minimalist feel. *There were many life guards and the pools were well attended. *The rooms were a bit dated, but very comfortable beds and elegant bathrooms that were perfect – this is not a chic hotel, so no dark wood shutters opening to the bed area. More ornate than chic. In summary this is a beautiful upscale resort – perfect for families, corporate events, and weddings. The grounds are amazing and this is likely one of the most beautiful places to have a wedding (with the chapel on the grounds). Great food – probably the best buffet style food I’ve ever had. However, it may not be the perfect hotel for a romantic honeymoon; (have the wedding there). A great place to go back once the honeymoon is over and you have kids. We felt guilty that our kids were not with us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Roxiematilda
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Maui and had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Wailea. The entire place is incredible. Every where you look there is something to see. The pools and all of the grounds were filled with lush, tropical foliage. It was a feast for the eyes! We really could not stop taking pictures. The beach was gorgeous as well. Our room was great. Bed was super comfy. Soft fluffy towels were always plentiful. The food was pretty good as well. Had the sushi several times and was always super. We did have dinner at Humu one night and while that was very good, I thought the food could have been a tiny bit better. The ambiance and service were spectacular, so I would still recommend it. The only little complaint that i had was that it seemed no matter how early you got to the pool (7 AM) there were still no lounge chairs available, they all had towels claiming them. Same on the beach. The hotel does have a strict use them or use them policy and we did see them "unclaim" chairs. You just have to ask, and they will help you find a spot. Used the Spa, and that truly is world class as well. For those that just want some coffee in the morning, next door in the Shopping Plaza is a Honolulu Coffee Co. Coffee is great, and reasonably priced. There is also a convenience store where you can purchase beer, wine, liquor, snacks, sunblock - again reasonably priced. At GW, things are expensive. Drinks are $14.50. Beer is $8.50. But, it is an incredible property, and just about worth the $$ you pay to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed”
Reviews.Author: dwigg
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grand for a conference for me and a vacation for my wife and college age daughter. We stayed a week. My wife and I read many reviews here before the trip, just to get some ideas on how we might make our experience more enjoyable, and what to watch out for ....if there are issues, better to know about it ahead of time. We had some concerns having read a few very negative reports, but we had a great time,and we were very impressed by the whole operation. Let me start by saying that everyone we met in Maui was very friendly...not just the Grand staff, but everyone. It was remarked upon by us at different times. People were just as helpful and nice as could be. I stopped to get instructions at a hardware store..it was on the Kula highway. The guy was not only super nice but knew exactly where we were going and had a little map he gave me that took us right to the spot. The first thing that you do when you get to the hotel is let the valet team take care of your car. The valet system worked great! Then step into the lobby of the Grand...if you could call it a lobby...it was awesome! It made me smile being there. We have done some traveling and stayed at some nice hotels, but this was beautiful. Nothing kitschy like you would see in Vegas. Even my daughter was impressed....she said WOW. That says it all. The only ding was that we were early and the check-in time is 4, so we had to wait for a couple hours. But waiting in the open lobby area was pleasant. Next time we will have a change of clothes at hand and go walk on the beach or swim. They took our cell number and called. I had to go to the conference while my wife dealt with getting the baggage moved to the room. It was no problem, and she texted me that the room was 'lovely'. We were on the chapel garden, and had a beautiful garden and ocean view. The room was very clean and the maid service was excellent...no chocolate on your pillow at turn down, but fresh towels every evening were nice. The grounds and the beach were gorgeous! The weather was a little windy, but otherwise perfect....it is a dry area, so they don't get bothered by much rain. We did eat at the hotel on a few occasions. The pineapple upside down cake is not as good as at Roy's in Waikiki, but we found Roy's to have been our lucky find of the trip for food...the best. We tried to have dessert at Humahuma one evening, but made the mistake of telling them we only wanted dessert before we were seated, and then they didn't have any available seating, which we could see was not true. So we went to the Bistro and had dessert there. We did the Luau one evening and really liked it. The food was good, and the show was enjoyable and not too long. Plan ahead and buy your ticket through Costco...I understand you can save about $25 per person that way. Get there at 4 for the seat assignments, and you will have a much better table. We were toward the front in the middle. I could go on, but more would start to become tedious, and you will want to find out some things for yourself. We loved it at the Grand Wailea! It is expensive, but worth the splurge if you want to stay in a beautiful resort in a tropical paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: livetwotravel
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the grounds, service and the pool area is amazing. Truly something for everyone. The beach is one of the best on the island with decent snorkeling, too. Room was nice and the bed was so comfortable. Food offerings a plus, especially with the Four Seasons next door. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Sandra L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel and lovely public areas... We upgraded our room to the Napua Club and thought that it was not really value for money. Having stayed on executive floors in many hotels they did not provide anything extra as far as canapes were concerned. The room was comfortable and clean and the maids took great pride in presenting the room at its best.. Thought that $824 was expensive for what we got .. The pool grounds were lovely and the spa was amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Great resort ... Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCouple00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 5 nights (2 adults + 6 month old) and loved the resort. Its a huge resort (we like that ... others might not) with the most amazing pools. We loved the pools that all join up by water slides ... was lots of fun for adults and kids! The grounds are beautiful and are well maintained. The whole place is great, kept very clean, the rooms were great with a huge bathroom. We stayed in an ocean view room (3rd floor) which had beautiful views over the pools and the ocean as well. The food options were very limited unfortunately. We had buffet breakfast included which was good (but i've had better). When it came to lunch, there were a couple of options, but we felt dinner was a bit of a let down. There were only two restaurants open for dinner. Menu's are not extensive so after eating there a couple of nights, we didn't want to keep eating the same foods. It would be great if they had a change in menu every night, would have kept us coming back. If you hire a car - you can drive to other nearby places with a LOT more options for dining. One thing that really put a damper on our vacation is the service at the front desk. We had prepaid for 1/3 of our accommodation months in advance, however when checking in the hotel put a hold on our credit card for the full amount of the accommodation - which meant that we were unable to use our credit card for the rest of the entire holiday! Tried to understand why they would do that when they already received that money - but front desk couldn't explain anything to me. I've stayed at many resorts in the past and have never had them do this. I pay for the accommodation in advance so I wouldn't need to worry about having the money for it while staying there - backfired in the end. I'm home now, after checking out of the hotel a week ago - and they still haven't released the money on the credit card. Really disappointing ... we absolutely loved this place and would love to come back again ... but not sure we will after having this issue with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Makes Maui Even Better Than It Already Is!”
Reviews.Author: ahollander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon in Maui and stayed at the Grand Wailea and had the best time! Of course, we had heard that Grand Wailea is the place to stay which is why we booked this hotel, but we did not know all of the little things this hotel had to offer that will keep us coming back here over any other hotel on the island. The grounds are truly beautiful! I was apprehensive about staying at such a large hotel at first, but it is so easy to navigate around the property and all of the different pools and slides all connect to one another. The grotto bar (in the water) is our favorite!The beach is not only beautiful on this side of the island but literally a few steps away from the pool, so it is super convient to go back and forth. They have this program at the hotel where we rented unlimited access to kayaks, paddle boarding, snorkeling gear, etc. for four days and it was totally worth the money; especially compared to the cost to purchase these types of activities outside the hotel. We also took advantage of the beautiful spa and fitness center which I only have good things to say. All of the staff were very professional and friendly from the bellmen to the maid service. After our bed was turned down at night, they would turn on the radio so you had music playing when you came in. We even didn't mind the mandatory daily valet parking, bc we could just call for our car when we knew we were leaving and it would be at the front when you arrive along with any directions you need. When we compared that to the time it would take to get to your car if you self parked, we felt like it was worth it. We got breakfast buffet included when we booked our package which was really useful, so you should check into the current promotion when you are booking your reservation. Next time we return, we will be excited to try the new restuaurant with chef, Alan Wong. I think it is opening in April and sounds great. Again, wonderful experience! We had originally looked into Four Seasons and now seeing everything Grand Wailea has to offer, we can't imagine going anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beach is a Zoo”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla S
Reviews.Content: We were here for a meeting recently. The facility is very large and a little flashy, but our room was lovely and overlooked the ocean. Maid service was excellent and towels were changed twice a day. We did not see hoards of people milling about inside of the hotel - no lines at reception or crowds of people in the lobby or bar areas. There was an entire bank of concierge desks to help you. We never had to wait for an elevator. We called ahead for our car, so it arrived usually when we did. We did not see lines of people in the front of the hotel waiting for cars or taxis. They are very efficient in that respect. The hotel itself is quite peaceful inside. However, once you get outside to the pool and beach areas, all of that changes. It becomes another world. The beach is overcrowded, with people sitting practically on top of each other. You really must get out there by 8 or 9 am to insure that you secure chairs on the beach, and after the attendants set you up, the service ends. No one comes around to take a drink order. Also, unless you pay $94 a day for a cushioned lounge chair with a canopy, there is little shade at the pool. There are several places to have lunch outside, but the food is like airline food and you are served unceremoniously on paper plates. One presumably comes to Hawaii for the sun and beaches and not to stay inside, but I found it much more pleasant to sit on my room balcony and look out over the ocean instead of being herded below. The inside of the hotel is quiet like a spa, and the pool and beach areas are like Macy's at Christmas. Therefore, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britters32
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights including my wedding night. Overall the hotel is nice. The grounds are beautiful. The pool area is awesome. My only complaint is that they are not very accommodating. Considering how much we paid a night to stay here and it is a Waldorf Astoria hotel, I figured the service would be better. The security took my wedding photographer and put her in a security room for about an hour. She has shot photos at this resort many times and has never had a problem. They told her I would have to pay $500 for her to take any pictures of me on property. She had to sign a form stating she would be fined if she took any photos. This is ridiculous. I am a guest of the resort. Since she was held up with them for a hour, that was a hour of getting ready photos I did not get. Then after my Trash the Dress shoot I asked the concierge if they could clean my dress and ship it home for me. He told me they don't clean wedding dresses and could direct me to where I could get a box to ship it myself. Normally I don't rely on hotels to do things for me but this was wedding related so thought they would offer these services. Especially since they have a million weddings here. The pool was overly crowded. They have a sign that says they will remove your belongings from the pool chairs if you have been gone for longer than an hour. I'm not sure they were keeping track of this since we could not find a single pool chair that didn't have a towel on it. We ended up in a grass area away from the pools. Due to being so far away, no one ever came to see if we wanted cocktails so we had to go to the bar ourselves for it. A bit of a bummer on your honeymoon. The restaurant was superb along with the spa. The whirlpools were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds...”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Q
Reviews.Content: The extravagant tropical landscaping and maze of heated pools really set this destination apart from other hotels in the area. The rooms and buildings themselves are starting to show their age, but the beds are comfortable, the sheets are soft, and the bathroom spacious. This is a very family-friendly hotel, but also has designated areas for adults to escape the kids if needed. The views are spectacular and you are a few footsteps away from the beach and nearby hotels with better dining options (you MUST walk to The Four Seasons for brunch at Duo). I would definitely stay here again, but if you are looking for a slightly classier stay for a couple (instead of family) I'd stay at the Four Seasons next door. Oh, and the water slide is better than you'd think. Had a blast!! Overpriced drinks by the pool ($15-$22 cocktails), but I guess that's what you expect when on Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service; friendly staff; gorgeous views; perfect family resort”
Reviews.Author: dot h
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in the Grand Wailea. The front desk immediately upgraded us to a top floor with perfect ocean view at no extra charge. Even though the Grand Wailea has been around for quite some time, the management has kept this resort very updated and clean. The staff is very friendly; the concierge suggested some terrific restaurants off the beaten path and sent us on a few really fun excursions for snorkeling, whale watching, etc. Plenty of room around the pool; tons of chairs, umbrellas, towels, wait staff, etc. Beach chairs / umbrellas at the ready; kayaking, snorkeling, paddle boarding all right there with helpful staff. My kids, age 12 & 10 loved the pool with all the slides, crazy lazy river, rope swing, etc. We felt comfortable staying in our chairs while they went from slide to slide. Very safe environment. And for those who need exercise while on vacation and not necessarily in the mood for the gym, a 1.5 mile paved walking path along the beach is most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: mydogxena
Reviews.Content: We contacted Grand Wailea while we were visiting Hawaii about a possible event and we were not treated well by the staff and not given any information. Then, we were contacted by a member of their management and told to give them a second chance. We did give them a second chance and the results were the same. Grand Wailea does not care about customer service. They do not follow through with promises and they do not treat their customers the way a high end resort should.

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's View - Best Pool in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC HOTEL POOL The Grand Waileaâ€™s pool area is so large, it has its own name, the Wailea Canyon Activity Pool. Donâ€™t let its singular name fool you, though, the Activity Pool is actually nine pools, seven waterslides (two of them are both long and fast for the thrill-seekers in your family), a white-water rapids slide (a short, wide, fast ride), a spectacular array of man-made caves and grottos (one nearly hiding a large hot tub and one housing a swim-up bar), tropical landscaping and a water elevator. Before my visit, I read about the Grand Waileaâ€™s water elevator and was very interested to see it in action. It seems it is the worldâ€™s first and, in my opinion, a brilliant way to turn the process of collecting water to supply the waterslides into an attraction. At the lowest water level, a water-proof door allows guests access to a circular water silo cleverly disguised in rock. Riders can climb up onto a giant inflatable tube and be lifted up as the water level rises. Onlookers can watch their progress through windows placed every so often up the rock. At the top, guests can hop out and ride down the waterslides. Other fun water attractions here are the adults-only pool, the Tarzan rope swing, the lazy river and the baby beach. The layout and variation of water rides enables families with children (and young-at-heart parents) to all have an equally good time. The rope swing is extremely popular with the 8- to 13-year-old crowd, but I saw a few dads try it out as well. The lazy river is less lazy than any Iâ€™ve personally tried; the current is delightfully strong and will carry an adult around the pools easily, even with a child in tow. The baby beach is another exceptional idea. This man-made mini beach has sand without the pesky waves â€“ perfect for babies to sit and splash in while their parents look on. During both days I played at Grand Wailea, I saw both kids and adults (even grandmas and grandpas) thoroughly enjoy the waterslides, elevator, lazy river and all that this wonderful pool has to offer. The Wailea Canyon Activity Pool is a fantastic family vacation find. THE HOTEL Beyond the pool, the hotel and spa are beautifully designed. Tiles and stucco finishes are just beginning to show their age, but the overall tropical ambiance is still intact. Rooms at the Grand Wailea are decorated in a Hawaiian plantation style using pale greens, yellows and blues. Shutters are used instead of drapes at the large front sliding door to the lanai. From my comforts of home checklist, the robes are cozy, rooms have clothes hampers (amazing), and the bathroom has double sinks. Coffee is available in the bathroom (unusual), but much better coffee can be had in the hotelâ€™s coffee shop (at a price). Several shops here do a great job of providing for last-minute retail needs and wants. MY RECOMMENDATION Although the Grand Wailea is a good choice for couples, because the beach can be a little crowded and this hotel boasts the best water park-style pool EVER, this hotel is best for families. My husband and I have a video review site on YouTube. See our videos by visiting YouTube.com/TravelbyLori. You can read my other written reviews by searching "Lori Metze" at Examiner.com.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jared B
Reviews.Content: This resort is fabulous. Don't listen to all the reviews that say it is too kid friendly. The pool is so large you can pick a spot that is more remote. The beach is excellent. Humuhumu restaurant is awesome

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nettsu
Reviews.Content: I loved the Grand Wailea. We went there as part of a corporate event (my partner's work hired a large chunk of the resort so I can't really comment on the pricing etc... except I know it was expensive). Some people in group found some of the staff a little bit cool and not overly friendly but I can't say I experienced that - I found all of the staff really helpful and quite friendly. I think that's also because they found me constantly chasing one of our terrible two toddlers amusing. The size of the resort is a little daunting - it took a while to get my bearings and then work out where everything was (I lost the kids pool). The kids pool and the waterslides are fantastic. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous and the girls fell in love with the Koi. We had to stop and watch the fishies at each of the Koi ponds if were going anywhere in the resort (turning what could be a 5 minute walk into about 30 minutes). The bar in the centre of the resort (near the front desk) does some fantastic drinks - easily the best Mai Tais we had in Hawaii and the coconut chill martini was absolutely gorgeous! Kudos to the barman too! The Volcano Bar near the pools was ok - the kid's lunches were awesome and come with a little pail & shovel - very cute! We got a couple of tiki drinks - you pay USD$22 for the drink container and they are very flimsy plastic - the pineapple container didn't last a day. Which isn't that much of a drama but it seems a bit of a rip-off when you are paying $22 for it. Spa Grande was good if not a little awkward. Maybe I'm a prude... but I've never done communal baths where people are wandering around naked. When I've done mineral baths previously I've always been in a room by myself. Although the mineral baths are excellent! And the roman showers - almost as good as the massage I got! Marilyn was a fabulous masseur - I highly recommend her. I enjoyed our experience at the Grand Wailea and I'm happy we got to go. It's one of the better hotels I've ever been too and the setting and the grounds are just absolutely gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: CWAC12
Reviews.Content: If they could rob you they would. When we checked in and inquired about a microwave for the room which the website implies is a complementary service we were told there would be one time of $25 charge. We passed. The next day I asked again and it was $5 delivery +7/day. The next day my wife asked and it became $5 + 8/day :-). This Complementary service is getting more expensive with each passing day. The room is decent size but cutting 3 square feet from an old ugly tile in the bathroom and replacing the small areas with marble does not constitute renovation. The chairs on the balcony are so dirty that I am afraid to sit on them.

Reviews.Title: “Food is BLAH and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a beautiful condo property a short beach stroll from the Grand Wailea, and decided to eat lunch here one day. Given it's reputation for luxury and the "Waldorf Astoria" branding, we thought it would be a treat. The entire meal, as mentioned in my title, was just Blah. It was edible, but every item was absolutely bland, boring, and showed zero effort or imagination (not to mention flavor). Our meal for 2 adults and 2 children rang in at about $120. Pretty pricey for what seemed like pre-prepared grocery store takeout food. A real disappointment, and certainly motivated us to not stay here. (Restaurant tip for anyone in the area: "Monkeypod" is an absolutely fantastic new restaurant in the area. It's either a long walk or a very short drive from the Wailea hotel strip. Amazing food -- funky, unique, flavorful. And, although it's not cheap, it's less expensive than any dining option at the Grand Wailea. Location is straight up the hill from the Wailea shopping mall)

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: BigorangeVolunteer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 31 st wedding anniversary and it was the most memorable. The facilities are fantastic, the staff very friendly, and everyone makes you feel special. This is a dream vavaction spot. We have traveled around the world and this hotel is one of the best. The best in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: Siaubas
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, clearly. Very much enjoyed the focus on artwork. Service and staff effort was first rate - except for my concierge experience I'll note later. Until the new restaurant opens, the resort only has 2 full service restaurants and both are oriented for ocean views. Its impossible to get a reservation for either resort restaurant from open to 8pm every day without advanced reservations as they are fully booked with sunset viewers. Both restaurants are good and my dinner at Humuhumu was a highlight of the trip. I'll note that this was my first trip to Maui - a place that was recommended by friends as THE island to experience a slower pace and quiet relaxation. My rooms lanai was great. I watched the sunset from there every night and I loved it. But the resort itself is busy - with alot of families with children, business conferences, etc. I saw the amenities before I arrived so I cant say this was unknown but I hoped for more in the way of adult quiet. My experience with the concierge service was much poorer than the Waldorf Astoria name would imply. I visited twice. Once inquiring how to order and ship fruit and flowers to the mainland. The other was to book a restaurant reservation for my birthday - which at that point I saw as a necessity as, previously noted, restaurant reservations in the Wailea area are tough. For the fruit and flowers inquiry I was handed a brochure that I could use to order from a local company. As much as I tried, I was looking for the concierge to understand I wanted them to arrange the order to my home address. Instead I walked away with a brochure. For my birthday dinner, since the Grand Wailea concierge doesnt appear to have access to preferred tables at their own resort - I was sent offsite to the Four Seasons. My dinner at Duo was very good - and that time at the Four Seasons resort next door showed me that it was likely the place I would visit next as it was more adult oriented and was more responsive to service requests. The Duo staff presented me with a birthday desert. The Grand Wailea, after telling the concierge I was there for my birthday, didnt present me with any greeting at all. I wasnt in Maui expecting birthday freebies but something, anything would have been nice. As many have posted, the additional costs ie parking and resort fees seem unnecessary. Include it in the room rate and be done with it. I'm a Hilton Diamond member and the lack of Diamond amenities was disappointing. The rooms are showing signs of wear, ie dented walls, chipped bathroom tiles - but these are small details. The room itself was very fine. But again, not Waldorf Astoria level given what I associate that name with.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: msplt
Reviews.Content: This resort is very nice. My family thoroughly enjoyed our vacation. Our terrace room was spacious and extremely comfortable. The hotel has some features worth noting. The pool is very entertaining, yet there is also a quiet adult pool plus a grassy hill for lounging away from the excitement of the rope swing, water elevator and various slides. Poolside water was readily available and distributed on multiple occassions. All our interactions with hotel staff were positive. Folks were friendly and helpful. The reception desk agent spent extra time with us as we checked in. Wireless internet in your room and throughout the hotel was a pleasant surprise as it is not uncommon for hotels to charge up to $15/day. Valet service was always prompt and they included chilled water at each pickup. Yes, I agree $30 is a bit much along with the resort fee each day, however you will find this at the other resorts as well. You might consider taking a cab from the airport and then renting a car for just a few days of your stay. It is also nice to not stand in line for a car rental after your long flight to the islands. There is a rental desk in the hotel. Be prepared for $20 hamburgers as you find at other island upscale resorts. We have also stayed at the Fairmont in Wailea and frequently stay at their properties. It is also a lovely resort, but we wanted to try the Grand Wailea for it's pool complex since we were travelling with a teenager. Overall we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great time, but as other have said - pricey”
Reviews.Author: EDH2022
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic. The pool area is the best in Maui. Our room (first floor by the pool) was great. My only real complaint was the price. If you are going with kids, I suggest paying up to stay on the first floor by the pool. It was really nice to just open the door and let my daughter run down to the pool (about 20 yards away). The pools close at 10pm so there is no problem iwth noise and the slides close at 5pm, so pretty much after that the pools are really quiet. Loved the grounds, the luau was very nice, but expensive. The spa (according to my wife) was great. Concierge and Rose (one of the greeters) were extremely helpful and friendly. If you can, take a trip to the Maui tropical plantation and go zip lining!!! The family loved it, including my 9 year old daughter. Say hi to Alex, Jerimiah and "Sasquatch" (that's what they called him, I can't remember his actual name) for me. They were great and they put my daughter at ease. The prices in the Grand Wailea gift stores were comparable to the shops in Lahaina, so you can do some of your shopping there. But definitely take a trip to Safeway and buy your snacks and drinks. You'll save a ton of money instead of $14 drinks at the pool. And the hotel provides an empty fridge to put stuff in - no forced mini bar junk. As my title suggests, the hotel is pricey. Be prepared to spend $30 per day for the valet and $25 per day for the "use of facilities." Neither one of which is optional. With that said, we would go back tomorrow if we could. Definitely the best family resort on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but overpriced,nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: jsksOrinda
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Wailea and the property is quite gorgeous. Unfortunately I am not fond of the excess resort fees and MANDATORY $30/day plus tax and tip valet parking fees .There is no option to self park so if you need to run up to your room for a few minutes it is always a hassle.For us it is a deal breaker that we would not return. Kind of like the airline baggage fees that everyone loves so much.... On a positive note the pools are are spacious and kid and adults both love the swimming. The entire place is huge and you need a few days to absorb it all.The beach is very close ,too. So basically if you can afford the place you will probably have a great time . But if the fees make you crazy ,don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: robert w
Reviews.Content: Thought I was going to a hotel that would excel in customer service and when I got there there were 20 people in line to check in and 3 people checking them in. It took 30 minutes to get to the front of the line only to be told if you don't have a reservation you can't check in even if they have rooms available. Which they did. So I went over to the house phone and asked for reservations. The girl told me they had no ocean front rooms which a online service said they did. So I hung up and made the reservation with a online service. Stood in another line for 30 minutes and now I am told they do not have my reservation. By this time I asked to speak to a manager. SO all of the sudden they find my room. A gentlemen comes out and tells me he is the manger and is sorry they have 250 people checking in that day. Do I care? A hotel of this caliber should have enough service personal to handle the business of such a large resort. The bellmen said it happens all the time. The Internet did not work in my room and I called there support and they said it was broke and they would report it. Never did work the whole time I was there. Then the checking out. Dont want to bore you with the same service I had since I had gotten there. Sad, A very nice resort with terrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, however a little to pricy”
Reviews.Author: Pashworth1
Reviews.Content: Location on Maui, fantastic, hotel suberbe, however like most US style resorts a little clinical and real local culture absent. Plenty of eateries and activities. Ideal place to bring children with the pool and beach and all needs catered for if you just want to stay in the resort. Spa also very good.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to my beloved Grand Wailea?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: liketorun
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the grand wailea was in 1994 and we have stayed there about 12 times over the past 18 years. We loved it so much that we joined the member program. Just finished a trip there this week and must say we were disappointed. Here goes: 1) We stayed in Napua tower which we have done several times over the years. Our room, which was attached to a suite, was mismatched in decorations and paint, very tired looking, chipped furniture (bedside table missing a handle), mattresses were horrible. One mattress was so broken down there was a giant valley in the middle of it. Rooms just look and feel like they have been neglected. Cleaning staff did nice job of keeping room clean. Napua tower no longer a value. Breakfast very limited in selection with plated fruit (apparently so you don't take too much), and the appetizer selection in the evening also plated cheese and one, maybe two hot appetizers. Definitely not worth the extra room rate to stay there. On a positive, staff in napua tower very friendly and accommodating. 2) Forced valet parking at $30 a day is not cool. I am more than happy to park my own car and walk. 3) Food and drink prices throughout the resort are obscene. So much so that we now purchase all food either from the grocery store or the general store in the mall next door. By the way, the general store has a fantastic lunch selection for cheap. We can afford to stay at the Grand Wailea, but don't appreciate being literally robbed for the price of a meal by the pool. $75 for a sandwich lunch for two is stupid. It's food, people! You only get to keep it for a few hours, if you know what I mean! 4) Beach umbrellas are free, which is a plus - you used to have to pay for them. However, they are in such poor condition that it makes the beach area so unattractive. They are faded, broken, lopsided. Look awful and not 5 star quality. 5) Pool area feels dirty. Bathrooms stink, pathways are filthy. We's given up on pool chairs during busy seasons because of the incredible hassle and lack of seating. 6) Napua tower rooms very noisy. People singing and drinking in bar in the middle, (one night large group drinking and toasting until midnight. Constantly yelling "Salute!"), and then large groups have dinner/luas on the lawn. Noise in stereo. Not relaxing for two adults not with a convention. 7) The general feeling is that you are being repeatedly violated. Absolutely nothing is free in this hotel and that makes people like me feel as if they have been taken advantage. It's a shame. Grand Wailea would do well to take lessons from the Ritz in customer service. The little free things make people feel welcome and special. So, Overall, just disappointed and saddened that this hotel feels like it is falling apart and that we are nickel and dimed at every corner. The rate you think you are paying is not really the rate. Add the valet, the resort charge, the resort tax and you've increased your rate by 150 a night. We are returning to Maui in June and for the first time in 18 years, we will not be staying at the Grand Wailea, but a neighboring hotel. Still absolutely love the area, but for the five star price, we are choosing to actually stay in a five star resort. Sadly, Seems to be an end to an era for us unless the Grand gets its act together.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: SangPei
Reviews.Content: We have been here several times with our kids. Great family hotel, pools are amazing. Not a quiet place due to lots of kids there. Wailea is a very classy section of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Scurry49428
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have visited. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The grounds are incredible and the pools are the best I have seen. I would love to return and bring the kids. They would love it! The restuarants are expensive but the food and service was good. As a Diamond member with Hilton we received two free drinks and a $40 dinner voucher. We also received a room upgrade to the concierge level. The continental breakfast was decent but the highlight was the appetizers and free cocktails. A really nice break from the $15 drinks by the pool. The beach is very nice. No rocks which makes the swimming very enjoyable. A nice perk with this hotel is the lounge chairs and beach umbrellas they provide the hotel guests. The rooms are very nice. They are really large and comfortable. The bed was incredible. This hotel is great for couples or families. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our 10th trip to Maui at the BEST hotel on the Island.”
Reviews.Author: 1stSammy
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before choosing this hotel. Some complained about the size. This is a very large resort; that part is true. What the complainers failed to say is to walk any distance at this resort is to be treated to stunning views throughout. There are sculptures, hidden waterfalls, secluded thatched huts, exotic flowers, green foliage of all kinds, palm trees, paintings ... everywhere that you look. Just the hotel grounds, without seeing any other part of the Island, delivers on the visual expectation and fantasy of what you hope to see when you visit Hawaii. I saw reviews about rooms not being up to par. We have had different types of rooms during our different stays at this property. Some have been average and others outstanding. None have been dirty or run down. Our last room was clearly remodeled and fabulous. Our room this time was older, very clean and also wonderful. The views are great. We've had pool views, garden views, ocean views... all great. I read some reviews that complained about not getting enough wrist bands for the pool, or having to pay 'too much' for wrist bands for non hotel guests. I can see that if someone is trying to "sneak" in a few extra people, that the hotel would hold to its policy and that does not bother me at all. The staff will ask for room numbers and names in order to provide bands. Once you see how easy it is to walk into the pool areas at the surrounding resorts, you change your mind about wearing wrist bands. It keeps the pool available for paying guests. The hotel fee is a fact of life as is the valet charge. No one likes fees. However, the car was delivered promptly and with fresh, cold bottles of water each time we called for it. Frankly, you really do not need a car. We always rent one, but for the first time this year, we took tours of some of the better known sights and it was well worth it. We were picked up at the hotel and returned to the hotel... no car needed. The food is great. My in-laws traveled to this hotel two weeks after we did. They had the opposite reaction: we loved the food at Humuhumu; they loved the Bistro Molokini (both restaurants at this resort). Our favorite restaurant used to be the Italian restaurant next door at the four seasons where table are outside and face the ocean. However, this year, the service and food at that venue disappointed, while Humuhumu outdid our expectations. We were also pleased with room service selections and taste. About a year or so ago we found that the Humuhumu fare was tasty but more like standard Hilton hotel fare. We can now say it is excellent. If you have children, the multiple, cascading pools, slides and rope swing will occupy them for hours. If you have small children, the little baby pool with little fountain and nearby sand covered pool entry where children play in the shallow water (which looks like a beach) will entertain you and the baby. From your chairs, you will hear the ocean surf in the background. There are lifeguards everywhere. This year I was at the foot of the big slide waiting to capture my husband on camera when he came hurtling out, when an older woman came down the slide first and then appeared disoriented as she stood coughing at the bottom of the slide. The lifeguard did not hesitate, he immediately was in the water, at her side. Her husband was laughing and she appeared embarrassed, but I was very impressed the rapid response as other resort staff also appeared to make sure all was well. We did not have children with us and have never traveled to this resort with children. However, we used all the pools, the slides and the lazy river just like the kids did and found there was room for all of us to safely and respectfully use the multiple pools. A bonus was the option to use the large sized adult-only pool with two large hot tubs. I was pleased that when children entered the adult-only hot tub or adult-only pool area, they were gently encouraged to leave. We debated staying at the four seasons this year, but the property just cannot compare to what is offered by the Grand Wailea. Even at its most crowded, when we returned from a tour late morning, we never had trouble finding two or more chairs together. There were also plenty of shaded areas. This year we noticed Super Cabanas with flat screen TVs and other amenities. The staff was very friendly. Housekeeping services were prompt and efficient. All the staff members were very friendly from housekeeping staff to groundskeepers, to the front desk and wait staff. Iced water was offered at the adult pool area. Are there any cons? It depends on who you are. If you like small, you can find private places there, but it is a large resort. If you want shiny and new, the resort is an older property, but there were signs of ongoing improvement throughout. The pool has some chipped tiles in places. Our room was a bit older, but beautiful. Our in-laws raved about their newly renovated room. All the rooms have giant bathrooms which is you like tiny bathrooms, could be a con. Is it expensive? Yes, it can be very expensive, but no more so than other luxury properties. Believe me, we looked at the other resorts. We have been to Maui ten times and we looked at many other properties... but we always return to the Grand Wailea... because it never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lvshack
Reviews.Content: My 15-year old son, 12-year-old daughter, husband and me stayed four nights at the Grand Wailea. The resort is breathtaking both inside and out. There are adult-only and kid pools. Kids of all ages will enjoy the pools, which include a sand area for little ones, two water slides, a lazy river, and water elevator. The beach is only steps away, with plenty of seating. We spent time pool side and at the beach. The food at the Wailea was only average. Having stayed at the Marriott next door for a few days prior, I was shocked at the price difference for food. The Marriott was more affordable from a meal perspective. We spent over $400 for dinner at the on-site restaurant called Humu's, and were disappointed with the quality of the food and service we received, which didn't match the high prices. The rooms were spacious, and the bath huge. Rooms include a shower and a huge soaking tub, and mini fridge too. Each room has a spacious balcony, which we used several time for dining. There are several bars on the property, however the drinks are very pricey and only average. There is an open mall area just a short walk from the resort in case you prefer other dining options. If you are going for the resort feel and can afford the luxury, and have kids who would enjoy the pool amenities and easy beach access, the Grand might be what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Vs. Wailea? Go for Ka'anapali in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Suxie22
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at Grand Wailea - mid February 2012 during peak whale-watching season. Looks like business has picked up again in general on Maui. I haven't seen it this crowded since 2006, pre-recession levels. We are a California family traveling during the school break Ski & Skate week. I doubt we will travel to Hawaii again during this period since it is so much more crowded than what we are used to for Hawaii in April or October. Our main question for this trip was Ka'anapali beach on the east end of Maui or Wailea on the west end? The slight weather differences aside, go for Ka'anpali Beach. Our biggest complaint against the Grand Wailea, and this may be trivial to some, is the music ambiance & personnel - seriously. The swim up bar tender plays REO Speedwagon and Freebird....Freebird on Maui? Really? I'm paying premium money per night and per mai tai to sit in a bar to listen to Freebird?!?! With all the great Hawaiian Slack Key guitar Masters, John Cruz, Jack Johnson, etc. none of that is played here at the hotel. You hear U2 and old Police songs in the hotel restaurant (Molokini) which could be anywhere in California. For some reason, a lot of the personnel here are disinchanted haoles from the mainland, and not locals. Ou bottom line is - Ka'anapali gives a better overall selection of ambiance and is better located closer to Lahina for activities in Maui. Better LOCAL music scene on the east end of the island. We've stayed in Maui four times; upcountry Kula, Pai'ia, Ka'anapali and right now in Wailea at the Grand Wailea. The biggest question is always Ka'anpali Vs. Wailea? I'd go for Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Sean H
Reviews.Content: We started this debacle by being deceived about how many wristbands we could receive when we checked in. Then, when we complained about this, the manager told us there was nothing he could do and whoever told us that we could have more wristbands was wrong. Then, we were supposed to have the oceanview room and when we got to our room, all we could see were palm trees. The bellman told us to just move the palm trees in our head. Then, when we are in the room, our bathtub is disgusting and we complained to the housekeeping staff and nothing was done. My wife had to clean the bathtub, ON OUR HONEYMOON!!!! The shower had mold in it, the air vents were black with filth, and there was dirt on the walls itself. I know we paid the local rate but that doesn't give anyone the right to do such a poor job. When we complained to the manager, Hilme, he implied that since we shouldn't expect much since we were getting the local rate. Just because I was a savvy shopper and knew people on the island is no reason for their standards to be lax. Then, we found that the valet parking (which is mandatory) is pretty ridiculous considering they are charging 30 dollars for parking. Then, I found out that 30 dollars is not total for your stay but PER DAY, which is not mentioned anywhere, which is fraud by the way. We complained and the valet manager reversed the charges after apologizing for the "miscommunication ". When we checked out, we complained about the many problems and the manager, Hilme again, told us that "A hundred off is more than generous considering you got the local rate." Now, not only is that being prejudiced against the local Hawaiian people, that is also showing bias against their guests for being savvy shoppers. That's not even remotely approaching the level of class that we were expecting from the hotel for something that was not our mistake. I expected our stay to be comped and apologies abounding. Instead, I got apathy and rudeness. Now, I work for the Bellagio in Las Vegas and when I booked our stay, they told me that the Grand Wailea was the Bellagio of Maui. Unfortunately, from what we saw, the cleanliness and professionalism of the hotel is comparable to a low-class Days Inn. I am extremely disappointed in the level of service and customer care that we received and I will be relating that information to every guest at the Bellagio who asks for the best place to stay in Maui. I will now be referring people to the Kea Lani from now on. That "should be more than generous", as the manager put it. They should have cleaned the room thoroughly. They should not have defrauded and deceived people about the price of parking and if they were gonna charge for parking, they should have offered the option of self parking. It is a Waldorf property, and I expected impeccable cleanliness, style, and charm. Instead, I got attitude, mold, dirt, and a poor attitude. I expect someone to contact me immediately regarding this problem. I expected more from a 4 diamond property.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Some Ambience Issues For Us.”
Reviews.Author: thea123
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write due to some mixed feelings. First the great: We booked this hotel through Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays and got a bargain rate. When we checked in we were automatically upgraded to a ground floor, corner, large suite, with two large lanaiâ€™s, containing two lanai loungers, and table and chairs. We had ocean and pool views. The suite was gorgeous! There was a large comfortable sitting area with flat screen, free WiFi, and separate dining area with refrigerator and sink. The large beautiful bedroom had another flatscreen and a huge marble bathroom with separate tub and shower. There was an additional half bath off the hall. This was a five star suite that we got for a three star price. The hotel itself is stunning with a beautiful lobby, gorgeous grounds, multiple pools, water slides, and a wonderful beach with great snorkeling and beach loungers and umbrellas for hotel guests. Wonderful shops for browsing in the hotel as well. Now to the down points, our room was a corner, ground floor suite, which we liked very much, but it was directly across from the childrenâ€™s pool so it was much like Disneyland all day, with shrieking children running all around. We didnâ€™t like this quite as much! They were quiet at night though, which was a blessing. The hotel in general is very crowded even mid-week in February, with lots of families with young children. It didnâ€™t provide the quiet relaxed ambience we look for in Hawaii, so people seeking quiet relaxation may want to look elsewhere. This would be a great choice for families with young children though. The kids were all having the time of their lives! We generally prefer to eat in local restaurants over hotel restaurants, but we did take out one meal to eat on our lanai from the hotelâ€™s casual CafÃ© Kula. This was a mistake as the Asian themed food we ordered was dry, tasteless and seemed like it had been stored for a long time in the frig. Do not recommend CafÃ© Kula. In conclusion, the room was stunning as was the hotel and grounds. The staff were friendly and helpful. The crowds and children were not really our cup of tea and the one meal we ate at the hotel was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Amazing”
Reviews.Author: totraveller12342
Reviews.Content: The fabulousness of this hotel starts from the time you pull up and are greeted by a multitude of friendly staff and receive your welcome lei. They all cannot do enough to make you feel as you are the most special guest they have ever had. The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and luxurious and the location is spectacular. Although we only had 3 nights booked, I wished we could have stayed forever. Splurge on the restaurant on site - thatched roof, over a salt water pond with fabulous service. Worth the price. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean and well appointed and beautiful location on a great stretch of beach. The pools was wonderful - heated too. Can't wait to get the opportunity to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful luxury hotel in Maui, Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: BobPGoFrogs
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of business travel and I can honestly say that the Grand Wailea is one of the best and most complete hotels I have ever stayed at. The hospitality that was given to my wife and I on our honeymoon just last week. The room when we arrived (on 2/6/12) was positively lovely, set the tone for our entire trip and will be a memory we will never forget. The property was exquisite and we had a phenomenal time and are counting down to our first big anniversary so that we can come back. There is not one thing that could have been better about our stay, that is a huge compliment to the entire hotel and its staff. We ate at each of the restaurants and had drinks at all of the bars. While at times it appeared the prices were a bit high on food, you definitely got what you paid for and you have to remember you are on Maui, everything is a bit more expensive compared to the mainland. Every worker was passionate about their job and were attentive to your needs. The consierge desk was extremelyl helpful and went above and beyond to ensure my excursions were to my liking. In fact, when a snorkling trip was cancelled, they called to ensure I was rescheduled and taken care of. Again, I thought that the Grand Wailea lives up to Waldorf name and is one of the best places I have ever been.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: royejr29
Reviews.Content: From the time you get out of your car and are greeted the experience at this resort was amazing. The landscaping was beautiful, the staff friendly, the pools were perfect, and the beach was one of the best in Maui. If you are looking for an "experience" I highly recommend staying at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the price and hard to get around”
Reviews.Author: tulsacats
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge while in Maui....sucked it up so to speak and stayed in an ocean front room. We had great whale watching with binoculars and a huge room and bath. It was quite nice. Getting to the pools and ocean was a task. You walk through the lobby to the back, take the elevator to the ground floor, then walk to your destination. The Humu restaurant was a hike in nice shoes. Didn't mind the valet parking charge but thought the "resort fee" $25 a day for the phone and fitness center was out of line. Never used either... Oh well.... Live and learn

Reviews.Title: “should have been MUCH better, customer service very bad, no one cares”
Reviews.Author: Pauline T
Reviews.Content: We had to pay a $25 a day resort fee to stay at a resort. You have to pay from $120 to $230 for umbrellas or any shade at the pool - that doesn't make sense. Room service sent us a bug in our salade, a brownie that was hard as a rock and under cooked chicken, and these are well reknowned chefs? No one called to see if we were alright. Both the children and adults became sick from the food. We had to eat at the shops next door every day. No one knows how to smile so the customer service was really sad and the food is bad. The only ones who showed they cared was the house keeping staff, dept manager and director. We informed the manager on duty the evening we were leaving (2/4/12) and showed him the four at the front desk that were not smiling, yet they all had someone with them. NEVER AGAIN. They nickle and dime you so bad, will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: Stephen R
Reviews.Content: its like a mini vegas resort on the beach. very nice amenities and grounds. the food was dissapointing and so was the high price. it does have one of the nicesest beaches on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kazoodog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea two times in the last year for a total of 14 nights and know the place in great detail. Over the years we have visited all of the Islands (that you can access) and this is our favorite spot. Our perspective is that of a family with grade school aged kids. The 3 reasons I would recommend staying here are the beach, the pools and the location. When you close your eyes and picture the perfect Hawaiian beach you are thinking of Wailea Beach. Very wide and long, golden sand, shallow entry into the water, small waves and there are reefs for snorkeling on both sides. The hotel staff will set you up with a large beach umbrella and lounge chairs. The water is warm, the bottom is sandy, boogie boarding with the kids is a blast, lots of room to build sand castles, its clean and kept immaculate by the staff. There is good snorkeling with turtles at both ends of the beach. You pay a lot to stay here, but it is so valuable to have access to this beach, to not have to drive and fight for a parking spot. It is about a 5 minute walk to the rooms. Tip: Buy a boogie board at the ABC store, don't rent one if you want to use it more than one day. Next are the pools. If you have kids or are young at heart you will love this. There are a series of pools built at different levels and connected by slides. There are 2 longer slides, one rapids, a fast river and a slow river, caves with hot tubs. My kids and I never got tired of it. Always clean, always warm, rarely crowded, most people seem content to lounge instead of play. A tip is to go out at night under the stars and enjoy the pools and hot tubs. Hardly anyone ventures to the pools after dark even though they are beautifully lit and tiki torches light the grounds. Third is Wailea. Oh my gosh, this is the best place to stay in Hawaii. The crowds of Kanapali make me claustrophobic. It is so much more relaxed in Wailea. The beach path connects the resorts which are widely spaced apart. Kihei is close by. We recommend the Kihei cafe (go early to beat the breakfast crowds and also keep track of what the cashier charges you, although the food was the best I don't think the overcharge was by accident) and try Da Kitchen for local food for dinner. Get takeout and eat on your Lanai watching the sun go down. If you want to get out and explore nearby we recommend Big Beach and Maluaka Beach with good snorkeling at the south end of each. Big Beach is amazing just to stop and behold it with your eyes. The valet parking staff were fast and friendly and loaded us up with towels and water. Negatives about the Grand Wailea. It is very expensive and the holiday rates are obscene. The restaurants are expensive too, but at least they are very good. Cafe Kula charges something like $14 for the banana taro pancakes but they are ono and enough for two people. Another tip is that it is only a 5 minute walk to the shops at Wailea. There are all kinds of cheap deli and prepared hot foods for takeout. Take the food back and eat on your lanai. The view is so much better. We ate at the Humuhumu one time. Really good but too expensive to go back. Never ate at the breakfast buffet, instead we bought cereal, muffins and milk at the ABC store next door. Concerning the rooms. We had a deluxe ocean view on the 9th floor. So we were kind of far back from the beach. But from what I could tell just about all of the rooms face the ocean. You pay more to be higher up. The four of us did fine in one room. There is a fridge and closet space. The bathroom is quite large and ours had a good luck gecko. I called to report that the next door neighbor was smoking on their lanai and hotel security came after them within minutes. All furnishings and beddings were top notch. Nothing shabby in our room. Maid service was great and they always made sure we had extra towels. In summary this is a beautiful resort, on a primo beach, in a super location. If you want to go out, drive around and explore everyday, then there is not much point in splurging on the cost of the Grand Wailea. On the other hand if you want a hassle free, idyllic beach vacation with your kids then this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Some good some bad not worth 400$ a night”
Reviews.Author: Babyjordan23
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife decided to stay at The Grand Wailea after seeing it on the movie Just Go With It. Upon arrival staff greeting us were nice even took pictures of us in the lobby. After we checked in we had a long walk to our room and it was kinda scary and secluded the back part of the hotel isnt very clean including the grounds ect. After changing clothes after an 8 hour flight we were starved and it was very hard to find somewhere to eat after 8pm and just getting out of the lobby needed help from Magellen only one elevator was working that you had to take to get to where the food was and that was a pain. We booked a kayak snorkel tour through the hotel paid a month ahead of time upon day of check in they had no record of it and said our credit card was not charged so we paid again and found out once we got home we were in fact charged twice. The tour was great though our tour guide brought me an octopus from the ocean floor to hold plus a sea urchin among other things. The grounds near the pool area were awesome we got many great pictures we also enjoyed the luau. The shops at wailea were nice with an abc store for cheap snacks and a restaurant called longhis was great we ate there 3 times and one of the waitresses was the best looking women ive ever seen. The pools were great and we never had any trouble getting chairs the walking path down the beach was also nice a good place to run. Complaints were the elevators broke the long walk to our room the quality of the room and the price of food was just unreal the first day i was ready to leave until i learned my way around then i really enjoyed it. We took 3 tours that all picked us up at the hotel that was nice. Another complaint is charging to use internet on the lobby computers we paid 6k for the trip and they want to charge per minute for the internet in the lobby lol very greedy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Grand Wailea has the most beautiful and well kept grounds. The fitness room is very well equipped. I enjoy the jogging trail along the beach. Staff are courteous and friendly. Our Ocean view room has a spectacular view with personal cabanas

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Tk100964
Reviews.Content: The whole place left us with the impression of a very cheap resort in Pattaya, Benidorm or Bali, though with 2 major differences : 10 times the price and far lower service. Truly unbelievable what some hotels can afford ! We were shocked... I travel 200 days a year in always stay in 5 star accommodations, though was from far one of the worst experiences I had. We stayed in the Napua tower which is definitely not worth the money. Just a few examples : * internet in the room was down. It took nearly 24 hours to get it up and running again. The only workaround was to log on to the wireless network of the Four seasons hotel. At their reception, you can buy a voucher and log on, also from the Grand Wailea. * the toilet was broken (water). We reported it to the reception and it took more than 4 hours to get it fixed. * the room is old and is a typical example of gone glory with spots on the carpet, on the cushions of the terrace chairs. The paint of the wooden blinds is peeling off. When you open and close the blinds, the carpets looks white of all the pain which is dropping off. The taps in the bathroom has once been in gold. Probably a loooong time ago. You can still see some traces of it :). Which is a nice example for the rest of the hotel : once it was probably a nice resort, though only very few traces are left. * the Napua tower has a kind of exec lounge where you can take breakfast. In all honesty, the evening drink is nice with a good selection of cocktail, wine and beer. Though, the breakfast is awful. And you should see how the waiters are throwing the food in the trays. My God !!! The juices are just sugar water served (self served) in plastic cups. * when waking up during the night, I noticed that the mini-bar is empty. How do I get a quick drink ? Calling room service ???? We stayed before at the Four Seasons which is a paradise and an example of efficient service and style. Prices are very similar, though quality is day and night difference. Compared with the Four Seasons, the Grand Wailea is a youth hostel. What a disappointment !

Reviews.Title: “let me catch my breath”
Reviews.Author: guy j
Reviews.Content: By far the most beautiful place I have ever stayed in my life. I know my wife would say the same. The room A++ the staff treats you like their life depends on it. The location just fab ul ouzzz in every way. Did I mention room service and the menu?? do try. I'm going back. Just a short walk from your room to the ocean. And clean so clean. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: kmts5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea 8 years ago and really liked it. All of the negative reviews made me scared that I would hate it this time. We had a great time, especially our 9 year old son. We never had a problem finding a seat at the pool and the birds were actually less annoying than they were on Oahu or on the other side of Maui. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The concierge, Mi, was exceptional. Now for the weak link: The food leaves a lot to be desired so we would walk over to the Four Seasons next door for lunch. We ate at Humuhumu one night and it was very good but the menu was extremely limited and no specials. However, the sunset at that restaurant makes it worth eating there just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Weilea Beach!”
Reviews.Author: ChyRa1
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is on Wailea Beach. You don't have to walk to the beach like all of the other hotels in Wailea. Perfect location and amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Words can't describe”
Reviews.Author: Tanja F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in my share of resort hotels. This is the finest resort I have ever stayed in. No need to pay more for an ocean view, as the buildings are surrounded by gardens and pools so every view is spectacular. This is a big hotel, with so many amenities. The downside is you do find yourself walking a lot to get from the pool to the spa, to your room, etc..I wish I could afford to come here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Gone Wild!”
Reviews.Author: spikeinlf
Reviews.Content: We spent a first night in Maui here, before we could check into our Time Share in Ka'anapali Beach, in Lahaina. The grounds are expansive, clean, majestic, flat out breathtaking. The continulously connected pools are a sight to see. The rooms were ok, but the property was amazing. After our night's stay here, it was hard to see anything else as acceptable, ... but we managed. Ka'Anapali Beach Club is our home away from home. But for an unforgettable getaway, check out Grand Wailea!! You will never regret the experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: fedebeek
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, perfect location. Wailea beach is awesome. The hotel was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and property”
Reviews.Author: lauralegs
Reviews.Content: We love coming her to relax and enjoy the beautiful pools. The rooms are very nice and I think they all have views of the ocean. The property is gorgeous and has a real open air feeling. We enjoyed the relaxing Spa and beautiful surrounding. I would say the food is lacking though as the restaurants need to be updated. The food just isn't up to the quality of this hotel and doesn't match the level expected. I would stay here again but the food definitely needs to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Danitoh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had heard many wonderful things about this hotel and were excited when we had the chance to go to this hotel for a business conference. The grounds are very well manicured and the pools and beach are nice. The restaurants are very nice and I hope to visit them again. The rooms are not that great and definately not worth the price. We stayed in a Deluxe Garden room. The paint was bubbled from water damage down one wall. Both beds were badly out of level. We tried to get a different room, one with a king bed like we had originally asked for, but were told the hotel was sold out. My sister and her husband were staying next door at the Four Seasons. Their room was much nicer. If I have another conference in Wailea, I think we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific grounds, great art, and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: This is my second conference at this location and both times my partner joined me. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stays here - though purchases on the grounds are a bit over the top in price. The grounds and common areas are lovely, and it has good beachfront. The art on the grounds is terrific ( they offer an art tour) and there are lots of options for sitting by the pools (and the lazy river). Our room did not really offer an ocean view, but it looked over a garden, and was quiet and comfortable. The room itself was spacious and well-appointed and the honey mango bath products smell delicious!! The restaurants on location are quite expensive - but, to tell the truth, the food is quite good. The $20 resort fee includes wi-fi connection throughout the property but the additional mandatory valet parking fee of $30 a night was outrageous. And the beverages are just a bit too spendy. Bring in your own or buy a few things at the store on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: firstplaceace
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. This is a top-notch facility where you can relax and be spoiled. The location and views are awesome as well as the staff. Of course high quality means higher prices so don't be too shocked if you spend $80 for lunch at the pool grill for two with a couple drinks. Money well spent at Grand Wailea! Even the valet was most helpful lending a hand to lower/raise the top of the Jeep rental. Dinner on site at the open-air restaurant was excellent and also romantic at sunset. Don't forget to ride the water elevator at the pool too! Fantastic upscale shopping beside the property as well. There are plenty of local things to do also. Go about the island and explore but skip the trip to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “kid's review of a family stay at the grand wailea”
Reviews.Author: George and fami... J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010. We stayed here 3 nights and then stayed at the Honua Kai. We were greeted with alohas and fresh flower leis. This resort is great for families with kids. Overall, it is very nice and luxurious. Here are it's pros and cons: pros: luxurious nice pool great restaurant great beach cons: purple dye in the koi pond room was a little crowded for a family or four one of the slides launches you into artificial rocks yes, it's true. at the end of one of the smaller water slides there is a strong current that pushes you onto plastic rocks. i got a deep cut in my foot from it. The beach is very gentle and sunny but the snorkeling isn't the best, and the resort is near a shopping center with a good restaurant. Also at night there are frogs hopping around that you can catch.

Reviews.Title: “great for kids, otherwise not worth the cash”
Reviews.Author: JamesHunt1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, the ONLY reason you come is because you have kids. The pool has numerous water slides and kids go nuts running all over the place having the time of their lives. As for me I just wanted to chill. and you can do that, just not really in the shade, that costs money. there are plenty of lawn chairs but the ones with umbrellas cost money and the 4 lawn chairs with a tent above it (think cabana but really just a canopy and 4 chairs) is $500 for the day. and as a result they are all empty sitting there unused. same with the umbrellas. I should ask how mush that costs. I have yet to see one person rent one of these. at least wifi is free. oh and the fish place with the super long name on the grounds looks cool, but the food was worse than most weddings Ive been too. oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at the spa”
Reviews.Author: StressedOutTraveler
Reviews.Content: The resort and grounds are beautiful, however I had a terrible experience at the Grand Wailea Spa. For what was supposed to be a relaxing afternoon with my husband at the spa, due to the poor customer service we experienced, it soured everything and I wish we had never gone. In addition, there were foreign gardeners right outside my massage room, chattering away, so it made for a very un-relaxing experience. Also, my massage therapist was just average- I thought their standards would be higher. When we complained to the spa manager on duty afterwards, she was very indifferent, like she didn't care.
