She gave us coupons to use their hydrotherapy again (which I believe is free to use with any service), which we will not use. We will not waste our valuable vacation time there again. Go somewhere else where the staff actually care.

Reviews.Title: “People were happy”
Reviews.Author: Great8_too
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. It is a lovely property and is well kept and very clean. When you first walk into the lobby it is very impressive and is as nice as any hotel we have been to. Room was large and very comfortable with spectacular views of the gardens, the ocean and the island. It is a busy place with many children having a lot of fun in the pools. There was a lot of laughter from the kids and their parents and everyone was having a good time. I think this sums up the property...if you are a family it is wonderful place to have fun and connect with your kids. What more do you want from a vacation! Although we enjoyed watching the children (who were generally pretty well behaved) we are long past those years. We probably would have enjoyed the place more if it had been a little quieter. The beautiful lawn in front of the adult pools was quiet and away from most of the hustle and bustle so we enjoyed that. The hotel does a large convention business but they have done an excellent job of keeping the conference activities (meals etc.) in a separate area from the main hotel. A separate entrance for conference goers keeps the main entrance clear of piles and piles of luggage when masses of people check out at one time at the end of the conference. We thought the food could be better and although it was well presented it reminded us of food in an upscale chain restaurant. It was a little mass produced and sometimes looked thrown together. The staff were friendly and competent but some looked like they were bored and in a rut but others were some of the nicest people you could ever meet. There have been a lot of comments about the prices of food etc. but we found that the prices were only a little higher than restaurants in the surrounding area. We would go back to this hotel again but next time we will bring our grandchildren so we can watch them having a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, bad frontdesk service, busy resort, fees for everything”
Reviews.Author: FrequenTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe oceanview room that was very nice and spacious with a great view. Hotel pool and beach area was very busy at all times except early morning. The hotel was very crowded with mainly families. The public areas were a bit gaudy and not elegant and refined. Personally, it was too busy and too large of a resort for our comfort. Our check-in experience as a Hilton top-tier hhonors member was very poor and they provide no benefits at this property for the HHonors members (not even daily bottled water or newspaper). We were not given any information on the rate for the daily resort fees, the fact that there was a house keeping gratuity automatically charged (and we left one in the room every day for the house keeping staff since we didn't know this). Check-out was also not accommodating nor helpful. My conference negotiated a great price and special resort fee that included the valet parking (but I didn't find out the correct information on the resort fees until checkout). The valets were very efficient, friendly and provided suggestions and advice on local attractions and restaurants when asked. The concierge desk didn't seem familiar with hiking opportunities on the island, but unlike us. most people probably come for the water sports. They did mainly try to push arranged tours and packages. Also, they suggested leaving the hotel by 2am to make it up to Haleakala summit for sunrise (which she claimed was at 6am)-- that would have meant waiting several hours in the cold for the sun to rise. We left the hotel at 4:30am and arrived in the overflow parking lot at 6:30am with 30 minutes before sunrise (since it was actually at 7am) with only a few people in the overflow lot and a great view. Also, the luau was very poor. They ran out of food by the time our table was called and were not restocking it. The complimentary Mai Tais were too sweet and watery . The luau at the Grand Hyatt on Kauai was great in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: BeachesForFour
Reviews.Content: Our visit this month was our fifth and the hotel continues to maintain amazing standards of excellence. Not only are all of the employees friendly, accommodating, and professional, but the property itself is constantly being maintained to the highest standards (brass railings are shined very day, paint is immediately touched up, and any debris on the lawn is picked up daily). The grounds are breathtakingly beautiful and the open air lobby will take our breath away. The oceanfront walk is a joy -- gorgeous views! A wonderful change from our last visit is that the beach chairs and umbrellas on the beach are FREE -- they had been $50 a day, according to what the bellman told us. One great thing about the Grand Wailea, as opposed to the other hotels in Wailea, is the size of the beach -- it's HUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanabata
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea makes you want to spend most of your time there. Although I didn't do that since I didn't have much time in Maui, I would definitely do it the next time I visit. The room is huge, absolutely clean and elegantly decorated with some island dÃ©cor (loved the ceiling fan). I was happy a refrigerator (with 2 free bottles of water) was there, so I could store drinks and food. The bathroom was huge with a good size sink and bathtub. It was also nicely decorated. The property had beautiful pools with all the amenities you could want. Unfortunately because of my schedule I didn't use them but was able to take advantage of the nice beach in front of the pools. One mishap that I experienced was during my first night when a couple in the next room was being loud. I couldn't understand why I could hear them so easily. I thought perhaps it was because it was an adjoining room. When I called the front desk, they promptly took care of it and I never heard the couple again. I fell asleep right after that. A slight negative was that my meal from room services was average. The short ribs were dry and a bit tough. On my last day, I was surprised to encounter a rude person at the reception because everyone had been so pleasant there. I asked her about how to get to the path along the coast. She wasn't explaining it clearly and when she thought I should understand and I didn't, she started rolling her eyes, making it obvious that she was getting frustrated. I just walked away and asked someone from the valet. This person explained it very clearly and I found the path right away. Other than those two things, I did enjoy my stay there and wish I had more time to enjoy the property, as well as their spa.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Wedding Day from the Grand Wailea in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Mike Q
Reviews.Content: Such a shame that a beautiful location is operated by amateurs. Here is our story: My cousin held her wedding at the Grand Wailea Chapel and what a disappointment. On the wedding day, the coordinator was no where to be found! We were frantic and contacted the catering staff, the front desk and The Consierge...no one was able to find the coordinator. The hotel staff was rude and did not offer to assist us in any way. On top of that, the photographer from Amity Photography (who was recommended from the resort) could not have been worse. She never responded to emails, phone calls or requests to meet before the wedding day. She showed up at the Bridal Suite more than 30 minutes late looking like she just came in from the beach. Very unprofessional lady and dressed so poorly for a five star resort. When my cousin said "I was so stressed, I thought you were not going to show up" the photographer said nothing. She just started taking pictures and laughed it off. The bride was close to a meltdown. She was already in her wedding gown and there was little time to capture the moment with photographs. The photos we received were nothing like the images from her web site. One saving grace was the amazing Videographer from The Artistry Video Company (also recombined by the resort) She arrived 30 minutes early & captured all the details (that the photographer missed) The Video DVD looks like a motion picture-truly a work of art. The Florist from Bella Bloom (referred by the resort) was also wonderful to work with. She was professional and her flower arrangements were beautiful and fresh! After the wedding day, we attempted to contact the lead coordinator in the wedding department but we were told she was not available and would return our call. Of course we never heard a word from her. Upon our departure, we left a personal hand written letter at the front desk for the resort Manager Mr. Daily and Mr. Brian Lynx, Director of Marketing. Did we receive any response? Never- What a Grand Failure! If you are planning a wedding, vacation or any special event, I would consider one of the neighboring resorts or The Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand over 2 dzn times. If I didn't think it was great, I would not have gone back so much. THe best thing they did over the last 5 -10 years was remodel all the rooms. Now they feel like a 5 star. My kids have always loved the place and as a parent I have always felt that they were safe. Little secret: get the Chapel wing. A beautiful view of the chapel with the ocean in the backround. It is also a little more quiet and closer to the pool & beach.Cave Bar is great and the bartender has been there for over 10 years. Service=great Rooms= great Restuarants= average ( Much better options off site) Pool= great Alcohol secret: go to the ABC store in the mall next door or the supermarket a couple of miles away. Buy the wine, Vodka, Rum, mixers as well as the little ABC soft sided cooler. Ice from the hotel icemaker by the room and head down to the pool/beach. You will save a lot of $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Really? This is a 4 Star Resort...I don't think so!!!”
Reviews.Author: baybree
Reviews.Content: So...right this minute I am sitting at the adult pool...this is my seventh day here... I wish I could post a picture of the pool tiles... THEY ARE DIRTY AND MISSING TONS OF TILES....simply not okay! I ordered a drink and it took 30 minutes to come...very under staffed...and when you do get your drink.. Just beware that all drinks are $15.50. Overall not impressed...I have stayed in some very nice places in the Carribean..Mexico...Miami...and so on...incomparison this place gets a 2 star :(... Will not return... So when I got to the end of this comment section I noticed that I can post a picture...so I got in the pool...this is what it looks like...REALLY WALDORF ASTORIA?

Reviews.Title: “True spirit of Aloha”
Reviews.Author: blind0wl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many resorts on Maui, as well as all over the world, but none have equaled our recent experience at the Grand Wailea! The grounds are beautiful, the pool and beach are 5 star, but what puts it over the top is the staff. Always so friendly, laughing and joking with you, but always looking for ways to make your stay special. No request was too much. Truly the spirit of Aloha! If you haven't stayed here because you felt it was overpriced, look into joining the Elite membership. This can bring your stay down to a more affordable range and offer you extras that truly make your stay special! And don't forget to treat yourself to their amazing spa!! It can all be part of the package!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, stay here”
Reviews.Author: EmmaBea
Reviews.Content: Luxury, beautiful hotel - you must stay here. Steps from the beach with a huge swimming pool - perfect for adults and children alike, it has water slides, a lazy river, rapids style slides going pool to pool, hot tubs, waterfalls, a seperate adult only pool (although many adults in the other bit, it was fab) - and best of all, a swim up bar where you could also watch sport - perfect. Lovely restaurant, delicious fresh lobster. Clean, modern, well presented bedrooms, huge bed and bathroom - excellent views. Several hotels nearby if you wanted to wander along for dinner too. NB - Saw no screaming children at all! Literally couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach, extremely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JBradleyR
Reviews.Content: Great location in South Maui, the Grand Wailea is one of four hotels side-by-side in this location. The beach is excellent and the pool is quite nice. Otherwise, the accommodations are very average. The food is below average at each on-site location we tried, and EVERYTHING is grossly overpriced! $500 for a basic room. $15 for any cocktail - no meal less than $50/person, and usually >$100! There must be better options in this area of Maui for a comparable price - check the Four Seasons for nicer and higher, or Fairmont for comparable. Or if you don't care about direct beach front look into the Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool in Maui”
Reviews.Author: CousinsClan4
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th year traveling to Maui and our 4 time staying at the Grand Wailea. As always the customer service is exceptional. The view from our room was absolutely gorgeous. My kids love the pool. It is a perfect pool for a family. My one complaint would be that the rooms could be remodeled but it looks like they are working on updating the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"beautiful hotel - too many kids!"”
Reviews.Author: Katy823
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and the views from the Grand Waiela are beautiful, however if you aren't into hanging out with other peoples screaming children I don't recommend this hotel. Everyday the parents of kids go down to the pool and save all the chairs with towels. They are gone by 8am-ish. If you try to use one you will be quickly told that little Jimmy is on his way! They claim to have an adult pool but no one regulates this - not even the adult hot tub. There were also never any towels at the pool after the peek hours of the day (after 4pm). You can call housekeeping but no one will come. Not to harp on the kids, but I tried to make a spa appointment and was told that I could not be booked anytime during my four day stay because they had several "little girl" birthday partys to accommodate. At the prices of the spa I couldn't believe it! We were there for a conference my husband attended so we only paid a small portion of the bill but if I were coming out of pocket $600+ a night I would have been highly upset!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 24KAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for our honeymoon this past October. It was a fantastic experience. Our room was absolutely lovely - with a beautiful balcony overlooking the ocean. The service at the hotel was top-notch. Everyone was friendly, helpful and completely professional. We highly recommend the Grand Wailea if you are looking for a luxurious, relaxing stay in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Grand name, marginal service”
Reviews.Author: Tom9799
Reviews.Content: Went there for a week's convention and was underwhelmed with the service. I've only stayed there once a few years ago, but it seems like things aren't quite what they were. It started on check-in, when our first "Deluxe Ocean View" room featured only a sliver of ocean above two large palm trees- see photo. The manager was rather unfriendly, and was minimally interested in giving us even a token compensation for the inconvenience of relocating us the next day. To their credit, the new room featured a much better view. But it was still fairly noisy - heard the valets squealing tires when parking cars well into the late evening, and the noisy tile in the outside outer hallway. We were also somewhat disappointed with their approach toward the Hilton Honors program. We were offered few extra amenities for our Diamond status - although it may have been because we booked the room through the convention, instead of doing it through our own account. This is a good resort for people who have children - the extensive pools and the ready access to the beach were a plus here. There was also a nice area for an adult pool. The restaurants were predictably pricey with average quality food. The food service at the pool was slow and spotty. Overall we enjoyed our vacation, but we came away with the sense that the laid back island mentality affected the quality of the service, and they lacked a strong enough management to overcome this. This level of service would be what you would expect out of a high category 3 or low category 4 hotel. A real highlight of our stay was our experience at the Spa Grande on the property. The management and service was excellent. In future visits we would consider the Four Seasons, as they are smaller and seem to feature better service. We visited the property, which is next door to the Grand Wailea, and came away impressed with the brief experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: cyclopseye
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Grand Wailea for a conference at the property. Stayed with my wife and was given a room with two queen beds. Asked for a room with a king bed but was told that there were none available as the property was sold out, but we would be informed if a room did open up. Never received a call. Received a hearty welcome upon arrival with leis. Room and furniture could use some update, as our couch's cushioning was well worn and there were unfinished areas of paint primer in the bathroom. Did appreciate the clock radio with the iPod dock and the wireless and wired internet access that was included in the resort fee. Was skeptical at first of the mandatory valet parking, but we called ahead right before we left our room and our car was ready to go (with 2 bottles of water !). The wife enjoyed the complimentary yoga classes and found the fitness center to be above average. We throughly enjoyed the beach, pools, and slides.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkster777
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent a wonderful relaxing week vacation at the Grand Wailea the 2nd week of the New 2012 Year. We escaped the winter cold of the S.F. Bay Area and arrived to 80 degree weather which was just perfect for us! We have not visited a lot of resorts in Maui but can't imagine any can be better than the Grand Wailea. This resort is pretty comparable to the Grand Hyatt in Kauai. We rented a car for the week but may have wasted our money! We used the car once to drive to Lahaina for the day and the rest of the week the car was valet parked! we either spent our days lounging at the beach or at the pool. We had dinner at the "Humuhumu.... " restaurant which had a special 5 course pairing menu with the visiting "Joseph Phelps Winery" from Napa, CA. The chef (Isaac Bancaco) there is excellent! Evenings we walked (5 minute leisurely) to the Shops at Wailea and ate dinner either at Tommy Bahama, Ruth Chris' Steakhouse, and enjoyed sushi at Kai-Wailea Sushi. There are a couple of other casual restaurants there also to enjoy. The Four Seasons right next door to the Grand Wailea has a pathway to their resort and has an excellent restaurant called "Ferraro's". We love this restaurant for dinner and enjoy the beautiful sunsets. Also, it's whale migration season so we were seeing whale "spouts" and tail splashes from the beach and the pool. Pretty amazing to see a lot of activity in the ocean while relaxing in a lounge chair catching some rays! This resort has the Hawaiian ambiance of all what you expect from a 5 star hotel. Service, food, and cleanliness is a plus and my husband & I are already thinking of how soon can we make it back to the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Limestone637
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Wailea the first week of January. The pools are great and the beach service was excellent. We moved back and forth with ease. All of the staff are first rate. Can't really say anything bad, they do a great job. Be prepared though, everything its expensive but this is maui so don't be surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, but the service is shakey”
Reviews.Author: pvaz2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Wailea Dec. 16-23, and I believe this was like my 12th or 13th time staying there. It is a fabulous property, great pools for adults, and separate spectacular pool for the kids, with slides, rope swings, water elevators, pool volleyball, sand beach at the pool.....that part of it makes it the best place for a family in Maui. However, be forewarned that it is VERY expensive, everything from the poolside drinks, to room service. Probably no more so than the neighboring Four Season, but just be prepared to spend $$$$$. They do kinda nickel and dime.....$30 daily resort fee, $25 daily valet parking fee which you MUST accdept since they no longer allow self parking. so add that to your room bill. The rooms have been remodeled and are nice, altho I would propably recommend that you stay away from the Garden view rooms, as some are ground level and therefore things get very busy and noisy, and some are a view of building rooftops. Why go to Hawaii for that? The service, however, is another story. The people are quite nice, however, they just seem like they have been smoking something, as they do not know how to respond to ANY type of problem. It is almost as if they are zombies or something. We had some problems with our bookings, which was very easily fixed, yet the front desk personnel could not understand how to fix it and said a manager would have to talk with me but there were none around. They said he would call me. He didin't, so I went back about 5 hours later, and again, no manager to be found..."in a meeting", but would call me in our room. No Call. Went down to the front desk first thing the next morning and FINALLY flagged down a manager, explained my situation, and they looked at me dumbfounded like they didn't understand english. Think of Jack Nicholson is Cookoo's Nest right after he had been zapped. Incredible. After at least 45 minutes, I finally got them to understand what I wanted, and they quickly took care of it--a very simple request to reregister the name under MY name instead of my partner's, since I am a GW member and get a little bit better pricing. Whooooo. I do not blame the employees, I just think that they are not trained to handle anything except a simple check in, and they certainly are not empowered to do much. They are very nice, but just seem like they have their hands tied and I felt like I was talking to a robot. Overall, this is a great hotel, and I will go back, but these frustrations with the front desk can drive you crazy (you will see it all the time with upset vacationers who get just as frustrated as I did). The hotel could go to 5 stars if they would just train the staff on a broader basis and empower them to make things right by their guests. Just like a Ritz Carlton does.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: DFC69
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels we have ever visited. Long trip from Boston but was well worth it. Top notch rooms, services and location in Maui. The staff went out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, needs polishing.”
Reviews.Author: jam12869
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge...like Vegas huge. Our room (with a beautiful view) was the furthest room from the hotel lobby, restaurants, shops and elevators. If you have senior members in your group, this might not be the best hotel for you. We asked for a room closer to the elevators upon check-in and there was no availability. We were gently reminded by the receptionist that, "we are getting a great deal on this room- these rooms normally go for $900/night." I felt that comment was unnecessary, condescending and presumptuous. And with that being said, I would have expected that the "$900/night room" would have been impeccably clean. Instead, the upholstery on the furniture on the lanai was extremely soiled and worn and there was white lime scale on the shower head and walls of the glass shower. Staff here was generally very friendly. Food was delicious. Concierge was friendly but not all that knowledgable in relation to local activities and restaurants. We were sent to a restaurant close by that was marginal (5 Palms), at best. We were misinformed about a Whale Watching activity (departure time and directions) and when asked for a recommendation for dinner in Lahina we were handed a book to thumb through. The setting of the hotel is beautiful, along the Maui coastline. However I felt the staff and appointments needed a little polishing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you have the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: Brandi411
Reviews.Content: Beautiful massive hotel with many upscale services but be prepared to pay up. I stayed here for a conference and received a steeply discounted room rate when divided between myself and my roommate was still expensive. Every inch of the hotel was beautiful and luxurious but absolutely everything was overpriced. We couldn't even eat breakfast for under $15 and that is for a muffin and tea. We soon discovered the convenience store/deli across at the shops at Wailea and ate most of our meals there. Our room was huge as was the bathroom which was very nicely designed. The staff all seemed very friendly and smiled and greeted you each time you passed. The pool areas were amazing and the floating restaurant was nice but I've definitely had better meals many other places. Overall the hotel is in a setting that is unreal and the grounds and hotel are kept immaculate. It is probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at and likely the nicest I ever will. However, I do not think I would ever pay the going rate unless I were to win the lottery and then maybe I could afford to take advantage of the other services the hotel also offers to people with some $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: lfolkerts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! Great views of the beach and the rooms are top notch! The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and could use an update”
Reviews.Author: Amy H
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a huge complex, great for families (lazy river pool, baby beach and waterslides) but is in need of an update. Our room was a nice size but the ottoman & chairs were stained, the shower had some limescale, and many walls around the resort were scuffed. Drinks & meals in the hotel were mediocre and overpriced, including a $20 room service burger that arrived like a hockey puck. We also felt a luxury hotel shouldn't nickel & dime their guests (i.e., daily housekeeping fee?). We were disappointed with the concierge service on 3 occasions. Given its size, the resort's signage could be a bit better/more direct. On the upside, the bed was very comfortable, the spa services were pricey but worth it, the view was gorgeous, and the small koi ponds and vegetation on the grounds were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the Storm!”
Reviews.Author: Ricepatch
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria lives up to its name. It has a the wonderful feel of Hawaii and is set on its own peaceful side of Maui. The Waldorf is surrounded by tropical gardens and manicured grounds. Its gorgeous! The staff were very courteous and friendly. There were torrential down pours and power outages for a few days during our visit to Hawaii and the Waldorf went beyond the norm to comfort all its guests by giving out complimentary ice cream and massages in the spa. All of the restaurants at the hotel were wonderful. The exciting swimming areas are full of caves, hot tubs, and slides and are fun for the whole family or a couple on a retreat. This luxury will cost you a pretty penny though. So for a weekend splurge it is definitely worth it! I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a luxurious experience!

Reviews.Title: “Worth $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: Tula T
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting on white sand beaches. The resort has it all activities for everyone in the family. The conference rooms for business are well equipped for multiple groups. The grounds are exceptional! The staff is wonderful. The food is excellent. The entertainment is phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lux at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: chumbud
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience: picturesque, luxurious, and fun. The views from every room are wonderful, I think. My bed was so comfy that I'd lust for it when I got home. They do charge a great deal for drinks, however, like $10 for a beer! They do nickel and dime you for all fitness center classes, even after the daily "spa fee". That's a bit much. Otherwise, the setting is delightful. There is actually a beach where you can safely swim on most days. It's expensive but a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: europeenne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for a conference. We paid a conference price (which, despite a number of negotiated reductions, was still not even close to cheap), and this is a very nice hotel. The room and bathroom were nice, well equipped and spacious; however, for a 5 star hotel, this place was seriously lacking (or at least inconsistent) in terms of service. The pool was open until 10pm at night, and we decided at 9pm one night that we wanted to go for a quick dip. We erred around the pool area for 10 minutes to get some towels, but none were to be found (and no life guard or any other staff), so we ended up going back up to our room after the swim dripping. We were able to get beach towels (from an utterly disinterested lady) at the towel counter the next morning. In our room, there was a nice card that said "Service with Aloha" and "In anticipation of your receipt of our emailed satisfaction survey, we'd like to know what we can do *now* to make your stay more enjoyable. Please share your comments or special requests with us on this card which we will retrieve during our next service." I noted the lack of pool towels on the card, which I was able to take home because room service never bothered to retrieve it. There was a coffee maker in the room, and we made coffee the first morning (we cleaned up the coffee grinds that were all over the machine from the previous occupant) and the second (we re-assembled the machine correctly after room service had re-assembled it incorrectly after cleaning). By the third morning, we had run out of the two packs of coffee that were in our room when we arrived. We asked at the front desk for a refill, and when we came back to our room after dinner, we had six (6) packs of coffee - wow. The telephone was really dusty, and we were charged a long-distance call instead of the local call that I made (they took it off the bill when we mentioned it at check-out). At check-out, the lady did not bother to ask whether we had enjoyed our stay, whether we had found everything alright, or anything like it. Don't get me wrong, these are all little things. For an expensive 5-star hotel like the Grand Wailea, though, it was quite disappointing to see such spotty service and disinterested attitude. Everybody can build and maintain a nice hotel with nice rooms and large bathrooms; it is the service that sets apart an excellent hotel from an average one. The Grand Wailea was no more than average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, but for a price”
Reviews.Author: miss_faw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Wailea several times now, and this time, I think it just lost its luster. First of all, the resort was booked to capacity, so it was nearly impossible to find any type of chair down by ANY of their many pools or on the beach. During the day, staff continually patrolled the area the make sure only paying guests were setting up shop on the property--which was fine, until they started to continually pester us to see our Grand Wailea bracelets while we were lounging by the pool. Overall, service seemed tense. There definitely wasn't the same level of friendliness, the degree of policing just made me uncomfortable. On New Year's Eve, while I was walking at the hotel's main entrance, I almost got kicked out of the grounds because I didn't have my room key when security stopped me. It was unsettling and unpleasant. Despite the service issues and the crowds, the resort is as fabulous as ever. I sincerely doubt there is a resort in the world as beautiful as the Grand Wailea. That said, all that opulence and beauty comes for a huge price--not just dollars (which there are certainly LOTS of around this place) but also a loss of comfort and tranquility. It's a beautiful place, the rooms and comfortable, but I probably will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful setting and service, but dissapointing food”
Reviews.Author: Steven D
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at "the Grand" with my girlfriend. I was atttending a conference there, so was happy that I didn't have to pay! I hear prices are crazy, ours was a conference fee of 235 before tax, resort charge, ... normally for our room (ocean view with beautiful lanai) you pay over $1000. Of course the setting was beautiful, romantic, and service (concierge, reception desk, housekeeping, ...) was excellent, however, ... I find that they are somewhat stingy and not so great on food. During the conference, the food was average, and they made us feel like there was only just enough for us to have one plate. They started taking in the buffet tables as soon as they could apparantly. Not a nice feeling. Same with the Luau, I would not recommend it, your average tacky show, and again the stingyness and average quality of the buffet food. In conclusion, if you have the money, or the opportunity, definitely go there, you won't find a more luxurious place where you really feel taken care of. But don't count on them for your catering. Only the Humu humu nuku nuku apua'a restaurant is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: kaboocan
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row we stayed in a Condo in Lahaina for two weeks and spend the last 5 days at the GW. Great retreat for the family and I am very impressed in how the GW has now cracked down the Pool intruders from the other resorts. They also appeared to be enforcing the 1 hour unattended chair policy, so we had NO problem getting chairs in most of the pools We invested in the Elite Memberships in which we came close to breaking even in the first year, however beware of the fine print. Discounts are ONLY available Wailea merchandise in shops, the spa and a few of the restaurants. The Grand Wailea Luau is not covered under the discount as the concierge advised us the Luau is a completely 3rd party event and not associated with the Grand Wailea (other than marketing). Otherwise we enjoy hanging at the pool and happy hour at Humuhumu (Max is our favorite bartender). Lastly, the poolside food seems to have improved from last year. Also you order from the Sports Bistro which has a larger menu.

Reviews.Title: “We need a 6 star rating for the Napua Tower it's that great!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Second review, third time staying at the Grand Wailea and loved it! We stayed in the Napua Tower and for everyone asking it's worth it! Breakfast everyday, tea and cookies for an afternoon snack, and a great happy hour with drinks and heavy appetizers included really makes it a special stay. This has to be the largest resort pool in Maui, but layed out so you have a good time and plenty to do. Food at the pool is really good and portions are huge. Chairs at the beach area are included, just check in at the desk and they put them where you want them, everywhere else in Hawaii they charge for this service. The beach area is the best sand and best waves to play in. We highly recommend paddle boarding and Kayaking out to see the turtles, the tour boats even stop here its that amazing! Located within walking distance of the Mall so everything really is right there. You really have to see it to enjoy how amazing this place is. There's not many 5 star hotels that cater to families, this is the exception, but traveling as a couple we still had a great time. They have changing rooms for your last day so you enjoy it till your flight leaves. You also keep your room charges open for anything that day. The only negative is when you have to leave, everyone makes you feel truly welcome here. When people like what they do it shows and this place has happy employees. We look forward to seeing you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not more than "OK"”
Reviews.Author: AlbanyL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days in January with two kids (4 and 8). The hotel is nice overall but can use some updates and improvements. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable. There is some noise problem between floors and between rooms - worse in some than others. We first stayed in a room that had a connecting door and could hear everything that was going on in the next room (even regular conversations). We moved to a room with no connected door and it was fine. There are several pools and water slides which were great for the kids. The key problem with the pool area is that there is very little room to sit around the pools. As a result the pools always feel very crowded. The beach suffers from a similar problem. It seems that these areas don't really fit the size of the hotel. Food is a real problem in this hotel. There are several restaurants but all were quite disappointing. If you can drive, there are some great restaurants in nearby towns. Finally we didn't feel the staff were as nice as can be. They were courteous but not too friendly. Some quick tips: 1) before you buy all the toys and boards your kids desire check lost and found. People leave a ton of toys behind and there were boogie boards and sand toys left on the beach almost every day. We gave away our board and toys the last day of our stay and many others do the same. 2) there is a Pizza Hut that delivers and it was probably the dinner our kids enjoyed best :) 3) the drive to Hana and the drive up the volcano are a problem for those with motion sickness...

Reviews.Title: “Grand but expensive”
Reviews.Author: amb614
Reviews.Content: A vast hotel and with extensive grounds, so it's very difficult to find one's way around at first, and we often felt we were in a maze. Once oriented, however, we appreciated the multi-level river pool with slides, and the beach front with umbrellas, best in the morning before the winds pick up. Food and drink were unreasonably expensive. However, it is an easy walk to the upscale Shops at Wailea, where provisions and restaurants can be found. The hotel has arrangements with the Wailea Tennis Club, but this did not offer any programs the first week of Jan., so I went to the Makena Tennis Club, about 3 miles down the road, which was very welcoming and quickly matched me up with a playing partner--I really enjoyed playing there.

Reviews.Title: “overall super but a bit big”
Reviews.Author: michaelrosenberg
Reviews.Content: From pulling up to the hotel and check-in to check-out, throughout our stay the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful all over the resort, except maybe the pool, where things can get a bit aggressive when it comes to getting and keeping a lounge chair. Our first day there we were up very early and got to the pool before it opened. One of the other guests, a frequent visitor, told us to get a good spot and make sure to lie on the lounges at least once an hour or the hotel would remove our stuff and give the lounges to someone else. I had never heard of such a crazy scenario, but it did indeed happen to us. I guess we lost track of time at the beach. When we returned to the lounges someone else was sitting there and our things were gone. My first reaction was that it was all stolen but then I remembered the cautionary tale from earlier in the day. I went to the towel desk to tell them what happened and was treated like some sort of criminal. I didn't know how to react, so I just didn't. Security came by moments later and apologized for the rules and gave me back my stuff. He was very polite and professional. From then on we just sat on the beach - the pool was too competitive. I can understand the reason for this rule as the hotel is tremendous and caters to large groups and conferences. There just are not enough lounges for every guest. Though we did not sit at the pool, the kids loved the pool. There is a water elevator, several slides, waterfalls and rivers. Great fun for them. Our room was super. Great view of the beach and sun rises. Large enough for family of four. The grounds and public spaces at the hotel are beautiful and chock full of art. If you like Botero, the lobby bar is the place for you. His sculptures abound. The grounds are littered with fountains and ponds with fish and waterfalls and bridges - the kids loved it; it was a great tropical adventure. The food is good, but not great. We had a few meals down the beach at the Four Seasons. The food is markedly better there and in some cases cheaper - especially the kids menus. All in all, we had an amazing week here.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical Las Vegas glitzy hotel”
Reviews.Author: DVEB
Reviews.Content: Great for rich family kids (4-10 yrs old). Service very professional. Great view of the ocean. Pathetic Internet access (dial-up speed from the '90). We complained to the front desk and to the IT help desk. They said that this is the Internet access that the hotel offers. If you try to stay in touch with your business partners via the Internet (ex. Skype) you need to go to a different hotel or to a Starbucks. For all water activities you need to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Luau was great-food disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rrosepetal
Reviews.Content: For our Hawaiian Christmas vacation,we planned to attend a luau. Everyone said to go to Costco and get luau tickets at a discount for the Grand Wailea,so we did. (We had previously planned to do the Old Lahaina Luau) The hotel is amazing and walking around the grounds was so much fun for the adults and the kids. There are fish ponds and many beautiful photo locations. It was Christmas,so the decorations all over the resort were fantastic! We were greeted at the luau with such charm and friendly smiles,escorted to our table for 9 and shown where to get drinks while waiting for the show to start. They even had lawn bowling and tattoos for the kids,which ours thoroughly enjoyed. The luau served drinks throughout and offered specialties such as pina coladas and mai tais (both alcoholic and non for the kiddies) and then they had the uncovering ceremony at the Emu pit. Finally the show started and the buffet was served. My husband and I had been to a luau before and the food here just didn't stand up at all. It was very disappointing,considering the splendor of the resort and show. I would recommend this only if you were already staying at the hotel,otherwise,spend a few more dollars and go to the Old Lahaina Luau.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: We actually only stayed here because of an issue with where we were supposed to stay. Just walked in and they were able to get a room. The lady checking in was very helpful. The room was a garden view but was still very nice. We loved the property. I was nice to just walk around and take it all in. And the wive loved going to the mall down the street. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “It is a not a good value”
Reviews.Author: donsteiny
Reviews.Content: It has some fun things, like a bar in the pool, but the drinks start at $15. They book events like whale watching and you can get the exact same thing for 1/2 the price by looking on the Internet. The first day I got there I had their buffet breakfast. Everything was cold, there was a meager selection and it was $30. Their sprinkler system has a pump that sounds like a jackhammer so you can't sleep with your windows open. You can hear your neighbors through the walls. Though it is lovely in some ways, it is artificial. Maui is so beautiful and there is so much to do hiding out in a overpriced artificial Maui just does not make sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: The lush gardens, the fabulous pools, and the beach are all wonderful. The hotel is very large and thus can hold many, many people. When we visited in August, the hotel was very full and included lots of families. By mid-morning all beach umbrellas were gone and all sitting spots around the pools were also taken. So don't expect just a few people at the beach and around the pools. The location is great as it is right next door to an upscale shopping mall and great restaurants; and several more wonderful beaches are within walking distance. The onsite "humuhumu" restaurant is located in a lagoon and offers great sunset views...a great place to have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great time...very big !”
Reviews.Author: amc10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here nineteen years ago when it was brand new...still lovely, needs a small bit of updating but still well kept and very eager to please. Rooms are nice, resort is beautiful, spa is still out of this world. Very large resort that has many pools and countless events for children but when you have a teenager it is a bit tricky. Teenagers under eighteen not allowed at the adult pool which I completely understand but we had to swim with our daughter with the kids ( and there are lots of them) at the water pools ( slides etc...) but we were happy to have heated pools ( which are not plentiful in the Hawaiian islands) and as we were there Christmas week the crowds were overwhelming. We rented cabanas every day and it really made our trip but at four hundred dollars a day it changes your whole financial dynamic and I can't imagine most guests willing to make that financial commitment. Still love this place...great memories and a staff from heaven. But be prepared to fight for chairs if the cabanas are out of your price range. BTW cabanas sell out so get a move on!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: s20mark
Reviews.Content: I travel the country weekly. This my favorite hotel in the US! Don't just think about it...GO.

Reviews.Title: “HONEST REVIEW....BEST HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: shakalakagirl
Reviews.Content: DON'T LISTEN TO THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS!!!!! We have stayed here numerous times and LOVE it!! Extremely kid friendly, with lots of activities!( I am nineteen and still LOVE to go here!) They have the most beautiful gardens and walkways, but the best part is the pools! My sister and I have the best memories at the pool, there are so many exciting water slides, a rope swing, waterfalls, and "secret" hot tubs. It's like having access to a water park. The beach is right across the walkway and it's super soft sand, perfect waves, and perfect slope in the ocean. I don't see what the negative reviewers are talking about....our experience has been nothing but perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kfaw
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, but you will pay for it. The rooms are expensive, and then they hit you with every little cost they can. Plus to eat anywhere in the hotel will cost you. We have stayed here a few times, but will not be going back after our most recent trip during New Years. The customer service was terrible, and with what we were paying we expected more. We had other family staying next door at the Marriott, and they couldn't even come sit on the chairs at the pool. There are better places to stay in Wailea, and you will come out feeling better about your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: c o
Reviews.Content: Staying here was one of the most pleasant vacations myself and my wife ever had,the hotel staff is so kind helpful and friendly they make you feel like family as soon as you arrive. Our room escort ( Robert ) was very friendly and very eager to answer any of our questions and gave us some great advice,then ( Lilia) the nice lady that took care of our room was so attentive to our needs making sure we had what we needed,the grounds itself make you feel like you are in paradise with all the different flowers, trees,tropical fruit garden,it makes you never want to leave the hotel grounds'they also have a nice cafe ( Hula) where you can enjoy a meal or a snack or just a coffee,there is just so much to says about this wonderful hotel all I can say once you go there you will always want to go back,but be prepared things are pricey

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: sunshine1066
Reviews.Content: I find this resort to be both adult and family friendly. My husband and I went and stayed in the "Napua Tower" and found it to be beyond our expectations. Overall thru- out the resort the service was first class, the grounds are beautifully maintained. No complaints at all! Can't wait to go back!!! Any questions or concerns you may have(we didn't) i'm sure would be accomated to. Love Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sorely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn V
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this beautiful hotel on our honeymoon in 2003 and decided to return again on our latest visit to Maui. From the moment we checked in, I started having second thoughts about staying here. The front desk staff seemed mildly annoyed that we were bothering them to check in. The room we had requested was taken and we were led to a room that was not nearly as nice as the one we remembered, and we paid even more for it this time. The second day of our stay my husband and I were having a good time going down the slide. On my last run, I felt a thud on the side of my head, but didn't think too much of it until one of the other swimmers yelled at me that I was bleeding from my head. Apparently, as I popped out of the slide chute, I slammed my head on one of the boulders outlining the pool. The hotel security took me to a back room where they called medics to look at my wound. Thankfully, I didn't have a concussion, but I did need to have stitches. Once I was deemed healthy enough to walk, the security guard pointed my husband in the direction of the nearest medical facility and we drove ourselves there. Eight stitches later, we returned to the hotel. We never heard from anyone at the hotel to check in on how I was doing - no phone call, no note, no nothing. I didn't expect anything from them except common courtesy and compassion and perhaps a call from the manager on duty. Two days later we checked out and again, the front desk was less than friendly. We've told this tale to several people and have been told that the hotel does a great job of marketing to reel the people in, but their customer service is severely lacking once you check-in. Needless to say, we will never return to this property and tell people all the time to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Grand Wailea. . . especially during XMAS”
Reviews.Author: JCTraveler1104
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Xmas week at the Grand Wailea and I will NOT go back. I simply cannot comprehend the postive reviews this hotel has received. And, if one person who reads my comments decides against the Grand Wailea, I will be happy because I will have saved someone lots of money (and time!). Perhaps if the room were $200.00 a night and my expectations were lower I could accept some of the failings but even then . . . I must begin by describing the most ridiculous aspect of this hotel, which, by the way, is not the poorly decorated, dirty, dated hotel rooms, but rather, the line for beach chairs. As another hotel guest stated while waiting on line for chairs, "the system is demeaning." Be prepared to be on line well before 7:30 am and to wait for at least twenty minutes to half an hour. Then, be ready to be told sometimes (this was not the case each day), you can only get two beach towels even though there are 5 people in your party and you have paid for two hotel rooms. Then walk to the beach, give your ticket to the men placing the beach chairs, and be sure to be armed with extra t-shirts, magazines, books, etc so that you can hold your place while you run back into the hotel to grab breakfast (and this is not quick feat either as there is a wait here too) or wake up your kids! Even these steps won't guarantee you will have seats when you come back. Twice, two of our unmanned chairs were "stolen." As for service, it's average to non-existent. The front desk people were uninterested and other than a server here or there in the restaurants, nobody seemed at all as if they cared about your stay. I guess I can't blame them. The hotel is HUGE and has many rules; I assume they have no choice but to enforce them. If you are used to staying at more service oriented hotels, do not even consider staying at the Grand Wailea, you will be disappointed and annoyed. Last, I expected the restaurants, the spa, and the stores to be expenisive but it seems as if everywhere this hotel is trying to charge for something (i.e. fitness classes other than 7:00 am yoga). In fact, upon checking in you are told that there is $20.00 per day charge per room on top of the room charge and taxes and on top of valet and on top of the $50.00 a day connecting room charge, should you want connecting rooms guaranteed. And, one tale I must relate was when I asked for a copy of my bill the night before we checked out and I was told by the front desk person that there would be a $2.25 charge to deliver it to my room. (I actually hadn't asked for it to be delivered, just that it be ready but she obviously wasn't listening, like the people at the pool who kept aksing me for my information to get a bracelet when all I said I wanted was a towel.) To spend hard earned money on a hotel with so many flaws and one with a general vibe of disinterest just doesn't feel good. It was only once I accepted all the problems (though it was hard to get over the bathroom) and reminded myself that I was lucky to be in beautifu lMaui, that I was able to enjoy myslef.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: MikelikesDisney
Reviews.Content: It is the hotel that other family hotels should be compared. We went over the Christmas holiday and spent a week at the property. We left to go to the other side of the island once and was happy to return to the quiet Grand Wailea. The resort is big which made it nice for our children. My wife and I went to the spa on several occasions. We played golf as a family on 3 of the days and then hung around the pool. The restaurants were good. The room service for breakfast on the lanai was good. I liked the place. Maui, however, is too touristic for me. Maui is great for golf and seclusion at a resort. The island has become a mecca for every American. Stay here if you come to Maui. Otherwise, consider the Four Seasons on Lanai and the big island.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: marciba
Reviews.Content: My family has been here twice now and we plan to go back as soon as possible. Our girls ages, 9 and 7, absolutely LOVE the pools, slides, water elevator and more! Their kids' camp, Camp Grande is the best. Both of my girls love going to the camp and that gives us a night out in the most beautiful place in the world. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “99.9999% perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Tuxedo23
Reviews.Content: Wailea is a perfect town and the Gand Wailea is the nicest and most elegant and opulent resort there. Movies have even been filmed at the hotel. If there was anything wrong to be found, it is that the food on the resort is only ok...but many good restaurants nearby like Gannons. You will love it and no matter if you are traveling with kids or not, Grand Wailea is the perfect place. Yes, it is pricey, but you more than get your money's worth. Near championship golf, and the POOL IS THE BEST POOL I HAVE EVER SEEN!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Grande Dame she once was”
Reviews.Author: jtimhall
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Grand Wailea. We have stayed here many times in the past, and always had a great time. Sadly to say, not so on this occasion. From the 'tepid' reception, to the listless registration,...it was then downhill. For $750 night you expect more. We had lunch at the Bistro Molikini, and I have to say I have had better service at a Denny's, and cardboard had more taste. We decided to 'sit around' the pool and 'chat' with our family, and we were 'chased away' by the pool girl, who said that if we were to sit in a chair, we had to have a 'pool id bracelot'... Seriously? I explained that I had 2 rooms rented, which rooms they were, and that all we wanted to do is sit, talk,, drink a drink, and enjoy. We were told that we had to leave. There were plenty of pool side seats available, it was 3pm in the afternoon. Sadly, this will be our last trip to the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “$758.00-seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: Unless they renovate, do not stay here. This is a motel 6 at least. Oh wait, a motel 6 cleans a bit better. It is so dusty! There was dust on the floorboards and the carpet that was coming up by the edges. The phone didn't work and the light didn't either. The band played until ten, making it impossible for us to put our kids to bed (terrible too). Carpet is old an dirty. Remote is broken. We have stayed in two different hotels and they were much nicer and much cheaper. (Around $400 a night). Big pain of a hotel. I've stayed in 3 star rated hotels in S.F. that is so much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “A least once”
Reviews.Author: golf18aday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week a couple of weeks ago. Thankfully I was able to use my Hilton points for the stay. We had a great views of the grounds and a small view of the ocean. The koi pond outside our room was a nice touch along with the occasional visit for the turtle that hung out in the pond. We took advantage of the photography and paintind classes offered at the resort. The instructors were very helpful and we feel we got our moneys worth from the classes. The beauty of the grounds can keep your camera busy. We ate at least one meal at each of the restaurants. This is a resort and prices are higher here. Humuhumu...should not be missed. It was a wonderful experience but pay attention to the lobster on the menu. It is priced by the pound. The hula pie is the best we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Restful reprieve from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: shofur4two
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully beautiful and exotic resort. Waterslides and waterfalls all wonderful. Rooms are clean with a beautiful view. The spa is amazing and everyone should make use of it. Only thing that I think needs an improvement is the food service around the pool. If it was more efficient and a bit more varied in menu the resort could make more money and the patrons happier. We can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but needs refreshing.”
Reviews.Author: 513pci
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most beautiful location on Maui accommodates this hotel. Beautiful exterior and pool/beach areas are prestine. Unfortunately, this level of perfection was not carried over to the individual rooms. Room #1 had food splattered all over the wall. Room #2 smelled of mold and was actually growing mold in the bathroom. This is about the point we asked for the manager. She was very courteous and understanding. She personally inspected addressed the aforementioned issues with staff and inspected a third room prior to dragging us up there. We were very pleased with the final room. The rest of the stay was bliss. A light refreshing of rooms will make this an amazing destination.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: tgdg558
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights Christmas week with a family of four including two teen aged girls. We all thought we died and went to heaven! I cannot imagine that the people who wrote some of the recent reviews were at the same hotel??? Anyway, we used the beach chair service each day and it was a complete breeze, walk up tell them you want four chairs and two umbrellas and the guys literally ran out to the beach with your umbrellas and chairs, gave them a $5 tip each day otherwise it was free (try like $25 a day for each chair elsewhere). We got the wrist bands when you got the towels, my one daughter never got one but it was no issue. I am a HH Gold member and used points, they gave me an upgraded room, the room was large and had an awesome view of the chapel and ocean, ground floor near the spa and workout facilities (I did not try the spa but the workout room were super nice; smoothies for after for free, towels in ice for your face, flowers on the desk, wood paneling; you get the picture). I did eat at Bistro Molikini and agree its expensive but being HH Gold we got a $40 off dinner coupon and a $30 off drink coupon at Humuhum too so we spent $84 with tip for four at a nice place for a couple of drinks one steak and three fish dinners (kudos to Hilton for treating its frequent guests so nice). We ate in Kihei otherwise which is close with many excellent choices. The lobby was decorated super nice for the holidays and the drive up to the hotel with the trees all lit up was also stunning. We thought the hotel was large but with the room placement we had by the chapel it worked out well. We also stayed at the Sheraton Maui on the same trip and the room was smaller (even the Deluxe room), beds not as nice, resort MUCH larger so way more walking and not even half as nice overall even with the Kannapali Beach location and Black Rock. Also they waved my $25 resort fee at the GW due to HH staus but not the Sheraton where I am also SPG Gold. I did pay the $25 valet fee at the GW. Overall my entire family thought the Grand Wailia was one of the nicest places we have ever stayed, we have stayed at some Ritz Carltons and this was just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: weather72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about a year and a half ago; however, I liked the hotel so much that I decided it definitely deserved a review. The hotel was beautiful. There was a ton of detail involved in everything, and everything was very clean and well kept. The rooms were clean and nice. The beds were very comfortable and its still some of the greatest sleeps that I have ever had. The bathroom was also very nice. Definitely the best bathroom I have ever had at a hotel before. It was great to really nice to open the front door to the room every morning and have a view of the mountains and swaying palm trees. The balcony on the other end of the room had a great view of the ocean and gardens around the property. The pool was nice and surprisingly quiet when I was there. Only certain times of the day would the pool be crowded and the adult pool is quiet all day long. They had a great walking path along the beach and I really enjoyed taking daily walks along that path (which lead to other nearby hotels including the Four Seasons right next door. The landscaping and dramatic views along the path were something that you would never experience outside of Hawaii! There were a few negatives though... - The food was not good at Humahumanukanukaapuaa. Something must have burnt in the kitchen so the entire restuarant had a burned smell to it toward the end of my dining experience. It really was terrible. The food at the bar in the lobby was very good though and there are some nice restaurants nearby. - There are not a lot of chairs at the beach. Get to the beach early. If you wait until 12am, there is a good chance that most of the lounge chairs will be gone. However, the beach is not that crowded even though it is technically a public beach. - The water current gets very strong after about 1pm. I went canoeing along the beach one day and the current was so strong that in just a matter of minutes I could barely see the beach. It was diffucult to paddle back and a bit scary knowing that there is nothing but 1000s of miles of ocean beyond the beach. However, if you are just swimming along the beach and you dont go out too far, you should have no problems with strong currents, expecially early in the morning when the water is actually very calm most days. - The location of the hotel, while beautiful, was a bit out of the way of everything. The area where the hotel was, was far away from any major cities. It seemed like the area mostly had large mansions, other luxury hotels, and some decent shopping areas. It would have been a bit more convienent of the hotel was nearby to a larger town. I highly recommend this hotel. Its one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and I will never forget this vacation thanks to the beautiful hotel and beautiful island!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TheWanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year during the holidays and had a much better experience. We are still here but not happy at all. Maid service in your room is questionable,Internet doesn,t work in your room unless you are wired, who is wired anymore. Hotel staff doesn't seem to care as I am sure they hear it all the time. Try getting a chair by the pool after 8 am, well don,t because they are all taken, then try getting a drink by the pool, order early then plan on staying late to get your drink then close your tab. I know they are sold out but when the least expensive room is 850 a night, at least give people the basics.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: pbm32019
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here since we were bringing children. We have always stayed at the four season but thought the children would enjoy the hotel. We didn't expect the same service or accommodations. However, we were shocked that the hotel reminded us of a motel 6. The food was horrible. The pool and beach was a nightmare. The system to get a chair on the beach was exhausting. Go get a wrist band, wait in another line to get a piece of paper to get in another line to get a chair set up on the beach. The whole process took about an hour each day. The beach was so crowded it was ridiculous. The rooms were old and dated. We were in a handicap room which left us half of a normal closet size so I never took anything out of the suitcase. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The kids love the beach and really didn't care that much about the slides after they went down a few times. i can highly recommend the four season please don't make the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “perfect quiet (Adults pool) resort for your Honeymoon or special occassion!”
Reviews.Author: NMTC
Reviews.Content: As a Professional Travel Consultant, I am very critical in my reviews of hotels and resorts. The Grand Wailea seems to never disappoint us. My brother was married at the GW years ago and returns annually for his anniversary. I have celebrated my last several birthdays at this property and found it to be lovely. My Honeymoon couples and special occassion clients receive VIP treatment and a high level of customer service. Very nice Spa and gym, and as with any resort, some of the restaurants are ok, and some are great. Overall, I send my clients to the GW with confidence and plan to return myself in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but not for a low key vacation”
Reviews.Author: piniw
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. We have loved it with the big pools, beach, beautiful hotel and grounds. BUT, it is huge!! It is a production just to get all the kids and their stuff to the pool b/c the walk back to your room can be quite long. We have always stayed here only a few nights b/c we also like the low key part of Hawaii so we stay in a condo or smaller hotel for the other part. This place drives my husband crazy with all the kids running around,etc. But, it is a lot of fun for the kids and adults. I did have to go down every morning at 7am to get chairs otherwise forget it. The hotel is clean and we even saw Adam Sandler and Jennifer Aniston there one year. And as expected, everything is overpriced there. They now have mandatory valet parking so add that on top of the resort fee, food is expensive, as well as poolside amentities. Be prepared. Overall, a fabulous place. Oh and we always got the mountain view aka parking lot view room. It saves a lot of money and it was just fine for how much we were in there.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing property”
Reviews.Author: Hlondon99
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at the hotel, and still love it. The grounds are amazing, more pools than you can count - including an adults only pool. This is right on the beach on the southern end of the island, tremendous service. It is quiet at night and busy during the day. The rooms are close to needing some remodeling, but large and comfortable with amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Day 1 of 11”
Reviews.Author: traceynt
Reviews.Content: Well we have arrived at the hotel for a ten night stay to celebrate our 20 year anniversary.... But it seems the upgrade I was told I had bythe manager weeks ago doesn't Exist..... So garden view here we come. And to top it off I was told that for the ocean view deluxe I would have to forfeit 2 queens for a king and a pull out ( traveling with our 7 year old) but now that I have the standard room they still want me to take a room with a king. Great way to start our trip :(. Got into our room about 2:30, son and husband went to the pool while I unpacked. Son loves the pool! Finally unpacked and met them for a bite to eat ( pool restaurant) average food... Good bloody mary's! Headed to the beach to watch the sunset and asked for a couple chairs and was told no because they were cleaning up. Room is average, needs an update but clean. Roll away too hard so son slept on sofa. Room has no wine opener or glasses so we requested some.... $5 charge and waited an hour, by then was too tired after traveling all day and getting settled in.... So we went to bed. Hope tomorrow is better!

Reviews.Title: “still charming....but needs a makeover, and NOT that great for families”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: years ago, we honeymooned in maui and stayed at the grand wailea and thought it was the most fantastic place on planet earth--we knew back then that someday we wanted to bring our kids there to enjoy it. so we did. we returned with 2 big kids and a 5 month old baby. it still is a great place--don't let any of the haters fool you--but it just didn't seem as contemporary and new this time around. the good: the grounds and the beach are still spectacular. the service is second to none (we got a big time room upgrade for free). spa grande is still THE best spa anywhere. the beds are comfortable and the twice daily room cleaning is great. the location is great and it's just a short walk to the wailea shops. it's a world class property. the not so good: even though the pool is the main attraction for families, to me the grand wailea was a better property without kids in tow. the rooms just aren't big enough to not feel on top of each other with kids. they did provide a baby carriage which was nice, but it didn't leave us with much more space. there's a small fridge, but there's no microwave. i was really excited to take the kids to the pool, but the wow factor wasn't quite there. having been to some really incredible water parks with my kids, the pool slides seemed kinda outdated and lame. the rope swing and water elevator was cool for 10 minutes...after that i kicked myself for not getting a condo or a suite at the fairmont for much more space and less money. (we later went to the honua kai on the kaanapali side of maui and thought we went to heaven) so bottom line, the grand wailea is somewhat overrated as a family hotel, somewhat overpriced, and could use some remodeling. i give it 3.5 stars but i'll round up because i'm nostalgic and have some great memories there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....but needs upgrade for the price”
Reviews.Author: bigdogroad
Reviews.Content: Grand it is but dated and tired.....from a ho-hum buffet to high priced beach services......even a thousand dollar a night suite and a "resort fee" doesn't get you squat at the pool or beach....poor attention to detail vs other high end resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT honeymoon here!”
Reviews.Author: holmonster
Reviews.Content: The staff is quite nice and we were immediately upgraded apon arrival for our honeymoon, but this place is terrible. It is a factory, children everywhere, food is beyond dispicae ( I ordered chicken on a salad and it was cafateria plastic chicken with fake grill marks and my husbnd ordered the worst fish tacos we have had this whole trip). You have to wear a wristband by the pool and don't expect a comfy lounge near the ocean or pool... Or for people to ring you towels...We ended up on lounges out on the grass and not one person came to ask us if we needed a cocktail. The Four Seasons was booked six months ago when we booked this honeymoon, so we figured we would just give this place a shot, but it is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Best spa on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: Terry W
Reviews.Content: The spa facilities in this resort are definitely the best we have seen on Maui...and we've tried others. Also, the service there is top shelf. My hats off to Alex Matthies in Sales who suggested this. After a tough flight over from the mainland, the skilled hands of the masseuse will melt the stress away. We have gone back twice on our last visit, and plan to use this as our "Island Therapy"...Stop #1. Thanks again Alex!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Gardens and exquisite service”
Reviews.Author: Chuck G
Reviews.Content: The most amazing resort ever! The gardens are spectacular and the service it top notch. I have been to many places, but none really compares to this one. I would highly recommend Grand Wailea Resort. Chances are once you have been there you will want to go back. Great place for kids and adults of all ages. The pools are incredible and the food is excellent. Don't forget to enjoy the spa, it was on of the highlights of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort; Just Relax and Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GW resort for a few nights in early December. It was still low season so I think we got a great value for this stay. The GW ground is so beautiful, with well manicured landscape, and great swimming pools for both young ones and the young at hearts. It was just very relaxing to take a walk to the beach and the view of the sunset was incredible. I got an ocean view room on the 7th floor. It seems every room has a small balcony as well. The room itself is pretty standard Hawaiian resort style, with a sofa/table as added furniture. The bathroom is good size with both shower and tub., and a ceiling fan comes standard in every room, I assumed. Overall it was a great experience to enjoy the GW resort, especially without the crowd and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort & great for kids”
Reviews.Author: willtravel4cupcakes
Reviews.Content: Beautiful yet large resort. Stayed here over Thanksgiving with my 2.5 year old. We had a gorgeous one bedroom suite. Very clean and great pool/ocean view. My only complaints are the food menus were very limiting and did not cater to vegetarians. Expensive but all resorts have pricey food especially in Hawaii. It's a large resort so be sure to be ok with walking a lot to and from spa, buffet and stores etc. Great pools & slides. Wasn't very crowded. So it was nice. Overall, great hotel. Friendly staff. Wonderful hotel. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: lily v
Reviews.Content: Loved this stunning hotel.Felt like an old palace,very classy with works of art and flowers everywhere. Women were given fresh leis upon arrival;fresh fruit,water and guava juice in the lobby{nice touch}We were lucky to be upgraded to the napua tower on the 6th floor where you get free breakfast,drinks during the day,tea and cookies in the afternoon and free high quality appetizers with wine ,beer etc...at night. Our room was very large,huge bathroom with a huge tub and large shower.Big balcony with flowers around and 2 lounge chairs and a beautiful view or the ocean,palm trees and gardens and very peaceful.Each floor in this tower has its own concierge. The grounds are breathtaking.yes, this place being popular with familes ,is very lively but it does have quiet aeras also.The pools are great and so much fun even for adults,best i ever seen.The beach is beautiful and so is the surrounding aera. Our our last night we ate at the Humuhumunukunukuapaa{not sure about my spelling} and the food was excellent.Its setting above the water made you feel you were in some polynesian island. Only stayed 2 nights in november and did not want to leave.Can't wait to go back and explore it further.All employees encountered were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible resort! Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Khan1212
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this resort and left extremely disappointed. There seems to be no desire to have repeat customers at this place. I should have known better when I found out that the Grand Wailea is in bankruptcy. The optimistic side of me thought this would cause the staff to be more appreciative of their guests, but boy was I wrong. It's almost as if they know their jobs are unstable and have just stopped caring. I've never experienced such a lack of customer service skills in my life. It's as if your very presence is some sort of inconvenience. From the rude valet personnel and front desk staff to the pool Nazis demanding to see your papers (wristbands) just to walk in the pool area, it was just plain miserable. It felt like being in an airport where you have to constantly be ready to prove it's okay for you to be there. The property is pretty nice, although maybe a little gaudy and "circus" like for some. The rooms are okay, but nothing too special considering the price and the constant nickel and dining that guests receive ($25 just to park there). I really wanted to like this place and it has some positives, but I suggest potential guests stay somewhere else. It was honestly the one bad decision I made when I scheduled my trip to Maui. The rest of my trip was absolutely wonderful though! I highly recommend visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Location, 5 Star Amenities; Expect to Pay for Them”
Reviews.Author: EastsideSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: We arrived during the first week of December for our first stay at the Grand Wailea. The hotel's holiday theme was very festive and the entry is impressive. Our rooms were well appointed with great views. This is a slow time of year, so we had no adjacent neighbors, which made for very quiet surroundings. The property is amazing with beautiful gardens, paths with sitting areas and peaceful streams fed by waterfalls. The pool complex is phenomenal; the most impressive I've seen in all my travels.
