Excellent for my 6 yr old. Love the fast slides, water elevator and rope swing. There are ample seating areas and we always found vacant chairs. The pool service is terribly inattentive for this level of resort, you need to order for the next hour as you won't see them for another 45 minutes. They could learn from Vegas or Bali. Food and drink prices are high, but you don't book a place like this and expect $3 beers and $5 burgers; it is what it is... Beach staff is fantastic, and I highly recommend getting one of their "all you can use" packages. Great beach for kids. Suggest you hit the beach before the winds pick up in the afternoon. Restaurants are good. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet and happy hour at Humuhumunukunukuapuaa. Their butterfish is fantastic. Prices are high, but once again that's to be expected. Kula Cafe was decent and more affordable, but they need someone on their staff that speaks English (I grew up in HI, so understand this is no slight against Pidgin but a comment to 1st generation foreign workers in the service industry). They screwed up every order. Be sure to double check your order. The shops are good, but Kula definitely screws up the flow of retail continuity and should've been put at the end of retail row. Overall the resort was a great place to take my 6 year old daughter. I knew it would be expensive and expected the costs. Would recommend they improve their poolside service as it would be mutually beneficial; I probably wouldve spent twice as much ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm_Hudson
Reviews.Content: My family (including wife and daughters aged 13 and 15) spent a week this summer at the Grand Wailea. Though I had booked the cheapest room class available, the room we got was large, about 50% bigger than a typical hotel room, then it had a lanai that extended out over the ceiling of the floor below, for a semi-private outdoor space as large as the room itself, including a table, two conventional chairs and two lounge chairs. The ocean was visible in the distance through the palm trees. Service was good, the waterslide complex got crowded at times but was incredible fun for the girls. The four of us made a point of going down the lazy river together at least once each day. The beach out front of the hotel is one of Maui's best, truly world class. A beautiful crescent of soft sand bordered by rock at either end, with mild waves. The South end has pretty good snorkeling, with equipment available at reasonable cost from the hotel. The health club is fantastic, and there's a beachside coastal walk that my oldest daughter used to go for a jog each morning. The resort is huge, with a decent length walk to the beach, and it's expensive, but a good value given the quality of the rooms, facilities and setting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mch60
Reviews.Content: Gardens and pools are gorgeous. The hotel itself is also really nice. A little old but I think they keep it up well. The hotel is large so it never felt crowded even though there were alot of weddings going on there. Can't wait to go back but need to build up the savings account first.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Resort - Best Slides around”
Reviews.Author: FlagstaffAZ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in Nov 2011. They have the best slides we have ever been at -- one very big one and the a bunch of little ones called "slide land". They also have a rope that you swing over the water and drop in. A one of a kind water elevator that the developer made for his son. On the last night they had movies by the pool - "Cars 2". We also rented their kayak for the three of us to go out in the ocean. The beach is right there next to the hotel. In a hour time we saw 10 turtles swimming next to us, some only 2 feet away. Before staying here we stayed one night next door at the Marriott, If you walk north of the Marriott on the beach they have the best snorkeling, where you see lots of fish and get to swim with turtles. The hotel has the best laid out balconies, ask for the rooms next to the pools. Our room was 3060. The ones higher up, I wasn't as impressed with, more like normal hotel rooms. Good pizza place near by and in town try the Maui Taco fast food - best fish tacos. For Thanksgiving day we went to Mulligan's just up the road, which had a turkey buffet perfect for hungry swimmers when they close the pools at 5pm. They close the water elevator at 4pm. Beautiful grounds. Resort fee includes internet and parking $25/nt, cheaper then Marriott next door was $30/nt and didn't include internet. Also if you want to learn to surf, down the road in town Maui Beach Boys were very reasonable and taught our 7 yr old, first try and a dozen more times to stand. Perfect location for little kids and older to learn, since it is shallow enough with surf to not be afraid to try.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a vacation, this place is for you”
Reviews.Author: ThreeFamily
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea was an experience you hope to have when you go on a vacation. A stunning lobby, gracious staff, beautiful grounds, big fun pools providing exciting water slides and relaxing nooks and crannies, handy bars, restaurants that look as fabulous as the food tastes, a spa with every possible service and gardens to stroll through. There is something for everyone. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Ocean Activities best part of stay!”
Reviews.Author: TerrellMarshall
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Grand Wailea since its opening week many, many years ago. The property is gorgeous, with architecture and landscaping that manage to be both tropical and elegant at the same time. One of the pluses at this property is that rooms advertised as "ocean view" truly have an ocean view, and those described as "deluxe ocean view" have stunning views. Deluxe ocean view rooms in the chapel wing are closest to the ocean, and have the advantage of quick access to the beach, and the sounds of the waves to lull you to sleep at night. Without doubt, the best part of this hotel, though, are the services offered through their "Maui Ocean Activities". This is what you come to Maui for - to play on the beach. The guys on the beach with Maui Ocean Activities are incredibly knowledgable, helpful and fun. Definitely the most fun of our trip! Staff at the Molikini Bistro are also super. Warm, professional, knowledgeable. Food is excellent!! We liked it at lunch when we could enjoy the beautiful views. (GREAT bartenders!). The waiter staff on the lawn serving the Bisto are outstanding. Friendly and super-hardworking!! Things for them to work on - food quality (with the exception of Molikini Bistro) is seriously in need of a major upgrade. Additonally, the pool staff needs help! They appear to be understaffed and overwhelmed. Long lines, sort of snarky attitudes - you definitely do not feel you are at a fine resort. It's a large pool area, and it often looks messy and unkept. No five-star experience here. (On the other hand, the activity pools are absolutely the most fun in all of Hawaii and reason enough to stay here if you are traveling with children!). If you want more fun and better service, head to the Maui Ocean Activities desk right before you hit the beach!

Reviews.Title: “From Rose to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: susan k
Reviews.Content: We were greated at the door by Rose Sumbicay with a beautiful orchid lei. Taken to a room with a spectacular view of one of the most gorgeous beaches in the world. We immediately threw on swim suits, went to the beach and were lulled into deep naps. We went to the spa - there is not another one like it. The water features and experiences were mind clearing and the serenity bringing opportunities were unique and wonderful. The employees at the Grand Wailea are attentive, and want to please. When we left Rose, our greeter, gave us hugs. We would stay there again. The Four Seasons is so typical of all the Four Seasons Resorts is Wailea is too white and too bright. Grand Wailea is a seaside beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good views”
Reviews.Author: pwitytwicky
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Hawaii, but our first time to stay at this resort. The front desk staff, both in person and on the phone, were only as helpful as they needed to be, they didn't go out of their way to help or offer additional services. It is a valet-only hotel and those guys were very helpful and friendly ever time we came and left. The rooms are very clean and the staff in that area was very friendly and courteous. The resort is very large and difficult to navigate around the pools, there were several times we walked around in circles trying to find our way around or through the area. If I hadn't come with a work group or came again on my own, I would pick a smaller hotel with better access to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassing Excellence! One of my favorite resorts in the world!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea Resort is truly magnificent, breathtakingly beautiful, and so pristine. The property is enchanting, and was very difficult to pack our bags at departure. You truly will feel as you are in a heavenly, magical sanctuary. The restaurants are the best, and is couple, and family-friendly. This is heaven on earth. This experience was flawless. From the warm lei greeting, opulent lobby, friendly, welcoming staff, spectacular ocean-front, well-appointed spacious rooms, with private lanais, which are stocked with their Grande Spa line of shampoos, conditioners and in-room coffee makers, and breathtaking views, your stay will be most enjoyable. Room service, bell staff, and housekeeping are very prompt, and responsive. Well done, Grand Wailea! The Waldorf Astoria has outdone itself!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: My husband and four year old daughter and I just returned from spending seven nights at this wonderful hotel and we loved every single minute. I really can't think of anything that would have made it better. The staff is welcoming and friendly, the beach is a really good one, our room was large and beautifully decorated and the grounds are some of the most gorgeous I have ever seen. Perhaps best of all was the swimming pool. Yes, it is a "splurge" to stay here but if you enjoy swimming and waterslides as much as our family does spending a little extra to stay here is so worth it. (Actually, we stayed at the Sheraton on Kaanapali Beach the first part of our trip, paid about the same amount there, and the pools there were so cold we couldn't get in them.) The Grand Wailea heats their pools so the water is a comfortable temperature. We plan to return as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, Good for couples too”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBeber
Reviews.Content: Took the wife here for her __th birthday over Thanksgiving. I was a bit worried after reading reviews that the hotel would be overrun with families. Was this going to be the Chuck E. Cheese of Maui beach hotels? Far from it. Yes, there were a lot of families spending their holidays at the hotel, but because the property is SO big, there were pockets of respite from kids. Reflecting now, it's odd that as we didn't want to be surrounded by kids, we never spent time at the adult only pool (though we did walk through a couple times and never heard the kids at the kid pool). We were able to control our kid exposure. Went down the slides and lazy river, had lunch at the bar and then on to the spa. While this was only my second spa experience and I'm not the best judge, my wife (a spa regular) thoroughly enjoyed her time there. Other comments: - All the staff there were pleasant and friendly. - We had a deluxe room on the top floor (9) and it was perfect. Would not have wanted anything smaller. View of sunset was awesome. We liked that we could see the ocean from our bed when we woke up. - The shopping center was a close 5 minute walk away, which was nice when we had to pick up forgotten clothes, snacks and other sundries. I only wish we could have had our act together and done it all in 1 trip. - If I was going to be super judgmental, I could probably remember 1 or 2 things I saw that stood out as being less than great in the room. But they were so minor in the grand scheme, I moved on after seeing them, and enjoyed the rest of the room. - Humuhumu was pretty good. Our 5-course meal was part of the package we booked. We enjoyed our meal. My steak had more pepper than I prefer, but it didn't stop me from finishing it. It was actually too much food. We opted to have dinner after the sunset (6pm), but I can see how that would be a great place for dinner during the sunset. - The concierge was very helpful in arranging a snorkel excursion for us with an outfit outside the hotel. At first we asked if they could help us schedule the kayak and snorkel tour at the hotel, but then suggested and external option for a little more money. So worth the extra cost. It was definitely a highlight of the trip (the snorkel trip, not the concierge experience). - A ding on the sleep quality only because I was woken up every morning to the sound of a cart rolling by outside on the tile hallway. Luckily, I was able to fall back asleep shortly on the super comfortable bed. Grand Wailea, I would suggest soft rubber tires (similar to tires for mountain bikes) and not hard ones if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea.. losing its shine .. losing its welcome”
Reviews.Author: Reazi
Reviews.Content: We were return guests at the Grand Wailea. In the short time since our previous visit I was disappointed and dismayed to find how much the Resort has slipped in its appearance and performance. Housekeeping is truly less that thorough with dirty bathroom floors, furniture surfaces left soiled and unclean. The rooms are showing their age in terms of dinged and damaged furnishings, broken lamp shades. chips on walls and scratched, soiled painted surfaces. Cupboards not closing properly and calls for repairs unanswered. We even left the "repair card" which is deposited in each room by the staff to notify them of any problems and this was never tended to nor answered. The breakfast buffet has simply lost its quality and execution. Most foods tasted bland and were either under/overcooked. Mediocre at best considering the hi price you pair for breakfast each morning in the Grand Dining Room. My biggest grip and huge shock was to see the mistreatment and disregard for guests at the main pool area (adult). 14-16 casabellas each morning with eight louge chairs a piece usurped by the staff with white towels as "reserved for paying guests" . Well at $1000 a day it was no surprise that only 2-3 three of these casabellas were ever rented during our week stay. This in turn left approx 96 poolside chairs unavailable to the rest of the guests who were inconvenienced and displaced out onto the lawn when the few chairs that remained poolside were grabbed up by guests as early as 7a.m. Not a person in sight to assist guests when they had to shuttle chairs out onto the lawn since nothing was left poolside and again only 2-3 casabellas occupied with 8 chairs each UNUSED. This is ridiculous and a slap in the face to paying guests who are already shelling out a minimum of $500/nite to stay here. 96 chairs left unusable ALL DAY LONG just in case someone MIGHT rent them and NO ONE did. This is completely unacceptable, bad business and the poorest way to treat guests. We all understand the economy is bad, but should paying guests be put out, put off and displaced by the uncertain hope/wish that maybe just MAYBE someone will rent a casabella and take the 8 chairs, or should they make a policy that unless one is reserved by the night before or 9a.m. that morning the rest should be left open and the 8 chairs they contain available to all guests . This has left a huge distaste in my mind and feeling that we will not be returning let alone recommending others to visit. Its a shame, the place was once magnificent and held it guests with the highest regard, always very accomodating and offering to make you comfortable. This seems to have disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea not what it used to be . .”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: I have had several stays at the Grand Wailea over the past 15 years. just visited there a few weeks ago for 8 nights. Was a real disappointment. Most venues closed due to low occupancy levels. even staff acknowledges. Some are calling it the "Grand Hampton Inn" versus a Waldorf Astoria experience. Our suite was very nice - still had the old "Hyatt Regency" sign on the back door. Yes i did say Hyatt as it was part of their group over 10 years ago. Forget trying to get a good reservation at HumuHumu. i tried for a good table any night we were there - they could not get it done. Yet when we walked in it was open. So i inquired and they said it was closed for that night. then 20 minutes later they seat another group of 3 there. i had offered a very respectable minimum check if they could get it done. very dissappointing experience. Hint - i have done both the Grand and the Four Seasons next door. Right now, Four Seasons has the edge except for the spa. So stay at the Four Seasons but do the spa at Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Beautiful Resort, Great Spa, Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAndrea
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because my friend stayed here on her honeymoon. I had researched the ritz, four seasons and fairmont. I would say this hotel has the most beautiful grounds out of the four hotels. It also seems to be the largest. The complimentary breakfast buffet every morning was fabulous. We ate at the other restaurants here and they were all terrible though. Either the food was flavorless or cold. I would suggest going next door to the four seasons. All three restaurants there were exceptional. As far as the spa goes the Grand Wailea has the best. They have a pre spa ritual room that I have never seen before. It has different salt soaks, hot/ cold tubs and different types of showers. They are not coed so warn your man that he is going to be walking around with naked dudes while doing the pre spa ritual. One little complaint was the masseusses added more gratuity than we really added and gave us a hard time at reception when we checked out about taking it off our bill. We only rented a car for one day which I though was adequate. We drove up the coast to the area where the ritz is and ate at pineapple grill which is just downt the street. The ritz is really beautiful but a little remote.This restaurant is a must to go to for lunch. Sit outside to enjoy the scenery. The sunset cruise was terrible because it was so windy we couldnt really leave the cabin so be cognizant of that before booking it. Definetly do a half day hiking tour with hike maui. Ask when Kahi will be the guide. He is so knowledgeable about all of the edible things in the rainforest. He will also bring you to many waterfalls to swim in and jump off of. If you do the half day tour with him it is kind of like halfway road to hana. Everyone that did the whole road to hana trip said it was too long and exhausing. I have been to hawaii three times now and personally would go to somewhere in the caribbean instead because it is closer and you dont have to deal with the 5 hour time change from Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: fromthelandoflegends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa for a week in Nov., 2011. I have to say this was one of the nicest (down south) hotels we have ever stayed at. Mind you itâ€™s expensive but you get what you pay for. From the moment we arrived (at night) with the tiki torches lit and drove past the waterfalls near the main entrance we knew we had made the right choice. The hotel itself is beautiful and serene with huge public spaces open to the soft winds and enchanting views. The grounds are expansive with hidden gardens and water features everywhere. Youâ€™ve probably read about all the art at the hotel, yes its everywhere, but well integrated and tastefully displayed. The room we stayed in had a great ocean view and was generally very quiet. The ate at all the restaurants and the food and service was great - to bad the main dining room was closed for renovations as we would have liked to try it also. We found all the staff to be helpful and friendly and not at all pretentious. The pools and beach are we always well maintained and we never had any trouble finding a lounge. If you have kids this is the place to go - the water park with its slides and river pools is fantastic. My wife even went on the water slide several times and loved it. They even have a little kids beach area at one of the numerous pools - neet. We spent most of our laying about time (so much to do on Maui that we were almost always on the go) by one of the hidden pools which was quiet and peaceful. The â€œadultâ€� pool was too frustrating - what with all the phones, tablets and laptops and b.s. - youâ€™re on vacation people. The shops of Wailea are a short stroll away, lots of places to spend your money and a few really good restaurants. There is not much nightlife at the hotel but Longhiâ€™s at the SoW has a great happy hour from 10 pm onwards. And there's nearby Kihei with tons of dining and nightlife. Ajacent to the Grand Wailea are several other beautiful hotels (within walking distance) with more upscale dining options. Overall we had a fantastic vacation not the least due to the wonderful friendly people of Maui and knowing that after a full day of touring we had this beautiful resort to come back to. Mahalo Maui, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MeganIsaac-Renton
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Grand Wailea from November 19 - 26, 2011, over the American Thanksgiving week. Because of the holiday, the hotel was absolutely packed, but nevertheless we had a great stay. The rooms were lovely and the bed was squishy and super comfortable. We also really enjoyed the adult-only pool. The only negative was that the food wasn't great, and was extremely overpriced ($2.50 for a boiled egg!). We ended up walking over to the Four Seasons next door for most of our meals, where we had absolutely exceptional meals at Ferraro's and Duo restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but stingy”
Reviews.Author: happycouple65
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are truly spectacular - amazing greenery and a maze of pools. However, be prepared to be nickel-and-dimed. For example, there's no self-park and no overnight parking nearby so you need to pay $25/night plus tips for valet parking. We asked for bowls and spoons to eat something in our room and were told there's a $5 delivery charge (plus tip, of course). We wanted to make a reservation for one of the restaurants and were told there's a $50 24-hour cancellation fee, even for guests of the hotel! We've been to many hotels that cost both less and more and have felt more welcome than at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: aimeeelizabethallen
Reviews.Content: The landscaping, the ocean views, the water park, the rooms, the amenities, the breakfast buffet, the bars, friendliness of the staff- all absolutely excellent!!!! Perfect honeymoon location!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: midcenturymoddallas
Reviews.Content: Prepare to be impressed during your drive to the Grand Wailea...then even more impressed when you turn into the drive of this beautiful property. The grounds are the star here. The rooms are very nice as well. I had perhaps my best nights sleep here with the balcony door open falling asleep to the sounds of the many fountains and waterfalls and the ocean in the background. Expensive yes, but worth it. When in Maui, treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for two evenings in early October. The stay was widely shaped but the warm and welcoming front desk person that checked us in. I cannot remember his name as it was over a month ago - he was a wonderful Filipino gentleman that has been with the hotel for many years. Given our Hilton status, he upgraded us to one of the most gorgeous ocean front rooms we've ever seen. He threw in a number of extras as we were celebrating our anniversary and have a baby on the way. We actually decided to stay an extra evening thanks to his hospitality. We stayed at the Four Seasons for our honeymoon 5 years prior. We were nervous about the Grand Wailea because we thought it would be flooded with kids and not comfortable for a couple. We were pleasantly surprised. Luckily, the pool area is so vast that there is an area for everybody - an adult pool area (which they strictly enforced), a pretty beach area, and a large pool area full of waterfalls, slides, and the like (this area is well-maintained and clean minus the bathroom - yuck, that could use a bit more cleaning). It could have to do with the fact that we visited in October, but we never felt overwhelmed with kids. This sort of resort certainly attracts jerky adults (we had to move away from overly indulged businessmen on vacation a few times, and if you scroll down to the woman that refused to wear a wristband review, you'll get a sense of what I mean), but our enjoyment of the grounds, the outstanding customer service, and overall beauty of the property more than made up for a few sour apples. Our room was top-notch from the extremely comfrtbale bed linens to the highly luxurious bathroom. They skimped on nothing. We had a lovely dinner at the Humumumu (if I recall correctly) - great service althought the food was standard hotel food - nothing to write home about. We look forward to returning with our child in the near future. The Grand Wailea is well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Rude personnel”
Reviews.Author: Fred S
Reviews.Content: In October of this year we decided to take a trip to the Shops at The Grand Wailea. The personnel at the valet parking area were rude and obnoxious. Not only that, they seemed to take pride in their rude behavior by congratulating each other on their performances as we departed. I wouldn't stay at this hotel or revisit it ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Pool, beach and grounds are first class”
Reviews.Author: BreezeWest
Reviews.Content: Pool, beach and grounds are perfect. Very nice although expensive! More laid back and not as much to do as in Laheina area. Will need a car to get around. Of course they hit you a big daily fee for this and lots of other things

Reviews.Title: “Never a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrey3
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of our fourth trip to the Grand Wailea and we will definitely be returning in the future. This is our absolute favorite resort of anywhere we have stayed and we have had nothing but great service and friendly interactions with the staff since we arrived. As a Hilton Diamond Member, Matthew Bailey did everything possible to make this a memorable stay for our family. Thank you! Another thank you to Michele Takahama at check-in. You went above and beyond with our requests and we really appreciated the upgrade. Yes it is expensive here, but this a top resort in Maui an any expectations that it will be inexpensive are unrealistic. We are here on points, thankfully, but still are managing to spend quite a bit extra which should be expected and budgeted for before planning such a trip. I don't like the $25 per day mandatory valet parking either, but was also not ever a fan of the narrow stalls in the self park lot. After experiencing the valet parking for once, I much prefer it. The pools and beach are amazing and the spa is second to none. Again, thank you for making us feel at home as always.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with world class amenities”
Reviews.Author: pcbinwal
Reviews.Content: I was there in Grand Wailea for 4 days during second week of June. It was a wonderful experience. Hotel has nice landscapes and beautiful views of ocean and the sun set was really wonderful. Hotel facilities were also excellent. The beach was very clean and enjoyable. Overall a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: wndsong
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week at the Grand Wailea. My experience with the hotel couldn't have been better. I was greeted with a beautiful lei upon arrival. The staff was always friendly and accomodating. When Valet brought my car, I was always furnished cold water and was always asked if I needed directions. The grounds are immaculate and breathtaking. I can't imagine any hotel ever topping my experience at the Grand Wailea. My bed was turned down nightly with a flower and a good-night card. I overbooked myself with tours. Next time I believe I could spend the entire week at the GW. Pam K Ft Worth, TX

Reviews.Title: “Grand Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: allymcd1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the Grand Wailea Oct. 3-8. We had a wonderful stay. When we arrived we were warmly greeted by "Rose" with a fresh flower Lei. Our check in was great with Christina...we were given a roon in the "NAPUA tower" which was wonderful. Our room was beautiful with and ocean view although not a sunset view which would have been even better but we are not complaining as it was still wonderful. The rooms are large with comfortable beds, a large Lanai and a large bathroom with a huge tub and seperate shower. In the Napua tower you get complimentary breakfast and happy hour every day. Both were very good. The breakfast always offered at least one hot item and plenty of fresh fruits, breads, cheeses ect. the happy hour we really loved...in part because of the Hostess 'Zenith" after the first night she knew us by name and would bring us fresh drinks without even having to walk up to the bar. She was so cheerful and fun! again there was always a hot appetizer and lots of finger foods. The lobby at the Grand Wailea is amazing...open air with a main bar that we went to every night. The bartender "KEONIE" was fantastic...so much fun and so welcomimg and again knew our names and drinks by the 2nd night. the managment should be very proud to have employess like him and Zenith among others. THE POOL...Huge and fun...I don't know if i would be so enthusiastic about it during high season but we were there when it was not horribly crowded and there was always a chair to be had and we had fun on the slides. I would say it is a little overwhelming but still fun. We loved the grotto bar and the bartender that was there most days..i can not remember his name but he was great. A downside...we had friends staying on different parts of the island and we wanted to have them over to ''show off" our resort! We totally understand the wrist band deal..we were told there was really no exceptions and no guests were allowed w/o a hefty charge. They said we could rent a cabana and then have the guests. the only cabana that would accomadate all of us was the "super cabana" the charge for the day was $1000.00...YIKES! After some talking we were given a price of $800.00 for the day (still..YIKES, especially because it was not crowded and there were plenty of empty cabanas!) With this price came, water, soda and a platter of sandwhiches...it was difficult to get service from the cabana people but the pool bar waiter "Adrian" waited on us for drinks we purchased and he was fabulous! Next time we will just know that we will not invite any guests!!! We ate dinner one night at Humus for our anniversary and we LOVED it! We can't wait to go back to the Grand Wailea! i know I have missed some things but all in all a great vacation! (beautiful beaches, less crowded then kaanapali) Eat breakfast next door at Lohngi's at the shops at Wailea..really good and the shops are amazing. pretty walk as well. The whole beach walk in the front of the reorts is just lovely. We went next door to the four Seasons for dinner one night..VERY expensive and not as good as Humu's in our opinion! We felt at home at the GW!!!! Good job to most of the employess there!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with a price”
Reviews.Author: Rachel67_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Wailea for one week during the week of October 22. The surroundings are just incredible - paradis. The beach is clean and there are enough chairs, the pool are is just beautiful but very noisy. This is a family resort - not the best place to go if you want a relax couples retreat. There were a lot of small children and the pool area is great if it's a family trip. Everything is very expensive but not worth the extra money. We finally went into town to buy some water, drinks and snacks because it is very expensive at the hotel. The restaurants are good but once again expense. At the Molokini, you can expect to pay 60$ for a lunch for two and at the Humahuma restaurant is delicious but expect to pay 250$ for a supper for two with wine (not the most expensive bottle). The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Car Rental beware: we rented a car for a trip to Hana and were unpleasantly surprised to find out that we could not return the car directly (which we were not told) and had to pay an extra 25$ for valet parking. Rent your car at the airport, it will be cheaper. Scuba Diving: they have a scuba diving service directly on-site. They charge 125$ approx. for a one-tank shore dive per person. Ridiculous. We went to Maui Dive Shop and payed 125$ for a two-tank boat dive per person. Shop around ! Grand Luau: although the dancers are very good, the show is really basic. No decor and simple dances. Shop around for a real authentic luau and not a commercial basic version.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: dcheekes
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent resort for all vacation travellers. Weather you are on a honeymoon like my husband and I or just a regualr vacation with your family. The resort is huge and has wonderful spots all over just to relax. The staff was super freindly and the food and drinks excellent. The best part was the pool with the many slides (big and small) and the grotto bar for the adults. Fantastic grounds and scenary.

Reviews.Title: “Step into paradise”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: Come to the grand and we will not be disappointed. The service is fantastic. True island paradise.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: NickChick
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Maui, you might as well treat yourself and enjoy the best!

Reviews.Title: “Early Anniversary Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Iamthe1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for an early wedding anniversary vacation. We used his HH points, which entitled us to a free stay (8 days/7 nights). We were not lucky enough to stay in the Napa tower, instead we had a â€˜ocean viewâ€� blocked by some palm trees on the middle 5th floor. I forgot the name of the tower but it started with an H and it was the same tower as check in. My overall impression of the room was that it was great for our needs. It was clean, it had a good amount of space and the bed was very nice. We werenâ€™t nickel and dimed like some reviewers stated I guess because we realized weâ€™re on vacation and we would try our best to relax. We did not have to wait for pool chairs or chairs on the beach. Why because we ate brunch at 10, and headed to the pool/beach around 2pm. This is key for those without children and do not mind sleeping in late. I noticed there were a lot of empty chairs with towels, but the hotel staff made sure to keep an eye out *and* remove them so that other guests could enjoy. Restaurants, we really didnâ€™t try any of the restaurants on the premises except for CafÃ© kula for pizza and French fries (BTW their pizzas are very good), and Humu for anniversary dinner. Would we go there again, probably not as weâ€™re the type to rent a condo. However for this trip we decided to stay free and splurge on other activities, which came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for families”
Reviews.Author: Cayobean
Reviews.Content: Great for families with kids. Do not go if you want quite couples time. That is next door... This is about kids and their experience. Service is average. Watch out, they now force you to pay for parking on top of daily room rate and daily resort fee... Kind of over the top if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within paradise”
Reviews.Author: selise1222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Grand Wailea with another couple for three nights at the beginning of our trip to Hawaii and we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff there were very friendly and accommodating. There was confusion regarding our reservations in terms of how many individuals were in our hotel room and they handled it with the utmost of professionalism, making sure we all had breakfast included with our room and also waived the per person / per day resort fee. The staff at breakfast remembered us every morning and chatted with us like old friends. The grounds are breathtakingly beautiful. The Grand Wailea obviously takes a lot of pride in making sure everything is perfectly manicured and landscaped. The pools are immaculate and the areas around the pools are also clean and inviting. I also liked that you had to get wrist-bands to get towels and use the pool areas; considering there are a lot of resorts in the Wailea area, I like that the Grand Wailea keeps a close eye on making sure that the people using the pool are registered hotel guests. Our room was also a pleasant surprise. The bathroom was huge and updated, and the bedroom itself was incredibly roomy, even for U.S. standards. We were upgraded to an ocean-view room and were not disappointed; it was lovely to watch the sunrise from our linai every morning! The room was clean and modern and they brought us extra towels, pillows and other amenities within minutes of calling the front desk. Plus, the beds were extremely comfortable! The Spa Grande was to die for. My girl friend and I booked massages for our first day and they were incredible. Afterward, we received a complimentary body scrub and then spent a good amount of time in the soaking tubs. I could have spent all day in the spa. The whole resort is very quiet and peaceful which made for a very relaxing time there. The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is the prices. Obviously when you go to a very upscale resort you expect high prices but the Grand Wailea really gouges you. I'm talking $20 for a drink by the pool and they also have higher prices at the pool-side bars than in the restaurants. I've lived in a big city for quite some time so my husband and I are not shocked by $15 glasses of wine or $20 cheeseburgers, but the Grand Wailea seemed pricey even to us. Overall, though, I thoroughly enjoyed the Grand Wailea and would return in a heartbeat. Such a grand time!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Dresch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about ten years ago and thought it was amazing. I decided to take my girlfriend here for lunch. After giving my keys to the valet he informed me that it would be $25 for parking, however we could get validation with lunch. What he didn't tell me was that there was nothing open and no food being served. We walked around the property for 15 minutes and some areas required a hard hat to enter. The beach was also much smaller than I remember. After returning to the car and not finding a place to eat we were charged $27 for parking. I would not stay here again. There are better places to stay for the price. The location here also seemed very isolating. Not the 'Aloha' spirit like the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ground, pool and beaches but also other issues”
Reviews.Author: robercs
Reviews.Content: I just came home from my hawaiian holidays. Is worth to say that these were just amazing !!! Now the review......The Grand Wailea is located at the wonderful beach of Wailea, where you will see some of the most beatiful sunsets of hawaii (maybe just below the ones at the Mauna Kea in big island). If you are looking for a good place with a nice beach and some fun at the pool you will do the right choice of staying there. Nevertheless there were few things that I dislike. First, I was in low season and there were a lof of space and very few people. But I can not imagine how that would be in high season. There are not too many chairs by the pool (at least way less chairs than rooms). Second at 5 pm everything dies at the pool. The really damn nice waterslide dies at 5 pm so does the pool bar (Which was just great !!!) but not just at the pool also the chairs and umbrellas will be picked up at the beach. Besides that and the terrifying high prices, I paid for a Scuba diving (1 tank) as much as I paid for a boat trip with 2 tanks and an underwater scooter elsewhere !!! The room was just amazing !!! The ocean view was just awesome and at least the one I had was clean, everything was working and the bath was georgeous. It is worth to say that the ladies who does the cleannin in the room deserves an A++++ my room was always clean and in order. Which really amaze me. I am a mess and I had everything spread all over the room. They really took timne to place everything in order. The best thing is that you have twice a day room service. In the morning and somewhere around sunset. Fresh towels and refill of the things you used in the morning (cream, shampoo, etc.). The Spa was just nice. I had a visit for a massage. I could do it all over again, it was so relaxing always fresh fruit and water (BTW the pineapple juice at the hotel, near the front desk, is just delicious). You can relax at the different hawaiian salt water jaquzzi (not sure if is well written). The people at the Spa also deserve an A++++ Contrary to the people at the front desk. On my very first night I had a trouble with my credit card and I had to contact my bank (in Germany) the people at the deskt (at night) have no idea how to an internationall phone call !!!! I was shockedd, they just couldn't do it. Also they did not provide any solution at all. They were like you can call using your card (but my credit card was not working !!!!) they seemed not to understand that, and I couldnot charge it to my room becuase they couldnot manage that. So in few words I was really disapointed that they did not even offer some kind of solution,. While they were at the pc on the front desk looking for the phone of my bank I asked her If I could go over and look it myself (I know there I find it) they refused !!! Hard to believe no..? Else the ladies (two) at the entrance of the buffet breakfast are quite rude !!! No good morning no ALOHA spirit just nothing, good for me in my 6 days I went just twice, the other days I went diving and had something in the boat. The valet parking as you may read in few other reviews it will take around 20 mins. So the best thing to do is before going out call and ask for your car. Then most of the time by the time you are there the car will be arriving. It happend to me few times (5). Anyways in case you do not want to read the complete review I will just tell you this. If you are going with your kids in a low season holiday make yourself and your kid a favor and stay at the hotel. The waterslides and the beach are just amazing and are a lot of fun, If you are going in high season mmm I am not sure you will like to go chasing for a chair in the morning just to be there 1 hour (if they do apply their 1 hour policy). I think the same applies for couples, I really do not like crowds, so is the reason why I stayed in low season.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do & enjoy. But you'll pay for each part of it...”
Reviews.Author: DeliKid
Reviews.Content: We were able to secure a rate of $285/ night for 4 nights. That was a discount from the regular $545 rate. The room was a nice room. But, I guess I expected to be wowed given the status of the Grand Wailea as *the* resort in Maui. The staff is incredible! The grounds are lush. The pool are clean and refreshing. There are separate areas for kids and adults. The beach is groomed each morning. Snorkeling right off the beach is enjoyable. But try to bring your own snorkel gear as itâ€™s $12/ day to rent it. Which brings me to the point of my review: paying for everything. WOW, the prices. Rum & Coke, $12. Mai Tai, $14. Bottled water, $5. Soda, $6.50. Hamburger w/ fries, $22. Cabanas, $300 for half day. Valet, $25/ day (no more free parking). Spa, $250 entry/access fee before you start picking treatments. Yes, I understand that itâ€™s not an all-inclusive. But after staying at Sandals and Beaches, we paid less than at Grand Wailea. I know this review goes against the grain of most reviews. But, after the flight and all the expense to stay at the resort, I guess I expected a little more for a little less. If you stay at the Grand Wailea, I do believe you WILL enjoy yourself â€“ we certainly did. But, the checkout bill will hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! . . . but be aware.”
Reviews.Author: NancyB37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (Hilton Diamond Elite members) just returned from a week's stay at the Grand Wailea--we hadn't been to Maui in many years and just wanted a relaxing getaway. The hotel is truly stunning and the location and views could not have been more fantastic. We are seasoned travelers and have been all over the world in many kinds of hotels. Our travel philosophy is that you make your own fun wherever you are, and if you don't have a good time, it's your own fault. But being experienced travelers, sometimes it's the small things--the annoying things--that you remember the most. And in a 5-Star, First Class resort like the Grand Wailea, the little, negative details seem spotlighted more because you hold this kind of resort to a higher standard. As with other reviewers, we found the chaise lounge situation around the Hibiscus pool to be problematical--most were "taken" for hours--and those that were available were "cheek by jowl" with others. And then there's the colored wrist band deal to get towels (not terribly classy), especially when, after bringing our towels up to the pool from the beach (where we did not need wristbands) were were ordered by the pool staff that both my husband and I had to go in person back down the stairs to the activity desk to get wristbands. COME ON!! It was hot, my husband is 90 years old and was a bit tired, and I explained this to the young man on duty. No dice! "Both of you have to go back down and get wrist bands." I did find check-in to be less than welcoming or helpful. We were told our room was not ready and they would call our cell phone when it was. Fine . . . we'll go have some lunch. But after nearly 2 hours, no call, so we went back upstairs to find out ourselves the room was ready; and it was a fine room with a beautiful view. But there was no explanation by the check-in clerk as to where anything in the hotel was located--just a perfunctory check in, sign here, here are your keys--.and the Grand Wailea is a BIG property! This would have been helpful. One final comment is the price of food and drink. Just expect to be astonished--no matter how deep your pockets are! I opted to have a "proper" breakfast in the Grand Dining Room our last morning--and I was both underwhelmed and overwhelmed. Underwhelmed by the cold potatoes, cold sausages and hard scrambled eggs. This was no lavish buffet breakfast as one might expect. And overwhelmed by the $30+ price. So those are the caveats in this truly beautiful property filled with orchids, tropical plants, waterfalls, lovely fixtures and decor and a terrific Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Tethier919
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Room was very comfortable. Great bathroom. Very friendly staff although we did not need much from them. The grounds are what makes the Grand Wailea the destination. A tropical forest outside your door. Koi Ponds. fountains, bridges. Five pools including an adult only pool. Two big slides and some small ones. The only Water Elevator in the world. Pretty cool. Pristine beach. Ocean front walkway for excercise. It passes the Marriott, Fairmont, and Four Seasons. Also some historical ruins. You can rent a car next door at the Marriott from Hertz for day trips which is convenient. It sits on the sunnier side of Maui as well.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay-great spa weekend!”
Reviews.Author: luv2tvlSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: visited with a friend for a spa weekend and this hotel did not disappoint. The spa was terrific...we had lunch and dinner at the resort and the food was great. The pools kept us occupied although the beach was enticing with the beach staff very friendly and with lots of beach equipment rentals. The staff was very nice here which is sometimes unusual at a large resort. This is a full service resort with lots of beautiful grounds to walk through. I highly recommend and we will be back next year for our girls weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Fancy and Romantic...everything you want!”
Reviews.Author: NatAtHome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went to the Grand Wailea to celebrate our 24th Anniversary. We were upgraded to the Napua Tower thanks to Agnes at the check-in desk who accommodated our request for a room with a king bed (instead of 2 queens.) We had SO much fun at the pool and water slides. We had been told by friends that the hotel was really big and over-the-top, and we were a bit concerned because we don't have kids, but we really loved it! The size of the resort was wonderful, because it never seemed crowded, and the water-slides and water-elevator were so much fun!! The service was wonderful. Everyone was incredibly helpful and friendly. The grounds were beautiful with gardens and unique art & sculpture. The beds were SO comfortable. If you want to go to the beach, which is right next to the pool, be sure to go in the morning when the water is calm & the wind is low. You can rent paddle boards, boogie boards, etc. right on the beach. As a guest of the hotel, you can get free lounge chairs, towels and umbrellas. We spent our mornings on the beach and our afternoons at the pool and our evenings at the bars and restaurants. We definitely would go to this resort again, and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you have kids and like swimming pools, but not the "real" Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds, rooms and beach area are all visually appealing. The staff are very good and beach is well kept, but staying here is not much different than going to an elegant resort in Florida or California or Las Vegas (minus the beach of course.) I do an enormous amount of business travel and so cashed in Hilton points to stay here. On a strictly logistical level the facility was appropriately valued against the point usage, but I would not return in the future. The reason is personal and not facility specific. If I'm spending 9 hours flying from the US east coast and coming to the South Pacific I'd prefer somthing more down to earth, away from crowds, and a bit more genuinely Hawaiian. I was glad to have a car and be able to drive to locally owned restaurants rather than be tied the chain places I can get in any big city in the US. If you're interested in just hanging out in a huge pool with slides, paying $16 for cocktails and $25 a day to valet park your car than this is your place. If you'd rather be off the beaten path, hang out at beaches were local folk go and catch sunsets at locally owned beach bars then keep searching for a different place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: Peacock N
Reviews.Content: My 2 children and I stayed for 8 nights. Could have done with some information from reception (how to get to pools, restaurants etc - a map of resort would have helped) (turned out there was a map in the key folder but I didn't notice for a few days). However, the kids and I loved it - thought the pools were great, loved going down the water slides which are the best I've ever experienced at a hotel) and the water was beautifully clean and kept at the perfect temperature. We only ate poolside or at Bar Molokini and would only recommend Bar Molokini, however, that might reflect that we are not American and don't really like some foods like that really yellowy-orange melted cheese that comes with nachos. Bar Molokini's kids' menu was fine for my fussy eaters and they both seemed perfectly happy with what they had (chicken, pasta and the pizza). My food was fine. The service is very efficient, but I did find I had to seek out help once our food had appeared, there was no follow up to see if all was ok with the meal etc. (Meal was fine, I just wanted to order a drink). Staff all nice excepting one un-smily woman at reception. I wanted to book another night, and she gruffly presented the tariff sheet - I said "yes, but that's never what is charged" (can't remember what the price was, but am pretty sure the original ocean-view with 2 queen beds rate she showed me was either $699 or $1100 (I only glanced before doing my "I don't think so" routine) and when I mentioned another staff member had quoted me much less she said "okay, $369".) She was just one of those bitter and twisted types I think, as her manner was certainly from the resentful of other people having a holiday brigade, but everyone else was perfectly lovely. Ordered a cab from my room but it obviously hadn't been ordered when I rocked up to hop in it. Took a bit of encouragement but it was only when I mentioned that if we were late for our planned activity and missed out that I'd have the hotel pay our expenses that they felt my sense of urgency. That being said, when I ordered a taxi directly from them the next time, it was seemless and very well executed. Did appreciate the plentiful towels in the room, and getting heaps of towels for the pool area was no problem either. One real highlight was the nighttime Camp Grande - my 2 kids (7 and 10) absolutely loved it - more than any other kids club they have experienced anywhere. That is a real reflection on the wonderful staff manning Camp Grande - I can't thank them enough for that. It's not cheap ($95 per kid with 15% discount if you have 2 enrolled) but they certainly loved it. It only operates if 3+ kids are enrolled though. Overall, I'd have to say that it was a seriously good destination with the kids. If it was just me and my husband, I'd probably opt for a more deluxe resort, but this was certainly a great call with the kids, and certainly deluxe enough.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: kendall924
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 days on the first half of our honeymoon. After our long flight from the East Coast, it was definitely nice to pull up to the hotel and receive a lei greeting with a happy Aloha and the girl who checked us in couldn't be any sweeter - we were double upgraded from terrace view to oceanview. The rooms are in serious need of an upgrade, especially for the price. The paint is peeling and the cleaning people could stand to do a better job. However, the view is beautiful, the beds are super comfortable, there's wifi, and the staff was very pleasant and kind. They leave 2 bottles of water in the room for you each day and the valet leaves 2 bottles each time you take the car out. The beach is amazing, there are employees that set up chairs and umbrellas for you each day. You do have to wear a bracelet in the pool area - I'm not opposed to it - there is a lazy river, waterslides and many pools. I would rather wear a bracelet rather than share the pool with people coming from other resorts - I could only imagine how packed it would be without it since the beaches are public in Hawaii and anyone could just walk into the pool area. The luau at the Grand Wailea is second to none, the show is amazing. Wailea is a great resort area and next to a shopping center with an ABC store and several restaurants. Longhi's was great for breakfast - the best eggs benedict we've had! We went to the Four Seasons for dinner twice. This property is BEAUTIFUL. In fact, I think I will stay here the next time we go as a couple. Duo was delicious but I wish we had gone when they had the raw bar buffet which is offered from Thurs-Sun. Our last night in Maui, we had dinner at Ferraro's - it was such a beautiful restaurant overlooking the beach and sunset. I would definitely recommend the Grand Wailea for family trips but if you're looking for a romantic trip, I would recommend the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Surge A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for six nights from 10/3/11-10/9/11 and we had an amazing time. Staff members were nice, polite, and attentive. The pools are great! The bars are fun and the bartenders are very nice. The beach is relaxing and beautiful and there is much to do than just laying in the beach. Both my wife and I are in our upper 20's so stay here is you want to have a fun, active, and relaxing time. Stay at the four seasons if you want to be boring, anti-social, and lethargic......... The staff are very informative of Maui and place to go to. They were not in the least trying to keep us in the resort spending all of our money there. They even drove us over to the four seasons in the shuttle for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience at Grand Wailea - Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggolfer C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for the last 8 days and had a great experience. The grounds are so lush and beautiful. Staff went out of their way to accommodate our stay. We were upgraded to the Napua Tower. The Morning breakfast and cocktails were nice. Pools - Spent most of our time on the tier lawned next to adult pool. No problem getting charges or drinking since it's October. Beach - Resort located on the beach Great Location - great walking path with outstanding views along the beach and ocean. While you're walking you'll see Sea Turtles and get a great look at the other other resorts. Dinners - Luau at GW - very entertaining - worth the $$. Bought tix at Costco when we landed. Hum Hum Restuarant (GW) - very good - very authentic - great outdoor atmosphere Dou @ 4 Seasons - Raw bar on Thu -Sat night is well worth it. $65 Lobster/King Crab/Oysters/Prawns plus salad Mama's Fish House - it's as good as everyone says. We went for late lunch It worth going during daylight to see wave and the grounds the big waves. Great Atmosphere. Their famous crusted crab stuffed Mahi was outstanding. Ruth Chris Steakhouse - Special Petit Filet/ 1-side/salad/desert for $40 before 6pm Very good and ask for a table in back room - oceanview Gannons at Wailea Gold Course - great views and upscale restuarant at moderate prices. Had the crusted Mahi - very good food & music. Has a good happy for drinks & food. Kehei Caffe - Best Breakfast Sorrentos - Best View for Breakfast. Directly on the beach. Food was good too. Grande Spa - great facility. The differet spa options were a treat since you can try them all. Massage was very nice. Outstanding spa specials available now. Costco - if you're staying more than 5 days, stocking up on liquor/beer/wine/snacks a must. Costco is in front of the airport. You can't miss it. Transportation - renting a car is a must for me. You want to go an explore Maui. Crater/Volcano - we left GW around 8am and go to the top of Crater (10k ft) by 915am. We missing all the bike traffic coming down. It is worth the trip - it has great views all the way up and down. If you get motion sick, take something before going. October is a great time to experience Maui. It's not crowded. A comment from a manager at the 4 Seasons said that he would recommend the Wailea over 4 Seasons or Fairmont. Hope this helps others.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: born2beamommy
Reviews.Content: I took my children for our first trip to Maui and we loved this resort! The property is pristine, lush, and large. The kids and I both absolutely loved the pools-they have multiple pools connected to one another with water slides that we did over and over and over! They also have a water elevator that was fun, as well. The beach is nice and the staff were very accommodating. We enjoyed our stay and will most likely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoYankee
Reviews.Content: We just love the Grand Wailea! We are here for the first time celebrating our 27th anniversary and the hotel and scenery is breath taking. From the moment we checked in the bellmen, front desk, beach and pool attendants are very friendly and attentive. We haven't checked out yet but are already planning our next visit. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “NO Aloha”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: Front Office staff, managers were very rude and uncordial. Complaints in regards to my bill was directed to accounting staff where only rude employees again that did not care of the amount of money I was putting into their pockets. NO ALOHA spirit at all. As I walked the grounds and lobby I saw employees from Front Office DRESSED in their white nurse looking uniform shopping and purchasing food. Very unprofessional to pay and be charged so much and I had to stand in line again with the same rude people to purchase a meal for my family. Very dissatisfied and not a fan of feeling like I didn't matter or that i was replaceable. Management should keep employees out of site and away IN UNIFORM. Ununiformed employees were also noticeable for they were openly speaking of their 30% employee discount that I was not granted and eligible for. Employees walking around laughing and giggling of the people over paying for rooms they pay $150 for...NO PROFESSIONALISM AT ALL! I will NOT be returning to this UNgrand hotel. I will stay at the Ritz or Four Seasons where I am welcomed and treated as an guest with ALOHA.

Reviews.Title: “Why don't staff smile?”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property, absolutely. But the staff didn't seem to live Aloha. Concierge tapped away on her keyboard while I stood right in front of her - wouldn't even look up to say hello or I'll be with you in a minute. Valet seemed frenzied all the time. Towel woman at the pool was especially rude, giving me attitude b/c I asked why I had to wear a green bracelet. If I go again I'll stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eileendoylecrane
Reviews.Content: Love the property! Loved the church, the pools, the beach, the room, the waterfalls. Great service! Traveled in June 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea- The BEST place in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Michele P
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Grand for many years and are NEVER disappointed. It really is our home away from home. My husband suprised me with a birthday to Hawaii. We considered going elsewhere but made the choice to return. Since it was my birthday we were given a couple of discount coupons to wonderful resturants on the property and a FREE bottle of Champagne and upgraded our room. Bonus!!! We look forward to catching up with employess such as BELL (a wonderful bell man who has just about become family)! Bell always gives you great advice on resturants and things to do around the hotel and surrounding area. We show each others pictures of our kids on how they've grown over the years. Number one man to seek out. POOM was a pool attendant who made the water slides and tarzan rope fun for my family. My husband kept on trying to get her wet and she had a great attitude the whole time. These employees take the time to talk and get to know you. We did miss seeing Duke on the beach. The amenities are top notch and the Makawao Chicken Salad with a Mango Smoothie are to die for! I had one everyday relaxing by the beautiful pool. If you forget something they have it by the pool. Very convienant. The slides cannot be beat by any hotel around the world. We have traveled all over and the beauty of the Grand is uncomparable. Yes it is exspensive but as my husband always says, "you work like a DOG and vacation like a KING"! The Grand Wailea makes you feel like royality. You get what you pay for and the memories are priceless. Mahalo to everyone at the Grand for making my birthday so special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel-it's lifestyles of the rich and famous.”
Reviews.Author: thebazers
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is the ultimate in luxury. The rooms, spa, common areas, pools are all top class. Beautiful views are around every corner. The main restaurant, the Humuhumu, has the best seafood and fish dishes I have ever eaten. All the restaurants are fantastic. It is close walking distance to the Shops at Wailea, where more good restaurants can be found, plus an ABC Store and Whalers General Store, The pool has a bar called "The Grotto", where an Andy Warhol look-alike bartender will make you best Mai Tai you ever had, while sitting in a barstool half underwater located near one of the pools many waterfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing gardens, beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller14649
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference. I have never been to Maui and I think if I had been paying for the room, I would have had sticker shock! That aside, the gardens are fantastic, and the seven pools seem that they would make the resort very family friendly - one even has a walk-in "beach". There was a bit of room noise from neighbors through the adjoining door, which surprised me. I didn't use the spa facilities, but I did take one fitness class and while the instructor was very good, I found the aerobics room to be small, sweaty and poorly ventilated. Beach rentals (snorkels, paddleboards, etc) were convenient and you are right on the beach - great views of the adjacent islands. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and the restaurants are good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property for families to visit”
Reviews.Author: Gone2TheBeachPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea four times and have never been disappointed. As our children have grown, they are still entertained by the pools and the beach. As parents, we can lounge by the pool or ocean as the kids play non-stop. We join them on the waterslides and Tarzan rope swing and then go back to our books as they continue playing. The resort is extremely beautiful and a joy to walk around soaking in all of the sights, sounds, and smells. It is not for those looking for a great deal, however. Plan on everything being expensive. You will pay for the luxury and beauty. However, if you know this going in, it's not such a shocker.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer paradise!”
Reviews.Author: VivianBedoya
Reviews.Content: "Maui no ka oi" and so is the Grand Wailea! Fantastic amenities, accomodations, location, everything you dream of, in the lap of luxury. An absolute delight! The grounds are beautiful. There are works of art to enjoy. The pools are amazing and so is the location on the beach. I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “What was once Grand is now four stars at best”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot17
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the resort you can see why it was once Grand. Some TLC, some paint, refurbishing of the pools, restaurants and rooms then maybe you could justify paying the rates they charge. It is sad to see that the resort is being allowed to to get that rundown tired look. I hope they plan to do something about it before it is to late. P.S. As of 10/9 the elevator is still not working.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Relaxing and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: RealiLuv2Travel!
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed our stay here. I especially liked how luxurious and timeless the rooms & bathrooms were. We thoroughly enjoyed the maze of swimming pools and the large, well maintained gardens and space around the hotels! The staff was always very helpful and welcoming! It is definitely a splurge though and wished there weren't extra resort charges and valet only parking but we expected that given it's status as a luxury resort and a Waldorf Astoria resort at that. It is very well designed and has a lot of beautiful photo spots. For photographers, you'd love the HDR opportunities made available all around this hotel! We shared our photos here in case you're interested --> http://www.idelish.com/2011/10/07/usa-luxurious-grand-wailea-in-maui/

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationadict
Reviews.Content: Grand Wailea is a beautiful hotel, situated on the best side of the island. Lush and they experience the best weather on Maui. The hotel is well maintained and the gardens are gorgeously attended to. The staff are warm, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are very nice, kind of that timeless classic - not too modern or too outdated. The spa is fantastic! The best I've ever been to. They make you feel right at home and offer a very nice bath variety and pool sitch for you to lounge before your treatments. Your treatments are kicked off by a total body loofah scrub. The spa was worth every penny! The room service was just ok, but what do you expect from room service? It was prompt and had all the amenities and more to make a nice evening in. Yes, there is only valetâ€¦but itâ€™s fast, super convenient and friendly. And each time you get in, there are cold bottles of water for your drive. Resort fee includes unlimited wi-fi with no limit to number of devices. The poolâ€¦.so fantastic! So many water slides, tarzan rope swing, water elevator (I know, right!?) and swim up bar complete the twisty pool path through the amazing gardens. Truly a well done pool environment, not at all boring. Something for everyone. The Huma Huma (hut) restaurant was very good. They open at 5:30pm, but to get in perfect view for a sunset you need to get there at 5?? There were people already in the best tables when we arrived at 5:30 (again, when they officially openedâ€¦), but the food was still good and the sunset was still awesome, even if we werenâ€™t in the front row to enjoy it. There is happy hour in the lobby bar from 5-6, which helps kick start your evening in an otherwise pricey drink environment. You simply must use the shoreline path to get next door to the Four Seasons for Duoâ€¦a most terrific steakhouse which does a fantastic breakfast buffet as well. Seriously, the rooms are 3x the price, so stay at Grand Wailea and crash Four Seasons for the great restaurant. I totally loved this place and would go back in a mnute...no need "try" a different place next time in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Can only valet park your car!”
Reviews.Author: dianepinter
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a beautiful resort however you can only valet park your car and they charge you $25 a day to do so plus tipping......there are no other options even if you're willing to walk a mile! Our rental car was damaged by the valet during our stay there and the valet denied doing it. After months of trying to get this rectified with Hertz and the Grand Wailea, we were not successful and had to pay Hertz for the damage we did not cause. What was most upsetting was that in an attempt to contact the General Manager of the Grand Wailea, (Matthew Baily) after 3+ attempts he never offered us the courtesy of a return phone call. How unprofessional for what should be such a quality establishment. As a guest that spent 7 nights there and plenty of money a simple phone call should not have been a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty amazing. Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: scb777
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. A bit expensive but an amazing experience

Reviews.Title: “The Grand-EST!”
Reviews.Author: kalaniPhd
Reviews.Content: There is no other place on Maui like the Grand Wailea. To start, the location is probably the best, most exclusive, and pristine beach in all of Maui. The resort's beach front location is the best of all the resorts along the Wailea coast; with ease of accessibility to the sandy beach, convenient shower and poolside service location and helpful staff, this place is the best. From the moment we arrived to the day we left, the staff and amenities were FIRST CLASS all the way. I've read other reviews that complained about the cost of everything from a coke to dinner to the resort fees..... Folks... This is The Grand Wailea!! with rooms from $369 to the thousands per night, if you complain about a $5.00 coke...THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovehenderson
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 4 night vacation at the Grand Wailea. It was better than we could have ever imagined. Great service, amenities, and location. The ocean is in the resorts backyard and is the ideal beach spot. They offer free umbrellas on the beach for hotel guests, offered on a first come first served basis, but there were plenty available. The pools were unlike any I've ever seen before... Adult only pool, lazy river pool, rope swing area, multiple water slides, swim up bar area, water falls, secluded hot tubs, and more! The rooms are amazing as well. We stayed in the Napua Tower in room 9055 overlooking the pools, ocean, and mountains. We had a great two room suite with a great living area and bedroom. The best part though was the lanai with a table, four chairs, and a lounge chair perfect for relaxing in the morning and enjoying breakfast and a cup of coffee or guava juice. The Napua Tower offers it's own complimentary continental breakfast in the morning as well as cocktails in the evening. Zenith at the cocktail reception is warm and welcoming and very friendly! The luau was great! My husband loved the world champion fire dancer! We decided to get a spa treatment on our last day right before we left and it was unbelievable. I wish we had gone earlier in our trip so I could have done two treatments! The baths are something I have never seen before and worth every minute spent there. They even have a bath to sooth sun burns! :) We are already talking about when we are going back, when we do it will without a doubt be at the Grand Wailea!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property”
Reviews.Author: sparky99Florida
Reviews.Content: The location, hotel, amenities, staff...everything was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kim3883ac
Reviews.Content: We went for our 10 year anniversary and we had an amazing trip. The hotel grounds are expansive and very well landscaped. Our room had a garden view and was very nice. The pools were great, but we only used the adult pool. The front desk agent waived our parking fee since we booked when there was still self parking so with the extra money we booked activities through the consierge desk which was a very easy experience. I loved that there was always cold water in our car when the valet brought it around. We had a great time and we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class experience all around.”
Reviews.Author: pdmboston
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I came to Maui on our honeymoon and had booked a room at the Grand Wailea. Upon arrival, we found out that due to a large conference we would be upgraded to a condo across the street at Ho'olei. Therefore this review focuses on all the amenities of the property, but not the rooms. For starters, this property is quite impressive. The grounds are huge and extremely well maintained. I couldnt get over how clean everything was. When you walk in through the main entrance, the place is palatial and beautiful. Check in was a breeze due to our late arrival, and we were happy to be given a voucher for a complementary bottle of champagne at one of the property's restaurants. We were given lei's upon our arrival, and everyone was extremely helpful, but not overbearing. The majority of our time was spent at the pool and beach while we were on the property. The beach staff was great, and we didnt have to wait more than 5 minutes to be setup with our chairs and umbrella. This could very well be a result of us coming during the off season, and that the majority of the guests on site were part of a corporate conference. There were very few children on the property during our stay, so we really were able to enjoy some relaxation. The beach is pristine and the water is calm. I do wish there was drink service on the beach, however. The pool area was also great. I had read so many horror stories about not getting chairs etc, but we never had a problem. Even if we showed up after 10am, finding a spot was a breeze. The number of pools is mind boggling. We let the kids inside of us have fun on the slides, tarzan swing and even took a ride on the very cool water elevator. We were lucky and never felt forced to go to the adult only pool, which honestly seemed boring compared to the main pool area. As far as dining options, we wish there were more. The poolside cafe is extremely limited, so you're better off going to the Bistro Molikini, which has a better menu. Both places are pretty average. The best food (and of course the most expensive) is at the Humuhumu. It was so great we went there twice. The shops area offers another cafe, but we did not try it. The gift shop is well equipped and you can buy some basics there like chips/soda/beer etc. I'm sure many people can come here for a week and never feel the need to leave! Wailea is probably the nicest area on Maui that we came across. No other city compared. You are a bit further away from some attractions in Maui, but its worth it for a true luxury experience. The staff is excellent, and i was impressed at how CLEAN everything was. At many hotels, i am scared to walk around barefoot in pool areas, but the staff here kept it spotless. I would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat (and that's without having ever stepped foot in one of the rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised: nice room, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: theregularguy
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that my wife and I were a little skeptical when we arrived. The valet fee, the portage fee, the housekeeping fee... you get the idea. However, I have to say that the hotel actually offered quite a bit of value and we would return in the future. We had a garden view room (likely one of the least expensive rooms on the property), but it was surprisingly large and well appointed. The room was quiet, it had plenty of light, and it was easily accessible from the (less busy) ballroom entrance on the side of the hotel. Regarding all of those fees, I have to say that I felt like I did get something extra for them. The housekeeping at this hotel was--hands down--the best that I've ever had while traveling. The housekeepers showed up twice a day (normal + turndown service), and they would exchange towels/empty trash/etc on both visits. We were also appreciative of the fact that the staff would actually attempt to pick up the room a little, instead of just changing the sheets. In addition, the valet parking was quick and efficient, and the parkers would always bring the car around with cold bottles of water waiting inside, along with a clean windshield. The pool area was great. I would never admit this in public, but water slides and lazy rivers never get old, even for adults. It was sometimes hard to find a shady spot, but the sheer size of the deck meant that we didn't feel like we were packed in like sardines.
