In short, I would recommend this hotel to others, and I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for rest and relax”
Reviews.Author: B0l02
Reviews.Content: This resort is probably best I have ever been, beautiful, perfectly designed and managed. staff very friendly and helpful. great pool=aquapark, direct access to beach. I spent there a week during my honeymoon and I deffinitely will come there again. Only two restaurants one more like for lunch and the Hunuhununupunupuapua (yes it is the name of restaurant) has great seafood at reasonable price, very good service but you have to make reservation and even though waite for table

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Fighterjock01
Reviews.Content: Mr Matthew Bailey, Managing Director, Grand Wailea Hotel Aloha Mr Bailey, My beautiful wife, Diana, and I would like to thank you for a wonderful honeymoon stay in your magnificent hotel. The room was truly magnificent and the view was spectacular! From the time we were met at the front of your hotel by your valet service, we were made to feel as if we were family, not guests. Your customer service representatives at the front desk were very professional and courteous and they made every effort to ensure all our needs were met promptly. While we were waiting for our room to be ready, we enjoyed a terrific lunch in your Bistro Molokini restaurant--something we will be enjoying frequently since we are kamaâ€™aina and have a home in Makawao. Your pool was as magnificent as it looks. We had great fun unwinding in it after the affairs of the morning. It was always Diana's dream to be swimming in your pool and I'm glad we could make that dream come true. The waterslides are a blast,even for old kids, and the water elevator was simply amazing. What can anyone say about HumuHumu's Restaurant? Dinner was truly a treat. We couldn't have imagined a more delectable repast exquisitely prepared and served. The sun setting over the ocean just added so much ambiance that we couldn't have asked for a more fitting end to a truly wonderful day. Once again, thank you for helping to make our wedding day one which we will never forget. You can count on us repeating our stay on our anniversaries. This is definitely not a hotel stay-it is the experience of a lifetime!! If you don't have fun here it is your own fault.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: educ8tor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea during our last two trips to Maui and I have to say, we love everything about this hotel. Sure, it's pricey, but it's Maui and worth every penny. From the moment the helpful gentlemen at the valet take your car, you feel like you are immediately whisked away to a Hawaiian paradise! We were greeted with a lei and the nearby employees were very accommodating and kind with taking a few pictures of us upon our arrival. Check in was a breeze and the delicious juice they have in the lobby was a fun treat to sip on while waiting. Initially, we were assigned a ground floor room but immediately asked for one on a higher floor due to us wanting to leave or doors open while we slept! The gentleman helping us was absolutely wonderful and switched us to a higher floor without a problem. Our room was absolutely gorgeous with an ocean view. Now...the pools! We came for the pools and the pools only...and we don't even have kids!! We had seen this hotel on The Travel Channel and specifically stayed at this hotel because of the pools and what they had to offer. Yes, the pools are packed and if you don't arrive poolside before 10am, you may be left wandering the decks looking for pool chairs and a place to sit. It does fill up fast. With a little roaming, we always found a place! The water elevator was a blast, as were the little mini water slides that connected all the pools together. One day of our vacation we were in the pools the entire day! The poolside restaurant was great and our food was tasty. We ordered a specialty drink from the grotto bar in the yellow pineapple and whatever that was, was out of this world! My husband and I took advantage of the complimentary scuba class and he even attended the open dive following the introductory class. We ate at both Humuhumu and Bistro Molokini and both restaurants were delicious and our meals were served with impeccable service. I can understand the sticker shock when initially booking this hotel, however, once you arrive and see what the Grand Wailea has to offer, you realize that this is not an ordinary hotel but one that will leave you speechless and with tons of memories. We look forward to our return visit on the 4th of july!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, firstly, its very big and over whelming at first, you really need afew days to get your bearings. The grounds and all common areas are immaculate! The rooms are spacious and immaculate with plenty of towels ect...in the bathrooms, beds very comfortable. The breakfast area is good but too small for such a large hotel and most mornings you have to wait for a table, which i was not impressed with! The pool areas for the kids is great with a tarzan rope swing add. The restaurants are ok, we mostly ate at the Four Seasons next door , they had great restaurants. If you want a Pool Cabana you should book it before you arrive as they are not easy to get , and they are great for the shade. The hotel spa is amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could use a renovation, grounds are lovely”
Reviews.Author: 2FlyingYorkies
Reviews.Content: We got stuck here for one night when our flight was cancelled. We didnâ€™t get checked in until 3 am, and we had to leave by 10 am to catch our flight, so take that into account when you read my review. The room we were given (Deluxe Garden category) was pretty dumpy. The sleeping area was an ok size for a king size bed, but was a bit small for two beds. It had a large bathroom and was probably very nice once upon a time, but that time is gone, and itâ€™s in need of a renovation. It was mostly clean except for a dead bug on the floor and some dusty spots in the corners, but it was also run down. Some of the light bulbs were burnt out, and the ceiling fan rattled too much to be left on during sleeping hours. We had breakfast at the hotel buffet, and it was by far the worst buffet of any of the five hotels weâ€™d stayed at during our Hawaiian vacation. Definitely not worth the price of admission. Earlier in the day, before our unexpected return due to the cancelled flight, we had wandered the grounds of this hotel and thought they were impeccable and quite lovely. The landscaping is neat, the beach is huge, and the pools looked like fun. The shopping corridor had some nice choices, and the reception area of the hotel seemed quite well maintained. If youâ€™re planning to spend all of your time outside, this would be a fine place to do it. But if you care about the room and the food, this is definitely not the place. We spent our other four nights on this island at the Fairmont Kea Lani just down the road. We had spent quite a lot of time trying to decide between the Fairmont and the Grand Wailea before our trip, and Iâ€™m very glad now that we chose the Fairmont. Iâ€™d definitely choose the Fairmont again over the Grand Wailea now that Iâ€™ve witnessed both.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zdenca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous. Staff was very very nice, beautiful garden and beach. The room was big, big bathroom and balcony. We really enjoyed our time over there in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, beautiful beach!”
Reviews.Author: Belinda93
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, beautiful beach, great hotel! My husband and I stayed at this resort for a company organised incentive holiday. The resort is huge, we enjoyed the pools, and the spa. The architecture of this resort is so impressive, at times I felt I was in Europe somewhere. Overall it's a great place to stay especially with a family/kids, as the resort has pools with slides, lifts, waterfalls, kids club etc. I would stay at this resort again! Interesting, the movie "Just go with it" partly was filmed here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand indeed!!!”
Reviews.Author: lagosbreed
Reviews.Content: Aloha, Aloha, Aloha. I fully enjoyed the pool with the different slides. Beautiful view of the beach. Excellent staff. The activities around the Hotel was too engaging to visit anywhere. I will like to expirience the fun all over again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lohoch
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort but very pricey! Plenty of activities for kids and many pools to choose from and beach activities. They're is even a chapel on the grounds. The lobby is beautiful with bronze Botero statues and native live plants everywhere. We were on a business trip so we were busy and didnt eat much on the grounds. Theyre is an inexpensive take out breakbast bar upstairs and a lovely well appt spa and some good shopping on the grounds. All in all a nice resort but have never been impressed with Waldorf Astoria properties!

Reviews.Title: “Clean * Quality* Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: carriebourdeau
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui in order to attend a friend's wedding. We stayed at the Grand Wailea. You are initially greeted with a "lei" welcome and the check in is fast and curteous. Durning regular hours, the desk offers free apples, ice water and guava juice for refreshment. Our room was clean. The resort if big, so if you can't walk well, then you might find it taxing to travel from room to pool and then to restaurants. We rented a cabana, which was placed somewhat close to the next cabana and it felt tight...and there are 8 lounges in the cabana four in a row facing back to back so a grouping or circle of friends really was not possible. But, I imagine the staff might work to accommodate the seating if you asked them. The free yoga class on the beach was a nice mid-level class and the smoothies at the pool walk-up bar are the most delicious thing at the resort! Kids go crazy over the waterslides and the rope swing. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as possible”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: I was here with my wife for 6 nights in April. Everything about the stay was excellent. the rooms are beautiful, the grounds are amazing. Lots of activities for kids and adults. The BEST Luau I've been to in Hawaii (this one was my 3rd - 1 kaui, 1 Oahu and then this one). Great food and amazing performers. The fire guy was beyond amazing. I unfortunately had already suffered through one on the island Oahu with a very deceiving name. There were a lot of families and couples. there was an adult pool area that was really for adults. the kids area was for adults too...fun slide and pool cawl. We had rented a canopy vs. one of those tent things and it worked out really well. Perfect amount of shade and right near the adult pool. If we didn't have a flight I don't know how I would have gotten my wife out of the spa. it was truly world class. There was a shopping center a mile or two away that had food and clothing, trinkets, etc. With all that said, the staff was excellent. We were greated so warmly by Rose when we arrived and everyone just followed suit. The food was exceptional at every turn. The lobby bar had really good apps and a great vibe. the cafe had really good breakfast sandwhiches and other hot food. The pool food was well prepared and we ate at the main restuarant that looked like a huge hut. The fish was fresh and perfectly cooked and the bartenders were great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot. Awesome sunsets.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0110
Reviews.Content: The resort is gorgeous and the fresh orchids and landscaping are top notch. Staff is very friendly and the service was A+. We loved our room location, private balcony and the sunsets were awesome from every vantage point on the property. Few draw backs: The bed. I am not a fan of down...so pillows and blankets were not my choice. They removed them, but the down was still in the room. The mattress was way to soft for me...my husband and I even flipped the mattress- no big improvement. The TV was out one morning and on-demand movies were out one night of our nine night stay. Pool cocktail service was great thanks to Ashley! Overall, the stay was really good.

Reviews.Title: “No privacy. No romance. Disneyland atmosphere on Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Sofia R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on Maui twice, Kauai twice and Oahu once. This stay at the Grand Wailea was overhyped and disappointing and didn't compare to other places we have stayed throughout the islands. When we arrived after 3pm the room was not ready - although not uncommon at large hotels, it was a little annoying to start the trip with no room. They didn't offer a room to change clothes into beachwear to enjoy the sun or anything else to accommodate the wait. We ran into a friend and changed in his room. The hotel staff was supposed to call our cell phone when the room was ready so we headed to the pool. It was so crowded; talk about nowhere to sit and nowhere to go. It reminded me of the hotel in dirty dancing. It was very 60's Poconos at the pool area. There were kids everywhere which is probably great for parents, but bad for a couple traveling without. We couldn't find a single chair in the adult pool area or in the grassy area below that pool. We went to the regular pool and it is too crowded to even walk. They have the chairs placed with just a few inches between each along the entire pool and lazy river area. We headed to the beach. That was the only place to get a little room between us and the nearest neighbor. They never called about the room. I finally called at around 5:30 because we had a dinner event at the hotel at 6p. They told me when I called it was ready. Not sure when it was really ready since they never called. The views of the whales (we were there in early March) were the best part of the location of the hotel. The crowds at the pool were beyond annoying and were that way for the entire stay. This is not a review for parents. I think they would love this place for the sandy area for kids to play, waterfalls and waterslides for kids. For such a high star rating I would expect to be writing about the exceptional staff, knowing staff members name to refer to in this review, but I had not one experience that was above average. Felt like a "number" getting in line at a waterpark to get towels each day. Service from the pool bar was beyond long wait times - the average time the three times we ordered at the pool area was at least 40 minutes. The one food order took over an hour. You had to get at the pool at 8am to get a chair in the adult area and they always had people with towels across multiple chairs for hours at a time and no one sitting there. There was not a single experience at the Grand Wailea that made it worth the price per night or made it worth the annoyingly crowded resort and hotel. Oh wait. The gym was nice. Equipment was nice and clean. We have a convention at the Wailea every four years, but in four years, we are going to stay at one of the other hotels that are within walking distance of this property. Views will be similar but hopefully the crowds and overall experience will not. Select the Marriott next door or the four seasons. Not worth the money when you can spend that on excursions or great dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is the place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: trvlgirl13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel -- we stayed in the Napua towers which entitled us to complimentary breakfast, snacks and cocktails. While the room was beautiful. We probably would have been just as happy in a "regular" room and saved on the cost of the Napua Towers. Be advised that while the hotel is beautiful, it is very expensive to eat/drink on property. The room was nicely appointed with a beautiful large bathroom -- double vanity, separate bath and glass enclosed shower plus full size amenities, the same used in the spa. And just a word about the spa -- amazing! If you can spare the time away from everything there is to do at the hotel, definitely take the time to book a spa appointment. The hydrotherapy room is one of the best I've seen, compares to Canyon Ranch. And the treatments are well done and priced in line with comparable spas, nothing too outrageous. The restaurants are very good but again a bit pricy. If you have a rental car and are willing to drive a bit, it's well worth the drive to Mama's Fish House or Hailemaile General Store for lunch or dinner. The hotel pool is also a highlight -- the water elevator is fun for both kids and adults alike, the water bar underneath the waterfall is a neat adult hang out and there are ample hot tubs and slides to keep everyone busy. Would not have stayed anywhere else and would love to go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “play all day, party all night, sleep in then repeat”
Reviews.Author: QFOX
Reviews.Content: Seems ideal but you will miss Maui doing this. I live on Maui so it wasn't hard for me. This resort makes me just wanna play in the pool for hours and get some drinks in the pool bar. buy some floaties and just cruise the water park. We got stuck with the kids for awhile and ended up swinging on the rope and landing on our faces a few times, in the water so just embaressing not so much pain. Back to the swim up bar no kids allowed for some lunch and a fill up on our plastic pineapple. Believe its about 17$ for the first drink (super strong) then re-fills for a lesser price. You can take this pineapple to other bars in the resort also. Lovely bath in the room, its like a baby pool just cleaner. we ordered the kids some Pizza Hut then went out to dinner at The Shops of Wailea next door to the hotel. Back to the hotel lobby bar, Botterros bar. Lots of fun and very lively on the weekends. Great entertainment and too funny of bartentenders. Nice wine selection and of course someone had to start the shots. zzzzzz wake up next day with a slight hangover, the pool will take that away. great overall hotel. Fun for all ages and easy to relax or have a blast. Oh yeah the beds are super comfy. looking for pics to post is hard, looked at all 600 or so here and other posters got it covered. so I submit the plastic pineapple and a large bathroom shot. You will love this property just don't party so much as Maui has alot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families; Review re Younger Kids”
Reviews.Author: Pompolina555
Reviews.Content: So, lots of the reviews covered families and kids but I had a hard time finding information that was applicable to me, so I thought I'd add my $.02 here, specifically re younger children -- We travelled 5 of us - my husband and I, and our 5 yr old, 3 yr old and 4 month old newborn. Pros: - Plenty to do for the 5 yr old and 3 yr old. Swimming pool mostly appropriate for the most part, for them. I say mostly because there's only one (sand-floor pool) that's actually 100% appropriate. But if your kid can swim or doesnt mind hanging out with floaties for a large chunk of the time, pretty much all pools are appropriate. Shouting and craziness is a given at this hotel and the slides (most, anyway) are appropriate for the wussiest and the youngest, as well. - Food (namely lunch) appropriate for the younger ones as well. Pricey, but decent. - Rooms (standard ones) are spacious and plenty of space for us all. - Location - your'e within minutes drive of dozens or reasonably priced, good food. Definitely worth having a car. This is not a resort I would plan to stay at for all meals with younger kids. Not just the price (although it's extremely pricey onsite!) but also the selection of the food was not particularly up the kids' alley for dinner. Cons: - Lounging chairs were ridiculously scarce. We literally set up an alarm starting the 2nd day, to head to the pool and reserve a couple of spots - every day. And we'd stand in line starting 15 minutes before the "chains" opened and still we'd be 10th in line sometimes. Kinda ridiculous.. you'd think when you pay $600-700/night, you would be able to rely on a chair or two for a family of 5. Shaded chairs? Pff - virtually no chance at all. So few of them (we needed one with a newborn but there were others like us that did, too..) - Pricey food - Distances --the downside of the gorgeous endless manicured gardens is that you walk. A lot. If I needed a quick visit to our room for baby feeding or forgotten floaties, I'd be gone for 15-20 minutes just for back and forthing to the room. We stayed for 7 nights through a Costco package and had a blast. Would definitely go back again. BUT Possibly lower season so that the lounging chairs is not as significant of an issue --or once we know that this has been dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for so many children”
Reviews.Author: Lurkinc
Reviews.Content: If you are a family, this is the place to be. The pool for kids and adults who want to play is amazing. But if you want some peace, you need to wait until 8 pm to go anywhere in the hotel. They also don't police the adult pool, and kids jump in there. Most annoying. I suggest the hotel have a monitor there all the time. After 8 pm the hotel is like a seductive dream for adults. I really loved it, but you just need to learn how to "work it." Excellent food. Great luau.

Reviews.Title: “Something for Everyone, except couples”
Reviews.Author: Gskiba
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the resort as we were with our family. Great pools, restaruants, etc although really not the type of resort I would enjoy if it were just my wife and I. Highly recommend the Napua tower and the excellent breakfast and drinks that are included daily. The staff up there were phenomenal. The Breakfast buffett was just so-so, recommend going to the Four Seasons if you enjoy a good breakfast. Service at the pool leaves a lot to be desired, dont expect any special treatment if you splurge for an overpriced cabana. Free high speed internet is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: KarenM1_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui. The hotel was fabulous, but pricey. We had a package that included the breakfast buffet, which was wonderful. The buffet had made to order omelets and a huge assortment of side dishes, fruits, cereals, etc. The food was hot and they continued to restock when it was getting low. On the last day, we were told by the hostess that the tip was already included in the package. We had no idea so the wait staff received tips from us for four days. Sure would have been nice to know up front. The only thing that turned me off about this property was that you had to have valet service for your car. This was a huge inconvenience for us. We typically felt rushed when we pulled up and twice we accidently left valuable items in the car (camera).

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable....”
Reviews.Author: Harold E
Reviews.Content: The atrium features a series of priceless Botero bronze sculptures. The property is not brand new but the initial investment was excessive. The suites and executive areas are exceptional. The theme-park like pool area is a bit tacky.

Reviews.Title: “In love with this resort, best vacation ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Klrhodes
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome honeymoon here! Everything from our room to the food was excellent. Will be going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite family vacation destination!”
Reviews.Author: Bellagirl78
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea 4 different times, and our whole family absolutely loves it. There's so much to do, or you can do absolutely nothing. The pools are our favorite part of the hotel. There's water slides that our little kids can handle, fast water slides teens and adults, a rope swing, one of a kind water elevator, sandy beach entrance, and it's all linked by a super fun lazy river. There's also an adult pool away from all the families with children. There is an on site luau and the restaurants are all very good. We love the poolside service during the day and the breakfast buffet is amazing. If you are vacationing with kids or just with adults you'll love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Stay....”
Reviews.Author: kosfam
Reviews.Content: We have been regulars to Wailea for years...but normally only day trip to the GW. This time we stayed in a Suite on the top floor that was over 2000 s ft and big enough for 4 adults and 6 kids...we were 2 adults and 2 kids...the room had a living area with TV, dinning area with a round table for 12 easily..and a mini kitchen with full size fride and sink..but that's it..you could easily fit in a stove, micro etc etc..but they did not. The room was great but needs a face lift for sure..windows included...the hotel itself is always great lots for the kids to do etc...they do tend to jam the chairs as close as possible which is super annoying but you can always move them somewhat. If you want a quiet relaxing trip..don't go here..fore more than 2 days...unless it's off season..or you have teenagers..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jimking2
Reviews.Content: A little pricey but a great hotel! Lots to do for the whole family. Be mindful of your credit card as I had fraud committed on mine. I believe it to be the person who checked me in. The hotel did take it seriously and investigated. But never heard the results.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for kids of all ages”
Reviews.Author: Al K
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Grand Wailea. After what seemed like an interminable delay at check-in (which was never explained), we had a wonderful stay. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and the pool complex is absolutely amazing. Our room was spacious and well appointed. Our teenage kids had a great time. With so many pools, it was sometimes hard to find them! The beach is fantatstic. It was very easy to get chairs and umbrellas. There was an excellent and inexpensive water sports concession on the beach with wonderful attendants. When we return to Wailea in the future, we will be sure to stay at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds but wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: TheGrens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for a week and were impressed with the hotel but less than satisfied with the front desk. The front desk manager Roberto was less than accommodating when we inquired about the amenities we are used to receiving, as diamond Hilton honors members, such as the use of the concierges lounge and breakfast. Roberto informed us that they are not really part of the Hilton association and do not grant the normal Hilton honors amenities. This was conveyed in a more matter of fact way without any discourse in our disappointment. The irony here is that we called before booking our trip and the hotel informed us that we will receive the normal amenities as diamond members. We honestly choose this hotel because we enjoy the amenities we typically receive with Hilton and Marriott properties. My husband and I both travel for work constantly and have never dealt with such a lack of customer service. After exploring the island for the week we highly recommend staying at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJIB5
Reviews.Content: It was our family's first experience Hawaii, much less Maui. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our 3 kids (ages 17, 12, 7) enjoyed the waterpark, especially the 7-yr old on the rope swing. This resort doesn't compare when it comes to water entertainment. Yes, there seem to be fees that others don't have but is worth it. You are building wonderful memories with your family. We rented a cabana for the 1st day of our 3-night stay. Well worth it as the other days, we had to get a spot that wasn't previosly marked with towels as token. I will say that security does it's best to keep track of loungers that have been saved but not present. The bar service was pretty prompt. My husband & I enjoyed a duo massage & absoluely recommend the escape with any service from SpaGrande or Salon. For breakfast, we dined at the Cafe. It's like breakfast on the go but with a beautfiul terrace to sit. You get the most for your valuable buck if you stay & take full advantage of the waterpark facilities. It's a tough call if you have tour stops to make when the kids are having so much fun in the water. The beach is right there, no stairs to get to the beach. Sunsets look like a photo backdrop. The grounds are absolutely beautfiful. If you aren't worried about cost, I would most likely visit again with1/2 the stay here & other 1/2 at Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT TIME DOES THE WET T SHIRT CONTEST START?”
Reviews.Author: LovetogoCalabasas
Reviews.Content: I thought I was all prepared for our trip after much research and investigation into this resort. We checked in and it was fabulous and just as I had hoped considering the resort was a Waldorf property and all. It is GRAND, it is BEAUTIFUL and it could have been perfect in every concievable way THEN they began arriving. Little by little over our first three days things began to change and by day four all hell had broken loose. We were at the hotel at the same time as convention, a huge 800 room check in in one day convention as I soon learned. I am so sad to say our dream trip was soon turned into watching a re-run of my Spring Break trips to Cancun from my teenage years. This very beautiful and wonderful resort was taken over and I do mean completely taken over by hundreds of people that apparently don't need to abide by ANY rules either by the hotel or even worse by society. I tell you it was as if caged animals were let loose by the pool. This resort with these supposed strict pool rules of one hour saving policys nope, apparently the pool chair saving rule DID NOT apply to this group (only to regular guests) as I saw rows of chairs being held by only a stray towel here and there for HOURS sitting empty when other chairs being held by family type items were swooped up and taken away by the pool staff. The staff was just standing back and letting these people have free reign at the ENTIRE hotel. The pool, the gym, it was awful. You could not even walk around the pool area to escape because there were so many of these conventioneers cheering on the company volleyball games the entire area was blocked by drunken, swearing, whoo-hooing, yelling, screaming people. I was just waiting for the WET T SHIRT contest to start. It was honestly THAT bad. Even worse I did try to speak to someone anyone but NOBODY cared. I went to the front desk THREE times. I was actually crying the third time I was so frustrated. The response was I will speak to ther manager. I promise you I did not even get a phone call. NO RESPONSE FROM ANY MANAGER. Nobody cared. The front desk acted annoyed by me and couldn't have possibly cared any less. I didn't really expect anything but I was really expecting at least a telephone call from someone, ANYONE. I did encounter a person that cared and his name is Gilbert. Gilbert remembered me from my first day and addressed me by name and was completely wonderful and exactly what you would expect from a Waldorf property. I found three people at this resort that were actually wonderful and deserve to be mentioned here. First Gilbert at the front desk second Keo the beach chair guy and third Dan the 8th floor bartender. These three pepole were just as wonderful as can be everyone else from the frint desk to the pool to the concierge were far too busy with this horrid convention to bother with my little family. It is clear to me that quantity is more of the focus here than is quality. My one family didn't mean a thing to this management. Not when they had just filled 800 rooms with drunken covention attending guests. To not receive at least a phone call from management after three compliaints at the front desk and two at the pool is unforgiveable to me. The General Manager here is Matt Bailey. He is not doing the Waldorf Astoria name any favors by his turning a blind eye to the resort being taken over by a large group at the expense of his regular guests. Lots of people were as horrified as I was. It is my understanding that this group has the company convention at The Grand Wailea every year so call and check before you go. If you are told there will be a large convention DO NOT GO. Like I said before this place is all about quantity NOT quality. Three people that cared and were great. Three. So sad. Gilbert, Keo and Dan. Beautiful place, so beautiful but such a shame that they didn't even pretend to care in the least bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rh0nda50
Reviews.Content: My son and I just spent eight days at the beautiful Grand Wailea and had a wonderful trip. The resort grounds are gorgeous with new surprises around every corner. We expected the hotel to be beautiful (and it was) but what we didn't expect was how comfortable and relaxed we would feel there. It was Grand but not so grand that we couldn't feel at home. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Rose Sumibcay, the lei greeter was an especially sweet lady. She always greeted my son and I by name and took some great pictures of us, one of which will probably be our Christmas card picture. It was difficult for us to keep from packing her up and taking her home with us! All in all a fabulous trip, the only regret is that they didn't give me my rewards points because the trip was booked through an agent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: JadedDeb
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth with an easy registration and the bellman ready to go with our luggage. Overall, the facility was very nice. We didn't eat on-site as we were already familiar with the area and had a car. The pool scene is a bit of a zoo and hard to enjoy. People would stake out their chairs at dawn and there was no place to sit by noon. The water park is the big draw, and it was fun, but the thrill wore off quickly for our teenagers. We had stayed next door at the Wailea Beach Villas. There was no comparison. The Wailea Beach Villas rule!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: stefrx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an anniversary celebration and found the property to be among the best we have stayed at. The staff were very warm and welcome, the property was clean, location was outstanding. We do suggest you rent a car so you can drive around the island.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT trip, will return! Spa and Business Center the only negatives.”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonResident
Reviews.Content: We visited on 6/12-6/17 and had a great time. We had a fast and pleasant check in and great bell hops. We did the bed and breakfast package with the upgrade to one of the back tower rooms with a great view but changed to the Chapel Wing on the 2nd floor on the second day (Rm. 2010). We loved the view the other room provided but appreciated the closer proximity to the pool in the Chapel wing because we have a small child. We also had another problem with the room because we had a native insect (lol) visit us in our room but they had quickly transfer us and even gave us an end room that was a little more spacious and had an additional side window with another fantastic view. It was a little bit of a walk to the main lobby and shops but we didnâ€™t mind. As for the pool, we loved it! The only negative was the guests. We had a very small child and kept getting water splashed right in his face. This is not uncommon in a pool, right? But this was at the baby beach area and most of the splashing was by ADULTS that just didnâ€™t care. We just ended coming back at the less busy times, in the morning and late afternoon. Our favorite part was the lazy river, my husband me and the baby all had a good time. The maid service was so great!!! She was so nice and worked well around the babies sleep times. As for the food, it was not so great. We only ate at the Bistro, Dinning room and the inside area lobby bar but the food could have been better. The service as the breakfast buffet in the Dinning room was hit or miss. Some days we where told one thing and then the next day with another server the info was totally different. They need to have all the servers on the same page. However the service was great at the inside area lobby bar and even talked with Angie (the food and beverage manager) and expressed our concerns and the high points in our stay. She was extremely receptive and did a great job listening and providing feedback!!! As for the negatives the Spa was great until I got the massage. The women that I had just didnâ€™t listen to what I wanted and it was just not up to par for the over $200 price tag. As for the rest of the spa, LOVED the other aspects of the spa and took advantage of the 1 hour before time in the spa. The business center was awful. I couldnâ€™t get the printer to work to print off our boarding passes and it wasted over an hour of my time trying to fix the problem and waiting for the technical staff that after an hour NEVER showed. This was also the middle of the day so I donâ€™t know what the problem was that they couldnâ€™t get someone to help me after waiting as long as I did. This also caused problems at the airport and took us twice as long to check in :( Overall we would stay here again and feel free to email me with questions about this hotel. TIP: Wait to get the upgrade via your email instead of doing it at the time of booking, it is way less expensive that way. Also, pay in full at the time of booking for a nice discount on the room but only if you are very positive that you are not going to need to cancel as you would not get a refund. Costco travel offers some good packages but they are not always available for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pools for family”
Reviews.Author: solarmaster
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here at the moment. The hotel is looking a litle used but who cares as the pools are awesome, the location is second to none and the staff are fab. If u are looking for a water park with a hotel attached this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jon34877
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5/7 days for our honeymoon. The place is immaculate. It's a little pricey (we used Hilton Points and got a great upgrade), but it's everything you need. This is a "resort", and yes, there are kids roaming around at the waterslides, kid pools, etc., but I'd rather stay somewhere with some kids (who can be amusing) than a bunch of stuffy adults. You can avoid the kids by going to the beach, etc. We took full advantage of the amenities eating at both restaurants, Did a couple's massage, Took the kayak/snorkel deal with "Kayak Chris" and even rode the water slides and the "lazy river". We also attended the Luau which was nice. Overall, we had a wonderful experience here. You can run up a bill pretty fast, but on a honeymoon. . . . that's okay. If you have young kinds, what a great place to be, but your trip will be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was even better!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller11_66
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Grand Wailea four years ago and were surprised that our experience this time actually exceeded our fabulous experience during our last stay. The grounds and hotel were just as beautiful and meticulously clean. But, the service this time, and the friendliness of the staff, was really top-notch. This hotel really does stand apart from the other hotels on the island, both in beauty and in service. This is a wonderful family hotel. Although upscale in design it is incredibly family friendly. Everything is impeccably clean. There are beautiful views in every direction. The landscaping is perfectly designed - photo ops abound. The pools are a huge draw for kids of all ages. And, the beach is beautiful with a view of Molokini crater and a lovely paved beach walk which meanders by some other resorts, often with views of green sea turtles just off the reef. Some folks will complain about the mandatory daily valet charge on top of the daily resort fee. And, while I agree that the cost is yet one more daily fee added to an already expensive hotel; they really add some nice touches that make it worth having. * The car was always ready when we needed it and we were always greeted kindly both when picking up the car and when dropping it off. * There were always cold water bottles, for each member of the party, provided by the valets each time they picked up your car * They always offered beach towels, for each member of the party, if you needed them. We were pleasantly surprised that a small complementary fridge was now included in the daily resort fee for guest use. It was plenty large enough to store some water bottles, yogurt, fruit and lunch meat; which can really save a family money over the course of a week. There are affordable food stores nearby as well (Foodland and Safeway) and even a Whole Foods in Kahului, near the airport. We had a chance to dine at Humu's on two separate evenings, once in the dining room area with our large party of eight and once in the bar area with a smaller party of four. Both meals were exceptional - both the food and the service. The wait staff was perfectly friendly and attentive. I can honestly say that they were our favorite meals on the island. We also had a chance to visit the spa and salon. The treatments and therapists there were wonderful and we really enjoyed the changes made in the hydrotherapy rooms and salon, since our last stay. There are five pools in the spa that feature indigenous ingredients from some of the islands and you can choose one of the baths to use in your pedicure. Nice touch! I would recommend this hotel for families with young children. The south shore of Maui is less congested than the Kaanapali area; and, the resort has plenty for kids to do to keep them happy and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: EHNL K
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing! We went for my birthday weekend - Aug 19-21 and were upgraded from garden view to an ocean view room. It was the best weekend I've ever had (personal experiences included). I cannot comment on the food or restaurants other than the Cafe Kula where we picked up breakfast and coffee to enjoy on our lanai. It opens at 6 am which is great for early risers like us. We did order drinks from room service once and they were up within 10 minutes! On Saturday we didn't get down to the pool until about 9 am, but I can assure you there were plenty of chairs available. As a matter of fact we got 2 over by the Grotto bar where all of the chairs were empty. No, there was no umbrella, but the plants behind us provided plenty of shade. Anyway, we weren't in the actual chairs for more than 15 mins combined. The pools are phenomenal, the rides sooo much fun! The staff was very helpful - my boyfriend dropped his sunglasses after one of the slides and the attendant dived in to find them for him. I must admit I was somewhat nervous seeing some of the bad reviews on here. I just have to say that your time will be what you make of it. If it's going to bug you that a small tile is cracked on the bottom of the pool, then by all means try to find perfection elsewhere. If you just want to relax and have fun, this is the place to do it!

Reviews.Title: “-Best Resort in Maui-”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Fits_1983
Reviews.Content: This is the third trip to Maui and this has been the most accommodating, elegant and yet still super family friendly resort we have experienced. My wife loved the extra large bathroom and walk out balcony. The water park provides endless hours of fun, and as a parent I was entertained and did not get bored of the kid attractions like I normally do. The pools and slides are great, there are slides for all ages including our 18 month old. The water elevator was not as cool as I expected, but hey who else has one?? The elevators are not air conditioned either, but it is a quick. Also call in your car from the room before you leave to ensure the A/C cools the car and to avoid delays with the valet. After days at the beach or out in town it was perfect to relax in the water and the gym is excellent! Usually after two weeks I am missing home and ready to go back... but not this time!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Disappointment! Hotel is overcrowded and in need of an update.”
Reviews.Author: spdma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Grand Wailea and was VERY DISAPPOINTED. This was supposed to be the pinnacle of our 3 Island trip and we had just checked out of the Hyatt on Poipu Bay in Kauai (which was absolutely fantastic) so we had high expectations. Upon arrival we went to the pool as our room wasn't ready. We could not find two adjacent chairs, let alone four for our family. The facility was overrun with guests and we ended up sitting on the lawn area as it was the only space available. The chairs in the pool area are crammed together, side by side, much like you'd find on the deck of a cruise ship. What we later learned is this hotel sells facility/pool access to an adjacent time share property. It appears they have little regard for registered guests and they are out for profit maximization as they do not have the physical space to support the hundreds of extra visitors that purchase pool passes. I shared this opinion with the front desk and the hotel waived the mandatory daily activity fee for our entire stay - the staff said they were familiar with this problem and apologized. I think this frustrated me even more as they are well aware the overcrowding is an ongoing problem. Also, we were less than pleased with the condition of our room. There was a signifcant amount of black mold in the grout lines of our bathtub & shower unit. Three days went by before we were notified that problem couldn't be fixed by housekeeping as engineering needed to get involved - the mold had penetrated the silicone caulking - probably more info here than you care to know, but this is supposed to be a 5 Star Hotel. In addition the room was noisier than expected as we could routinely hear staff going down the hallway, especially the bellman's cart, and occassionally could hear the guests in the adjacent rooms. It is really unfortunate as this is a beautiful property which seems to be falling into neglect. I came to this conclusion whenI was looking at the condition of the pool which had many missing tiles, the condition of some of the fountains which needed cleaning/repair, and the dated colors throughout the hotel- which could use a good overall painting. When we spoke with some of the staff, which were very good, they told us the property has changed hands a few times over the past several years....it appears this lack of continuity may be responsible for the compromised condition of this Hotel. Any way, if you are going to stay in Wailea I wouldn't, in any way, recommend this Hotel. Next time we are going to try the Four Seasons which is next to The Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is the Grandest Resort in Maui”
Reviews.Author: c_ito423
Reviews.Content: Do: If you stay during the busy months (June-Aug) or busy times of the year (easter/xmas break) get to the pool early to reserve your seat or think about renting a cabana or umbrelled lawn chair. Cabana @ $300 per day was a bit pricey but worth it to guarantee your seats. FYI - the cabana seats up to eight. Four inside and four in front of it. Don't: Lua was not that great. Instead save yourself some money and go the Polynesian Village Lua. The food is decent and the show is good. Hiallarious MC. Snorkeling tours are not worth it. We saw only 1 turtle at turtel bay and only about two dozen fish on molokini. We were shocked at how little fish there were compared to 20 years ago. Over gaming and perhaps global warming. :( Instead spend it on zip lining and hana tour.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: RobLoves314159
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights (wish it had been longer!) while on my honeymoon and from start to finish we were taken care of perfectly. We were given an upgraded room, the people of the hotel were amazingly helpful and the service from front desk to the valet was superb. We got back to the hotel late one evening to find a light on and a flower on the pillow... nice touch! We did not have to pay for our room because I was using reward points so I cant comment on value, but its an expensive place to stay... but the service did not disappoint! The resort was huge, lots of kid friendly activities (it seems) and hands down the best experience/service we've ever had (by far!) at any hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jlm0712
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Grand Wailea with my 2 kids. What a wonderful place. The views are out of this world. The pools and water slides are fun for all. The beach is beautiful. I highly recommend paddleboarding, snorkeling and boogie boarding. The food/drink prices are very high, but we had a refridgerator and microwave so it allowed us to save some money by eating in the room. If you have the opportunity to visit the Grand Wailea I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, expensive not exceptionally friendly”
Reviews.Author: urdunn
Reviews.Content: i am going to tell you the things that i disliked first since i am assuming you need to have that information first this was a well deserved family vacation and I was prepared to spend money I had done my research about this hotel and was mentally prepared for sticker shock My children are a 15 yr old son and 10 yr old daughter - they loved the place. they are easily pleased as we usually are From their point of view, the pool and beach were fantastic and we certainly kept them busy- the concierge set us up with a car rental (disgustingly dirty and older model)snuba diving, snorkeling, Pearl Harbor, and a helicopter ride. I had already planned surfing lessons at Blue Hawaiin and the luau at Old Lahaina both were well worth the money and trip to lahaina. The thing that I can advise is plan ahead - dont waste a half a day with the concierge and it is more expensive through them. upon arrival we were greated by Rosie who was very friendly- you have probably read reviews about her- but she only said aloha Check in was a different story, being hilton honors members and taking 2 rooms for 10 nights didnt get us a thing we were in rooms 5118 and 5120 not a great view - too low if you are in this part of the hotel, you have to be ready to walk to the main pool and beach area it is far!! if you are having health issues definately ask for a closer room- you may go through the grand ballroom for your car but this is a very large hotel and spread out-the room was slightly dirty some mold in bathrooms but after talking to housecleaning they took care of it during turn down service - which i personally love I got sick there with strep throat and went to the clinic in kehei- they couldnt have been nicer at clinic however when we ordered room service that was an eye opener! expensive is too mild-holy cow for 1 mozzerella appetizer, four soups, house salads and 4 sodas i spent almost $180! then the second night my daughter got fish and chips with a bone in it that could've killed her! no exaggeration!! it was the size of a tooth pick and as sharp! they said that we wouldnt be charged but I am still fighting that one with them-the rush for the pool chairs is certainly true unless you are willing to pay $300/day for a cabana-which seem to take up all the space around all of the pools - you can get chairs however by the adult pool near the beach and the staff there were great they expected to be tipped but at least they smiled and made you feel good about spending money to sit down if you can get the breakfast buffet it is worth the money, although I must agree with reviews about the birds - too many and it is a health concern we watched them cr.. on the tables next to us the hotel should consider netting-one more thing - i booked photos with the hotel photographer, at sunset on our last day there - that didnt turn out well-he double booked and he tried to divide his time with us and them the other family complained quite loudly and took over the session - I am currently waiting to see if he gives us the discounted rate that he promised to - the hotel is absolutly breathtaking and there is a premium for that beauty one of the nicest places on the island of maui and the property is immaculately maintained the pools are fantastic and they even have manicure and pedicure services poolside along with popcorn and slushies! the restaurants are great but you would do better eating out if you are looking to save money somewhere hard rock in lahaina was really good and less then half the price of the grand wailea the pizza place across the street from hotel, matteos, was not new york pizza so we did not care for the sauce at all - plus im italian so its hard to compare any gravy to mine haha the overall feeling from the people on maui is laid back, kind and considerate great vibe from almost everyone i dont want you to think that we didnt have a fantastic time, we did i just thought that you would want to hear about these things so that you can be better prepared when you step off the plane onto paradise!

Reviews.Title: “BEST RESORT ON MAUI WITH SIX STAR TREATMENT OF GUESTS”
Reviews.Author: larryt43
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect vacation spot for a family. The team members are all great, and the rooms contain everything needed for your enjoyment. The Humuhumunukunukuapua'a is a very romantic place to eat, with a view of the sunset and food that is hard to beat. All of the water slides and pool area is a big hit with the kids. The level beach is incredible. A kids club is there, if needed; to give parents time alone. It really is fun for the kids, and great for parents.

Reviews.Title: “The kids LOVED the pools and the sheer size of the resort, the parents not so much”
Reviews.Author: Corinne819
Reviews.Content: Maybe this was a high season week, but we found the pool area to be ridiculously crowded and chaotic. lounge chairs are practically on top of each other and just walking around trying to find even one available seat was a 45 minute chore. The pools were definitely a highlight for the kids (age 11 and 13) . they loved them. However, I felt that the pools were dirty. I went in them and just decided that I would have to bathe immediately upon returning to the hotel room, but I just did not get the sense that the resort attended to cleaning the pools. in the morning, there was still debris floating on the surface and sunk at the bottom and the water was just downright murky by the end of the day. Another thing that really bothered us was the fact that people that are not guests of the hotel find ways to use the pools without having paid to do so. So I've paid an exorbitant amount to stay at the hotel just to use the pools when I guess I could have stayed at the Marriott or Four SEasons down the beach and snuck into the Grand Wailea for the afternoon. A few of our swim shirts disappeared one afternoon while drying on our lounge chairs. The next day coincidentally the very large family that was seated near us happened to bump into us and said they had picked up our shirts with their own stuff. They told us they are not guests of the resort but just sneak in wiht their kids in the afternoons. Re food - eat breakfast at Kula Cafe instead of the grand dining room buffet. the birds are all over every table and the buffet food in the dining room and it was foul (no pun intended)

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: mrtraveltime
Reviews.Content: Stayed during our last getaway and did our family love this place! they have something for everyone. The grounds are beautifully manicured and the amenities in the rooms are top notch. We will stay nowhere else while in Maui. Thanks Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasMomtotwo
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive hotel, but so worth the money! Starting with the lei's you receive upon checking in, to the beach, waterslides, rooms etc... There is so much to love about this resort. We arrived a few hours before check in and we were given a hospitality suite to change into our swimsuits and hit the pool. We also used it for a late check out on our last day. The employees are good but not great. They don't go that extra mile like those employees at Hilton Los Cabos. The hotel food is just ok as well. We had a car and it was so worth it to be able to grab a subway sandwich for lunch or get a pizza from Matteos to eat on the beach! Tip - There are actually two valet areas at the GW. The Ballroom entrance is much less crowded and the valet's are so willing to give you directions. We will definately go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: Ramona N
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Wailea for our 6 night stay, and began the stay with our reservation being wrong. Our documentation was correct... their records were not. Even though we made reservations for 2 rooms months ago (we were traveling with our daughters), we ended up with our rooms being 3 floors apart. The front desk staff was not willing to work with us, even though it was their error. The grounds and pools were beautiful. We really enjoyed the pools and beach, but as others have said, the 7am rush for pool chairs was ridiculous. Why there aren't enough chairs for the guests is beyond me. The hotel knows how many guests they are accomodating; have enough chairs! Our rooms were a disappointment. We had come to the Grand Wailea from the Grand Hyatt on Kauai and expected the same, if not better accomodations. Our rooms were nice, size wise, but dated and even dirty. The shower in one room had a fair amount of mold between the tiles, the carpet was dirty and I don't think the room was vacuumed at all during the week. The mattresses on the beds in our other room were very warn, to the point of having large "hills and valleys." The valet parking was a pain to deal with during the week. I read the managers response to an earlier post and I don't buy the reasoning for them having valet parking. We had to wait 10 minutes or longer a number of times to get our car and did not have bottled water in our car whenever it was brought to us. Waiting to get our car is a waste of our valuable vacation time. When we stay at resorts like this, we expect the cost of food, etc, to be higher, but these costs were astronimical. Thankfully there are some really good restaurants nearby. The refrigerators in the roooms are nice amenity. The fitness center was nice and there is plenty of equipment to be used. The staff was not that helpful when I had questions. And having water other then the little paper cups would be nice! My daughter had a massage and said it was wonderful. Overall, we were disappointed in our stay here. We have been to many very nice resorts and this is not somewhere we will likely return. We did love the area of Wailea, though.

Reviews.Title: “have deep pockets”
Reviews.Author: charles r
Reviews.Content: rack rate for garden room 700. plus tax and surcharge of about 100. makes it 800.rent a car in hawaii and you pay state 7.50 per day. go to Costco because supermarkets are price way off the charts,A LEMON 198 at Safeway,A LIME 129 each,RED POTATO 2.49lb.MAHI MAHI 22.95 per lb.jalepano peppers 6.99 per lb.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea is definitely Grand”
Reviews.Author: drussman
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Staff was very friendly and bumped us up to an ocean view. Friendly, courteous, and very pleasant. Valet: The valet staff was excellent - always friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations (they did not push hotel restaurants, but were accurate on recommendations based on location, price, food type, etc.). Note - there is a second valet that is much closer to the rooms on the east side next to the conference area - it is never busy and makes vehicle retrieval quick. Room: We originally booked a king and planned for our two boys (ages 15 & 18) to use the fold out couch. At check-in, they kindly switched us to two queens - which worked very well. The room was spacious with a great balcony with table and chairs - beautiful for watching the ocean, grounds, and sunset (also nice for morning coffee). The bathroom was huge - well appointed too. Room was in good condition - not overyly worn, not new. Overall, a great room. Restaurants: Sorry, we ate offsite for everything except a pizza which was very good. Workout room: Well equipped. Only used once as outdoor activities sufficed. Spa: Outstanding. Not much more to say - great experience. Grounds and Pool Area: Incredible. Huge. Lush tropical grounds with pools everywhere. Very family friendly. The adult pool was much quieter and a nice place to escape for some privacy. Chairs tended to fill up early, but we were always able to find something when needed to park our stuff. Staff around the pool were very pleasant and friendly. Other Activities: Kayak and snorkel adventure with Kayak Chris were great. Outdoor rentals (boogie boards, paddle boards, kayaks) were not cheap, but the 4 day option worked well for $99. The best spot to snorkel is south/east by the Four Seasons off the point - the reef there goes way out. We were also steered to Kihei for surf lessons with Maui Beach Boys (2 hours for $60 - and small groups) which both boys thoroughly enjoyed. The Road to Hana was another activity which took all day - plan on at least 10 hours away. The valet staff provided a map and great information for our trip. All-in-all - a great trip. We were concerned by some of the negative reviews, but did not experience anything like those - perhaps meeting the friendly staff with a smile and laid back attitude were the key - they responded more than double in kind. A friend of ours always complains about service, but treats those providing service with disrespect and contempt and wonders why "his" service is so poor. LOL. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: The best service came from the spa and valet. Everything in between was ok to poor. Our first contact was with Agnes who checked us in. We couldn't have been met by a more unhappy person. If she's a great employee having a bad day then she should have been stationed somewhere else for the day. We had minimal conversation and no smile at all. She gave us a fabulous room but we had no idea where it was or what made it so great until we got there. We knew nothing about the property, restaurants or any other details you usually get when you check in at a resort. She just gave us our keys and told us where to go for the elevators. The Humuhumu restaurant was all disorganized. We were removed from our seats and reseated. Another party was taking their empty drinks to the bar because their server didn't return. It is a beautiful property. Great for kids maybe not so much for honeymooners wanting quiet time. Walking distance to Shops at Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth. Recharged my batteries”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler884
Reviews.Content: I recently took a very quite trip to Maui and stayed at Grand Wailea. Not only was I upgraded to a room with a ocean view, but I was pampered and treated so well. I do like the spa, but I think the therapists talk a bit too much during services, making it a little difficult for you to completely relax. Make sure you get a great spot on the beach early. I definitely will be back, but I won't do the snorkling turtle/kayak package they offer because it wasn't very good. Walk down the beach and book a table at the Four Seasons' steak house. It's amazing and the fish is soo fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids”
Reviews.Author: darch
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the water park for our kids (13, 10, 10). They really enjoyed it, but all agreed that it does not compare to the one at Atlantis in the Bahamas! So if your goal is to enjoy a waterpark resort, Atlantis is still a better bet. The frenzied rush to reserve lounge chairs each morning was a pain, and the loudness and craziness of kids running around the pool area made did not make for a relaxing vacation! The hotel entrance and lobby are impressive, but the rooms are in need of updating. All in all, our kids still loved it and it was a good base for us in Maui as we visited the various attractions on the island.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time not a charm”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler852
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Grand Wailea. The summer season was packed with kids (yes, we have two of them ourselves), a bit stressful for me personally. With taxes, daily fees, and valet parking, we paid close to $700 a night, for this price, I expected top notch service and friendly courtesy from the staff, which was totally lacking. I often felt that their service was heavily motivated by tips. Upon check-in, we went to the pool desk to get towels, and was immediately being lectured by the staff there that if we left our belongs un-attended for more than an hour, our things would be removed, and we have to get them at lost and found. This resort is huge, it is easy to be away for longer than an hour. Luckily, we quickly found this to be an empty threat. We couldn't find available beach chairs, and couldn't locate anyone to help us gather chairs together, we walked all over the pools, finally decided to sit separetly. The most relaxing moment for me was swimming at night at their adult pool. The pool closes at 10PM. Yet, there were no beach towels out for the guests at night. We had to call house keeping to bring us towels, and it took them 20 mins. We had dinner at their Humu restaurant. I actually really enjoyed the dinner, it was delicious. But again, the service was lacking. Our waiter had the poker face on all night. It seemed that he did not want to work that night. For such a high priced resort, I had expected more than just a water park.

Reviews.Title: “You'll pay the price for the best.”
Reviews.Author: ThreeVirgos
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Grand Wailea is definitely an experience. The grounds are phenomenal, the rooms are gorgeous and the staff is helpful and will do just about anything for their guests. The pools are spectacular. This resort is just about perfect. My family (2 kids ages 6 and 9) had a great time. However, perfection comes with a price. A standard mixed drink at the pool and lobby bar was $14.00. Regardless of price, if you are hanging out at the pool and use the slides from pool to pool, one should invest in the cool plastic Pineapple container for your drinks ($21.00 initially and $14.00 for cocktail refills). It has a handy sealed lid to keep your drink somewhat safe as you slide from pool to pool or if you drink too much. Once you get home, the pineapple doubles as a piggybank for the kids or your next trip back to the Grand Wailea. The Spa Grande is one of the nicest spas I have ever been to. The Terme baths are unique! Here's the stuff you may or may not care to know: The daily resort fee was $20.00 plus valet parking is mandatory at the resort at an additional $25.00 per day...not to mention every time you want your car, you have to fork over more money for a tip for the valet. Our room contained a king size bed and a pull out couch for the kids. The first night we had to put sheets on the pull out couch. Fortunately, the sheets and blanket were neatly sealed in a box in the closet. I am not super high maintenance but it would have been nice for the staff to recognize our reservation would be using the pull out couch and prepared accordingly for our arrival. The bed for my husband and I was super comfortable and we slept well but the mattress topper had obviously hills and valleys in it which to me indicates wear. Again, I am not the type who is going to demand for my bed to be ergonomically redesigned for my liking on vacation, so I just dealt with it. Other than my small complaints, The Grand Wailea is awesome. The Grand is not necessarily for those who are frugal like myself. However, I work hard and play even harder so the expense of staying at the Grand Wailea was completely justified in my eyes. I will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and what a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? 25 dollars a day for compulsory parking, no free refills of water in fridge, no free bottles of water in the gym, charging for beach umbrellas, rude reception staff, rude valet staff, rip off prices in all eating establishments, non plussed managers - I could go on. I would class myself as a seasoned traveller and I would never recommend this hotel at all. The Four Seasons down the road was far superior, and quite rightly is top of the trip advisor listings. I'm not too sure why I am paying 500 dollars a night here, but I am here on a family holiday, that I did not book. It's about Motel 6 standard.

Reviews.Title: “Too busy for us”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand wailea in august. The room we rented was a 1bedroom suite which is quite a hike to the pools with small kids 5 and 8. The rooms need renovating and agree with other reviews. Get there early to get a pool chair . Overall the resort would be fine for family with teenagers or perhaps a couple but for us too many people.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: GarlowFamily
Reviews.Content: Sitting at breakfast on our last morning, I asked the family (husband, kids 6,13,14 and grandma) where they wanted to go next year. The response was unanimous: "Can we come back here?" This from a family who never wants to visit the same place twice! We spent nearly a week at the GW, and from start to finish it was a great experience. We are Diamond Members and booked two rooms--one on points, the other we paid for. We arrived late and our rooms were ready and our childen enjoyed the lei greeting. The rooms were spacious, and kept clean, with no maintenance issues whatsoever. The beds were wonderful, among the best I have ever had in a hotel, with great pillows. One room was Deluxe Ocean View, the other Ocean View and I honestly couldn't tell the difference in the views. We were not in the Napua Tower and honestly didn't miss its amenities. The dining room food for breakfast was excellent - though I wished they opened at 6 instead of 7 -- something about Hawaii made us awake each day at 5:30 or so. Bistro Molokini was okay, though a pricey lunch option. Cafe Kula left something to be desired--across the board the staff working the morning shift was grumpy and unhelpful. The pool chairs thing IS a drag, but with a pool that amazing you can see why people line up to get their place in the shade. Our last day my husband rented a cabana -- we've also decided this will be an annual tradiiton to end vacations in style. The extra chairs, extra shade and extra service were absolutely worth the price, especially given the size of our group. Snorkeling right off the beach at the hotel was great - as was kayaking, paddleboarding, boogie boarding and just plain beach time. The sand was the nicest I have ever had at a hotel. Soft, even on the floor of the ocean. The package rentals from the beach are great - especially since you can decide what you want to do whenever, and aren't locked into hauling around the gear. The spa was great. Best Couples Massage ever. The Terme was also great, and I only wish I'd had more treatments! It was sad to leave, but we've already started to look at when we can come back -- and how we can stay longer for our second trip!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service at a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Logan_Logan_79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property and decided to bravely bring our infant daughter with us. From the moment we stepped off the plane and were greeted at the airport (unknowing that the hotel had sent a driver to pick us up) to the time we left, it was a great experience. When we arrived at the hotel around 3pm, our room was not ready but the front desk staffed offered for us to have a complimentary lunch by the pool so that definitely worked for us!. Within an hour, the front desk called and said that our suite was ready. When we entered our sweet, my wife yelled "oh my god" as it was approximately 2000 sq ft and had 3 balconies and definitely plenty of room to accommodate our 3 month old's crib, etc. The meals at the hotel were consistently of high quality and the pool was warm enough so that we could bring our daughter in the pool each day. Despite not having a car, there was plenty to do on site or within walking distance (shops of Wailea, the beach, pools, etc.) Even after we left, the staff was able to track down a white pullover that was left behind and it was sent to us in Chicago within a few days. We were using hilton diamond free night certificates so we weren't sure how we would be treated - and our expectations were certainly exceeded. Thank you to everyone at the property from hotel manager through the front line staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pools define this place”
Reviews.Author: smopart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for 3 nights for a wedding after staying at the Honua Kai for 3 nights first. We have two small boys( 4 months old and 3 years old). The entrance to the hotel is breathtaking with the amazing waterfalls. We were greeted by Rose with leis each time we arrived. She was very friendly with the kids. Check in was very quick. We were given an early check in and a free upgrade. The rooms were average. The balcony area was big and very nice and the bathroom were very big and recently renovated. The room itself was a bit dated with older carpet and tiles. The bed was very comfortable. Maid service and turndown service was good. Concierge was not very helpful in giving us advice on places to go. The breakfast buffet was good. Got takeout from Humu one night and thought it was excellent. Also went to the food court at Cafe Kulu in the resort which was convenient The Valet parking was mandatory and the drivers were in a rush to accomodate all the cars. One time, they started driving off before I even got one of my sons out of the car and almost ran over my foot. Needless to say we did not pay for parking during our stay. They do provide 2 bottles of water each time they get the car. This resort, however, is worth every penny because of the amazing grounds with art and sculptures and the MAGNIFICENT pools. The pools are quite elaborate with one pool leading to another and connected by slides. Also had whitewater currents leading to the lazy river. Water elevator was neat. Kids beach area and rope swing were nice touches. It is difficult to get seating and you do need to go at 7 AM to reserve a chair. Shops at Wailea were conveneint. Went to Island Burger one night. Went to a friends wedding at the Four Seasons which was right next door. 5 minute walk along the beach. The pool area there paled in comparison but I am sure the rooms and service were great. Overall we loved our stay because of the great views, beautiful property, and world class pools

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dsbVoorhees
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The grounds are spectacular. The beach and pools are fantastic. The service is first class. We stayed for 10 days in the Napua Tower. The cost is high, but continental breakfast and evening cocktails and light food are included. Perfect for a family. Tough to get a chair by the pool in the late morning, but no problem in the afternoon. We sat on the beach in the morning. Easy to get chairs and umbrellas set up by the beach staff. Rented a cabana by the pool one day. Cost was $300. Included 8 beach chairs and light food and drinks throughout the day. Nice if you can splurge. Food was pricy but good throughout the resort. Shopping and restaurants less than 5 minutes away. Teenage daughters absolutely loved the pools and beach. May not be the perfect location for a couple looking for peace and quiet, but wonderful for any family. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Need to take the Kids”
Reviews.Author: Pixtonian
Reviews.Content: We had a great time wo the kids but would love to take them next time we go. Everything was amazing. We rented a jeep and went driving all over this trip since we didn't have the kids but the hotel has everything to just stay there and relax and enjoy. I took a scooter dive right from the beach and saw plenty of turtles some white tip sharks and some big eels. I highly recomend you take advantage of the water sports while at the resort. The spa was amazing as well. We are going back for sure. We hope to make this a yearly thing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel stay at Maui”
Reviews.Author: BlingMalaysia
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great! You can rent car from Budget. There a counter at the hotel lobby but they closed after 5pm. Thus, is better for your to do your online book before you arrive at the hotel There's shopping mall within 5 min walk from hotel. But all of them are luxury brands like LV, Gucci , Coach. There's a ABC Store there too where you can shop for snakcs & mineral water.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea is bankrupt and it shows!!”
Reviews.Author: Cowbell2011
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the worst vacation of my life thanks to the Grand Wailea. I had high expectations for this place based on reviews and reputation but was poorly disappointed from the moment I checked in. The staff: The front desk staff were rude upon check in and didnâ€™t even provide directions to the room which felt like it was a mile from the entrance. It wasnâ€™t until the last day I was told I could valet park at the convention center for easier access to the roomâ€¦ The rooms: The first night of sleep was interrupted by a bed that smelled like the previous guest had sweated out the bedding. Also, the air conditioning was pumping out a damp mildew smell. The overall condition of the room was poor and run down. The bathroom tiles were moldy and there was hair all over the place. I asked for a new room and was treated as if I was inconveniencing the hotel. I never received an apology and had to wait hours for a new room. On day 2, I found an enormous cockroach in my shoes that I had placed in the closet!!! GROSS!!!! Yes, I expect roaches in Hawaii, but NOT at a Waldorf Astoria Resort. Again, I didnâ€™t receive any apologies. The front desk said cockroaches were something they couldnâ€™t control and offered to have the room sprayed for bugs. After the room was sprayed, I found 2 more roachesâ€¦ The Pool: This place felt like a low end Disneyland Resort. The pool was over crowded, there are kids running/screaming everywhere, there are more guests than pool chairs to go around, the pool bathrooms smelled like sewage, and if you want anyone to help you find a chair at the beach you have to have cash ready to tip. Otherwise you can rent cabanaâ€™s for $500 a day. The cabanaâ€™s of course sit vacant and the lounges are never released for people who canâ€™t find a place to sit at the pool.
