The staff do not follow up on there â€œone hour chair policyâ€� at all. The Parking: The only parking option is valet at $25 a day. Itâ€™s not the cost that is an issue itâ€™s the inconvenience of not being able to easily get your car when you need it. The valets are overworked and it takes like 20 minutes to get your car. The Food: I expected the food to be expensive but I didnâ€™t expect it to taste so bad. The food was like something from a junior high cafeteria. Your best bet is to eat at local establishments like Merrimans, Mamaâ€™s, and MonkeyPod. Even the sandwich I got at Subway was better than the food I ordered from Grand Waileaâ€™s room service. Fitness Center: This is the only redeeming quality of the entire resort. There was plenty of equipment and lots of if! Bottom Line: Donâ€™t listen to the 5 star reviews. Take your money to either the Grand Hyatt in Kaanapali or the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. You will be glad you did! ps. The Grand Wailea actually is in chapter 11 bankruptcy court. Had I known that I would have booked my vacation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Eagles2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea after staying at the Sheraton Maui the week before. I have to say that this hotel far exceeded any expectations I had. The hotel, grounds, pool, and beach are all breathtaking. We stayed in the Napua Tower and if you can afford the extra money, I would definitely recommend it. You make up the difference with the free breakfast and drinks and appetizers every night. The food was outstanding. If you are looking for a place to relax as a couple, this might not be the place. They do have an adult only pool, but the pools with the waterslides get pretty wild. The one complaint I have is the race to the pool every day to get a chair. You have to pay a hefty sum to rent a cabana or casabella, or else you are in a race to find a chair. We did the rental to avoid the headache after reading the reviews. If you decide to do the rental, I would recommend doing it ahead of time as they rent out quickly. Our kids are older, but the hotels provides plenty of activities for the younger ones. Service is outstanding. When we were directed to the tower to check in, we were greeted by name and a cold drink. The guy that brought the bags to our room even knew we were from the Dallas area and commented on how hot it had been there. We were impressed. Asked for extra towels the first day and they replaced them twice a day from there on out. We also spent some time at the Spa Grande. It was obvious why they are one of the top spas in the country. If you are coming to Hawaii with your family, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: sosbh97
Reviews.Content: Its been several years since we stayed at the Grand Wailea and it once again met all of our expectations. Our daughters are older now (17 and 12) and were able to enjoy the pools and slides on their own allowing my wife and myself time to our selves. The service was great and the rooms and common areas are all kept up. We had a noise problem with our neighbors in the next room the first two mornings. After complaining, we were moved from a partial to a full ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to relax and recharge your batteries.”
Reviews.Author: Mauigirl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend at the Grand Wailea. What a weekend it was. The grounds are so beautiful. Its like a nature hike with a bonus of tropical flowers and plants. The room was very nice, lots of room to relax, sitting on the balcony watching the weddings from the Hawaiian Wedding chapel was special. The ocean view of Molokini was great, the over view of the property and also people watching is always fun. The staff at the hotel are very nice and always looking for someway to make your stay more enjoyable. We live on the other side of the island, but it was so nice to be pampered for the weekend. All of Maui is so beautiful and staying at the Grand Wailea they take many flavors of the island for us to enjoy at their resort. We will definately be back to stay at this resort if just to relax and recharge our batteries.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: cassie_keating
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel we would stay at on a regular basis, but after just getting back from a deployment it was a much needed getaway. My husband and I were so in aw of the place we only ventured into the rest of Maui 2 out of the 5 days we were there and we weren't away from the hotel for more than 5hrs! When we checked into the resort some of the first things you see are beautiful statues, fountains and flowers everywhere. Our room had a very updated fresh feeling and I was absolutely envious of the bathroom which was large with a separate shower and tub. The resort sits on the beach which is only for the resort guests, you can see the islands of Lanai and Molokai from the beach. A large water play area that has water slides, a mini lazy river, a swim up pool bar, a large swimming pool, a separate pool for adults only, a shallow area for small children, and the only water elevator in the world. The resort puts on luau's in the evening. There is a large round bar in the main entry way of the resort. There is a babysitting service, the cleaning service was on point and really took care of us. There is a church on the property and many cabanas to reserve. Just walking around the resort with the beautiful scenery and landscaping is very relaxing, so many pictures were taken of my husband and I out and about in the resort. The resort is very pricy but we purchased it in a packaged deal that included our flight from where we lived on Oahu to Maui and the rental car, so the overall price was much better than doing it all separate. The food options were plentiful but can of course get pricey. There are clothing, jewelry and other shopping available. There is a spa but I did not go. This is definitely a place to go if you want to treat yourself or someone you love, to have a honeymoon or wedding or just a really great relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Joyglo
Reviews.Content: Everything is great here!!!! We can see the Molokini island from our room which is wonderful.. Beautiful room, great pools, nice breakfast, marvelous view... So perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Tex5555
Reviews.Content: First impression of the Grand Wailea was, well, Grand. The awesome gardens, waterfalls hit you right when you enter the property for the first time and the great service and awe inspiring suroundings of the entire 40 acres just never disappointed. Stayed in the Chapel wing on the ground floor and got the best of both worlds........Probably closest rooms to the beach in the whole place with the lanai looking out over a koi pond, the chapel, beautiful lush landscaping. Just a perfect, wonderfully quiet room. Beach area was crowded, but it didn't bother us one iota. Saw some cool sea turtles while snorkeling right off the rocks on the left side of the cove in front of the Grand Wailea. Great, great place. We did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: hawntraveler
Reviews.Content: It had been several years since I stayed at the Grand Wailea and I was excited when I had the opportunity to return last March. The drive from Kahului airport to Wailea was a familiar site -- and breeze with the added lanes on both sides of the main highway. Pulling up to the hotel, I was delighted to see the bougainvillea and the tropical trees still lining the main entrance. But if it wasn't for the stationary, I probably wouldn't have noticed that the hotel is now a part of the Waldorf Astoria family. I had to flag down a bellman to assist with my luggage. I guess I looked like the type to carry my own bags. The doorman offered me a valet ticket -- and asked if I was staying or just visiting. I thought the two were one and the same, so I said, "Yes." He then clarified his question to be, "Are you just having lunch?" I replied that I was staying for a few days. I asked about self parking and was informed that the hotel no longer offers self parking. All cars are parked by a valet -- whether you enter the main entrance or the group entrance. Interesting, I thought: No options. The front desk was busy as expected, but the agent made me feel welcome and greeted me with a warm smile and a cheerful "aloha!" Within minutes, I was given my room key and was pointed in the right direction. As I had stayed at the hotel before, I knew my way around and was aware that certain rooms were farther away from the lobby than others. Then again, not everyone is heading to the lobby in the morning -- so farther away isn't always a bad thing. The staff will offer you a map -- not that you can change your room at any given time. But at least you'll have an idea how far away you are from the restaurants and pools. My room was techinically in the Molokini wing. Some of the rooms there are frightful. You can be in a mountain category and actually looking out at the group entrance. Depending on who's staying at the hotel (i.e. a large convention), the noise from the buses at all hours can be annoying. But I was lucky and had a room facing the garden area within the hotel. My room wasn't too far from the elevators -- which was a good choice on a business trip. If I was on a romantic getaway, I would definitely request something away from the elevators. People tend to chat alot when they stand in front of the elevators. Don't know why. I think they might be talking about the weather (and how beautiful Maui is!). The room had two full beds, was adequate in size, and was clean. There was a balcony/lanai -- but everyone from the Cafe Kula would look at me whenever I went outside. I didn't utilize room service -- which I told took awhile. I dined at Cafe Kula almost every morning -- mainly because of its close proximity to my room. For dinner and lunch, I dined off property. The pool and the Spa were my two favorite places to run off to. The slides at the pool are too much fun. There are different slides in different parts of the pool. Some for little kids, some for big kids. But definitely a fun place to be. The Spa speaks for itself. One of the best worldwide. I did have time to head out to the beach one day. The water was tranquil, cool, and refreshing. Everyone was glad to be on Maui. And as I mentioned, this was back in March. The night the sirens went off and everyone was headed for higher ground...

Reviews.Title: “Unique and amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Sas0920
Reviews.Content: I was simple blown away by this beautiful property. When you arrive people are so gracious. The hotel is open roof of lobby with beautiful birds everywhere but a little annoying near breakfast area. The room was gorgeous, big, clean, great linens. Reasturants at the hotel didn't thrill me but great places were just a quick drive away. The grounds were gorgeous! Gardens an pool was just breath taking. The beach spoke for itself by far the bluest water I have ever seen. I have nothin bad to say it was truly an amazing place I will go back there if I ever go to Hawaii in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Has Gone Downhill Since I was there 8 years ago”
Reviews.Author: TeriTravels74
Reviews.Content: The best parts of The Grand Wailea? The Pools, the impressive lobby entrance, and the spa. The beach is nice as well, and this hotel is located right next door to "The Shops at Wailea" which is very convenient! The gym is great - it has everything you could want, although it be nice if there was a view of something (other then the basement.) The downside for me is that this resort has lost some of it's glory over the last ten years - I think the recession has had an impact. The corridors are showing a lot of wear and tear, and the rooms definitely need some TLC. (There were nicks in the paint all over the room, the bathroom had chips in the tile, etc.) It just is starting to look old. For a place that will charge you $20 for a poolside cocktail and $500-$700 a night for a room, I expect a little more. The service is still great, no complaints there although we did not eat in any of the restaurants except at lunchtime. Poolside the service seems to be a little slower, not as many staff members to take your order. Overall I don't think I would go back - I think there are better resorts in Maui for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach and Pool”
Reviews.Author: ZorroMerion
Reviews.Content: Hotel and beach are awesome. If only they could figure out the chair scene at the pool and beach and not make everyone crazy about reserving chairs before 8am, this place would be the best hotel. The one hour rule on chairs doesn't work. Kids are out of control near the waterslides. But even with these minor flaws, the place is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation ever! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Soccerbunny99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! When you get there, you see lots of waterfalls, colorful flowers, and trees. Then the bell hop comes and takes your luggage and a staff member greets you with a warm aloha and a lei. When you check in, they have water and a pinaple mango fruit juice. On the counter they have fresh fruit that is chilled. We got a complimentary upgrade,to a high floor. Then the bell hop told us how to get to the beach, pool, back to the lobby, concierge, etc. The bell hop walks you to your room! We stayed in the deluxe ocean front on the 8th floor and the view was breath taking. The shower is glass, big tub, nice rug under the sink, a mini room with a door and phone for the toilet, and a large sink space. The carpet is clean and the sheets are as white as fresh fallen snow. You have a large deck...and I'm pretty sure everybody has a large deck because you can see all the towers from the beach/pool. The maid gave us extra towels (by request), because they don't give you a lot of towels. The pool is amazing, which includes a lazy river, water falls, slides, a volleyball net, a hot tub, and the worlds only water elevator! The beach is the best part. With pure white sand, lots of umbrellas and chairs, and clear turquoise water. The water is nice, but can get very wavy so be careful. I recommend getting a tube or raft because it's relaxing. We kayaked and the sights were beautiful. We rented a car and had an ant problem on the road to Hana, but had all $230 COMPED! When we rented one a second time, they said they had inspected it and no ants. Also, when we picked up our second rental, we did not see that car there. The hotel is beautiful and outdoors, which makes it that much better. The staff is friendly and service is great. It's a very clean hotel and we actully saw the janitor vacuuming the light and cleaning the elevator buttons! The breakfast buffet was fresh and we looked for it everyday. Somedays, when we wanted breakfast my husband went down to cafe' kula and brought back muffins, croissants, coffees, cereal, etc. The food is amazing. Our favorite resturaunts there was Bistro Molokini and Humahumanukanukaapuwa'a. I would suggest doing the road to Hana-only if you don't get car sick, a helicopter ride, and black sand beaches, waterfalls, etc. We were so sad to leave, even after 14 days. We are already planning our return trip, not only to Maui, but to the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined the wedding”
Reviews.Author: sad_11
Reviews.Content: We attended a family wedding at the Grand Wailea recently and it was an incredible disappointment! Weeks would go by without a return phone call from our wedding coordinator. Our emails were ignored. NO customer service at all. When we requested that Gail, the Director of Weddings contact us, we were told she was â€œoff islandâ€� and could not be reached. No one, including Mr. Bailey, the Resort Manager, ever returned our phone calls. Debbie, the "Senior Catering Manager" coordinated the wedding day and reception. She was disorganized and emotionally stressed from day one. After the ceremony, the guests were invited to the cocktail hour for appetizers and drinks. The beautiful Boterro Bar was empty! The coordinator completely forgot to set up the cocktail reception! No dÃ©cor, no staff to attend to the guests for over an hour! If you are planning a special event or a once in a lifetime wedding, go to the Four Seasons or another 5 star resort in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: annmurphy2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Son's wedding which was held at the chapel at the Grand Waiela. This hotel was incredible. The service was wonderful and the amenities were awesome. The pool and beach are the best in Maui. Our 10 year old loved the waterslides at the hotel. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else. One word describes our trip - fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best beaches ever and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Dunecoon
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon for about a week. It was sad to leave the place. We really lived it up even though the place is fairly expensive. We were planning on splurging so it was guilt free. I would definitely recommend it. Maui is a great island. Beaches are diverse and beautiful. This resort is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. The lobby itself is a piece of art. We were in awe for a few days. The food was excellent everywhere. Even though each meal can end up being 100/person. The all inclusive is probably worth it if you don't plan on leaving the resort much. Outside options are good too but everything is a drive away or a cab ride and can get even more expensive. The breakfast is excellent at Longhis in the mall next door. Next time I will probably take the all inclusive if they still offer it. Room service was great and quick. Rooms are nice but not spectacular. You probably won't spend much time in them. We were in the pool all day or in the ocean. Snorkeling is great right off the hotel and paddle boarding is one of the best inventions ever. We always compare everywhere we stay now to this hotel. We have been to one other comparable place now, Secrets Maroma Beach in Playa Del Carmen/Cancun. The daily resort charge is always a bummer but it seems to be getting very common nowadays. Doesn't seem like a big deal once you look at the total cost though and that's what they expect of you.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Vacation, Great Property and Service”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttG
Reviews.Content: If you are a Hilton Diamond Member using points, be prepared to use quite a few points. For us it was worth it! Here's a tip - when you book your reservation, prior to your travel you will get a 2nd email from hotel with an area to submit an upgrade request. We used that link to upgrade, for free, to the Napua Tower. The Napua Tower is like the Executive Level. They have a good breakfast in the morning and appetizer in the evening. The service is great. House Keeping did a great job and our room was very clean. Another Tip - At The Whaler's General Store in The Shops at Wailea (a short drive/walk from the Hotel) you can pick up some reasonably priced snacks, drinks and deli. I was surprised the prices on most items were cheaper than the local super markets in Kihei. Finally, the greeter at the front (Rose Sumibcay) was very cool. She was very kind and engaging and my 9 year old daughter looked forward to seeing her everyday to "talk story". Solid Vacation --- Hope to be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Its a hude Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvrao
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 21st June to 23rd,2011 Its a huge hotel, located at south of Mauii, one hour drive from kapalua West mauii airport, It has fantastic staff, beautiful ambience. good for people who likes to be in crowd, its has a strict valet parking policy,

Reviews.Title: “This was our first time at the Grand Wailea and we had a blast for 10 days.”
Reviews.Author: afsanehm
Reviews.Content: My kids loved the greeting and attentiveness of the lei greeters with flowers each evening. my daughter was in love with one of the hotel employees Rose Sumibcay who was always smiling and offering her flowers for her hair each evening. Rose even knew my daughter's first name, she went far beyond her our expectations of hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Are saving up to go again next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: csaszarl
Reviews.Content: Wow! Okay, in short - this place is the "Atlantis in the Bahamas" equivalent in Maui! If you and your family enjoy water slides, a rope swing into the pool, rapid rivers that glide you along the pool's path, and water volleyball, with a great beach and great views, not to mention fabulous comfortable and plush rooms, go here .... The pool water was very comfortable - so much so that we didn't want to get out of the water. My family and I did not initially intend on staying here due to the high price point but switched to this hotel because we weren't happy at our original choice in Lahaina. I really didn't care that it was twice as much because the smile on my daughter's face the entire time was totally worth it! Honestly, apart from the cost nothing bad to say .....

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not sure its worth the cost!!!!”
Reviews.Author: swissmiss3913
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Wailea with seven adults and six kids. This wasnt our first time here but since we last stayed at this hotel the prices have gone up considerably. Food is outrageous, eight dollars for a shaved ice, six dollars for a small bag of popcorn? The food onsite isnt even that good. Pool side service was poor. took twenty minutes to get our food and then didnt get all of it. Food choices were limited. Now for the pool itself. Very nice, kids and adults loved it. Now for the bad. They dont have enough umbrellas, I had to get up at six thirty everyday to stand in line for a spot with an umbrella. Getting shady seats is a cutt throat business here. Parking is all done by valet now. Every time we needed our car we waited at least ten minutes and one time canceled the request and ended up walking because it took so long. We also stayed at the Hyatt at Kaanapali and I have to say I think I enjoyed that much better. Sorry Grand Wailea. Your prices are outrageous and I dont think I will be back. Ironically, I can easily pay for this hotel but I just cant justifiy the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Dredawn9
Reviews.Content: I am so sad to be sitting back at home. I keep having visions of looking out from the balcony on my 9th floor room at the hotel. I was there on a girls trip with 5 others and we had co-joining rooms. I don't think they intentionally gave us co-joining rooms, but it definitely made our overall experience a million times better!! I loved the pool with the mini waterfall. The staff were great too. The only thing that was a bit annoying was they were crazy about making sure you had the bracelet on if you were at the pool. Their bar makes it seem like you are on a cruise ship... You will understand if you sit there and look around you!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow.”
Reviews.Author: Frangela625
Reviews.Content: From the resort grounds to our room, we loved our stay at the Grand Wailea during our honeymoon. The hotel offers every amenity you could imagine, and that forced us to relax, which we both needed! The spa was unbelievable; I wish I could spend every day there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pool resort”
Reviews.Author: longboard
Reviews.Content: We are actually waikiki people but were in Maui for a wedding, so we stayed 3 nights at the GW. Our last trip was about 8 years ago. We dined at Humu and Tommy Bahamas and did the Luau. Positives, big WOW factor, great pools, the slides were fun, we liked the swim up bar, the grounds were fabulous, room was good- we got a nice upgrade. We found the staff, particulary the bartenders engaging. It is nice to have a pool on the beach level. Humum is awsome, just what you would expect in Hawaii. Negatives, awfully big and the bermuda glass killed me, there were a lot of families- I am fine with the kids but the helicopter moms drive me nuts- you really do not need to reserve 6 chairs when your kids will be in the pool all day. Luau was good as far as service but I have seen better shows, maybe that is what they do in Maui these days but I prefer the dances of the pacific over the rain and volcanoe dances, I miss the tahiti girls, they did have a good fire dancer. Overall- He toured the 4 seasons but found it too high end, I think we had a better time at the GW. If you want the classic Maui pool resort this seemed about as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND Prices but not GRAND Service”
Reviews.Author: kenarsen
Reviews.Content: We checked in were not greeted by anyone. Eventually a nice lady pointed us to the concierge tower. We went up and elevator with our own bags and waited behind a locked door before the concierge (who was great) greeted us. In our room the view was nice and room was ok. What was lacking was the service....we were paying $800 per night for the club level and were extremely let down by the service. We also thought the property and pool felt like being at Disneyland....not the place you want to go while on a relaxing Hawaii vacation. The place was so big we had to take 2 elevators to the beach and walk about 1/5 of a mile. We ended leaving after the first night and checking into the Fourseasons next door and had and amazing experience for the next 12 nights! The 2 hotels are not even comparable and the only thing in my mind they had in common was they shared the same beach. I am sure this hotel might be a good fit for some but I would advise you to do your research before staying.... KA

Reviews.Title: “Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: MauiSuffern
Reviews.Content: For those of you who may have doubted the existence of the garden of eden, doubt no more! To find paradise book a flight (NOT CONTINENTAL!) to The Grand Wailea in Maui Hawaii. Adam and Eve may not have been there, but Roy and Lois sure were and we loved every second of it!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: keala5937
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful.The grounds and swimming pools are well maintained and fun for the kids and adults. The only downside are the restaurants, which are limited. The prices were high, but the quality of the food just average. We found better dining options at other nearby hotels, which were also pricey, but the food was excellent. Otherwise, we had a fun vacation and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It was the most awesome place ever”
Reviews.Author: LisaGreen2011
Reviews.Content: The room, pools were terrific. Our favorite part was coming back to the resort (which we hardly ever left) and the Lei Greeter Rosanna Sumibcay (Rose) was so wonderful. My 9 year old daughter fell in love with her and was always asking where she was if she was not on duty. Rose made us feel so welcome and she is truly the first person you would want to see that sets the tone for a great stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A tough call”
Reviews.Author: zacaramarketing
Reviews.Content: This property is clearly gorgeous but very very big! The pricing is what the pricing is and I feel that if you stay here you should have known that going in and thus you are not allowed to complain. I found the staff to be very pleasant individually but something just doesn't click here? It may be that it is so large that it all just doesn't connect, or come together as complete. The grounds are spectacular and easy to navigate, just be prepared to walk. Take in all that is around you, there is plenty to look at! The pool area was crowded but it was not a problem finding chairs, even after 11:00 am. There is limited space around any pool no matter how big, if you want to be pool front get up and get out! There was lovely lawn area with plenty of chairs and it was just fine and a short walk to the pools...just wear your flip flops, as the walkway is sooo hot! Not the GW's fault! The beach is shared by 3-4 hotels and, though lovely, it is not huge and it gets packed!!! We went into the ocean but parked ourselves by pool and lawn. We ate at Humu and the pool area restaurant. Humu, with the $40 coupons was a fairly reasonable value and a great atmosphere. We had 3 rooms so we had $120 worth of coupons. Our dinner for 6, after coupons, was just over $200! This included some apps and drinks. Don't drink as much as us and use your free drink coupons with dinner, not before, and it is even less! We all felt it very good. The pool area food and bar was as expected, just fine. My daughter loved the spa treatment and, again after using the 20% off coupon, thought it was reasonable at about $125 for a 50 minute message and one hour use of other facilities included. The gym was large and we were there at peak time and waited for no machine. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. We were in the back building and on the 6th floor and had a great view! I liked the bed though others with us thought they were to soft. If you take the down mattress cover off, or ask housekeeping to, it will be more firm. One thing to note, the lovely bathrooms were adorned with a throw rug that had no rubber backing in front of the sink!!! REMOVE IT if they have not yet changed them all out. I took a pretty good fall, after ignoring a slip or two prior. I was lucky to only twist my ankle and bruise my elbow pretty good- enough to miss my scheduled golf event with son. I can only imagine if it was someone older or less able to control the fall. I mentioned this to front desk and though my rug was immediately changed out to one with rubber backing the other two rooms we had were not! I was clearly not the first by the look on the faces of those I mentioned it to. Though I was looking for nothing, I was surprised by the apparent lack of concern when discussed with security. Would I stay again, yes I would. It was a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Spectacular 8 days at the Grand Wailea Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HalSR
Reviews.Content: What an experience that exceeded our expectations!! This first started at the front desk where everyone that was not busy gave us a big Aloha! We stayed in the Napua Tower overlooking the main pool and ocean. The room was big enough for two adults and two teenagers, a little tight, but it worked. I had to work by computer many mornings, and I found a favorite table and chair to plug in my computer (wifi all over the hotel) and get right to work. I did not have to disturb my family which they very much appreciated. Part of the service of the Napua tower included continental breakfasts which included fresh fruit, bagels, toast, pastries, eggs, juices, etc. We really loved the breakfasts (I like really hot water for my tea, and one of the staff knew my routine by the second day and immediately brought me a cup of steaming hot water from the pantry each morning). The food never ran out. In addition, we loved the Aloha cheerfulness of the staff. This included staff from nearly ever department. The Bistro Molikini is the place for lunch, and my wife and I ate at the bar a couple of times, and you could really tell Shane, the bartender, enjoyed giving great service to his guests! I worked out everyday at their gym (there was never a wait to use any of the equipment, aerobic or weight resistance machines and free weights), and the Bell staff always had something nice to stay as I passed them on the way to or from the gym. One night, we ate at the Humuhumunukunukuapuaâ€™a and had a delightful evening! Both the service and food were superb. The bartender served us among the best Mai Tais we have ever tasted. We will go back just for them. This was our third stay at the Grand Wailea, and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: brandy97_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. It was beautiful! The open air lobby makes such a wonderful entrance. The hotel is awesome. Great views, fun pools! Great drinks at pool bar. We stayed there for our honeymoon and loved it. Also, it is on the driest part of the island so if it is raining on the other side of the island it is typically sunny at the Grand Wailea. Would highly recommend. The spa was AMAZING! Best spa I have ever been too. The restaurant huma-huma (whatever it is called) wasn't very good and very overpriced. However the breakfast buffet was great. $70 is a little steep for breakfast, but it was a nice treat our first morning there. We discovered the town of Kihea and they had a lot of great restaurants there that were a little more "beachy" and not so upscale, as the Shops of Wailea. We went to an italian restaurant at the Shops called Longhis...and it was one of our best meals in Hawaii. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Badddddd”
Reviews.Author: Cessna414dad
Reviews.Content: Carpets grungy, beds sag and there was fighting over pool/beach chairs. Upon request to get another room for the saggy bed the second room had the same issue. We came down to the beach at around 10. No chairs and probably 20 people waiting. About 20 minutes later brought more chairs and fighting/grabbing occurred because still not enough. Was told they are allowing condo owners across road to use pool. Beach Employee said they have brought this shortage situation up to management but not resolved. I believe it is a deep management problem that is more than specifics. They are full and until they have to change they may not. When I brought it up with office(front desk) manager - he had to ask me what I wanted him to do. Deeeeeepppppp. Again, he probably has been given little training on what to say or do ---- deeeepppp. ---main mgr was not on sight on the day. The office Manager dealing with chair situation called the pool mgr., I guess, because I received a call from pool mgr. ----but the pool mgr was not aware of chair situation that beach employees were experiencing -- got a call from pool mgr 15 minutes saying she said she found 1 chair---the front desk mgr did not relay my need for 4----deeeeeppppppppppp I could tell from all of this that unless you are good about accepting poor performance do not stay here. I travel a lot and stay at hilton garden inns and Marriotts. This was of this not as up to date and clean. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, amazing views, service unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: OutAndAbout7414
Reviews.Content: Stay here! You will not regret it and will most likely start planning your next visit upon leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with lousy attitudes”
Reviews.Author: dbski4it
Reviews.Content: For what this place costs, you would think that the resort would actually try to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Grand-scape of this Wailea Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Just_another_review
Reviews.Content: In reading the reviews, I want to first offer that guests should offer to disclose how one is gauging this property. I will first state: I live VERY comfortably in California. At the age of 47, we have raised our children, enjoyed multiple vacations every year and want for nothing. We are completely content with our lifestyle and would not change a thing. Having said that, HI is a much cheaper vacation for us than what we typically pay at a CA resort. Tax is much lower and food cost is about the same. The Grand Wailea is GRAND...as in BIG...so unless you are an optimistically fit person, it may not be the resort for you. Yes it is a bit of a walk throughout the grounds....the amenities are spaciously designed and placed so that everything is not on top of each other. Perhaps a cruise ship would have been a better choice for those who are not as ambulatory~

Reviews.Title: “Little Things Can Make or Break a Resort Stay, Sadly”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We were next door at the Marriott when my husband decided to switch over to this resort. We stayed for three nights in two adjoining, partial ocean view rooms. The rooms were comfortable, well appointed & completely identical - down to the art work. I would have enjoyed some originality. The macadamia nut crusted mahi mahi with sweet potatoes & something else at Humumhumunukunukuapuaa is one of the best, most atmospheric meals I've ever enjoyed & I can't praise the staff, the locale or the chef highly enough. The spa was nice. My daughter & I both had facials (separately) & both technicians talked to us about wanting to leave Maui during the entire service. I understand island fever, but this was interesting. The big problem that soured me on this property & makes it unlikely that I will return or suggest that people stay here is an issue we experienced on our second day at the pool. My husband had moved this belongings to a poolside chair around 3 pm, folded his shirt, Maui (something) sunglasses, ocean equipment rental pass & room key along with a tee shirt & went into the pool for 20 minutes. When he came out, all was gone. They had left his flip flops & our son's belongings on the chair next door. My husband was frantic. We went to the towel desk. The clerk looked at a chart & told us no pool towel collection had occurred, goodbye. We insisted she ask the towel girl. She called over the towel girl & the very first thing the girl did when asked about our lost items was smirk & deny collecting any towels or belongings. The desk clerk called security at our request & two guys arrived. My husband was quite sure they'd either been stolen or removed by the pool towel person. My husband said then they were stolen. Security said no. I went to the woman sitting next to us & thank heavens, she recalled in great detail that a towel girl had removed my husband's stuff, it bothered her so she noted it, thought it was odd & let it go until we asked her. Security again said not possible, don't get upset, mellow out, this is Hawaii, goodbye. My husband asked if either of them were working today, would they take the time to talk to the woman & they refused. I went to the woman, she went to the security guys, identified exactly who had removed the items - the smirking girl. Then they went through the towels & discovered the items rather carefully placed in the bottom of the towel hamper. Apparently the Maui sunglasses are rather prized over there. There was no apology, just a "oh here they are - funny thing that!" & we were sent on our way feeling very unhappy about the experience. I had been planning a big family reunion for next summer in HI & due to this, I will not be suggesting this property as one where we should stay.

Reviews.Title: “Negative Reviewers are Wrong about this Resort”
Reviews.Author: KnicksFanHou
Reviews.Content: We agonized about staying either here or the Westin in Lahaina, after looking at all the information we decided the Grand Wailea would do the trick. We came here on the second part of our Hawaii trip, the first of which was at Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu which we have already reviewed. The Grand Wailea exceeded all expections and the few most common complaints I read on trip advisor were dead wrong. Debunking Myths: The Pools Close at 10pm not 5pm. The water slides and pools used in the fantastic water slide system close at 5pm however you still have access to the normal pools until 10pm. I am not sure where all these people that say the pools close at 5pm got there information from, this is just totally wrong. The pools in fact were amazing and the waterslides fun for all ages. The property is lovely well maintained with great gardens that you can spend evenigns walking through and taking. There are so many different plants and the sound of the ocean especially at night makes for such a romatic setting. The beach front seems private because generally only hotel guests are making use of it and the service was always prompt and attentive. The rooms were large and spacious with huge bathrooms. Separate shower and tub and toilet room made it feel like home. The balcony facing the gardens and the ocean in the distance created serenity. The bed was comfortable and sleeping at night with the balcony open was wonderfull. The food though expensive was mostly good, however, with a rental car you have many great food options on Kihei, such as Wok Star. The Safeway nearby is great but there is also a Foodland and Times Mart and CVS (Longs Drugs is the trade name, but rest assured it is CVS) are also very close in Kihei the availability of all these stores made the overpriced food not so much of an issue. Kihei Cafe had great French Toast for all the breakfast lovers out there. The one negative that I will agree with is the Valet Parking was overpriced and not worth the service. They have ample parking and should have allowed self park for a nominal fee with optional valet parking. All in all I loved Grand Wailea and Maui and found this resort hotel to meet every expectaton plus, I will stay here again, just for the pools and slides!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Princesita06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea from May 22 to the 28th. It was the 2nd week of our honeymoon (1st was in Honolulu). Fantastic resort, great service and food. Humus restaurant in the resort is AMAZING...if you go between 5-6pm you can get a 2lb lobster for half price....the best lobster I ever had! Lamb and fish also amazing. Bistro Molokini is also very good for lunch and drinks. The poolside restaurant is ok... We got the plastic pineapples to drink out of which saved us a lot of $$! You pay more when you buy them but every time you order a drink they fill the pineapple so you get double the amount of drink for the same price as a regular drink. The shops in the hotel are very cute but some are $$. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse is at the Shops at Wailea (next door to hotel) and is AMAZING! If you like steak and seafood it's a must. Overall the rooms are super clean. We were upgraded to the Napua Tower which is a gated area with extra services. The pools are out of this world! Huge lazy river and also an adults-only pool. Mama's Fish House is a MUST in Maui!! Save room for the lilikoi creme brulee! If you rent a car, you have to pay valet which is 20$ a day, but the valet is excellent and they give you cold water bottles every time! Overall outstanding resort! Saving up to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but with some short comings...”
Reviews.Author: ojycart
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is gorgeous without a doubt. It's also expensive without a doubt. If you were to go to a resort and not planning on really leaving, this would be a good place. The large water park area is a lot of fun and great for playing or relaxing. They have multiple little water slides and a water elevator (must do once). Lazy type river and a side that actually is sand / pool combo. Great for kids. If you want to do things around the Island or do any excursions, I would recommend staying in Lahaina where there are more shops, restaurants and all of the docks for the excursions are. We drove to Lahaina three times and it's 40 minutes each way. We put 600 miles on the car driving around to the different sites and areas over 6 days. I believe the parking is mandatory valet at $25/day. You do get two fresh cold bottles of water in your car everytime you pick it up. The rooms were nice - nothing fancy. The beds were way too soft and after laying in them a bit you start to sink into pits and wake up with sore backs. I loved how they had ice water in dispensers throughout the property and pool area and at the front desk they had a guava pineapple juice set up complimentary. (it went great with my vanilla vodka I had!) Drinks at the pool and bars are minimum $14. Get the plastic pineapple upgrade for $21 then the refills after that are $14 but it appears you get a bigger drink. The restaurants were all good that we experienced. Ate at Huma Huma one night - good food and about $50/person (without drinks). The restaurant at the main dining area was good - we didn't try the buffett. And for quick snacks they had a cafe that was pretty good. The boardwalk along the beach is great and goes on for quite a ways. The beach itself is very nice and you can get the umbrellas and chairs without extra $$. There is a mandatory $20 a day resort fee as well for what I'm not sure. Internet and access to gym? It seems that after paying $600 a night they wouldn't nickel and dime you. For Hilton members....you don't get much in priviledges here. We are diamond members and we did get a late check out at 4:00 and were given a coupon for a restaurant and drinks. they didn't give them to us when we checked in and I had to ask about it a few days later. We also got to check in about 1:00 and got a room upgrade to ocean view. Don't expect the normal free breakfasts! Housekeeping was good and replaced everything whether we needed it or not and the soaps and shampoos are actually really good! We would get ice every day ourselves and housekeeping would dump it out when they came and cleaned but not ever actually fill it up. Until the last day they finally figured it out. (and we tipped her every day even). Staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved that the whole hotel is outdoors and natural air. The rooms themselves didn't really seem to get really cold but it was okay. Beautiful flowers and plants everywhere and the maintenance crews are out in full force making the property sparkle. I probably wouldn't choose to stay here again simply due to the cost and location of the property but it is pretty!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: KAJ2947
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Grand Wailea on June 9th for 5 nights. We were on a HHonors reward vacation and was pleasantly surprised on the â€œextrasâ€� we were given since I am a HHonors Gold member. Thank you Grand Wailea for a wonderful trip including the room upgrade to Napua Tower (which includes continental breakfast and Happy Hour), plus a $40 dinner gift card, and two free drink cards. We very much enjoyed our vacation and didnâ€™t want to leave. The hotel room and grounds were absolutely wonderful. The pool and ocean were the best! We did meet one wonderful person on the staff at the Grand Wailea that went above and beyond. Rose, the lei greeter was simply wonderful from day one welcoming us with a smile (and lei) and making my daughter feel special each time we saw her. My daughter formed a wonderful bond with this very nice woman and wants to go back just to see Rose. Thank you Rose for all you did to make our trip the best it could be! My only complaint during our stay was the recent change to mandatory valet parking. This fee is outrageous at $25/day, plus on the ticket they give you it states the daily fee does not include gratuity. First of all, I personally like the exercise of getting my own car and the Grand Wailea has two large parking garages, so space doesnâ€™t appear to be a shortage. Second, most people only take their car out once, at most two times a day. We personally did only take our car out one time per day during our stay, thatâ€™s $30-35 to move the car one time. I feel you should give people the choice, as Iâ€™m sure there are plenty of people who demand this type of service, but not make it mandatory for those who do not want to participate. This mandatory fee was not presented up front with our reservation, plus our reservation was made so far in advance before they implemented this mandatory fee, the hotel was nice enough to remove it. It appears, similar to the extra fees by the airlines, just another way to increase revenue.

Reviews.Title: “Probably great for kids, but do not honeymoon at this property”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveller015
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, but the hotel itself is pretty dated. I've stayed at nicer rooms at the new Hampton Inn properties for much less money. The property is probably too large for them to offer great service. We started the honeymoon at a 5 star property in Kauai, which set the Wailea up as a disappointment. I would be surprised if this property remained a part of the Waldorf collection much longer.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford a stay, there's no reason not to.”
Reviews.Author: wandererer151
Reviews.Content: First things first, I actually didn't stay here in March 2011, but my exact date wasn't an option. The Grand Wailea should be considered one of the greatest family resorts in the world. I've hit fifteen countries, stayed in hundreds of hotel rooms, but something about this place...it's more than a hotel. It's a world of comfort, excitement, and pleasure. Everything you could ever ask for can be found within the grounds, or a short walk, from your room. I've stayed here twice, both times renting enormous 2-bedroom suites. Both had butler's entrances, so when you order breakfast in bed, they quite literally make the final prep right there in your kitchen. There's so much to be said about this resort, it's nearly impossible to articulate. I went SCUBA diving, snorkeling, surfing, golfing, had countless drinks at the swim-up bar, used the world's only water elevator, rubbed elbows with some celebs, joined the fun of a Luau, and explored the multitude of pools. This place will honestly impress the best travelled souls. I'll stress the family angle, as it's fun for everyone, and travelled families know it. While there are areas designated "Adults Only" the family aspect is all around. I've stayed next door, as well, but The Grand Wailea is still my preference. So as the title goes, if you can afford it, why not?

Reviews.Title: “Large and lovely but I can see where it could be busy and boisterous during high season.”
Reviews.Author: kala327
Reviews.Content: The grounds are large but you get your bearings after a day or two. Don't know what it is like during high season, but it was not a problem to get a pool chair or beach umbrella in May. Was there for business so I can't complain about the cost. The location is wonderful and the ocean walkway was lovely to explore the coastline outside the hotel. The Four Seasons next door looks a bit more refined, but again, this was a business trip so there was no option. The Wailea area of Maui is beautiful and appears to be one of the nicer resort areas on the island (from what I've read), although it is relatively far from Lahaina and some of the other hotel areas such as Ka'anapali. The grounds are lovely and the food is good. I think Humuhumu is a little overrated but it all depends what you are used to and what your tastes are. Customer service all around was stellar. As for "complaints": The walkways outside the rooms are tile and that makes for some noise when luggage is being brought up or down but I suppose that's a small complaint in an otherwise lovely property. Bathroom was spacious, bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. It wasn't as high-end as I expected from Waldorf Astoria, but on the other hand, I appreciated the lower key experience. If I was traveling on my own dime I might not stay there as I could see that if it were filled to capacity it would be akin to a "cruise on land" with lots of groups and kids. It is not a secluded, intimate resort so keep that in mind if you are looking for a more quiet, upscale hotel experience. Overall, a lovely property with lovely service, just I wouldn't let the Waldorf Astoria name fool you as it's not "uber-ritzy".

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort.. couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: MCTravellers23
Reviews.Content: We actually booked the Grand Wailea while in Maui. Our original itinerary was to stay at a resort recommended by our travel agent which we arrived at and we're so unhappy with, we frantically called the Grand Wailea (where we were originally wanted to stay) and hoped they could accommodate us with such short notice. Not only did they accommodate us without any problem, but when I told them the story of why I was booking the same day I would be arriving the agent upgraded our room free of charge! WOW! already an amazing first impression!! The resort and our room were gorgeous, amazing service, food and drinks were excellent, breathtaking beach views, and FUN FUN pools! We loved every minute and every second of being at this resort!! I can't say enough wonderful things about this place and their staff! When I return to Maui in the future, I won't stay anywhere but the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “OMG it's good - can I go back now?”
Reviews.Author: Bagpuss3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, gorgeous building, phenomenal swimming pool, fantastic beach, lovely room, seriously good food... Ahh did I say I enjoyed myself? The staff were very attentive, and the food, even for a big conference, was excellent. Certain of the add-ons were pricey (300$ per day for a cabana?) but a lot was included in the basic price. The micro-climate at Wailea means it never rains. The sea is beautifully warm and the swimming pool complex has plenty of space for kids/kidults with a separate pool complex for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there”
Reviews.Author: Calgariancouple
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVED this amazing hotel!!! The staff is amazing, the room was spacious. The bed OH SO COMFY! Beach is perfect, sunsets here are the best!!!! Best POOLS EVER. And we've traveled lots to know!!! The waterslides are super fun for us 30yr olds who like to be playful. Water elevator - neatO! We loved this hotel and all the people including other tourists. We are sad to be home but the next time we consider Maui we will be staying again at the Grand Wailea. We miss you GW!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: travlinfamCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We returned for the third time to our favorite hotel!!!The pools and slides were so enjoyable. We loved every minute. The beaches are the most beautiful in Maui. The beach chairs and umbrellas are complementary!!!!!Our kids are 8 and 11- they LOVE the pools and slides. The pool surfaces have been updated and the property is immaculate! We had dinner at Humu and enjoyed it very much!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, not for the person looking to do maui on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Theroders3
Reviews.Content: We had done our research and knew this place was not only one of the more expensive, but there were a lot of little charges here and there. If you rent a car, it must be valet parked at a rate of 25.00 a day, and there is also a 20.00 a day resort fee. So you walk in with a 300.00 bill before you get to the room. With all that being said, this was the best vacation our family has ever taken. My seven year old son loved the pools, slides, Tarzan swing, and the awesome water elevator. The beach in front of the resort is amazing also. The days just seemed to run together you were so lost in paradise you began not to know what day it was. We will certainly be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: ebbief
Reviews.Content: After initially being worried about how their bankruptcy would affect our vacation, all our worries were to put rest the minute we pulled up to the Grand Wailea property. The staff (bellmen, front desk, maids, wait staff etc.) that we came in contact with were welcoming, friendly and accommodating. The hotel was gorgeous and well maintained, we found our room to be spacious, clean and comfortable, there were plenty of towels, drinking glasses and toiletries. There was no sign that we could see of any corners being cut with regard to customer service. All the little things were thought of, even down to water bottles placed into our cup holders each time we retrieved our rental car daily. Being a huge resort we thought it would be over run with people but we never felt like we were crowded. The only down side was that food and drinks were a little expensive, but we found that to be the case everywhere we went in Hawaii, we went to Oahu & Kauai also. We enjoyed lunch at Molokini near the adult pool which was good, nice selection of lunch items ; dinner at Huma, also very good fish dishes and had a beautiful view of the sunset, also happy hour drink specials at the bar; and an ala-carte breakfast at the Grand Dining Room which had a great view of the grounds and the beach. The only small complaint, because of its size, we had a bit of a walk to the pool/beach from our room, but we needed the exercise with all the food we ate, so we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: SuperTramp22
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place on the planet and I have been all over the planet! HumuHumu restaurant is some of the best and freshest food ever and unique as well. I would kill to live here, the definition of beauty! Oh and I never wanted to leave the spa!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING resort in beautiful Maui”
Reviews.Author: travelbirds0809
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant to stay here after reading some of the negative reviews, but we had a great time and can't wait to return! Even though there is an adult pool, my husband and I had so much fun at the family pool, that we didn't even venture to the adult pool. The beach area is beautiful, as are the rest of the hotel grounds. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and unlike some other reviewers, we had no problems with the service. The food isn't horrible, but isn't great either. I would suggest going off the resort for at least a couple of meals. We can't wait to return to Maui and would not even consider staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “extra fees”
Reviews.Author: mickviv
Reviews.Content: there are extra fees they won't tell you about until you're stuck with the bill. $20 hotel fee. covers everything except your room rate and parking. to exclude this mandatory fee from the main room rate to look cheaper is just annoying. $25 MANDATORY valet parking. that's right, you don't have a choice. you are required to valet, there is no self-parking. and it's an inconvenience waiting for the valets to get your car. calculate an extra 10 mins for the wait. you will need a wrist band for the pools. all the fun stuff in the pool area ends at 5 which is nonsense since it's Hawaii, it's never cold, the sun doesn't set until 7, and you're paying $20 extra a day for it anyway. birds EVERYWHERE at buffet. they nip at the spoons, food, water. view is nice though. couple other inconveniences I was too lazy to deal with, the room key never worked on the first try. had to rub the strip on my shirt to get it to work, and the frig would make a loud annoying hum sound when the fan was on cooling. I wouldn't stay here again. not saying it was all bad. close beach access, nice pools, clean rooms, close to kihei and shops. but when they say complimentary, you've paid for it somewhere. other than these two charges, the stay was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiDuck
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to any single negative comment about this hotel. I browsed a few of them: "Too much sun at the pool"? "Average food"? "You have to wear a wristband to use the pool"? Who are these sad, little people? If more than usual sun exposure is a concern for you, then please: don't visit a tropical island for your vacation. My wife and I came here on our honeymoon, and we returned for our one year anniversary. When we informed them of this, they gave us an amazing (free) room upgrade and put a bottle of wine and a cheese plate in our room! The thing about the GW is there's NO reason to ever leave the property. You have beautiful beach, SEVEN swimming pools, a pool bar, and incredible restaurants. The layout of the hotel is awe-inspiring as well. Basically everything IS expensive, and it's because you're receiving the best of the best. Just down the beach are two other famous, upscale resorts: The Four Seasons and the Fairmont. While each are also impressive in their own ways, they just don't compare because the pools at the GW are so epic. There's amazing water slides and even a current-driven path that connects one pool to another. You can easily walk to any of the restaurants at other hotels. If you can afford it, why would you stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Not The Grande Dame she used to be...but still the best property on Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: PriniNewportBeach_Ca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married here 16 years ago...unfortunately the exclusivity, unparelled service and great food is no longer part of the experience however the property itself is still unbeatable. We love the Chapel Wing. The lanai's overlook gardens, palm trees, koi ponds and ocean. If you like a more expansive view go to a higher floor in one of the back two wings. The lagoon wing is close to the pools..more convenient if you dont like to walk but louder than the others. The good - Our children loved the slides. We enjoyed the amazing spa - they welcome children. The beach was incredible with chairs and umbrellas. The adult pool was a nice reprieve for us for a few hours. The grounds can't be beat. There is nothing like walking around this property any time of day...it is spectacular! Go to Humuhumu room for cocktails...great place to watch sunset. The bad - service is just so-so. Could not find a decent meal. The Saturday we were there when occupancy went down, many locals showed up at the pools (I think they get a good rate when occupancy is low). The umbrellas, coolers, tupperware, floaties that came with them really put a damper on the atmosphere. They had all of their chairs reserved before 7am,,,first time the whole week we had trouble finding a decent seat and ended up renting a cabana that just came available on our 4th attempt. This was our 3rd time back and we will return again. This property just cant be beat. It is stunning!! We had an amazing time. Check out Four Seasons for sunset cocktails and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort A++!!”
Reviews.Author: laclar
Reviews.Content: Just returned on May 2nd and I must say that I was very impressed with this resort. The rooms are very spacious and beds are extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are very big and ours had a jacuzzi; I'm not sure if they all had. The swimming pools are well situated so that kids stay in one area while adults have their privacy in other swimming pools. The gym is well equip and the spa is world class. The employees were very attentive. Do not miss the Luau and the show; it's very entertaining. Also, Huma Huma restaurant is not to be missed, the food was excellent. On the down side I was not too impressed with the beach. The water was cold and not as clear as I would have expected. The sand on the beach was not soft and powdery. Besides that, this resort gets a AAA plus diamonds for service, food, cleanliness and overall attentiveness. PS if you like running there is a running path next to to beach which takes to through different resorts and the scenery is just breathtaking. For you ladies, there is an exclusive mall just outside next to the resort. BCBG, Louie Vuitton, Guess, Movado .........just to name few.

Reviews.Title: “Return Every Year”
Reviews.Author: sqwuishythings
Reviews.Content: This is my family's faviorite hotel in Hawaii. We started going there in 2004, and coming all the way from the east coast it is quite a hike. This hotel however is worth it. The minute you step into the lobby the stuning views hit you. The lobby has a brezzy ocean view with beautiful sculptures. I have been to this hotel 5 times so far and I have had very different experiences with check in. I am a hilton honors member, which allows me to go in a different line. However this has not been the case for all of my visits. The line can be 30 min long, but the staff does everything to make it a better experiece. They take your bags when you arrive and you don't have to worry about them they will show up in your room. This helps but my greatest advice is go at an off time for check in, or hurry to the hotel after your flight came in. Chances are a few of those people are also headed to the Grand. Once you check in if you have kids go staight to the pools, believe me kids never get sick of the pools. Things you must do include going to SPA grande it is truely amazing. As far as restraunts go I always go to humu for the atmoshpere. The best food is probably at the four seasons next door (very short walk) I would suggest Spago (wolfgang puck's resturant) or Ferraros (outside). Both are amazing at sunset is the best tiotime to go. Overall one of my favorite hotels in the world. My only reservations are that everytime I visit this time my family has a hard time leaving, so if you want to explore the island not just lay by the pool pick a less awsome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - Great for family - NO COMPLAINTS”
Reviews.Author: Danield528
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. We are 2 adults (35) and 3 kids (9, 6 and 2). We arrived at 9:30PM and were greeted by the valet/bellmen with flower leis and warm welcome. CAt check-in, we did not have to wait at all. We were escorted to our room and given a tour. Our room was on the first floor of the lagoon wing, at the very end, It was a long walk to the lobby, but right outside our door were the pools and the ocean. We found this room location to be awesome and would take it again a hundred times over. When we booked this trip, in November 2010, there was still self-parking available for free. When we checked in, we were told that everything was now valet only and that it was $25 a day. I told them that it wasn't like that when we booked the trip and she immediately told us it would be comped for the duration of our stay. (I didn't even complain just merely mentioned that it was news to us). Awesome. The room was modern, comfortable, spacious and clean. The view from the huge balcony was awesome. We looked at the beach and the pools. There were plenty of outlets and the high speed internet (wired and wireless) worked well. We ate almost all of our breakfasts at the Kihei Caffe (I reviewed it, too) which was a fantastic local spot about ten minutes from the hotel. For all 5 of us, it was about $30-$35. (My wife and 2 daughters ate one breakfast at the hotel for $50+ and said it was so-so.) The pools were incredible. The beach was beautiful. We never had to "fight" for a chair or spot on the beach. When we came down at 7am, there was no one there. Even when we came down later, like 9 or 10, there was always a place to throw down our stuff. We don't sit in the chairs anyway, just need a place to lay our things. No problem there. Pools and pool area were always clean and well staffed. The grounds at this place, starting in the lobby and all throughout are just beautiful. I travel a lot and have never had this level of service at any hotel I've stayed at. As for the complaints about nickel and dime charges, this is a five-star hotel and you can expect things to cost more than other hotels. For example, we got 4 frozen drinks at the pool (3 without alcohol) and it was $45. Again, you have to expect this at a place of this caliber. You also don't get any riff-raff at the hotel - We met a lot of nice people at the pools, beach and the lu'au. About the lu'au...It is expensive. All 5 of us went, and we ponied up the extra $ for premium seats which got us front row/center table. It was a neat show and the kids loved it. Live music, open bar, hula dancers, big buffet, entertainment for the kids, temporary tattoos, Hawaiian horseshoes, crafts vendors etc. The food was adequate, not exceptional, but not bad at all. For the 5 of us, it was $440, like I said - expensive. We figured it was one of those things you have to do your first time in Hawaii. The gym is clean and has treadmills, dumbbells, nautilus-type machines, a Smith machine, high ceilings, and other miscellaneous fad exercise gadgets. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: socal_desertgirl
Reviews.Content: Great place for everyone! The service was great, felt very comfortable. Have stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea and it felt stuffy. We had an amazing view of the beach and pools from the lanai and of the koi pond from the door side of the room. The room staff was always right on top of things! We went to dinner on the last night and were only gone an hour. When we got back, the room had been prepared for the night, towels replenished, bed turned down radio on and shutters closed. This happened every night while we were out, never saw them ;) There is too much to write about, everything about this place was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: dallas29
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Grand Wailea. My wife and I also spent our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea three years ago. We really enjoyed our return trip to the Grand Wailea. Obviously there were some problems (as there are with any major vacation), but overall we had a great 7-night stay at the Grand Wailea. Our room was on the chapel wing, which was great (very quiet and convenient access to all of the hotel's amenities). The room was just a garden view, but it was a really nice view with a partial view of the ocean. I forgot just how gorgeous the grounds are. It's truly a beautiful hotel. The pools are amazing, while the beach is also great. I preferred the activities pool with the slides and the swim-up bar, while my wife enjoyed the beach and the adult pool. I used the fitness center and the walking/jogging trail for workouts while my wife really enjoyed the Spa Grande, although she said it was quite pricey. The food at the hotel wasn't great and was expensive, but we already knew this coming in. We bought granola bars and cereal bars for breakfast at K-Mart, an idea I highly recommend, as the breakfast at the hotel is really expensive. If we ate lunch at the hotel, my wife and I shared meals, as the portions are sizeable. Our dinner at Humu was enjoyable in a very unique, relaxed setting. I would recommend eating there. I would also suggest bringing in your own water/sodas, as our room had an empty refrigerator that you could stock with your own drinks. The room is quite nice, deserving of a 4 or possibly 4.5 star rating. My only complaints were the shower and the air conditioner. The shower had some mildew and the drain wasn't working properly. If you leave the air conditioner on automatic, it turns on and off every minute or so, which can wake you up periodically during the night. If you switch the air conditioner to fan it will blow constantly and will not bother you at all. We learned that the hard way the first night. Overall these problems weren't huge and the room was really nice. The staff is friendly and accomodating and quickly brought us whatever we requested (toothpaste, extra soap, towels, etc.). Richard, the bartender at the swim-up bar is a really nice guy. The conceirge was also very helpful with dinner reservations. In summary, the hotel is a beautiful resort with a great beach and the best pool(s) on Maui. The rooms are good but did have some flaws. The food is hit and miss but to be expected at a hotel. I really liked how close the hotel was to the Shops at Wailea, which was in walking distance and had several restaurants and two general stores. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel to those looking for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: vtgambler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea the first week of May. We booked using Hilton Honors points which only guarantees the most basic room. At check-in we were upgraded to an ocean view room in the lagoon tower. We liked the location as it was closest to the beach, pool and restaurants. The room was large with a very big bathroom and nice sized lanai. There was some visible wear and tear but everything was very clean during our stay. You could see the ocean so I guess that qualifies as ocean view, but it was over the pool complex and through a maze of palm tree. I would have been disappointed had weâ€™d paid extra for the view. We donâ€™t go to Hawaii to hang out at the pool so we didnâ€™t spend much time there. We did notice the chair squatting started early but we never had a problem finding chairs later in the afternoon for an hour or two. The beach in front of the hotel is excellent as are others nearby. We ate at Humu one night and it was very good. It was pricey but consistent with other high end restaurants in Wailea. Unfortunately Bistro Molokini was closed for dinner during our entire stay. This is the pool restaurant/casual dinner option. The menu looked good and less expensive than Humu. The cafÃ© was a complete ripoff so we never ate a full meal there but the quality of the baked goods and such was unimpressive. There are numerous dining options within 10 minutes, both casual and upscale. My wife had a massage one day and said the spa is excellent. I used the fitness center a few times and it is as complete as any hotel Iâ€™ve been to. We found the service to be very good. Everyone was pleasant and efficient. Valets were particularly good. Overall we enjoyed our stay but the place is a little â€œbusyâ€� for our liking. Iâ€™d have no problem using points to stay here again but if I was spending $500+ per night there are other options on Maui I would choose. Seemed like a better choice for families than couples.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back Next Year”
Reviews.Author: salsaisgood
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Some of the best I have been in. The bed's are super comfortable. Huge bathrooms, and the scent of the toiletries they provide are excellent! Plenty of room to store everything. Turn down service always brings extra towels and leaves a nice little note on your bed with a flower. Restaurants: I believe there are two nice restaurants on the property (Seafood/Steak place and a Japanese place), as well as a bistro (service not so good). Restaurants are super pricey, but food is pretty good. Lobby bar is the best. Hotel: Most service is impeccable. We wanted to view the grand suite (nicest suite and $12k a night), they said there is someone in it right now but to call back on Friday (it was on Sunday we asked about it). Sure enough, we called back and they took us up there to show us. Valet and bartenders try to remember your name, and pool side service is pretty good. Pool: Clearly the focal point of the whole property. Lazy river and two large slides. Also about 4-5 tiers of pools with smaller slides connecting all of them. Swim up bar, and worlds only water elevator. Adult only pool as well. Cabana's are for rent which provide food and water. If going through busy season, you need to get up EARLY to get chairs. Otherwise it is pretty easy. Other: Beach is super nice. Four Seasons, Kia Lani, and the Marriott are all along the strand right next to the hotel which all provide their own restaurants you can eat at. Grand Wailea shops are super nice as well which are walking distance. Spa is awesome (though expensive). Had a massage from Priya, who was AWESOME! Great before treatment as well with access to all their special hot tubs, water massages, etc. Free wireless for guests. You are making a mistake if not booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Michele428
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the resort. This is our first time in Hawaii and hopefully not the last. This place is amazing! The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were great (we had an oceanview room) and the Humumus restaurant was one the best place we have ever eaten! The spa was unbelievable; soaked in different baths before getting a swedish massage. It was the best. The only negative I would say is the mandatory valet fee. We rented a car (Budget on premise) and they charged you $25 every day. I think this is crazy, since the car is there anyway and they didn't tell us about it either. The pool was amazing and having beach access with towels there was great. Would definetly come here again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MtPRealtor
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui and had a fabulous stay at the Grand Wailea Resort!! The Rooms were clean, comfortable, spacious and well stocked with bath essentials. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well-kept. Our kids (ages 9 and 10) had a BALL at the pools. The water slides, water elevator, lazy river, and the Tarzan Rope (Rope Swing) were very entertaining! As you would expect the food and snacks were very pricey but good. The Spa was amazing! I went two days back to back and had wonderful experiences both times. I enjoyed the walking path along that beach that went on for miles. The views were absolutely amazing--you didn't even feel like you were exercising! The hotel is also within walking distance to a shopping area where you would find very nice shops and restaurants. I can't wait to go back to this hotel. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very high brow”
Reviews.Author: coocoomaroo
Reviews.Content: This is a five star Hotel with a five srar price. The grounds are amazing, and a few good restaurants, but stay away from the quick service one by the shops, it's very expensive, and the food is not very good, although convient. Don't leave your pool lounge unattended for too long, the staff will pick up your items your items. It is walking distance to waiela shops. It also has a beautiful beach walk. The gym is first rate, but you do have to pay for the use.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea not so "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: FireballXO9
Reviews.Content: If I had one word to describe the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa it would be â€œInconsistentâ€� This was our first trip to the Hawaiian island of Maui and the Grand Wailea Resort we had previously vacationed several times on the Big Island at Four Seasons Hualalai. We stayed 5 days and 4 nights the resort was at about 60 percent capacity. The strength of this property is the nice rooms, world class beach and water park pool area. Our room was clean the king bed was comfortable and the staff did a wonderful job keeping us stocked with towels. The beach is gorgeous and water park pool fun! Weakness included inconsistent customer service, food, grounds and employee attitudes, plus the ever present nickel and dime charging. My wife wasnâ€™t impressed by the spa she went for one treatment early in our trip and never returned. Warning: The stone area around the pool is slippery witnessed several adults and children slipping and falling on the stone tile surrounding the upper pool area. Also there is a lack of shade around the pools, so you need to get to the pool early in order to stake claim to a shaded standard lounge chairs. Beach goers need to arrive early before 9am to stake claim to one of the limited number of beach umbrella and lounge chairs available at no additional charge. The wind came up by noon each day so we would do the beach in the morning and the pool in the afternoon. Even with its short comings we had a good time, but I would only return to the Grand Wailea during non-peak travel times.

Reviews.Title: “One of best places we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TammyTD
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. It seemed very expensive and had some not great reviews, but it was a fabulous place and was worth every penny. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I was nervous that the pool would be chaos, but wasn't at all.
