The pool is directly across from the beach, which is perfect because you can do both easily. We rented a cabana/chair between the beach and pool for $75 a day, which was perfect. We did spurge the last day for a big cabana right by the pool ($300) but wasn't really worth it. The food is fabulous - the Humahuma restaurant is a must. The hotel is located right next to a shopping center that also has some great restaurants. The hotel is in a great location -easy ride to surfing and towns, although my kids never wanted to leave the hotel. The spa was unbelievable. We've traveled many places and stayed in some fabulous spaces and this hotel rates in my top three ever.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: Steep_&_Deep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea earlier in May. The hotel was very beautiful and the rooms were quite spacious and nice. The hotel is massive, I think they said 850 rooms. Positives: - The pool was great, loved the river, tarzan rope, waterslides and waterfalls. Nice being able to grab a new towel whenever you need one. Bring tubes for floating around the "river", we spent hours doing this and it was great fun. - Spacious rooms with very comfortable beds. - The beach is nice but can get a bit busy depending on how busy the hotel, and surrounding hotels are. - The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had one bad experience with one of the valet guys barking at my wife for not parking the car in the correct place but everyone else was great. - The chairs and table outside on the deck are fantastic, very nice for watching the sunset and having a drink. - The juice in the lobby was excellent, it usually showed up around check-in time, very good! - Courtesy rooms. We had a late flight and checkout was 12:00, we spent the day at the pool and then used one of their courtesy rooms which is a full size hotel room which you can use complimentary for 45 mins. This was a huge help and very nice to be able to have your own room to shower and get ready. Negatives: - The hotel size can be a negative, we were on the back wing and it was a pretty decent walk to and from the pool or beach, between 5 and 10 minutes walk I would say. I don't know if there is a difference in the rooms but you could ask for a room in one of the front wings. - Mandetory valet, I would rather just get my own car rather than having to go valet all the time. At times it can be a relatively long wait. I am just not really a valet person so I like the option of self parking. - A good portion of the guests! Certainly not the hotel's fault directly but it was a negative on our trip overall, we are not painting all guess with one brush but we found that many of the guests were quite rude and pretentious. I also hate it when people go down to the pool at 7 am and place towels on the pool chairs and don't come back down until it's 11:00. The hotel wasn't too busy when we were there and I was up early as it was so it wasn't too big of a deal but it's just sucks when you come down and all the good spots are taken yet nobody is there. There are signs that the hotel will move peoples stuff but maybe that's only during busy times like Christmas or Spring Break because we didn't see it happen. We had better luck getting good chairs at the regular pool over the adult pool, we usually ended up sitting behind the "river" closest to the beach which seemed to be a good spot. - No Versus!! I am Canadian and I love hockey, I was there for the playoffs and the hotel didn't have Versus on their cable network which was a major pain, we ended up going to Moose McGillycuddys which is the unofficial home for Vancouverites to watch hockey games, definitely go there for Taco Tuesday, awesome! Overall we definitely enjoyed our stay, the staff with one exception was great and the rooms were very nice. Food prices weren't too bad but I thought that the drink prices were a bit much, although not too much more than you would pay at a Fairmont or Four Seasons. The hotel had a good deal on snorkel and stand-up padel boarding, $99 for unlimited use. Stand up, was lots of fun and I would highly recommend. We liked Wailea and being walking distance to the shops, we have stayed in Kihei and Kaanapali also. I would definitely recommend having a car to go check out the other beaches, my favorite beaches are: Big Beach, Keawakapu, Kaanapali, Kamaole and Honolua Bay for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation in paridise”
Reviews.Author: Richmond-VA-Barb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days in July of 2010. Ocean suite in Napua Tower with concierge level access. Joined the membership club and was able to get better rooms because of member discount. The Waldorf Astoria is owned by Hilton. Both kids (11 and 18 at the time) enjoyed facility. The pool makes all of the difference for the kids. Ocean is so close you can choose to go in the ocean if you get bored with the pool. It's not an inexpensive vacation - but this is Hawaii!! Concierge helps with any tours or day trips and many are available. I think this is a much better location than the Four Seasons for families with children. Lots of stores and world class spa on site... this place really lives up to it's reputation and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mcronander
Reviews.Content: Staff was attentive and friendly. Hotel was very clean and in good repair. All facilities-pools, restaurants, rooms and gym were kept clean and seemed to be managed well.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: shabzinca
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is simply the best hotel/resort with the best beach & pools on the best Hawaiian Island. We purchased our package from Costco Service was outstanding. Wife and I stayed in the Napua Terrace which has some of the best views, and access to our own private breakfast and happy hour every day. We were here for 7 days. We also had our own concierge desk for our tower. Resort fees are $20 per day and valet is $20 per day. Free WiFi internet. access. They have a complimentary scuba class which they hold in their 10 foot deep pool. Once the class is over, you can pay to go out with the instructors. Water slides and pools are really fun. Beach was very calm and scenic. No waves though. A lot of paddle boarders. They have staff to setup your lounge chairs and umbrellas. They also have separate beach and pool activity counters. We also got the Grand Dining breakfast every morning. It was very good and had a lot of options, but after 7 days it starts to get a little old. Our room had a mini fridge for us to use. Room service will bring up a microwave oven up to your room. We loved spending time on our lanai and watching the sunsets. They had a really nice outdoor mall with some really nice high-end shops within walking distance to the resort (Gucci, Tiffany, LV, BCBG, etc). My favorite shop there was Lappert's Coffee & Ice Cream. Wife and I did the complimentary morning Yoga on the Beach class which was relaxing. After staying at this place, it will be impossible for us to stay any where else. We didn't have a chance to visit Spa Grande, but from what we heard it is one of the best on the island. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort greatly exceeding expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first anniversary and I have to stay that we were stunned at the overall beauty of the resort as a whole, the rooms, and the service. We have been to many exceptional resorts including in French Polynesia and we both thought the Grand Wailea was just spectacular from the minute we arrived. We pretty much jumped right out of the car, tossed the keys to the valet, checked in without any wait with an outstanding front desk agent and were taken to a beautiful "garden view" room with an exceptional ocean view. Since it was our anniversary our room had been decorated with tropical flowers all over the bed and through the bathroom and a jacuzzi tub all ready to go with floating flower pedals - we were both in awe to find this waiting for us. The grounds of the resort are masterfully planned and about as beautiful as could be everywhere we went. The gym, spa, and pool areas were stunning as well all featuring everything one could possibly want. I would particularly recommend the spa which is ranked among the best in the world with a massive array of hydrotherapy for use before and after any spa treatment. Ask for a 298 dollar couples package including two massages, lunch at the resort, and valet parking for out of resort guests. I would also recommend dining at Humu's as well - the food and ambiance were truly amazing. Overall the only negative thing i have to say about this place is that the business center should not charge an arm and a leg to access the Internet and print something other than a boarding pass. Do plan on spending a significant sum of money if you plan to stay here or anywhere else in Wailea - definitely pricey but worth it for a special occasion. If it's a special occasion such as an anniversary let the hotel know in advance - as I mentioned before they decorated our room really nice but also gave us a whole bunch of other things like a free bottle of champagne and free entree at Humu's plus some free drinks. We walked over to the Four Seasons and Fairmont and had dinner and drinks at each but we both agreed that the Grand Wailea was an overall better choice in terms of resort amenties, spa, and dining choices although we could not speak to the quality of the rooms and service in comparison. Overall I would highly recommend the Grand Wailea and will no doubt stay here again when we get back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, awesome spa, weak on service”
Reviews.Author: Sprincer
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a really nice stay in Hawaii so it's tough to complain, but I really strongly felt like I had to share the scope of our experience. The grounds and rooms at the Grand Wailea were nice, and the pools are all amazing, which explains the fact that it was quite crowded with families soaking up the sun and fun. I don't mind a busy place and definitely felt like if we had our kids with us it would have been a great fit for us in that way so people should know that. Their Spa Grande was a unique and delightful experience for me. I had the Signature Treatment - when I normally always get a Deep Tissue- and this still fit the bill for me, which can be tough. The bathing tubs in the main room and varying hot/cold tubs were a novelty which I really enjoyed as well. I would highly recommend the Spa to anyone staying in the vicinity of this place, actually, for a day visit as it was wonderful. I should not however, my husband felt differently. His primary complaint was that his treatment room was well-lit, with open windows- through which he could hear all the kids screaming at the pool outside. He didn't like that. My room was well lit but I only heard birds chirping. My one, big, issue was with service. When I'm staying at a nice place, paying nice-place rates- I want to feel like the staff cares, and I distinctly did not get that feeling at this hotel. The first day our flight landed early (which I think is common) so we asked the bellhop if we could leave our laptop bag with them while we wandered the grounds and ate lunch. She conceded but was clearly put-out by our request. That struck me as odd. We then proceeded to Bar Molikini for lunch where we waited...to be seen by the hostess, seated, to meet a waiter, to get food,... I chalked it up to being hungry and grumpy and ordered a glass of champagne with-instead of OJ- a splash of mango juice. The waiter acted like I was weird and I later received- just champagne. I drank it because hey, I like champagne. But that was odd to me too. Again, I chalked this all up to timing and me. The next day after lounging on the beach all morning we were starving yet again so we walked to the conveniently located Bar Molokini where we waited...for everything...all over again. I was so disappointed (and frustrated to be honest) that after 20 minutes of waiting I asked the hostess if any waiter knew we existed and she just pointed at a guy and said, "Yeah- he's right there", like it's my job to figure this out? I said "Well right there is not right at my table, where I'd like him to be." I went back to the table and sat for a few minutes again. Finally I got up to leave and of course my apparent 'server' approached me and I said "We're leaving" to which he brightly answered "Great!" Indeed. Later that afternoon once I had calmed down, and of course happily eaten and been served off the property at Longhi's- which deserves it's own great review- for $25 instead of the $92 Molokini had cost me the day prior, I shared my experience with the Hotel Manager. He kindly listened to me and then said "Thanks for sharing!" SO yeah- he blew me off. I guess I would too if my place was crowded with people willing to receive bad service so their kids could enjoy an awesome pool. I get it, really. But as far as I'm concerned, there are too many high end resorts in Hawaii with amazing locations to waste your hard-earned money on a place that doesn't expend the effort to show they care, even a little. Don't stay here!!! Just visit the spa! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with exceptional spa”
Reviews.Author: MrsBerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Grand Wailea at the end of two weeks in Hawaii. It is a absolutely beautiful hotel. From the greeting by the friendly valet and lovely orchid lei, we were happy to have arrived at in our final island. We are Diamond HHonors and used points for our stay. We opted to upgrade for $150/night, which gave us an amazing oceanview room overlooking the chapel. Ryan, the bellman who brought our bags up was very friendly and helped us with the layout of the hotel. Our room was very large with sliding glass doors to the full length balcony. The bath was a good size with glass shower, deep tub and separate toilet room. We called the spa to see if they had any availability and luckily got an appointment for 90 minute massages. My #1 recommendation is to GO TO THIS SPA!!!! I've been in many and this was amazing. The hour before your massage, you have the use of whirlpools, cold plunge pools, soaking tubs, a a complimentary body scrub. I almost didn't need a massage. In three days, we went twice! The first night we ate at the Humu.... restaurant. Although it was hard to find (take your map if you're going exploring!) we enjoyed our dinner. Service was a bit lacking at the restaurant, but probably more because we had very high expectations. The beach is really nice, so I didn't use the pool. We explored around the island, so didn't eat too many meals at the resort. You should expect everything to be much more expensive at the resort than off property. Ths typical of all resort complexes. Overall, the resort is lovely. I do think the common areas could be cleaned more frequently. The stairs down past the shops didn't seem to be clean during our stay. This did not affect our stay; however, our expecations of a Waldorf are very high. We throughly enjoyed our stay and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NMGT
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Staff & Amenities. My son & daughter loved it! Gorgeous grounds and landscaping, breath taking views and restaurants. It's a 5+ Star Hotel. I would love to buy a suite at this hotel as a vacation home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trip.....no complaints from us.”
Reviews.Author: gofish3
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a fun filled week in Maui. We stayed the week preceding Easter so obviously a busy time. All the concerns I had before my arrival were not a worry once we got there. Yes....it's expensive, but we knew that when we booked so we'd planned for that. The Grand Wailea is beautiful, we had 2 deluxe ocean front rooms on the 8th floor & they were just perfect for us, the view was incredible, slept at night with the doors open & fell asleep listening to the surf. Yes we had to pay an extra $50 dollars per night so we could insure we had adjoining rooms, but we knew that before we went, so not a problem. Plenty of room in the room & storage too, a fridge in each room & tastefully decorated. The pools are great, although the water elevator is IMO a waste of space. Not really sure what the point of that was, we as a family thought they would have been better off building a couple of extra slides instead....but....not really an issue. We tend to be more beach people too, so onto the next topic...chair games.....my concern before we went. Well, when I'm on vacaction the last thing I want to do is get up at 7am & reserve loungers, so we didn't. We got up when ever we woke, sometimes 9 sometime later....went down had a leisurley breakfast & then generally by 10ish maybe 11 we were ready to hit the beach......not once on the beach did I have a problem getting a lounger....there were always plenty. Never did we get an umbrella, but we are there to enjoy the sun, so we never wanted an umbrella...so not an issue for us. We moved the loungers to wherever we wanted so we didn't feel like we were on top of anyone else...it was perfect. We generally hit the pool in the afternoon after our beach time & again almost always found 2 loungers together, our kids didn't need them as they were always off in the pool. One afternoon we had to wait 30 mins for some loungers to free up....but no big deal...for us anyway. Yep, the price for Cabanas seems high, but if someone is prepared to pay for that, more power to them....I myself can't bear the shade so not something I'm interested in. So chair games are only an issue if you make them an issue. The price for snacks & drinks is silly, again we knew that before we went, but we took a collapsable cooler made a stop at walmart on our first day & stocked up on drinks & snacks, boogie boards...& always had a supply with us, poolside, beachside or when we were out & about. Although my kids did enjoy the Grand Wailea icee's, swore they were the best they've ever had! We had the deal where we got free breakfast as we stayed over a certain #of nights, it was just OK.......each day it's exactly the same offerings....so my thought is they could change the menu up a little....to avoid the repetition. I took my daughter to the SPA where we both got massages...never been somewhere before that would massage a 9 year old, but it was lovely.....being in the room together & getting spoilt...definetly a treat for her. Staff at the hotel were great, always friendly & always helpfull...no compaints there We rented a Suburban through Budget....no problems, brand new car. Had fun exploring...we went to Makena Beach & enjoyed some impressive surf, we did half the road th Hana, but ran out of time....we couldn't stop swimming in the waterfalls!! WE snorkelled at Molokini, which was pretty neat but the snorkelling does not compare to the Carribean....my opinion. We went to the Luau at the Grand Wailea which was fun...just remember to take cash, because if you want to buy anything form the vendors or the photos they take as you enter, you're unable to charge to the room. On our last day we were catchign the red eye back to the US so asked for late checkout.....they let us keep one of our rooms, until 7pm...at no charge, checkout is usually 12pm so that was a great deal....we got to enjoy the beach for the whole last day, & showered up & headed off to the airport....it was much appreciated. It was a great relaxing trip which none of us wanted to leave...If you can afford the Grand Wailea...go & enjoy...we're so glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotell and Great Setting”
Reviews.Author: jimf1111
Reviews.Content: We just finished a five night stay at the Grand Wailea. We were there with boys aged 11, 14 and 16. They loved all of the water features and the adjoining ocean. I think we went through two bottles of sunscreen with them in and out of the water so much. We all enjoyed the amenities of the hotel. My wife and I both received massages and spent time in the beautiful spa. An all around great trip for the family.

Reviews.Title: “SIX STAR RESORT ON MAUI WHERE THE ALOHA SPIRIT IS ALWAYS PRESENT!”
Reviews.Author: larryt43
Reviews.Content: First impression is breathtaking. A welcome and lei is presented by bell staff, prior to arrival at the Front Desk. Check in was easy and quick , even though the hotel was busy due to spring break. After a warm welcome by the front desk staff, we were taken to our room which was spotless; and kept that way by hk for the entire stay. Room Service was the best and fairly priced. Dinner at the Mokikini Bistro was great, service was outstanding; and each child was presented with a free stuffed animal at the end of the meal. The beach is to die for, and there is no charge for the umbrellas. There is a "Kids Club" which provides activities and meals for the children, the staff goes out of their way to make the kids happy; and it is a great feature of this hotel. The team members at this resort are always anxious to help guests, and make them happy. This is where this hotel really shines. All of the team members have a great attitude. In conclusion , this really is the best resort on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Bobb54
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from my third stay at this hotel as all the other reviews point out it is a grand and opulent hotel . I was there 5 years ago and think that it is still in great shape contrary to other reviews . The pool is the best of any hotel I have stayed at and is the main attraction ( in my opinion) and why they can get the rates they charge . Beyond that my issues are, if I am spending $700 a night to stay someplace I do not expect to be nickeled and dime'd in other aspects such as required valet parking and $13.00 to use a computer to print my boarding pass for my departure. Six dollars for a 12 ounce orange juice is just silly . Commodity prices for produce has not gotten that silly yet to my knowledge .The other thing that seems to have gotten worse is the pre dawn towel chair group and the limited space near the entertainment pool for general seating as I call it . They have two pool areas , one is for adults and one is more fun for adults and kids alike depending on your likes or dislikes . The adult pool used to have l the cabana's for those who like that kind of thing and maybe more refined appearance. They have now lined the volly ball or wide area of the pool with these to earn more revenue I guess for those who want to spend more money or dont like sun ( not sure why go to Hawaii) . That leave's the rest to get there first for those chairs left on top of each other , or go to beach which is quite nice and where we spent the last day away from the crowded pool . Dont get me wrong , pool , rope swing and all are a blast but waves were great for boggie boarding. Obviously if you are spending the money through direct booking with hotel to stay there you can afford the fee's above or rent a cabana but its simply the principal that given the cost to stay there you would think they could provide a computer to print your boarding pass ,not demand valet parking and leave the cabana set to the quiet pool . It is convenient to the Wailea Shops ( very short walk ) . We were traveling with our 17 year old son and were at the Hyatt at Kaanapali Beach for the first 6 nights. For about $150 per night less we were on the Regency Club level with continental breakfast , evening appetizers and deserts at 7:30 no mandatory valet and a computer all set for you in the lobby free of charge to print your boarding pass . Our view was beautiful on the top floor and water front not water views as with the Grand Wailea (which is what I paid for and mostly got) . Kaanapali beach is about 3 miles , lined with other hotels , shopping at Whalers Village , and shuttle to Lahaina with all of its shops and restaurants within a few miles . I went to school in Hilo and have been back 9 times now , for value and location go to Kaanapali . If you want a simply beautiful hotel room and hotel structure , do not mind over paying regardless if you can afford it go to Grand Wailea . 17 year old preferred Hyatt and Kaanapali which also has a pretty good pool .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Wailea”
Reviews.Author: mike125Boston
Reviews.Content: First time in Hawaii / Grand Wailea and loved it. Great location, ocean views, service, food and people. We have been all over the Caribbean, Mexico and Europe, and I have to say that it was the best vacation ever (Barcelona and Florence are great also, but they are different types of vacations). You must try Mama's Fish House in Paia (the name does not do it justice) They have great food with excellent oceanfront views. Already planning to return next year. The Wailea, and Hawaii in general, are expensive. But if you go there knowing that, It will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: hulahawaii1976
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way!!! This location has it all. Great staff,great service,great rooms,great view,great beach,great huge pool with slides,baby beach,water way system,tarzan rope swing,grotto bar,water elevator,adult only,cabanas,hot tubs ect...,great beach,kids programs, great hawaiian art work,statues,shops and happy hour and an AMAZING spa!!. There is so much more to this wonderful place. If you can go,then go!!! Well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Dream of all dreams!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritnsoul1
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend pulled in front of Grand Wailea with our mouths wide open... We were completely tooken by the beauty of this hotel and island. We got lucky with a suite w/ocean view and access to the Napua lounge. Our room was very spacious, well kept it had a royalty feel to it. The food was WONDERFUL you have to try all the property foods. We made all effort to eat outside of the hotel but still wind up eating at all the resturants. We were there during NYE, we had a romantic time on the beach with fireworks that the Waliea hosted at the stroke of midnight... It was so romantic that my boyfriend now fiancee proposed. :) we are looking to come back to Waliea for another romantic time. IMPORTANT NOTE: although there maybe kids on the resort, there are parts on the resort where kids are not allowed. So you can have that romantic time with your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “was concerned over some of the negative reviews and recent bankruptcy, you would never know...amazing place”
Reviews.Author: KazLA210
Reviews.Content: We split our trip in Maui starting here and then going to Lana'i. It was perfect to start here. It is like Disneyworld for Hawaii. Huge sprawling pools and slides. We arrived right after the spring break rush, and I would suggest NOT being here when it is overbooked. The ratio of service to guests was perfect, we were never more than 10 seconds from someone helping us when we needed. The grounds were well kept and clean, rooms were spotless. We were in a normal ocean view...got a decent price online but this is not a cheap hotel. The sheer vastness of the hotel is impressive, and if you are looking to bling out your trip this is where to go. It was relatively quiet even with the large amount of families. The room service food is horrendous and overpriced, avoid at all costs. The Humuhumu restaurant on the other hand and other places to eat on site are very well worth it at least once. We really enjoyed our stay here and it was a perfect start which ended up on lazy Lana'i island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RAM07
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a beautiful resort with lots of amenities. The pool and the slides are a wonderful addition. The spa is, by far, the best one that I have been too! The food is great and the location is perfect! It would have to be the best hotel in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay At Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: Great Family Holiday!!! Fantastic Pools, waterslides, lazy river, waterfalls....fun for all!! We also love the beach!! We stayed on the club level and really enjoyed it...it was nice to have breakfast included, and our view from our room was beautiful!!! We ate at all the restaurants..love Humumu..ect...it was great...our daughter loved looking at all the fish and the lobsters... We would return to Grand wailea..we have also stayed at Wailea beach villas and four seasons....love them all...maui is a piece of paradise!!! And the spa is the best I have ever been too!!! It is fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ho'olei Villas at The Grand Wailea.....very nice”
Reviews.Author: Bfulk
Reviews.Content: 2 parents. 3 teenagers. We occupied a villa for a week in March. The villa was very large, clean and well appointed. Check-in was quick and efficient. We all received leis before the concierge took us to our villa. Upon arriving, we were given a tour of the villa while another staff member unloaded our car, put our luggage in the bedrooms and unpacked and put away the groceries we had brought with us. I appreciated this immensely since I was on vacation and had planned to prepare only a few meals during our stay, but needed the extra food because, as mentioned before....we had 3 teenagers with us and well, enough said! The Grand Wailea resort is very nice. The grounds ar beautiful and they are very meticulous in keeping them up. The pools were nice as well. The common areas of the hotel itself was luxurious and beautiful. Food and drinks around the pool were delicious. The villa, the shops in the hotel and the restaurant prices should be expected at a facility of this caliber. The Grand Wailea is probably not the best choice for those on a tight budget. If you are concerned about prices, you probably will not be able to enjoy the beauty and ammentities of this resort. We found the service from the concierge (before and after we arrived) to the pool staff excellent. We had flight cancellations/delays and arrived at the resort 24 hours later than planned. We called the concierge as soon as we knew we weren't going to make it on time and she said they would just "roll" our reservation to the next day. We were not charged for the first night that we missed. And we were offered an extra day on the end of our stay. Which we were happy to have. The particular villa we were in was reserved on the extra day that we opted to stay so they gave us another villa that was not occupied. It was bigger and even more beautiful than the first and even had a better ocean view. When it came to the morning when we needed to switch villas......we called and let them know when we were ready and the concierge and a staff member came and moved everything. Our luggage, packed up the fridge and the groceries and put everything in the new villa. We can't say enough good things about the service. It's simply outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience, but a lot of money!”
Reviews.Author: smuie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our daughters 11, 8 and 4 for spring break. We opted to stay at the GW for 3 out of 8 nights because of the price of the room. They typically do not allow 5 people to a room, but a reservationist who I contacted via email allowed it as my youngest was only 4. I paid $30 per day for a rollaway. At $650 per night, we were unwilling to purchase 2 rooms per night. My husband is an attorney and makes a nice living and this was a stretch for us -- I don't know WHO can afford this place for a week in high season! Now-- all of that said, we had a WONDERFUL time while we were here! The kids enjoyed the pools so much. We did have to scope out chairs early but certainly not 7 AM. We would head down in the morning but probably more like 9-10. I did not feel like the slides or pools were too crowded to enjoy as others have mentioned -- NOT AT ALL. In fact, the longest we ever waiting was for the water elevator and that was probably 5-10 min and that is because there is only one and can only hold 12-15 people. We ate dinner at Molokini one evening and thought it was good (not great but certainly good) but yes, over $100 for 3 kids meals and sushi. The beach is so incredible - so much better than Kaanapali. We ate dinner at Spago's (twice) at the Four Seasons - the Four Seasons is very nice but it is VERY fancy -- people are decked out there! It has a very California feel to me. I am not sure that my children would have enjoyed the pool or the feel of it. We rented a cabana one day and it was very nice -- 4 chaises inside with comfy pillow seats and 4 chaises outside of the cabana for those who like the sunshine. It was half the price of a room therefore we only booked it for one day but it was a nice treat. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. There is no arguing that the place needs a facelift -- the bathrooms are tiled an the colors are dated but truly, the place is LOVELY! The grounds are maintained so well and I don't see how anyone could honestly give this place less than 4 stars (except being VERY pricey). I would definitely go back -- I would just love to see them lower the rates!

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime.”
Reviews.Author: BKandCK
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience a slice of Vegas while on Hawaii this is the place for you. Crowds, enormous property, so-so service and over priced food. We paid top dollar for an "exclusive" tower suite and were disappointed. For the price we paid the service and ammenities were substandard. The service was a real disappointment. 1 out of every 5 employees we encountered was helpful. Our check-in was a nightmare and set the tone for our stay. Most employees we encountered just didn't seem interested in being nice or helpful. For our dollar we will be back at The Four Seasons for all future stays in Hawaii. Trying the alleged 5 star resort was a mistake we will not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: dissatisfied154916
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Maui started at the Grand Wailea when we were greeted by superb bell staff when we arrived. I cannot say enough good things about the front line workers as soon as you arrive. Upon arriving at the check in desk in the late afternoon (almost 6pm) we were greeted with the question of can I see your visa and ID. once that was provided to them we were presented with keys to our room and was told nothing else. There was no mention of where the restaurants were located, what restaurant was open to people without a reservation (kinda hard to make a reservation when you arrive at meal time) and no map of the hotel was given. we were basically on our own to figure out where to get a meal after traveling 8 hours to get to our 5 star hotel. we went to a couple of the restaurants on the resort to try to get in to get a meal the first night and were told "sorry you need a reservation..we can see about getting you in later that evening" needless to say we went to bed with no supper. I do have to say that when we arrived in our room I read over all the info that about the restaurants and the features in the hotel and it was not until day 9 of our 10 day trip that a room service menu magically appeared in our room. The swimming pool was great, the water eleavator was a blast but the chair situation around the pool and on the beach were a joke. The first 2 days at the hotel we were very pleased to find that when you go to the beach there are chairs and umbrella's that were brought to you at your desired location. we had no problems at all finding chairs and umbrella's come the 7th day it was another story. After traveling the island and taking a break from the hotel water we went at 10 am to the beach and asked for 4 chairs and a umbrella and were told sorry we are all out of them right now come back in 15 to 20 minutes, we have people doing a sweep of the beach looking for unoccupied chairs. I stood by the chair and umbrella sign out stand with another lady who was having the same problem. when her husband came from the beach and told her he needed money so that he can pay the people doing the sweeps to find him 6 chairs he explained to his wife if he gave the money to the young men they would get him chairs right away. sure enough, not even 5 minutes later while standing in front to the chair sign out spot with his wife he came back and said we have chairs now and they left. I still had not been accomodated with chairs or an umbrella and My family arrived ahead of his. So we tried his theory...People when you are told there are no chairs left no worries, here are the steps you take to get some...step 1....ask for an umbrella or 2 depending on your family size. the young men will deliver it to your preferred location. step 2....while the young men are setting up the umbrella tell them that you have a few bucks for the amount of chairs you need. with our family it cost 8 dollars to have them find us 4 chairs. and we got them within 5 minutes of preforming step 2 . step 3...enjoy the sun. sit back people and watch the ones around you, it is very interesting. the young men who are serving patrons of the hotel on the beach in a half hour period definately make good money, the one we watched made at least 30 dollars from what we could see doing the chair sweep policy. chairs and umbrella's are left occupied by one person. usally a woman reading a book. she will be there for about half an hour and then she will disappear for about half an hour. If you go to the pool area (which was where my kids were splitting their time between the beach and the pool) you will see that same lady that was on the beach with her allotted amount of chairs, sitting at her other allotted amount of chairs next to the pool. This will go on all day as we found There are also some downfalls to the money for chairs policy in this hotel. We were a victim of the chair sweep on the 8th day. my family was on the beach enjoying the sun when we decided we should go to the ocean as a family of four and enjoy the waves and the ocean.we were gone less than 3 minutes when we witnessed the same young man who accomodated us with chairs the day before take our towel off of one of our chairs and slide it over to an umbrella next to us for 4 women we go our chair back however immediately after we got our chair back the 4 women disappeared to the pool area for over 3 hours. wonder why they needed our chair and how much did they have to pay for these chairs. for the next 2 days we could not swim in the pool or on the beach as a family as we had to have at least one person or more guarding our chairs. IF you drink coffee in the morning (provided by the hotel in rooms) make sure you leave your sugar packages next to the sugar holder on the counter,that way the cleaning staff know that you are in need of more sugar. we had many days in our stay that we were drinking black coffee due to the fact that we cleaned up our sugar packages off the counter. the days that we left the empty sugar packages on the counter our sugar was always restocked. beware that if you want to book a tour that most of the tours do not come to the Grand Wailea to pick you up, you have to drive yourself. BE SURE to rent a car at the airport when you get off your plane. we did not know that and found that you pay more for a car rental at the hotel than at the airport. shopping, there are very few options for shopping around this hotel. If you want reasonable priced shopping or meals, you have to rent a car. My family was very disappointed in what we got at the hotel for the price of the room. we will not be stayinig here again

Reviews.Title: “A Complete Disorganized Mess !”
Reviews.Author: hnllaw60982
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Honolulu with my wife and two young girls ages 6 and 8 during the week of March 20, 2011 for a five day vacation at the Grand Wailea. Upon arrival, the hotel was reportedly at about 90% occupancy. There are approximately 780 rooms to the Property. Assuming an average of 3.0 people per room this would equate to 2100 guests more or less exclusive of staff during our stay. The facilities and staff simply can not come close to servicing that amount of people to any degree, let alone to a four or five star level. The main attraction to the hotel, the pools and slides become so crowded and so chaotic by noon that it is difficult to imagine that after the initial pleasure of merely being in Hawaii wears off the mid west or east coast traveler, one doesn't feel stressed over fighting over towls and chairs and space. It is Lord of the Flies at $1,000 a day. By 7:45 am 95% percent of the chairs around the multi level pool complex are completely taken. By 8:00 am 100% are taken. No one is actually using the pool or is even at the pool at that hour however. The one hour policy to "reserve" your chair is not enforced and in fact I actually witnessed on Friday March 25 at approx 11:00 am two young girls ages 8 and 10 , who had claimed two chairs and were quietly sitting next to me (which had been cleared by security about 30 minutes prior due to a guest placing a book there at approx 7:00 am and quickly disappearing) removed by hotel security because the guest returned 4 hours later and claimed he had BEEN USING THE CHAIR- A BLATANT AND OBVIOUS LIE. THE YOUNG GIRLS WERE SCARED, THE 5FT 10 260LB WHITE MALE GOT HIS CHAIR BACK,because the hotel secuity made the expedient decision after looking at thesize of the belligerent male and then the two little innocent girls who would be easier to deal with and the young girls had their day ruined. You could provide that friendly spring break experience for your kids without spending a 1,000 dollars a day for room and meals! Thank God the girls parents were not there at the time or there might have been a stabbing! So much for the blind eyes of Justice! Not once by the pool in five days did a server ever ask if we were interested in placing a food order. When we did eat by the pool the food was horrible. I do not mind the prices but the food was horrendous. The rooms were fair but can not compare to any four star or five star hotel in Kona, Lanai, or even next door at the Four Seasons. It is not enough for Management to say that occupancy is 90% and things get tight. A hotel need that number in order to make money so obviously the business plan for this Hotel coupled with the size and design do not provide functional utility for the guests ,and hence, this hotel constitutes a very poor value and a terrible waste of money. Management, let me tell you something: from 7am to 10 am the amount of people that are actually using the pool and need to legtimately "claim" a chair for immediate use is around zero. Issue towels and chairs at 10:00am and not earlier before someone gets killed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection -Rare family fun and luxury found in one resort”
Reviews.Author: Dana90
Reviews.Content: We have many favorite resorts from The Sanctuary at Kiawah Island to The Grand Del Mar in San Diego and we will add Grand Wailea to our list of top luxury destinations. The Grand Wailea easily rises to the top of our short but favorite list because it outperforms due to it's superior focus on first-rate attention to the kids. First of all, the pool complex is a keiki's (child's) dream and entertains for 12 hours with no boredom. This is huge because the last thing you ever want to hear from your kids on a luxury vacation is "I'm bored!" and you won't hear it once. Even the world class spa offers a menu for kids as young as age 6. I've requested this so many times on other trips only to find it's not an option. our 7 year old was thrilled with her chocolate-coconut pedicure and her cupcake bath bomb she bought in the gift shop. More importantly, she didn't have to feel excluded since my husband and I both enjoyed a spa morning. The napua tower rooms were wonderfully appointed and the view amazing. The hospitality room offered the daily breakfast, afternoon cookies and evening bar and appetizers and we so enjoyed the food, the company and the staff who knew us by name after one visit. Our dinner at Humu was fabulous with our daughter feeding the fish in the koi pond, getting to see and touch a lobster from the tank, and food that was just the perfection of fresh fish you would expect My Macadamia nut encrusted mahi mahi was excellent. Highlights of the trip were the days spent on the beach and pool where the tarzan rope swing was a huge hit for both daughter and father. I'll never forget my husband's many attempts alongside other dads .....lots of back flips going on! Great family fun is the perfect description for our time at Grand Wailea and it is priceless!

Reviews.Title: “For The Money, Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: jennfam5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the Grand Wailee where we spent 8 days celebrating our 20th anniversary. While we had a nice time on our trip, we were disappointed with the Grand Wailee (given the price point). I will break down my review from the good to the not so good The good. Location of the Hotel is great and the beach and sunsets are magnificent. Also convenient to nearby hotels and shops at wailee, its a short walk Pools and grounds are nice Check in was not a problem although they did not offer us a room upgrade Room size is fine and bathroom size is also spacious Bed was pretty comfortable Humu restaurant was pretty good, we got a great table and had the most amazing sunset Courtesy room was a nice touch. given that checkout is noon and most flights off the island are at night, the hotel offers guests a courtesy room where you can stay by the pools on the day of your departure and when you are done, they will let you use a room to shower and get cleaned up for your flight. very nice touch Loved the grotto bar, richie the bartender was very nice and served great drinks The not so good Place needs some work, pool tiles are dis-colored and carpets are old and dirty. Paint was noticeable peeling in our bathroom. Most people dont know this but the owners of the resort recently filed for bankruptcy (feb 2011) I would imagine given the amount of leverage morgan stanley put on this and other properties they acquired, they skimped on the maintanence capital expenditures and the resort is starting to show this. Other than the two restaurants, there was not much else available on the property in terms of bars and entertainment The Vallet Parking is bad, long wait times and for $20 per day, its a ripoff. I would rather they charge me $10 per day and let me self park. Resort fee of $20 per day is also a joke, internet access is not very good and coffee is marginal. Also, they have a business center with computers available. You would think given that they charge you $20 per day for internet access that this would cover the use of their computers in the business center. But no, they want additional money from you to access their computer. Seems to me this is double charging. Also, computers were down at the resort several times which was more annoying to the bar staff than to the guests as they had to write up manual tickets for charges. While the pools and slides are fun, they dont have enough covered chairs available for their guests. Similar to Atlantis, people start saving seats as soon as the pool opens at 7 am. Additionally, they try and sell cabanas at $300 per day which takes away from available seating as a lot of these go unfilled. There were far more children at the resort than I would have expected. I am not against children (i have 3 of my own) I was surprised at the sheer volume, and there were a lot of young children. While this was not a problem per se, if you are looking for an adult vacation or a romantic vacation, this may not be the place, again given the high price point. Service is not what you would expect for the price you pay and the pool side waiters tend to cater to the cabana guests versus the other guests. This may seem a little petty but when we threw our robes into the hamper to be cleaned (after a few days of use) they never bothered to replace them, even after a call to the front desk. Do they expect you at a luxury resort to wear the same bathrobe for 8 days? there are other things i could mention but i think you get the point. My wife and I had a good time there and enjoyed our stay in Hawaii. Do I think we got good value for the price we paid, no unfortunately I dont think we received good value. If you are looking for a high end experience, I would recommend the Four Seasons which is right next door to the Grand Wailee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Rod-Kis
Reviews.Content: Toss up between 4 star/ 5 star.Stayed 3/18-3/24/11 on Honors rewards. Better beach, pool and view vs. Hyatt last Spring break in Kaanapali.Food and drinks are very pricey here as is most everything on the Island ( don't opt for the hemi at car rental with gas at $4.39/gal.). Room was very nice, bathroom was even better however the balcony and view were to die for! Carpeting in room was close to or at end of life cycle. Mandatory Valet parking since Jan. is bogus and was glad I was not paying resort fee. Great beds. Go to Wal-Mart or Safeway and buy cereal/oatmeal ,juice, milk, bread, snacks and lunch meats and save your $ for Dinner out. Gilbert Santiago at front desk and Eric Blair Valet Supv. really get what service is all about, hats off gents!! Wife did the $149.00 Spa Special and loved it. Go to Lahaina Jan.-May for whale watching and drive yourself to top of Haleakala. Do one breakfast at Kihei Cafe and drinks or dinner at Humuhumunucunucuaapua on site and take your camera for magnificient sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money”
Reviews.Author: cattrom
Reviews.Content: We are frequent traveler's and have stayed at the gw in the past. Last year we got a room at four seasons next door and one at the gw for kids, since the pools are the only thing worth enjoying at the gw. This year the four seasons was booked solid and we were all stuck at gw. The spa is run down, the service is young and inexperienced in hospitality. I watched a man squeeze snot out of his daughters nose and wash it away in the kids pool. It is worse than a zoo. No attendants at the adult pool and the service for a 300 a day cabana is a joke. The rooms are damp in napua towers and all need upgrading, rate w tax over 900 a night. The food is mediocre at best. We did have a great meal at Huma Huma and my son loves the camp. $155 a day for camp. Never again for us.

Reviews.Title: “amazingly beautiful site and hotel”
Reviews.Author: avid_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: We were for two nights with my adult daughter who initially was apprehensive of a Disney type hotel. Yes, there is a pool with children, but it is not on the way,and it is also good to see some happy children. The grounds are amazing, and so is the beach in front of the hotel and the natural setting. The open air lobby is elegant , with nice art work and understated majesty. The breakfast room is superb with a great view of the ocean and the gardens, and beautiful birds visiting us occasionally! We were upgraded to a room with (partial?) ocean view:just great! Nice balcony with garden and armchairs, huge marble bathroom. We felt that the price was well worthwhile. We felt that we were in an ideal place with comfort , elegance and beauty. We would like to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nevaeh86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very luxurious! The grounds are breathtaking. Beautiful Wailea beach is right on the resort! It also has many pools including a lazy river. What more can you ask for. The restauraunt prices are ridiculous however. $31.00 for a basic breakfast and $13.00 for a bagel no thank you! I would recommend eating off the resort. Kihei ave has plenty of options nearby. The employees of the hotel are very helpful and friendly. It was very clean as well. One complaint I had was we did not have an inroom safe and they nickel and dime you for everything. Overall it is worth the money because of its beautiful location!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: robert_p07
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Wailea was outstanding! We stayed at the resort for 8 nights and the service provided by the entire staff was exceptional. The room was very large, clean and quiet. The pool was incredible and the grounds were immaculate. Our stay at the Grand Wailea exceeded our expectations and as a result of the great service we received from the entire Wailea staff, we are planning to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time even BETTER than 1st!”
Reviews.Author: fromvancouver666
Reviews.Content: We just spent a fabulous last week at the Grand Wailea. Our expectations were really high as we had previously visited in 2009 and hadn't stopped talking about how great it was for 2 years. The hotel itself was incredibly clean and there were staff working hard all day everyday at it. Even small details such as shining the railings in the Napua Tower we noticed. Our room was incredible - 9th floor with ocean view - saw whales all the time - and after a busy day we would fall into bed and listen to the waves! We found the service overall exceptional, super friendly, quick and helpful. Hotel restaurants were great and the wait staff always made the extra effort to get our picky teen eaters satisfied. Location and set up of hotel was ideal for teenagers... pool kept them busy, beach was awesome, lots of places they could stroll to within the hotel to get popcorn, food etc and feel their much needed independence. We stayed in the Napua tower and absolutely loved it. The breakfast buffet was great (fruit was so great - kids who never eat fruit - loaded up each morning!). We already miss the Napua tower staff - superior customer service and genuinely friendly! There is a beach pass for rental gear - well worth the money for the week - where you can rent boogie boards, kayaks, paddle boards, snorkeling gear - we all tried everything. Earlier morning kayak and snorkelling near the rocks on either side of the beach was a fantastic spot to see turtles. We all can't wait to go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overrated - poor value- careless mandatory valet parking”
Reviews.Author: acesneights
Reviews.Content: Be sure to check your car BEFORE turning it over to the valet parking and ask to see the resort half of the ticket. If they damage it, they merely mark the ticket to show pre-existing damage and there is nothing you can do. They never marked the ticket the ten times we parked there, EXCEPT WHEN THEY DAMAGED the right front panel. When we complained they showed us that the damage was marked on the ticket. Since you don't get a copy of the condition report, they are free to mark up the ticket after they damage it. Other than that, the rooms are average, the food is mediocre, many of the staff are dispirited since the bankruptcy filing. There is evidence of deferred maintenance. This property was acquired by the Blackstone Group, a $50 billion hedge fund at the height of the real estate bubble. They have taken the property through bankruptcy to reduce the enormous debt, but it seems they are out to milk every dollar they can from their guests before the property loses its cachet as a world class resort. If you want to spend $1000 a night in Wailea, try the Four Seasons next door where most of the guests at the Grand Wailea go for world class food (if you are going to spend $300 for dinner for two, it ought to better than mediocre). It's a beautiful resort and you ought to walk through it on your way to the Four Seasons next door.

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: LPLAuburn
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Grand Wailea the 3rd week of March for Spring Break. It was our first trip to Hawaii and I have to say we couldn't have been more pleased with the service and the facilities this hotel had to offer. Everything about it was absolutely beautiful including the ocean view from our room. The beach was beautiful and you could easily snorkel over reefs right off shore. We saw many fish and turtles. This hotel provided as many beach towels as you needed even if you planned excursions away from the hotel. We would certainly go back. Also if you have the time, I highly recommend Hike Maui. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back!”
Reviews.Author: mikemorone
Reviews.Content: It's been three years since we last stayed at the incomparable GW. But when we arrive in 13 days, it will be our fifth time in eight years. Without question, this has been our favorite vacation place. This hotel will impress you in many different ways. For instance, get up and walk the grounds at 3am. You'll appreciate all the service workers cleaning the public areas and pruning the beautiful flora. And for a spa experience, you'll find the GW unsurpassed. Bottom line, this place isn't cheap, but it's always been worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: ETPW
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Grand Wailea for a week and we had a really nice time. We loved the resort location and we were really pleased with our room. We had a Deluxe Ocean View room that was nice and spacious, had a decent sized balcony and had great views of the ocean and pool area. Our room was very clean and the property seemed clean the entire week we were there. As others have mentioned, the rooms are pricey and everything at the resort was expensive, but it wasn't a surprise....most places in Maui are pretty pricey. We have a 3 year old son who travelled with us and he had a ball at the pool. There was so much to do (even for little ones). The spa is amazing and is a must-do for anyone who stays at or anywhere near the resort. In general we had a fantastic time, but we did make note of a couple of things that could be improved upon: - One downside to the pool was the limited number of pool chairs. People get in line at 7am to claim their pool chairs and some people leave them unoccupied for hours. The rule is one hour only, but on most days we saw chairs being left unoccupied for 2-3 hours. - Prior to our vacation we called and asked about cabana rentals and were told we wouldn't need to book a cabana in advance, that it could be booked when we arrived. Regardless of that information, we called the week before our vacation and booked a cabana near the baby beach. When we arrived at the resort we called to confirm the cabana rental and were told that they had no record of our cabana reservation. We figured they'd be a little apologetic, but they really weren't. We were then told that people book the cabanas months in advance (which was completely different from what we were told weeks prior to our trip). The upside was we saved $250 in the cabana rental for that day! - The food and drink service at the pool was hit or miss. We went an entire day without anyone coming to take a drink order. Late in the afternoon, we saw a server and my husband asked her if she could come over to get our drink order and she did, but with zero enthusiasm and customer service skills that most servers at a resort of this caliber would display. On other days we had great pool service so i guess it really just depends on the server. Everyone else at the resort was extremely friendly and our overall experience was great. We had such a lovely time we definitely plan to go back and we would stay at the Grand Wailea again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: gcwilliams80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Wailea in early February. Beautiful property, good experience with the staff. Our room was facing the chapel and courtyard with view of the beach. I had won the trip as a result of a sales promotion, so the only cost to use was food and excursions. The cost of the food on the resort was very high. Definitely not the place to vacation for somebody on a budget. Lots to do on Maui we happened to be in Maui during whale season,would recommend a boat trip out to see the Whales

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds- Expensive Food”
Reviews.Author: win300
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room with a gorgeous view. The grounds were well manicured, but the building appeared to be falling apart,especially near the spa. We stayed away from the "carnival" down by the pool and found that to be a little too "Mexico" for us. I guess we expected more. The restaurant was expensive, but the food was o.k. We went to the Four Seasons to eat.

Reviews.Title: “No accountability!”
Reviews.Author: Jayefo
Reviews.Content: I booked the luau for my extended family (6 people total) through the hotel directly. On the day of the luau it started raining, but no one called so we headed over to the resort. As we valet the car, one of the bell men said the luau had been cancelled. No one had called us. When we went inside, the concierge had no information about our reservation. I started wondering if I had booked at a diiferent resort. I left the family, went back to find my smart phone and sure enough, I had booked at the Grand Wailea. I went back to the concierge and they informed me they outsource the luau. So now its 6:30 PM on a Friday night and I've got a four year old to feed. Good luck trying to get a reservation somewhere nice. The concierge said she would try and "squeeze me in" at the hotel's restaurant. There was no squeezing to be had, lots of empty tables, overpriced, and not original in any way shape or form. They offered the same macadamia nut encrusted fish that the local fast food places offered as well. I learned a painful lesson!

Reviews.Title: “Overated would be an understatement”
Reviews.Author: Floyd099
Reviews.Content: Well, we were referred to this hotel by a friend and were very disappointed. The hotel comes highly rated as a luxury resort. The rooms are no better than holiday inn. The resort is old and not kept up very well. ie paint carpet etc. I had read various reviews before I left and many off them experienced the same things we did. Just super super overrated and let me not even start to tell you how expensive. We make VERY good money and even for us this place was a huge RIP!!! If you want real luxury go to the four seasons. We went there one day for afternoon drinks,the sunset was incredible from there cliff top lobby area. Please understand we are very reasonable people and are easily pleased so take this review seriously before dropping $800 bucks a night for the room alone. The only plus for this hotel is the pool areas if you have young active kids. It's like a mini water park with slides etc. But if you are used to a high level of luxury don't go here. We left two days early and saved 1600 bucks and now going on a second vacation to a nice resort. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spa!”
Reviews.Author: Benita2011
Reviews.Content: The spa was absolutely amazing. I received a massage, sever times, from one lady and she did an amazing job. She was the best messeuse I've been to see. And I have had numerous massages due to migraines. She was phenomenal. I wish I could find someone that good where I live. The other spa attendants were wonderful as well. The bar area by the "adult" pool provided delicious food and beverages. The onion rings and the sauce is absolutely fabulous! The service was great for the casabella - frozen grapes, popsicles, fruit plates, cold towels, water. . . It was a wonderful and fully relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and great property but a few things important to know”
Reviews.Author: reesmarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an absolutely incredible location. The grounds are gorgeous, the beach is beautiful and the rooms are great. We had a deluxe ocean view room and it was well worth the extra money. A few things, however, to note. First off, is that there is not a first class restaraunt there. The "main" restaraunt attempts to appeal to a true tourist crowd with a service staff in tacky outfits and a fish lagoon surrounding it. For true 5 star dining, you need to go next door to Four Seasons where Spago offers the same incredible vantage point but with modern and professional service and decor. Also of note in terms of the property in general is that there are quite a number of kids around which makes for a little bit less relaxation. We had one issue with our room cleanliness. For the most part, it was excellent BUT there was an issue with the bath tub. For three days, we tried to get the bath tub cleaned properly (there were hair in it when we checked in) and it took until the fourth day to get it taken care of....not what you'd expect for $620 per night (although they made up for it with a cash deduction on our rate at the end due to this problem). All in all though, we had a great 10 day trip. This hotel is in a great location, has a great beach and is first class. Like elswhere in Maui, you'll need a car rented to get around but the Four Seasons next door is great for dining options and is in walking distance as is the Fairmont. Grand Wailea is a great place to stay, but hopefully they will upgrade their dining to a more modern 5 star experience like the rest of the property in short order...........

Reviews.Title: “Grand Couple Getaway”
Reviews.Author: love2snorkel17
Reviews.Content: 40th Birthday Celebration vacation. The resort accommodations was a gift. We arrived early 9AM to preregister. My husband asked about the room and they told us we were being upgraded to an ocean view, I cried, because this is what I wanted. We were told the resort fee was being waved but there was a $20 a day valet fee which we were fine with. Resort fees should not exist, you already feel like you paid for resort then they add on this fee. I feel like I am actually getting a service with Valet Fee. They took our phone number to call us when our room was ready and informed us we were free to use the facilities and to leave our luggage but we had other plans with my brother. Nicole and Gilbert (front desk help) were very friendly and courteous. We got the call around 3PM that our room was ready. Bellman Robert (chris daughtry lookalike) was very polite and friendly and did his job well. We were very pleased with our room. Bathroom is huge. I enjoyed a good soak in bath to get all the sand out. Shower was also huge with ledge. Closet was perfectly sized with plenty of hangers. More than enough drawers for clothes. Balcony had table, two chairs, wooden clothes dryer rack, and ottoman. Alarm clock was iphone dock. Bed was a king, soft, white bedding which is a requirement of mine( you can see that it is clean) two kinds of pillows feather and normal to choose from. Room was quiet only noise we heard was day we were checking out we could hear luggage being rolled out early in AM. Housekeeping did an excellent job of keeping room clean and refreshing Towels, and toiletry products. The only odd thing was that there wasn't any coffee cups for our morning coffee so we had to use the glass cups. Never experienced this at a hotel. My brother who stayed at the Marriott said the same thing. Not sure the reasoning behind this. We had a refrigerator which we assumed we had to rent but it was unlocked, nice surprise. Not sure if this is included because person who gifted us the hotel is a hiltons honors member. We never hung out at the pool. Towels were set up early to save spots, but we had no interest to hang out at pool, we prefer the beach. They have a company that rents out snorkel equipment, paddle boards, and body boards with 4 and 7 day packages reasonably priced. It was nice to have chairs and umbrellas provided by the hotel on beach at no additional fee. Water stations around pool is a nice touch. We also enjoyed the POG juice and water at front desk. The valet men worked very hard, always provide cold bottled water in our rental car in the morning. We are not familiar with using valet but quickly learned we could call down to valet and have our car waiting for us. Every employee we interacted with was friendly and did their job well. One night I was half asleep and my husband asked me to put the TV on sleep timer since I had already figured it out. Well somehow I purchased a showtime episode in the process. A couple of days later we went to front desk to check if we were charged and also to explain that A robe was missing. Front desk completely understood the mistake and reversed the TV charge and had two robes sent up to our room with in 15 minutes. I explained we only needed one robe but was told to just keep both in our room. Every time we walked by an employee we were greeted friendly. Gardeners were constantly working on the grounds cleaning up leaves. The grounds are beautiful. The fitness center has a lot of equipment but older than what we are used to at home. We used it once. We did not use the Spa facilities. I prefer to spend money on excursions. Would I stay here again yes if my budget allowed.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Pathora07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for the second time. It was an awesome 8 nights, AGAIN. Wonderful service, all of the workers who helped us were so sincere and helpful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, Humu was wonderful and very romantic. Bistro Molokini has really good food for lunch if you want a step up from the poolside restaurant, which is good too. It is cool that kids can swim while their parents eat beside them. I don't have kids, but I love the slides, pools, and especially the GROTTO BAR. It was awesome fun. You swim up in a cave and have mai tais, etc. while listening to great music; it can't be beat. The ocean is awesome, as are the umbrellas at the beach. You can easily walk to Mala or Spago, Duo and Ferraros, and it is a short walk to the shops at Wailea as well. It was a fantasy week and I loved it. I plan to go back and do the same next year. Don't miss it. My room was floor level facing the chapel and was awesome. Each time the valet brings your car they have 2 ice cold bottles of water in it waiting for you. I honestly have no complaints and only raves. Four Seasons looks nice, but if I had to go to the pool there, I would go for an hour or two and leave. At Grand Wailea, you stay all day and slide, swim, ride the rapids, grotto bar, etc. AWESOME FUN, even for this 40+ year old couple with no kids. And of course the spa was awesome per usual, don't miss the terme. I had my hair done as well, and that was a great experience too. Go to Maui and Grand Wailea for the time of your lives.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: GKMJ
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Grand Wailea with our two boys, 10 and 8, to celebrate our younger son's birthday and to commemorate his being cancer free for 5 years. It was nothing short of spectacular! The entire resort and our room were beautifully appointed and thoroughly clean. The hotel gave us a lovely welcome basket of goodies (we had mentioned what we were celebrating when we checked in). The beach is beautiful and swimmable with nice stuff to see snorkeling and plenty of fun rental equipment. The food was fantastic. But I have to say the standout, especially for the boys, was the waterpark - pool after pool with waterfall slides connecting them, and even a couple of really big waterslides, a rope swing, and a lazy river - they never wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Spa Grande package in US Airways magazine”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBill
Reviews.Content: We found an ad for a "Spa Day" @ Spa Grande at the Grande Wailea in the US Airways magazine. The ad was for an hour of hydro massage, one hour facial or massage, lufah exfoliation, lunch, valet parking, access to their facilities. All for $298 per couple plus taxes and gratuities. The facility and the staff were excellent. It was a great way to spend a day. "Rack Rates" for these services were about 3 times as much, so a good deal, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful piece of property but needs work in other areas”
Reviews.Author: kywcat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights from Jan. 27 - Feb. 4. We stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando recently so we were excited about staying at another W A location. The resort has breathtaking views and we were fortunate to have an upgraded room on the 9th (top) floor. However, the rooms felt less like a 5-star Waldorf Astoria and more like a typical 3-1/2 - 4 star hotel room. We actually asked for a new room after the first night because the room did not meet our expectations. The second room was a little bit cleaner but it still needed to be remodeled. Ironically, the resort was recently renovated in the past few years. The service lacked 5 star quality as well. Overall, we did enjoy the many amenities at the resort. First of all, the pool and beach area were top notch. There's a couples only pool or a family/fun pool with a waterslide and cave bar. Since Maui has one of the best climates in the world, huge pool and beach area was perfect for fun and relaxation. Also, the spa was top notch. My wife and I each enjoyed a massage. I recommend getting there an hour before so you can utilize the spa facilities because it is well worth it. For fitness, the excercise gym was one of the better facilities I've seen in a hotel. One final note, we ate at all of the restaurants including the pool restaurants and the food was just average in comparison to some of the other restaurants in the area. The signature restaurant at the Grand Wailea (HumuHumu????) was good but if you want a great meal walk along the path by the beach to the Four Seasons and eat at Spago or Duo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for children”
Reviews.Author: lanad0
Reviews.Content: I read all of these reviews before deciding on the Grand Wailea for a week with my family, which includes young children. Yes, it is pricey and you should not go if you can't stomach paying $20 for a cocktail, but it was totally worth it for us. The location is amazing, the beach is perfect and close (unlike the Fairmont and Four Seasons) and the pools are heaven for young kids. Nothing else compares to the pool scene here. The Fairmont and Four Seasons are more grown up and elegant in my opinion, but this is not what we wanted with young children. You can tell the resort was built in the early 90s and definitely needs a little updating (the peach paint on the exterior is cheesy), but the grounds are beautiful and huge. Until our children are older, we would not change a thing as they had the time of their lives. The fridge in our room was complimentary by the way. The room was decent and clean but not huge. You could see some wear and tear in the bathrooms, so updating will likely happen in the near future, one would hope. But these were all minor complaints as we had a fabulous holiday here. Our breakfast was included and we loved the buffet at the grand dining room every morning. I had a mediocre massage at the spa, but the baths there were lovely. Highly recommend this hotel to families. If you are a stickler for perfection, go to the Four Seasons, where the scene is little more quiet and grown up. The Grand Wailea was heavenly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Davidmoss54
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, right on the beach, fantastic grounds,fantastic views and some of the greatest people in the business working there. This is a great all around resort experience no matter why you are coming to Maui. Nicest wedding chapel beautiful ocean view golf course right next to it and one of the best pool and beach areas on Maui. For a group or convention it must be fantastic. There was a big group in the hotel but we hardly noticed it. The area for conventions is well separated from the rest of the hotel. Rated one of the best spa's in the world.

Reviews.Title: “You have to LOVE MARILYN...”
Reviews.Author: aLITTLESpoiled
Reviews.Content: Even the beginning of our stay with Marilyn in Reservations patiently answering every question... The Grand Wailea has undergone many changes since it opened, but the people are the charm that never changes...

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was amazing but very pricey.”
Reviews.Author: DinIndy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Grand Wailea. We were greeted immediately by bellmen who parked our car and took the luggage right up to the room. The service was very quick and responsive during our stay. Our car was down in front right within minutes of requesting it with ice cold bottles of water waiting on each passenger. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds were amazing. They were just the right amount of firm and had enough pillows for the two of us. The bathroom was big enough to be a room itself..which helped because my girlfriend used most of it for her makeup and toiletries. The grounds were very big and kept nicely. There were plenty of pools and hot tubs to keep us busy and even secluded ones for privacy. The best part was the grotto bar. The beach was right there as well if that's what you're looking for...great place to watch the sunset. The only drawback to the GW is the cost of staying there. We were fortunate enough to get a reduced rate on the room so we might have noticed this more than people that have the money to stay at such a nice hotel but when you're ordering $21 fruity drinks ($14 if you keep the plastic pineapple, which we lost twice, they're GOO-OOO-OOOD) and paying $55 each for brunch it's a bit much. However, that's the only drawback I could see at all. I'd say if you're looking for a great place to stay on Maui the Grand Wailea is a great option if money is not really a concern.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea experience was Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: pamperedschaaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for two nights Feb 11 and Feb 12. We were originally scheduled to stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani but had to change our plans due to a big snowstorm. I had looked at staying at the Grand Wailea for our entire trip but I was worried that it would just be too much of a "scene" for us and not be relaxing. I walked over the Grand Wailea the day before we checked in and talked to one of the clerks at the registration desk. She could not have been nicer. I explained our situation and she said "yeah, come on over and spend all day, even if your room is not ready...". So that's what we did. We wore our swimsuits and coverups and left all our luggage with the bellman until our room was ready. We arrived at about 12:00 and our room was ready a little after 1:00. Nice. The front desk called my cell to tell me. I left the kids and hubby at the pool and met the bellman and he took me to our room with all our luggage. He was very friendly and filled me in about the property, The bellman suggested that I get a refrigerator for the room when he found out I have two kids, but he didn't tell me it is $8.00 a day. Not a big deal, but I would have liked to know upfront. The front desk told me that our room was a complimentary upgrade. The room was on the ground level and it had a view of a little grassy area and some paths that lead to the upper pool. If I looked at a certain angle there was a peek-a-boo view through the trees to the ocean. The room was smaller than the Kea Lani suite (as I knew it would be) the bellman opened the slider to the patio and it was pretty.
