The bathroom was a little worn, with cracked tiles and mildew (I hate when other people point this out, but it was!). The first impression was good, but upon closer look you could see that this room was worn and needed some TLC. The beds were made but you could clearly see indentations on the pillowtop/mattress top, like the mattress was worn out. There are white shutters that slide over the patio door at night instead of drapery. I was ok with the room until we tried to go to sleep and I could hear music and people talking and walking and pushing carts on the tile floors. I hardly slept at all the first night and either did my husband. I guess our room was off the the side below the Grand Ballrooom and there was loud music going that we could clearly hear from our shuttered room. Also, when the room was closed up it smelled kind of bad/musty. I couldn't wait to open the big slider each time we came in. My kids were crazy about the pool. There was plenty of seating. The first day we sat by the activities desk and it was loud and busy with the music playing and lots of people coming and going. The next day we sat near the upper pool deck and there was hardly anyone around, plenty of chairs both shade and sun. There was no issue trying to find a chair. I spent quite a bit of time going down the slides and the lazy river/rapids and my kids loved it that we were all in the pool together. We ate lunch at the volcano bar and none of us really liked our lunch. Ok, strike one. Later, my hubby and I went to the Molokini rest/bar and I had the WORST lava flow drink ever. It tasted like they put dish detergent in my glass w/ the drink. My husband had a tropical drink and it was very weak. We decided not to eat dinner there and left for Tommy Bahama's at The Shops at Wailea. The next day I enjoyed the pool and I ordered two more drinks, one was GREAT and the other was borderline bad. The waitress said it depends on who the bartender is on duty. Not really my problem, when I am paying $14 for a drink they should all be good. On the good side, the grounds are stunning and I took tons of pictures of the fountains and grounds and I even bought a painting of the chapel. There are other pretty properties that have more consistent food and drink service, so I'm not sure that the grounds make up for the terrible drinks and the worn room. One more issue bothered me that I will mention. Recently the GW instituted mandatory valet parking for $20 a day in addition to the $25 a day resort fee. I knew about it in advance. One night it was raining heavily and we waited about 15 minutes for our car and then they parked it out in the rain, not even under the canopy. The valet did bring the umbrella to the car for me, but my husband and kids walked in the rain, it defeats the purpose of having a valet, right? It happened again the next day when we checked out, we had all our luggage and were waiting and waiting for our car for about 15 minutes (even though we called from our room). When the valet finally brought our car he parked it on the far side of the drive from where we were standing. It really frosted me that we had to do the mandatory $20.00 valet and they can't even pull the car up to me (there weren't that many people out there). Maybe they are cutting corners on drinks, food, and staff due to the bankruptcy, but I am still paying top dollar to stay there. It was fun to check out, but I wouldn't stay there for more than a night or two, not even sure about that. I will just say again that there are other properties that have more consistent service. The Grand Wailea has so much potential if they can work out some of their service issues and give the rooms some TLC. I hope that they can emerge from bankruptcy stronger and more consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Our third visit...cannot wait to return for the fourth and more”
Reviews.Author: ATP1
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel. We spent part of our honeymoon here over 6 years ago. We had a wonderful time here last February, and our visit this February did not disappoint. This hotel and the lovely grounds and pools are an amusement park for adults. The service is excellent. Everyone is friendly. The food is very good. My husband and I love the Molokini Bistro -- we eat there nearly every night due to the combination of the food, the service, and the setting. The spa is topnotch. I have been there twice before. The lomi lomi massage is heavenly! However, this time, a mild cold that I was fighting from the previous week had morphed into a major sinus infection. We were with a friend -- she and I had been planning our visit to the spa for months. So I really tried to put my best foot forward and join her at the spa. However, after I got to the spa, got my locker, took a shower, etc., I realized I was feeling far too sick to have a massage. I felt so ill that I was fully prepared to accept that fact that I'd likely have to pay for a massage that I wouldn't be getting. Much to my surprise, upon learning about my condition, the manager of the spa informed me that I would not be charged. She and the other staff members seemed honestly concerned about my well-being. I was EXTREMELY impressed because they had every right to charge me since we were well within the 24-hr cancellation window. I was so grateful, and I ended up spending that money at the Urgent Care facility in Kihei to treat my massive sinus infection. This gesture really impressed me, and we are already planning our next trip back to this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for perfection, you'll find it here”
Reviews.Author: Michelle766
Reviews.Content: My best trip ever. The hotel is exceptional, the staff is attentive, informed and very friendly. The rooms are well appointed, comfortable and plush. As you'd expect they would be at the Waldorf Astoria. It's a tropical paradise, from the moment you walk into the front lobby all the way to the incredible beach access. The lovely paved walking trail, that takes you all around the property as well as the hotels to either side is it's own destination. The food was truly 5 star. We had sticker shock the first night, but then we tasted the incredible food that was served. It was worth every penny. It is not a value trip. You'll spend and spend here. But, spending on perfection is a whole different animal. There is a safeway about 10 minutes down the main street. We stocked up on snacks, wine and bottled water. We had a garden level room with a lovely patio. Every evening the sun would set behind the Chapel and we'd have a glass of wine and toast the most beautiful thing on earth. Go, Go, Go. Enjoy. You'll never forget it and you'll never regret the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kartice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel and my my my it was amazing. Our main reason for going was to renew our vows. The hotel is absolutely stunning. Very exotic location and when compared to the others it stands out like a sore thumb. The hotel is like paradise. It fulfills the Hawaii experience 100%. The room was very clean. However, needs upgrading on toliet and shower. The scenery and splashing waves against the rocks from our balcony was priceless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: OhCanadaOh
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. I have no complaints, and I am considering a return next year. There's no question IT AIN'T CHEAP, but it is Breathtaking! Good food, great spa and fantastic grounds!

Reviews.Title: “Great use of Hilton Honors Points”
Reviews.Author: Joel G
Reviews.Content: For those other Diamond level HHonors members: Reserved a Terrace Garden room, got upgraded to Deluxe Ocean view. Best views on 7th or above floors. Given two free drinks coupon at HumuHumu (bartenders would give you anything), note that there are restrictions for the hours you can use them. Also given $40 voucher, which was awesome. We loved Humu bar area - reserve bar table #5 for 5:30 (arrive at 5) and watch the best sunset in Wailea. We did it four times - and we usually never visit the same place twice while on vacation. The $25 daily resort fee was waived. However, was told there was a "new" $20 daily mandatory valet charge. We were only charged for one day out of six. There is a free hospitality room that you can use to shower (if your flight leaves in the evening and you don't want to stink on the way back home after checking out that morning). This was our third trip to Hawaii and we spent more time enjoying this resort than any other. Other resorts were more of a "home base" to explore the island. We found ourselves cancelling our planned excursions because we were having such a good time on the grounds. We are avid snorklers and pride ourselves in finding spots that no one else knows about to find hidden gems. With that said, the best snorkle we had besides Molokini was around the left corner of the beach here at Grand Wailea. Keep going until the reef ends abruptly in front of the condos. Dive under the water and hear the whales. Everything was clean and fresh - loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great week and worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: jhawkfan31
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is beautiful and on a great beach. The staff accommodated our every request- we never heard no. The large ocean view room was clean and well furnished. It appears most rooms face the ocean and have a lanai with at least 2 chairs and a table. We spent our time at the beach each day and only enjoyed the swim up bar one afternoon. The bar offered a nice mix of sun and shade. The spa staff and facilities are awesome. The spa lounge is outside with a view of the ocean. We cannot wait to go back. We are already looking for dates for next January and we will definitely stay at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: vangruna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea 1/24-1/28 as the last part of our honeymoon. Upon arriving we were greated by a valet attendant who told us we could not self park, we did not know this when we had booked the hotel and probably would have not if we had known this. We had saved up our money for this special occasion to stay at here and weren't expecting an extra $25/day. And during our stay we observed guests going to their own cars and not using the valet. Upon checking in the receptionist was not friendly, she seemed very rushed and sent us on our way with the bellman to take us to our room. The room itself was overlooking the Molokini parking lot but had great views of the ocean from the balcony and the smell from the flowers below was incredible although it was constantly loud when outside on the balcony. The room itself was fine although our shower did not work the 2nd day there, we called the front desk who said maintenance would be taking care of it, when we arrived back at the hotel later that evening it had still not been fixed, finally at 10pm, when we were in bed they called to let us know it would be fixed by the morning and that we could change rooms if we wanted, at this late time we decided to wait until morning. The shower was not fixed until the 3rd day and they did not charge us the resort fee for our stay which was nice. The maintenance personnel, housekeeping and valet attendant staff were all very friendly despite the problems we had. My husband and I enjoyed using the adult pool and strolling along the beach, if you are going there for a pool experience this would be the place to go. We were also shocked by the price of food at the hotel and realized by the 2nd day that we would go elsewhere for food, $12 for a breakfast burrito and $13 for a quesadilla!! That's a little ridiculous to me, we ended up spitting those 2 meals so it would be cheaper. If you are looking to spend all your time at the hotel and the pool this would be a great place to stay but just wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 10 day stay in a beautiful part of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Gymspinna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days from Jan 15 to Jan 25. It was our first trip to Maui and our purpose was to relax. The hotel is set in beautiful grounds with water features and sculptures everywhere. The lush gardens are constantly being worked on - we thought they were beautifully kept. The hotel's facilities were wide ranging: the extensive pools were fantastic fun for all ages. There was staff located at each rapid, or at the tarzan swing from 10am to 5pm for safety. The rapids and slides are closed outside of these times - but there was plenty of other pool space to enjoy after that. We were able to get sun beds every day at our leisure - there was no annoying reserving of stuff at 6.30 am. The Spa Grande was a lovely experience. We took the special deal $149 which gave an hour's use of the spa baths/saunas etc before a 50min massage (included $25 toward a lunch/dinner at Molokini bistro). I thought this was an enjoyable and indulgent experience - both our masseurs were great. Make sure you get there an hour before your massage to use the different baths and saunas etc. The gym was excellent for a hotel - better equipped than some professional gyms! There are some gym classes but some you have to pay an extra $10 eg. spin classes. The yoga classes are complimentary. Give it a go even if you're a beginner. I liked the 7am beach yoga with no-nonsense Nancy. Our room was in the lagoon wing on the 1st floor. Great king size bed, beautiful bathroom - all kept clean. Wifi in room. Everything good quality and worked. Amazing sunsets. Breakfast in the Grand Dining room - a huge buffet with American/European/Hawaiian/Japanese dishes and an egg station. During our 10-day stay we were always able to choose something we liked from the buffet. Staff was quick to refill, in our experience. Egg guy was great. We found the staff at Grand Wailea to be friendly and non-intrusive (which is how we like it). I suppose I could go on - but the review is already a bit rambling. On the whole we had an amazing stay - something for everyone. The one annoyance was the $25 daily resort fee. You know of course before you book. I liked the fact that you didn't have to go with the valet parking at $20 a day but you could self-park and this was included in the $25 fee. They have now changed this arrangement and you have to take the valet parking at $20 p/day and the resort fee has been reduced to $20 p/day. Just take this in to account when you are looking at the daily cost of staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lars27
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference at the Hotel. The room was very nice, the Restaurants had excellent food and the pools and facilities were awesome!! Be careful of the waves however.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tapow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here in January. The location and rooms a great. The staff was first class from the moment we checked in until we left. we will return..

Reviews.Title: “horrible, was shocked at how different it was compared to reviews”
Reviews.Author: TableOf5
Reviews.Content: Just all around bad :( Engineering couldn't get our TV to work w/ a remote, loud, unkempt, etc. . . it's basically a MOTEL w/ a waterpark. There were piles of soiled towels everywhere outside, bathroom by pool had wallpaper peeling off, etc. . . I could literally go on and on. Service was horrible, even management agreed to let us out of reservations that were supposed to be non-refundable thankfully. One woman at the desk acknowledged that they had way over sold. WTHeck!?! Willing to sacrifice service for squeezing a few more folks in . . . shame on you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property”
Reviews.Author: DrDBA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous property!!!!! Great pool complex. I can see why there are negative reviews when kids are out of school, as the water slides and other amenities are great for kids. I visited while kids were in school, so they didn't bother me. Wailea is the best location in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “BLOWS THE FOURS SEASONS NEXT DOOR AWAY ON MOST LEVELS!!!”
Reviews.Author: srosenman
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in Hawaii, and spent time at both Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. We dined one evening at Spago at Four Seasons, which was terrific, skip the crabcake (poor) and the atmosphere was very serene, but overall, the Grand Wailea has it all over the Four Seasons. SERVICE: The serivce is comparable in terms of friendliness and capability with the main difference in being the Four Seasons employees were more proactive approaching guests (due to their relatively small size). We had the pleasure of staying in the Napua tower (exclusive tower) and the staff was 100% friendly and helpful. To note, Nupua tower includes an extended continential style breakfast (excellent by the way and we ate there each morning), as well as afternoon tea and cocktail time with lite bites each evening. Loved the free business center and Internet. We are Hilton HHonors Gold using points and even the $25 resort fee was waived! Valet parking staff was exceptional and worth the $20/day. Not only did they deliver the cars quickly and with a smile, but they offered help navigating the island. ROOMS: Casual island elegance. We had an ocean view, king bed. Bed lovely, bathroom very spacious and this coming from someone with a 50 sq. foot shower at home. maid staff very good and left lovely surprises in the evenings and departure. Walls thick so you dont hear neighboring rooms, plantation shutters kept room 100% dark. View awesome of ocean and mountains! Our room had fridge at no charge. Large LCD hi-def TV. GROUNDS: Inside and out...Immaculate, extraordinary and just plain paradise. This is where the resort simply crushes the Four Seasons next door. The Four Seasons looks like a motor lodge next to the Grand Wailea (inside and out) and they should be ashamed of their pool area compared the GW. We were at GW during high season, and there were NO CROWDS, kids were wll behaved and mostly confied to kids pool areas. Think luxury, beauty combined with convenience. The GW also has the nicest, widest stretch of beach with no rocks. snorkeling excellent to the left and right side of beach. Lunch excellent, facilities wonderful...not so much at the Four Seasons. Downside would be action closes early, with food done by 10pm unless you go room service. Shops of Wailea close though with plenty of low cost options. We stay at many of the worlds finest resorts and go 5 star all the way...would definatley say The Grand Wailea is up there with the best, and has been the nicest Hawaiian hotel we have ever been to (out of several top hotels on Maui, Hawaii and Oahu).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, peaceful, customer service absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: bunnybirdSacramento
Reviews.Content: Great location on Maui. The Grand Wailea staff were wonderful. The beach was beautiful, water was warm and beach staff were very accommodating, offering all the beach activities, the pool was great as well as all the restaurants with all the gorgeous breathtaking ocean views, had a great time, vacation of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: muppins
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so beautiful and with such a friendly staff, that I relocated from another hotel after visiting the Grand Spa. They must treat their employees well because they are all very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to relax for a couple days and just enjoy yourself, if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: fischi19
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is truly an amazing hotel. It starts with a warm welcome and a quick and uncomplicated check in. The rooms are amazing. We stayed in a ocean view room on the 6th floor, overlooking parts of the hotel own park and the ocean. The rooms are very big, with complimentary fast WiFi, a big TV (which we never used), a nice balcony and any amenity that makes your stay comfortable. The bathroom is really big and maybe the nicest part of the whole room. The whole hotel complex is very well maintained, it almost looks like Disneyland, but it's real. The breakfast buffet is amazing, with all kind of fresh fruit, pancakes, bagels, various juices, a omelett/egg station that cooks them according to your personal preference. We once had dinner at the humuhumunukunuku and that was a great experience as well. The food is simply delicious. The pool area is very big, with many interconnecting pools and slides. The masterpiece for us was the swim-up bar. Sipping you MaiTai while being in the water and enjoying the Maui sun is simply priceless. The only downpoint about the hotel is that the service staff was once in a while not completely up to upscale, european hotel standards. But in general they did an ok job and I was told that on Hawaii, clocks tick a little different. The second downpoint, but that you know it when you book a waldorf astoria resort, is the high prices. If you can't pay it with a smile, don't do it. Just to give you an idea, the two of us together paid for the ocean view room per day, with breakfast, lunch and dinner including drinks, tips, taxes and so on about 1000$ per day, about 150 dollar per day we spent on drinks only, i was quite thirsty :) For me that was well worth it and i would go back in a heartbeat if ever I am on Maui again. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Grand Wailea Finale”
Reviews.Author: ecs10022010
Reviews.Content: We had been told we must stay at the Grand Wailea by our best friends who also honeymooned there. Because it was over Christmas, it was expensive, so we budgeted to have our last two nights of our two week honeymoon spent at the Grand Wailea. We were greeted with amazing warmth, a $40 Voucher for Humu's which we already had made reservations for our last dinner and a free bottle of champagne along with our dinner. In the three other hotels we stayed throughout our two weeks, this was the only hotel that actually recognized our honeymoon. We stayed in the exclusive Nupua Tower which offers continental breakfast and cocktails/apps in a private lounge. The lobby bar was wonderful with live music and Humu's was the most romantic dinner for our last night. The pool is one of the most amazing pools ever. Everytime you explore, you find a new waterfall, slide or hideaway to layout. The grotto swim-up bar is the coolest thing I've ever seen - swim up to a built-in table or hide under the waterfall to sip on your mai-tai - too cool. We had a wonderful Hawaiian pizza at the Bistro restaurant for lunch and had to take home the touristy pinapple souvenier glasses! Finally, we must comment on the spa. Kohler Spa is the only other spa in the many spas I've visted that even comes close to this unique experience. Definitely recommend having a some sort of treatment if only to use the pre-treatment bathing facilities. What a perfect way to end a perfect honeymoon - it was truly a Grand Finale at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Resort is not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: adammock1
Reviews.Content: Upon reading numerous reviews of the Grand Wailea Resort, we were willing to pay the exorbitant price to stay there over Christmas. We paid over $12,000 for three rooms from December 22-27, 2010. We quickly realized we were paying the higher price not for the luxury we expected, but simply because demand exceeded supply over the holidays. If youâ€™re not going to appreciate crowds by the pools and waterslides and the inability to get food after 11:30 pm, this is not the resort for you. Our grievances throughout our stay are as follows: Check-in: While we were greeted warmly and efficiently, we were provided with very little information about the resort. For example, no info about pool times, the necessity of getting a wristband to be around the pool, etc. We appreciate that this is the peak time at the hotel, but some words of warning about crowds at breakfast and around the pools would have certainly have been helpful â€“ we waited almost 20 minutes to get a table at breakfast and it was almost impossible to find chairs at the pool. Rooms: Our rooms were spacious and comfortable. However, there were small annoyances that you would not anticipate when youâ€™re paying almost $4000/room for a five-night stay. In one room, light bulbs were burned out, and in another, the toilet would run constantly. At least maintenance was reasonably prompt to respond to these issues. Activities: When working with the concierge desk, they were very helpful at booking activities and making dinner reservations. However, their information regarding the activities was both limited and inaccurate. We were provided no information about the ticketing process/table assignment for the luau (which we would recommend, once we figured it out!), the concierge gave us false information about the end time and transportation time for one of our tours, and we were led to believe use of the tennis facilities was include. (Itâ€™s not â€“ in fact the tennis facilities have no association with the resort) While our stay, overall, was pleasant, it is simply not what you would expect when paying the rates that we paid. We certainly expected more from the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Period”
Reviews.Author: Schtev1
Reviews.Content: It was our 10th anniversay, having been married at this very hotel. We made plans in advance to stay a week here. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well. We arrived prior to check in and they had a room available for us. (unlike the other resort where I also commented on). We had a beautiful ocean view room, over looking the Chapel where we were "maui'd"..stunning. I read alot of comments on this forum and fathom on some of the negative comments. "the food was horrible" ?? we had a car, we used it twice in a week! the food at this hotel is fabulous! From the excellent pool side service, to the Grand Buffet, everything was excellent. We ordered room service one night and I was treated to one of the best pizzas I have ever ate!, and the kids mac and cheese was enourmous and awesome. Remember folks, this is Maui and everything is expensive on the Island, but I didn't find the prices here that unreasonable. If your looking to save a nickle or dime - and honestly, if you stew if you pay $4 for a coke - this isnt' your type of hotel..- this isn't the place for the folks that schlep a cooler and lawn chairs, if thats you...go stay down the road in Kihei. The location is also the best in Maui, the beach here is fabulous, plently of sand and no big "drop off" like you find in Kaanapali. And for those with kids, the pools and slides here are the best I have ever seen, the pools are very clean, and the Kids Camp is a fabulous place for your youngsters to make friends, learn about Maui and explore the world around them. .The grounds are spectacular, IMO the best on Maui and the four seasons next door doesn't even compare! ( I don't get the raves for that place..the kids pool was as big a bathtub..oh thats right, they only want stars and no kids) From the staff, the rooms..the grounds food etc. We had one of the best vacations of our lifetime..and G-D willing we will be back next year. Mahalo to all at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was absolutely amazing! Itâ€™s hard to save up for, but worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: emanon256
Reviews.Content: Rooms: We got a basic garden view room, it was the least expensive, but did not seem cheep in any way. I asked about an upgrade and was told they were at 100% occupancy with none available. We were in the Chapel wing on the first floor and I must say the room was amazing. I was very impressed. The bed was very comfortable, the room, bathroom, patio, were huge, and very well appointed. Beautiful bathrooms, beautiful furniture, and we even had a waterfall near our door in one of the many amazing gardens. Humuâ€™s: I got a Mai Tai, which normally I am not a fan of when they give them out at most Hawaiian hotels, but this was highly recommended by some other guests; letâ€™s just say I am a fan of Humuâ€™s Mai Tais. Wow! The service was impeccable, attentive, and knowledgeable. The food was all good. I recommend the Ahi Traps. Resort food tends to be expensive, thought the GWâ€™s food wasnâ€™t outrageously expensive, it was actually less than I expected. (Please donâ€™t use this as a cue to raise your prices). Pools: For being at 100% occupancy, the hotel sure did not feel crowded. They really did a great job of laying things out, having a variety of pools, etc. Donâ€™t get me wrong, it was pretty crowded, but it still felt personable, lots of small pool areas, etc. Most of the chairs were taken if we didnâ€™t rush out at 6am, but we eventually found two chairs together both days. Also, be sure you go to the activities desk and get a wrist band each day. We didnâ€™t know this our first day, and security will ask you to leave if you donâ€™t have one. I guess people try to sneak in from the Four Seasons or the Marriott? There were a lot of children, though Hawaii is a family destination, so we expected this. Most were very well behaved, supervised by parents, etc. But I feel I need to warn others who are looking for more of an adult only retreat, thought they did have an adult only pool, but that was more crowded than others. The pools are fun. They have a network of waterslides connecting the pools and even have a water elevator if you donâ€™t want to climb the stairs. I donâ€™t think I have been to a water park type place in over 20 years; letâ€™s just say I had a lot of fun. Many other adults were partaking in the waterslides too. Pool/Food/Bars: We have stayed in a lot of resort type places over the past few years, and the GW is defiantly in the top two to three. The staff is so nice and helpful, very personable. The drinks by the pool are reasonably priced for a resort of this caliber, and they do not skimp on the alcohol. The food was amazing, even with pool side service. The pool side service is slow, but the wait staff always told us what the expected time would be, as they prepare all of the food fresh. They also have a grotto bar that you swim up too. Itâ€™s inside a cave with flowers growing out of the walls, amazing! Though the music gets loud later in the day, but they have tables outside the bar as well, also in the water. We had such a great time at the GW and canâ€™t wait to go back. It was an amazing experience, beautiful grounds which we walked for hours, amazing hospitality, and everything was just designed really well. There is shopping on site, and an outdoor mall within walking distance. They have activities on site, though we didnâ€™t participate in much on this stay. We did go to the marine station and learn about whales. But we were more into relaxing and hanging by the pool and walking on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “8 Day Stay = Full Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: COtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed with another couple on the 7th floor in two Deluxe Ocean View rooms. The staff was above average and in some cases excellent. I have attached pictures to show off the accommdations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should not have the Waldorf Astoria name!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights and we were very disappointed. The entrance and lobby are spectacular, but it all stops there. The rooms are fair at best and badly need renovating and decorating. The carpet in the room was disgusting! The room was bland and the furniture was old and unattractive. The staff were not service oriented at all and acted as if they were doing us a favor by waiting on us! The breakfast buffet was very small and not refilled rapidly. When we requested some items to be refilled, the staff member responded to my husband with, "I'm working on it dude!" The internet was not working in our room and we called 3 times and got no response until my son got nasty with them on the 5th day there. It was then repaired. The concierge gave us some very poor advice on how to travel back from a day trip, sending us on a very treacherous route. The concierge also didn't get us our dinner reservations at the times we requested. At the pool, it took a long time to find someone to take your order and it took a very long time to get the food. The staff were not accomadating of special food requests and were even sarcastic with us. I hope the sarcastic waitress at the pool restaurant enjoyed the lack of a tip for her poor attitude and service! The front desk staff were also very curt and abrupt when approached. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member and we have stayed at other Waldorf properties and this one is definitely not up to par!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica666
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Hawaii with our four kids ages 4-14. We first went to Kauai which is unbelievably beautiful. After being in such a gorgeous setting Maui was a let down. The grand wailea tells you that all rooms are ocean view. They are not. There are palm trees blocking the views from the first 5 floors! The hotel has zero customer service and they charge extra for everything! Even the simple kids art activities at the pool are 25.00 extra a day. The servers were rude. Forget room service bc they don't even answer the phone. The beach has no service. We were paying a lot to stay there and felt like it was a money pit with Bo care for their guests. The food was terrible and expensive. It was not relaxing, indulgent or enjoyable there period. We walked over to the four seasons and for the same priced dinner a's wailea we were treated amazingly. The kids were given toys to play with. My teenager was given a teen menu even. The food was out of this world and their attention to their guests was top notch. We are regulars at at. Regis, ritz and four seasons properties and Hawaii was a big deal for us to travel to with four kids and the wailea was a huge key down and a waste if money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a nice beach, fun swimming pool and relaxing spa”
Reviews.Author: petlad
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. Our room was clean and spacious. We loved the easy access to the beach. The pools were so much fun especially the slides. We wished the lazy river moved faster like the one at the Aruba Surf Hotel. We dined at one of the restaurants which was nice and in a great location with a nice view of the beach. The location of the hotel provided easy access to the highway and was a short distance to the town of Kihei which had a lot of restaurants and shops. The spa was fantastic. We first experienced the hydrotherapy which gives you the chance to relax in different baths and also in the saunas. We then went onto the massage and body scrub. The rain shower scrubs were great and feel very relaxing. The price for the hotel was a bit high but we very happy that we were able to use our points!

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: whirligir1
Reviews.Content: We were at the Grand Wailea the week before Thanksgiving. Everything about the hotel was lovely, no complaints there. My husband & I had Grand Wailea spa treatments, they were fine. We were so excited to share the pools/slides with our kids, ages 6 12, and 16. And while it was fun, for a few days, it was way too crazy and crowded. Like others said, if you weren't down to the pools by 7:30 a.m., you did not get a chair...the WHOLE day! One morning someone removed all our stuff and it ended up in security. It is just a frenzy, too stressful when all you want to do is relax!! After a week at the Grand Wailea, we moved to a condo just a 1/4 mile down the road and I was SO surprised, our kids said they liked the condo better! Didn't expect that! I'm glad we got to experience the Grand Wailea ONCE, but I would not stay here again. If you do go, upgrade to the Napua tower, the concierge wing of the hotel. The breakfast and evening "appetizers" were all we needed for breakfast/dinner, it saved us some $$. Lunches for five of us came to at least $125 at the poolside eating place, so having the "free" food made us happy! (We still usually went out to dinner, but it was nice to have that option). And the GW, at least when we were there, is definitely a family place. If you are honeymooners, I would definitely go somewhere else more romantic and quiet. This reminded me a little of Disney World, happy to be there for a few days but even more happy when you leave! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: KimD7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wailea as the second part of my honeymoon. Wish I continued my stay at the Four Seasons on the big island. Problems started at check in. Not sure why the front desk staff would think it was a good idea (knowing it was our honeymoon) to put us in a room right in front of the water slide. We tried to access the pools later that afternoon, and the next day but the pool decks, and the beach were way overcrowded to the point of being unsafe. This hotel is definitely not a Waldorf nor is the staff trained properly. The hotel allows outsiders to access their pool, as long as they have a bracelet and they don't monitor to make sure you are a hotel guest. If you are looking for a Nascar tailgate, complete with coolers, and cans of beer, or a spring break atmosphere this is your spot. Needless to say after dealing with the clientele, and the staff being severely under-trained we left property and went to the beach in town. Town beach was less crowded and people were much nicer, good thing we paid good money for the amenities so others could use them. Once the weekend was over and the crowds subsided somewhat, the hotel informs us that the spa was under repair and that the women had no locker room. Thanks for letting us know in advance considering the spa treatment was booked 6 months in advance. The next day Tuesday the hotel made us aware that 2 of the 3 restaurants would close earlier then advertised, and the pools, and slides were going to be closed for renovations. I couldn't take any more I contacted the management, and a week later I am still waiting for the supervisor on duty to call me back. did I mention that the staff is not trained properly, and that this is not a Waldorf. So if Jaime [-] is reading this I am still waiting for your response. If I had the opportunity for refund and could cancel my stay after the first day I would have checked out after the first night, instead I was stuck there for 6 additional nights. Stay away at all costs. Better and more authentic Hawaiian hotels out there that are much cheaper, and places that you will be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is gorgeous, the facilities are amazing, site is breathtaking and the staff are phenomenal.”
Reviews.Author: amadonna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the resort for a few days just before Thanksgiving. It is located in beautiful Wailea and has a gorgeous view of the coastline and Molikini island. The rooms are spacious and beautiful, with excellent views. We were given a room that overlooked the ocean and Molikini island and had a spacious lanai which was great for relaxing and enjoying the sunset and sunrise. We tried to take in as much as we could that the resort offered but they had so much available, it was difficult to do. They have a variety of pools from the fun canyon pools to the relaxing adult-only pool and the spacious beach area. The staff are so friendly and willing to help and provide anything you need. We were so pleased with those that took care of the hotel, setup the umbrellas and chairs on the beach, served food and drinks in the pools and the staff at the restaurants. We started our trip with dinner at the Humuhumu restaurant which was an experience in and of itself. It's a beautiful, thatch roofed restaurant that sits atop the waters where we watched the sunset as we enjoyed delicious, regional cuisine and impeccable service. The next night we enjoyed the luau complete with fire dancers, stories and, of course, pulling the pig roast out of the ground. I would recommend a stay at the Grand Wailea to anyone planning a trip to Maui. In a sentence: The hotel is gorgeous, the facilities are amazing, site is breathtaking and the staff are phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else in Wailea”
Reviews.Author: jon3054
Reviews.Content: Great beach and pool. Everything else was mediocre and far below what I expected for what we paid. Food was very low quality. Service was terrible, particularly at the pool cafe and pool. Slow (over an hour wait for appetizers with longer wait for food), never got orders right, pool servers only came around once every hour/hour and a half, checks were never right. Beach staff was rude and annoyed that you were there to get chairs, umbrellas, snorkeling equipment. Because we booked late, we had Thanksgiving dinner at the hotel, where we were rushed through dinner. Bussers repeatedly picked up plates as people were eating off of them and took full drinks away. Hotel rooms were only marginally better than a Marriot Courtyard (albeit with better views). Public areas were not cleaned regularly. Saw the same trash and spots on the floors for days. We also did the luau. Don't. For the price, terrible food and show comparable to others that are less expensive. Bad buffet chicken, potato salad, etc. Go to Wailea. Stay at the Four Seasons or the Fairmont. They have to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great adult-only areas, views, bathrooms in rooms are best in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Briank1
Reviews.Content: Went during an ACOG Convention (doctors) in October. Expected hotel to be cheesy and over top. Our ocean-view room was small but great lanai and great bathrooms. Silent and relaxing at adult pool and adjacent lawn area overlooking ocean was also just great. My wife thought the spa was just OK. We didn't eat there; we've been to Maui many times and ate at our favorite places. No place is perfect in this economy - but you will enjoy the Grand unless you have to find fault in things.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect antidote for stress”
Reviews.Author: Kraughto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on Maui and checked into the Grand Wailea Resort around 8:00 pm. From the gracious welcome at the valet to the wonderful front desk staff...we knew we came to the right place to relax and de-stress. There was a line at the front desk to check in, but Noreen Medeiros helped us with all of our questions (it's easy to get lost in that huge hotel property)...she was so patient and knowledgeable. We had made reservations for a room in the Napua Club wing and were delighted to find that our room had been upgraded to a huge junior suite. My hubby and I participated in the free Saturday morning yoga on the lawn in front of the chapel...outdoor yoga is so relaxing. When we went to the Sunday yoga class however, the teacher was rough and barking out orders like a boot camp captain in a small, stink aerobics room. I left and so did 3 other guests...we had an impromptu yoga session ourselves out on the lawn. One of the guests luckily turned out to be a yoga instructor herself! My husband indulged in Spa Grande and the terme baths. I noticed he was walking much straighter when he walked out of the spa. Dining-wise we had dinner at Humuhumunukunukuapuahaa restaurant at the hotel. Food and service is excellent and the ambiance is even better...you feel like you are dining in the middle of a lagoon under thatched roof. Our favorite dinner however was seated at the bar at Ruth Chris at the shopping center next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: GeniceGallegos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to steal away to Maui for a couple of days in the beginning of November. Our first vacation together since our son was born two years ago. It was our anniversary and we wanted to celebrate! We arrived at the Grand Wailea and were blown away. What an amazing resort! After we received our lei, the friendly front desk staff took care of us: they were wonderful and very helpful! They hooked us up with an amazing room (upgrade), which really made our vacation special! I actually got teary-eyed when I saw the room - I obviously needed a break from the daily grind, and this vacation, made special by this fabulous resort and staff, really contributed to soaking up every wonderful minute we spent there. We had such a great time at the Grand Wailea and are eternally grateful for the special memories we brought home with us! Be prepared to spend money, but honey, it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families, Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: YGlobalTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a luxurious getaway and planned a few nights at the Grand Wailea before heading off to Kauai. Our room was very nice and had a fantastic lanai. The hotel was extremely large and offered a multitude of activities. Herein lies our main issue. The resort wasn't particularly clean, had lots of noisy children, and service was only so-so. This would be a great resort for families, but not great for couples. We checked out after the first night and moved to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Peachy3313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Grand Wailea from Nov. 8th - 16th in Maui, Hawaii. It was the best vacation we have ever had. The Wailea area is beautiful and the hotel exceeded expectations. The grounds, pools, rooms, restaurants and beach are immaculate and everything you expect and more from a hawaiian vacation. The rooms are comfortable and are cleaned twice a day. Wailea is pricey. Be prepared to pay $7-8 for beers and $14 for cocktails and an average of $30-40/person on food. If you're renting a car, gas is $3.85/gallon. Fortunately, you're spending a bundle but the food is out of this world and the tropical cocktails are not only tastey, but beautifully appointed with fruit and flowers - the epitome of a classic tropical drink. Be sure to check out Spago at the Four Seasons next door for an extra special dinner. We took three excursions while we were there and all of the tour guides said our hotel was their favorite and pointed it out to people who weren't staying there as a place to check out! This hotel might have been a little out of our league, and we might be payi ng for this vacation for a while, but the memories are well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pelagia812
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days at the Grand Wailea for my honeymoon. This is a family resort, but that didn't bother us. There was an adult pool for those who didn't want to be around kids. The staff was wonderful and they booked all our excursions and dinner reservations. They were very helpful. October was not a busy travel month so we were able to get beach chairs and umbrellas without any problems. The resort did not charge you for this. The hotel has 2 restaurant's, one is open for lunch and dinner and the Humu restaurant was only open for dinner which was our favorite, next to Mama's fishhouse which was about 40 minutes away. The hotel has a luao and dinner. The food wasn't so good and the show was so so. If I were to go there again, I would've just watched it from the lawn chairs, as you can still enjoy the show without wasting any money. I wish I would have seen the Old Lahana Luao instead. This is a more traditional luao that they say is really. The beach was spectacular and very clear. It never rained on our part of the island but it did rain on other parts of the island. The hotel charges $25 a day for valet parking, but there is a garage that you can park yourself at no charge. There is also a mini market at the Wailea shops between the Grand Wailea and Marriot, that has sandwiches/coffee/snacks. This is walking distance from the hotel. Overall, this hotel was very clean and the staff was great. We would definately stay here again on our 10 year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: travel2008la
Reviews.Content: You will likely either love or hate this resort. The biggest selling feature of the GW is the pool complex. It is a great complex, but if you stay on a weekend or during the busy season, good luck finding a beach chair. Many people get in line at 7:00 a.m. to reserve beach chairs. By 9:00 a.m., most of the chairs have been taken. The food at the GW is one of the biggest downsides. Even if you are willing to pay the high prices, it is a challenge to find something that you want to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel/Resort on Maui (possibly the US)!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyFrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights during our honeymoon. It was beyond what we could have ever imagined. The rooms were extremely clean, the staff was very friendly, but most importantly the views were breathtaking! We ate at The Bistro, Humu, went to The Grand Spa - it was all amazing. We honestly don't have one single complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: sweater12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! The pool definitely has children at it, but it was still a lot of fun for newlyweds. It's a bit of a drive to get anywhere on the island, but the location the water is fabulous. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Best Pools”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Grand Wailea on a layover between islands, the hotel was really beautiful. The beach area was well taken care of and there ample chairs and umbellas available for us to use. The pool areas, however, were the best I have ever seen at a hotel. There were a number of slides, water ways , spas, lazy river etc. I just did not expect to see this at a hotel in Maui. If you have kids who like the water this is the place to stay. They also had monitors located at various [points along the slides etc. that helped move the traffic along and provided a measure of safety. The rooms at the hotel are very large and well equipped, the only complaint I would have albeit a very small one was that the bathroom was a little tired. A refridgerator was not included in the room, you could rent one for a fee, (kind of strange). The shops at Wailea are not far from this hotel where you could purchase food items etc. There are also a number of resturants at the hotel, we at at Humahuma......... (real long name) the food was excellent and the service was also excellent. All in all you can't go wrong with staying here. If you are an American Express Platinum member they usually have a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: Beachdreams2
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Grand Wailea in October and had an overall good experience, but I can see how the degree of satisfaction with this property would depend on oneâ€™s expectations and what they paid to stay there. I am a Hilton HHonors member (Diamond level) and used Hilton free night certificates for my stay, so the only out of pocket costs I had were for my incidentals, which were minimal since I only had dinner at the resort one night. When I was making my reservations, I noticed that the least expensive rooms for the dates of my stay were around $400 + tax. I think that the majority of people who are disappointed with this property probably fall into two categories: 1) People who are used to five star properties with a high level of service and superior amenities and find the Grand Wailea coming up short, or 2) People who have never stayed at a property as expensive as the Grand Wailea, are doing so for a special occasion, and expect more for the price paid. I think that at the GW, a lot of what you are paying for is the location and the property itself, but I donâ€™t necessarily think it is a true â€œfive starâ€� property with respect to the guest rooms or service. Location: The hotel is on the beach in Wailea, which is a very nice, upscale area in South Maui. This was my first trip to Maui, and if I returned, Iâ€™m not sure if I would stay in Wailea again or if I would try somewhere on West Maui. I did like the walking path along Wailea beach, and the proximity of the GW to different places to shop and dine. The Grand Wailea is on a good part of Wailea beach; some of the other hotels do not have much (if any) beach area, but GW is on a wider, sandy part of Wailea Beach. Amenities: This is a stunning property. I did not get to see all the art or take a tour since it was not offered when I was there, but the architecture and grounds, including the many pools and landscaping, are beautiful. The beach area is pretty nice (Iâ€™m a beach snob so my expectations in this area are very high), and the staff will set up chairs and umbrellas on the beach for guests (one guy was good about setting up a chair for me with a little more distance between me and other people, but the guy the next day was trying to pack everyone in very close together). The property has a large, well equipped, and well air-conditioned fitness room, which I used one morning for strength training. The GW has several restaurants. I only tried Humu (it has a longer name) for a drink at the bar and dinner. I enjoyed my dinner (fresh fish entrÃ©e, side vegetable, glass of wine) there, and I felt that the prices there were reasonable for the Wailea area and a resort restaurant (I looked at menus for the restaurant at the Wailea Marriott and some of the restaurants at the Shops at Wailea, where I ended up having dinner one night at Tommy Bahama). Self parking at the GW was free; the garage spaces were small as others have stated, and the garage also does not have any elevators. The property is huge and kind of hard to figure out where you are at first, but it was not insurmountable, and I was fine after the first day. A larger property map would be useful, because it was hard to read the small one they gave me, and more signs around the property and on buildings would help too. Rooms: The rooms were nice enough, but they didnâ€™t blow me away. I understand that with the exception of the Napau tower rooms, other guest rooms at the GW are pretty much the same, and the location/view determines price. My room was a first floor (actually on the second floor because they have "ground" floor rooms) room that the front desk person told me was an upgrade (I think she called it a "lagoon" or "garden" view room), but I actually had a nice view of one of the pools and the ocean from my room/balcony, so I was happy with it. There was a balcony with a table and chairs, but I really didnâ€™t use it. My room had two queen size beds, a desk, a chaise lounge chair, a dresser with a flat screen TV on top of it, and a bar area with a coffee maker and glassware/ice bucket. There was a locked cabinet below the bar counter where I assume that they place mini- refrigerators if people choose to rent one. There was a safe in the closet, but it was not large enough for my laptop. The bathroom was very large with a separate tub, shower with a seat, vanity, and separate room with toilet. It had an ornately tiled floor area, but IMO, the tub and shower tiles were kind of dated and not that attractive. Oh, and I know this sounds petty, but I hated the provided toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, moisturizer), which I guess were supposed to be tropical but had an overpowering smell like some of the suntan lotions (e.g., Hawaiian Tropic or Banana Boat). I had my own products, but I just wanted to warn others who might try to pack light. Staff/service: Iâ€™m not someone who regularly stays at five star resorts, so I donâ€™t need or even want a lot of attention or hovering staff, but I want any questions or problems addressed efficiently and in a timely manner. I would rate the staff/service level as acceptable but not exceptional. I interacted with the front desk staff at check-in, again the day before my departure to check about a late checkout, and at checkout. I had a flight after 8 pm to be followed by over 20 hours of travel to get home, so this was one time when I was hoping for a late checkout (I got my checkout extended until 2 pm). It is hard for me to put in words why I felt that service was just average. I did not experience any staff who were rude, but for the most part customer facing staff did not come across as being as well-trained, polished, and/or service-oriented as I would expect in what is supposed to be the top tier Hilton brand, and processes seemed a little impersonal. For example, when I called the specified number around 6 pm to make a dinner reservation, I got an automated message that the office was closed, and I should call the restaurant I wanted to book directly (and they disconnected my call). I had another underwhelming experience with the GW phone system when I called before my stay with a couple of questions about general room amenities. Also, the staff member who checked me out had to ask someone else (in the office) when I asked about being able to use internet on my laptop after checking out (internet access is free to guests as part of the resort fee, but once you have checked out, you need to get some guest login code to use wifi in the lobby area). Iâ€™m sure I wasnâ€™t the first person to ask this, so I would have expected that front desk staff would be able to answer this question. Housekeeping (or others) seemed to come into the room frequently. On the full day I was there, they were in once to do the cleaning (late morning to mid afternoon), again after cleaning to leave two bottles of water and a note, and again after that to do â€œturndownâ€� service (which seemed kind of unnecessary since my beds only had the white sheets and comforters on them anyway). My service at Humu was pretty good, both for dinner and when I got a drink at the bar. I never got a lei which is supposed to be one of the amenities provided (in fairness though, I never asked about it). Feel free to send me a private message if there are any questions!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST RESORT ON MAUI”
Reviews.Author: larryt43
Reviews.Content: Easy check in, great rooms, aloha spirit exhibited by all team members. The footprint of the hotel is the best on Maui! Management "gets it" and the spa is unique. The food and in room dining is fairly priced and served up as ordered. A really great trip, thanks to all of the people working at the resort. Much Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Four Seasons Resort next door!”
Reviews.Author: BrittMatt
Reviews.Content: I have worked at one of the top rated resorts in the country for years and have never had such a bad experience as I did at the Grand Wailea! From the extreme lack of customer service, the poor quality of food and beverages, to the worst spa treatment I have ever had in my life I was so very disappointed and disturbed by this resort. Luckily enough the Four Seasons Resort is right next door and they far exceeded any expectations I have and it was the best experience I have ever had at a resort!!! The only positive points I can say about the Grand Wailea is that they have amazing grounds, pools, and the five sacred pools at the spa are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place - kids, romance, anything”
Reviews.Author: merorvis
Reviews.Content: Amazing place. Anybody who doesn't give this place a 5 star is way too high maintenance !! Pool was amazing for kids !! Pool was great for adults. Beach was perfect. Grounds were unreal !! Closest thing to a negative was that ALL food was expensive (pretty much all hotel food in Maui is I am guessing) Rooms were perfect - bathrooms crazy nice.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder they call it the "Grand" Wailea!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happyinhawaii10
Reviews.Content: This was our our first trip to Hawaii...and we chose to go to the island of Maui for our first visit. I researched lots on the internet...talked to people. I had asked "where would you stay if it was your first visit"? I had many people tell me "well if you can swing it..stay at the Grand Wailea". I had contiplated over a bed and breakfast or a resort style hotel. I looked at the pictures online..and that did it...I wanted to stay there. This was the picture perfect place for me!!!! It was all I could have ever wanted in a hotel..and MORE. I had talked to one of the reservationist a few months before making my decision as to where we would stay...told her it was our very first time visiting..and how EXCITED I was to get there. I had reserved a garden terrace room area...and we walked in our room..and we had a partial ocean!!! I thought I was in the wrong room...thank goodness we weren't. It was more then I could have imagined!!! We could even hear the ocean waves!!!!!! So, we had a view of the beautiful chapel...garden, AND OCEAN. What more could we ask for!!!! All the employees were soooo accomodating and FRIENDLY. They all greeted you "Aloha", all the time!!! with smiles!!!! The surrounding gardens..and waterfall outside our room...topped it off!!! The inside of the hotel was beyond belief beautiful..all the statues...flowers, the mermaid in the lobby surrounded by the bluest water ever was one of my favorite things about the hotel....just soooo beautiful, and the bar/lounge was beyond that. Some of the rooms had overflowing flowers hanging from the balconies...how beautiful it was. Everywhere you looked was beauty to be found..not to mention the blue ocean that you could view from soooo many areas in the hotel!!! The pools were just breathtaking....tiles in flowers at the bottom of each pool...grassy area lounge chairs to relax on....even some on the beautiful lawn OVERLOOKING the beach..ugh!!!! The cocktail waitress was sooo friendly...she packed her bags and moved there....she looked so happy!! Why wouldn't she be..her office was blue hawaii :-) The Grand Dining Room was just over the top gorgous!!! We loved it there. Food was soooo beautiful and yummy, and the service was so friendly and inviting!!! We went there ..at least four times. You just can not beat the view in this dining room..no wonder they call it the Grand Dining Room..it is!!!!!! There is also a very beautiful shopping area outside the hotel...very nice. Not to mention the Shops of Wailea which are right around the corner, outside the hotel....soooo nice. Tommy Bahama's was beyond yummy...we ate there twice...great service, great people, great staff!!! I highly recommend it!!!! All and all I consider myself lucky to have stayed there...I would go back in a minute!!! Give yourself a treat ....and don't think twice, you won't be sorry. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic grounds and pools, OK rooms, great location, expensive!”
Reviews.Author: ryanfrommd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 2010 with a conference. The conference rate was substantially below the rack rates for the rooms. Grounds are fantastic- one of the nicest hotels I've ever been to, and I have traveled a fair amount. Truly impressive- especially the pools, which may be some of the nicest in the world. They have a lei greeting and an impressive entrance. I was a little disappointed when we checked in, because the person at the front desk gave me a hard time about the room type. I brought my wife with me and the room type was a big deal for us- this was both a late anniversary celibration and her birthday was the final day of our trip. We wanted it to be special. I used to have a fairly decent Hilton Hhonors level status, but we have two young kids and I lost it since I haven't traveled as much since they were born. I mention this because as with any other hotel, your status matters in how they treat you. Since our conference rate was the same price for a variety of room types, this issue probably wouldn't apply to those who pay a set price for a specific room type. I booked way ahead to reserve a 'deluxe oceanfront' room. A colleague with higher Hhonors status who booked when only garden view rooms were available requested an oceanfront room (right next to me in line) and they gave it to him without hassle. The person at the counter gave me a garden room and then told me three times that room types are not guaranteed. I was getting ready to ask for a manager when she finally (reluctantly) agreed to give me the room type I booked. I would understand if she said it once to make the point, but I just traveled 15 hours from the east coast to get there, and I expect that if the hotel can simply accomodate the request I made, that they do so without hassling me. Although the start was rocky, the rest of the stay improved. Again, the grounds are fantastic. Amazing. The room itself was nice, but not commensurate with the price of the hotel. I would have been a little disappointed if we paid full price. As many other reviews state, you are paying for the grounds. They're worth it. Our view was not as good as a couple of other oceanfront rooms on site that my colleagues got, but I did have an ocean view and that was good enough. Our room had a shower and large (non-jetted) tub and a balcony with a table and chairs. The pictures on the website seem to be fairly accurate- this is not always the case with some hotels, but what you see is what you get here. This room would have been expected in a standard hilton beach property, but not in a waldorf astoria. It is due for a remodel in the rooms. I had emailed in advance about a fridge for the room because food is EXPENSIVE on and near the property. Get a rental car, because a cab is about $60 each way to/from the airport and there is great food fairly reasonably priced in Kihei about 5 miles down the road. Parking was a little annoying- the parking garage is a quarter mile down the road if you don't want to pay for the valet. The on-site eating options are good, but quite expensive. We had dinner at humuhumunukunukuapuaa and it was very nice. My wife had lobster and steak, and I had sushi and fresh fish ceviche. Both were nicely prepared. They told me the fridge would be $25 for the whole stay. When I checked in, they said $5 delivery charge plus $8 a day. Then when we checked out after five nights, there was an almost $80 charge (no idea where they got this figure)! The front desk happily adjusted it to $25 when I showed the email that I got from the hotel representative. The worst part- the fridge was already in the room the whole time!!! All they did was come in and use a key to unlock the cabinet where it was stored. On the second day of our stay, we noticed that the fridge had frozen our items. The milk was a hard slush, beers were nearly frozen, everything else was inedible because it was too cold. Tried turning down the thermostat, that only made it worse. Everything froze hard, so we couldn't use the milk for our coffee and I was afraid the glass beer bottles would explode if I took them out by hand. I mentioned the problem to the front desk and they volunteered to get us a new fridge and replace all the food items right away. They replaced the beer, milk, and cream. We also had bought guacamole dip and french onion dip at the grocery store. They replaced them with fresh guacamole and had the chef whip us up some french onion dip using Maui sweet onions. I mention the fridge incident not because I hold it against the hotel that the first fridge broke, but because it shows that they do take the effort to try and fix problems when they occur. Although we had a rough day without our coffee, the effort the hotel made to fix it made up for the problem. The dips were delicious! When not at the conference, we did the typical tourist stuff (road to hana, sunrise at the volcano, etc.). But I spent the most (non-work) time at the pool. The slides and lazy river are great! Spent some time (and a few bucks) at the grotto bar. If you pay a little extra, you can get a big pineapple mug that holds a lot more than the other cups and you get a whole lot more drink for you money the rest of your trip. I didn't figure this out until too late. Speaking of drink deals, there was a (unadvertised, as far as I could tell) happy hour in the main bar in the middle of the hotel from 5-6 with a serious discount on mai tais. The beach in front of the hotel is pristine. Swimming there is comfortable and safe. We booked a snorkeling trip to two sites- Molokini crater and turtle town. Drove a half hour north of the hotel to get to the boat (boss frogs, which was inexpensive and great), and they went to molokini first. Then, turtle town ended up being directly in front of the hotel!!! If you have (or rent) snorkel gear, you can easily check out the turtles on the southern end of the beach in front of the hotel. You can swim or kayak out just a little bit and see the turtles surfacing. Some were almost as big as a vw beetle. My wife visited the spa on her birthday and loved it. The locals had told us (when we mentioned where we were staying) that our hotel had the best spa on the island. My wife didn't try any others, but certainly enjoyed this one very much. In summary, the grounds were amazing, the room was nice (if not quite up to our expectations), and expect to pay extra for everything. The location in Wailea is great. Stay here, but don't expect to do so frugally! We had a wonderful trip and while there were a couple of things that could have been done better, the hotel generally met or exceeded our expectations and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Five-Star Stay Worth Ten Stars”
Reviews.Author: UncleOtto34116
Reviews.Content: The following is an email I sent to Matthew Bailey, Managing Director, after our stay: Aloha Matt, My wife and I recently returned from a trip to the Big Island and Maui and wanted to commend some of your staff for an incredible experience while at Grand Wailea from 9/28-10/1. First off, the property was fantastic and exceeded our expectations. You truly have a great hotel. We could not have had a better experience for our delayed honeymoon. Individually we want to thank Zenith and Jay in the concierge area for the great service and attention we received during the stay. The attention to detail and knowing our preferences by the end of our first evening visit was noted and appreciated. They were personal yet professional every evening. Jay was equally attentive on the mornings we visited for breakfast. Of course that service would not have been possible without the attention we received at check-in from Haren. He assisted in the room upgrade to Napua Tower which made our stay truly magnificent. The dinner we had at Humuhumunukunukuapuaâ€™a was outstanding. Our server Matt was very attentive and made excellent suggestions as well as taking some great photos for us. On another evening Max at the bar took very good care of us with some fun drink concoctions. We had a great time. Mahalo to you and your staff for a top-notch vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5-star Luxury Hotel with few deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: gerdhachtel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Wailea (belongs to Hilton) for four nights during our Hawaii vacations. We had a great time. The hotel is well located and a good starting point to explore Maui. Rooms are excellent and food is great (e.g. hotel restaurant Humuhumunukunukuapua'a). Unfortunately there were some deficiencies which you don't expect with a real 5-star Luxury Hotel: seats in the bar and on the balkony were dirty and service at bar and room was also not always as expected.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT. I want to LIVE there.”
Reviews.Author: wrldskppr
Reviews.Content: Before heading to a wedding at the Grand Wailea, I read these reviews and was really apprehensive about how my experience at the hotel would be. I am really sensitive to people being rude to me and I hate hearing noise from other hotel rooms when I am in mine. That said, I am not at all sure where the people stayed who gave Grand Wailea bad reviews. It was just wonderful, probably one of the best resort experiences I have ever had. The staff was great, from Daisy who checked us in, to Rex who handled our bags and never failed to greet my husband and me *by name* whenever he saw us, to Elena and Brian at the bar, everyone was just awesome. The place is extremely well-kept, the gardens are lush, the pools are great (and we never had a problem getting a seat at any time of day) and the luau was really fun. The concierges are on-site 24 hours a day and they are very helpful as you try to find tours that fit your needs and budget. I could not recommend Grand Wailea more highly and I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “amazing location - terrible service”
Reviews.Author: RefreshinglyFrank
Reviews.Content: Our room is lovely with an amazing ocean view. The beach is one of the nicest I have ever been to, the hotel is spotless, but the service is no match for the location. We arrived at the hotel at 10 am with several bags, and here was no porter available to help with the bags, we shuffled our way to the front desk. Check in took over 40 minutes because we had to email proof that we had booked an ocean view room to the front desk clerk, so she could print it out and take it to her supervisor (we showed her the confirmation on the phone). We were then told that there is a $10 baggage handling fee and $3 daily tip for the maids added to the room...on top of the $25 resort fee. We were told we could check our luggage in while or room was being prepared. This consisted of us rolling it ot the bell desk, and them leaving it there all day unsecured. When it was finally time to go to our room several hours later, the porter took my boyfriend's 2 bags and left me to tag along behind managing all my own luggage. I guess they figured they were getting their $10 anyway, so why put out an extra effort. The next day i decided to go to the pool - the desk at the adult pool is closed, you have to go down the stairs and around the corner, but there is also a beach desk,which is closer, I thought I would just go there to grab a towel, but I was told quite firmly by the 7 staff members sitting in the shade I needed to back up the hill and around the corner to get a towel for sitting next to the pool. Fair enough, but maybe one or two of those 7 could have been sent to actually staff the desk at the adult pool? Oh and if you want any shade, you need to rent a cabana - because they have been placed in all the areas that have shade. It seems everything is just a "nominal" fee, but it feels like this resort is nickel and diming it's customers to death. A room fridge is $8 a day, and there are actually only 1-2 classes a day at the fitness center tht are included, the rest are $10 It's all just little things, like the brochure says Hilton Honours members get a daily newspaper, and we don't, but after the check in fiasco, neither one of us wants to deal with the front desk. It's made me not even want to try the spa for fear of what they are going to layer on there. It really is a shame. This is a lovely hotel, with a stunning location and beach, but compared to other resorts of this supposed caliber, the service is just not in place.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True :)”
Reviews.Author: m_amson
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Grand Wailea and hopefully it will not be my last. I traveled with my boyfriend who has been there many times and I can see why... 1)Excellent service 2)Absolutely gorgeous location/beach 3)Beautiful pools 4)Delicious food 5)Wonderful shops 6)BEST SPA!!! Please do not listen to any of the bad reviews because this place is PARADISE. I think about The Grand Wailea every single day and have made it my top priority to go back as soon as possible!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best way to unwind”
Reviews.Author: weloveditall
Reviews.Content: Great food, conscientious staff, beautiful surroundings....loved it all!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Breathtaking...”
Reviews.Author: CAndrewSemon
Reviews.Content: I can't gush enough about this property. Even the drive up to the entrance is an event. In front of the hotel is a giant waterfall that was nothing short of spectacular. Upon arrival we were met by a group of bellmen who took our luggage and presented us with tea leaf leis. Check in was very quick once the room was ready. We arrived rather early so we had no expectation that it would be. In the meantime they stored our luggage and we were free to enjoy the amenities. The lobby area is incredible. There is a pond by the lobby bar, large sculptures everywhere, and great views of the ocean. Our room was on the top floor of the main building, overlooking the ocean. The upgrade to an ocean view room will not disappoint and will be more than worth the extra money. We woke up every morning to beautiful sunrises and crashing waves all from the comfort of our bed. The room itself was more spacious than most standard hotel rooms, allowing room for a sofa and generous workspace. The in room dining menu is comparably priced to going to just about any restaurant in the area. The food is good, service is excellent and best of all every balcony has a table and chairs that is more than suitable for dining. Meals taken on the balcony were less of a meal and more of an experience. The concierge was incredibly helpful in planning our activities and she was a great source of ideas for what to do. The pools were great, but a little disappointing. The water elevator is slightly over hyped. Yes, it is very unique, but it takes FOREVER to get to the top and even longer to get back down to the bottom. It is actually much faster to take the stairs. There are two water slides, one of which is one of the most fun water slides I've been on, the other wasn't worth the energy to get to it. We loved the hot tub that was hidden in a grotto behind a waterfall. Most people don't know it's there so it is more often than not empty. The swim up bar was fun too. Service at this hotel in general is second to none. Every person we encountered was professional without being cold (as has been our experience with other Hilton properties), eager to help without being overbearing, and everyone seemed as though they actually liked being there, which is rare. (Of course I'd be that way too if I worked in that atmosphere.). My only issue was resolved fairly quickly. During the first two days Maintenance came both days wanting to do things in the room. I appreciate the effort of keeping the hotel nice, but do these thing when someone is not checked into the room. I informed the man that we'd prefer not to be bothered by these issues while we were here and he never came back again. Word of warning: Lounges and umbrellas on the beach as well as by the pool ARE limited. The hotel enforces a policy of items being left unattended for over an hour will be removed so you'll want to at least get out of the pool once an hour and go back to your stuff. Complaints about shortages of lounges and umbrellas are generally found during times when the hotel is exceptionally busy. Plan your trip accordingly if these things are important to you, or deal with the fact that you'll have to be up with the sun to secure them. They also offer cabanas with food service and dedicated lounges so that may be an option as well. We decided that this wasn't necessary, but I can see how this would be a nice experience. This is a perfect location if you want to get away from it all and have a wonderfully romantic vacation. Not only would I want to return to this hotel, I had a hard time wanting to come home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in it's management!”
Reviews.Author: SAD091910
