Reviews.Content: My husband and recently went to Maui for our honeymoon, figured we wont be able to a trip like this in a long while. We decide to splurge on a coupleâ€™s message, since neither one of us have had one together, and was transferred from our hotel to Grand Waileaâ€™s spa to book there, which we did. A week before our appointment, we went into the hotel and explained that we booked a spa package ($400+) and asked if we are able to use the pool facilities when we are done. The man at the front desk of reception said, â€œof courseâ€�. Perfect I thought and we went a head with it. When the day came for our spa day, we had lunch afterâ€¦spent more money at the gift storeâ€¦.spent more than ($600+) in total. We than made our way to the pool! This is where we were than told we are PROHIBITED to use the pools! I was furious after spending all this money at this hotel, especially after I asked the week before if we could!! Than I spoke to the front desk about it, of course the guy I spoke to wasnâ€™t there and everyone else I spoke to, including management, that everyone in staff has knowledge that pools are for guests onlyâ€¦â€�Clearly not all guest areâ€�!!! â€¦..if this is such an important rule, than the person I spoke to at reception, should have made that clear before we spent all this money. As honeymooners, this was a lot for us, and wanted to treat ourselves, but if we knew that we would have been dismissed and treated unfairly there with no resolution, I would have chose to spend my time and money at another hotel!! I would think twice if interested in staying hereâ€¦.they certainly know how to take your money and make sure you spend it, but when it comes to service, donâ€™t expect much!! I rented a place in Haiku for half the price and 100% better than this placeâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “30th Wedding Anniversary Bliss”
Reviews.Author: BigNom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 30th Wedding anniversary with a 3day/2nite romantic getaway to this great resort. Although it is rather pricey, the ambiance and service is well worth it. The grounds are impecable and the dining experience in the Humunukuapua'a Resturant was awesome. The hotel staff knew we were celebrating a special ocassion and they went overboard to please us.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE BUT FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Kuklari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is enormous and their art collection is world class so you should go see that if you are in the area. The room was spacious & beautiful and the service was impeccable everywhere. We ate only breakfast at the hotel since it was included in our package & the buffet was wonderful. The pool is so much fun, even for those not with children.. it's like a water park with several slides, a lazy river, etc. The beach is also very nice and there was good snorkeling right from the beach. I didn't like the distance from our room to the beach/pool area.. it felt like a mile. But once you got down there it was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: greekgirl66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for 5 days, 4 nights using Hilton Honors certificates. The hotel was amazing and we really cannot complain about a thing except the expense of the food and drinks on property, but we are used to that when staying at a resort. The pool was a blast and my 9 and 10 year old loved it. It was completely uncrowded and no wait for any of the amazing water slides and Tarzan rope. The boys lost themselves in the pool and I loved relaxing on the beach. The beach loungers are free to guests and I love the beach so I saw no need to rent a cabana by the pool. We have pools in Phoenix, just no beaches! The Wailea area has great beaches and snorkeling. We rented sn snorkel gear from Snorkel Bobs in Kihei for $22 for the week. We felt the service was amazing and that everyone was really friendly and courteous. We used the free self parking and rarely ate on property to save money. We did eat at the "K" restaurant on property one night without the kids. The food was delicious and because we are Hilton DIamond, they gave us a $40 voucher and 2 free drinks. Our drinks were fishbowls and $26 each so it was nice that they were free! I thought the food was great. Kihei town is 3 miles away and the restaurants there are fun and yummy. The Kihei cafe has the best breakfasts. My son also took some great surfing lessons from Ricardo on the beach across the street. I can't remember the surf school he works with, but the truck is on the beach directly across from the Kihei Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieFlyer
Reviews.Content: As a diamond HHonors member we were upgraded to a top floor ocean view room. We were staying on points and free night vouchers. The Grand Wailea is on a nice beach. In Sept. it never seemed crowded at the beach or pools. I really thought the pools and beach were nicer than other Wailea properties nearby. The property, common areas, spa, were all very nice. The grounds were lovely and while we were there it was obvious that a lot of care and attention goes into keeping it that way. Lucky I read another review where the couple found a coupon in the in room magazine for the spa....around $150 for an hour in the baths (which there are several, shower of different kinds, sauna), a 50 min. massage, and lunch at Bistro Molokini. With tip, tax, and a t-shirt with the spa logo it came to around $200. Without the coupon it would have started at around $200. I really did enjoy the baths, massage and lunch. My spouse couldn't justify the expense so to each his or her own. Our room was very comfortable and the view was gorgeous. It was quite a hike to the self park from our room on the other side of the resort, but that was fine. Other than Bistro Molokini, which is a bar and cafe out by the pools, we ate on property at the cafe located in the shops at Grand Wailea for lunch ( note is has strange hours and not open every day). We rented a refrigerator for $7 a day, which saved us quite a bit on breakfasts. We found provisions at the natural foods grocery, Mana Foods in Paia. I liked that little town. Has some nice shopping and restaurants like the Paia Fish Market (casual cafe on the corner...Ono burger was great) and good art galleries. Drove the road to Hana, went north to Lahaina, and up Haleakala Mountain (about a 10K elevation gain and great views). Really liked Maui and the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesnt mean everything”
Reviews.Author: my_travel_sucked
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been to Maui many times, and the Grand Wailea seemed like a nice place to make base camp. After all it had water slides, it was on nice grounds, so what could go wrong? Well, let me put it this way, Iâ€™m writing this from the room while the rest of my family canâ€™t pack fast enough. I had been here before and had experienced many disconcerting problems, but I figured, anyone can have a bad week. Little did I know that all though problems were not anomalies and appear to be almost a policy. $250 - $750 a night is a lot of money to secure your family in having a bad vacation. If your idea of a vacation is a restful and peaceful place with a courteous staff, the Mauiâ€™s Grand Wailea is not your hotel. I can go on and list all the many problems with the Maui Grand Wailea, but Iâ€™m sure the limiter on these reviews would cut me off. You want some specificsâ€¦ 1. You now have to pay for a refrigerator 2. Now the hotel staff continually rolls refrigerator carts, up and down your hallway which is made of a thick Spanish tile. If you canâ€™t picture it, just think of continuous freight trains rolling past your door every 5 minutes, day and night. This continuous noise and shaking also comes from the luggage and in-room dining carts. 3. Management doesnâ€™t really care. No return call from GM, and front desk manager has no effect. 4. Continuous maintenance on adjacent rooms both times I was here. 5. Hugely expensive drinks and food. Kind of expected, but note just a fountain coke is $7.50. 6. Donâ€™t expect many of the restaurants to be open. 7. And the room keys. What a joke. Last time I was here I spent two days getting my door lock replaced, this trip I just get locked out every other day. 8. They actually made my paying 19 year old daughter leave the fitness center because they said she had to be at least 16 years of age. 9. The room last time was in a hole and had no view. 10. If you let the resort plan an off site excursion to include your 18 year old son, make sure he brings 3 forms of picture ID. Without it, an 18 year old, whoâ€™s been driving his very expensive car will not be allowed on an ATV. There is much more, but the bottom line in this review was derived from two different stays, so I am confident that Mauiâ€™s Grand Wailea Resort is a great place to get your vacation ruined.

Reviews.Title: “What a Glorious Stay”
Reviews.Author: cheermom505
Reviews.Content: Perfect from beginning to end. Something for everyone, from eating options to where to swim. Adult pool is very quiet and private, multiple pools from the top to bottom (you can walk or slide to each one) are a blast for any age. If you are tired, take the water elevator which is the first of it's kind. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. After the Four Seasons, I could not imagine staying here but will definitely return. If only they could throw in the cabanas. Oh and don't miss the spa, so awesome with very comparable pricing

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: lash06
Reviews.Content: Had a partial ocean view and it was absolutely wonderful! Had a great view with a nice view of the little church. Room was very clean and service very prompt. The grounds were always very clean too. Walking distance to the shops and restaurants next door was great too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: TheMangler
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service and amenities. My only complaint is that for what they charge for a room (plus "Resort Fee"), charging you another $9 to use the bar fridge in your room is tacky. Also, the maid carts make a heck of a racket in the morning on the ceramic tiles as they wheel them up and down the hall outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Great Pool/Beach, Nice Rooms, Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for five nights of our 9 night Hawaii trip. This is a great hotel but could use a bit of polishing to come up to the service expectations of a 4-5 star resort charging $400+ per night. The location was easily found by our GPS located in the heart of the Wailea Resort area, right on the beach and adjacent to the Shops at Wailea. Upon check in, you have the option of leaving your car with the valet during your check in and till 7 pm that day. At that point you have the option of choosing free self parking or continuing with valet and paying $20. The walk to the self parking is about a 7 minute walk from the central lobby. The spots in the self parking garage are a bit small, but the Town Car that we had always fit in the spots. Though there was sometimes a shortage of spots during the day, we were always to find a spot within a few minutes. Parking in the evenings was always easy. Unfortunately they also allow some employees to park in the garage....which is unacceptable with the limited number of spots. They should be using the surface lot beyond the garage. (I actually had to tell an employee to vacate a spot....they have the option of the surface lot while I did not.) Check in was quick and easy and our luggage arrived in our room promptly. They upgraded us from a garden view to an ocean view as Hhonors Diamond members and also provided us with two free welcome cocktails in Humu, a $40 dining certificate, and waived resort fee. (waiving the resort fee was a nice touch) I am not sure if the resort fee was waived because we were on a reward stay or simply because we were Diamond members. For the second and subsequent nights we were upgraded to the Napua Tower do to some issues we experienced. There is a grand beautifully decorated lobby with concierge, front desk, bell services, and dining reservations. There is also a nice lobby bar, though we did not try it as we would prefer to be outside near the water. The bar was always empty with the exception of the night that a convention was in house. Most of the day there was a Guava juice available near the front desk which was a nice touch. The $25 per night resort fee (Yes, I feel resort fees are a scam....include it in the base rate!) includes beach lounges and umbrellas, water slides / water elevator / Tarzan swing / lazy river, towel service, local calls, coffee/tea in room, and wifi access. Initially on booking we were concerned that the hotel pool would be extremely crowded. Given we were at the resort during low season we were always able to find a lounger at the adult pool, but lounger saving was rampant at the activity pool and the staff did absolutely nothing to try and free up loungers even after hours of being unoccupied. Fortunately getting a lounger and umbrella at the beach was always easy as the county has a law that the chairs can not be unoccupied for more than 30 minutes and the beach staff sets up the chairs on request. Personally I prefer to be at the beach hearing the crashing waves. Finding space at the pool in the evening was always easy and the pool area was open till 10pm I believe. For guests staying at the adult pool, you must still go over to the activity pool to get towels and the ever popular wrist band. They have staff coming around asking to see your wrist band. It would be nice if those same people would be tasked with providing arm bands and towels at the adult pool like many other hotels do....all they would need is a simple roster of rooms or a handheld with guest data. Not a big issue but a minor thing that should seriously consider implementing. The pools and associated water effects are all great. (Though the water elevator is a one time thing, it's cool but the wait to do it is pretty long and you kind of go...hmmm, okay.) The water at the beach was calm in the mornings and still enjoyable in the afternoons when the trade winds pick up. As expected dining and cocktails on property are expensive, everything we tried was pretty good. (One of our meals in Humu was a bit over seasoned for our taste but still good) It is an easy 5 minute walk over to the Shops at Wailea for additional dining and shopping options. There is also an on property casual counter service restaurant on the way to the self parking but we did not take the opportunity to go in and check it out. There are quite a few shops in the same wing that leads to the self parking. Since we were in Kihei for Scuba or Surfing many days, we tended to do lunch in Kihei. The room we had in the Napua tower (as well as our first room) were both nearly the same. (There were a few more appointments in the Napua rooms but nothing significant as far as in room amenities). The rooms were large and quiet. Set up with a king size bed, love seat, work desk, and chair/ottoman, louvered shutters, and a nice balcony with a table and two chairs. The rooms are exactly as described on the hotel website and nicely decorated with plenty of storage and a nice bed. The rooms have an HDTV and clock radio with MP3 jack. The climate control works well and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while the climate control is still functioning. The AC shuts off when the balcony door is open but that is fully understandable. The room had no discernable noise from nearby rooms. There is also a mini bar and counter area. You can rent a fridge for a reasonable price. We requested one but it never showed up and when we ran to the store that evening we just got a small cooler to keep our drinks cool. The bathrooms are very nice, with a separate shower and soaking tub, plenty of counter space, hamper, etc. The have plenty of toiletries on hand. There is also plenty of closet space in the rooms as well as in room safe, iron / ironing board, etc. The Napua Tower upgrade was wonderful. Though the room was basically the same, they had a concierge on staff in the tower, business center (no extra charge), breakfast (continental + 1-2 hot items), an afternoon tea hour (cookies and tea/lemonade), and an evening cocktail hour with attended bar, appetizers (hot and cold). There was plenty of seating space in the lounge area and the staff was wonderful....always willing to go the extra mile. What a great place. (But is it worth the $$$ to pay for an upgrade....you would have to decide that yourself.) Most of the staff at the hotel was excellent. Bell services was usually good, valet, front desk, and concierge were helpful. Housekeeping was always great. Two points do stand out however: One day however we came back from diving and I dropped my wife off at the valet area with the intent that she was going to get a bellman to bring the dive gear up to the room. Well 15 minutes later I am walking through the lobby and see all the bellman standing around the bell desk chatting so I went to the valet area and realized not one of them had come out to help her. SO....I got a bell cart and took it myself. While we are getting in the elevator, one of the a bellman comes over and says that we can not use the cart and "do you want help"....I said absolutely....he proceeds to try and take the cart back out of the elevator to bring to us later. (there is not a service elevator...they use the guest elevators so that was not the reason) ABSOLUTELY not....I told him get in or leave....he decided to leave. What a jerk...and he was one of the gaggle of them standing around the bell desk chatting. The second issue we ran into was that the louvered shutters in our room were broken. We called and asked to have them fixed that morning and low and behold 6 hours later we come back and the shutters are worse...the broken parts are missing, more louvers are missing, and the door was jammed shut. After talking to their customer service hotline multiple times over 45 minutes and telling them it was NOT a housekeeping issue they sent a housekeeper to clean up broken glass. (The housekeeper was very friendly and apologized for the hotlines error) Then they said that the blinds would be fixed because the maintenance staff was going off shift. Unacceptable. They offered to move our room but we had just unpacked. Finally after some In back and fourth banter they agreed to move us to the Napua tower....that was a nice upgrade and worth the effort to pack up and move. All in all I could have driven into Kihei gotten a tube of caulk, and fixed the shutters myself for less time than it took to demand they take care of the issues. We would have been happy staying in the original room had the problem not happened but really liked the upgrade! Based on positive reviews we decided to attend the Luau at the Grand Wailea. This Luau recently moved from another resort and we really enjoyed the show and meal. We paid a bit extra for the premium seating and were right up front. The Luau was not overly crowded so I am not sure if it was 100% worth the upgrade to premium but I think so. We were able to hit the buffet first and had a great view. The only odd thing about the Luau is the check in. They tell you to arrive during a particular window to check in....well low and behold when you get there the staff is on a union mandated break, and the guests must stand around waiting. What? Once we got into the grounds everything was great. The show was good (fire dancer!) and the food was good. It was different than the Old Lahaina Luau we attended last year. I like the show a bit better at Wailea as well as the ocean front location. The food was about the same (quality but buffet), I liked the show a bit more at Wailea. The selection of tropical cocktails was more limited than at the Old Lahaina but Wailea had more general offerings for mixed drinks and beer / malt's. I try not to be over critical of hotels, as you will seem most of my reviews are favorable. All in all this was a great stay but believe that they need to polish their service before they truly deserve a 4-5 star for service. As I mentioned, while some of the staff such as housekeeping always performed at a high level other services tended to fall short, with a few glaring failures. Given this was during off season, I wonder how the services would be during the high season! On our next stay in Wailea we will probably investigate other offerings in the area. While the pool is the central point of the hotel, and it was great.....I donâ€™t think they can live on the laurels of the pool. Though we were on a reward stay, I write this review from the aspect of looking at what the regular rate was during the stay and write the review from that perspective. I am so very glad we stayed and got to experience the great amenities but might look at neighboring hotels next time. Beautiful Grounds, Great Rooms Great Pool / Beach.....Service needs polishing.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jvb1128
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it! We were there for 6 days in early September. I was not sure what to expect based on earlier reviews, but the reception staff was extremely friendly and even upgraded us to a lovely oceanview room. We were there the week of Labor Day so it seemed to be a little quieter. All facilities, beach, etc. were lovely. It is an idyllic setting, beach was stunning, pools perfect, and sunrises and sunsets were to die for. Did the water slides and enjoyed immensely. We went to Humuhumu and Bistro Molokini. We thought the food was great (pricier at Humuhumu) but food was better than expected and what a place to enjoy the sunsets. Staff could not have been more accommodating. For breakfast, we went to Kihei which we found to be an absolutely charming place to go. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: dgitaltimes
Reviews.Content: The beach, pool, service, restaurant are all very good. You can rent many there like surf board, boat, not to mention you have free towel and beach chair available. Walking around the beach (very long) is also a good thing you can do. Sitting around the beach, or inside the room, you can see Sunset.

Reviews.Title: “I would expect better service for the price”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_Delgado
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. This is a great resort. However, I find it way to pricy for the quality of service. After paying substantial bucks for the room we have to pay not to get charged extra for the microwave and the minibar fridge!! That's something I wouldn't expect from a hotel of this category. Also, unpleasent surprises came with the bill: a $25 a-day charge for use of "resort facilities" (tea and coffee in the room, gym, etc.). Again, these come free in all hotels of this category I've stayed so far. Finally, we mistakenly put a large beach towel into the towel bin of the hotel the first day of our stay. We called every day to see whether the towel had been recovered. Never returned our calls. Nobody took action on it. We had to leave without the towel after almost two weeks of stay. But, hey, the beach is gorgeous, swimming pools nice and hotel accomodations are first class. Mind it: you're paying for it. Also the restaurants are quite pricy and I found the food just ok. Finally, it's a little far away of where action takes place. If you like a quite beach, it's perfect. For some shopping and walking around, you've to move north. Forget about the shops at Wailea. They're more expensive that the high-up malls in NY or DC.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: semcclure
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Grand Wailea. It's a beautiful hotel with friendly staff and great amenities. Our 6 year old son loves the pools. The beach is easy to access and is gorgeous. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation and A Perfect Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tess79
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Maui we stayed at the Grand Wailea. Not only did we find this to be the most beautiful resort, we found the service (particularly the housekeeping and room service staff) to be excellent!!! This is a perfect place to honeymoon! The grounds are gorgeous and the pool area and beach are the best in Wailea! You can't go wrong with this hotel and everything you need, from shops to great food, is right on site.

Reviews.Title: “You will love this place if you love shallow souless people and shameless displays of wealth & excess.”
Reviews.Author: rggsquared
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you want a disney world experience with a beach view. Everything about this resort and the Island of Maui is shallow, grandiose, and all about nothing of substance. Stay here is you want to show off your recent plastic body job. Stay here is you want a crowded beach with endless activities, booze, and fun. Stay here is if you want shopping and all of the creature comforts. If you want robot-like staff and customer service stay here. This island is like any mainland style ritzy "it's all about me all of the time" such as South Beach, the Cape, and LA. I recommend it for you if you want a distant, unfriendly and completely souless experience. The other guests and the staff are happy to oblige you. Stay here to be nickled and dimed to death. If you want the Aloha Spirit and "Hawaii", don't stay on Maui or the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be, better options on Maui for less $$$...”
Reviews.Author: nycDON
Reviews.Content: Came to Grand Wailea on a honeymoon for 6 days after coming from the St Regis on Kauai, and boy what a difference. I know its not exactly fair to compare a different hotel chain from a different island, but we paid similar money to stay at both, with similarly nice accomodations. St Regis Kauai is head and shoulders above in terms of service, grounds upkeep, and exclusivity. You can relax there, not worry about racing for good seats, there are not 1000's of screaming children and pushy adults. I just dont know how else to describe it other than "down market," which is not how a hotel in this price range should feel, in my opinion. The good: Our room was awesome, we were on the 5th or 6th floor and we were upgraded to oceanview room with terrace. Room was perfectly nice, although our couch was a bit stodgy. Otherwise an A+. Room service despite not serving 24hrs (which lets be real people at these prices and on maui, this should be available) was pretty good and we used them several times. Great views from the room. The beach was nice (if you could get on it). The pools/slides are cool. The grounds are very nice in certain areas where the original hotels grandeur has been preserved, such as the lobbys and entrance and some of the outer grounds/gardens. Its beautiful to walk around at night. There is a nice long path that runs along the hotel beach and goes past many other hotels, nice for a walk in the morning or sunset. Good snorkeling can be found near by, we swam with sea turtles and saw lots of fish. And the highlight of our trip was SHANE THE BARTENDER, WHO ROCKED . HE KNEW US BY NAME AND WELCOMED US WARMLY each time we popped by for a drink. He would remeber what we drank last and was very good. Unfortunately, he was the only one who we got this type of service from at this hotel (and in comparison, when at the st regis, there were several employees throughout the resort who knew us by name and were outgoing and friendly.) Big difference to me. The Bad: I was here 10 yrs ago, and let me tell you there has been alot of change. All these glowing reviews of this place must be from first time travelers to this hotel. If they had the priviledge to see this place in its glory, they would have a better idea of whats gone wrong with this place. The hotel itself is basically the same, except everything seems worn and dirty: pathways are dirty and falling apart in some areas, there are wood banisters in some spots that need some up keep or paint or to be redone, or something. The grandiose gardens that I came back for are not as well kept, and there are plants that are really beat up and half dying. They need to be replaced. The grass along the walkways is worn out and its dirt or yellow/dead in many places. they try to cut and paste new grass is but it just doesnt look right. The water by the restaurant on the tropical lagoon is atrocious looking, I was concerned for the fish they had in it (and in the grand scheme of things these might not be such a big deal, and I am being critical, but only because I saw the real Grand Wailea Hotel and Spa, and know how far its fallen. Several times we tried to call down to the concierge and the phone just rand and rang and rang. I spoke to several peope who are "members" allowing them special rates and frequent visits and they agreed that the place has taken a turn for the worse.) There is just a major vibe of corner cutting, and just maintaing what they have, to milk it for as much money as they possibly can, without investing anything more money into it. OK NOW LETS TALK ABOUT THE UNPLEASANT POOL/BEACH SCENE. I love the pools at this place. However, there are just too many people on this property. WHERE DO ALL THESE PEOPLE COME FROM?!!?!?!?!?!? The management is dropping the ball here big time. Finding a free chair can be a nightmare. There are lines for towels, which are needed to claim a chair. People line up at ungodly hours to be first. They say they clear the towels off the chairs if people dont come down after an hour, but I didnt see this happen once. The pool/beach staff was not friendly at all. I was told these hotel gigs are hard to get on Maui and are well liked by the locals, apparently not! The loungers and chairs around the pools are stacked so closely there may not even be an inch between them, and in some places they go 3 or 4 rows deep. I felt like I was sitting on the expressway, in rush hour, only in a lounge chair with palm trees around me, and a melted 20 odd dollar pinacolada. And dont let them tell you they are at max capacity, because this hotel is huge and was not filled if we were getting free oceanview room upgrades. The scam here is, they built this huge condo complex (Hoelei? or something)across the street, and to get people to stay there, they allow them full access to the Grand Wailea pools and grounds. These people seem to bring kids by the dozen. Its screaming kids all day. I felt like I was at a six flags water park, not an alleged 4 star resort upscale resort. So you basically have 2 resorts worth of people on one property. NO WONDER THE PLACE IS SO OVER CROWDED. SO HERE I AM WITH MY VERY HIGH ROOM RATE AND 20$ COCKTAIL, STRUGGLING TO FIND A SEAT ANYWHERE NEAR A BODY OF WATER, WEDGED IN TRAFFIC 3 ROWS BACK FROM THE POOL AND IM STUCK BEHIND/PUSHED OUT BY PEOPLE WHO ARE NOT EVEN HOTEL GUESTS!!!!!!!! THIS IS AN OUTRAGE!!!!!!! but this is not a problem, just simply rent one of there 300 dollar a day poolside huts and you will not have to worry. Service is so so poolside. Did I mention the screaming kids yet? haha! This place has sold its soul in my opinion, I dont even want to get into the beach scene, which was actually a little better. I left with a bad taste in my mouth, wishing I had never left the st regis. I will never be back. I gave 3 stars because the grounds are still somewhat nice in comparison to most properties and the pools are still cool. If you walked around this place at night after all the cattle go back to the barn, and the darkness covers up the blemishes, its a beautiful place. We just spent alot of time off the property and hung in our room so we could have some peace and quiet. Something that there is a severe shortage of here. Do yourself a favor and go to the 4 Seasons, the Ritz or Kea lani if your coming to Maui. We were watering at the mouth walking past the Marriot Outrigger resort which is down the beach path from the GW. Things looked so peaceful and realxing and serent there. Chairs were spaced out appropriately. This place needs to lower its prices and have there 4 star rating removed. We still managed to have a great time here, but beware! Things are not the same here anymore. If we do come back we'll stay at the Marriott a few doors down or the Ritz in Kaplua or 4 seasons next door. Both looked serene and could be had for less money, except the 4 seasons. BOTTOM LINE: THE GRAND WAILEA IS A ZOO AND THE HOTEL HAS TAKEN A TURN FOR THE WORSE!!!! IF YOU MUST GO, IT BETTER BE DURING THE SLOWEST PART OF THE SEASON THERE. LOOK ELSEWHERE, UNLESS YOU ARE A FAMILY WITH & KIDS AND PLAN TO STAY AT THE CONDO PLACE HOELEI ACROSS THE STREET. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at its finest...”
Reviews.Author: jandrew461
Reviews.Content: I went to the Grand Wailea expecting to be impressed and amazed...instead, I was blown away. My experience there was nothing short of amazing from the moment I checked in to the moment I had to leave (albeit kicking and screaming). It was all I could do to not stay another week. The staff at the GW are the most attentive and friendly I have ever encountered, exactly what I would have expected from the Waldorf Astoria, but I was still impressed. The rooms were cleaned consistently and in great detail. The spa grande was by far the highlight of my trip. The personal attention and level of service/amenities at this spa was the best I have ever received. If you get a chance, play the Old Blue golf course as well. With stunning views of the ocean and mountains, and beautifully manicured fairways and greens, this course was all I could have hoped for. My only negative feedback was that I received three phone calls asking me to join their membership program, as well as a letter...but this was such a minor thing that it hardly even mattered. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone that was looking to find a relaxing, beautiful, breathtaking piece of paradise. Thanks to all at the GW that made my stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Slide & Comfortable, Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelmasterhi
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay. The room was clean & comfortable. The bathroom was spacious for a hotel bathroom. We did not like that even with a Resort Fee there were NO newspapers, NO refrigerator ($8 per day charge), and NO coffee in the Lobby. We felt that nothing was provided for the Resort Fee. The pools at the GW are the best part. Shade is very hard to find unless you pay extra everyday on top of the room and resort fee. On our last night a large family checked into the room next to us and the noise was unbearable. We made several calls and nothing was ever resolved and we suffered a sleepless night and noisy morning before we left. I felt that management could have handled this matter and they did NOTHING. The Hotel had plenty of empty rooms and they should have moved the family next to us to another room. A great place for families and do not expect Management to address your concerns.

Reviews.Title: “I am sooo glad we didn't listen to those reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: Mommy17
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for months and every time I start writing, something comes up; I am so glad the time has come to give you my honest review of this resort. Let me start off by saying, we were worried for the months preceding our trip to Maui. There were some concerning reviews regarding this property, which we didn't see until after we booked the Grand Wailea. We even contemplated staying somewhere else after we read some of the reviews, but we are very glad we didn't give in to blind fear. With that said.... There is one word I can use to describe this resort- SPECTACULAR! As soon as we arrived we were welcomed with a warm smile and a Lei greeting for the entire family :). Check-in was a breeze and we were surprised to know that we had been upgraded to the Napua Tower, which is the Grand Wailea's Concierge building. We had a great room with breathtaking side views of the ocean. The marble bathroom was beautiful with a soaking tub and a shower big enough for 2! That day, we arrived just in time for the Cocktail hour (complimentary for Napua Tower guests). The cocktail hour consisted of unlimited cocktails, tasty Hors d'oeuvres and an array of bright and colorful Shirley Temples for the kids! Everyone we encounted was warm and friendly. The pools were awesome and our kids really enjoyed them. The water elevator is as cool as it sounds and the tarzan jump- in my son's words- was "Out of this world!" The ocean was gorgeous, although it would tend to be rough and choppy in the afternoons, which was the time of day we normally would be there. The impeccably manicured grounds were absolutely phenomenal, and as full as the resort was it never felt crowded. The resort had ordered more than 700 extra chairs around the pool areas to ensure the comfort of their guests, which we really appreciated because that meant that we didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn to get our chairs. The food was great and their Sunday Brunch was unforgettable! The kids really enjoyed the desserts. The location is wonderful as it is next to the Shops at Wailea, which is an upscale center with stores like Louis Vuitton and Gucci and a couple of really good restaurants. We have to stress how much we appreciated the hotel's hospitality. Everyone, from the ladies who cleaned our room to the Napua Tower's Concierge staff, the bartenders, the guitar player at the lobby bar to the Executive Office staff member we met on our last day, who so warmly snapped our last family photo at the resort as we were departing. Everyone we encountered at this hotel appeared to be sincerely happy and delighted to serve us. We truly received exceptional service at the Grand Wailea and hopefully will be back soon! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “THESE GUYS ARE HORRIBLE : AARON IS A DISGRACE TO SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: caved050
Reviews.Content: I stayed their for my honeymoon - and they threw an item out from my room through room service. I spent hours upon hours looking for assistance from them - they sent a security guard to the room accusing me of lying and rummaging through my personal belongings and under garments - then they ignored me till the end of my stay when Aaron who denied any assistance showed up with a phony smirk to say we can't do anything about it. Spend nearly $500/night for this level of service - NEVER again.

Reviews.Title: “I was living a dream”
Reviews.Author: vacationjulia
Reviews.Content: I visited your resort between September 11 and 19, 2010. When I first arrived at the resort on Saturday, I routinely asked one of your guests how he was and his answer was â€œIâ€™m living a dreamâ€�. I quickly began to understand his response because I too began to imagine myself in a dream that I didnâ€™t want to wake up from. Every morning when I opened the shades and saw the beautiful Pacific, I pinched myself to make sure I was awake and not sleeping. Location alone does not guarantee a memorable vacation. The staff was so professional and kind that I wanted to find a question to ask them on a regular basis. I will return and fully recommend this resort to all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel BUT....how the mighty fall...”
Reviews.Author: rsturdy67
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice before - the last time being eight years ago. We always had a wonderful time and could not wait to come back. (from the UK - long trip but we knew it would be worth it). Put simply this is still a stunning hotel in a great location with wonderful grounds and fantastic pools - but what a disapointment. However the tough economic climate has taken its toll. - The biggest problem is the pools but I will come back to that. On arrival (after 20hrs travel) I had to load our bags and take them to reception myself as nobody was available to help at that time. - No smiles on reception and then we made it to our room - which was lovely! Then we just wanted some water.- however, none in the room and no more mini bar - the mini bar was still in the room but locked (no access - they no longer offer this service due to the financial conditions I was told - however we could hire a fridge for the room at $8 / day plus delivery). So called for room service at 22:35 - "Sorry room service stops at 22:30" - "All I want is some water and juice - we are all really thirsty" - "Go to the main bar - you can get water there" - "our daugher is now asleep- we don't want take her to the bar" - "sorry can't help you, room service is closed!" Needless to say that was a real disapointment after looking forward to the trip for so long. Including taxes we were paying just over $400/night for the most basic room overlooking the car parks - not a problem in itself although noisy in the early morning with delivery vehicals etc - All rooms other than suites are the same size with the same facilities - its just that you can pay extra for nicer views and to be nearer to the pools etc - If I do go back again I would pay for a sea view as really you are paying for a stunning sun set view each night - priceless!. Anyway - my real disapointment was the pools (we were there for the last week in August and the first week in September)- They really are extensive and great fun. I should also say that my disapointment wasn't shared by my seven year old daughter who had a wonderful time and thought that everything was amazing. The problem that we as grown ups had was that when you stay in a top flight hotel and pay a lot of money for the rooom (plus a daily $25 resort charge) - you dont expect not to be able to find three loungers together after 10am - you also don't expect to be in a line of twenty sunbeds each literally within one inch (or less) of your neighbours lounger (three rows deep). When we had previously stayed here you could turn up at any time of the day and have a comfortable choice of loungers. However, I spoke with the towel attendent who explained that the hotel had come to an arrangement with a neighboring newely built appartment complex that gave all residents unrestricted access to the pools - They had also put up at least four times the amount of loungers to accomodate - taking up every last piece of available poolside space and this still wasn't enough. If you are tough, and can cope with stress well, and can get your family up early to secure a spot then you will have a great time although you will still be disapointed with the denisty of the beds by the pool. In summary - I will be checking trip advisor in fine detail before I consider going again - I really hope that the hotel fixes things and returns to the glory days - otherwise there are so many alternative places to go and nice hotels to stay at that offer all the positives with none of the negatives of the not quite so grand wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: BetsyBPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Really impressive. Just gorgious and our view was stunning. Loved the property and all the pools. The rope swing was fun and I enjoyed swimming upstream in directional pool. I thought the water elevator was a little silly but that didn't stop me from going in it twice and I really enjoyed acting like a kid by sliding down the myriad of water slides. Very nice hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “I was in Heaven the entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: PatrikaDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: From our arrival on 9/16 until our happily sanctioned late check out on 9/20, we felt appreciated and pampered. From previous reviews on this site, I was anticipating perfunctory service in an oppulent resort setting. This was not the case! The service was awesome and genuine. The first night there, we went to the grocery to get some nibbles, drinks, etc. for our in room refrig (which was delivered immediately). We parked in the self park garage and were each carrying 2-3 grocery bags and our purses. We got lost and disoriented (this resort is huge!). My friend left me with the bags and went to look for someone to ask directions. Two very handsome and friendly gentlemen offered to assist. It turned out to be Micheal, Director of Security and Jeremy, another staffer. They not only led us to our room, they insisted on carrying the groceries in for us! The next four days were delightful with every staff member we encountered making eye contact, smiling and offering a warm greeting. Our beds were blissful and the room big and comfortable. The beach boys and gal happily set up chairs and an umbrella for us on the beach. I could go on and on... We highly recommend "The Grand"! This was my fifth trip to Maui and by far, my most enjoyable. Oh yes, the fragrant flower leis upon arrival were delightful. Don't miss this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time & Fantastic Weather”
Reviews.Author: soCAtraveler
Reviews.Content: September was a perfect time to visit this hotel-weather could not have been more perfect and there were no signs of rain or any overcast days. It was also a perect time because there weren't that many people there-well aside from a giant Mon A Vie conference for a few of the days we were there. We decided not to rent a car on this trip-simply because what usually happens is that the car gets parked in the parking structure the entire time and doesn't get used-so why waste the $ to have it parked the whole time! Everything of interest to us-ie shopping & dining, was within walking distance of this hotel. Our largest decision each day seemed to be whether to spend the day at the pool or spend the day at the beach-rought life I know! The main pool was great and there were no problems finding chairs or umbrellas for that matter-i was a tad bit worried because of the reviews on here regarding that and having to wake up at 7am to get a chair or umbrella-but we had no problems each day around 10am. It was also great because this hotel didn't nickel & dime you over everything-chairs and umbrellas were complimentary each day both at the pool and at the beach. The adult pool was great and even the regular pool was ok-didn't see that many kids. We did do the spa for manicures/pedicures-my polish-9 days later, is still in tact, so I thought it was worth it. Even treated my husband to one too. Regarding the food-stay away from the Breakfast Buffet there-well unless you plan on eating $28 each! worth of food for breakfast It really wasn't worth it for a hot omelet and some fruit-we just grabbed a bagel at the little bistro that was upstairs from the buffet place. Wish I could remember what the place was called-they served hot & cold items-even had boxes of cereal, fruit, sandwich meats that you could buy. I'd suggest NOT ordering lunch there-gross sandwiches :( We liked the Bistro Molokini next to the adult pool-ate there a few times for lunch and dinner. $17 chicken sandwich, $22 Lobster Sandwich, $4.50 sodas, $14 cocktails, $19 cold crab cake, $26 surf & turf, $14 calamari appetizer-some expamles of menu items We never made it to HumuHumu-the fancy restaurant there. After reading reviews from here it just didn't sound worth it. We ate a few times at the Shops of Wailea which is like 2 blocks away-Tommy Bahama restaurant was great-even though it is a chain restuarant-great happy hour & GREAT food & live entertainment out on the patio. There is also a Ruth Chris steak house and a sushi place at this outdoor mall. Ruth Chris is always great & the sushi place was just ok for us- pretty pricey for mediocre food. I also wouldn' t recommend buying sunscreen anywhere on this property-$22 for it! Go to the ABC store in the Shops @ Wailea-MUCH cheaper-ie $8 there! Same for buying macadamia nuts. There is an Italian place that serves Great Pizza and salad across from the Shops of Wailea-think it was called Matteo's-it overlooks the golf course. All you see from the street is an Italian flag waving-no name or anything-our cabbie told us about it. Monday night was 1/2 off the menu & wine too-great deal and really good pizza! The Shops at Wailea are great-your typical Louis Vuitton & Gucci were the highlights, got a few items at these stores & the sales tax is cheaper than CA-so it was a deal to us :) All in all, a great trip & we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is one of the most beautiful places I have ever stayed at. As you drive up you realized this hotel was going to be nice. The staff welcomes you right away. The front desk was so welcoming. The only bad thing is we arrived at the hotel at 12:45 p.m. and the room was ready until 2:45 p.m. The room was very nice and had a lot of room to walk around in. The pool area was very large and clean. There were a lot of seats that werenâ€™t reserved after 7:00 a.m. so we had no problem getting chairs together. We would arrive around 9:00 a.m. each day. I think there may be a problem during high season but you have that problem everywhere. Go to Vegas in July. The restaurants were pricey but I found a lot of hotels are like that. We did eat at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a which was great and well worth the price. The buffet in the morning at the Grand Dining room is not worth the price. Mateoâ€™s right outside the resort was good for dinner and great prices. I would recommended renting a car since parking is free and that way youâ€™re not stuck eating at the resort each night. Overall our stay at the resort was great. Throughout the whole stay the staff was very nice and the grounds were very clean. Did not use the spa since we thought it was way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “The spa is first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: jent72la
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon last week to Maui and I was lucky enough to have a facial at the Grand Wailea Spa in Maui. I had the organic facial, which was just wonderful. My facialist Jessica was just terrific and made the whole experience so relaxing. The staff at the spa is extremely accommodating and gracious and the spa itself is just gorgeous. I wish I had booked another treatment like a massage but I just didn't have the time this trip. I would highly recommend this spa if you plan to be vacationing in Maui and want to experience the best in pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Very ornate ... not so sure it's worth all the money....”
Reviews.Author: Fantastic49
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk: When we first arrived at the Grand Wailea, we had 2 separate rooms, so we had two different desk clerks. One of them was NOT nice!! I think some previous reviewers mentioned the lack of courtesy before. When you are spending almost $400+ per night for a BASIC room, EVERYBODY NEEDS TO BE SMILING AND KIND!!! Not the case. The clerk did her job, but was not pleasant and never once even cracked a smile. The other clerk was very nice and accommodating and he ended up upgrading our room to an ocean view. Several other desk clerks were also very friendly, but I feel like at this level of hotel, there should be absolutely no exceptions. The Rooms: They were very spacious and pretty nice. We had a room with double queen beds. The bathroom was huge, mostly marble, and the toilet was separate from the rest of the bathroom and had a separate door, which I really liked. There was a large soaking tub and a separate shower with a little bench. Good water pressure and plenty of space for your things. Great little mango/honey shower gels and shampoo/conditioners. Usually, I ignore the hotel samples, but these were very nice. There was a large flat screen TV in the room and plantation shutters that kept out most of the light if you wanted to sleep in. You could also sleep with the windows open and the screen door closed, so no bugs got in. Maid service was annoying, but efficient. They just came way too early, so we had to use the do not disturb sign every day. The carpets did look like they could stand to be replaced. They weren't dirty, but again, for the price of the rooms, we expected better. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were great. I slept well every night. The hotel: The hotel is extremely ornate and has a lot of beautiful elements. Statues all over the place, flowers all over the place, they've clearly put a LOT of money into making this hotel spectacular. That being said, we went down the street to the Four Seasons to have a drink and it was sheer understated elegance. We didn't go into any of the guest rooms, but the common areas were just gorgeous and classy. While the GW is not OVERstated, we agreed that it IS stated. If we were to spend that type of money again, we would probably go to the Four Seasons. In addition, the GW property is HUGE. There is a long walk pretty much anywhere you go. I think we were pretty central to everything, but it took at least 3-5 minutes to walk anywhere. I would have hated to have had one of the less central rooms. It was mostly ok because the weather was pleasant, but at times it was just a pain in the butt. There were times when I would bring things for later just so I didn't have to walk to get back to the room. The pools: There are a ton of pools on the property, but we only used the adult pool, which was nice. There were a lot of slides all over, which would be a lot of fun for kids, but we weren't sure if there was an age or height limit and it didn't appear that they were used too much by adults, so we never used them. Never too crowded (we went the week after the Labor Day holiday) and the pool had a beautiful fountain. You could get as many towels as you liked, but they did ask for your name and room number before giving you anything. It wasn't a long process. The beach: The beach behind the pools is GORGEOUS. We had the use of free beach chairs and umbrellas while at the beach and the sand out there was just supersoft and beautiful. It's a golden color, so it's darker than what I normally see, but I got used to it very quickly. There was very little debris in the sand or the water and it made swimming in the ocean a joy. I would walk down the beach next door to the front of the Four Seasons property and enjoy the view from there. Just stunning. The spa: Spa Grande is FABULOUS!!! The facilities are great and I didn't have enough time to fully enjoy them to the extent I wanted. Think Burke Williams within a resort. There are 5 different baths with different salts, eastern and western hot and cold pools, a steam room, sauna and several other amenities. Make sure you ask for a tour of the facility so you know where everything is. And get there at least an hour before your service so you can enjoy it. If I did it again, I'd allow myself an hour and a half to two hours because I like to do repeats. They also give you a free 5 minute exfoliation if you are receiving a service. This is a great way to ensure that all of the guests are clean before they use the amenities (you are still required to shower first). I got an 80 minute massage that wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was perfectly fine and I felt extremely relaxed afterward. One thing that was REALLY annoying about the spa is that the staff was constantly walking around calling names of guests who had services scheduled. When you are trying to relax in the steam room or a bath or something, the last thing you want to hear is someone else's name repeated over and over (rather loudly, I might add). They should take a hint from Burke Williams and require folks to report to one area 5 minutes prior to their service. That way, the other guests are not disturbed. They came to get me a full 10 minutes prior to my service. I needed my 10 minutes and still made it upstairs in enough time that I had to wait for my masseuse. The food: It's extremely expensive. Extremely. We had lunch once at the restaurant closest to the Hibiscus Pool (I forget the name) and the food was very average. Definitely not worthy the price. We had dinner one night at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a (named after the fish) and it was pretty good, but again, very pricey. We were having a birthday celebration and had asked for seating to see the sunset, but we didn't feel like the seating we got was optimal. In fact, when we spoke to the person making the reservation, she told us the sun set at 7:30pm when it was fully below the horizon at 6:30!! A couple of the servers were great, though, and we had fun with them. We mostly ate off property, including The Shops down the street. We really enjoyed Longhi's for breakfast and we also ate at the place next door to it (something about burgers), but didn't enjoy the food or the service nearly as much as Longhi's. One day, my friend and her dad had the $50 buffet brunch, which they said was decent. They did mention that the view from the buffet was spectacular. I went driving up a mountain instead, so I missed it. :) We also had dinner at Nick's Fishmarket, which had delicious food and stellar service and we tried Pacifico's in Lahaina (worth the 45 minute drive -- if you go, be sure to get some shaved iced from Ululani's). Our first night, we ate at Cafe Olei (sp?), which we didn't particularly enjoy. The expensive food was average to below, with a less than average atmosphere at a strip mall. It was recommended to us by the valets at the hotel. Bad choice, skip it. The concierge service: On one day, I spent over 3 hours going back and forth with the concierge about activity plans. It was my most frustrating, non-enjoyable day. I wanted to go to Road to Hana, but the people I was with didn't want to go, so the concierge (who sounded like she knew her stuff) told me there were less touristy, more spiritual things to do there. We agreed to connect an hour later and when I showed up, she was the only concierge out of 4 of them who was busy. After waiting for 30 minutes and seeing the people going nowhere, I finally asked her to call me when they were done because I wanted to get in some time in the sun. Of course, she called as soon as I settled in my lounge chair. She said I needed to come back up so she could show me some places on a map, so I headed back up. The call soon dropped and she didn't call back. When I called back, I was told she was busy with other guests. I walked up soon after and she started apologizing profusely for having to leave!!! I couldn't believe she had taken an hour break, then came back, helped other people and left without helping me!! She passed me off to another concierge who gave me incorrect directions, even though I asked her repeatedly whether she knew where she was going and told her I didn't want to drive for 45 minutes to get lost. She seemed very unsure of herself. I had to ask her a thousand questions over the course of about an hour just to get any relevant information. And guess what? I never found the location. She claimed she would send up a more detailed map, but the map she sent up was less detailed than the one she showed me at the desk!! Completely useless!! And none of them seemed to know about the black sand beach 10 minutes down the road!! I just don't get how these people can hold these jobs and know practically nothing about what's going on and where things are ... I definitely expected more from such a highly rated hotel, but I was completely disappointed.... Overall, though I enjoyed my visit, I wouldn't stay at this resort again ... it's too expensive for what you get and there are plenty of other really nice places to stay in the area.... but I will DEFINITELY be back to Maui ... it's awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: sckim41
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a week from and we loved it there, especially the pool and spa. It is definitely a gorgeous property. However, there were a few things I wanted to bring up: 1. Our TV didn't work and it had to be replaced twice. 2. Refrigerator - most upscale hotels would provide this without a fee. I heard that they used to provide it and now they charge $8/day! After we landed, we went to Costco to buy a few things, only to find out that they don't provide refrigerators. This alone almost made me wish that I booked the Fairmont. 3. The parking spaces in self parking is EXTREMELY small. We had a full size car and we had to literally squeeze into the space. It was also hard to use the room key to open the gate. It would take about 3-4 attempts before it would work. I also saw a lot of other people with the same issue. 4. We found a gecko in our room. I know it's Hawaii, but since it's a Waldorf Astoria collection, I was surprised to see this. The front desk clerk said that since it's Hawaii, it's normal to see them. 5. $25/day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Ohvox
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty. The housekeeping was perfection. The valets were pleasant and professional. The front desk and concierge personnel were so on it we hardly had to finish our sentences as they already knew what we needed - even beyond our expectations! We came to celebrate our honeymoon and could not have asked for a more romantic stay. Oh - and you HAVE to go to the restaurant Humuhumunukunukuapua'a....the food was out of this world. This place certainly is GRAND.

Reviews.Title: “OMG what a Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelnut
Reviews.Content: This is a very elegant hotel. We were not going to stay here at first we were going to stay in Ka'anapali my husband travels all the time and is a Hilton Honors member and he wanted to stay here. So we rebooked our hotel to the Grand Wailea. OMG what a hotel. It is all marble and has so much art work in it. It was amazing. The valet parking was excellent and Erik B. the head valet was very nice and always asked if he could help us with anything. Gave us great places to get groceries and if we wanted to know where to go, where to eat he was always willing to help. He knew my husbands name the second time we saw him and would always say, "Mr. B how are you today? Where are you going? Have a great day!" It was very personal and was nice to be reconized. Our daughter liked the pools, but would have liked to see a lap pool. Only because she is a competive swimmer and wanted to do laps. Otherwise they were nice. The pool area was always crowded but we were able to always find chairs. Some people had towels on the chairs before 6am as my husband was always up and we had a Deluxe Ocean View room so had a view of the pool too and he said the towels were always out there before he was. Not sure how that was possible as pools did not open until 7am? I would think that they would pull all the towels before opening pool so people who were there could get the first seats by the pool. The ones that put down towels would not show up until later.....not sure how that worked either as there is supposedly a 60 minute time limit if you are not there they are to remove your stuff. I only saw that happen on Saturday and later in the morning. My daughter and I did the spa, that was nice but I would not say it was any nicer than any of the other spa's have been to. We did have good service and they offer alot of stuff. Food was really expense there but it was expense everywhere on the island. We ate at Humuhumu 2 times once for our anniversary. It is very spendy but the food was excellent. Our server the first time was not anything to write about but the second time was excellent. The rooms are not very sound proof. We had a screaming child on the one side of us and every morning before 6am he would be carrying on for hours while we tried to sleep. It was really annoying and one night it was around midnight. Atleast it was half way through our vacation before they showed up but still was annoying since I am totally not a morning person. The beds where very comfortable and we all slept good when we slept! Huge awesome bathrooms! They have some shops right on site and one place had local artists they had some awesome glass jellyfish that I would have loved to have but could not see spending that kind of money for....couple hundred dollars and up. They had other beautiful art in there too. It was a very clean and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: AlyK620
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel truly is Grand (aside from their insane food prices), except that the morning I checked out I noticed over a dozen red bites on my right torso. My allergist confirmed they were BED BUG BITES. Aside from taking the usual precautions and then the usual after-care, I spoke to the hotel I was transfered to Security to "file a report," and when I asked about restitution I was hung up on. When I called back and insisted on speaking to the hotel manager, he was unhelpful to the point of being rude, and at one point stated emphatically "the Grand Wailea does not have a bed bug problem." Well, my torso would beg to differ. It is in fact a great hotel, with an awesome pool area and beach. Remember not all rooms in a hotel will have bed bugs, but based on how I've been treated so far I am not likely to run back there any time soon. It is a very expensive resort, and they should not have bed bugs in any room, or they should do more to help those affected.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Beautiful, Romantic.”
Reviews.Author: SarahAlize
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, impeccable service, lovely beach and pools. It was amazing and cannot wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Grounds and sunsets but pricey!! Totally dies down by 9 PM”
Reviews.Author: Cplaf1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights this week (I'm at the airport writing this). The property is gorgeous with a chapel and pools, etc. Keep in mind that it caters to families with lots of money. The rooms have no fridges (you can rent them for $8 daily.). Hard to eat at a reasonable rate here. An egg sandwich for breakfast was $11 and a yogurt parfait was $7. Drinks at pool were 7-8 for beers and 14 for Pina Coladas, etc. Dinners were ridiculous. Humuhumu restaurant has drinks at $26 (YES 26 bucks). Entrees were around $40+ A good idea is to go to a local supermarket (about 3 miles away) and stock up with a stirofoam cooler. Also note that this place only has 1 lounge open after 9 pm. Everything shuts down. Totally for families who have kids up at 7 am and then crash by 8 pm. The only lounge open is the one in the lobby and that closes at 11-11:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel with 2 star service. Could not believe how unhelpful and unfriendly the staff was”
Reviews.Author: 6colemans
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many top notch, luxury resorts around the world, eg Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton, etc. We enjoy these resorts, not only for their luxury but also for their impeccable service. The Grand Wailea fell short in almost every situation of service, from being greeted when we arrived (which didn't happen), check in staff acting like they were doing us a favor, and on and on. We were bitterly disappointed with the service and also the food at the hotel. Most of the food we ordered there was overpriced and not what you'd expect at a resort of this price point. After several disappointing meals, we decided to eat out most of the remaining meals.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven.................”
Reviews.Author: mylesmom
Reviews.Content: It has taken me a while to write this review. As I do, it brings back such good memories. My family and I travel quite a bit and we depend on Tripadvisor to guide us. I am always thankful to those who write reviews that are helpful which is why I try to do the same when I return. I've learned over the years to take the negative reviews with a grain of salt because some people you just can't please. My husband, son 11 yr., nephew 12 yr. and I traveled to Maui from Honolulu. We were only here for 2 nights, but they were well worth it and left us wanting more. We stopped at the K-mart on the way from the airport and got snacks and drinks to take with us. Prices maybe slightly higher than at home. We also stopped and got lunch at the Burger King before we continued on. We had a fantastic time at the Grand Wailea Resort. When we first planned our trip to Hawaii someone suggested we should do more than one island since we were traveling so far. Boy are we glad we did! When we stepped out of the car we were greeted with flower leis. When we arrived our room wasn't ready, so they allowed us to check our bags and start enjoying the property. Guest services was always very helpful, although oftenbusy, but still the wait was not that long even when there was a line. They serve you juice while you wait and the views from there are great too. We are Hilton members and got a coupon for a free bottle of champagne and $40. off dinner. Join before you go. The staff was always smiling, courteous, and helpful. The lobby area is beautiful with a lot of great art work. The resort is huge, but we had a friendly bellman that gave us a good tour and orientation on the way to our room. We loved our room overlooking the Chapel. The Chapel was a nice cool place to sit and get away from the hustle and bustle. I got some great pictures of the chapel reflected in the pond surrounding it. (I will try and add them later) We could still see a beautiful ocean view and the sun rising/setting from our room which was spectacular. Our room was spacious enough for the 4 of us with 2 queen beds. The beds were extremely comfortable and we all slept like babies. We had a nice size balcony to sit on with chairs and a table. The bathroom is huge and nicely decorated. Although, it was spring break, it was quiet in our building. The resort was packed, but we wouldn't have known it once we were in our room. Take the time to walk the grounds and the beach. Walking from the resort on the path to the left as you face the ocean you pass by some amazing houses and get some wonderful views, there is another little beach cove along the way about a 10 min walk. There is a path to the right which takes you pass what looks like condos. Stunning views everywhere you look. I walked these paths a few mornings when it was quiet before there was more foot traffic. We loved the easy access to the beach and close proximity to the beautiful pool with rapids, Tarzan rope swing, water elevator, lazy river and water slides. The kids loved it. All of us enjoyed the cave and waterfalls. The pool staff and security does a great job of making sure everyone has a good time. Our housekeeper was very nice and made sure we had everything we needed. All of our requests were handled promptly. If you want to continue your fitness routine, don't miss the gym, the facilities at the GW are great. The equipment is state of the art with lots of cardio/weight equipment, each with its own video monitors. We only snacked at the pool one day. We got hamburgers and pina coladas (adult and kid versions) which were good but could be expensive to do every day. We used the self parking lot (which was a quite a walk from our room) but you pass by some great scenery while walking, so we didn't mind. We were always able to find a space. The valet parking was a little expensive for us. There are marble terraces and fountains everywhere. There are a lot of little gazebo with benches where you can sit and enjoy some quiet. The property is meticulously manicured and has a true local island flavor. There is an artificial sandy beach which is good for kids/adults who aren't up for the the strong currents on the real beach. My son and nephew loved the water trampoline. The guy that runs it is very nice. We bought a ticket for them to use it for the day, but they didn't really use it that much, so he let them use the rest of their time the next day. We only snacked at the pool one day. We got hamburgers and pina coladas (adult and kid versions) which were good, but could be expensive to do every day. We asked at guest services and got the name of several nice restaurants. We also tried the Outback Steakhouse about a 15 min drive from the resort headed back towards the airport. Went to the farmer's market http://mauiopenmarket.com We found some great deals on souvenirs and fresh fruit. We all golfed at a country club (a place whose name escapes me). The grounds were beautiful and a lot fun! I don't think you can go wrong with any of the courses. All in all we enjoyed our stay in Maui and at the GW. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: kingsqueen1000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea Hotel in October of 2009 for 5 days. The experience that we had was amazing! Everything about the experience was first class all the way. The hotel room and bathroom were large and inviting spaces. We really enjoyed the balcony that overlooked the ocean. It was a wonderful place to have coffee each morning and watch the sun rise. The hotel concierge was great about helping you book excursions and outings. We went to a luau, had a sunset dinner, went kayaking and snorkeling while we were there. the kayaking and snorkeling trip we booked thru the guide at the hotel. He was wonderful and it was a lot of fun to be on a small trip where you really had time to spend with the guide. It was only my husband and I and one other couple. It was a lot of fun and we were able to see a lot of underwater life. I have recommended this hotel to many people I know who are traveling to Hawaii. The only downside I can say to this hotel would be that it is very expensive, but you definelty get what you pay for. Although meals could be costly there was not one thing that I did not enjoy abou tmy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spa, poor service”
Reviews.Author: AmyLynn230
Reviews.Content: This is a grand property - very lush and manicured. We usually stay at the Ritz in Kapalua, but friends encouraged us to try something new. Upon arrival, we called room service to get some champagne flutes (we bought wine & champagne at Costco) -- room service is answered by VOICEMAIL. You are required to leave a name and room number, and they'll call you back. After 15 minutes with no call back, I called an "express service agent" - identified in the reference book as a troubleshooter. She transferred me back to room service voicemail. I called the agent again, and this time, she said she'd have room service call me. When all was said and done, it took 90 minutes to get the glasses, and they charged us a $5 delivery fee. It appears we should have just walked 1/2 mile to the bar, but by that time, we had already ordered them and were being charged. The spa was amazing - very large with lots of amenities; however, it was like an assembly line with names being called in all spa areas, and overall very confusing. This is a very family-friendly hotel - lots of kids. While the staff tries to enforce the "adult pool" policy of no kids under 18, there are still some rude parents who brought their kids anyway to the adult pool.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: BabiStella
Reviews.Content: We live in Dubai and we are accustomed to five star resorts all over the world, but our stay at Grand Wailea has been the most memorable experience truly had . The Grand Wailea is a state of art property with everything you would expect from a top 5* resort. The resort is fully surrounded by nature: flowers, tropical trees, waterfalls, spectacular views of the ocean â€¦ definitely the best resort in Maui offering a top quality services in all aspects. The reception area is majestic and stunning; large fountains, marble everywhere and modern statues, make you feel like you walk through an open air museum. The gardens, the private chapel surrounded by a pond and waterfalls and the ocean behind it offering a breathtaking sunset every day; the SPA is huge and high quality services offering the best treatmentâ€¦those are just few details to explain how architecturally impressive the resort is. We arrived late evening at the airport and our pick up went smoothly and fast. At the hotel the welcome experience was warm and charming: the employees are calling you by your name and flowers necklace were offered upon arrival. The check in was done in our room and welcome card with a large cheese platter and a bottle of wine was offered from the hotel (truly a personal touch). The room is spacious and nicely decorated: it looks much better on reality than it does on the website! The bathroom is large with big shower and bath tub, there is a lot of space around the marble sink to keep personal creams, solar products, facial make up etc; I liked in particular the positioned of the hair-dryer next to a mirror: a very good thought detail as many hotels store them in drawers or somewhere in the rooms where it is difficult to use it properly. The food and beverage outlets are wonderful and the food is delicious especially the fish restaurant Humuhumunukunukukapuaâ€™a (you may pronounce in syllables) offering a great selection of live lobsters and pacific rim cuisine; The Bistro Malikini is delicious and tasty: the fish and chips is superb, recommended to try; it was not greasy at all and the taste of the cod was delicious. The Japanese restaurant is astonishing (impressive the quality of the furniture and the ambience) offering a real Japanese food specialties â€“ itâ€™s a must if you like Japanese food!. For the independent people there is a coffee shop located in the resort where at any time you can buy whatever you would like for meal or simply eating on a nice terrace overlooking the gardens. They also make large good take away pizzas to taste while looking at the sunset! The professionalism of the employees offered a genuine service, attentiveness and always accommodating at all time. They help us to organize all our excursions and they assisted us all over needed. Last but not least, if you feel like shopping, there is a large choice of shops offering whatever you might have forgotten home up to an interesting art gallery with super cool paintings and art decor. Truthfully, the Grand Wailea resort and its team exceed our expectation: quality, attention to details, comfort and professionalism made us feeling very special creating unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Magical, and magic comes at a price!”
Reviews.Author: PierreChicago
Reviews.Content: So beautiful, best weather and best beach. Hint: If you can travel without kids, go in October when it is less crowded. These guys offer an adult only pool where you can carry your drinks, kiss in the pool, whatever. Hint: I think you can get a garden view (if your room overlooks the chapel) that is the closest to the pool and beach. I may not spend the $$ for the deluxe ocean view next time. The people were great, service was great, I have no complaints. The hotel can get very crowded, so maybe people complain about the service during those times. I did not each dinner there but once, the view was great from the steakhouse, but the food was so/so at best. At night, get in the rent a car and go out to each, there are many great places.

Reviews.Title: “I love Maui and most of all the Grand.”
Reviews.Author: maui1954
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of traveling in my lifetime, I have been very blessed, and one of my favorite place to return to year after year is the Grand Wailea. I love the friendly staff, the comfortable rooms, the beautiful surroundings, the pools and the artists that line the lobby. One of my favorite finds this last trip was a small jeweler down by the pool, Sophie Grace, beautiful hand made jewelry.
