I always try and buy something special each trip to Maui and I will remember the trip of 2010 with the beautiful necklaces and earrings that I purchased that afternoon down by the pool. Go and enjoy, it will be well worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service on all fronts - unexpected, but true!”
Reviews.Author: ALB135
Reviews.Content: I was privileged to attend an elite company trip last week at this coveted 5-star hotel and was both shocked and insulted by the poor customer service by both the wait staff at the restaurants and room service as well as the poor people skills of all those working the resort. Specifically, not only was the room service repeatedly untimely (over 1 hour) and the orders were not correct (but too late, by that time, just glad to have some food!), one of the room service guys didn't even knock, but just came ahead into the room unannounce claiming they were very busy, so he just thought he'd drop off quickly...?? Also, the waitresses around the pool and the pool eateries were minimally congenial at best and service pool side was very slow. Comparitively, I had attended a company meeting in Atlanta just 2 weeks prior at the Omni downtown and I will tell you, EVERY staff member had a smile on their face 100% of the time and always greeted the guests and asked what they could do to assist. Actually, one of the front desk ladies walked down the street 2 blocks after dark to get me allergy medicine and volunteered to do so! I mention this because this is the kind of service you expect from a 5 star - did I mention the Omni was not 5 star? Maybe it should be... In summary, I will continue to patronize those that demonstrate leadership in the industry with kindness, over-delivery of service, and a smile - it's that simple.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...A Perfect Family Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: PetePuma
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children just came back from 8 days in Maui at the Grand Wailea. We've stayed at several other Hilton/Waldorf Properties, and when we thought our past experiences could not be beat, the Grand Wailea came through with a grand slam. First, we had a rather complicated travel itinerary and the local reservation folks at the Grand Wailea were extremely helpful and flexible. Upon we were given a room at the end of one of their concourses, right by the pools, which could not be better for our children. Mind you, this is a large facility so depending on your pleasures, location is key. Prior to arrival we contacted the concierge and arranged a variety of activities including, Scuba, snorkeling, kayaking, horseback riding and a car rental. They even helped arrange transportation to and from the airport as well as shuttled us to a variety of local dinner spots. The entire staff was extremely friendly and polite. This hotel and their management should be commended for defining the true Aloha Spirit. I would highly recommend this property, as it makes the long journey to Maui more then work it.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and loved it even more than the last!”
Reviews.Author: RSC518
Reviews.Content: We returned for another great stay in Maui, and everything was awesome yet again. The staff is pretty friendly, especially the housekeepers. One thing we learned to do is run by the grocery store for the basics like water and breakfast items, because it is really expensive at the hotel. The coffee in the room is great and free. The pools and the ocean out front are so much fun and were very clean. We travel a lot and stay in nice hotels all over, but Grand Wailea is our favorite and cannot wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded, Overrated and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: cpwife
Reviews.Content: What an inflated ego this place has. First the pool area is obnoxiously crowded. Was told by the staff if we wanted chairs at the pool, we need to be ther by 7AM - Really? I'm vacation, not getting up to go to work. If you finally find a chair, it is smack up against another chair - Love thy neighbor? Attitude of housekeeping is lousy. Our 10 yr. old slept on the worst sofa bed imaginable. I tried getting a comforter to make the bed more comfortable. They said if they could find an "extra" they'd bring one - that's the answer I would expect at an economy hotel. As far as the food - go to the Four Seasons next door. This may have been "the resort" in its day, but sadly its glory days are over. I cannot in good conscience recommend this "resort".

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, would never stay there again.....”
Reviews.Author: RAzar1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. The room was average, however the AC was not working properly, called the tech he said nothing is wrong with it, so had to use the ceiling fan most of time. There was a â€œsewage likeâ€� smell so we couldnâ€™t leave the balcony door opened. We couldn't get any food after 11pm. They had a number of small pools, but really no â€œswimming poolâ€� you couldnâ€™t do any swimming. The adult pool was more like walking around in a kidâ€™s pool. Pools were dirty most of the time. Resort walkways were very narrow and slippery with little access and no clear directions to different areas of the resort. If you are a handicapped in a wheelchair, donâ€™t even think of going to the Grand Wailea; not sure if youâ€™ll be able to get around. There were no ramps that I saw, in the lobby area, next to the stairs or near the access to pool area. There were really no shaded areas that you could sit in. If you needed a covered area around the adult pool you had to reserve a cabana >$70/day. The only place they provided umbrellas was on the beach. Overall the location is nice, the Lifeguards very unobservant; I saw many of them on numerous occasions texting or on their phones. Water elevator guard sat at least 20 of us, he didnâ€™t say one word, no directions, or what to expect. My wife had no place, she sat on my lap and I saw one lady slip on the step and hurt her knee. There was a non-visible deep step, because it was covered with water and the bottom is dark. Very unsafe especially for kids could easily fall backwards and get trapped in between the float and the wall. Food was very pricy and quality was very average, even below average in some resort restaurants. I was really looking forward to going to the Grand Wailea, especially after I viewed their website and saw some pictures; however, my experience was very poor due to the above noted.

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort, not customer service oriented”
Reviews.Author: USCFB5
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a beautiful hotel with beautiful grounds in a great location in Wailea. However, the overall customer service of most of the employees is not commensurate with a 4- or 5-star hotel. Also, there are limited on-site options to eat, the food is average at best, and yet exorbitatntly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service-Uninterested employees”
Reviews.Author: jam33333
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this resort. The rooms are nice, but most of the employees are not. The only good experience we had with service was the evening shift room service employees. They were timely and kind. Service at the restaurants was extremely slow, even if they only had a couple customers. Front desk employees were slow and acted as though you were just an annoyance. For such a "Grand" hotel, their service stinks. We went to the Four Season next door for dinner a few times and they had excellent service. Front desk employees were also very helpful. Perhaps Grand Wailea could take some lessons. Also, self parking was terrible and not cheap. Many times we had to drive around and around waiting for a spot. If you're going to charge a premium price, I expect to have a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive and crowded”
Reviews.Author: Travelman0705
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large. The pool is very cool but extremely crowded. The food was mediocre and very expensive. Service was only OK, others we talked to had bad experiences with hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea desrves an F grade”
Reviews.Author: pansyparkison
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many nice hotels around the globe. Grand Wailea was unfortunatley the worst experience we have ever had (thankfully, we have always been pleased with the hotels we have chosen). This is the only time that I have EVER gone out of my way to write a review. We had heard many nice things about the hotel in the past, but we believe ever since Hilton has acquired the hotel it has really gone down hill. If you choose to stay at this hotel be prepared: to walk a lot-everything is spread way out, there is no easy access to anyplace, pay a lot, swim in a dirty, but fun pool, eat mediocre food, deal with a less than friendly front desk who will not honor what you booked (in our case we booked over a year in advance), wake up at 6:00 to get in line by 6:30 to be standing in line to get a chair from the stand that opens at 7 (no matter what, the whole process takes at least about an hour and a half and much more if you're late...), also when you get your chairs be prepared to defend them with your life-angry vacationers that did not wake up as early as you will constantly be preying on your space-cabana, chairs by the pool, or chairs on the beach because of their lack of chairs and space for all the guests. BTW, the hotel is overcrowded because they sold membership to the locals and other neighboring properties during the economic downturn. There seems to be aggressive tension by the pool. Wonder why. If you are looking to relax, you won't. If you are looking for the best food, go next door (the four seasons). And if you are expecting at the least good if not great service then don't make the same mistake we made. Staying anywhere else I'm sure would be better. Also, if you leave anything on your beach chair, they will tell you they take it and keep it until you come, they just keep it, and tell you a guest took it. Ha!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting, over the top - but not 5 star....”
Reviews.Author: MOTraveler010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon. First of all - late April and early May are a great time to be in Hawaii - when we were here the resort was only about 60% occupied so many of the reviews we read about crowds did not apply. That aside - this is a beautiful place. The beach is amazing, it didn't rain once the entire time we were there, and you get the feeling of being in a palace. I would describe it as the ultimate Maui resort. The spa simply can not be missed - there is nothing else like it in the world and they run some great specials via Hawaiian Airlines. We had the one hour Terme', hour couples massage, body scrub, and lunch at the Molokini for $299. Very reasonable considering normal prices. The rooms are great - we had a deluxe ocean view on the 8th floor right near the Napua Tower - wonderful furnishings, amazing bathroom, etc. The only downside.....it's operated by Hilton and you can tell. We had come here from the Grand Hyatt in Kauai and as far as the service and details, the Grand Wailea could learn alot from the GH. For the cost of staying at the Grand Wailea there are some areas they need to improve....Service is spotty - a good example is that the valets and bellmen were so friendly when we arrived, but the lady at the front desk was about as nice as a snake. The grounds are nice, but not especially well maintained - dead plants, litter, etc. The place is starting to look a bit tired. And the worst thing of all that absolutely shocked me given the cost to stay there.......the corridors that run to all of the guestrooms are ceramic tile and the housekeeping staff begins running these carts down the corridors at a pretty early hour that are SO noisy!!! We aren't late sleepers and we were SO annoyed by this!! It's really really bad!! The bartenders at all venues were a BLAST! Happy hour in the Botero Bar was a daily event. Likes: Location, beach and the beach chairs and umbrellas that are included in the resort fee, pools (all are so great!), HUGE bathrooms, wonderful beds, great lanai outside of the rooms, beautiful setting, Incredible Spa. Dislikes: NOISY housekeeping carts, service level of a standard Hilton, tired looking in some places, very VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Vegas/Orlando hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Wailea for 4 nights last week. Last time I was in Wailea a few yrs ago I stayed at the FS, so I am somewhat jaded. This hotel is enormous....almost 800 rooms! Everything seemed like a hike. Was a 5-10 min walk from my room just to get to the pool. Felt I was nickel and dimed at check in. $25 resort fee. $10 luggage transfer fee. $3 maid gratuity fee. All this on top of my nightly rate. Didn't find staff to be too polite or accomodating. They need some lessons from their neighbors down the beach (FS & Fairmount). Anytime I asked a question, they made me feel like I was harassing them. Would not stay here again and would not recommend to anyone...even families....there are plenty of other resorts in HI that'll cater to children. You don't need to spend your money at this place. The biggest joke was the line of people (40 deep) waiting to get towels prior to the pool opening at 7 AM. It stressed me out just looking at them from my beachside yoga class. This is not a 5 star property, or anything close to luxurious. Conrad Hilton would be rolling over in his grave if he knew the GW was associated with his chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Fun...”
Reviews.Author: jenledet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay. I have two children 7 and 9 that truly enjoyed the pool. We booked a snorkel trip out to Molikini... not too great. It ws a beautiful day but you don't see nearly as much as you do when you snorkel the other islands... We couldn't wait to return to our "Grand Wailea Home"- Hotel was at 100% capacity everyday. There werent a lot of pool chairs available but the pool itself never seemed crowded. My kids had to wait about 2 minutes to do the rope swing, 5 minutes for the water elevator and maybe 5 minutes for the largest water slide. The defiinitely do NOT enforce a saving seats policy. I watched about 10 chairs around our cabana stay with only towels and a magazine on them for about 3 hours before the people decicded to show up. The Spa was amazing. It is about $150 for a massage but it is actually a two hour treatment. You check in one hour before and use their baths and other relaxing amenities before your treatment. The kids massage i not worth it. It was $100 for each of my children for a $25 minute massage and they do nto get to use any of the baths or relaxing areas so for them it really is just a 25 minute thing. If you are looking for low carb food options do not eat at humhumu--- least accomadating. However, if you are set on it call ahead and ask for the secluded table for 6 that sits on its on little island like circle. Even though self park is free--- there were never any spots so we had to valet. I thought the rooms were great. When you travel with kids you pray for 2 queens instead of 2 doubles-- they have queens. OR my parents had a conencting room with a king and the king had a sofa pull out my kids could have slept on. If you get 2 queens, request extra pillows before you arrive otherwise you will only get 2 pillows on each bed. Longhi's had a great breakfast--- we didn't discover it til day 3 so we ate the buffet at the hotel the first two days-- not all that great. We walked to the Four Seasons next door to eat dinner one night-- Their pool would be disappointing to any kid who saw the Grand Wailea pool. Heidi at the activity desk had a smile each day and was very helpful to our family.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at a Four star hotel with poor customer service- :(”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner82010
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but sooo disappointed. Everything was sooo expensive. Don't go to maui in august for a quiet vacation. I might as well staying in Kaanapali or Lahaina. Families galore. Kids running up and down the hallway early in the morning. Where are the parents?? The spa was the best thing. 5 star for sure!!! So many things to try and hot/cold tubs, massaging showers, scrub down. First of all when we checked in for our honeymoon. We had to wait a long time before we were helped or even greeted. A woman was complaining about her bill for at least 10 minutes.Nice to be greeted after getting off the plane. Finally another front desk girl helped us. We told her we were on our honeymoon and asked for a suite, however the hotel was completely booked. We asked for a refrigerator in our room ahead of time. And paid for it upfront. We received a refrigerator in our room, however after a day of having our drinks in the refrigerator we noticed that the temperature was on the coldest setting. And our drinks were still slightly cooler than room temperature. My husband contacted the front desk before we were about to leave in the morning to go out for the day. 8/4/10- believe it was. We came back to our room and there was a roll away bed. We were on our honeymoon, so we surely didn't ask for it. My husband called and asked to get a new refrigerator, I called the front desk and talked to Carolina.. Time went by 30 minutes and so I decided to go down to the front desk. I spoke to Carolina and she said it had been taken care of. I asked her to see if we were charged for the bed and she said no right away without checking and didn't seem to care attitude. I waited a little while later, I called Carolina and she said she would have the manager call us. a few minutes later we finally got our new fridge, I was so angry that I told the gentleman that delivered the fridge we waited at least 45-60min. he apologized and told us the front desk had told him the incorrect room number 2 floors from our room. No call from the manager. So I called the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. Spoke to Roberto? He had just got on his shift that evening and apologized and took the $25 charge off our bill. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. 4 star hotel I don't think so. My husband and my honeymoon. We will never stay here again.Next time we will stay somewhere else. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced...needs regular maintenance”
Reviews.Author: rxhappiness
Reviews.Content: This hotel is visually stunning but after a long day of touring Maui, a lengthy tortuous walk to your room is not exactly very rewarding. During our stay, the nearest elevators went out of service and the door keys ran out of batteries. This kept us out of our room for 2 hours in midday! These small things DO cause a lot of inconveniences especially when you plan a grand vacation at a steep price. It remains a bragging piece for your Maui vacation to have stayed at the Grand Wailea, but be ready for some disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for all of us! We love the Botero sculptures in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: MPKC
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a condo (Ekahi) and visited the Grand Wailea to check it out. My 2 teen daughters, 14 and 19 years old were so excited by the atmosphere that we planned a one night stay to use the pools and get some room service! Spoiled, yes... The hotel was very accommodating and worked with us to arrange the one night stay- they were technically "sold out" but when we appealed to their soft spots the manager "checked" and did find us a room for about $540 for the night. It was a pleasure and we thought the restaurant service was great (Humahuma) and the cafe as well. The pool thing though is soooo obnoxious...I mean the chairs being claimed by 730 am with towels placed on them. It seems to happen at a lot of resorts from what I read here on TA.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise for a Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JennMichaels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Grand Wailea in Maui and it absolutely lived up to everything we've read and seen about it. We were with a group of 8, ages ranging from 70 to 8 and not one of us left disappointed. Day 5 we realized we hadn't left the hotel yet and thought maybe we should. We had fun when we did but couldn't wait to get back. I absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special location for an event, or just for a getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: silverwedding
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. One negative would be that if you want a lounger on the beach, you need to get to the desk when they open at 7a.m. If you don't occupy the lounger after 30 minutes, they can remove your things, so best to get there early, then go for quick breakfast. The grounds are beautiful and kept very well. One other comment - we asked for vegetarian food for luau. The concierge said that they would notify them and speak to the chef. When we got to the luau, they didn't know anything about it. Communication could have been better, especially for $100 a head! Food and show were good.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea Resort is the ultimate travel destination to relax & unwind”
Reviews.Author: jjrlosgatos
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Grand Wailea Resort since 1994. Recently Lily in reservations went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our reservation was secure after being on the waiting list for nearly 60 days. She came through! You could tell she enjoys her job because it genuinely shines through over the phone. Of all the hotels in the world I have visited, this is definitely one of the finest and the one I look forward to returning to the most. Spacious well appointed rooms, Incredible grounds, pools, spa, fitness center, golf, restaurants, walking distance to shops. One does not need to leave the Grand upon arrival. More memories are made with each visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pure elegance”
Reviews.Author: Darlene3161
Reviews.Content: Simply Loved it we stayed for 2 weeks and was fabulous..top of the line all the way...Gorgeous property..A1 service..stunning decor & luxury room..amazing dining.....

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Imagine a better place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: nuclear_travels
Reviews.Content: We must have earned some good karma to stay here. Our flight to the mainland got canceled and American Airlines put us up at this resort (from Waldorf Astoria). I think the karma came from driving some hikers in the rain in Haleakala earlier that week. Weâ€™d been staying in a nice condo the whole week, this was a great way to end our vacation. Iâ€™m sure everything seems better if youâ€™re not paying for it but this is quite the resort. So opulent as to make you feel guilty. Marble terraces everywhere, a series of fountains to draw your eye to their network of pools that are connected by two lazy rivers, the artificial sandy beach for the kids to avoid the strong currents of the real beach, the swim up bars. Our room was very generous in size, had a balcony, the bathroom was the size of my bedroom at home (two person Jacuzzi bathtub and double shower area separate from the toilet and sink rooms. This must be how that other 0.5% of the population lives! Tip: book a late flight so that you can check your luggage with the front desk, enjoy the pools all day long, and then shower and freshen up at one of their complimentary suites before your flight. Better tip: pray that your American Airlines flight is canceled.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: grantant
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Everyday we found something new to explore and enjoy. The food on site was excellent, pools and waterslides were clean, fun and safe, and the views from every aspect were breath taking. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in the world!”
Reviews.Author: shbabbette
Reviews.Content: this hotel and it s property are spectacular. been coming since l997 and became members in 98. it exceeds every hotel in the state of Hawaii and has become our home away from home for many years. If you want pure luxury, then you will want to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Brokedown Palace”
Reviews.Author: musicmafia
Reviews.Content: "Brokedown Palace" best describes this place to me. I think the glory days for the GW are long gone. It's still on a beautiful beach and the pool is nice if you don't mind 5000 screaming kids like Disneyworld. During our visit there must have been some sort of Fred Durst family convention going on LOL I swear, every guy there had a backwards baseball cap, a goatee or soul patch (!) and had tons of kids in tow. The whole grounds, pool area and all the patios (especially on the ground floor) looked like they had been hit with a tidal wave of inflatable toys, boogie boards, towels, food, soda bottles and trash. I have nothing against kids, but this place markets itself as a romantic high-end luxury property (with prices to match) but in reality it is more like a huge 3 1/2 star Disney hotel aging in a beautiful location. Did I mention most of the Durst clones were sloppy drunk at the pool by 1PM? A true Durster wouldn't even get up until 1PM. Amateurs ;) They should lower their prices and lower their guests expectations. The prices at GW are still very high and there are many other beachfront hotels that are less expensive and will probably offer the same experience for less $. If you are looking to spend big bucks for a romantic luxury trip of a lifetime and you want a true 5 star experience, you will be much happier at the Four Seasons next door or the Ritz in Kapalua. I've stayed at both and both are a thousand times nicer than Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “children friendly and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: fivestarholidays
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel with fantastic landscapes and plenty of activities to keep children and adults occupied. One would not feel the need to leave the hotel and just enjoy the luxurious ambience and the excellent food. The staff is friendly and efficient. The beach beautiful and has several pool options. Turndown service and housekeeping response very prompt. The hotel has a service hotline. However the hotline is forever going to the voice mail and one has to wait for them to call back. That is a hitch and an irritant at times. But the service is quick once the connection is made.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: chuito1120
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Grand Wailea. The grounds are beautifully landscapaed and the beds are very comfortable. Dinners and lunches are very tasty, which does not hold true at some other places in the island, and the area it's located at, is very safe and nice. The one thing that I found not to live up to my expectations, was the lazy river, but that's only because I compared it to the lazy river over at the Atlantis Hotel in Paradise Island.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Spa - a unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: srp99
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I booked treatments at the Grand Wailea Spa. Along with a treatment comes use of the fitness center (including one class) and use of the Terma Baths. The Terma Baths themselves are a wonderful and unique experience - 5 different warm baths filled with things like Red Lava & Guava, Vanilla & Black Lava, etc. Definitely worth the experience! Here are some other glimpses of our experience; hope it is helpful if you choose to spend time at the Grand Wailea Spa! 1) Give yourself ample time to find the Fitness Studio where Boot Camp (and the other classes) were held. It took me, my cousin, and one other seeker about 10 minutes of walking around the racquetball court & spa area to find it. (And that, too, only after we asked an employee who had no idea but knew enough to bring us back to the spa area so we could ask them) 2) The woman who teaches the classes is GREAT - friendly, informative, and very very fit! Unfortunately, the room itself is awful - absolutely NO ventilation! No windows, no air, no nothing. Brace yourself for that and bring plenty of your own water. 3) The fitness center teacher (her name escapes me at the moment) encouraged my cousin & I to stay for a 2nd class. So we decided to try to push our spa treatment appointments back an hour. That's where the fun began. We went to the Spa front desk area and were told that since we had already "checked in" and made our payment, the system wouldn't let them change our appts. (huh?) We were referred to a woman at a different desk. We re-explained our simple request. 2 phone calls later and she, too, concluded "Sorry, I don't think we can do that....well, I suppose I can try calling up there" (Okayyyyyy, yes, please do that....) Another few minutes tick by and we are referred back to the front desk lady, to whom we have to once again explain what we are trying to do. Mind you, we were very polite and repeatedly offered to stick with the original appointments if there was no availability for later appts. This is where it gets even funnier. We were told that there seems to be space available, "but no one inside is answering the phone, so....." <insert apologetic look> (Okayyyyyyyyy...) At this point, we decided to forgo the class and proceed with our treatments. Once "inside", I asked the attendant if she wouldn't mind checking if we could push our appts. She was utterly confused by this simple request as well (but very very nice nonetheless). Shortly thereafter, another woman appeared who fortunately understood our request clearly, and within 2 minutes, changed our appts and sent us back to the fitness studio. Success! (albeit with a lot of effort, and 15 minutes late to class, but still....!) 4) Once inside the spa.... Everyone was pleasant enough, but next time I will be a bit more insistent on getting a tour/lay-of-the-land before entering. E.g. what are these European baths and can I use them? What are these Auto-showers and should I be using them between termas? What about the Steam Room? Is that something I can/should use before or after my treatment? before/after the termas? Lots of questions and every time I politely asked the attendant, I'd get a friendly but rather uninformative "yes/no" answer. 5) The treatment itself (Seaweed Wrap by Devri) was wonderful; she was very professional, the room was relaxing, and the overall experience was very pleasant. Overall, I would recommend the Grand Wailea Spa, especially for the uniqueness of the Termas!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hutt2010
Reviews.Content: We visited the GW for our honeymoon and were absolutely blown away by the customer service. We were treated like royalty by the concierges, servers, bellmen, everyone! It was always "Yes, Mrs. ___" and everything was done in a timely fashion. The cocktail waitresses at the pool were amazing and so friendly. And the spa was to-die for! We are looking forward to going back for our 1-year anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds: You can live out your Hawaiian experience here OR see the island, with Grand Wailea's help”
Reviews.Author: wolflynch71
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Magnificent stretch of beach with all the added amenities surrounding it. Great spa - I went with a hot stone this time. The pool is INSANE, over 25,000 sq ft with a 'rolling river' concept to it, including a rope swing and water elevator. The reason I like this hotel is because it can help build your trip. You can either have a really relaxing 'staycation' at this resort because it has so many restaurants and amenities (beach, pool, spa, shopping, local artists), that you do not need to leave it. however, if you want to check out the amazing island of Maui, the concierge has services to help you do just about anything. Really great place to stay. And, because it's such a large property, you can find a private spot, or have your whole family with you and meet lots of people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: TheCamMan
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea was a stunning place to stay for four nights in Maui. The room was large and the bathroom was top notch. The "garden view" included the ocean as well as the beautiful chapel gardens. For those looking for a fitness room, the facilities at the GW are great. Lots of cardio/weight equipment to go around, each with their own video monitors. The guest services were very helpful, although often quite busy. The staff were always courteous, and helpful. The pool scene is a bit crowded, but we were usually out on an adventure during the mornings and by the time we got back to the hotel, most everything was available for use i.e. lounge chairs and umbrellas. We only ate once at the hotel at the Humuhumunukunukuapuaa Restaurant. The food was fair, but expensive, but watching the sunset there was spectacular. We used the self parking lot (which was a pretty long walk from our room) and we didn't use the valet parking because of cost, but pulling in late one night to drop my wife off, the valet noticed, ran over, and took our car for free. SERVICE!!! (didn't even let me tip him!). The only "con" would be price. Unless you are used to spending money without thought, you will notice that everything is very expensive. From the $8 bottle of water in your room, to the $450 dollar spa services. Having said that, I loved every minute we were there and would love to go back someday. Two things to look for while staying at this hotel; 1. Look for Jamie at the Sophie Grace Jewelry kiosk near the pool/towels area. She has wonderful handmade necklaces and jewelry. 2. Take the time to walk the grounds and the beach walk. Stunning views everywhere you look. Really a great way to spend a morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand about Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: EchoBlue673
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to the Grand Wailea after I had seen it on the travel channel. I was not able to stay there the entire time I was on Maui, because of price. I used Hilton pts for 2 nights. The first 2 nights on Maui were spent at the Marriott next to Grand Wailea....beautiful by the way...anyway. As we checked in, confirmation in hand, I was told there was a additional charge for having 4 people in the room. No where on my conf did it say that and I booked it for 4 people. Conf stated 4 people and 2 double beds. The woman checking us in had nothing to say except that is the rules. I asked to speak to the manager, but she just happened to step into a meeting at that exact moment. So, I asked for a phone call. Did I receive a call the 2 days we were there.....no!!!! The additional $200 they got from us, was the only money they got from us. We refused to eat or buy anything on that property. We walked to the shopping center and had the best breakfast on the island at Longhi's.......highly recommend! I agree with all the other comments regarding the chairs.....good luck! I basically stalked people and once they got up I would grab the chairs......so much for relaxing. I would not recommend this property to anyone even if you are staying for free.....because what I thought was going to be free.....ended up costing me and taking away from my excursions. Stay at the Marriott.....great property, pools, location and the food at the pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: DevonSaire
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort. Can't think of a sinlge negative thing to say other than price. But come on for 4+ star resort, what do you expect? Loved the gorgeous bathrooms! Awesome beach, pools and view. The adult pool was killer and the lazy river, simply amazing. This place is leagues above all the other resorts in Wailea. To be honest I would have been very disappointed to have stayed at any of the others, including the Four Seasons...not even close to being as nice as the Grand. But again I think the reason they call it the Grand Wailea is that it costs you a grand for everyday you stay there...I wish I was kidding.

Reviews.Title: “Painful Beach Chair Service”
Reviews.Author: gerryny
Reviews.Content: My family and I are just completing a one week stay at Ho'olei at Grand Wailea. The hotel and The Grand Wailea Resort are some how affiliated so we spend each day at The Grand Wailea. We have been here before and think the Grand Wailea is a great place for kids. The service is very good with one major exception. Every morning I head down to the beach for chairs and umbrellas. The stand opens at 7am. The resort is pretty busy so you need to get down there by 9 to get a seat. This is to be expected during busy season. I get there at 7 to 730 every morning and stand in line waiting from 40 min to 1 hour because they do not have enough attendants. Everyone on line complains but the situation never improves. If they just added two more people they would make the start of our day much better. I hope they are listening.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top”
Reviews.Author: hotdumale
Reviews.Content: Five star facility, service, room, location (for what we wanted) Expensive as all get out - and that's before tipping! Facility: Every bit as beautiful as the website! The property is huge - it took about 10 minutes to get to our room at the end of the furthest building, but it was worth it. Ornate with attentive staff everywhere. Room: Roomy and comfortable. We had a 4th floor room with a balcony overlooking the water park. It was quiet and we were well cared for by the staff. Nothing escaped their attention. Dining on site is pricey (scone/coffee/fruit for 2 at the Cafe Kula coffee shop = $28 while dinner at Humu restaurant = $125). It's a less at the mall just a short walk away. Activities: Beach, pool, and water park - all were fun. There is an adult pool by the bar and a number of family pools around an outdoor dining area. Beach cabanas are avail for $300/day, covered chairs along the beach are $75 (3rd party vendor), while umbrella/umbrella set up on the beach is free. Spa and 2 level fitness center are top notch. In the back of the hotel there is a running trail paralleling the beach. It crosses several other hotels and goes into residential areas. Be aware it is narrow and gets very crowded by 7am. Maui isn't our favorite island, but this hotel made the trip one of the most relaxing ones I've been on. Advice: If there is anything you think you've forgotten, there is a Wal-Mart and Costco five minutes from the airport. Wailea is another 30 minutes away. Once you get there (Wailea) you may not want to leave :) This is your first opportunity to stock up on alcohol cheaply. Invest in a small, collapsible cooler. You can fill it with ice, snacks, and drinks for day outings. I got a lunch pail size one for $5 and even brought it back home when done. Kihei: Everything is downright affordable and fun if you get out onto Kihei Road (5 minute drive) and discover unique restaurants in Kihei (the chief valet gave us great recommendations). We found it best to hit the grocery store in Kihei for fresh fruit and baked goods for breakfast as well as snacks/drinks for afternoons or beach or outings. The same goes for alchohol, sunscreen, swim gear etc. The beaches are so-so. Molokini: This beautiful crater rim island was mentioned on Travel Channel and was on my bucket list to snorkel, but I was disappointed. The tour started at 8am, it took an hour to get there and there were a lot of other boats there were equally as many people. I saw only 2-3 different types of fish despite cool, clear water. Don't waste your money. Find a good nearby reef (like Turtle Town just south of the hotel) and hang out there. Parking: Valet is $20/day. Free parking but fills up early in the morning. Although it took us a long walk to get to our room (near the Humu restaurant), our room was steps away fr the free parking area so it made getting to/from our car very convenient. Surprise: We got a modest daily resort fee, but it covered parking, towels, and internet access. Unlike Oahu where those are separate charges. Bonus: There were a few hollywood actors we recognized roaming the premises.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME for children!”
Reviews.Author: Gafan
Reviews.Content: The pools and slides are AWESOME for families with children! Plus the beachfront location is fantastic. The property is meticulously manicured and kept true to the local island flavor. However, the prices at the restaurants and room rates are insane...$6 for a half of a papaya...$5 for a bagel. The rooms are a bit dated and have a few rough edges in terms of maintenance. And the self-parking is absurd...almost impossible to park anything larger than a compact car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, But A Touch Dated...”
Reviews.Author: Chudacris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night at the Grand (we had rented a home in Maui for the week). We enjoyed a fantastic dinner and sunset at Humuhumu, and had an overall wonderful experience there. My only knock on the property (and bear in mind, we only spent one night there) was that the rooms felt dated to us. I would certainly consider returning to the Grand for future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: Drozman
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my wife and I had been to Maui. We took our 22 year old daughter with us. We loved the grounds and the pools and the water slides. Lots of kids so if you want to avoid them stick to the adult pool. It was conveniently located in a not so busy part of Maui near the shops at Wailea and a very nice beach. The beach path was a great morning stroll (for us) and a jog for our daughter. We had the Sunday brunch on Father's Day which was awesome ( not cheap though!). The restaurants and lounges were very nice, we especially liked the lobby bar, although I wish the bar/restaurant nearest the adult pool had later hours. We had a great dinner at the Humuhumunukunukuapua restaurant ( say that three times real fast !) aka The Humu with a nice view of the ocean. With the Four Seasons next door and some nice restaurants at The Shops at Wailea within walking distance you also have some other dining options if you choose. Our room was spacious and clean with a nice sized balcony which overlooked the lower part of the resort and the ocean. We did get a visit from a baby lizard (a gecko I assume, even though he didn't try to sell me insurance) which I think snuck in when housekeeping dropped something off. It was kind of funny because when I opened the door after catching the little darling in a glass, the mommy was waiting outside for junior to return! They do charge you $25 if you want a fridge for the stay. As with most resorts we've stayed at, you have the pool chair circus with people lining up before 7 AM to snag their spots. If you don't have kids, the adult pool always seemed to have plenty of open chairs. We rented a car and the self parking garage is a bit small and spaces were at a premium even though the resort did not seem to be very crowded. If you have a handicap sticker you'll find plenty of spaces though! My wife and daughter both had spa treatments, which they loved, and the workout room is well equipped with plenty of treadmill type machines, weight machines and free weights. If you visit their web site and view their pictures, it is every bit a beautiful as it looks.

Reviews.Title: “Water Elevator... Puh-lease”
Reviews.Author: badromance13
Reviews.Content: All the slides and pool activities were excellent! That is, except for the water elevator. I don't see why it's there and who would use it when there are slides and swings galore. The hotel makes the elevator into a huge deal when it's actually not exciting at all and is incredibly disappointing especially after the 15 minute wait. Although when we visited we hardly had trouble with crowds, it was still IMPOSSIBLE to get FOOD by the pool. Plus, everything is expensive and they do charge for every little thing. Lastly, keep in mind that you are not paying for the room. The Grand Wailea is basically an amazing pool complex with motel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Still grand!”
Reviews.Author: adler223
Reviews.Content: Travelled here when the hotel first opened and was back five years ago. This place is better than ever. Less nickle and diming. I think management took many of the complaints to heart. 5 years ago, you had to buy a casabella to have shade, now they provide free beach chairs and umbrellas. The staff seemed more professional and better trained than before as well. Overall, a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: padresin07
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea many times. It has great amentities and location. Perfect for kids. Howver, the management has changed to Hilton. The place is going down hill fast.. Many of our conversations with guests was about this topic. EVERY return guest noticed the difference. There is a fee for EVERYTHING now, the bathroom near the pool was out of order for 2 straight days. People must have been peeing in pool with no place to go. My eyes were burning from pool water being so chlorinated. Service was spotty. Some good some not good. Our booking was screwed up so we were offered free room upgrade that was on our confirmation email. At check in, they claimed no such upgrade was part of reservation. We had to go to the business center to print out reservation that showed upgrade on eamil. We were charged 10 bucks for this. Then when we showed front desk, they made process too difficult to even deal with it. There were lines for all water slides. Very difficult to get lounge chairs even when hotel not that full. It seems they create false demand for shade and chairs to charge $300 for place to sit by pool in a cabana. Luau was a joke. We stood in multiple lines for hours for bad food and amatuer show. Staff just stood around not knowing what to do. One guy sat people as people in line were frustrated. Fire dancer at end was very good though. Bottom line if you don't have kids, stay at the four seasons for the money. If you have kids, book a two day stay for the slides at most . Then move to Four seasons. Our kids ended up playing in ocean much more than the pool. It is a shame. Such a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Only for Those Wanting a Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: stryker-houston
Reviews.Content: We returned to the GW in June of 2010 after getting married there 10 years ago. The experience was everything we remembered and more! The facility itself is beyond compare. If you were imagining a fantasy trip to Hawai'i - this is the place you would see. In the 10 years since our last visit, the rooms seem not to have aged a day. Still roomy, bright and comfortable. The addition of LCD TV's since our last visit was a nice touch. The staff is what makes this place the best. They are not all over you, they are simply there and available when you need them. They are courteous and helpful at all times and always willing to go out of their way for you, and they always remember you the next time they see you. The Wailea area itself is out of this world. Everything you need is within walking distance, and the beach area is one of the best in the islands, with every beach activity (except parasailing) available whenever you like.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great location, Great beach!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scope123
Reviews.Content: What can I say...... We stayed on Kauai and Maui in January on our long awaited Hawaiian trip. We couldn't have been more pleased with our whole trip. However, the highlight had to be our 5 day stay at Grand Wailea. From the moment we entered Grand Wailea's grounds, we were completely impressed. Our room had an ocean view and we were able to watch hump back whales from our balcony. The bathrooms were great in the guest rooms and the amenities are some of our favorites (a coconut smell)! Beds were also fine. The facilities at the hotel were awesome â€“ immaculately kept. The boys (17 & 13) loved the pool complex, as did my wife and I. We also partook in the complimentary scuba introduction. Needless to say, once we were complete with the intro, we went diving right off of Garand Wailea's beach. AWESOME - sea urchins, star fish and octopus. We could also hear the humpbacks talking. The location was great for all of our needs. We frequently shot down the coast to the town of Kihei for shopping and "island" eating - lots of variety. There was also some great high-end shopping right at the hotel and at a mall right next door. We went to the highlands, whale watching, the road to Hana, and more. We loved Maui!!!! We would definitely go back and we will definitely be staying at Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Cent !”
Reviews.Author: bluestjewel
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many of the Caribbean Islands, other Hawaiian Islands and 48 of the 50 states....Maui, especially the Wailea Beach areas is exceptional....I found Kanapali beach to be more of a high rise hotel, lots of eateries and souvenir shops hotel beach strip...where Wailea is much more tropical and lush....without the 30 floor hotels...Wailea is definitely the place to stay ...and the Grand Wailea is the hotel to experience it all at....the grounds are gorgeous, the staff exceptionally friendly...( especially Keiko at the lobby bar and Richie at the Grotto bar )....Yes, it is expensive....drinks average at about $14 ...meals average about $140 for 2.....but sooo worth it....We tried the HUMU restaurant....excellent....We tried Spago and Ferraras at the Four Seasons next door...also exceptional....Mama's Fish Market is so worth the trip ....outstanding....a great Happy Hour at Tommy Bahama's...$6 for appetizers and drinks....Cheeseburger in Paradise....for a less expensive quick meal....is also next door to the Grand Wailea in the shopping area....Take the Road to Hana....an experience of a lifetime....beautiful.....try to take a snorkeling excursion....Enjoy ! Enjoy ! Enjoy !....After having found this hotel and this beach, I can promise you I will be back again and again and again....I am already planning for next year !

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Zseller
Reviews.Content: This is the thrid time that my wife and I have been lucky enough to stay at the Grand Wailea. We were on the tail end of our trip to Maui and after having a week at our time share in the wind it was a glorious treat to spend our last 3 nights at the GW. Our first day we took a couples spa and I would have to say that on a future trip I am likely going to be willing to pass up on a round of golf to get the opportunity to do this again. 5 different pools with different scents to relax in, a shower that if I recall correctly dropped water at the rate of 30gpm, hot tub, cold tub, 2 kinds of sauna's and then topped off with a massage to help my ailing shoulder. The staff at the hotel is unsurpassed. From the front desk at check in to the staff at the poolside restaurant, and on to the Humuhumu restaurant, they all went above and beyond to make us feel special. The management of this property knows how to treat the staff as they all truly enjoy doing their jobs. We look forward to when we are lucky enough to come back and visit what we feel is heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to stay with children”
Reviews.Author: RMTCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 11-19 with our two children ages 9 and 6. We stayed (upgraded) in the Napua tower and for the price of upgrade ($90/night) it was well worth it. Continental Breakfast (quite substantial) plus the afternoon cocktails and appetizers well-covered the cost. Room was great and the grounds are more beautiful than any website or photo could do it justice. The kids went on all slides, elevator and tarzan swing more times that I could count. When they wanted a change, down to the ocean we went. Service was great too! Only gripe? They must find a way to fairly allocate lounge chairs. At 7am, there were people lining up to get chairs at both the beach and pool area leaving few if any chairs for those who choose not to screw up their vacation by getting up early for a chair. They have a 1 hour remove if not anyone at the chairs but the current system is not working... It had been 5 years since our last visit and it will not be that long again!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: milena229
Reviews.Content: This is paradise! I have been here several times and it is gorgeous. I have recommended friends and they have been amazed

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Cabana”
Reviews.Author: jamesantonelli
Reviews.Content: The $300 a day cabana at the adult pool advertises "concierge service". The "concierge" is simply the waitress assigned to every other person at the pool, who aren't paying the $300. And, although the cabana is available at 7:00am, the waitress doesn't start service until 11:00am, nor does the nearby bar. We went hours with no service, then waited until 11:20am for the waitress to make it to our cabana after taking the entire pool's order. First drink delivered at 11:40am. Essentially, we paid $300 to have a little shade on demand. They need to visit a Vegas hotel to learn the meaning of "cabana concierge". And the pool food was a joke at any price. PS: The rule at the adult pool of 18 years old and up was never enforced. I saw plenty of little kids and young obnoxious teens in the pool. Why offer the relaxing adult pool next to the all ages "water park", if staff doesn't enforce the rule? I think part of the problem was large families there for weddings and reunions who didn't want to split up between the pools. Also,not the best place for a romantic, intimate couples getaway, with all the large groups, lacking decorum, taking over the spaces, forgetting they're in public, and not in their own backyards.

Reviews.Title: “I thought you should know”
Reviews.Author: ACEDMC
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review because I feel it could be very beneficial to not only family vacations but also corporate and incentive travel groups. I have worked in the hospitality industry over the past 30 years and currently own and operate a Destination Management Company in Scottsdale Arizona. Service is the key to my success and anytime I travel, I am always evaluating those who I encounter. I recently took a family vacation to Grand Wailea Resort on the island of Maui. I can not express enough what a wonderful time we had. The room was spacious and had all the necessary amenities to enhance our stay. My kids, 10 & 12 are still talking about the Tarzan Swing, Water Slides and Water Elevator. My wife on the other hand enjoyed a message by the adult pool. During one of the evenings, I noticed that a group was having a private Luau on the beach. What a spectacular setting, over looking the ocean with the sun setting. Even though Arizona is known for it sunsets, there is no comparison to what I experienced in Maui! The service at the hotel was outstanding, from the pool service to the front desk. As I had mentioned, being in the industry, sometimes I can be a little demanding. Not once did anyone say no or even give me a reason to think twice. Upon check-out, we needed to vacate our room due to a large group checking in. Since our plane did not depart until 10:30PM, the front desk clerk suggested that we enjoy the pool facilities and than come back to the desk and they would give us a hospitality room to change. In closing, I would highly recommend the Grand Wailea Resort to anyone who is looking for a beautiful hotel, with impeccable service, unbelievable sunsets and wonderful recreational activities, than this is the hotel for you! Jack Hardy Jr. Arizona Creative Events

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: RyanLCrook
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely stunning resort. The pictures you see on their website don't do it justice. My fiance and I stayed here for 8 days and we left feeling like we didn't fully experience everything the resort has to offer. There's so much to do it's really incredible. My fiance and I visited a few other beaches around the island and we came to the conclusion that the beach in Wailea is the best without a doubt. It's perfect for swimming and hanging out. You can rent kayaks to take out on the ocean if you'd like or just hang out on a complimentary lounge chair and umbrella that the resort offers. The staff is extremely friendly and very accommodating. I surprised my fiancÃ© with a cabana dinner offered by bistro molokini. To elaborate on the "very accommodating" part of my review, bistro molokini just happened to be closed for dinner when I was there but opened up just for us! A cabana dinner on the water is truly an experience that you would never forget. We also ate at the Humu restaurant for dinner and that was an incredible experience as well. The restaurant itself sits on top of a fish pond so and ambiance is really remarkable. We stayed in a deluxe ocean room which was absolutely amazing. The views we had were breathtaking. We could see the sunset every night from out room if we wanted to. It was extremely clean and everything was top of the line. Not to mention the bed was probably the most comfortable bed we've ever slept on! I would suggest walking around the resort a few times during the day and at night to take in the sites and smells of this resort. If you've ever been inside a florist before and smelled the fresh flowers there, that's pretty much the entire resort. On one of the last days there my Fiance and I got duo massages at their world class spa. I've been to some spas before but this one knocked me off my feet. We received a full body complimentary ex-foliating scrub and we had access to use the facilities there as well prior to our massages. I'm not sure about the women's side but the men's side has a Roman, Japanese, and Hawaiian style relaxation pools in the spa. Each area is surrounded by lush greens and a serene atmosphere that puts you in a completely different world. You HAVE to stop here for a service while staying at the resort. The spa has been rated as one of the top 10 spas in the U.S. by Travel and Leisure magazine. There's a shopping area about 5 minute's walking distance away from the resort as well. I highly recommend this place to future travelers looking for a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Go all out here!

Reviews.Title: “BYOF (bring your own food)”
Reviews.Author: trvldoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ALL about the pool. The rooms are beginning to show their age. During our stay the grotto bar and the Volcano cafe were closed for sewer problems (all torn up,did not look good), and the cafe Kula is closed for lunch. It was just downright painful finding food during mid day. After 2 days of basically starving at the pool and not being able to get a beer I drove to the grocery store. THERE IS NO AVAILABLE FOOD AT THE POOL. Seems silly at such a high end resort. But that seemed to be the norm. I saw outside food everywhere on the pool decks. Otherwise , very fun stay. The pools are expansive. The rest is just standard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, great staff, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DavidNour
Reviews.Content: We returned to this beautiful property after 13 years to find it even more beautiful, friendly, and inviting. We have two young children (8+6) and took my elderly parents and were very comfortable in a suite. The staff was friendly; the kids couldn't get enough of the pools, the slides, the water elevator, and the beach. Dad and I walked every morning, my wife and I both had much needed deep tissue messages at the spa, and the concierge desk was very helpful with an assortment of excursions. There is good shopping both on the property as well as within walking distance. Recommend a car (a full-size SUV in our case) to explore a bit. Would highly, highly recommend this inviting resort - if you're not price sensitive and are looking to really relax for a few days to a week and be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr12
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel -- my wife and I have been to Maui several times and stayed in various hotels and condos and the Grand Wailea is our favorite. The grounds are spectacular and well maintained, and the pools are like a mini water-park. The large grounds also make it easy to find a nice spot to relax in the lounge chairs with plenty of space. The water slides close at 5, but the pools remain open until 10, and we recommend swimming in the evenings -- you will have acres of pool almost completely to yourself. We stayed in the Molokini wing, and the room was spacious with a huge tub and great view. The free internet in the room was reliable and fast. The staff was attentive and friendly throughout, and we'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Piper044
Reviews.Content: Great resort, probably one of the best in Hawaii right now!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: srlavaslider
Reviews.Content: A perfect week at the Grand Wailea, rendezvousing with our grown kids, getting to see a movie being made, with all the behind-the-scenes activities, including paparazzi on the beach! Walked along the beach to check out the Four Seasons. As beautiful as it is, we will always return to the Grand Wailea for the water activities and lush tropical well-maintained park atmosphere. We are seniors who love the water slides (baby ones for me, but the super lava slide for my husband and kids), the water elevator, and the maze of pools. Anyone who wants quiet can go to the adult only pool. Let me assure you that the water slides are carefully supervised and monitored! One of the lifeguards jumped in and bailed me out when I needed help!! Our rooms were clean and comfortable, and I loved the large bathroom and balcony with adjustable chairs. Every member of the staff was courteous and willing to assist in any way, helping us get our boarding passes for the return trip home, setting up umbrellas and chairs for us on the beach, providing fresh towels in the exercise room, serving us quickly at the restaurants. Each night my husband and I would walk around the grounds at sunset, enjoying the privilege of being in this tropical paradise. Sounds like a travel ad, but it is true!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Walk Into "Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: JerryandCherylW
Reviews.Content: This past March 2010, my wife and I spent a week at the Grand Wailea Resort in MAui, HI. As this was a special occassion, we scoured the globe and had numerous options to spend this time together. Because of our "near perfect" experience at the Grand Wailea Resort during one of our annual family vacations, my wife and I decided not to second guess another location, but rather choose a "proven performer". Wow!!!!! Our second trip to this resort exceeded all of our expectations that we all experienced a few years ago with the entire family. From the time you pull up in your car to the time you leave the property, you begin to realize that you have truly walked into "Paradise"! A beautiful waterfall of sight and sound, a warm lei gretting, and a carefree check in and baggage delivery to our room set the entire tone of our next few days at this property. Nothing but smiles and warm greetings from the entire staff from check-in to the towel desk at the the pool-everyday!!!! Cleanliness of the room and property were exquisite and the bed made it sometimes impossible to get up in the morning for our daily plan of walking along some of the most beautiful seashore that we have ever walked on. If you are fortunate enough to book an oceanview room, sitting on your Lanai during the afternoon or evening is just spectacular! Whether enjoying breakfast at the Cafe or at the Grand Buffett, the food quality and selections were excellent. Lunch and dinner played the same way with either an open air atmosphere at the Bistro Cafe or fine dining at the HumuHumu Restaurant with some of the most spectacular views of the blue Pacific Ocean and the golden fire-orange sunsets. Bring your cameras to dinner!!!! Congratualtions to the entire staff and management at the Grand Wailea for their secret formula in making everyone feel like you truly have stepped into "Paradise". If you want to experience the best at least once in your lifetime-spend some time at the The Grand Wailea Resort and their freindly staff in Maui, HI...thanks again to the entire staff-you are now 2 for 2 with us!!!!!! J and C W.-Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: ksparks1
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying here after reading the reviews for the past few months, but my husband and I did not have the problems others complained about because we did not go during Spring Break or any other break from school. If you don't want those problems (ex: having to wait in line for a chair by the pool) that's the time you need to go (if you can)! I will say there were not tons of umbrellas available at the pool, but they did have umbrellas and chairs that you could have set up at the beach. We loved the location! It's a quiet area and didn't get too crazy even though a movie with a few celebrities was being filmed there. Expect to spend some money if you eat at the restaurants, it's an expensive resort to stay at so everything there is going to be expensive. Cons: Had problems with card key, would not always open the door, had to try several times on some days. The parking garage had some issues as well. Lots of people were having a difficult time getting in the gate , the front desk new about it but no one ever seemed to fix it. It was great to see a moving being made, but there was equipment all over the place outside so that took a little bit away from the beauty of the place. Overall I would recommend this place, but if you want to avoid crowds don't go during school breaks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: tabbinesta
Reviews.Content: The grounds and the location are so beautiful! Nice rooms, friendly staff. Great place to be if you are visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but not my kind of place”
Reviews.Author: solferino71
Reviews.Content: First off... this place is huge. The lobby is clearly designed to impress, and it does -- beautiful statues (bronze Boteros IIRC?), lovely flowers, many open-air seating areas etc. The grounds are really pretty -- my kiddo loved the koi pond by the chapel. The room's furnishings were quite nice (and clean) but I thought the style was a bit dated. Bathroom was small (more dated than the room); toiletries were nice, as one would expect. View of the beach and grounds was gorgeous. We stayed as part of a group from my husband's company so had work functions at night and had to park our son in the Kids' Club -- which was enormous with a very enthusiastic staff. They had interesting things planned for the kids -- not just "sit in front of the tv and watch a movie". So, points for that. The pool and waterslides are pretty cool -- my son enjoyed them, although the waterslides may be a bit scary for some kids his age. Overall this is a nice hotel but it's way too big and too full of people for me. Admittedly I was there with my own child, but it was absolutely crawling with children. And the pool was *loud*, not relaxing at all, even the "adults only" pool. I think this end of the island is not worth the premium that every place charges. It's a touch remote and the beach is pretty windy -- vastly prefer out by Napali and Kapalua. My spoiled child complained the entire time during this trip that he wanted to go to "the other Hawaii". It was humiliating but secretly I agreed with him.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is truly GRAND!”
Reviews.Author: khc_Idaho
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about the Grand Wailea. I stayed at the Grand Wailea with my adult daughter this winter and we both agreed it was the highlight of our trip to Maui. Our room was large and even with two queen beds and a chaise lounge, we had plenty of space to move around -- we didn't feel crowded or cramped at all. The patio (lanie?) is big and was our favorite place to watch the sunset. The pools are amazing and are not just for kids. I enjoyed the lazy river and the slides -- I passed on the opportunity to do the water elevator or the Tarzan Swing. My favorite part is Spa Grande. I enjoy the baths and the waterfalls. I had a massage and it was the best massage I have ever had. I'm more of a budget traveler and I'm glad I "splurged" on the Grand Wailea -- it was worth every penny of my hard-earned money! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel/location experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: nemYakima_WA
Reviews.Content: Everything and everybody at the Grand Wailea made our visit to Maui an absolute highlight: from roomservice, to conceirge, restaurant staff, beach boys...no one (and I challenged myself to find the anomally) performed their job less than professionally, courteously, and thoroughly. I do not hire out services at home so when I stayed at the Wailea, I noticed and appreciated that not a single dead branch was left hanging from a tree, bed corners were made nice and tigh, TP folded in a perfect triangle, no sand on porch or fingerprints on slider, etc. etc. Truely, my visit to the Grand Wailea was the best ever, by every standard I might measure. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “When the Grand Wailea is just what you're looking forâ€”you've found it.”
Reviews.Author: californiasgold
Reviews.Content: You know those quiet little understated hotels that feel like undiscovered gems (like, for instance, the dreamy Jake's in Treasure Beach, Jamaicaâ€”but I digress)? This is not one of them. This is the huge resort hotel with all the amenities, services, endless leis on arrival (every time you come back from any excursion!), terrific happy hour on the concierge level, sprawling grounds... You'll hardly be alone there, but if a huge resort with all the trimmings is what you're looking for, you've found it! Major eye candy: gorgeous open-air lobby that has to be seen to be believed. Also, I happened to get engaged here (on a nearby hike). So clearly I have fond memories! The Humuhumunukunukuwapuwa'a restaurant gave us a great table (OK, my fiance had arranged it in advance, but still) out over the water, and a beautiful congratulatory dessert laced with macadamias that I can still taste in my mind's eye. Er, mouth. Also: amazing room service. We had a fun pizza night one night to unwind, and the night we got engaged we came back to the room to find rose petals on the bed in a heart shape (again, my fiance's pre-arranged plan) and champagne. We were there in November, and the crowd felt very thin, which was great. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: Kaiserphoto
Reviews.Content: We're at the Ho'olei across for the Grand Wailea. It's the condo side of the hotel. 3000sf, 3 master suites & all of the amenities. We have our own pool in our complex, but have full use of the main facilities. We make a phone call and our shuttle is here! Although it is right across the street. We the attendant gave us the tour of our unit, I mentioned that I didn't like down pillow, he was on his headset and had a set of foam pillows delivered with in minutes. Also mentioned to my wife that it would be nice to have a child's gate for our daughter, again it was done. Service is the best, along with the grounds and pool. Great slides and water attractions for my 3 1/2 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate !!!”
Reviews.Author: cabol
Reviews.Content: First, I was a bit skeptical of Grand Wailea due to some of the reviews.But considering we were HiltonHonors members, it was an easy choice. We stayed here the first week of May and could not have been more pleased with our choice. Staff was so friendly and courteous, grounds are unbelievably beautiful, everything is top notch. Be sure to make use of the conceirge, he helped us plan out such amazing excurtions. Now, as far as the beach chair/pool situations everyone had talked about, that was not our experience....we had no complications. I was actually up at 7am the first morning to "grab" our chairs...well, I was the only person on the beach!! We never waited in a line, we never sat without a lounge chair or umbrella, and they were even a bit crowded due to filming a movie here during the week !! I would recommend this property over and over again. Keep in mind, we are probably vacationing during a slow period(before summer rush), but it has simply been amazing from start to finish. Tip...avoid valet parking and save some $ by parking in the second entrance lot free and walking...its such a beautiful walk you will hardly mind.

Reviews.Title: “good pools for kids, very big resort”
Reviews.Author: Pandora68
Reviews.Content: First, if you are European and thinking of coming here to get married I would say that the Indian Ocean offers better options without such long flights. We came here after visiting LA. We had no particular problems, other than a lack of healthy eating options - but that's the USA all over for you. Why have food when you can have corn syrup and chemicalised transfats! How a hotel at this level cannot have fresh juices on hand is ridiculous. My children loved the pools and the wonderful gardens which were extremely good. The rooms were large and comfortable with nice bathrooms. It's expensive, charges for everything (side by side rooms $50 a night, internet, parking, resort charges etc) Prices are net of taxes and compulsory service charges. Spa prices were 3 times more than European spas. The Humu restaurant is fun - and the kids get treated well. Most of the employees are very friendly and helpful and set up a picnic for my children which was a nice touch. There is a nice restaurant if you turn left by the pools and head to Duo at the Four Seasons. Also, if you have young kids, get ground floor suites opening onto the front gardens - mine had a great time catching fish, frogs, lizards etc just outside our rooms. I would not want to be at the back of the building or to have a long walk to the pools. We loved being in the Chapel Pavillion - it was a perfect peaceful spot overlooking the chapel and close to the nice adult only pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: TXCathy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels in the world! It has everything you could ask for!

Reviews.Title: “A special treat”
Reviews.Author: Spundiferous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of our honeymoon to treat ourselves before going home and we had a great time. We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite with a living room, dining room, enormous bathroom and separate smaller half bath, and 2 lanai. i was worried from what other people said that the bathroom would be old and gross but it looked like it had just recently been re-done. The waterslides were so much fun and the beach in front of the hotel is great. We had a very yummy brunch in the hotel ballroom. If you can find a good deal like we did at 1800hotels.com I would totally recommend staying here for its loveliness and lusury.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxtion and stress free”
Reviews.Author: happycouple96
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort and sleep quality was the best I have ever had, Very expensive but you get what you pay for. Food quality and variety not as good as we had expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Reservation Service”
Reviews.Author: RJM27
Reviews.Content: I had relatives attending the Sunday Brunch. I was able in advance to treat them to the affair even though I was not there. They had an excellent table on the lanai and enjoyed a great brunch that was not only billed to my credit card, but I received a personal email with detailed charges. Very professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Maui”
Reviews.Author: carrhodges
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for a family. With a slide, rope, and a few pools this is a great kid friendly vacation. We went for a couples vacation and enjoyed the breakfast buffet, rooms and beach although the breakfast buffet was the only place (other than a little shop) that you could enjoy a sit down breakfast and closed at 10:30 every morning. Also, there's very little options within the hotel if you want lunch and dinner as well (the fancy dinner option was closed the whole time for private parties). There is a nice little shopping center within a 5 minute walking distance with a great little Cheeseburger place, shops, galleries (a great "celebrity" art gallery, ruths Chris steak house and sushi joint. Nice beach with activity optioons. Watch The lunch place at the pool, as its extremely expensive and the food both times was horrible (turkey burger was questionably putty-like and the "large" salad was tiny and mushy. Found out after the fact that Maui has an amazing little market on the beach on Sundays, so ask about that if you're there on a Sunday:). All-in-all, Maui is absolutely breath taking, the grand wailea was a little too large (you literally need a map) but greets for family vacation and alright for a couples stay. Service was delightful. Bed extraordinarally comfortable, very clean room. Ask for Ocean view room. Worth it. While we wewre there Adam Sandler and Jennifer Aniston were filming a movie at Grand Wailea and staying at the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful location but please be prepared to pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: Mugspaw
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay here for a family vacation, our party included 10 people. We had 2 senior citizens, 4 38-40 year olds and 4 children ranging in age from 7 to 13. The rooms were very nice and the beach was great to go walking, body surfing and snorkeling on. I saw my first octopus! The kids LOVED the pools! They could have stayed in the pools all day long and often did! The adults liked the pools too but did not enjoy always trying to find a place to sit. The pool areas is extremely crowded and difficult to find a spot together. I really did not enjoy the fact the hotel charged for little things like a float to go around the lazy river!! The food by the pool was very expensive and not very good. In fact one day we walked to Cheeseburger in paradise then took it back to the pool for the kids, the GW waitress saw our food and even commented that our food looked better than what they served. The crafts by the side of the pool were very expensive too. However the staff was very helpful, we had to stand in line for towels and rarely had to wait for more than one person before us. Also when one of the kids got stung by a bee they were fast to help out. We had a rental car and did not use the entire time we stayed at this resort. The rooms were luxurious and had amazing views and lanais, the grounds were well maintained and relaxing to walk around. The food was very good but very expensive. m We did enjoy a great Sunday brunch. The proximity to the Shops at Waileau was easily a short walk, we had meals and ice cream several times there. I would suggest that if you go please be budget more $$$$ for the little things.

Reviews.Title: “Have money to burn, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Optimistyk
Reviews.Content: PROS: It was a beautifully landscaped, and manicured property. The housekeeping staff were also very hardworking. The staff were very friendly. The hotel was a wonderful feast for the eyes. CONS: It took ten minutes to get from the room to the pool or beach, it took two elevators, and a very long walk to get to the self parking that unless you had a can opener, you wouldn't get your car in.
