I was surprised by a 25 dollar hotel fee that did not include high speed internet, or similar amenities like sauna or steam room use or parking! 250 dollars for a lounge chair for a day! 35 dollars for a turkey sandwich and chips! The rooms in the exclusive "Napua Tower" are nice, but the noise from the bar is so loud at night you can't sleep a wink. The decmial point seemed to be seriously misplaced in most cases. It was really a place that if you have money to burn, or you are not on ANY kind of a budget, you could be very comfortable here.... I myself; was not!

Reviews.Title: “Get up Early to claim you spot”
Reviews.Author: bostonfiveo
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful spot, one of the most gorgeous scenery you will ever see. However, the first day there my husband and I got up early (6:30 a.m) due to time change and urge to walk the awesome cliff walk. When we got to the beach we saw a line resembling the running of the brides at Filene's Basement in Boston (except it was coed). We were puzzled and asked what everyone was lining up for. The response was that everyone was there to claim their chairs! I told my husband that I REFUSED to enter that rat race and line up at 6:30 to get a chair. Well, that was a mistake as I ended up laying on my towel on the beach at a $700 a night resort! I felt like I was back in HS! The elderly couple next to me was in the same predicament and I watched in horror as the gentlemen struggled to get up from the sand. The pool area resembled a scene from CNN showing the tent cities in Haiti. People were elbow to elbow with towels, rafts, etc strewn about. The resort is beautiful and the beach is glorious, however, I don't understand why this chair scene is more competitive than the Wall Street Job Market! Why don't they have enough chairs for everyone or why can't they stop people from "saving their spot" all day?

Reviews.Title: “Do your own due diligence!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingirl2010
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers re: the pool scene. It is a HORROR show - the likes of which I have not encountered in Florida, California, the entire Carribbean (including Atlantis in the Bahamas) or the entire East Coast in the summer. The hotel management is non- existent. Pay your $$$$$$$ and they could care less if you have no place to sit by the pool or the beach! And if you arrive after 7 am - you will NOT have anyplace to sit. This is not a relaxing vacation - honestly there is less stress fighting your way on to the NYC or Japanese subway systems. As the prior reviewer said - if you leave your chair for an hour - they remove your items and give away your chair. I noticed a LOT of this on our last day - there was one security guard who was especially agressive and seemed to be enjoying himself. As I watched, I thought - wow I've been on beaches in the Dominican Republic that were ringed with armed guards from the military toting machine guns and felt more relaxed. At least those guards were actually protecting me and my stuff! One striking thing I will remember also is that around the pool - no one ever seems to smile. Not the guests and not the staff. Pretty odd for a "vacation paradise." I heard that there is some type of condo or time share property adjoining this hotel. These folks pay little $$ to rent their rooms but have full privileges to the pool and beach. As a result - the hotel has a huge overcapacity of people v. the facilities available. Couple that with the fact that 40% of the pool and beach cabanas are reserved (for a tidy $250-$300 per day extra to the hotel) by other guests when they book their rooms (a fact NO ONE ever mentions when you are booking) and you have the root of the problem. Adding insult to injury - many of the "reserved" cabansa sit empty if not for the entire day - for much of it. So people who know the system can just plunk down their $$, tour the rest of Maui and laugh at the hotel guests who would just like a seat to unwind by the pool. As I said - the most ridiculous pool scene I have encountered world wide. If you are no looking to use the pool or the beach and/or you go at a time other than Thanksgiving, Xmas or Spring Break, the property itself is gorgeous - as is the room. I found the staff very helpful from the front deak to the bellman. I was peeved when I requested 2 wine glasses and was told there was a $5 delivery charge (no joke). I did not eat at the hotel as there are tons of fabulous restaurants closeby. In particular we skipped the overpriced Easter brunch ($72 per person $36 for kids) and ate at Longhi's at the Shops at Wailea (great breakfast!). I also HIGHLY recommend Sorrentos on the Beach - 5 minutes away with GREAT food, wine and an unbelievable view of the sunset. We had dinner there twice it was that good. At the Grand Wailea, we did have drinks by the beach bar (name escapes me at the moment) and the apps were awful and the "house" wine was undrinkable. If you must stay in Waliea - definitely check out the Four Seasons. Their property is much more elegant (even if their mortgage seems to be in default - doesn't seem to have trickled down to the property at least not yet). We had dinner at Duos - service and food were fabulous. We tried to book Ferraros - but it was fully booked. Check it out ahead of your arrival if you have any interest in eating there. I will return to Maui but I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Repeat Winner”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl29
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Grand Wailea for a relaxing trip at the end of Sept 2009, and were so glad we did. It feels like home in a way to us...we first stayed here in Oct of 2007. We checked into a garden view room, and loved the upgrades they've done to the rooms since we were last here. New bed linens, new flat screen tvs, and new love seats make the rooms look refreshed and sparkling. We had no problems checking in, and immediately put on swimsuits to go play in the pools. The resort was not very crowded (perhaps because school was in session) so that was nice. -Restaurants: Ate at the Grand Dining room each morning for breakfast. Is is pricey? Yes, but so is Wailea (as a whole) and I found the buffet to be a good value for the money. Fresh juices, hot tea for me, coffee for husband, and a full buffet with all the trimmings. Crisp bacon, waffles, yogurt parfaits, and every kind of tropical fresh fruit. Servers would offer us a newspaper, they were very attentive, and this relaxation is part of the reason we come to the Grand Wailea. Didn't eat at Bistro Molokini or Humu's this time around, but previous visits to Molokini have been tasty. -Pools: To be honest, this is the main reason we come back to the Grand Wailea! Yes, I am almost 30 years old, and yes I don't have kids but I still love the waterslides! The pool is so tranquil in some spots, and raucous (fun) in others. We have always been able to find a lounge chair, we love the frozen drinks that they serve you poolside (even though they're pricey) and we love to get hot in the Maui sun and then race each other down the slides. If you have kids or are just a kid at heart (like us) then you'll LOVE the activity pool at the GW. Can't say much about the Hibiscus (adult) pool because we never go in it! We will sometimes sit in the jacuzzis at night, and the temperature has been pleasantly warm. -Grounds/Beach: Beautiful landscaping, lush greenery, plumeria everywhere. I just love walking around the GW and admiring the reflecting pools, the artwork, the gorgeous flowers. This place always takes my breath away. Beach is large, clean, and pretty quiet. We spend a lot of time in the pools, but this time around also did some snorkeling. The snorkeling was better in Kaanapali at Black Rock, but it was still worthwhile in Wailea. -Surrounding Wailea area: We always go over to the Shops at Wailea to browse and window shop. You can easily walk there from GW, but we usually drove. I recommend the Cheeseburger Island Style place, it had good made-to-order burgers, and it was nice to sit in the open air restaurant and just kick back. They have some high end boutiques (Louis Vuitton, Gucci) as well as souvenir and sundries shops (ABC Stores) so there truly is something for everyone. We love the Grand Wailea and would come back in a heartbeat. It is an expensive trip, but I feel like it is worth the money, and we will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for price; uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: MikeBlas
Reviews.Content: At a Waldorf property, we expected a five-star experience. We were disappointed. The hotel has nice views (but what hotel in Maui doesn't?) but is absolutely giant; it is a lot like a strip casino in Vegas. One night, we decided to stay in. We ordered room service at 630 and were told it would take an hour to deliver our order -- two Caesar salads, one with chicken. The food arrived in about 50 minutes, but the salads were terrible. Both featured hard bitter romaine lettuce hearts. Two salads for $45 total where were only half edible. Can you imagine? Two mornings we tried to sleep in. On Mondays, the staff mows the lawn about 9am. On Thursday, there was a test of the fire alarm and emergency PA system at 10am. I understand that maintenance is required and tests of life safety systems are important, but so early in the morning at a five-star resort? Most other mornings, we were woken by staff moving luggage carts over the tiles in the hallway. The hard wheels on the luggage carts make an incredible amount of noise on the five-inch tiles outside the rooms, which reverberates through the rooms. Remarkably, the hotel uses phenolic wheels on their carts instead of softer pneumatic wheels. Missing details like these sound trivial until you can't sleep in on what's meant to be a relaxing and romantic getaway. I don't mind paying more for great service and good food. But the marginal service wasn't worth the prices. Most of the employees were very courteous and attentive, but the hotel is simply too big for its own good. There isn't enough room at the pools; the bars are too small, and the situation with lounges at the pool is chaotic. Renting a cabana costs almost as much as renting a room. The staff can't keep up with cleaning the facilities or stocking the bars; can't keep up with waiting tables, clearing lounges, or advising customers. Some members of the overworked staff end up rude and stressed, of course. The only casual dining restaurant in the place had a terrible waitstaff, though the bar staff in the central lobby bar was very friendly and tolerant. I'd recommend staying at a smaller property where the staff is better equipped to handle your requests, able to provide more personal service, and the facilities aren't so over-taxed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very expensive, tons of people, best pool around”
Reviews.Author: PackersFanCleveland
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is one of the grand dames of Wailea and after going there it is easy to see why it has such an amazing reputation. However, reputations are built on the past and given how crowded the hotel /pool was and how relatively low staffed the hotel was I would say that the GW is past its prime. The last time I stayed at a $700 per night hotel I don't recall having to line up at 6:30am just so I could sprint to get a beach/pool chair but that is the case at the Grand Wailea. If you are not in line by 6:30 you better plan on sitting on the beach with no chair because for some reason the hotel has chosen to make getting a pool chair a full contact sport. Oh, and don't leave your pool chair unattended for more than an hour or they will scoop up your stuff and give away your chaise to someone else. The stupidest thing I have ever seen at a hotel unless you consider the Motel 6 to be a fair comparison. I guess the reason they get away with this is that the GW is an awesome hotel with the absolute best position on the best beach with the best pools I have ever experienced. So...take the good with the bad and decide for yourself what is most important: pampered luxury a few doors down (Four Seasons), Smaller pool and 50 yard walk to the beach but certainly less crowded and less expensive (Marriott) or the mack daddy pool in the mack daddy location while fighting hordes of visitors for a coveted chaise at the pool (Grand Wailea).

Reviews.Title: “Quite a disappointing experience. I...”
Reviews.Author: Sabra1023
Reviews.Content: Quite a disappointing experience. I understand the hotel is at its full capacity during spring break, however I shouldn't have to or need to get up at 6am to fight a mob of people to get a poolside chair. Getting lunch was nearly impossible unless you are by the poolside. I really was looking forward to my stay at the Grand Wailea, but the happiest and most relaxed moments were far away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand, and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Rollerbademom
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui and chose the Grand Wailea as our hotel because of the great location and the fact that it had such a great pool with water slides and a lazy river. We have two kids ages 5 and 6. We are easy going, physically fit people who enjoy playing with our children and spending time outside. Here are the pros and cons of this hotel: Pros: 1-Great location... the other parts of the island had several days of very high winds. The beach at the Grand Wailea had winds, too, but we could still swim in the ocean and play on the beach. It was still warm and nice. 2-The pool has many things for kids to do. There is something for everyone. 3- The workout facilities were great. Cons: 1- Upon check in our room was still dirty from the people who stayed there before us. when we complained, they did fix it and said they'd comp our breakfast. 2- We went to the Grand Buffet for the "comped" breakfast, ate and left. It was not grand at all for over a hundred dollars. Then, the breakfast charge appeared on our hotel bill and stayed instead of being "comped" as we were told it would be. Toward the end of the trip it still did not come off until we went down to talk to someone. They still would not take it off until my husband started to get very mad and there was a line of people waiting to check in. Then they took it off. If you stay at this hotel we recommend going next door to the Four Seasons for breakfast. Their buffet was much more impressive with a lot more choices for the same price as that at the Grand Wailea 3- The hotel hallways are filthy. The carpet is just nasty, not just old, but nasty dirty. There was the same dirty half empty cocktail glass accompanied by an empty plastic juice bottle that sat on the console table by the elevator for 3 straight days before someone cleaned it up.... and that is just getting started.... 4- It takes a very long time to walk back to your room if you forget something because the place is so big. 5-They don't have nearly enough pool chairs or beach umbrellas to accommodate. We witnessed fights over the chairs and you have to get up and get in line at 7 am to get your chair and then wait until 8 when the umbrella's stand opens and tip someone to carry it out to the beach for you unless you want to do it yourself. The only people who get "poolside" service for beverages and food are those who "rent" the cabanas. Cabanas cost extra. ALL others must walk up to the poolside cafe/bar and stand in that line to get their own drinks and food and carry them back to the pool spot or beach spot they are sitting. And it is crazy at that place. 6- the pool water was cloudy every day that we were there. It did not look the way a pool should look. 7- The "family" bathroom did not lock when we were there-Easter week... I was walked in on two different times when I was in there with our kids, a boy and a girl. Also, there is only 1 family bathroom. For a hotel this size it is not enough in my opinion especially when single people with no kids go in the family bathroom because they don't want to wait in the line at the men's or women's bathrooms right next door. 8-The hotel staff takes down the chairs at the beach to put them away before 6 pm. So if you plan to watch the sunset on the beach you won't be able to sit in a chair while your kids play in the sand to do that. 9-If there is a little wind at the beach, the hotel staff doesn't just put down the umbrellas until it stops, they take them down and take them away for the rest of the day. A baby was taking his nap at the umbrella next to me and they still took down the umbrella and left him with no shade. At 1 o'clock in the afternoon...... 10- When we were there the hotel pool deck did not get cleaned off. It was slimy and gross the whole time. In addition to the debris floating int he pools, and the cloudy pool water, we saw debris floating in the hot tub and were not sure if it was something from a coconut tree or poop. The pool was not very clean. 11-The women's restroom by the pool smelled horrendous the entire time we stayed at the hotel. It was not maintained during the day, I don't know if it was at night or not, but anytime I used it during the day whether it was first thing in the morning or not, it was ridiculously dirty and smelled like urine. 12- I made an appointment for a pedicure and manicure at the "grand spa". The appointment was supposed to be for 2 pm on the Saturday before Easter. I had asked them to write it on a card because they seemed very distracted and casual about the appointment when I made it. It was a good thing I asked them to write it on a card because the next day when I was supposed to be there for my appointment they told me I didn't have one. Then, when I showed them the card they couldn't have been nicer but told me it was for noon in the computer not 2 pm like they told me and wrote down on the card. Unbelievable. They were booked and the only time they could get me in was Easter Sunday morning at 9 am. We went to church so I said no thanks. 13-Another thing about the pool- if you swim later in the afternoon don't forget to get a towel. The towel stand closes promptly at 6 pm. If you are swimming with your kids after that and didn't get a towel right away, you will have to walk through the lobby all the way to your room in your suits dripping wet. 14- Another thing about the food- we paid 30 dollars for 2 kids' meals at the pool side bar/restaurant. The kids' meals were a hot dog (or other choice of main entree), a small bag of oreo cookies, a jello cup, a bag of chips and a capri sun. The capri suns were served warm all 4 times I got my kids a kids' meal. The jello was not jelled. It was like it sat in the sun from another kid's meal and liquified or something until it made it back to the lunch shack and got put in our bucket. This happened all the times we got kids' meals for our kids at the pool. One time, I first waited 15 minutes in line to order the food. Then, was rudely told by the bartender, the kitchen was really "backed up" and it would be a 1/2 hour until they'd be ready. So, I came back 1/2 hour later and there was still a long line. In short....we were disappointed. We did visit other hotels in the same beach area to compare food, cleanliness and pool and service. But mainly we visited the other hotels just to get out of the Wailea to eat. There was no comparison. The Grand Wailea is not grand and it is dirty inside and out at the pool. For the same money you could go to the Four Seasons, the Fairmont or even the Marriot. Their pools were not cloudy, their staff was all friendly and the food was much better. For a 100 dollars for breakfast you want it to feel like 100 dollars. The four seasons breakfasts felt like 100 dollars, at least. Grand Wailea was not only dirty, but it was old and worn. It was not worth the money. I would not recommend this hotel, and we will never go there again. Although we love Maui and next time we will stay at the Four Seasons, the Fairmont or the Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort for a fun family vacation”
Reviews.Author: McCall
Reviews.Content: Our family of four has visited Maui many times and have been fortunate enough to spend time at several of the resorts on Maui. One of our favorites is the Grand Wailea. It's just a great place for everyone in the family regardless of age. When our kids were little the toddler pool with the sand bottom was a hit and now that our kids are 11 and 14 they have fun exploring all the pools and sandy beach. We stayed at the GW for four nights and left on Easter Sunday. Since it was Spring break the resort was sold out and except for the pool area it didn't feel overly crowded. The only problem we encountered was that the pool area was so busy that you had to wait in line for drinks and it was difficult to find a place to sit down. We quickly figured out that we needed to be at the pool at 7:00 AM in order to get a recliner. A few weeks earlier we tried to reserve a cabana but they were reserved for this time several months earlier. After waiting 30 minutes to get a drink at the main pool lunch bar we realized the best place to order drinks was from Richard at the swim up bar. The Humu restaurant was good but for the price we enjoy more Nicks at the Kea Lani and the fine dinning spots at the Four Seasons. The resort is huge so be prepared to walk and dig deep into your wallet. After a few Lava Flows, it won't hurt as much. The rooms are large and have comfy beds and a walk in shower. We paid for a partial ocean view and we had a pretty good view of the pools and ocean. Overall, another fantastic stay and our kids are already asking when we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “The place is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Jersey2010
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a civilized typical Hawaiian Resort do not stay here! The place is bedlam and out of control. I have never seen a resort with more security guards then this place. They are there to control the guests fighting for beach and pool chairs which is crazy. You get on a line at 7am to get your own beach chairs and carry them to the beach and then at 8am you have to wait on the another line to get an umbrella. There is not enough pool and beach chairs for the amount of guests!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!!! Please can I go back!!”
Reviews.Author: alisa_phillips_123
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Grand Wailea resort over February vacation 2010. We used Hilton Honors points for our room. 80,000 points per night is a heafty sum, but sooooo worth it! We were upgraded to an ocean view room on the 3rd floor of the Chaple wing. We had an excellent view of the chaple, hibiscus pool and the ocean. The room itself was spectacular with a large tub plus a glass shower. The free parking is a bit of a walk from the rooms, but the grounds are so beautiful you hardly notice the time! We spent most of our time at the main activity pools. They have interconnecting pools with slides, a water elevator, and a rope swing. We tried it all! We even snorkeled at Wailea beach. (No reef=not many fish, just silver ones.) Took a walk on beach side path to view other resorts. Food: Had lunch by the pool at volcano bar. Frozen drinks were very expensive!! But sandwiches were good. We had a fabulous meal at the Bistro Molokini in the evening. A bit expensive but the kids enjoyed the turtle stuffed animal that came with their meals. I would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tiranga
Reviews.Content: Great place - highly recommended esp with family. Kids had a great time and the beach was perfect for young kids.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Royalty at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: SonomaMom707
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel where the location is incredible, the staff top notch, the food delectable, then look no further than the Grand Wailea. My husband, and two teenage boys spent a week enjoying all that it had to offer. The beach had the softest sand imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “GW=Luxurious accomodations, heavenly setting, friendly staff,everything your heart desires”
Reviews.Author: Mellowmom
Reviews.Content: Just had the most wonderful 13 days relaxing at the GW- by the end of our vacation my 14 year old daughter was already planning our return trip for Christmas. What do you dream of when you go to a tropical island? Beautiful white sand beach with great beach activities? Warm tropical breezes and sunny skies? Great, friendly staff ready to satisfy your every request? So many pools to explore with slides and caves- and a swim up bar with Richie shaking up frosty cocktails? Incredible grounds with amazing tropical flowers, beautiful artwork around every corner- fabulous food in a thatched hut restaurant where you are suspended over a tropical aquarium- oh and the spa- heavenly! Does it all sound over the top? Maybe- but the GW is one of the most incredible hotels I have ever experienced. We were treated like queens- upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room in the Chapel Wing, had champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries from the hotel delivered to the room for my birthday. The only bummer was the guy in the next room who took a 5am conference call on the speaker phone for three days in a row- but one small blemish in paradise I can overlook. We will be back...as many times as we can!! Highly recommend taking a day trip to Piiholo Ranch for the Zipline- amazing, breathtaking, soooo fun!

Reviews.Title: “Memories are made of these......”
Reviews.Author: Sunjourney
Reviews.Content: Beautifully laid out out rooms with the sounds of waterfalls, birds and the scent of flowers. A great service staff. Fabulous beach and nice saltwater pools. Definitely, on my list of regular places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Maui”
Reviews.Author: blondie_at
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is the perfect hotel-resort. The rooms were great with wonderful views of the ocean and it is in the perfect location in Wailea, Maui. The beach is wonderful and the resort is great. At Christmas, it's busiest time of the year there are lots of families so the resort (pool, slides etc) is overrun with children everywhere. The spa was great and well priced. Our only issues were that the breakfast in the large dinning area was terrible (and expensive) we won't be doing that again. In addition, the prices at all of the restaurants like the one at the pool are outrageous. Overall we had a great stay and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip”
Reviews.Author: DVS
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful trip to the Grand Wailea. The check in staff were all so friendly and helpful. We had a ocean view room on the 9th floor. We could watch the whales from our room. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and decorated beautifully. We love the bath products (lotions, shampoo, etc.) Smell so good. The food was good, service was excellent. If you have children, I feel there is no other place to go. The pools and water slides are so much fun. We did walk over to the shops that are next to the resort to buy water and snacks (saves so much money). We had a spa day and it was incredible. Currently, they are running a special that includes the brunch. It was well worth it! If you don't get the special, make sure to eat brunch in the Grand Dining Room at least once. We really enjoyed our time at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic upscale resort, great time, with a few improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Darren
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights a few weeks before the crowds expected for Spring Break. Resort is beautiful, well manicured and maintained. Our desire was for the pools and beach, which were fantastic and fully met our expectations. Lazy river, slides, pools, rope swing...clean sand beach sheltered from rough surf, lots of grassy areas and lots of landscaping, walking paths, waterfalls, koi ponds, etc. Has it all. If you want a clean, upscale area and resort, this is it. The food/restaurant selection was OK, but not great. They need a Hula Grill..!! Of course everything is expensive...but that's how you maintain an upscale clean and beautiful resort. We expected it. We were able to find shade at the pool with free umbrellas (family pool, not adult pool) - IF YOU GET UP EARLY and stake out your spot. Negatives: Drinks and food are 20% more expensive than they should be. Some of the staff were not friendly or helpful (we had significantly better staff service at the Kaanapali Westin which we visited next). Room service failed to pick up dishes outside door for 2 days and multiple phone calls, and when we finished the coffee and creamer every morning in the room, we had to call room service for fresh creamer replacement the next day (you would think that would be a no-brainer). BTW...the guy who delivered it was none too happy. So for what it is, we had a GREAT time and would cerainly visit again. However for full Waldorf-Astoria expectations, some of the finer details were not consistenly present. Bottom line: It's a beautiful place that you can't help fully enjoying if you look past some of the minor things. Hopefully the resort management reads these threads. They are not far off the mark.

Reviews.Title: “great but”
Reviews.Author: Ninkaz
Reviews.Content: They have beautiful grounds and art at the resort. The rooms were very nice, great beach. Two dissapointments were the food options and uncaring and unfriendly staff at check in and in the spa. Expect to pay for everything even shade. We couldn't find one umbrella at the adult pool. You can pay for a cabana. Amazing place for children because of the slides. The scuba lessons with Eric were great, he was patient and thourough. A must try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, spectacular views,price required for shade”
Reviews.Author: cineteach
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Wailea was wonderful. The room was quite large with a huge bathroom, separate shower and tub, and a spectacular partial view of the ocean, the palm trees and the manicured grounds of the hotel. The service at the hotel, from the reception to the housekeeping was excellent. The concierge was very helpful with directions to restaurants and arrangements for a snorkeling trip to Molokini. I only have one complaint about the hotel and it is that you have to pay to have shade by the pools or on the grassy areas overlooking the ocean. We checked on the cost of a cabana (which, by the way, were 90% vacant during our entire stay of 10 days)and it was $225 per day for a cabana. The small two seater shaded cabanas near the beach were $50 per day.I don't know what families did with small children who can't be exposed to the sun for an entire day. There were a couple of umbrellas near some of the pools.(none around the adult pool). I think at a luxury hotel like this, some alternate shade should have been available for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiFF
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous location, amazing beach, great pools, beautiful art, nice landscaping. We were on the 9th (top) floor that provided an awesome view of Molokini. Comfy beds and quiet rooms. Food was typical resort fair and was quite pricey. Stay away from the Kula Cafe for actual food, for drinks and packaged snacks it is ok. Breakfast buffet was excellent and so was the service. Don't bother paying $20/day for valet. The free parking garage is secure and not far away. Our almost 4 year old son had a blast and so did we. Didn't think it was quite Waldorf-Astoria material, but it was a super nice place, just had more of a hotel feel, not so posh room wise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferL12
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds were breathtaking. The atmoshpher is quiet and peaceful. Perfect for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Lounge Chair Wars”
Reviews.Author: cbaraj
Reviews.Content: To compare the G.W to Disneyland, would be a disservice to Disneyland, which while equally frenetic, has more authenticity than the fake opulence and general grossness of the Grand Wailea. The waterslides are great, and my hat's off to them for that. But the crowds, often made up of competitive sunbathers and loungers, are scary and packed. The staff at the GW was great and when they saw me and my kids sitting on the cement, told us to take one of the twenty empty lounge chairs, which people had "reserved" by placing a newspaper or book on the way to breakfast. We did and of course, the people came back, enraged, looking for a fight. I don't really use lounge chairs anyway. But every day that I was there, I saw at least 2 lounge chair fights. Weird. Lounge Rage in paradise. Had a great massage at cheesy, Italianate spa. If you want a peaceful retreat, this ain't it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rubymill
Reviews.Content: the surroundings....the people....the service.....the view.....and the spa, awwwwwwwwww.....THE BEST I had ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Grand and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KellyL8
Reviews.Content: The best choice of honeymoon and wedding and relax. Enjoy the lush, Polynesian beauty of Grand Wailea - an elegant island hideaway providing an incomparable destination for relaxation and adventure. dont know where the paradise is, just come and visit and stay in grand wailea in Maui, Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: ladybug0709
Reviews.Content: We chose The Grand Wailea because we had a great stay in April of 2007. This time (Oct 2009) things were a bit off. We caught two different conventions while we were there. It felt more like 'Spring Break' for 30 year olds. People were playing football in the pool and 30 year old drunk men were hitting on me. The grounds were also not as nice as I remember. Our room was great as it was the first time (clean and the bathroom is huge!). The staff was very nice especially in the main bar. However this will be the last time staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: mauigirlLansing_MI
Reviews.Content: Just returned last week from this spectacular hotel. We were in the Napua Tower which had the extra amenities such as breakfast and cocktails/appetizers in the early evening. Excellent service from the staff, we really felt that we were well taken care of during our stay. The beds were to die for.....very comfortable, I would love to have this bed in my home. The view from our lanai (room 7044) was the ocean and the grounds. We enjoyed the adult pool each day as well as the pool menu and drinks. Everything was great, especially the maui onion rings....don't miss out on these little gems!!! We had a great time...... thank you to everyone at the Grand Wailea for making our trip a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Smiling Can't Be Helped”
Reviews.Author: GoSpartans
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would stay here, again. Positives: The pools are magnificent and there is something for everyone. There is a wonderful quiet adult pool with restaurant/bar service. There is a fun zero depth entry pool with sand for the kids, and a large pool for games with meandering rivers, slides, and a water elevator for fun. There are hidden hot tubs and a grotto swim up bar. Depending on your mood, you can find it all. The "fun" pools do have a lot of children, but the beach and the adult pool do not. The beach is beautiful with golden sand and warm and inviting water. Bring your binoculars so that you will have a better view of the whales. There is chair and umbrella service at the beach, however, you cannot get drink/bar service at the beach as ALL beaches in Hawaii are public property. The rooms are huge (we were in the Napua Tower,) including the bathrooms. Amenities are plentiful including coffee and toiletries. The bathrooms have a very large tub, double sinks, huge walk-in shower, and separate water closet. Slippers and robes are provided. The beds are comfy and double-sheeted which I always consider a bonus. There were extra pillows and blankets in the closet so you do not have to call for them! The lobby is open-air with marble floors and plenty of places to sit and relax. The art work is unusal and interesting. The lobby bar is large with wonderful entertainment each night. The area is clean and safe with wonderful restuarants within walking distance or within a short drive. A fantastic beach trail fronts the hotel and affords a wonderful walk either in the morning or evening. The shopping in the hotel itself is spectacular with top brands (swimsuits and clothing for men and women.) If you stay in the Napua Tower, you feel very secure as a key is needed to enter the floor. Breakfast is wonderful with all the usual continental dishes in addition to a hot egg dish of some kind or waffles. Coffee is wonderful and plentiful. The evening cocktail hour is nice with full bar service and good appetizers. You could make a meal out of the evening cocktail hour if you wished. Internet access is free in the Napua Tower, also, and there is a designated concierge to help with dinner or site seeing reservations. The location is wonderful. You can get to many wonderful things on the Island in less than 45 minutes. The beach is one of the best on Maui. It has wonderful shopping, golf, and restuarants nearby. Negatives: The hotel is huge. It took me a good day or so to get my bearings. If you are on a higher floor or in the Napua tower, you will have to take two separate elevators to get to the pool or spa. The pools can get a little crowded with people putting their towels out early. Cabanas cost a lot of money, but you do get waited on! The breeze is always nice, so I do not think the cabanas are needed. Umbrellas for the beach are free (at least for Napua Tower guests.) Food and drinks are very expensive. A bloody mary or other mixed drink is $13 and lunch can easily run $22 dollars for a sandwich of some sort. We only ate in the hotel for a couple of lunches. The food was good (the onion rings were to die for.) You can certainly find both more expensive and less expensive food outside the resort! We had many wonderful meals in Maui. You can buy your own drinks (soda pop, water, liquor, beer) and keep it in your room. A refrigerator cost only $25 for the week and is well worth it to save on these items alone.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: BitsyM
Reviews.Content: This was probably my 8th visit and as usual, it is a remarkable property that kids and adults alike enjoy. Great family venue.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Beach, property almost too big!”
Reviews.Author: kentdan1
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days at this property and 6 at Hyatt. We enjoyed the adult only pool area but still spent time in the other pools and on the beach. Service was good at the pool even when it got crowded. Grounds are nice but a bit unkept. Used the ice room every day and the entire visit the same trash was sitting on the floor. Plastic bags were floating in the water falls pool and were there our entire stay. This sounds trivial but it is the little things that distinguish good from great. The property was very nice but really huge. The beach is very nice. Fairly far from the rooms but that is apparently because the zoning laws have changed since some of the older, closer to the beach, properties were built. This place is great for kids but if you are not there on a business account reach really deep in your pockets for everything. One boiled egg was $2.50 and a six pack of beer $22 ! Glad I don't like boiled eggs. Walk down to the mall and buy some stuff at the ABC store. Unfortunately they offer no fridge in the room for your stuff like the Hyatt and other properties do. We bought a cheap cooler. Great workout area and the spa was wonderful. If you are looking for some late night entertainment (we were not) this is not the place. We will go again, but next time stay longer at the Hyatt Regency and less at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Maui Destination”
Reviews.Author: TravelsaLotCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in December. The room we stayed in had a full ocean view and was a corner room, so we could actually see the sunset from the bed (amazing.) We ate breakfast once in the hotel and the staff was incredibly detail-oriented. My girlfriend used some of the various jams on the table, and the server would swing by, replacing the ones that were used. The housekeeping staff was also very hospitable. Thank you for a memorable stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: annie10306
Reviews.Content: It's been two years since we've been but we loved the Grand Wailea. The location was fabulous. It is sunny and dry our entire stay. The beach was gorgeous and the pools were great for the kids (and adults, too). My children loved this place so much. I loved going to the adult area and escaping the kids for some r and r. I found the food to be average for the price but we went next door to the 4 Seasons to eat, and out and about. Loved Mama's Fish House as usual. The rooms are really small which is the only drawback to this hotel. Will that stop us from going back? Nope. We'll be back after this year's trip to the Big Island.

Reviews.Title: “View, Ocean and Fun”
Reviews.Author: LlamaTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea Resort is a great place to go for vacation. Te Grand Wailea has very nice rooms that are very clean and roomy. It also has availability to the ocean and for kids even pools and waterslides. The food is great. The prices are a little high but worth it. If your planning a trip to Hawaii consider going to the Grand Wailea For Fun and Excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon haven”
Reviews.Author: voyager_cmc
Reviews.Content: We checked in today after finding the fairmont kea lani too stuffy and spatially challenged (all the pool noise echoed up to our room). This place offers complimentary upgrades for honeymooners and champagne ...something the Fairmont didn't too but promised. The ocean view is superb, the grounds are breat taking if your into tropical beauty and a maze of pools and gardens. This is my recommendation fir honeymooners!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: SunInHawaii
Reviews.Content: Yikes - this place is so expensive for what you get! We just started a 1 week stay here and I have massive sticker shock. There are no reasonable restaurant options - $13 for a very average small kids pizza. So far the food hasn't been bad, but certainly nowhere near justifying the price. And there's nothing else reasonable within walking distance - you always have to hop in the car, which is a hassle, and double that when you have kids. Sure the pools are great but I really wish I got more for the money. Maybe it's too much to expect for Hawaii. Next time for sure we're renting a little condo with a kitchenette. Also, we'll go someplace smaller - this hotel is enormous and it's hard to find your way around. Also - the charge is $95 for 3 hours at the kids club - wow! We were told that the kids club had an area where you could just go hang out with your kids and do fun stuff, but we didn't see anything like that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, great views...be ready to dig into your wallet.”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay during the later half of January 2010 for five days. We had a nice room which was overlooking the waterslide, pool and partial ocean view, even though we only paid for garden view. The service I experienced was better than most in Hawaii. Everyone seemed happy to have business, during these trying times. The amenities are perfect for couples/families with younger children, but, might be too much walking for the elderly. Get ready to pay for every little thing. You get charged a daily fee ($10) + parking ($20) + porterage ($10) + housekeeping ($3), etc . I wasn't aware that the bill was masterbilled under a group rate, so these were all included. Not knowing, I graciously tipped those who served us. Not that they didn't deserve a tip...just not double. Make sure to ask if these services are included in your package when you check in, because it won't be apparent. Hot tip: if you plan to eat breakfast on the grounds, instead of room service, you can take a short walk up to the cafeteria style store and buy off the grill items for about 1/3 of the price of room service. Ate there just about every day and wasn't disappointed. You can pop out just down the road in Kihei town and hit Stella Blues/Jawz/Thailand Cuisine/Pita Paradise and get a pretty inexpensive meal. Golf courses surround the property and it is pretty easy to book the day of. It's pretty slow right now because of the economy, so look online and in the travel magazines for deals. You can drive about 30 minutes and pay $100 less and play several decent courses in Kahili and Dunes @ Maui Lani or even less at muni-like courses Elleair or Pukalani. Overall, you won't be disappointed. Just be prepared and bring a flowing wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but good, not great”
Reviews.Author: nyc_and_chi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Wailea from 1/16-1/23. We had a king room, Terrace View which had a beautiful bathroom and was easily accessible to the pools and restaurant. After staying at a number of luxury hotels, I was underwhelmed by the room which is the standard room (upgraded to king rather than 2 twin beds), but wowed by the bathroom. Housekeeping staff was wonderful and efficient. The restaurant, Humu... was nothing special. The entrees were OK. You are surrounded by bodies of water that closely resemble swamps, not really appetizing. The pools were great, especially compared to the Four Seasons next door and the children there seemed really pleased. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families with children, it's like a mini water park. The ambience at the Four Seasons is better for adults and the breakfast there is better, so just walk next door. Price wise though, you get a bigger bang for your buck at the Grand Wailea and they share the same beach. My other main complaint is that after spending $450/night plus a $25 per night resort fee, you still have to pay for non-motorized watersports. Boogie boards were $40/hr! Bring your own snorkel gear or rent it from the number of places there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Gettothesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea in early Jan/10. It really is a beautiful hotel on a beautiful stretch of beach. Room We had a few problems with our room during our stay - the toilet broke, the safe broke, and the TV broke...seems like alot of problems for a room during a 7 day stay. I will say, however, that they very promptly responded to the concerns and fixed the toilet and safe very promptly...although the safe malfunctioned again at the end of our stay, we didn't bother to raise the issue again. The TV never was fixed properly - every 15 min, we had to jiggle the coaxial wire when the TV signal was lost; this after 2 service calls. however, we didn't spend much time watching TV so it wasn't a big deal. In my opinion for a hotel of this class (and price), I think it is ridiculous to have 3 issues with a room during a single week. The bed was great - very comfortable, and the lanai was equally great. Bathroom was definitely 5-star. Beach Note, this resort is situated on a public beach. Not a swimming beach, at least at the time of the year we were there, but wonderful soft sand, and fun to jump into the waves...good for kids and adults. We rented a "casabella" for 4 of the days we were there and what a WASTE of money. True, you do get a guaranteed spot, and a nice view of the ocean, but of significant issue was the fact that about 2:30pm, we had non-paying "visitors" squatting in the adjacent casabellas. I raised this with the staff, and they explained that because they start removing the loungers and umbrellas at 3pm, this is a "grey" area and they don't really enforce the use of the casabellas for that reason from about 3pm onward. Well, there didn't seem to be any "grey area" with my $50/day bill for use of the casabellas! I think the resort should be pro-rating the charge for the "free" hours they are allowing non-paying patrons to use them. It really is absurd - so my advice, do not book a casabella...instead, wait until about 2:30pm and choose any free one and enjoy! Clearly the hotel has no problem with this. Food The food was excellent. Humu has an amazing filet mignon that is cooked to perfection. All the food was really quite good. Breakfast was quite good too - we ate at the buffet in the Grand Dining Room for breakfast. Like many similar places, you have to be prepared to wait a while to get a made-to-order omlette. The waiters at breakfast could also stand to get a refresher in good customer service...at least some of them. A couple of the waiters we had were great, others were terrible...no service at all. And, I personally saw one of the waiters go to the bathroom (beside the restaurant) and he didn't wash his hands. How disgusting is that? We had room service one evening and it was very good (albeit outrageously priced). Service Service was largely good...not great, but good. The wait staff at dinner was far better than breakfast or lunch. Despite the fact we paid $50/day for the casabellas, we only had a server approach us on 2 of the 4 days we rented the casabella. I thought the maid service was very good, and was impressed when I went to the room (on two occasions) while the maid was in the room, and she insisted I demonstrate it was my room by using the key card...this vs. my experience in Mexico where I strolled into the room when the maid was there and got a polite smile, despite I could have been anyone taking anything from the room. One other note is the cost of food / drinks during the day is really quite absurd. $13 for a cocktail (plus tip?). A hot dog will cost you $12 (each). I ordered some sushi and beers on the beach and rang up a $70 bill for a snack...gimme a break. Overall, a beautiful resort, on a beautiful beach. However, the $50/day casabella charge when others used it for free really iritated me. I wrote the hotel with the same complaint, and didn't hear back...I guess they don't care. So, my advice to all is feel free to use the casabellas, for free, from 2:30pm onward. And, if anyone asks, this is hotel practice and the "grey area". Would I go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but spendy”
Reviews.Author: C_B0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great as you would expect for the price. I have nothing but nice things to say about the room (1069 is right on the end over the pool), the restaurants (Humu is great but avoid the eel), and the pool....lots of little nooks and crannies to explore. Really good for kids but there is an "adults only" pool. However....my complaint is that the charged you for everything that should have been in the price of the room...housekeeping ($3), resort fee ($20), portage fee ($10), parking ($20), and they charged to use their (very nice) fitness center. All of this is mandatory and it just makes you feel like you are getting screwed. Include it in my price and let me decide if the hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Resort”
Reviews.Author: CrystalA4
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful and upscale. Wonderful ocean views from your suite. Many activities, very family friendly, but also caters to those who want a more relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Huge place that's great when it's not fully booked”
Reviews.Author: Wagsdvm
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't normally choose a resort of this size in Hawaii, but we stayed because of a convention at the resort. We were pleasantly surprised by the terrific, warm service and laid back atmosphere. This may have been because the resort was only about half booked, so I'm sure it made it all the better...no stress about securing a great poolside padded lounger and no waits for anything. The pools are spectacular and liked that one of them is reserved for adults only. Adults and kids alike can have a blast in the big pool with waterslide and lazy river. The price for drinks and food were expensive on the property (and in Wailea in general), but we would drive up to Kihei for some great restaurants and grocery shop for fruit and drinks we'd keep in the fridge in the room. Loved our garden room which had a view of the ocean thru the palms and a nice grassy patio that extended our outside area quite a bit. Look for deals during your stay at the spa. It's worth the visit - and especially nice when you can get 2 services for the price of one :-) Also enjoyed the morning beach yoga and going for a stroll by the ocean to watch the turtles feeding around the tidepools in the morning (just north of the resort).

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Ritz would have been better”
Reviews.Author: midwestfoodie53
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to take a trip to Hawaii and wanted to spend a few days in Maui, we had been to the island years before and had stayed elsewhere but had heard great things and decided to stay at The Grand Wailea. To be frank for the price the resort charges for everything (room rates to cans of soda), the experience was not worthwhile by any means. The property itself was beautiful and the facilities well maintained, however the service was sub par at best with the exceptions of any restaurant/bar staff and valet/bell-service. I will say the food at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a was fantastic and the bar menu stellar. I went to the spa for a massage which was a very positive experience- the baths were great and so was the service. I wasnâ€™t impressed with the salon services though (mani/pedi and a blowout), the staff was apathetic and what they charged did not reflect their skill-set. The fitness center and shops were top notch. The most disappointing aspect of the trip was the treatment we received from the front reception- we were placed next to a room with several children who were extremely loud and messy (things left in front of our door etc) and after calling the front desk several times to have the situation remedied, we were essentially ignored. Without any follow-ups, apologies of even the option of changing rooms (the hotel was not at full capacity). For the amount of money spent I would have done one of two things: spent more money and stayed at the Ritz Carlton or stayed someplace cheaper and received the same service.

Reviews.Title: “Had more fun here than at the Four Seasons - definitely the place to go with kids”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFDC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at both the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons Maui (see separate review) but haven't been back for a couple of years so the info is a little dated. We preferred the Grand Wailea, we basically had more fun there. You'll spend most of your time outside and the beach and pools are MUCH much better at the Grand than at FS. Service/food was better at FS, but we just went there most of the time for dinner. For adults, I can see choosing the FS if you really want all the FS service and aren't too bothered about the beach/waterslides. With kids, it's a no brainer, Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: gkace
Reviews.Content: I read a lot about this hotel on Trip Advisor. To be honest I did not have a clear view after the mixed reviews. So we stayed here with our 3 boys (11,9 & 7) in Jan 2010. In summary would I come here again... NO. Why ? the hotel rooms are ridicously expensive for what you get. We have travelled all over the world in 5* hotels and its seems you pay a premium as US citizens dont want to travel far for their beach holidays. Everyone raved about the water slides they were ho hum. There are only 3 or 4, with only 1 good one. My kids enjoyed them but you should not choose this place for that reason. The beach is okay but again it comes back to what you are use to and expect. We asked for an upgrade and they responded by putting us in the Ocean view rooms. Rooms were excellent and service was really good. We requested a fridge and that came in handy with 3 kids. We bought some groceries from the local Safeway. Hiring a car makes sense as you can venture out and try restaurants outside the Waliea trap. The thing that really irked me the struggle to find beach/pool chairs (we were there in peak time). Then the hotel has the hide to rent you some others at a cost. You pay a $25 resort fee ....you should expect a chair. The gardens are nice but the pool area is tired and needs updating. Molokini snorkeling trip is rubbish if you have snorkeled anywhere decent in the world. The trip to volcanoe is worth it. To summarise Thailand, Bali, Tahiti, Langkawi, Fiji are much better options. If you dont travel much you will like this place.......if you do you will come away feeling ho hum.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jma4nyc
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel, especially the rooms in the Napua tower. Its worth the extra money. Complimentary continental breakfast and the cocktail hour are just some of the great amenities at the concierge floor. The staff at the Napua tower go over and beyond to make you feel at home. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea several times during Thanksgiving but last November was the first time at the Napua tower, we were so happy with our visit we already booked the Napua tower this Thanksgiving. Looking forward to our visit. I was once told anyone can build a beautiful building but its the people who make it warm. This is what the Grand Wailea is all about. Its a beautiful hotel with lots of warm people that make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: esmeluv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our Honeymoon and we never wanted to leave the hotel! We originally chose this place because we were Hilton members and in the end we were very happy with our choice. The rooms were clean nice and large enough to get a basic room and feel the need to upgrade to a suite. The areas around the hotel is gorgouse! amazing views everywhere you turn. The pools have a lot of activities for the kids and adults. The swim up bar was probably our favorite spot. If you wanted a quiet area you could go to the adult pool. Theres hot tubs by both pools as well... I woud also reccomend trying out the spa. Expensive but worth every dollar. We didnt eat out much but the chefs accommodated us with whatever we needed. Our next vacation I would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Islandbum07
Reviews.Content: We went on a first time in my life trip to Hawaii, we choose Grand Wailea beacuse of its Waldorf Astoria affiliation. We travel a lot but usually dont stay in places that expensive, trying to stay in a little bit lower level. My first impression was awesome, trees were decorated with Christmas lights, valet parking and check in was prompt and courteous. Our room looked like it was recently renovated and had grear balcony with partial ocen view, central reception hall had a great bar with pools around it., all together with beautiful beach realy created an island experience. i loved Hawaii, liked the place but would probably opt out for little bit cheaper lodging.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a year makes”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelVT
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth visit to the Grand Wailea. It was definitely the best! While we dealt with bad service and no pools last year, the newly renovated pools were open in full force this year. We stayed in our favorite room to date--a deluxe ocean room on the ninth floor. From our door we could see Haleakala and from our lanai we could see the beautiful grounds and ocean. We found that the service was much improved this year, our room was cleaned by11 everyday. The newly rennovated pools were lovely and we enjoyed acting like kids and going down the slides and floating on the lazy river. We were not at the pools to drink, so I can't comment on the prices there, as others have. We used the self park garage to avoid valet fees and tips. Although the spaces are tight, our midsize car fit in nicely. The food is pricey at the Wailea, but a quick walk to the shops at Wailea and you can get takeout at Whaler's General Store's Deli and bring it back for a relaxing lunch on the lanai. There are many great restaurants to eat at in Kihei that will not break the budget (Cafe O Lei is our fav). As many point out, the food is pricy on premisis. While others complain about being nickeled and dimed (and in truth there are a lot of fees), the Grand is aptly named and is not to be missed

Reviews.Title: “Really....think about this one, not that great!”
Reviews.Author: Chantimack
Reviews.Content: We knew when booking this trip that it would be crowded, expensive and a big commercial hotel...we took the chance for the water slides and pool for our 5 year old daughter. with a one flight option from CA -the food is mediocre, expensive and NEVER HOT -I had better nachos at Taco Bell then the cold, soggy ones served to me by the pool -it took us 2 elevators and 15-20 minutes to walk to the pool -we had to get up at 6:30am, race to the pool, and stake out chairs by the pool, the pool opens and 7AM and the mad chair rush begins -snow cone $8, bag of popcorn $6 -50M renovation-where, maybe in the rooms, so they must have been real dumpy before? -drinks are $13-15 each -we paid $175 each for a new years casino celebration...the sprinklers came on half way through and soked us and our blackjack table-oh and we got 1 glass of champange! -as a family of 3 we averaged $300-500 a day in extras and we ate out some of the time -breakfast for 3 at a buffet $80 with tax and tip -handles were falling off our dresser in our room -room service dishes sat out side of our room and other rooms for hours even overnight I would reccomend a condo on the beach and come to this hotel ask for a day pass and use the slides and pool-which were fun With all due respect to the families that we met that return year after year....There are many more wonderful warm islands in the rest of world!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodyguy99
Reviews.Content: This is a stunningly pretty place to stay. The hotel is located right on one of Maui's nicest beaches(and that's saying something.) It's on the expensive side and so are all the restaurants and snack bars. But if you want to splurge.... . There is a great pool area complete with waterslide and a kiddie area. The beach is soft white sand and stunning. The grounds are lush and sculpted with artworks and statuary sprinkled liberally around. Our room was slightly smallish but very luxurious with marble tile everywhere etc etc... Staff and hotel service were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastWanderer79
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel and a great way to splurge on your Hawaiian vacation! Make sure you give yourself time to enjoy the hotel amenities instead of doing a day trip every single day. Wailea is the most stunning resort area on the island and we found it to be a lot cleaner, quieter and more upscale than areas such as Kanapaali. Close enough to all major attractions such as Kihei, Lahaina etc. but you will definitely need to rent a car. Our room was fantastic, the service was exceptional (great concierge), the beach is beautiful, the pool areas are unreal. Would recommend not dining at Humu Humu because we found that, although the atmosphere and service were great, the seafood was not the best we've had. Spa Grande is unbelievable! No complaints about this hotel whatsoever and would HIGHLY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: jjdm922
Reviews.Content: My family spent 5 days at the Grand Wailea at the end of October. My 8 year old daughter and 6 year old son had the most wonderful time and have been asking when we are going to return. My 8 year old is very social and made friends with kids every morning and spent the day going from waterslide to pool to water elevator, having a grand time. My son just wanted to go from the top pool down though all the little water slides (the two large slides were too scary for him) and float around the lazy river. When we arrived, a family who was leaving gave us their giant green and pink float rings (we passed them on when we left as well). The families staying there were very laid back, nice friendly people who were happy to chat or snooze, whatever. We didn't run into any high-maintenance folks complaining. The wait staff were present but not intrusive. They weren't spraying you with Evian or bringing frozen fruit on a stick but they were helpful when needed and extremely friendly. I felt that the kids were safe when out of direct eyesight, as there are people tending all the waterslides (presumably as a safety measure as well as keeping people who aren't staying at the GW from clogging the pools). The place is huge and we didn't even try to explore the other wing of the hotel. We never went to the adult pool, though it looked fairly empty. We got a great deal on the room, so for the price and the enjoyment of the entire family it couldn't be beat. We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian village on Ohau and the Hyatt in Lahaina. The GW blew them both away (and I'll never go back to the Hyatt). We were off season, so there were absolutely no crowds, no waiting, no issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: jwmerrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11/28 thru 12/5/09. This was between the crowded thanksgiving and Christams crowds, and was very nice to have smaller crowds. They will give you a Lei when checking to the hotel. Don't expect a Lei at the airport, unless you prearrange for this, I used leigreeting.com and had no problems. We had no problem doing what we wanted and making same day resrvations for things was no issue. The resort is very beautiful and very large, but does't feel too large. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort was clean and well the landscaping was in perfect shape. It is obivous that they put alot of work in to keeping the resort in good condition. It's located right on the beach, which is a nice beach. The pools are the best on the island with an adult only and large waterpark like pool for everybody. Drinks at the pool start at about $13, which tends to make you not buy many. I think they should lower the drink price and make up the profit with volume on the drinks. They have private Cabanas at the pools, but require a resvation and cost a couple of hundred dollars for the day. The food is good but overpriced, as are most of the nice resturants on the island. We ate the daily the breakfast buffet because it was part of our package it was good but not worth the 30 plus dollars per person if your paying for it separetely. We also ate dinner one night at Humuhumunukunukuapua's very nice and romantic; the food was very good but pricey. The best meal we had was at Mama's Fish House in Paia, yes it was expensive but the food was fabulous and the ambience was fantastic. Drinks at the pool start at about $13, which tends to make you not buy many. I think they should lower the drink price and make up the profit with volume on the drinks. They have private Cabanas at the pools, but require a resvation and cost a couple of hundred dollars for the day. The spa was very nice and would recommend a couples massage. We stayed in a Oceanview king. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was huge. The rooms have safes and mini bars. But you can get a small fridge in the room to use for outside drinks and food for $25 for the week. We stayed in the Chapel wing room 2014, greatviews. Parking is free in the self park lot but can a hike depending on where your room is. Valet is nice but $20/day. If you have a late night flight out, the hotel will hold your bags while you go do stuff all day, and when you come back they will let use a courtsey room to clean up/shower and change clothes before heading to the airport. We did this and found this to be easy to do and nice to clean up before our 12 hours of travel back home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: KimTravel62
Reviews.Content: In December 2009 we spent five wonderful days at the Grand Wailea in a ground floor room near the chapel. The hotel is right on the beach so after you walk through the magnificent gardens you are there. There is a pathway which leads to all of the hotels and apartments along the water. This is quite popular for an early morning/evening walk, with some great photo opportuntiies. Our two queen beds were extremely comfortable for my husband and I and our 12 and 15 year old boys. The room was quite spacious with a bedside table between the beds, desk, large flat screen TV, TV stand with plenty of drawers, lots of room for our four quite large suitcases, and decent size wardrobe with safe. Our bathroom was a great size and suitable for wheelchair access so the shower had no door. I did feel this was not that private for me at times, but I coped! Beautiful shampoos, body lotions etc were supplied which are also available to purchase from the spa shop. Rooms were serviced quite promptly and we also had turn down service at night. Outside we had a table, two chairs, footstool and small rack for wet swimsuits. The wonderful waterslides at the pool were just great for our boys (and us too!). The boys would disappear for hours and the staff were so friendly and learn't their names which was nice. Hi David! You can order some great snacks and drinks by the pool too or eat at one of the dining areas or restaurants. We would often grab a quick breakfast at Cafe Kula in the morning then have lunch or dinner at Bisto Molokini. On our last night we had a wonderful dinner at the Humu Humu restaurant which was really beautiful. There are also restaurants at the Shops at Wailea which is a short walk from the hotel. Tommy Bahamas was really good and we also had dinner at a pizza pasta restaurant called Matteo's. We all loved the Grand Wailea and can't wait to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great restort, but lacks 5 Star feeling”
Reviews.Author: tigerider
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s interesting to see all of the reviews on this property. I read the reviews from months ago and it seemed they were struggling with keeping guests happy. Then in recent months the reviews seemed to have been more positive. The one common theme I read among them was poor food service, great SPA and love the pools. After spending 7 nights there I would agree with each of those. The only one Iâ€™d add is that it doesnâ€™t have the personality of a 5 star property. More like a 3.5 â€“ 4.0. I say this only because of the lack of personal service and attention to detail shown to the guests. I guess this is probably due to the fact itâ€™s a 700+ room facility and spread out like an amusement park. Itâ€™s a beautiful property with amazing views, groomed grounds and a pool area that would compete with the fun of a small water park. It also has the â€œadult onlyâ€� pool which was nice for those of us traveling to getaway and relax. ROOMS â€“ We booked an ocean view room. It was nice, but had a better view of the garden than the ocean. After requesting to be changed we were put into a corner room and it was great. I donâ€™t think there are many at the ocean view rate, but if there are â€“ request the corner room. It has a much larger bathroom and walk-in closet. Not to mention a window in the bathroom that overlooks the ocean (also two ocean view windows in the bedroom area). The rooms were clean and neat. Very nicely decorated with newer amenities. The only complaint on the room was the A/C. It seemed to struggle to keep it cool, but wasnâ€™t uncomfortable. STAFF â€“ Front desk was always helpful and friendly. BILLING â€“ We requested a refrigerator for the room. Itâ€™s a onetime charge of $25. They put it on the bill twice. They did the same thing to one of the others in our party. However, another one in our party wasnâ€™t charged at all. So, definitely review your bill for accuracy. Several have posted similar encounters about this. SPA â€“ Outstanding! Awesome facility, services and staff. The only unpleasant part was the front desk receptionist. Her name was LJ and she was very bad at her job. As the first and last person the guests see at the Spa, youâ€™d think they would have someone friendly and helpful there. But, look past that â€“ once inside â€“ itâ€™s the best spa youâ€™ll ever find. FITNESS CENTER - Very nice and well equipped. GROUNDS â€“ the landscaping and pools were impeccable. The pools and slides were more fun for adults than kids I think. We spent many hours being kids again! The only drawback is the size of this place. You spend a lot of time walking to get from your room to anywhere (pool, front desk, shops, etc). Donâ€™t forget something in your room â€“ because itâ€™s a long haul back there. FOOD â€“ Head to Safeway and stock your fridge! The restaurants are overpriced and not that good. The â€œGrillâ€� menu poolside was the biggest disappointment. The burgers were dry and tasteless. Very unfortunate. Itâ€™s not hard to make a good burger. I donâ€™t mind paying the high prices for the convenience, but not when the quality is worse than fast food. There are plenty of alternatives for food off the property. PROâ€™s Pools, Views, Rooms, Spa CONâ€™s Billing Errors, Food, Personal Attention OVERALL Great resort and had fun while there. More for families or those wanting that â€œresortâ€� feel. If youâ€™re looking for luxury, relaxation and 5 star treatment, look next door to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place - TERRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: GEFDenver
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a beautiful property and a great location but the customer service and attention to detail is absolutely terrible. Our bill included hundreds of dollars of charges that we never made including a large bar bill that we never incurred (huge charge for numerous Heineken beers which neither I nor my wife drink) We had to speak with several people at the front desk before anyone would agree to adjust the bill. The first person we spoke to at the front desk plainly told us that she had no authority to do anything about it and that we were out of luck. Next, the internet was not available in the rooms for two days of the trip (I do hear that they have since upgraded to wireless). It seems that internet access is standard for a hotel of this caliber. The advertisement for the room we booked said that it had a mini-refrigerator. When we got to the room and it did not have a refrigerator, they agreed to set one up (after two different requests). They then tried to charge us about 25 dollars to have the refrigerator - not a big deal but felt like they were nickel and diming us. The people at the front desk could not be less knowlegable or less caring. After promising us a late check-out (2 pm), they locked us out of our room at noon. They failed to record my Hilton Honors number even though I gave them my card and I had to call Hilton directly to get retroactive credit for the stay. There is a resort charge of about 25 bucks a day that seems to provide no benefit. Other resorts provide free snorkle gear or free internet access when there is a resort charge - this resort charge seemed to provide us nothing. Of course, we did have an excellent time. Some bad customer service does not ruin a vacation in paradise. Beach is beautiful, weather was perfect. Restaurants nearby are great (except Spago which was overpriced). Pool was super. Seperate adult pool is really nice, very quiet. Views are amazing. Very nice spa. Yoga classes were good. Contrary to some other reviews on this site, our experience did not reveal that the place was overrrun with kids. Despite the problems with the staff it is hard not to have a good time here.

Reviews.Title: “Review of spa only--WOW”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to have my spa experience here instead of where I was staying (Four Seasons). Boy was that the right decision! It was a short walk next door, and this is the Olympics of spas, a waterpark for adults. It is unbelievable. I wondered why they wanted me to arrive an hour before my massage, then I found out why---the multiple options for jacuzzies, soaking baths, water massages, etc. If you are a bit shy, you can wear a bathing suit, but most women were au natural. It's worth every penny, and after this experience I will feel shortchanged at any other spa. The massage room was open to the air, and I could hear the waterfall and birds outside with a lovely breeze coming in. WOW. Only complaint is that they were cheap on amenities---I had to ask for a razor, and there was nothing else out. BTW, I used the Four Seasons spa area but did not have a treatment. I wasn't impressed--standard steam, sauna, showers. The way I see it, most treatments are the same and these hotels need to differentiate on something else. Go to the Grand Spa---you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for our family and friends!!”
Reviews.Author: Maui_mermaid33
Reviews.Content: Our family has the best time whenever we come to the Grand Wailea!! We have some of our best memories here with many pictures to share! One of our favorite Holiday picture cards was at the Grand Wailea. We are Kulana Members so we love to take advantage of all the awesome hotel offers. Thanks to Gail in membership who is extremely helpful and informative! I love to use the amazing 5 star spa with the most friendly and attentive staff (Mahalo to Jennifer and Valerie)!! There is one of the best yoga and fitness trainers named Nancy who is so positive and uplifting! She has been helping me get in the best shape ever!! The resort is huge so try to request a Chapel or Lagoon Wing and you will be closer to the front and nearer to the pools(but you may choose to use the stairs because the elevators maybe more distant). We recently held our kids birthday party there and the staff was exceptional and extremely helpful. We were able to use the awesome "Camp Grande" for the kids to play, have treats, and birthday cake!! The parents and kids have told us that Grand Wailea was one of the best parties ever!! I could go on and on.... We just can't wait to have another party with friends and family there!! PS. We also love the extensive pool hours....very generous for such a lrge resort!!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: tommykoo_in_LA
Reviews.Content: This was the first Waldorf Astoria hotel i've stayed & it rocked my vacation. It was the most beautiful hotel I've ever seen. You should stay at this hotel at lease once in your life

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wailea”
Reviews.Author: AndreaL7
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. 7 pools one with 14 karat gold inset.

Reviews.Title: “Too, too fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: francesca_maui
Reviews.Content: We are over 50, with no kids, and we had an amazing time at this hotel! We played on the water slides, and enjoyed every minute! We ate at the Bistro Molokini, and had the best pizza ever! (Tell them to make it with a crispy crust.) We recommend this place to anyone who wants a romantic, fun, getaway from it all. Even though we live in Maui, this was a special treat, and one that we will repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful property, mediocre service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Krm8164
