Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 10-day stay at the Grand Wailea. Our very first impression as we drove in to the resort was that this was going to be a perfect honeymoon. The drive in to the resort is beautiful, especially at night with all of the Tiki torches lit. We were promptly greeted by the valet and escorted to the check-in desk and we were offered a free upgrade, as promised, but we were a bit disappointed that we were only offered a room with 2 double beds instead of a king - especially since the resort appeared to be extremely vacant. The room was as we expected, but it was not perfectly clean. The balconies looked as though they had not been washed in several months and the shower had mold along the grout lines where the grout met the glass. The landscaping of the resort was impeccable, but unfortunately that was not shared by the rest of the amenities. The common area hallways were not very clean and the upkeep was not spectacular. You don't need to look far to see areas that need improvement. Lot's of painting, cleaning, and repairs need to be made to get this hotel to what should be Waldorf-Astoria standards. One day I removed my plastic bracelet (Daily plastic bracelets must be worn to access the pool and beach areas) and placed it on a table near the elevator. Two days later when we checked out it was still there! This should give you some idea of the lack of attention to detail. I would guess that no less than 100 employees walked by that bracelet during those 2 days. The food at the Grand Wailea was spectacular, and overall the service was good. Our highlights include the service at the swim-up pool bar as provided by Wayne and Richard. Our waiter, Justin, at HumuHumu was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. Some of the disappointments were the service at the breakfast restaurant, the Grand Dining Room. They must expect most customers to eat the Buffet so that they can serve theirselves, because the service was almost non-existent. We ate here three times and had hrrible service all three times. On our third visit, we decided to time how long it took before we were greeted by our server. It took 12 minutes, followed by another 9 minutes just to get coffee! We did complain to the hotel manager who put us in touch with the Food & Beverage Manager and the charges for two of the meals were reversed. Service by the adult pool was also very poor. We did see servers, but nobody ever stopped by to take our drink orders despite our attempts to wave their attention. We had to go inside the poolside restaurant to get our own drinks. The activities at the GW and in Maui are great. I am a certified diver, but my wife is not. She took a 45 minute course at the resort which consisted of a 20 minute lecture followed by a dive in their own dive pool. We were then both take to a beach dive right at the resort that had some reef and sea life. Our instructor/guide, Eric, was excellent. He was very friendly and we found sea turtles and a small octopus that we actually held in our hands while he took underwater photography. The concierge was also excellent. You MUST take advantage of the concierge. They will build you a whole itinerary for your visit and have relationships to book all of the non-resort activities on your behalf and have them billed to your room. We took a helicoptor tour of West Maui and Molokini with Sunshine helicoptors. They are the only provider that will guarantee front row seating for two for a small premium upgrade. The tour was good - not great, though that was no fault of the tour guide. It's just unfortunate that there are no active volcanoes to see in Maui. We also took a snorkel/snuba tour on a powered twin-hull catamaran out of Maalea Harbour. We dove at two locations Molokini Crater and another "unknown" location that was know to have lots of turtles. The crater was decent, but if you have any experience scuba diving, then this will not live up to your expectations. We happened to be out on a very windy and wavey day, so the snorkeling was difficult for most of the inexperienced snorkel, snuba divers (Snuba is a hybrid of snorkeling and scuba that allows you to breathe up to 20 feet underwater via a hose and air tank that floats on the surface). The highlight of this tour was having about 20 spinner dolphins swim with the boat as we cruised at slow speed between dives. The burgers that they cook right on board between dives were also pretty tasty! We did a zipline tour in Kaanapali that wes pretty good. Not as scarey as the ziplining in Costa Rica, but that's a good thing for most people. It seems much safer and has very large landing platforms so there is no fear of making any mistakes. In fact, they make it foolproof and the scenery is of course spectacular. The highlight of our activities was the drive to Hana. The drive is simply breathtaking through lush, tropical landscape along the most winding road you will ever travel! I recommend going on a day that has forecasted some rain or had rain the night before. The dozens of waterfalls that we saw along the way were extremely active due to all the rainfall they had up the mountain. Don't worry - it doesn't ever seem to rain in Wailea despite the forecast. Wailea gets 16" of rain a year while it rains over 350" just 10 miles away! It's the strangest thing - but very cool! The concierge will provide you a list of the best places to stop along the way to swim in waterholes and waterfalls, eat banana bread, buy local art, have a scenic lunch, etc. Do not miss out on this excursion! It takes a full day, but I found it far more exhilerating than the helicoptor tour. We drove back the same way we came up, though you can go all the way around the mountain. My wife had a videcamera but was afraid to let go of the dashboard because of my speeding down the roads! For driving enthusiasts that like to go fast, this is as good as it gets. By fast I mean a top speed of maybe 30 MPH. This road has over 600 turns where you turn the wheel greater than 45 degrees. I hope Playstation has this road on one of their driving games because I'm buying it! Other recommendations for food include Mama's Fish House for dinner. It's about a 30 minute drive from the resort, but it's very charming and the food is delicious. Everyone that you talk to will tell you to go here. We also had great meals at Duo and Spago next door at the Four Seasons. Overall, we had a wonderful trip. We had some disappointments with the resort that we did not expect to have when spending that kind of money. Plan to spend a lot of money! We averaged about $750 a day for 2 people, not including the cost of the room. The activities will run about $300 for ziplining to over $800 for the helicoptor tour. When you add that to $200+ dinners and lunch and drinks by the pool, you will see how it quickly adds up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Lizsamail
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Just fantastic. Try the SPA and diving Molokini.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Brisvegas_mel
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five nights at the Grand Wailea for a business meeting. This hotel is truly one of the most beautiful places I have ever stayed. It is a massive place and there is lots of walking to get around, but who cares!!! Once you figure out where your room is, it's easy enough to find your way around. Firstly the rooms - they are enormous. I have a 9th floor room in the Molokai wing with views to the ocean, over the gardens and the pools. The sunsets from my balcony were breathtaking. The room itself was enormous - easily the biggest room I have ever had in any hotel. The bathroom was big enough to throw a party in with both a shower and the deepest tub. Everything you could need was supplied and the little touches like the prettily folded towels with ginger flowers made it extra-special. It was also lovely to come back to the room every night to find a card on your pillow with a lovely saying and yet another flower - I felt very pampered. The restaurants - very very expensive, but very very good. We ate at Humuhumu one night and whilst it was outrageously priced, the food was superb as was the service. I ate my breakfast at Kafe Kulu which serves up lighter fare - rather than the big buffet breakfast in the main restaurant. Again it was expensive considering the food was fairly ordinary - but it was good enough for me - breakfast burritos, french toast, yoghurt and cereal. And sitting out on the deck and watching the sparrows made for a very pleasant start to the day. I also had lunch twice at Bistro Molokini which was fabulous - great food, very well prepared and just delicious. The pools and gardens - well everyone raves about these and with good reason. I was there in November so finding a pool chair was never a problem, but I can imagine in the middle of summer holidays it could be a problem. I also didn't find a multitude of kids thank goodness - but again in high season, well it certainly wouldn't be quiet or relaxing. The outrageous charges for the cabanas meant that I rarely saw anyone using them - what a shame. But there are so many different pools to sit by and the adult-only area is fantastic - what a brilliant idea. I didn't do the slides etc, but plenty of people were and seemed to be having a ball. Even the beach was great - and this coming from an Aussie!!! I also enjoyed the lovely beach walk heading in either direction along the foreshore - definately give that a go early morning or late afternoon. From the business point of view I couldn't have had a better experience - I organise lots of conferences and business meetings and dealing with the staff (including Delia and the lovely Sharon) was simply easy - which is exactly what I want. The meeting room we had was lovely - everything worked like clockwork - the timing of food, arranging a data projector when ours broke down - it was just smooth. Okay so that is all the positives - my only real negative I guess would be Wailea itself. It is very very expensive - the Shops at Wailea are lovely, but mostly designer and if you have the dollars to spend in Gucci or Tiffany, then great. But Kihei is just down the road - about $12 in a cab, and that is much more reasonable. I also found eating out in Wailea super expensive with little choice - Ruth Chris's Steakhouse at the shops was great, but the prices were mad. We also ate at Seawatch - it was again expensive, but worth every cent as the food was sublime and the service exceptional. My big tip - like many othes on the site - is hire a car, you will need it to get around and out of Wailea so you don't have to re-mortgage your house to pay for your holiday. I was lucky as being a business trip all costs were pretty much covered. If I could afford it I would definately take the family there, but I would hire a car for sure. My other tips - make the effort to get up early and go up Haleakala to watch the sunrise one morning, and the Sunset Cocktail Cruise aboard the Alii Nui was amazing value for money and just so much fun. All in all - a superb hotel and worth a visit at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Elevation Retreat for XanGo's Top Leaders”
Reviews.Author: RenePana
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Nature, Great Foods, Great Service, Great Pools and Beach

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: JackA09
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the location of the Grand Wailea are first class all the way. It's a huge resort and its layout can be a bit confusing at first. Depending on your room location you may have a very long walk to the pools. The staff is attentive but not overly friendly or helpful. The restaurants and shops are outrageously expensive, but you are their captive audience so be prepared. Guest rooms are large with extremely comfortable bedding and are beautifully appointed with big, modern and well laid-out bathrooms. Outstanding views, a great beach, wonderful pools, together with an award winning spa on property and lots of good golf nearby make this resort a must.. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristiB3
Reviews.Content: The Rooms were Great! Staff was extremely nice! Plenty of things around the resort for both children and adults! Very Pricey, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnificant”
Reviews.Author: barbKentucky
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this resort and it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is beautiful, the sculptures and gardens magnificant, the entire staff catered to every need and were so professional. From the front desak clerk, maids, gardeners, landscape professionals and all staff-it was obvious how proud they are of their work and the resorts image, Our room was wonderful, close to one of the many pools and framed by the beach and ocean. The room was very clean and decorated well. The food excellent and presentation excellent The beach was beautiful, and the laua was very, very nice. I highly recommend this resort. It is a treat from the moment you pull up to this resort until your last moment. Be sure and enjoy the brunch!

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: rsr7
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea was a great resort vacation spot. I have never been big on staying at resorts while on Hawaii but traveling with a 2 year old changed that. She loved the water parks as did my wife and I. The service was great, the spa was spectacular with the different water treatments before the actual massage. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff was friendly. They accommodated our needs very well, parking was not a big issue with a rental car (they have a free garage), and they were very helpful in suggesting attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea indeed offers the full package!”
Reviews.Author: ndcarea
Reviews.Content: Last summer, my husband, our two young adult children, and I made our first trip to Hawaii. When I saw that The Grand Wailea on Maui was considered a Hilton Honors hotel, we knew we could expect the quality of our stay to measure up to the high expectations we had for our trip. And we were not at all disappointed. We knew we were making a financial sacrifice for even our short two-day stay at The Grand Wailea, but our stay was like a dream! (I rated the resort 'average' for 'Value' simply because the room rate is a bit expensive -- even for Maui -- though it offers a great stay if affordable.) Upon check-in, we were thrilled to find that our upgrade gave us an absolutely beautiful view of the ocean! And that was the great beginning to our wonderful stay. Our visit to Maui was one that we have talked about incessantly, and will remember joyfully. The resort's common space and grounds are absolutely beautiful, and our room was so neat, clean, and tastefully decorated. The front-desk staff at the Grand Wailea went out of their way to provide us advice about convenient and more affordable dining options within the hotel as well as the locals' place, Da Kitchen, in nearby Kihei. They also advised us of inexpensive tour options like the beautiful Iao Valley, and shared the value of us doing even an abbreviated drive up the Road to Hana! The service we received from the Grand Wailea's bellmen, front desk, housekeeping, and dining wait staff was so cordial and valuable. We also enjoyed pleasant conversation with our bartender in one of Grand Waileaâ€™s restaurants, while we took in the gorgeous sunset! And my daughter and I had great fun with the water slides and pools! When it came time for us to leave the resort, our bellman was a genius in the way he methodically situated all of our luggage in the trunk of our car -- on the first try! The Grand Wailea indeed offers the full package! And we will recommend it highly to our friends and acquaintances who are seeking a first-rate vacation on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Keng94
Reviews.Content: There is nothing grand about this place other than the prices. If we had paid $200-250 a night I would be giving this hotel a better review, but we paid far more than that . They claim $50 Mil in renovations, but our room seemed dated and there was black stuff (mold maybe??) in the shower. For 2 nights, the cleaning people failed to remove the dirty glasses from our room and we had to set them outside to have them replaced. On first night, I went down to the pool, and could not a towel. So I asked one of the hotel staff and they instructed me to get on the phone and request a towel. Well a few minutes later another staff person comes by the pool and she has folded up fresh towels on her golf cart; naturally I assumed one was for me, because I was the only person at the pool. When I asked her about the towel she told me I had to call the desk and request one!! I told her that I had already did that,and her reply was that I had to wait. She then proceeded to grab the clean towels up and carry them back into some storage area. I was just about to create a stink when another gentleman comes walking by with a clean towel..... Overall this place was average... Positives: 1. Wonderful Sunsets 2. Nice beach right outside of the hotel 3. Free internet (Negative with this also) 4. Free Bike Rental (at least for us anyway) 5. Plenty of on site activities (you have to pay though) 6. Awesome Pools!!! Negatives: 1. Customer Service could be improved with some of the grounds staff (Desk staff and the people out in the front were excellent). 2. No courtesy shuttle from airport to hotel; you have to either: a. Rent a Car b. Speedy Shuttle ($28 per person; need to give the guy a tip also) 3. Free internet has a limited connection speed. If you want faster, you have to pay. Tips: 1. Bus stop less than 1/4 mile away from the hotel. Costs $1 and will take you to kehai for plenty of shopping; sushi; etc 2. They do offer free bike rentals, but you better be in shape cause there are hills galore. 3. Rent a Car if you plan on going on any off site excursions! 4. Some excursions will pick you up; make sure that you book with them. 5. The mall next door has alcohol and good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but need to treat kamaaina better”
Reviews.Author: imso808
Reviews.Content: I hope that this review is read by a Grand Wailea staffer and that you share it and take it to heart. We are local and live on Maui. My husband and I recently married and stayed at the Grand Wailea on our wedding night.. From the time that we checked in to the minute we checked out we were treated with indifference by the staff. I guess you guys could tell that we were local because of my husband's pickup truck. It was disheartening to say the least. Please remember that our money is just as good as the tourists' money. We worked just as hard (if not harder) to make that $300+ to stay at your hotel as Mr. & Mrs. Continental USA did. We deserve to be treated with the same respect. I am not blaming the tourists for our treatment. Rather the staff who caters to them. The resort itself was lovely, the pool was fun. The attitude however needs to change.

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui resort money can buy...and the people it can't.”
Reviews.Author: konaaina
Reviews.Content: This is simpleâ€¦if you are planning to spend time at a resort on Maui, you will not find a better experience than the Grand Wailea. If you are local or visiting from a neighbor island (as was our case) and looking for a special getaway, Grand Wailea will not disappoint. There are many reasons I say this, obviously the grounds are amazing, spacious, beautiful and extremely well kept. The buildings, facilities, restaurants are beyond excellent and of the highest quality weâ€™ve ever experienced (I melted in that bed) The kids club is extensive, the opportunity for adults to use a separate pool without us families seems like a great thing too. The location on Maui is perfect (check the internet for weather patterns on Maui, you will find the Grand Wailea perfectly situated in one of the ideal spots on the island for weather and beach usability). The activity pool and beach access is second to none on Mauiâ€¦but here it is, the people that give the Grand Wailea life are absolutely some of the finest individuals serving visitors on this island. The staff and management at this resort genuinely care about sharing the spirit of aloha with their guests and it is evident at every turn. The people of Hawaii are an extraordinary collection of exceptional humans and the Grand Wailea has done an exceptional job at staffing their resort with some of the finest among them. I could go on and on but if you are reading this trying to decide how to best spend your â€œhotel dollarsâ€� while on Maui, you will not find a better resort than the Grand Wailea. One last thingâ€¦maybe a rebuttal to the negative reviewsâ€¦the Grand Wailea is a resort. An amazing resort staffed by amazing people on some of the most amazing lands on earth, but it is just a place. While it provides an invitation to escape to an altered reality for a time, if you are looking for the negative in anything (or everything as the case may be) you will find it, even there. If however you accept the invitation and soak in all that the Grand Wailea and Hawaii have to offer, you will find those things instead. Bring the negative and you will find the negative, bring the aloha and you will find the alohaâ€¦Remember â€œâ€¦itâ€™s an island babe, if you didnâ€™t bring it here, you wonâ€™t find it here.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: nocalsker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay at the Grand Wailea. I have stayed here two previous times. It was even better than my prior visits. Every staff member from the bell staff. front desk, room service, shopping outlets, pool staff and food service was wonderful. This resort truly has something for everyone. The prices are in-line with rates and services from similar resorts and hotels worldwide. I am a bit amused by some of the critics who posted on here. If you travel much and stay at world-class hotels you know nothing at the Grand Wailea is out of line with the norm. Last year I spent a week at the Ritz-Carlton in Cancun and it was not even comparable to how wonderful the Grand Wailea and Maui is.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: 3snoopyfans
Reviews.Content: I thought the room prices were a bit expensive. The level of service was fantastic. Cleanliness was spotless. It was a great place to stay with the whole family. We were able to play with our kids and relax in a beautiful location. We can't say enough nice things about this hotel and look forward to returning many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but disappointing food.”
Reviews.Author: AlisonDB_8
Reviews.Content: My husband won a President's Award, which was the only reason we stayed at such an upscale resort. Usually when we travel, we choose modest accomodations so we can splurge on activities and meals. The size of the resort is almost overwhelming, but is nicely landscaped and decorated with fine art, and the room was quite spacious. The food was a different story. We were both rather disappointed that the quality wasn't better for the price. I've grilled better steak at home and the cocktails were less than impressive. Some people commented here that the spa was dirty. I completely disagree. I thought the spa was fantastic. Although the price tag was a bit steep, the baths were heavenly and the free scrub was an added bonus. I choose a traditional swedish massage, and my massage therapist, Roxanne, did an amazing job! It was quite an experience. If we were to go back to Maui, my husband and I would probably just stay at the Days Inn for $90 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny - the best vacation we've ever taken”
Reviews.Author: socal9r
Reviews.Content: We were married at the Grand Wailea ten years ago and just returned from our anniversary trip there with our seven and five year old girls. What an amazing experience. The kids were welcomed everywhere - slides, gift shops, all restaurants on the property - and actually cried when it was time for us to go home after nine days there. Yes, it is expensive - but worth every penny. They upgraded our room WITHOUT knowing we were married there ten years ago or that it was even our anniversary... nice. Maid service twice a day was an unexpected luxury when we showered every afternoon before going out and found clean dry towels and beds turned down when we got back. The people, from the pools to the restaurants to the cleaning people, were friendly, helpful and considerate. I won't stay anywhere else on Maui - it's that perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea 2009”
Reviews.Author: athomedad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea the last week of March '09 into the first week of April. While we signed up for potential upgrades, given the US economy we thought we had a chance of getting one, a pharmaceutical convention was in town. Despite that we were upgraded from an ocean view to a deluxe ocean view. Our room was spectacular we were on the 8th floor and overlooked the Wedding Chapel and had a direct view of the ocean. The rooms were clean and we spent the $25/wk to have a refrigerator brought to our room, best money we ever spent. We were able to get wine and food at the shop at Wailea and just sit on our balcony and relax when we wanted to without being forced to go out for lunch every day or evening. We had no trouble finding seating around the adult pool unlike the difficulty we used to have when our daughter was younger and we tried to find space around the water slide pools. The new policy where they will provide you with free, yes I said free chairs and umbrellas on the beach was greatly appreciated. I gave $5 tip to the porter who put our chairs and umbrella out each time. Dining: We really like the upscaled wine/food menu at Bistro Molokini and ate there several times but our favorite is still Ferraro's at the Four Seasons. Ferraro's food and view are spectacular. Not cheap but spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Danilohb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights this past weekend on my HHonors points. When we checked in, we were told our room would be a garden view room. Upon request with no additional charge, we were immediately upgraded to an ocean view room. I forgot the name of the tower but our room was near the end so it was quite a walk to the nearest elevator. The room view was fantastic. We used the pools quite a lot and found it very clean and very large I might add. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants so I can't speak for those. We valley-parked our car throughout our stay and found the staffs there to be courteous, quick, and very professional. We never had to wait longer than 5 minutes for our car and we never called ahead. My wife and I have stayed at quite a number of Hilton family hotels including those that are part the Waldorf Astoria Collection (i.e. Rome Cavalieri). This has to be one of the Best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Great at apologies”
Reviews.Author: Piberoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wailea for our honeymoon. For the price of this hotel we had high expectations. Our Oceanfront room was very nice and the grounds of the hotel were lovely. All was well until about 5AM. We awoke to a noise that sounded like gym sneakers in a washing machine which lasted for 2 minutes and would repeat every 10 minutes. When we called the front desk, it took a little pleading, but they were courteous and sent a bellman up to move our room. They moved us to the Napua tower but to a "temporary room" while we waited for another to be ready. This room had broken shutters, no ocean view, and a pillow top mattress pad that was too small for the bed. It was also extremely noisy. About an hour later they moved us to our final room which was very nice. Definitely not worth what they charge for it, but very nice. They apologized profusely for the noise, which we were told was a pipe problem, and gave us some goodies to smooth over the situation. We were back on track. After that there were some small disappointments. First, there is no shade at the adult pool unless you pay for a cabana. At the activities pool, chairs are right on top of each other and it is very hard to have any semblance of privacy. Next, there is no room service lunch. At a hotel of this calibur? When we asked if someone could just bring a take out order from one of the hotel restaurants, we received more apologies. Finally, even after calling 5 minutes before we went down for our car, we always had to wait at the vallet for 5-10 minutes. Overall its a nice hotel, but I think more value is obtained at the Four Seasons where service is amazing and you dont have to pay extra for shade or privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful property and location”
Reviews.Author: LindseyReis
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was incredible! Wailea is the most beautiful area of Maui and this hotel adds to that. We had great service and a great stay! The hotel's signature Restaurant Humu's was amazing - service and food were amazing! There were so many activities available between the unique water elevator and the slides and pools - we were never without something to do. The room was huge - and the views amazing! We were on the 9th floor and had the greatest view of both the ocean and the beautiful gardens. Plus, we couldn't believe we had free parking, too. Overall, it was an amazing experience and we'd go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Uyster
Reviews.Content: My bf and I went to Maui for a weekend getaway. We've both never been there and we weren't sure what to expect. The Grand Wailea exceeded all our expectations! We booked for a regular room but got upgraded to a FANTASTIC suite. We never wanted to leave the hotel! This is by far the BEST hotel we've both stayed at. The room was wonderful, service was impeccable, and the property itself was just beautiful! We'd both go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal resort for both family and kids”
Reviews.Author: Familytravels_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while expensive was outstanding. The grounds were beautiful as well as the spa and pool. I have a 10 year old, 7 year old and 4 year old and all loved the pool with its many slides and rope swing and grotto. It had it all. And it was an activity that my husband wanted to actually help out and take the kids on all the slides because he enjoyed it as well. There are nanny services, kids club, beach time. We didnt even feel we needed to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: fourfamilytravelers
Reviews.Content: Great upscale area of Maui. The hotel was very nice. We went to church at their little chapel on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY GRAND”
Reviews.Author: AFBrat64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly GRAND. The open-air setting, rooms, pools, grounds, gardens, etc, are all immaculately kept and are extremely BEAUTIFUL. The people who work there are very friendly and accomodating. The beach was pristine. The location was convenient to everything. The only negative we found was the cost of food in the different restaurants. We expected high prices in the lovely Humuhumunukunukuapua'a restaurant, but the other more informal eateries were VERY pricey (ex: $9 for a bagel)! Also, it would have been nice to have a refrigerator to use and a microwave. (The refrigerator was locked unless you wanted to use the bar inside.)

Reviews.Title: “A Nickel and Dime you resort”
Reviews.Author: itsaboutthejourney
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a very nice property and perhaps the hotel has the best hangout view from the adult pool to the ocean. It is very unfortunate that this resort continue to nickel and dime their customers. Try getting a large coffee in the b'fast take out and check out the price, it's obnoxious. Coffee is not expensive, sashimi is. I woudl not stay there again mainly because I felt they are always trying to squeeze you out of your last dollar. Probably can get more next door from the Marriot then the Wailea. They have a long way to go with customer service and not ripping people off right before their eyes. The public is not stupid and long term it will hurt this hotel. If you can afford it try the Four Seasons, if not, like us, check out the Marriot and work a deal with them. For me the only reason to stay at the Grand Wailea is if you have young children, otherwise, go to the Marriot ot if one can afford it the Four Season where the word "no" is not in their vocabulary.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: vabeachbum91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Grand Wailea 3 yrs ago when we got married in Kaanapali. We thought the resort was absolutely amazing and vowed to return for our 5 yr anniversary. We loved it so much we couldn't wait the 5 yrs and returned September 2009 for our 3rd anniversary. It was a bit of a let down. We stayed in the Napua Tower which we were upgraded to 3 yrs ago and loved it. The morning breakfast is very plentiful but the evening cocktails are a little sparse. Our room overlooked the chapel and rooftop area where nightly wedding receptions were held. I enjoyed watching and listening to their entertainment but it can get a bit loud. I believe there is a noise ordinance that doesn't allow music past 10pm which is nice. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. We opted to rent a refrigerator for $25 for the entire stay which was nice, but it is more of a freezer. Turned down to level 1 our drinks still froze as well as any food we kept in there. The rooms are large with a huge bathroom. I enjoyed several bubble baths in the soaking tub. We stayed for two weeks and the first week we felt as if we were the only ones at the resort the occupancy was extremely low yet we still did not get very personalized service. In fact, despite being out of our room from 8am it was still not cleaned at 2pm when we returned. Not a huge deal but a little inconvienent. We were there celebrating our anniversary which was told to the front desk at check in yet NO ONE ever said Happy Anniversary. No complimentary bottle of champagne. No fruit basket. Not even a coupon for a spa treatment or dinner. I was expecting more. The pools were great, the beach was awesome. Take advantage of the complimentary lounge chairs and umbrellas at the beach. the food at the pool area is very good (especially the tuna) but is pretty pricey. Molokini restaurant was closed due to low occupancy while we were there. The parking lot is a bit of a walk and the spaces are tight but we had no problem finding a space even when there was a convention the 2nd week of our stay. Kihei is a short drive from Wailea with lots of great cheap shops and restaurants. Be sure to check out Hilo Hatties and ABC for souveniers. Vietnamese cuisine (in Azele shopping center) & Maui Taco for cheap large tasty meals. All in all, Grand Wailea is great if you have never been here before it is well worth the experience, but if you want more personalized service i say go elsewhere. Note: while there, there was an article in Maui News that resort is planning a million dollar expansion project that will relocate the chapel and add more suites. If this goes through, i would strongly reconsider staying here. it can get very crowded already. I know I will not be returning if the expansion goes through, I'm already weary about returning and considering the Marriott or 4 Seasons for more personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: PowaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Last week my husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea in the Napua Tower for the second time this year. This trip like many others, we had the opportunity to stay next door at the Four Seasons but instead chose to stay at the Grand Wailea mostly because of the staff at the hotel, especially in the Napua Tower. The staff in the Napua tower provides such great attention to detail and service and the fact that they remember us from previous trips and call us by name makes us feel very special not to mention at home. Our vacation wouldn't be the same if we werenâ€™t at this hotel with our â€˜extended familyâ€™

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, but not too friendly and over-priced!"”
Reviews.Author: Manifest8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea Resort with our two year old daughter in September of 2009. The pools/waterslides and baby beach were the best I've ever seen and my daughter had an absolute blast. I felt that the staff could've been friendlier, our room could have been cleaner and the food prices were OUTRAGEOUS. Overall, we had a great time and the views and outdoor fun was spectacular. The onsite amenities were too spread out--and way too expensive. Certainly, 5 star luxury resorts are going to be spendy, but I hate to be nickel and dimed. My husband ordered a coca cola at the lounge with dinner, $4.50. She offered him a refill and on our bill she added another $4.50. Unbelievable. One other gripe I have is that the self parking lot was a mile from our room, at the very opposite end of the hotel, almost forcing you to pay for valet. If you have a lot of money, love to play on waterslides and in pools with your kids and enjoy a vacation that is fairly secluded from shopping....go to the Grand Wailea. I think next time I go to Hawaii, I'll stay in Kaanapali (we stayed there in 2004 on our honeymoon).....less expensive, more food options, walkable shops and activities and I'm sure I can find a hotel with comparable water features. It was still a good trip, but I'm broke.

Reviews.Title: “Great location "turtles"”
Reviews.Author: sunrich
Reviews.Content: Fantastic setting in a perfect location! beds where out of this world.. wouldn't fit in my suite case " I tried" room 1024,setting is unreal I felt like I was on our Honeymoon " married 17 years" ( this would be a great place to get married if you could afford the $$$ ,great staff and not one problem with anyone , beach ..spent 5 days 6-8 hours per day swimming and relaxing in the free lounge chairs/umbrellas and then rolling over and go for a swim in the amazing pool 100ft away " best of both worlds" if you like sea turtles swim out around the point on the right and go about 100 yrds along the rocks and head out another 100ft or so we saw 10-15 large turtles each visit, or rent kayak for $25 per hr.only down side was the food & beverage prices "unreal", mall down the street had several good value restaurants and don't miss the ABC store for all your beverage & food,water toys, sunscreen,film etc. at Costco prices! one other thing the self park is a long ways from the hotel pay the $20 per day and save yourself a lot of work and time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Hilton Honors Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: mascarahead
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 7-night stay at the Grand Wailea (supposedly a Hilton property, and therefore, subject to Hilton Honors amenities for qualified Diamond Members!) My fiance and I booked a leisure trip to Maui, and specifically inquired about Diamond Member privileges from both the Grand Wailea and Hilton Honors before booking our stay. We were assured there would be the usual complimentary light breakfast and happy hour drinks and hors' d'oeuvres in the Honors' Lounge from both parties. Imagine our surprise upon check-in when we were advised by a manager that no such amenity exists at this property. They may be owned by Hilton, but they don't treat Hilton's Diamond members as such. Now, we did not book this hotel for frees snacks, but we were cashing in almost 300,000 points, and had we been properly advised upon booking, we might have chosen the Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island, instead (which, by the way, is a fabulous property!) We were given a token coupon for a free bottle of champagne at one of the restaurants on property, instead. Frustratingly, even our call to Hilton's 800 number was not returned until one week later, as we sat in the airport for our return flight! Despite this awkward launch to our vacation, we still enjoyed the property. We are avid swimmers, and loved the beach and ocean the hotel faces. We ate off-property a lot in local spots to avoid the obvious "touristy" vibe, but we did dine one night at the restaurant on property : it starts with an "H", and is one of those names with about 17 letters, and far too difficult for a haole to pronounce! (: Rooms are clean, service in general is pretty good. Just don't expect Honors' privileges! Beautiful setting and location. But after this, I think we're switching to Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Wailea getaway”
Reviews.Author: leisure78
Reviews.Content: our stay was lovely - the amenities were wonderful and the restaurants very good. We stayed on a club floor that gave us access to the private breakfast lounge. The shopping is quite good for a hotel, if pricey. But the Shops at Wailea are down the road. The only thing that kept this from being excellent is that we couldn't arrange a late check out. With our flight leaving in the evening that would have been a good thing. We had to pack up and drive around with our suitcases in the trunk all day on the last day of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very large”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: I sponsored an investment conference here, so I worked extensively with hotel staff from many functional areas including reservations, accounting, sales, catering, so my opinion is from a corporate angle rather than leisure travel angle. As a hotel for leisure travelers, I would recommend this property. It has many wonderful resort amenities like a large swimming pool, beauitful beach, large and grand public areas, numerous restaurants, etc. As a business hotel, I found there to be too many inconsistencies of quality with some of the banquet food at various conference meals, errors in accounting, attention to client servicing, conference room floorplan requirements. I might come back here to vacation with the family but never again to hold a conference or business meetings. Keep in mind this hotel is large and sprawling so be prepared to get turned around at night while walking the grounds and expect a lot of walking. In all fairness, if you have children, they will think they've found heaven at the Grand Wailea. If it were just my wife and me, we will probably stay at the Four Seasons next door on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth.”
Reviews.Author: smjjc
Reviews.Content: I cried when I left. It was AMAZING. The best hotel & staff I have ever had the luxery of experiencing. I can not wait to go back. We stayed in a Presidential Suite with an ocean view for 7 days, and got married in a rainforest in Hana. Do yourself & your family a huge favor & stay here, in any room. Trust me, it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “We love Grand Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: krisyManila
Reviews.Content: Please pay extra for Napua Tower- well worth your money, the beds are fabulous-the bathroom is exceptional! The swimming pools and slides are wonderful! The people on the staff of Grand Wailea are all friendly and attentive!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time to Visit Maui!”
Reviews.Author: FlyDC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel to Hawaii every year. We always visit Kauai and one other island. This year it was Maui. We returned to the Grand Wailea - where we stayed 2 years ago. We really enjoyed our visit. We had a great rate and a great room. It was our 8th anniversary. The hotel upgraded us to a ocean view room and gave us a coupon for a free bottle of champagne. As a silver member of Hilton HHonors, I was given a $40 certificate for use in the restaurants. Very, very nice. The rooms are very nice. Seem up to date with anything you need. We had one issue - the toilet kept running. After several visits from their engineer - no luck - so we just jiggled the handle and dealt with it. Just like home. We were at the hotel over Labor Day weekend (checked out on Tuesday after Labor Day). What a great time for those of us without kids to visit HawaiI! The first few days, the adult pool was key to our enjoyment. Every once in awhile someone under 18 would venture over and within 15 minutes a very kind security officer escorted them to the other, more appropriate pool. (Thank you!) Very close to Kihei for great breakfast spots and grocery stores. We bought snacks and brought them and sodas to the pool versus paying the very, very high drink prices (over $10 for a drink at the pool?!?). The spa is amazing. The loofa scrub and baths before and after my massage was amazing. I did it two years ago and forgot how good it was. The prices for the spa were a bit high - but with the scrub and baths, totally worth it. Fitness center is great too. Classes for $10 is a great deal. Very clean gym. Staff was very friendly in the fitness center. Staff at the hotel were great. Everyone friendly. Everyone says hello in the hallways and smiles at you. Something so basic, but means alot! I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat. I was worried about it after reading other reviews and am very glad we had such a great experience. Probably was a good week to visit (hotel was at 50% occupancy....)! Maui continues to be very expensive ... 40 cents more for a gallon of gas than on Kauai.... but we really enjoyed ourselves.... We did the Haleakala bike ride (Haleakala Bike Company in Haiku - do not recommend using them...) which was ok. I would recommend only for a nice day (we had bad weather) and wouldn't recommend using Haleakala Bike Company (broken bike and they seemed to care less....) Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the price”
Reviews.Author: Midnight88
Reviews.Content: Based on the price we paid, I expected more. Plus they charge $25/room /day on top resort fee. I suppose this is supposed to cover use of pool/gym/towels/self parking. I'm just not used to that. Anyhow, the biggest disapointment was the bathroom. We were in 0055. Location of the room is quite good, close to the beach/pool, ice machine right around the corner, opens to a lanai & lush gardens. The bathroom however, was not clean. The grout was filthy & the shower seemed like it hadn't been scrubbed in ages. We didn't dare put our bare feet into the shower, we always wore slippers. We've stayed in older places that were cleaner. Dirty stuff around the toilet area and there were always these nasty gnats that hung around the toilet. Everyday I killed 3-5 of them. I suspect that they flew into the toilet area from the vent because they would magically appear even though we never opened any doors to the outside. We're not the complaining type so we kept the room, no big deal. The water in the pool seemed murky but i guess it's difficult to keep clean with so many kids going in & out of them. The location is spectacular. The wailea beach is beautiful & connects to the Four Seasons. We strolled over there one evening & it was so lovely. The property is smaller but much quieter and romantic. We'll probably try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MimiStans
Reviews.Content: :My husband, mother-in-law and I can not say enough nice things about this hotel. While there my father-in-law got very sick at 4:00 a.m. in the attached room. My mother-in-law came in and said she called 911. Soon the hotel security as well as the night manager came to the rooms to assist in any way they could. As soon as the paramedics arrived my father-in-law passed away. After the trip to the hospital and morgue the hotel staff stayed with us every step of the way. They allowed us to stay at hotel at no additional charge until his body could be released and we could return home. All of our immediate needs were met. The managers were on the phone with us every day offering any service we needed. Hotel staff from security to the maid in the hall (who was NOT our personal maid) offered their condolences. On the anniversary of Paws death in February we have been invited back by the Grand Wailea to stay on the house. We are going back and our adult children are going with us to celebrate Paws life. As my brother in law said, How else would you want to die, but at a luxury resort on a tropical island. We will always love the Grand Wailea and their employees for their hospitality. We love you Matt and Jaimie!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Gold Member Treated Right for Points Stay at Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: HonuGirl
Reviews.Content: Aloha, Just returned from 10 days on Maui. Our first 4 days were at the Grand Wailea points stay. I can't say enough nice things about our stay with respects to the service and attitude of the staff. My husband and I are in our 40's/50's. We are pretty low key folks with no kids. This trip was to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. We were treated as if it were our honeymoon. Upon check-in we were upgraded to an Oceanview Deluxe room which was lovely, however we preferred being in one of the smaller buildings near the beach and pools. No problem. Kyle at the front desk was fantastic and did not skip a beat even at 9:30pm (late night flight from LA) offering us several choices in the other building. Jason the bellman helped us change our room with a friendly smile and great attitude. The service and attitude by the staff was very good for our entire stay. We had drinks and appetizers in the bar at Humu. Justin was our server in the bar. Funny he was our server 2 years ago when we last stayed at the Grand with points. Excellent service. The ahi sashimi was super fresh and delicious but try the lobster roll $18. Lobster inside and assorted sashimi on top. Really amazing. On another night we went to the Humu dining room for dinner. We had the whole fish (hawaiian pink snapper) easily enough for 2 for $60 served with vegetables and rice. We had 2 glasses of wine and salads for around $120. Which was pretty reasonable for the dinner we enjoyed. Cafe Kula at the Grand is a fast food cafe where you can enjoy the ocean view patio or do take out. We had the kalbi ribs plate lunch which was great! Rice, Mac salad, stir fry vegies and green salad plus 6 of those carmelized ribs. I think it was about $14. A great deal. Beach boys: not rude, actually very nice. Every day they set up umbrellas and lounges for us. Adult Pool: great, heated and no problem finding chairs in the afternoon. We called to thank Kyle at the front desk the night before we left the resort. We had really appreciated his help getting the right room for our stay. He was very thankful that we called since most guests don't. We really enjoyed our stay and I can easily say it was due to the excellent service from the moment we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: sandybch
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to the GWR over the last 16 years few things have remained constant. That can be good and bad. But when it comes superior customer service, the Concierge at Napua Tower have been consistently exceptional. In particular, Jerry Fournier, the Napua Suite Liaison, has always helped us manage the vacation process before we arrive as well as coordinate plans during our stay. He's a go-to type of person that gets tasks done. Clearly it's a challenge keeping everyone happy simultaneously, but Jerry and his team just find a way to make it happen ! I do spend my fair share of time travelling for business, usually to Asia from the US's east coast multiple times a year. I am quite familiar with good service and few hotels in the US match up to their Asian counterparts. The Napua team is the closest I've seen to that type of service. For me to write something like this is rare indeed. But when someone like Jerry (and I'm sure there are more on the GWR staff) does his job everyday as an unsung hero of the resort, it merits special attention.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best! Best vacation I have ever had. Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Guysanddollsnewtoyou
Reviews.Content: First trip to Hawaii and what a gorgeous resort. We were welcomed with open arms and wonderful hospitality. We were upgraded to an incredible ocean view on the top floor and were presented with the biggest basket of fruit and snacks I have ever seen. The staff was absolutely wonderful in every way. The atmosphere was very romantic and the resort was cleaner than Mr. Cleans house. We loved our stay and look forward to coming back next year. Thanks to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service and Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: sarin70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for our wedding anniversary with our 2 children (ages 13 and 10). We were there for 8 days and stayed in the Napua Tower at the resort. First of all the service at the resort was exceptional from everybody we encountered. Kyle (Manager) upgraded us (Thank you Kyle) to the Napua tower as it was our 20th wedding anniversary and we read some reviews where we had concerns about the experience we would have. Kyle assured me we would not be disappointed. I have to honestly say that we found the Grand Wailea absolutely amazing in its service, cleanliness, open air architecture and beautiful location. I am very particular about service and found the staff incredibly competent and genuinely interested in making our stay wonderful. The Napua staff of Zenith, Dan, Jay and Judy were exceptionally professional and welcoming. The pool area is fantastic for anybody who has children or just wants to be a "kid" again themselves. Also, the adult pool is fantastic if you want to get away from it all. The only downside I could see is the pool area can be tight on chairs but security does remove towels from unoccupied chairs. Better yet, get a free lounge chair and umbrella set up on the beach right next to the pool. Enjoyed is so much that we already booked for next August. Great job folks - your service is an absolute differentiator.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not the place for a honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: ShellB09
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Grand Wailea was wonderful, I won't say it wasn't. We got great service from the moment we arrived, with a warm greeting at the door, a bellman who was helpful and enthusiastic, and maids who worked around our schedule and came in with a smile. We loved the pool with the water slides and had fun acting like kids again as we floated through the water slides and then like adults as we drank in the Grotto bar. However the hotel is FILLED with families. It's difficult to get a chaise lounge and there are screaming kids everywhere, pushing their way in front of you on every water slide. It was getting old fast. But then we discovered the secret to happiness at the Grand Wailea... the adult only Hibiscus pool. At the adult only pool we got waitress service and some peace and quiet. At the Hibiscus Pool it was easier, though still not easy to find a chaise lounge and we would walk down the steps to do a lap around the slides before returning to our peace and quiet. Our room at the Grand Wailea was BEAUTIFUL and our bathroom was amazing. I loved it. We had a gorgeous view of the ocean and the grounds of the hotel. The hotel has every amenity and some wonderful restaurants. We were particularly fond of Bistro Molokini and enjoyed having Cafe Kula at our disposal for easy meals. As for honeymoon amenities there wasn't much, but we did come home to a romantic evening of orchids all around our room and in our jacuzzi tub. I had one major complaint. There were ants in our room, they were really small, and I believe they were the result of our complimentary chocolate covered strawberries being left out, which the bellman was quick to report and before we new it they had collected the ant ridden dish and brought a brand new one with a cover, still the little ants were kicking around for the entire trip, though they were mainly delegated to the desk. They did have an exterminator coming on our last day. My only other complaint was that the hotel offers hospitality suites that we took advantage of since we were leaving at 9:30pm, but unfortunately we found the suite dirty, the shower wet and all the towels were used. It was gross thinking you would use a shower that you didn't know who was in it before you and it hadn't been cleaned. Luckily we didn't go to the pool that day, but if we had we would have been stuck using the shower. But at least they had a place we could get dressed, so its a minor complaint. Despite the ants and the hospitality suite... I would go back in a heartbeat when I have a family of my own, if I can afford to. if I was to rebook my honeymoon though, I might consider someplace a little less family oriented and a little more romantic. But my fiance loved it and I thought it was a great location, I can't complain and we had a lot of fun. I hear the spa is wonderful but we didn't have the time or money to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Where did all the kid's come from...”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveler5
Reviews.Content: Grand Wailea is the most beautiful hotel and we had been wanting to relax on our vacation...but the hotel is a huge water park with lot's of children running around - the rooms and grounds are deluxe and spendy - we would choose another property next time that is quite around the pool areas with not so many families. If you are wanting a quite and relaxing adult place to vacation in July you might consider another hotel without the water park we were dissapointed with the noise in the pool area - our visit to Maui was to relax and listen to the birds & ocean. If you are a young family with kid's this is a great hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “We never had to leave the resort”
Reviews.Author: AtlantatoMaui
Reviews.Content: Great location for the family and a hotel that offers all of the amenities. We never had to leave the resort. The staff, from check in to check out are very friendly and provide great service. Once you experience this hotel,you will return year after year. Please check it out, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, and I'm spoiled and picky!”
Reviews.Author: mommyloveshawaii
Reviews.Content: Let me start out with saying that I have been to many places in the Caribbean, stayed in 5 star hotels, and had very high expectations coming into this stay. I was nothing more than blown away with the amazing grounds, the great service, and the awesome beach. It takes a lot to actually "blow me away", but this was definitley achieved at this resort. When, we got there, they asked if we were on our honeymoon- sweet, but we weren't. We were there for our 5 year anniversary, so they automatically upgraded us to a bigger room on the concierge level, which included a free cocktail hour with a free breakfast every morning. AWESOME! Nothing is cheap in Hawaii, so FREE was unbelievable! The pools, although kid friendly, were awesome for my husband and me. They have an adults only pool which gets you away from the noise, but seriously, who doesn't want to be a kid still and go down those water slides??? Awesome! The beach in front of the Grand Wailea should not be taken for granted. There are many hotels in Maui that don't have that great of a beach front. This resort is the exception. Not only is there great snorkeling on down toward the Marriott, but the size of the beach directly in front of the beach was great for playing and laying out. Service? I don't know how you could complain. I guess if you are a princess and want someone to sit next to you every second of the day and be there at the drop of a hat, then you might have a case. Otherwise, fo us normal people, service was very efficient and very friendly. The Humuhumu restaurant on the resort was also very good. We went to the Four Seasons, The Fairmont, Mama's Fish House, and some other local places and this was our second favorite (behind Mama's...you gotta go there on your way home from Hana!) The room we stayed in was big, had a great view, and was exceptionally clean. I highly recommend renting a refrigerador for the week for only $20. Probably the cheapest thing we did! Unless other rooms in this resort are way different, I don't see how anyone could complain. All in all, this was the best trip of both me and my husband. We are already planning a return trip with our daughter this spring. We can't wait and would highly recommend this resort to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TCelectric
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful stay. The hotel was clean and the employees were very friendly, organized, and accomadating. The room was as comfortable as can be very big and spacious. We could not hear our neighbors. The scenery is beautiful. My son called it his new home and didn't want to go home. The pool is very relaxing and if you have kids there is a little like beach pool it is awesome not deep at all, it's like being at the beach. I would suggest everyone staying there I know we will agin. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Despite A Few Missteps”
Reviews.Author: costcoqueen
Reviews.Content: I felt that it was necessary to give back to my fellow travelers by writing this review since I have read and used the advise of trip advisor reviewers in order to plan my trip. I traveled with my husband and two children (1 and 5 years) for a long anticipated summer vacation. I chose the Grand b/c of the beach, pools and adult activities alike. This was my second trip. The first was about 8 years ago for a conference. I fell in love with the hotel back then. This time around I can honestly say that I still love the hotel, grounds, pools , beach and spa -but the food and room / furniture left much to be desired. After a 50 million dollar renovation, I could not explain why there was chipped furniture and peeling paint in our deluxe garden view lagoon wing room. Several handles fell off of our bedside table. New Carpet??? Hard to tell. There was also a slight musty smell in the room that I got used to after the first day. There did not appear to be an air conditioner vent in the bathroom and it felt quite warm in there most days. The room air conditioner was adequate though. The marbled bathroom very nice and spacious. The food: Overpriced for the quality. Skip lunch at the volcano bar and try the brick oven baked pizza at Bistro Molokini instead. Cafe Kula had a decent lunch menu with great onion rings and a plate lunch though the teriyaki chicken was overcooked. Because we were traveling with small children, I was too tired to go next door to the shops for lunch or dinner. The hubby and I hired a sitter and had dinner at Humu Humu it was ok. I had the lobster bisque and the surf and turf. The steak was right on but my lobster tasted grainy. The service was professional and attentive but inexperienced. We loved dinner however, at Cuatro in Kihei. A must try! We did not have breakfast so I cannot review this area. With the kids, we chose to feed them in the room. We were lucky enough to have a refrigerator and a microwave so this made it easy for us to heat up bottles and serve my son cereal. I even had reheated left overs one morning. The pool: What we expected and why we chose the hotel. My 5 year old loved the beach and the pool. We rented a casabella (2 shaded,padded lounge chairs and 2 regular sun-exposed loungers) for 150.00 per day for the entire week. This was truly the best investment we made during the entire trip. I can't imagine having to trek down to the pool at 7 am to reserve chairs as most of our fellow pool users did. The pool service was great. Shortly after checking into our casabella for the day we were given a fruit tray with banana bread and iced water which was replaced throughout the day. We were also given popsicles and frozen grapes throughout the day as well. My husband especially love the chilled towels!!! The pool side amenities were a nice touch but they came at a steep price. It is truly a shame to have to pay for shade. The pool is really laking in enough shady places to sit (bummer). The cost for the casabella was a little easier to swallow after my husband and I decided to pay for an elite membership $1500.00 (non-refundable) with 30% off best available rates for the rooms and 20% off food, beverages and spa/salon for future stays. In doing so, we were given a $500.00 resort credit which helped to off set our casabella rental costs. The pools and slides were a blast especially for a pool loving family. I felt like a kid again! For any future trips I will definitely reserve a casabella by the pool ($150) or facing the beach but near the pool ($75.00). In summary, we loved the pools and grounds. The staff were wonderful and very accommodating. I never once had to wait for our room to be cleaned. The housekeeping staff took very good care of us. I do not blame the hotel for charging the $25.00 resort fee because between bathing, the spa and the pool I must have used 15-20 towels per day! Not to mention the white sheets and duvet covers that were changed daily. By the way, the Terme baths are not to be missed. You can show up at 4 pm (last call) a reservation for the baths is not required and for $55.00, what is there not to like! Skip the massage. The baths were not at all crowded. I went to the spa on a rainy afternoon and left the husband and the kids napping in the room...total bliss for 2 hours! Although the Grand Wailea is not a 5 star hotel, it is pretty darn nice for an upscale resort. What I like best about the Grand is that there is something for everyone. The adult pool, gym and spa for mom and dad and the best resort pool anywhere that not only kids but parents can enjoy as well. We hope to return next year. PS - After the first day of valet parking we took advantage of the free self parking lot. The parking spaces were small and it was not ideal to have to walk to the parking lot through the loading and receiving dock. At times we could smell the stench of warm garbage...Yuk!! During our last trip, self parking was located in the current valet lot. We miss the old location and it was too bad our polynesian fantasy was disrupted every time we walked to the car.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: dkc9
Reviews.Content: Please forward to your General Manager. Thank you We just finished another wonderful trip to Grand Wailea. And though we did run into some room hiccups, we were eventually taken care of. Thank you. However, our reason for writing is to recognize some outstanding staff that continuously makes our visits extremely special. When we arrive, these individuals recognize us immediately and some even remember our names! I wish that I was able to grab all their names, but I for those that I donâ€™t, I am sure that you will be able to identify them: Management Assistant Manager â€“ I am not sure of her name, but Sarah had some problems during our check in. Your assistant manager was extremely understanding, gracious and took care of the problem quickly. Key Asset! â€“ but you probably knew that already! Napua Tower Ken (Concierge) â€“ Sarah would not know what to do, if it werenâ€™t for Ken who has taken care of all her concerns for our family. He is simply GREAT and one of reasons why we enjoyed our first visit so much and decided to return. Key Asset! Zenith (Bartender) â€“ where did you find her? I watched in amazement as she remembered guestâ€™s names after guests and their drinks as well! She remembered us just as we arrived! She is AWESOME! Key Asset! Cabana Services Nelson â€“ Sarah just loves his smile and tremendous disposition. He is great with the kids and extremely helpful for EVERYTHING! Key Asset! Pool KaryAnn (Activities) â€“ I am not sure when this girl sleeps?! She was one of the first to greet us as soon as she saw us at the pool. And the kids just love her (and Courtney is usually shy!). She IS one of the reasons why we keep coming back. She really works hard to take care of everyone wherever she is! One of your key assets! Larry (now at HumuHumu) â€“ what a great smile, and attitude. He is great with people and has one of those natural ways about him that you cannot help feel good when you see him. Gym I donâ€™t know her name, but extremely kind and friendly. Tall, with long brown hair and big brown eyes. Hands a towel to each guest when they arrive and helps to anyone that is lost or looks confused with the equipment. Bellmen We missed their names, but one of the men has been there since we started coming 7 years ago. He looks like a model and has a tremendous attitude to help anyone coming and going. He works outside and takes the bags just as we pull up. He took our Christmas pictures by the waterfall this year. The other bellman actually took care of our bags when we checked out. Tall, bald, and goatee â€“ like stone cold Steve Austin. (Ha! But much nicer!) Great relief and help since we wanted to get dinner before catching our evening flight and he took care of everything, bags stored, retrieved, taxi, loaded and go! Housekeeping I know that we never got to know them in person or by name, but they were terrific in taking care of the messes we left behind each day. And can I say extremely honest?! One morning in my haste, I left my money clip on the night table. I did not realize it until I returned to the room that afternoon and found it placed discreetly on the night stand under the notepad. The point is, during these difficult times, it would be easy to cut corners and not employ people like the ones above â€“ but you didnâ€™t and that is why we are so grateful to have been treated so well by your staff. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for relaxing family vacation”
Reviews.Author: binkelot
Reviews.Content: Pleasing to the senses. Delightful and engaging for the kids. This was our second trip and we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.....Needs a renovation and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: hawaii0709
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 4 nights and unfortunately this hotel is overpriced. Although the kids(ages 6,11, 13) loved the pool/slides/beach) it was crowded for a hotel that was not booked. We think the hotel was recruiting islanders to use the pool/beach for a daily rate and/or cruise ships. The hotel rooms were old and needed rennovation. When six out of the 8 handles on the bureau came off in both of the rooms...its time to get new furniture. Also, be prepared to spend a lot of money on food. On a positive note, the grounds/location are beautiful and the spa was excellent but I would look into the Fairmont, 4seasons or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to worth it”
Reviews.Author: Kate_rochester
Reviews.Content: We are checking out of the Grand Wailea today and we are really happy to be getting out of here. We've been in Maui for about ten days for our honeymoon and have been staying at a few places including the Ritz Carlton, the Hotel Hana and the Grand Wailea. The Grand Wailea has been a HUGE disappointment. The service is lackluster at best and the entire place is packed with people. There is nothing relaxing about being here- it has the feel of an overpacked cruise ship. The grounds were supposed to be luxurious but are actually pretty tacky. There are ads everywhere for everything from vow renewals to property ownership and the whole place is just a tourist trap nightmare. My husband and I booked a spa treatment at the spa hoping that it would be a nice retreat but it was just more overpriced tourist fodder. The hydrotherapy room was so packed with people that it just seemed gross to be jumping in and out of the pools- you couldn't get any room to yourself. The service at the spa was not good, the whole place is much more hype than reality. At the end of the day we spent over $800 on spa treatments today and if I had to do it over again I wouldn't have done it. Moral of the story- this place is not at all worth it. We had heard that from some of the reviews on TripAdvisor and didn't listen and we couldn't regret it more. We made the mistake of pre-paying for our room and we were so disappointed when we arrived that we tried to cancel and go somewhere else but due to prepaying didn't have the flexibility to do so. If we could have left the day we checked in we absolutely would have.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Sydneypearl100
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 10 days at the Grand Wailea. I would like to state first off that my expectations were low after having read some of these reviews. The Hotel - It is a truly beautiful setting and we were so pleased when we drove in past an amazing waterfall and lovely lobby. We were a little bit annoyed about the $20 per day resort charge, as it was mandatory and you couldn't opt out of what it was for so we didn't understand why it wasn't included in the room price. However, it is on the website so I suppose that is fair. I should state that the valet parking is $20 per day but they do offer free self parking. The room - Lovely, perfect. We were upgraded to a garden view room and it was spacious enough for my family of 2 adults and 2 grown children. Great big bathroom, perfectly air conditioned and lovely deck. We were only slightly taken aback by the $8.50 charge for water in the room! The pools - Fantastic. The children in our family were over 18 so we got to use the Hibiscus pool which is far quieter than the activity pool but in close proximity and so we could still use the slides etc. The slides are amazing for a hotel pool, and it was not too crowded when we were there. The poolside snacks are ok but very expensive for what they are ($8 for shaved ice). The restaurants - This is where the hotel really lets itself down we felt. They were expensive, and the food was ok but the service is dreadful and clumsy for the price. It feels a little like you are dining at a theme park. However, there are some great restaurants in the shopping center next door, so don't let this discourage you. The spa - Expensive and one member of staff was rude Was another example of the service not going over and above what they are required to do. The facial had was fine. Had manicure and pedicure with my daughter - cost almost $200! The concierge - useless. My husband and son wanted a beach that would have some waves, they had no idea. Overall I would say that go if you can afford it, we had a great time just using the pools and our room. However, be aware that the service is not amazing, so go elsewhere to eat. Longhi's is great - have the artichoke! I hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star setting 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: rsobati5
Reviews.Content: The location and design of the hotel is great, but the staff and service that is offered is definitely lacking. Although the hotel is expensive to start with, it is loaded with hidden fees. I understand that it should be expected to pay a lot for a little in Hawaii, but some of the fees were ridiculous. They don't tell you this, but it is $20 dollars a day to valet your car and they do not offer any other parking. There is a daily resort fee for pool use and you are charged if you use the gym. Also the management of the hotel is rude and unhelpful. We were booked to have a late checkout because we were flying a red eye out. They acknowledged that we booked this when we checked in, but on our last day they notified us that we had to leave by 1:00. We met with the manager, Jane Valdez, and we were met with hostility. She spoke down to us and had quite an attitude. We felt as if we were swept aside once we had paid our bill. Overall, the beautiful Hawaiian setting that the Grand Wailea has can be found elsewhere and with better service, especially for the price you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful escape to Maui”
Reviews.Author: wavelets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand from August 7- 14th. It is a beautiful hotel and we had a great room on the 8th floor of the Wailea wing. Overall, I can't say enough nice things about the resort. The rooms were lovely, the bathrooms huge and housekeeping did a superb job. One quirk was that they came to do turn down service around 6:30, usually while we were still preparing for dinner. We didn't spend much time at the pool because it was overrun with kids and families (the hotel said these were their busiest few weeks for families before school starts). We did spend an afternoon on the slides, lazy river and grotto bar. The adult pool looked much more serene, but we are beach people. The beach was nice and wide and the sand soft. No rocks or coral in the water. The only unfriendly staff we encountered at the resort were the beach boys, everyone else was very friendly and helpful. The restaurants were fine, a little pricey, but this is a resort! I think most of the complaints about this resort are a result of the rude guests and have nothing to do with the managment of the resort. I'll go back as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in the world has been improved and updated”
Reviews.Author: Desigal7
Reviews.Content: We were really preparing for disappointment after going each year for the last 9 years to this hotel. We felt that in the last visit, Hilton was clearly letting the quality slide. Were we surprised. Many renovations were made and additional little fun things were added to every aspect of the hotel from the pools, restaurants, rooms and the spa. More workers also seemed available to help and we really enjoyed it. The spa is a bargain compared to what you get. I would avoid the restaurants on site. Try Mulligans on the Blue across the street, Lulu's or Roy's or Wokstar in Kihei. Only disappointment was that the rate for the rooms has gone up about 50% in the last year. Instead of being empty during this recession, we found the hotel completely full and people spending money like it was going out of style. Great for the hotel but bad for us who would like to see the hotel room rates go down like all the other hotels have.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TravelOut808
Reviews.Content: This resort needs to revamp their restaurants and retrain their staff! The food at all the restaurants were mediocre at best. The service was slow and sloppy. The staff at the concierge were rude and unfriendly. I will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kunu99
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 11 days here in late July into August 2009. The rooms were clean and our view was spectacular. Pool-side service was frequent and friendly, but like most food & beverage service on Hawaii - $$$. I chose to post a comment because I experienced many "holier-than-thou"..."I've traveled all 7 continents" snobs expecting this resort was put on the planet solely for them. Surprise people - it's big and beautiful, but your still in the US on summer vacation with everyone else. If you want a bungalow on a private beach, sack up and go to Tahiti or Thailand. As a Seattle-native, this is a short flight to paradise. I traveled with an infant this trip and the Grand Wailea was more than accommodating - setting up a Pack-n-Play for us near the pool in the morning, bringing by free fruit for my baby to enjoy in the sun....all the things that helped my wife and I enjoy a pleasant and quiet vacation from the cold, cruel Seattle weather. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous, despite arguments and shouting between hotel guests. American summer travelers need to take a deep breathe and appreciate being on Maui.
