Please pause before shouting at cashiers because you didn't get enough foam on your double, mocha latte-thing before you begin your 5am work out, people. And, please refrain from boxing over moved towels near the pool - it's not the hotel, it's the guests causing these annoying disturbances. And, I marveled that pool-side bullies were managed quickly and respectfully.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: randyoneseattle
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was so poor that we checked out early and checked into the Four Seasons next door and wished we had done it earlier. From check in to check out the service was unbelievable. The pool side staff were rude, the restaurant staff was short and abrupt, the front desk was a mess, and the managers that I spoke to regarding the poor service were unsympathetic and did not resolve our problems promptly and to our satisfaction. We are very seasoned travelers and have been to most continents staying at four and five star hotels and we came to the conclusion that this hotel should be rated a two to three star hotel at best. The location was beautiful and the physical property, although aging, was nice. The overall service including the valet, bell, and all front desk contact was very very sub par. For a hotel that was $300+/night, you can do a lot better. If you want true luxury, go next door to the Four Seasons or two doors down to the Fairmont. If you decide to stay here you too will be writing a disappointing review as I am. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a circus - not for anyone who wants a nice relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: AZLUVS2TRVL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but I agree with other reviewers that it is overpriced. This is our fourth trip to the Hawaii Islands and this hotel is the most expensive - not so much the rooms but the food, drinks and other expenses. They tend to nickel and dime you whenever possible (i.e., approximately 60 free park-yourself spots and when that lot is full, you have to pay $20 and tip per night to valet). However, the food is very good and the pool area is amazing. We are also looking forward to surfing lessons that are available at the hotel (again, at an additional price). I would say that the biggest problem (and the reason we will not be returning) is the incredibly poorly behaved children, which is too bad because that is not the fault of the hotel. There is an adult pool area but other than that there is no peace and quiet in the hotel. I apologize to any parent that has well-behaved children and frequent this hotel; however, little girls running and screaming through the hallways, having a play car hitting me in the foot during cocktail hour, little boys sliding across the floor to get their toys from under tables, and a little girl scooting her chair all the way across the hall during lunch and stopping in front of us, is all unacceptable behavior at a nice hotel. Worst thing is, the parents barely notice or if they do, they just look up and smile (as if to say, isn't my child cute?). In fact I am sitting in the room right now and on the eighth floor I can hear children running down the hallway and yelling to their parents to let them in the room and another child is yelling out on the balcony. Complete circus!

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Spa were great, but not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsmom55
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 heavenly days at the Wailea Beach Villas before heading to the Grand Wailea for 2 nights. We tried to check-in at noon, but no rooms were available until 4:30. (Amazing, since the hotels are not full!) Right away the difference in level of service and friendliness was apparent between the two places. Once we were able to move into our room, it was very warm as most hotel rooms can be at the beginning. We turned the A/C down, waited 3 hours and called maintenance to fix (when it was apparent that it wasn't working properly) while we were at dinner. When we arrived back at the hotel, it was still warm and we had to call again. Also, the cable had been out for the entire day (which we didn't need until the evening) Maintenance indicated that they have a conservation mode that makes the A/C not work when there is no movement in the room, which he overrode. Also, there is no A/C in the bathrooms, so it was extremely warm for our entire stay. We finally had to have housekeeping bring fans to our room as management indicated that they had no rooms to move us to. (Some level of service!) Our room never did get cool enough for us even though we had NO issues at the Wailea Beach Villas. Management never checked back with us to see if everything had been resolved. Lack of caring is a theme I had read about this hotel before I booked, but I guess we thought we'd be the exception. Rooms - They may say they are updated, but we travel extensively, and we were not impressed. Decor may be updated, but the beds were so soft and worn that we highly doubt they were upgraded. While the room was our biggest disappointment, we are happy we didn't have to spend tons of time in the room, but for the price, we expected more. Pools - These were the reason we chose the Grand Wailea and they didn't disappoint. My kids, age 12 and 13, enjoyed them, but as we thought, two days of the craziness of the Disney scene was enough for them as well. Lines for the largest slide were long, so I can't imagine what they would be like if the hotel was completely packed. Spa - I enjoyed a wonderful massage that included an hour of various bath treatments and scrub that made my experience the most enjoyable of the time at this hotel. Kuddo's to those who work in the spa. Only downside, once again, was the lack of enough A/C when trying to get ready to head to the airport after my appointment. Would we stay here again when visiting Maui? Probably not. We should have listened to our instincts and stayed longer at the condo or booked the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “It's always fun to stay at the Grand Wailea if you are a kid at heart...”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Grand Wailea. Although I stay at different hotels in Maui at different times, I've been coming for perhaps nine years now, as I am a member of the Grand Wailea Club, which offers a 50% discount from the "rack rates." It used to be more a deal, but with discounted hotel offers these days it's not as big as an incentive, especially as I've got $2500 "on loan" to the hotel for the benefit (which I get back when I want to end this "priviige"). What the Grand Wailea offers that no other hotel on Maui has (as far as I know) is the fantastic pool and water slides, with a magnificent and wide swatch of prime oceanfront with a white sandy beach. Whether you are five years old or you are sixty years old (and still a kid at heart), it's absolutely a blast to ride the slides, float, or swim. And if you like kids (and you should if you stay at the Grand Wailea), it's great to see kids having so much fun. Most kids never seem off to take off their daily pool band that is issued daily, with ever changing colors. It's not uncommon to see some kids with perhaps up to a dozen colored wristbands which they wear until they get back home! And if you are an adult, there is always the adults only swimming pool, for a more peaceful trip to the pool. The kids pool and water slide area can be extremely crowded, so you have to be prepared for that. We like the lunch grill here, and the Cheeseburgers and sandwiches are excellent. As for food in the rest of the hotel, we love the Huma Huma restaurant, and the breakfast buffet is outstanding. Service at the hotel is fine, not exceptional, but if you really want great service in a perfect hotel environment, then check in next door at the Four Seasons, as they have mastered service in a way that the Grand Wailea has not and they truly make you feel like an honored guest. Staying at the Grand Wailea is a bit more akin to being a guest at Disneyland as you really are at a hotel that doubles as a theme park. As for prices, the Grand Wailea charges premium prices for most everything....there are no great bargains to be found here ($4.50 for a glass of fruit punch at the poolside burger shack!) but....they have certainly mastered the art of building a hotel with a fantastic pool/water park area. And the sunset views are typically astounding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Will Come Back Again & Again!”
Reviews.Author: GBL123
Reviews.Content: I have a 6 year old boy & a 9 year old girl and have not taken a big family trip in a long while. This was our best family trip ever! The resort had everything we needed. In fact, we ventured off the property for only a couple times the whole time we were there. The kids must have spent 9 hours a day on those water slides... Many of the hotels in Wailea are not so easy to navigate from pool to beach and back. The Grand Wailea has this wonderful convenience factor. The beach is amazing! The pools are incredible and many to choose from. I spent many hours sitting underneath a cabana in major relaxation mode while the kids swam their hearts out. Nothing is more amazing than listening to island music on my IPOD, and watching the incredible views from my lounge chair. The staff was incredible. From the pool side servers to room service to the brilliant knowledge of the concierge staff, the people working there made our stay one of the most enjoyable experiences and we can't wait to come back :). As much as I tried to get away from work, the free WI-FI made it tough :) I don't think I have seen many hotels ever offer free Internet. That is amazing. The Fitness center is state of the art! I love working out while I am away and the equipment was all fairly new ( TV Screens at every Cardio center) and the 2 story gym is well kept! All in all, this was truly a memorable experience and I would recommend to anyone. One thing that amazed me was the fact that this was build in the early 90's. If you go there for the first time you would think it was brand new! That is how well kept this property is! Can't wait to come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: 3DTurkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a business conference but had a lot of time for personal fun. The Good: The facility is beautiful and the beach is beautiful. Everything is well kept and very nice. Room service did a great job every day. We didn't have kids with us so we spent a decent amount of time at the adult pool area. It's a nice pool with a big lawn you can hang out. We really enjoyed the peace and quiet. The beach is open to the public but not too many people outside the resort go there. You can swim in the water and the current is not bad at all. The staff seemed nice and we had good service from just about everyone. Valet parking for the day is free but you pay a lot to stay overnight. The Bad: As with everything in Hawaii the food and beverages at the hotel are very expensive. We bought a styrofoam cooler and some beer and wine at the Wal Mart and kept this in our room. We still ate and drank at the hotel but having our little cooler was a nice break from $10+ drinks. Overnight valet parking is very expensive so we parked in the free lot on the other side of the resort. It's first come first serve and fills up at night so get there early if you want a spot. There are some rooms that are newly renovated and others that are not. We were originally put in a newly renovated room but it had two beds. When they moved us to a room with one bed it was the older room. Bummer. It was nice but not as nice as the other. We didn't pay for our room (paid for by corporate) but when I compared the cost of this hotel vs. other comparable hotels it seemed a little pricey for what you get. I think this is because of the sweet beach location. We would consider returning in spite of this. Especially if we bring kids. The best part of our trip was renting a Harley for the day and cruising the island. Definitely one of the most memorable times of my life. Sorry if my review wasn't very thorough but we spent a lot of time either playing offsite or at organized social functions revolved around business. The functions were great and a lot of fun but it didn't give us a lot of time to really get a feel for everything at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest all around, luxury family hotel destination in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: LuxFamTrvlr
Reviews.Content: This was our first "real" family vacation with our 3 year old son and the hotel made it wonderful. My wife and I are accustomed to staying at premier hotel properties, and this one was compairable in its amenities, cleanliness, and services offered. At the same time, it was completely family friendly. Our son (and his parents) enjoyed the pool complex. There is nothing in Hawaii that rivals the Grand Wailea's pools and beach. After our wonderful stay, we've vowed to return to the Grand Wailea every year for a family vacation. It truly is an easy place to stay with kids and offers extacly what families need. This hotel is as good as it gets without being an "all inclusive" resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: trvlLV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indisuptably gorgeous! I have to give the hotel a 3 because, while gorgeous and amazing, it was definitely overpriced. Everything costs extra and it's just not worth the money. We saved for this trip and for what we paid for our room, we should have been treated like royalty and received the most incredible experience. We were treated just as though we were at any other hotel and almost everything was an additional cost. That was very disappointing. The decor is beautiful, the grounds are beautiful, and the beach is fabulous. Our room was a bit small and needed some work, but we couldn't complain with the gorgeous view of the chapel and ocean. It was lovely to leave the balcony door open and hear the tide come in as we slept. We weren't impressed with the service we received, particularly upon check-in. We arrived slightly before standard check-in time and were told we had to wait. No problem...howevever when it was a half hour past THEIR check-in time, we were getting frustrated. We received no apology and were surprised to be treated like we were an annoyance. The pools are AMAZING!!! They are gorgeous. The slide was really fun and we just loved the hot tub behind the waterfall. The swim-up bar was great fun as well. We loved swimming up, sitting on a stool in the water and ordering a cocktail. As others have stated, we did have difficulty finding chairs by the pool. Again, with what we paid, this shouldn't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gardenia06georgia
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Grand Wailea ten years ago and had a wonderful time. In planning a trip back this year to celebrate our anniversary, we read reviews from Trip Advisor. We were concerned about some of the comments made in these reviews. We called the hotel and asked to speak to a manager. He was not available so we left a message. Our call was returned in under an hour. He listened to our concerns and assured us that we would have a wonderful experience at the Grand Wailea. Based on his assurances, we booked our hotel rooms for 5 nights. . When we arrived in Maui, we were warmly greeted by the bell staff and quickly brought to the front desk. We were told that our room had been upgraded and we were wished a very Happy Anniversary. We were absolutely amazed with our upgraded room. We had an incredible view of the Chapel, ocean,and mountains.. Everything in our room was luxurious. Housekeeping did an exceptional job each day. The bathrooms are very large and well-equipped. The hotel grounds are absolutely beautiful. We had read some comments that people had difficulty finding chairs at the pool. During our entire stay, we never found that to be true. We had the choice to sit around the pool, on the lawn area behind the pool, or on the beach. The adult only pool was quiet and very relaxing. We celebrated our anniversary with an outstanding dinner at Humuhumu. Our table overlooked the beach area and we watched the breathtaking sunset. The conceirge gave us a coupon for a bottle of champagne. We felt very pampered! The spa experience was amazing. The staff is very well trained, attentive to every detail, and totally comitted to making your spa services exceptional. We used the fitness center every day and found it to be one of the very best equipped of any hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel for adults and families with children. We'll definitely return to this beautiful spot. .

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in hawaii”
Reviews.Author: thebazers
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying here and imagine my surprise to discover how incredibly poor the hotel is in every respect. Customer service is laughable. The employees must hate their jobs here. They are rude and arrogant and unwilling to help. The smallest request is met with rudeness, arrogance and indifference. The hotel was probably great in its day, but now is old , dated and a run down. The rooms are stale, lifeless and musty. The hotel will nickel and dime you to death, their motto is soak the tourist. The wedding and catering department are mean and impossible to reach. Don't get married here!!!!! We did, and are very sorry we chose this hotle for our wedding. Avoid, avoid avoid. Go to a great hotel like the Four Seasons or Hale Kelani instead. Avoid getting robbed and having a disappointing vacation or wedding. This place needs to start providing a great experience again and quit resting on it's laurels and relying on the Waldorf-Astoria name.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully uncrowded”
Reviews.Author: hd91364
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find that this large resort was, thankfully, uncrowded. It is probably not as pleasant in the height of the season, when it is full. Hotel staff and service was very good, with the exception of Humuhumu restaurant, which I have reviewed separately, and won't launch into a diatribe about here. Our deluxe, ocean view room was comfortable and airy, with a decent sized balcony and lovely view, and a better than average bathroom (room 8033). We had mentioned it was our honeymoon, and each time we returned to our room, there was a sweet little notecard and sentiment, orchids on the bed, towel sculptures and other thoughtful little niceties. The grounds are beautifully manicured, and we really enjoyed the quieter, adult only, hibiscus pool. Although you have to try out the world's only water elevator in the children's pool area. By anyone's standards, $300 per day for a cabana is excessive. The $75 per day casabellas overlooking the beach, but near enough the pools, are a much better deal. We'll stay here again, but we'll find other places to dine. Also valet parking is $20 per day. Otherwise, it's a bit of a trek to free, self-parking. By the way, there is some amazing art work around the hotel. Check out the amazing Botero sculptures. In a world where we are not all a size 6 and anorexic, they are refreshingly honest and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the previous reviewers are talking about ? Place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLuvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea, and I will list the very good, the bad ( not much) and everything in between. From the moment you walk in, the hotel itself will blow you away with how breathtaking it is. We visited the Four Seasons, and the white hotel next door to the Four Seasons ( cant think of the name ) , and trust me, although the Four Seasons is nothing to sneeze at, its not nearly as dramatic, and open and large as the Grand W. Remember the movie phrase, " You had me at hello"? That's kind of how you feel when you walk through the large lobby of the GW. Regarding our room , we had an ocean view room on the 8th floor, which was ready for us, with a warm bath, with flowers floating on top.. A nice honeymoon touch that we didn't expect - On a one to ten rating regarding the room being perfectly clean, I would give it an 8. A large hand print over the headboard that you could see in certain day light knocked down the rating. The bed was comfy, had a flat screen TV, and the bathroom was large with a tub and shower. The balcony was pretty big too which had a large table , two chairs and enough room where you can stow your suitcases. The pool situation at the GW is crazy -insane- nice. ( And probably 3 times larger than the FS hotel. They have an adult pool and a kiddie area with water slides. The overall grounds at the GW are very well maintained. Spend the time yourself and look online at the pictures so you make an informed decision. You'll see what I mean. The gym at the GW is two levels overall and rates pretty highly among hotels. I generally stay at 4 star hotels and this is one of the best I have come across. They have very top notch new equipment with a decent amount of free weights too. Don't be surprised to run into a few celebrities. We did. They offer yoga classes on the beach, boot camp, spin you name it. The SPA itself is huge and my wife and I did a couples massage. Personally I'm not that big of a spa person but it's as nice as I've seen, and of course the price tag comes along with that. They have like 5 different types of bath tubs to soak in Japanese style, hot tubs, 2 steam rooms, and like most places every treatment you can possibly imagine. Heads up look for a pretty decent discount coupon on your inboard flight magazine. Unfortunately we found it on the way home. A few things that I thought could be better. The restaurants closed mostly at 9pm. The main bar closed at 11ish. Overall if this place had any downside, the dining experiences we enjoyed the most were located off property. The best the GW has to offer is the Humuhumunukunukuapua'a. I wouldn't say any of their restaurants are terrible but for the money certainly not stellar. The place to be dining wise, is outside under that stars at Ferrars( Four Seasons), Tommy Bahamas, two minutes away at the shops at GW and of course an old favorite Ruth Chris. All not cheap but all very very good. We didn't get to try Spago's but heard great things there too. For the area that the GW is situated, being young and wanting to party a bit, the downfall is pretty much the entire town closes early. Certainly the bars at the GW do. Mulligan's a bar around 3 miles away located at a golf course ( go figure ) is open the latest and seems to have a local theme. We also suggest hitting the local Kmart or Walmart, twenty minute drive and loading up on a cheap cooler and beer and some snacks. This will save some money because the drinks are $$$$$. Other misc. info. Room service food is consistent with what I said about the restaurants. Make sure to put the do not disturb sign on your door. They are very consistent on knocking on your door to clean your room. Wi-Fi is not available in your hotel room but it's free in the lobby and the Napua towers lobby. This could certainly be improved. It is 2009? The beach is large and nice, and chairs and umbrella's are free. Also they don't allow you to swim in the hot tub or pool very late. Security guards get notified by cameras if you try. We did several times. So like anything else in Maui, this place is very expensive, very romantic, and my opinion VERY worth it if you can afford it. OOPS I almost forget. The staff that we came across were great. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming Experience...Overwhelming Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: M2Maui4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had our wedding at the Grand Wailea. The wedding itself, was spectacular, good job Wailea! However, we were there for two weeks and aside from our wedding day, we were underwhelmed, in particular, with the service. We had so many logistical problems and the hotel was not quick to resolve them. Upon check-out, for the first time in my life, and I've traveled all over the world, we had the manager of the hotel, roll her eyes at us and stomp out because we brought a hotel problem to her attention! Could you imagine the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton ever doing such a thing? As beautiful as the hotel was, we were very disappointed with the service, the employee attitudes and the lack of wanting to make our experience better. We put in a call to the General Manager, and after spending thousands of dollars at the Grand Wailea on our event, we never even got an return phone call, let alone an apology. Our conclusion...next time we're staying at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “lovely gardens and pool but outdated exterior, terrible level of service, needs an upgrade! stay at the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: sdchargersgirl
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was to attend our best friendâ€™s wedding. We arrived eagerly at the Grand Wailea after a long flight from CA and after hearing such great things about the hotel, we couldn't wait to get there. Upon our arrival, my immediate impression was that it looked really outdated, peach/pink accents that reminded me of the late 80's/early 90's. We waited in line to check in and the staff at the front desk were quite rude. The hotel was only about 50% occupied. It was 4:00pm by the time we checked in however our room wasn't ready, so we were put in another room supposedly with a better view. The hotel is quite large and there are several elevators that take you only to the pool/spa area and others that take you only to your room. We were not given any direction as to where are room was located and how to get there. We got lost and walked around for quite some time before we found it - it felt like we were at the embassy suites to be honest. Once we arrived at our room, immediately I could smell mold. The room was small, dark and the bathroom didnâ€™t have a single place to put your toiletries not even a drawer or a cabinet. We were starving and asked where the restaurant was located, we were told to go down to the second floor, but not told that there restaurants were not open yet, this information would have been very helpful. Once we figured that out after walking forever to find that it was closed, we asked a staff member where we could get some food. We were directed to one of the pool bars. we found it, sat down, ordered and then were told that it was closing in 10 minutes!!! it was 4:50pm! By this time I was getting a little annoyed and asked to speak with a manager. She was nice and upgraded us to a nicer room located in the napui tower (this is where you want to stay). This was part of the remodeled section others are referring to. The room was bigger, brighter and nicer. the bathroom was bigger as well. The complimentary breakfast buffet was quite nice. They also serve complimentary drinks at 5pm, which was nice, but the drinks are very mediocre, albeit free. If they would not have upgraded us to the napui tower, I would have been out of there!!! We stayed 4 nights. the level of service at the hotel is laughable although not funny when you are paying $500 bucks per night. We ate at the restaurant humuhumu (shortened) 2 times. The first time was part of a wedding reception we attended, the food was quite good. The second time we at there we were initially told that we (my husband and I) couldn't get a table, I insisted that we get one. They called back and said they could squeeze us in. Once we got there, there was hardly anyone there!! not even 50% full. ridiculous. Everything was a hassle at this hotel! We had dinner at the Four Seasons down the road at Spago. It was quite a contrast in terms of service, we were treated as guests although we only at dinner there. If I had to do it again, I would stay at the Four Seasons. It was packed with a lot of energy unlike the Grand Wailea, which was like a ghost town. One of the bartenders at the Grand Wailea said that because occupancy has been low, they have been closing down the pool bar early and opening the restaurants later. The only employee of the hotel who was polite was the Manager we spoke with. On the upside, the pools alone were amazing especially the kids pool - there is nothing like it that I have seen before. WE have 2 young kids (under 5) and they would have loved the pool - but were not traveling with us for this trip. They also had a nice pool for adults only which was nice. The service at the pool....TERRIBLE!!!! Good luck finding a drink or something to eat! Even after renting out cabanas the service was STILL bad. the chapel is quite lovely and a great place to take pictures. the humu humu restaurant is really nice and tranquil if you can get a reservation.....Our friends very small wedding was quite beautiful. The outside grounds of the hotel are really quite beautiful. It's very sad to see a hotel that has an amazing potential and such a great history, go downhill so quickly. It desperately needs an upgrade and they need a big time service overhaul as well, otherwise, they should not be positioning and pricing themselves as a 5 star hotel. My recommendation â€“ go stay at the Four Seasons next door and make a reservation to eat at Humu Humu at the Grand Wailea during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I would stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: scottjh
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui on an incentive trip at the GW. The rooms are very nice and the service from house keeping outstanding. Views from various places in the hotel are very dramatic. On the neg side, high cost of extras like cabanas, umbrellas, drinks,etc. Some highlights- Dinners at Ferrara's and Spago next door at the four seasons The walking path along the beach The Art Galleries at the Shops at Wailiea For the money, I would choose the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Honeymoon Trip A Winner”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Wailea for our honeymoon this past week. Staff personnel were friendly, polite and very helpful in answering questions and communicating potential Maui destinations to visit. Resort room had more than enough living space and overall hotel grounds/accomodations were first class. We strongly suggest this hotel to anyone heading to Maui and plan on staying there again during future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_lover
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a great resort for couples, families, and kids. My initial impression of the Grand Wailea was that is definitely is grand. The open air lobby made you feel relaxed immediately. The check-in was pretty efficient and friendly. We ended up with a corner room-- with an extra huge double shower and a huge bathtub. It was definitely a spacious room with a large balcony. Everything was well maintained, housekeeping were fantastic. The view was spectacular, directly in front of us, we could see Molokini. We even saw a few whales from our balcony in the mornings. The food was probably just average for resort food. My hubby and I know Maui pretty well, so we often ventured off the hotel for better food. The spa was grand as well- with the many different types of soaking tubs, jacuzzis, and showers... I was disappointed that they only allowed you to use those amenities an hour prior to your service. And, the spa was slightly disorganized. There was no one to give me a tour of the facilities-- and I was unaware that there was a scrub included in the service- in which you had to tip the attendant separately. Although it was just my husband and I, the most memorable part of the hotel for the both of us were the amazing pools, slides, and water features... I think kids and those that are just kids at heart would love their pools & slides. I love that the Wailea beach is so easily accessible from the hotel-- and it was really easy to grab a chair to just sit and read peacefully at the beach. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - Best place in Maui to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: RSC518
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Grand Wailea for our week-long vacation in Maui. We both work in the industry, and have high expectations. Grad Wailea blew us away! It was by far the best hotel on the island. The open-air lobby, friendly staff, and amazing views from the room, along with the most fun pool (all the pools are connected by water slides) and beach made our stay extremely memorable and fun. It's about 30 mintes from the airport - if you are renting a car, we STRONGLY recommend bringing a GPS to get around - it was incredibly useful to us. The room was spacious (we had a suite on the eighth floor) with three balconies. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom amenities - Honey Mango - are the best we've had!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Art Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: sdworman
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is now a Hilton Property. This amazing resort is one of the most beautiful in the world. The art collection in the hotel is probably the greatest of any hotel. Huge Botero sculptures fill the lobby area. Their beach is one of the most beautiful on the islands. And they have winding pools with waterslides, swim up bar, rope swing, and a multi million dollar water elevator. The rooms have just been completely refurbished. The hotel is next to the Four Seasons. They share the beach, but you won't find this beauty and art over there. It really is heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: 24SeaIsle
Reviews.Content: We went to relax and found ourselves in the perfect spot. The staff was amazing, attentive and always gracious. The room was spacious with every amenity. The grounds were beautiful and perfectly maintained. The Aloha spirit is alive and well at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: klmrobinson
Reviews.Content: We just got back from The GW and it was fantastic. I was a bit worried about all the negative reviews here but I did not experience anything like what people are describing. The first day we were up at the crack of dawn (with the 6 hour time difference it was not hard) and went down to the pool to â€˜reserve our spotâ€™ to find no one around at 7am, all chairs were freeâ€¦went back at 8 and still only about Â½ a dozen chars were reserved. People started showing up around 9 and the slides opened at 10 when people finally started to show up. Needless to say I never when down early again and we never had a problem finding chairs any of the 7 days we were there. Heck the worst lounge chair at the GW is still a thousand times better than the chair in my office, LOL. At the beach they will set-up seats where ever you want so no rush at all for beach days, just go to the kiosk. Pricing for food on the resort was exactly as posted on their website, so there were no surprises there at all. I found food on Maui was generally high compared to the rest of the US and â€˜resortâ€™ pricing is always higher than off property (same as any resort I have stayed around the world). We ate off property a half the time and off property restaurants were relatively expensive as well compared to the mainland so I never expect pricing at the resort to be less than the restaurants off property. Is it McDonaldsâ€¦no, itâ€™s a resort on Maui, with resort pricing. You can save money by stopping at Safeway/Walmart/etc. and stocking up on snacks and beverages and getting a fridge and microwave in the room (microwaves are limited supply so reserve one well in advance, and yes there is a nominal fee for using fridges and microwaves). The resort grounds are beautiful, service was fantastic, food was good, pools were great and the beach was even better than I imagined. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and crowded”
Reviews.Author: Carmen292
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is quite nice, which, for the money you have to pay, is expected. Our two girls (ages 6 and 8) loved the pool complex, with its seven water-slides and the water elevator. That was the main draw. The issues we had were that, first, the pool area is very over-crowded. To get a place by the pool, you MUST be at the pool by at least 7:30am, or even earlier. If you want a chair in the shade by the pool, you MUST be in line by 7am or earlier. Sound relaxing? Not once you witness two or three fights over pool chairs. This happens because security comes and takes away towels from the pool chairs if they are not used within the hour. The poor unsuspecting person then taking the chair is accosted by the returning guest, who thinks the person sitting in the chair has stolen it from them. This happened repeatedly on our visit. Very unpleasant. Another issue is the size of the resort. We were in a nice room relatively close to the pool in comparison to the other rooms. But that's still a 10 minute walk, requiring the use of two different elevators. On the whole, we could have saved lots of money, been closer to the pool, had a more relaxing time with no crowding, at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai, which we visited the year before. It's much better than the Grand Wailea in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea, We'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: DiVe_FaMiLy4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea from 5/1/08 to 5/8/09 and had a great time in a great resort. We are a family of 4 with Mom, Dad, a 3 year old daughter, and a 2 year old son. The resort proved to be perfect for our family needs and in my opinion, to the needs of any traveler regardless of travelling companions and purpose. We chose the Grand Wailea due to its location, its many up-scale amenities and their pool system, (which is fun for kids of all ages). We wanted to spoil ourselves a little after our last trip, (see my Trip Advisor review for Breezes Curacao) and this resort seemed to fill the niche. The Grand Wailea is a resort in the 4 star plus category and lives up to its billing. The entry and grounds are impressive and well kept. Check in is smooth and quick (after a fresh flower lei greeting and a cool-refreshing glass of fresh pineapple juice), which is a blessing after a long flight (meaning the check in and the cold pineapple juice both). It also has beautiful interior architecture and impressive attention to detail in the dÃ©cor. Luxurious marble abounds. The only problem I could see with the resort property itself is that the exterior looked a little â€œdatedâ€� during daylight hours only. Not architecturally, just color wise. It looked as though it was a faded or light pink version of that pink you see in the art deco areas of Miami. Perhaps a different color swatch (the white you see in the buildings of Mykonos would look great Grand Wailea) â€œmeaning a fresh coat of paintâ€� could cure that and look great with the interior theme/dÃ©cor but otherwise, an all around first rate resort and definitely not a deal breaker. We stayed in the Napua tower section and had an â€œocean view king roomâ€�. The ocean view was very impressive with Molokini crater and the island of Kahoolawe in the background. The room was clean, and the Berber carpets, linens and toiletries were first rate. The bathroom is large with a huge whirlpool tub, separate shower, separate toilet and impressive marble/tile work. Ample hot water was never a problem (regardless of what time of day), and thatâ€™s always a personal pet peeve with me at most resorts. They are also not â€œtowel stingyâ€� which gives it another â€œAâ€� in my book. The staff is super friendly and helpful. In fact, we had a situation in the middle of the night regarding our 2 year old and bedding, (use your imagination). They swept in immediately to resolve the problem with a smile on their face. A real trooper and a veteran he was. It was late, so I didnâ€™t catch his name, but what a help. The only problem we had with the staff and this was only an â€œintermittent problemâ€�, is that sometimes they could be a little slow to respond even for â€œisland timeâ€�. With that said, we were there at the peak of slow season and at the peak of slow season, I suspect they have fewer staff on hand. I know if I was a proactive manager, I would be working a skeleton crew during slow season in this economy in the spirit of efficiency and maximizing resources to make my P&L as tight as possible. Job security, you know. Anyway, there is a trade off. In slow season you get an un-crowded resort, fast/easy lines on the water features, and less crowded beach and restaurants. You still get the same friendly and personal service from the staff, it just may take a few minutes longer than normal if they are wrapping up tending to someone elseâ€™s needs. It is a very minimal complaint, and I would return this time of year because I would prefer the service we got, with the resort being less crowded versus consistently faster service and more crowds. I could envision problems getting a good spot at the pool or beach, (unless you got up really early) during peak season, so this trade off was fine and acceptable. The resort itself is large and impressive. Itâ€™s got beautiful gardens with walking paths and koi ponds along the way. The water features are impressive and resembles a small water park. For the non kid crowd, they have a large adult pool with itâ€™s own bar to service your needs. While the resort is large, it is well planned out as it doesnâ€™t take long to get to any one spot on the property that you wish to get to, (itâ€™s all about the angles and logistical placement of paths, stairs and elevators). Additionally, things are spaced out just enough and floor planned well enough, that whether you are looking for romantic get away, having a wedding, on a honeymoon, an older traveler looking for some R&R, or a family with 10 screaming kids; nobody is on top of each other. The older R&R traveler will not be affected by the family with 10 screaming kids. Conversely, the parents of the 10 screaming kids wonâ€™t feel guilty about encroaching on someone elseâ€™s good time. I donâ€™t know how they did it, but they did, and you canâ€™t even hear through the walls. Nice. They have excellent shops on site with premium brand names and plenty of restaurants and food to satisfy the pallet. We did find the resort food to be very pricey which was expected, but we only spent 1 full day on the resort and a few half days here and there due to getting out for activities. With that said, the resort has enough amenities with the waterslides, water elevator, hot tubs, rope swings, spa and restaurants that you can have a great time without leaving. We however like to experience where we travel as much as possible, so we always plan off resort activities. You can find much cheaper food off the resort with just a quick drive north on the coast heading towards Kihei. A small local place called â€œDa Kitchenâ€� was a great find. It was recommended through a sitter we hired while we went SCUBA diving from Happy Kids Maui baby sitting service. We also hit the Safeway and picked up a gallon of milk, some cereal for the kids, some snacks and plastic-ware to get us through mornings and snack times, (which worked out great and allowed us to save a few bucks). We just used the mini bar for our stuff, and left the stuff already inside alone. Of course you can also drive a little further into Lahaina in West Maui for some more affordable dining. In all, this is a first class place. Everything was up to or exceeded our expectations. I would definitely recommend this resort to any of my friends or family (regardless of the size/ages of family members or romantic status) as this resort works for anyone for any vacation purpose. While we got an excellent deal on off season rates, we would still stay there full price and to me, that says a lot about this place. Maui is a regular haunt for us and this so far is the best resort experience we have had on this incredible island. Visit the Grand Wailea and give them a big â€œAlohaâ€� from myself and my Ohana. â€œMaui No Ka Oeâ€�â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: travelersK&W
Reviews.Content: Make no mistakes. This is a nice property. As a Hilton Diamond I was upgraded to a great oceanview room. Totally re-furbished and nicely appointed. After that every thing else went downhill. I found the hotel staff to be condescending. Not rude but not helping you while smiling all the time. I did encounter some staff who admitted that due to the low room count that several restaurants and activities had been cut back. Total confusion as to what restaurant would be open when. And if they were open they were extremely expensive. I realize that things will cost more at a resort like this but $8.00 for a bottle of water is a little over the top. Hamburgers $14.00, etc.. We were told we could use a courtesy room because we had a late flight. This turned out to be a nightmare and the hotel staff was not exactly honest in their discussions with me. The grounds are great. The adult pool could use some work.. Room count was low so service at the pool was almost non-existent. My advice would be to either stay at a condo of choose another true five star hotel (Fairmont or Four Seasons).. I don't normally speak negatively about vacations but be forewarned that the raving reviews you read here don't tell the entire story. In any event I wish you good travels.

Reviews.Title: “Service has diminished.”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0411
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at Grand Wailea and I was very disappointed. They have been touting $50 million in renovations which is all very nice, but they have cut down on their employees to make up the difference. Getting a drink by the pool was a 30 - 45 minute wait because they have so few people working. I saw many guests getting very frustrated. The rooms have definitely been updated, but they are still not to the level of the Four Seasons (next door) or the Ritz Carlton. The Hibiscus pool (adults only) is in horrible shape. The tiles are coming off and the jaccuzi's make awful noises. For those of you who have never stayed here, be sure you are prepared for a great deal of walking. My room was at least a 1/4 mile from the pool/beach. Granted some rooms are closer, but most require a lot of walking. The restaraunt selection is very limited as well. They have increased food prices since my last stay too. I will say that the grounds are lovely and are the best of any hotel on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility and Fabulous Staff-the ultimate vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Texas008
Reviews.Content: I wanted to send a note of thanks to you and your phenomenal staff. We were honored to stay at your beautiful facility in May 2009. The hotel is stunning and your staff is exceptional. Every single person we passed in the halls, saw at the beach, pool, restaurants, bell stand, parking garage/valet, concierge and in housekeeping was extremely welcoming, willing to assist with a smile and genuinely happy we were staying at the hotel. With a facility as large as yours, I realize it is difficult to have that type of employee in all areas of the hotel at all times. But, you have done it and I wanted to commend you for your wonderful leadership. My husband and I did not want to leave and will definitely continue to recommend the hotel for many years to come. I also want to mention the outstanding food we were fortunate enough to enjoy during our visit. Whether at our hospitality room in the morning for breakfast, the wonderful treats delivered to our room, Humuhumu, CafÃ© Kula, the beach restaurant (Molokini?) or any of the group receptions, the food was outstanding. The highlight was the luau and we will fondly recall the spectacular food, dÃ©cor, entertainment and service for many years. Thank you again for making our week in Maui one of our best vacations! We will be back! By the way, I wanted to relate an encounter I had with one of your guests. She was sitting next to us on the beach and dreading her departure later that day as well. She indicated the hotel had graciously given her a late check out due to having a 9pm flight and commented how nice the hotel had been with regard to the staff and service especially. She said her 7 year old son had a security blanket accidentally taken away in the laundry when the sheets were changed. She said her mother had made it and they were sick to lose it. The hotel apparently went through 50 carts of laundry to locate it, wash it and your Director of Housekeeping or Laundry personally delivered it to the family. They were so impressed at the level of concern and attention to detail with regard to this lost item. While I realize this may be â€œall in a dayâ€™s workâ€� for your staff, it certainly wowed this family. Way to go and keep up the terrific work!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: tiagayepfa
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely incredible resort. It was our first true luxury vacation. Everything five star! The best part for us was in our room, when you open the shutters (didn't have drapes), you just saw the beach and it was breathtaking. We slept with the shutters open each night. The pool area was fabulous and food simply incredible. The service is superior! Love the location on Maui. Have been back to Hawaii and stayed at different places, but this is the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl5
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying here. The first part of our trip we stay on Kaanapali Beach and then stay the last part here. Everything was absolutely wonderful here. Valet very friendly and helpful, shuttle service great, front desk check in and check out wonderful, we were majorly upgraded at no extra charge and also had a late flight out so were given complimentary late check out. Our room was huge, bathroom was huge with walk in shower, very very clean, beds so comfy, it was wonderful!!!! Bartender very friendly and service wonderful!!! I would definitely stay here again and for even longer time because it was that GREAT. Thanks to the staff and management at this hotel, it was first class!!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels on Maui”
Reviews.Author: DenverKgirl
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th trip to Maui in 6 years, and we have always wanted to stay at the Grand Wailea. We have visited this hotel on every trip we have been on and finally stayed here for 3 nights. This is a beautiful hotel, the grounds are breathtaking, and the pools are fantastic especially for my boyfriend who is truly a kid at heart :) Even the adult pool is wonderful and actually quiet! Now we stayed in May which apparently is a very slow month for Maui. So we didn't experience any issues with crowding, but this resort is huge and if it were sold out I could see where people might get frustrated with this problem. One thing that disappointed me was the fact we were celebrating an event and were given a gift certificate for a complimentary bottle of champagne if we went to their main restaurant. Now any other hotel I have stayed at has actually given us a bottle of wine or champagne in the room. I can see from a business stand point they are trying to save money, and get you to spend yours for this "extra" but for the price of this hotel I think they should offer a bottle of champagne without any strings attached. I did however enjoy the fact that they offer hospitality rooms after you check out. We had an 8:45pm flight so even though we had to check out we could still enjoy the resort, beach and pools. Then go to the front desk, ask for a hospitality room and they give you a room for 45 mins so you can shower and clean up before you have to take off. Great idea! Wish more hotels did this. We also experienced a few hours at the spa. Probably the greatest spa experience I have ever had! I wish I had the money to go back everyday I was there! Overall we had a great experience; the resort lived up to our expectations. Now we know Maui is extremely expensive, so this isn't a resort to go to if you are looking to stretch your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mindwurkz
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Hawaii, but my first time on Maui, so I decided to splurge and stay at the Grand Wailea. First impressions are important and this hotel did not dissapoint. This is a very well maintained with a very attentive staff. The grounds are beautiful, if not a bit large. Unlike some other hotels in Wailea, this one is located right on the beach, with plenty of attendants to help set up beach chairs, umbrellas and the sort. The weekend I was there happened to be fairly quiet, so there were no issues finding a good spot on the beach, by the pool, etc. I can forsee how crowded the pools and beach can get during high season though. The restaurant choices were pretty good, albeit a little on the expensive side, but about on-par with what you'd expect from an upscale resort like this one. One thing I would like to spotlight is their Spa. This is probably one of the better spas I've been to, with a great staff, great treatment options, and excellent terme.

Reviews.Title: “Add this place to your bucket list.”
Reviews.Author: pratt_and_the_lake
Reviews.Content: For our last two visits to Hawaii we stayed at the Hilton Waikoloa Village. My daughter and I really wanted to go back to that property. We are quite smitten with the HWV fantasy pools, boat ride to our room, dolphins, and Buddha Point. But, my wife insisted that we make it to Maui for this trip. The Maui Ritz in Kapalua had a great rate but we quickly soured on that idea after reading all the negative reviews. A couple of years ago I saw a great piece on the Travel Channel about the Grand Wailea, Oprah takes her staff there, and based on the abundance of positive reviews on Trip Advisor we decided to give this hotel a chance. This vacation, far and away, was the best we have ever experienced. The weather: We arrived after the spring break crush on April 22, 2009. One day ahead of plan because the weather forecast for our stay looked quite bleak and the 22nd was the only day not calling for rain (even though my wife assured me that Wailea had a freakish micro-micro climate with little or no clouds/rain.) Upon our descent into Maui, as I had feared, a huge low pressure system laid a thick layer of clouds over the islands. As we made our final approach from the south, a small break in the clouds allowed the sun to light up a few hotels on the southern shore of Maui. I couldnâ€™t make out the GW, but, with its white wash exterior I could clearly see the Fairmont from the window of the plane. I knew the Fairmont was in the same neighborhood as the GW. So maybe we had a chance of avoiding the dreaded â€˜rained outâ€™ Hawaii vacation. The hotel made arrangement for our transportation from the airport (taxi). As mentioned, we decided to come a day early and the concierge said they would change our pick up date. The change wasnâ€™t made. No big deal, we grabbed a taxi (mini van) at the stand, and made our way to the resort. ($60 + tip). The cab driver was great and the ride was short (20-25 minutes). As we rolled into Wailea, the scenery turned noticeably up-scale. Arrival and check-in were flawless. The lei greeting made it special. As reported by others, the bell desk is excellent, and really got the stay off to a good start as they escorted us up to our room in the Napua tower. Although more expensive, the Napua tower was an excellent value (A few more sq ft., better lanai furniture, central location, morning continental breakfast, and evening hors dâ€™oeuvres/cocktails, and personal concierge). I recommend a room facing west to catch the sunset (Or, get a Napua suite.) As mentioned by others, the fantasy pools are great. They do a good job of separating the â€˜big funâ€™ water park from the sublime adult pool. As planned, we didnâ€™t venture out of Wailea. We fell into a nice resort rhythm during our 6 day stay. 1.Breakfast at the Napua Club 2.Have the GW staff set up our beach umbrella and chairs. 3.Wander back and forth between the beach and pools. 4.Participate in one â€˜looselyâ€™ planned event for the day (spa, luau, snorkeling, scuba lessons) 5.Lunch at our beach camp. (My wife would venture to shopping center next door and grab us some deli sandwiches and snacks.) 6.Grab a cocktail in the Humu lounge for the torch lighting ceremony 7.Head up to the Napua Club for evening hors dâ€™oeuvres and a few more cocktails. 8.Watch the sunset from the lanai. 9.Nightly stroll of torch lit property and beach. 10.End up back in the lobby bar for some live music and night cap (the bartender made the kids great smoothies) 11.Head back up to the room, watch the local Hawaii news and go to sleep. (Return to step 1 and repeat for six days/five nights) The kids will be older for our next visit to Hawaii, therefore will add a little more off site adventure, but, we all really enjoyed falling into this daily relaxed routine. The few negative reviews Iâ€™ve read about this property are from folks who expect the staff to perform at a Four Season, Ritz, or Park Hyatt level. Many of the GW staff does perform at that level especially the bell desk, and the Napua Club bartenders/servers. I felt like the GW is reaching for the â€˜flawlessâ€™ service standards youâ€™d expect at a 5 star property, and they come oh, so very close. Only a couple slips. My wife asked the pool server for a cocktail while looking for a place to lounge and the server abruptly asked her to find her seat first (the server apologized). The young woman running the towel/wrist band desk in the morning could probably use some training at the Disney institute. One night housekeeping arrived to restock our ice bucket with a plastic laundry bag of ice.(handing me the bag). I mentioned this to the manager on duty and he said they would put a stop to this 'tacky' practice). As mentioned before, they fumbled our pick up at the airport (I canâ€™t imagine the Four Seasons would have dropped that ball). I did visit our next door neighbors (Marriot and Four Seasons). The evening vibe at the Four Seasons is fantastic, but the facility is ho-hum compared to the Grand Wailea and the exterior of the Marriot is downright dowdy/low-rent in appearance (although in fairness, the new Marriot adult pools are sharp and, based on the pictures, the rooms look rather nice). At the end of the day the extraordinary facility and the â€˜mostly perfectâ€™ service, push the Grand Wailea to the top in my book. Even w/out the kids in tow we would be hard pressed to pick the Four Seasons over the GW (but, for sure, we will stop by for dinner at Spago). p.s. Not one drop of rain fell in our little Wailea micro climate during the six day stay. Even though the road to Hana was closed (mud slides) and the leeward side of the island experience heavy rains and flash floods (not common for the leeward side).

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families who enjoy the water!”
Reviews.Author: girlguide61
Reviews.Content: The greatest part about our trip and the hotel were the surprises, exploring, and just relaxing while still having fun! I can tell you that the hotel is great for families who enjoy the water. The pools are fantastic and the beach out front is perfect! On most days we would settle on the beach near the pool. When the waves were big enough to bodysurf we swam at the beach but for most of the day we found ourselves in an oasis of slides and pools. I found myself giggling a number of times -even after my 40th time down the slides. Near the beach there is a hut where someone gives you towels and will bring lounge chairs and umbrellas to the beach and set you all up. No extra fee, but we tipped $5 to $10 ( four lounge chairs and 2 umbrellas). This way you can place your chairs and umbrellas in any direction you want vs. pool are set one way. No, the food is not great and yes, it is expensive. ( I found food prices on Maui expensive overall - but the wine is cheaper) I was impressed with the artwork and the gardens!!! Beautiful. The room was large enough for our family of four and the large bathroom helped. Overall the hotel was fantastic for our family! After we stayed here 6 days we went to Ekahi Village which was also beautiful - it was nice to eat in for a change again. My advice is if you are watching your pennies stay at the Wailea for a few days and enjoy all that the hotel has to offer then stay at a condo. If money is not a worry than this is your place if you and your family enjoy the water!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: amlm
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a week in October! It was perfect. The room was amazing (beach view) and the pool was so much fun!! It really wasn't too busy either and I had read that the pool gets crazy busy. We never had a problem finding a spot to sit. The water slide line was never long either. There were not a lot of kids which i had read too. I don't think I would enjoy staying here in the summer because of the kid population in the pool. The beach in front of the hotel is great and that is where I got engaged:) Very special place to me. We loved Paia(spelling) the fish market there is to die for. I would stay here again but maybe not in the summer if I was looking for a quiet spot. The Four Seasons next door looked great too.

Reviews.Title: “Sensory Overload”
Reviews.Author: callehiedra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea over Easter. We were on a 12 day trip on Maui but since we got an employee rate we decided to stay here for a couple days. Normally when I go to Maui, I love staying in a condo. More space and a kitchen is essential for long stay there with small kids IMO. We stayed in a lagoon room over looking the pool. It had a king bed and pull out couch. --Towel game in full force. Pool areas feel really crowded. Positives: --The room itself was big, cleaned each day and had a gorgeous bathroom. The tub was separate from the shower and this was a huge plus. --The resort itself is gorgeous and huge. --The pool is heaven for kids and adults alike. --The beach is great, calm, big, great walking paths --Snorkeling at the beach was really great. Did not have to go far to see fish but there was a ton to see far out as well. --Wailea is a beautiful place, the shops of Wailea are not far from the resort. Cons --You have to do a lot of research yourself. Because the resort is so big, you really had to search out information on what and where different kids activities can do. This is not a hand holding resort, you have to figure it out yourself. This isn't really a con but for those that like a cruise director, there isn't one here! I thought it would be nice to have list of activities and locations slipped under your door each night --All the food at the resort is extremely expensive. I guess that's relative, if you have a ton of money, maybe a ten dollar peanut butter and jelly sandwich doesn't phase you. We went to Kihei cafe in the morning and brought back food. All in all it was a fun place to stay for two nights. After that we returned to our condo and enjoyed the peace and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better but...”
Reviews.Author: Mctcfitz
Reviews.Content: So, we stayed at the Grand Wailea a few years ago when it was badly in need of renovation and didn't enjoy our trip then. This time we added a couple of days to our trip at the last minute and decided to give it a try after hearing about the renovation. First off the renovation is great. I would not have recognized the rooms from our previous stay. New carpet, furniture, a great comfortable bed, really nice. No more mold or mildew smell. The rooms are now right there in the 4 Star category. The service was also much better. We were upgraded to a ocean view deluxe room that did have a nice view of the property and ocean. They were at low occupancy so we had no issues with housekeeping or getting service by the pool or beach. The pools are great. We have 4 kids - 8,7,4,2 and there was a pool for each of them. The little ones love the small pools connected by small slides and then down to a nice flowing river. The older kids loved the large slides and rope swing park. The largest slide is really fun even for adults. The pool area was not crowded with minimal lines and we always were able to get good spots in the shade. The grounds of the hotel are huge with rivers, small lakes with fish, and bridges. Our kids really liked walking around the property. All of the above made this a great stay. As other reviews have said be prepared to be nickel and dimmed here. I was expecting it but was surprised still. A cabana at the pool was $225 per day ($70 at nearby places), drinks in the $15 range, breakfast buffet for us was over $100 (Adequate but nothing special). In general for the rates they charge you would expect a higher quality of food and service. This didn't affect our trip but should be noted. The biggest surprise came on our last night. We came back to our room to find a note under our door saying that all the upper pools, river, slides, etc. would be closed Tuesday to Friday. Not a word about this when we checked in or at any time during our stay until this note. We were checking out the next morning so it didn't affect us but it would have really messed up our trip if we would have been just arriving. I understand that these complicated systems need maintenance but no notice. I know the Hawaii hotels are hurting but is seems short sighted to not warn people checking in or making reservations about this. I would guess having 4 days of down revenue is better than losing customers. Anyway, we had a great time at this resort as the pool closure didn't affect us and I would definitely come back but I would really ask to confirm the pool will be open when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for people used to crowds and lines.”
Reviews.Author: hipmamatravels
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Maui visitors and usually rent a private home for our vacation. My kids always long for a pool so on this trip instead of forking over $400 to go to a luau or snorkeling trip we spent one night at the Grand Wailea in order to use their amazing pool. The cheapest rate we could find online was $468 for a midweek, garden view room. We were allowed to check in at noon and get right down to the pool. Only trouble is you have to have chairs staked out at 7AM if you want a place to sit. We wandered around the PACKED pool area and finally "squatted" on some chairs in front of an unrented cabana. Cabana's rent for $300 a day! So many were not being used and have both chairs under cover and right in front. The ones in front are covered with towels but we went ahead and set our stuff there. I wouldn't have felt comfortable sitting there for fear of getting kicked off. The kids had a blast in the pool. It was a little cold for me and the 2 hot tubs were packed with people. 2 kids meals, 2 adult meals and 2 cocktails cost $92 poolside. Ouch. The room was lovely. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view. The bathroom was all marble and enormous. It was clean. The bed was comfy and soft. We sent the kids back to the house with the sitter and spent the night alone as a couple. Ahhhh this part was heavenly. We woke up at 6:30 AM the next morning to stake out some shaded lounge chairs. The night before we'd scouted out 3 choices. At exactly 6:58 I arrived poolside to find our first 2 choices already taken. I scrambled to the 3rd, tossed things from my bag onto them and then stood in a line 10 deep (at 7 freaking AM) to get towels. Amazing. And this was after the spring break weeks on a Wednesday morning. They do have a policy that they will remove personal things from chairs not used for an hour but I never saw them do this. There are very few chairs with umbrellas over them which is hard when you have small children. Overall we're glad we did it once but we would never go back. The only draw of this resort over neighboring ones is the pool and my kids were bored with it by the 2nd day. The stress of having to wait in line, jostling for chairs etc. took away from any fun we had. There are so many cheaper places to stay with free chairs, ocean view etc. for half the price. For that much money I expect to feel pampered not like a lemming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Beautiful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PaReviewer003
Reviews.Content: We (extended-extended family) stayed at the resort for 5 nights. This place is beautiful and the grounds are well maintained. There is selfpark and valet at the hotel, so parking your rental car is a breeze. We found that it was nice to have a rental car to get around town and try out some of the local eateries and tour the area. Since there was a bunch of us at the resort, I was able to take a peek in several rooms. In general the rooms were well appointed and everyone seemed happy with their rooms. However, I did notice that some bathrooms were more outdated than others. We attended a catered event one of the evenings and the event staff was fantastic. Usually banquet food falls short even at finest establishments but the food was delicious. We also enjoyed dinner at the hotelâ€™s Humuhumunukunukuapaâ€™a Restaurant. What a beautifully romantic setting! Recommend: tiger prawns and lobster bisque to start. As you would expect food was expensive... very expensive throughout the resort. The pools were FUNtastic! I saw young and old alike enjoying the pool areasâ€¦ lazy river, swing rope,â€¦ The pool and beach areas were pretty crowded at times. But I donâ€™t recall having too much trouble getting a lounge chair. We were able to rent umbrellas and kayaks from the hotel staff at the beach. (TIP: be cautious of mosquitoes!)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, excellent staff, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel808
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Wailea Resort for 2 nights (April 17 - 19, 2009) for a weekend getaway (18 of us traveling from O'ahu). We were very impressed with the service from the time we got there to the minute we left. I am very particular about service, safety, cleanliness and location when I travel. The Grand Wailea Resort Hotel & Spa has it all! Upon arrival we were greeted with leis, which we thought were a nice touch. Check-in was hassle free and they were friendly and very accomodating in having us placed in the same wing (we were on the chapel side). The amount of Aloha at this hotel is overwhelming, service was superb. I can't believe how people can write mediocre reviews for this hotel. The rooms were clean, spacious and well lit. Bathrooms were spacious, equipped with a glass shower stall and separate tub. The towels were huge, soft and fluffy. Linens on the beds were crisp and clean. The room's air conditioning system was a great asset during the humid weekend. The big flat screen TV was a nice addition. The only thing our room was missing was a refrigerator and microwave. But it was equipped with a stocked mini-bar. We enjoyed every minute of our time spent at the hotel and can't wait to go back. The pool was beautiful and a lot of us made use of it every single time it was open and we weren't out and about. Tips: Go see 'Ulalena at the Maui Myth and Magic Theatre in Lahaina and instead of going up to Haleakala at sunrise, go at sunset, it's beautiful and you'll save yourself the early morning wake-up of 4 am. If you have children between the ages of 5 - 12, I highly suggest enrolling them in Camp Grande, the staff is well trained, friendly and overall fun people, perfect for kids! I highly recommend this hotel, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, but crowded beach & pool areas, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JnJ_Montreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea 10 to 12 April 2009 for two nights over Easter Weekend. The hotel is a beautiful work of art, the grounds are a botanical garden and the rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable; but beware as the beach and pool areas are very crowded and the service in these areas is very poor. Our experience of the hotel was very much as described in considerable detail by the previous reviewer Girlstar 128. I wrote this review to re-affirm the realities set out by Girlstar 128 as our experiences were very similar. Beware if you stay on a Hilton Honours free room reward ( which we did) as my credit card got billed for the cost of the room after we checked out of the hotel and the first I knew of the double billing for the cost of the room was on my credit card bill as the hotel never had the courtesy to notify me of an illegitimate post departure charge - great practice for a 4+star hotel ! I now have to waste time correcting their mistake. From a very seasoned traveler's perspective, overall the Grand Wailea beach and pool areas are like an overcrowded 3 star hotel in the Dominican Republic charging 4 and 5 star prices. We liked the hotel building, the hotel grounds, the room and the dinner we had at the Molokini Restaurant but because of the overcrowding, we would not go back. Having seen the cost of the room charged to my credit card, the Grand Wailea in our experience is over priced for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE!!! The most amazing hotel we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TheeBabydotcom
Reviews.Content: Wow, my wife and I are completely homesick for the GW. This truly was an amazing stay. Here are some facts and a little background on what we can compare this Hotel to: We have traveled to many countries including: Italy, Greece, Turkey, China, Moscow, Israel, France, Thailand, Hong Kong, +++ and we live in Southern California near Laguna Beach so the bar is quite high. The GW was really the most beautiful place weâ€™ve ever stayed at. This IS a 5 star resort. But what made it great was the friendly staff and amazing pool. When you travel, if you choose to stay at a 5 star hotel you expect 5 star service. The people were just amazing. Michele in reservations and Shannon at the front counter are just two examples of Perfect service. Yes you are going to pay a little more money for food and other items, but what do you expect when you are in such a place. My wife and I absolutely loved the pool. We spent most of our time here just hanging out and talking with our 1 year old. The $14.95 burger at the pool was super tasty, the spa is a must visit. We love to travel and actually do not have tons of money, but we like nice things. So we saved and were able to make the trip here. We canâ€™t wait to go back. Great to bring kids too. The pools are separated for kids and adults so either way is perfect if you donâ€™t want to be around the children. Just get there and relax. The Hotel it self is just beautiful. You can see the pictures all over the internet and they are accurate in beauty. But you could have a beautiful place and terrible service, but here you get the whole package which is very important when you take a vacation. Thanks to everyone at the GW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hawaiian Vacation/Resort”
Reviews.Author: MPHAA_Mi
Reviews.Content: Visited Hawaii for 4th time and had MOST ENJOYABLE vacation at this Resort. Great, dsicounted group rates for on-site meeting ~$300/night. Beautiful grounds, beach, pools, and common areas. Excellent rooms and Fitness Center. Restaurant, housekeeping, and Bar service was disappointing but beautiful setting and amenities more than compensated. Would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Pamper yourself at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: MadsteveLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea recently and couldn't have asked for a more perfect experience. We splurged and enjoyed watching the sunset from our ocean view room in the Napua Tower which comes with some fabulous amenities (great complimentary breakfast, cocktails and pu pus and use of a couple of Apple computers with great big monitors.) Spectacular spa experience (anti-aging facial and a deep tissue massage). We like kids but were delighted that there was a separate pool for adults when we wanted some quiet relaxation. Food, service and atmosphere at Humuhumu for dinner were outstanding. No complaints! Loved IT! GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful! Heaven On Earth!”
Reviews.Author: TravelManiac1991
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: I cannot say enough good things about this resort. From the minute we arrived we were greeted with smiles and immediately had our bags taken out of our hands and whisked away to our room. Check in was quick and extremely easy, they already had everything prepared before our arrival. ROOM: We stayed in a Napua Club Room and if you are willing to pay the extra cost , it is definitely worth it! The room service was exceptional, and the turn down service even better. The Napua Level included a full breakfast buffet every morning, water/ice tea and cookies all day, and an AMAZING cocktail hour starting at 5:30. The Mai Tai's were incredible, and the bar tender (I wish I could remember her name) was very nice and called all of us by our first and last names. The room was awesome, and the beds even more. The view equally as great, and the bathroom too. Shower was huge, and the jacuzzi tub was as well. The whole room had a very luxurious classy vibe to it. FOOD: Expensive.... but very very good. I'm not going to complain about the prices at this hotel, because at the end of the day you get what you pay for. This hotel is known for being luxurious and high class, so obviously it will be highly priced. Although, once again the food was impeccable. We ate at every restaurant and our personal favorite was the "Bistro Molokini". It was the cafe next to the adult pool, and although casual the food was still wonderful, with a variety of options. POOLS: PERFECT. The adult pool was always quiet, and had friendly pool service. You can reserve a cabana near the pool for a fee, but it was a nice bonus. The hot tubs were set at a perfect temperature as well. The main pool had SO many awesome activities and kept the kids busy all day. Between the water slides, lazy river, and rope swing i'd say it was one of the best pools i've ever seen. You can also schedule scuba diving lessons, they have a private pool to learn in. BEACH: Very nice, the water was very calm and nice to swim in. If I had one complaint i'd say that it was a bit to crowded. It isn't a very big beach, and when you have 3 hotels that are using that beach it can get crowded quickly. Make sure you get up and grab a nice spot early in the morning. (Same goes for the pools) LOCATION: Excellent. The Wailea shops were a short walk away, and if you feel like eating away from the resort there are some casual restaurants within walking distance as well. The nightlife is a short cab ride away, and not as stuffy as the town of Wailea. OVERALL EXPERIENCE: I recommend this hotel and vacation spot to almost anyone. It's great for families, couples, young people, just about everyone! If you are going to be staying at this resort, and I can assure you that you will have an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BigVVancouver
Reviews.Content: We just loved staying at the Grand Wailea. The staff was courteous and the view roms fanatstic.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: tnewsome
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to travel around the world, spending alot of time in Hawaii, the US Carribean, the British Virgin Islands, & the West Indies. I can honestly say that this resort was the most beautiful, with an impecable attention to detail and service.
