I typically like to try new resorts for each "adventure" I plan, but this place is so special that I hope to return on a regular basis!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but know before you go.....”
Reviews.Author: tcinboise
Reviews.Content: This resort is NOT for everyone. It is a mega resort. Incredible pools, beautiful grounds, fabulous location and loaded with tourists. If you want to go play with the kids in one of the best pools anywhere, don't miss this resort. If you want romance and luxury, go to the Four Seasons or Kea Lani next door. We had a an oceanview room which was nicely appointed. Very large bathroom with separate tub/shower. Fully stocked mini bar that is sealed(nice if you have little ones!) Refrigerators are available for an extra fee. Matter of fact everything comes with an extra fee but if you choose to stay at this type of resort, expect it. The restaurants are overpriced and mediocre but the ambience is hard to beat! The spa is incredible(expensive) but lives up to the expectation. Staff was courteous, rooms were clean, beach is nice but not exceptional. Expect to walk 10 minutes to get to the beach, pool, restaurants, etc. Like I said mega resort. Enjoy the resort for all it has to offer but just be prepared to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5 star experience!”
Reviews.Author: Frosato
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were absolutely taken by the lobby. It is beautifully decorated and open to the elements with a spectacular view of the ocean. The staff were friendly and very attentive to all our needs. I would highly recommend a treatment at the spa, my 80 minute massage was amazing and the facility is as well. We had a wonderful meal at the Humu Humu Nuku Nuku restaurant one night and enjoyed lounging at the adult only pool during the day. All in all, a delightful experience...can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: dp123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a company do for 5 days in March. Very nice as ever, as was here last year. Stayed in a twin with my mate. Everything was good but be aware that the hotel bar closes at between 11 - 12 at night - not late!! Pools were all open - a little bit of work going on around the grounds but not too bad. A little dated at this stage tho They may recommend an Italian restaurant to you - forget the name but mis-spelt - don't bother - very over rated and not that great Go for the lava flow cocktail in the hotel - excellent!! Be ware of the smoking issues in Hawaii tho - they are draconian to say the least - not just specific to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is HEAVENLY”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryPrincess35
Reviews.Content: We love to travel,My husband and 2 kids have travelled all over the U.S,over to Europe and South Pacific..We usually stayed at the Grand Hyatt Kauai,Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island,and Westin Maui..5 yrs ago we decided to stay at the Grand Wailea in April 2004..We had a great time,met lots of travellers from around the world whom we keep in contact with.The pool was spectacular,the staff were remarkably beautiful people whom always seemed happy.We have returned every year since that stay.Our Dining experiences at Humuhumu is always phenominal.They have a wonderful kids club staff.We have been to alot of luxury resorts,however Grand Wailea remains on our TOP list.You dont always find luxury resorts with such an atmosphere of LOVE or ALOHA.I want everybody to know that if you want a happy family vacation,always go with the Grand Wailea.The Spa is spectacular.Everything is HEAVENLY..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver45
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with kids 10 and 11 years old. We were in the Napua tower, great room size and lanai, great breakfasts and appetizers too. The hotel is spread out and there are lots of places to walk and hang out. The pool was fantastic with the waterslides and lazy river. Our kids loved the beach as you could simply play in the waves, or rent kayaks, go snorkling etc. The staff at the Grand were exceptional and very friendly and they were always attentive. Smiles and Aloha from everyone all day! Adults feel the luxury and the kids can be kids here. Everything here is easy to do. Sure it is expensive but it's all relative and we were more than satisfied with the hotel for the money! We are extremely picky and have nothing to say but good things about the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Aloha! Fabulous trip to the Grand Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: JWSHALOHA
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a weeks stay at the Grand Wailea - took my 11 year old for her spring break. I am a hotel snob and was very happy with the Grand Wailea. This was our first visit to this property. I had stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua previously at the other end of the island - I like the Wailea area much better. We booked the least expensive category room and received a nice (complimentary) upgrade to a pool view/partial ocean view room in the Lagoon wing. We found the room and bath to be spacious and luxurious. The feather beds were quite welcoming after 14 hours of traveling - nice linens as well. We enjoyed the separate shower, soaker tub, island fragrance bath amenities and large bath sheet towels in the bathroom. Maid service was excellent & efficient while we were at breakfast each morning - and dinner for trundown time in the evening. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast the first morning but settled on the quick service Cafe Kula for the following breakfasts. We miss the locally made bagels - try the coconut or pineapple toasted with guava jam - Yummy! The food is ridiculously expensive but it is simply this way at all top rated hotels in Hawaii. The pool and beach were the real draw for our spring break trip. We loved every aspect of the pools - all the slides, rope swing, water elevator, swift moving canyon, lazy river and swim up bar. We enjoyed delicious burgers poolside several days. The hotel offers poolside activities for a fee that my daughter enjoyed such as Puka Shell necklace making and lei making. They also offer a spa cabana that offers manicures, pedicures & hair wraps/braids pool/beach side. I enjoyed walking on the path that runs between all the Wailea hotels along the beach daily - great whale watching from this path. There are a few hotels along the walking path that offer beverages, coffee, breakfast treats for sale. We really enjoyed lunching over at the Four Season's a few days - treat yourself to the beautiful view and a delicious lobster sandwich at their poolside grill. You may even see a celebrity or two - we did! Some recommendations: Whale Watching tour with "Pacific Whale Foundation" - visit their website for more info. They run a great, informative tour and have a wonderful gift shop at their Ma'alaea harbor location. "Maui Ocean Center" at Ma'alaea Harbor - Hawaii's aquarium is super for all ages and they have another great gift shop. "Hula Cookies" in this same shopping center at Ma'alaea - to die for cookies with Island ingredients, local Roselani ice creams and shave ice. Try an ice cream sandwich made with chocolate chip mac nut cookies and kona coffee or coconut ice cream in the middle. YUMMY! 2 restaurants not to miss are: Stella Blue's in the Azeka Plaza in N. Kihei (10-12 minutes from hotel). The locals eat here and they have 3 meals a day here - delicious and fairly priced. "Mama's Fish House" in Paia (30-40 minutes from hotel) - simply don't miss this splurge - incredible fresh fish, fantastic tropical libations and a beachside location. This will be a memorable dinner for all - they do have a children's menu. Make reservations online at opentable.com - highly recommend the 5pm to 5:30pm time frame so you can enjoy the ocean view before it gets dark. "Shops of Wailea" adjacent to the hotel (walk or drive). Luxury shopping & dining along with more budget friendly shopping & dining. Enjoy souvenir shopping at Whalers General Store or ABC Store and ice cream at Lappert's. They also have complimentary hula dancing & music some nights. Self park in the Makena deck by using your room key card. Enjoy your trip to Hawaii. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Trip to Maui at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Ladygolfer71
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a trip to the Grand (my husband, young kids and nanny), and we had a wonderful time. The service and attitude of everyone was absolutely fantastic--thanks so much to Jerry, Dan, Ally and Faye in the Napua tower--it was such a good time. We thoroughly enjoyed the morning breakfast and the evening cocktails- it is such a great set-up and makes it so nice each morning and evening. The rooms have been re-done new paint, carpet, etc. and are really nicely appointed-- I have to say that the Napua Nani suite is as nice (actually nicer I think!) than any luxury condo. The living room and adjoining room make it very comfortable and roomy. The DVD in the living room was great for a movie for the little ones. The entertainment value of this resort just can't be beat--the kids (2 and 6) had a blast at the pools and on the slides, and there was always someting to do. From feeding the fish at Humuhumu on Friday mornings and a big Thanks to Laurie at Camp Grande down by the pool who made "craftmaking" very memorable-- from memory boxes to tie dyed t-shirts it was great!! I would definitely recommend the Grand Wailea to anyone who wants a fun filled vacation at a beautiful location-It's worth it! The service and food and the restaurants were very good, and the Wailea shops next door are also nice and make it convenient, and just up the street Matteo's pizzeria was a good casual meal. We've been coming to Maui for a while and will definitely come back to the Grand Wailea, it was a great vacation for everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - this is paradise!”
Reviews.Author: traveled2
Reviews.Content: Incrediblly beautiful hotel. Gorgeous view of ocean (with whales) and volcano. Lush grounds and great beach and pool. Breakfast buffet is an quite a spread - so much delicious fresh fruit. Very helpful staff. Beds sooo comfortable - we slept like babies! If you plan to visit here often becoming a member is the way to go - significant discounts on room, food and services.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, would go every year if in Europe ...................”
Reviews.Author: Lowey77
Reviews.Content: Went for freinds wedding and nearly chose to stay elsewhere due to cost but thankfully decided to stay 10 nights and would have regretted it if had gone elsewhere. The place is basically the "Grandest" hotel in probably the grandest resort (Wailea) on probably the best Hawian island. We went at the begining of Sept and it was only a thrid full which was great as busy but just nice, you could always get loungers, always got served quickly etc whereas we spoke to some people who had been there during the main weeks and they said it was bedlam and too busy so avoid then if possble. Hotel itself is huge with some grand rooms - the lobby and main bar area is impressive, with certain areas open to the elements and just oozes class. Rooms very spacious and very comfortable with flat screen tv's, mini bars and all other mod cons - bathroom was loved by my wife as has huge bath and at least a double sized walk in shower, 2 sinks etc etc etc. One of the main reasons we loved it so much was the pool areas; several pools starting at the top of the hill that have different slides (fast, twisty, straight leading into lazy river through ravine) that you just work your way through until you eventually come t the pool bar where "you have to have a mudslide cocktail" and then flow through the lazy river that takes you metres from the beachfront and then if you see fit back up to the top on a water elevator. For adults and bigger kids only who want fast slides, there are 2 big slides that go from top to bottom quickly that are great fun. Food at the hotel and neigbouring hotels (Fairmont & Four Seasons) plus "The shops at Wailea" is out of this world, good sized portions and sea food to die for (I think i ate the Pacifics stock of Scallops and Shrimp). The only downside is that this holiday aint a cheap one. The Grand Wailea dont seem to discount and only offer room only and the local restaurants as mentioned above costs best part of $200 per meal (2 adults and one child, starter, main and couple drinks) but i guess you get what you pay for. 10 mins drive away are cheaper restaurants and good supermarkets that you should definately use to stock up your water, drinks, snacks etc as they are probably only 25% of the price you pay at the hotel. Would i go there again - most definately and to be honest would kind of live with the cost if it was not for the 10 hour flight to the West Coast of America followed by a further 6 hours to Maui. Only regret - great golf courses just 5 mins away and didnt play !! Conclusion - pure class, treat yourself as a must do in a lifetime experience

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice- ask about the hospitality suite”
Reviews.Author: nicekittycat
Reviews.Content: Lots of great things about this hotel. so many to mention. Keoni was our favorite person to see there at the Botero Bar. "Hey Forty-Fort!" would stay there again and again. We went out to eat often though to save money for value and great places nearby. The concierge helps with that too! Another great thing was a hospitality suite so when we checked out at noon, we hung out til 7pm and used a special room to refresh before heading to the airport. we didn't have to pay for an extra night

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Gorgeous Grounds, Really, Really Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Utsoob
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (2 adults, 3 kids 7 - 11) stayed a night at the Grand Wailea to wrap up our vacation in Maui. First, let me say, it is really, really expensive. We got what is supposed to be an Ocean Front room, which means, you have an unobstructed view of the ocean but it is not "ocean front." It's just at a higher floor. The rooms are spacious and the linens, products, soaps etc... in the room are all high quality. The air conditioning is great and is tied to the Lanai sliding glass door (A/C turns off when door is open). The grounds, both inside and out, are simply beautiful. I've stayed in many upscale hotels. The Grand Wailea is is one of the few where I've been this deeply impressed. Lovely sculpture, manicured gardens, waterfalls, ponds, a beautiful wedding chapel, magnificent spa, impressive lobby and bars, a fun kids pool and an 18+ pool for those wanting to avoid kids - it's all there at the Grand Wailea. And it's all for a price. We had an Ocean front room for one night (w/ AAA discount), Valet Parking, a "casabella" (two padded chairs w/ a cover), Two Adult Room Service Breakfasts with Coffee and Juice, Two kids Hot Dogs, Two cheeseburgers and two mixed drinks. Our check out bill was close to $1100. We ate dinner off-site. There are less expensive rooms and we were allowed to have a one-time exemption to have 5 people in the room (we had to request in advance and acknowledge risk factors etc...). We were also able to enjoy the facilites prior to official check-in time (4:30 PM) so a one night stay allows you to enjoy what the Grand Wailea offers. We enjoyed our stay at the Grand Wailea and the kids loved the pool. It's worth experiencing at least once in a lifetime. If you have the money or want to experience the grounds, this is a great hotel. If you have a special event, like a wedding, and you're trading guest count for beauty and memories, this is a great place to have it. If you want a great pool with lots of people and overpriced food ($15 for a cheeseburger), this is the place for you. Just don't be shocked when the bill comes due.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy River kept the kid entertained all week”
Reviews.Author: nycmr
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fun week at the Dermatological Docs conference. This was our first visit to Maui and we were impressed with the non-sea hotel water activities, so were our children. Our 4yr old loved the lazy river and water slides and our 1.5yearer 'digged' the 'sandy beach' pool, right next to the sea. Water was very gently chlorinated, hardly noticeable in fact, which made a dip even more attractive. The beach is idealic and has the best access of all the Wailea hotels. Food and service was average for Hawaii ($$$s and middle of the road), staff were just doing their minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Still Best Place Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-John09
Reviews.Content: Well both my husband & I have stayed in some amazing places around the world but this was and still is our best memory. (10 days in total) 9th Nov 05 we were married at the Grand Waliea Chapel, Maui.This is on the grounds of the hotel & spa, check out pictures just fairytale.Our 16 guests arrived to be wowed by the welcome, service, rooms and country. Everything was sorted directly with th hotel from Uk & our day went perfectly! Harp,butterflies, dinner under stars and fireworks we had it! I have heard it has changed ownership now so not sure it will be the same however we do have one issue. Since our wedding and returning to Uk we have tried several times to contact the hotel reservations, wedding department and also our old contract for details of our photos and still do not have them! Yes we do have a disc of images from the day but we did pay for our album part of our package to the hotel. We hope to return one day so we can collect them in person. So if your getting married there make sure you get them before you leave! Spa - over looks the main water falls / pool it is a must do! we had our first day of wedding bliss sharing treatments. Rooms huge especailly the suites! Ground perfectly lawned and beautiful flowers Resturants - bit pricey but great mall in walking distance with good selection of food. Recomend max stay - 3/4 days - so much more to see in Maui or mainland, also helps the budget! Chuck Virtue - is the man! head of reservations or was, thank you again! Theresa Martin - wedding coordinator, she made me feel so welcome, we dont know how she did it!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea trying hard”
Reviews.Author: Magoudz
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about this place after reading the negative reviews here. We found the Grand Wailea to be fantastic. First, upon arrival they waived the $25 resort fee. Second, beach umbrellas are now free. Yes, everything is expensive, but they seem to have gotten the message about nickel and diming their guests to death. Food quality at the Bistro for lunch was mediocre. The breakfast buffet was nothing special as for selection or quality; not worth the cost. We had dinner at Kincha, the Japanese restaurant. It was fantastic. Unfortunately, it is closing the end of this month. A one time $25 fee for use of a room refrigerator is the smartest $25 you'll spend. You can then have breakfast in your room, have a place to store left overs, make sandwiches for lunch, for example. Some of the best snorkeling we found on Maui was just a brief walk down the beach. In fact while we were there we saw many of the tour boats stopping off the same point we could go to without paying someone to get us there. If you need to watch your dining budget, be prepared to run up to Kihei Town for bargain meals. Otherwise be prepared to pay and pay. If you've got the money to stay at a place of this caliber you should find this place pretty nice. If you can afford more, you'll likely enjoy the Four Season's (right next door) more. If you're already stretching to afford the Grand Wailea, save your money and stay elsewhere. You will blow your budget on things that do nothing but upset you.

Reviews.Title: “It Dosent get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: ArmenianUtah
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many resorts all over the five main Hawaiian Islands.....and our favorite is the Grand Wailea in Maui. Rarely do you find a resort which can please both the reclusive couple as well as the adventurous family. This resort not only pulls it off, but it does it very very well. The kids pool area is simply the best I have ever seen, the adult Hibiscus pool is heavenly (especially the grass area just off the pool.) If you go in the winter months, you can see Humpback whales right from your lounge chair! Make sure to rent a kayak from the beach rental ($35 for two hours) and then you can go snorkle, whale watch up close or see some turtles. The rooms are great, make sure you get an Ocean view if possible as the beach is so close. The spa is world class, tthere are 5 world class golf courses within 10 min drive. The only thing you need to go off campus for is for tennis. (Wailea Tennis center has about 10 great courts nearby.) Perhaps the best part of the resort is the staff......just go ask staff members how long they have been working at the hotel....you wil be hard pressed to find anyone who has not been there for under five years. All in all, its hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: UnkFrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa from January 27th thru 31st, (this was the 2nd part of our Hawaii trip - we had spent the prior 3 days in Waikiki) and would not hesitate to go back. I don't think there was anything about the property or the stay to dissuade me from going there again. We arrived around 2:30p (check in is 3p) and were told our room was not ready yet. No biggie, headed to the bar for an adult beverage (after picking our jaws off of the ground over how the grounds looked, even in the rain that had been hitting the islands for about 3 days). The front desk called my cell phone to tell me the room was ready, and to our great surprise (and many thanks to our travel agent Amy), we found we had been upgraded to the more exclusive Napua Tower. Our room, 8045, was superb. A nice sized balcony with a view of the hills to the right, and the ocean to the left, and looking over the grounds. The bed was very, very comfortable, and the bath had a separate soaking tub and glass-enclosed shower, dual vanity, and separate toilet area. We had rain the first 2 days of our stay in Wailea, but of course those days are taylor-made for shopping, and there is a nice shopping area right next door (The Shops of Wailea - I think most of the managers knew us by first names it seemed ;-) The rain also limited our exploring the grounds as much as we would have likes, and that was limited to a bit over the last 2 days. But we really liked what we saw. The pools were wonderful, and the "family" pool didn't seem that crowded when we went wandering around. Even the beach wasn't that busy. I'm betting a lot was due to the time of year and the economy though. The times we ate at the resort, especially at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a for dinner, were some of the better meals we've had. You do get a complimentary continental breakfast when staying in the Napua Towers, which is pretty good, but we did do the regular breakfast buffet which was a fairly good deal and tasty too. No matter who it was, every member of the staff always had a smile, and greeted us with an "Aloha", even when we asked at the last minute for a little later checkout. From the bartenders to the bellman to the housekeepers to the valets, I don't remember not getting at least a smile. And yes, there are a couple of minor complaints. First off, it seems most of the bars (especially around some of the pools) close early or aren't open very long. The swim-up Grotto Bar was only open from 12p - 5p, most of the other bars closed by 7 or 8p (exception being the Botero Bar, in the main atrium). Couldn't really determine if it was a year-round policy regarding the hours or because of the economy limiting the number of guests, but it seems this is not a place for late-night partying (which was actually OK with us, since we were in the relaxing mode). And a more minor gripe, I thought the pu-pus left a little to be desired. They were good, but not up to the caliber of the the rest of the meals. And as far as the 'nickel and diming' some people complain about, it's not like these are surprise fees. They are right up front, and if you don't like them, don't stay there. I knew what I was getting when I booked, and especially with the upgrade, I had no complaints. I got a peek into a regular room walking by, and the sneak peak looked nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: gccc116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used our Hilton Honor Points and redeemed for a 6-nights stay, from 01/29/09 to 02/04/09. We have stayed at numerous Hiltons and Conrads, but this is the first (and most likely last) time we will be staying in a Waldorf Astoria property. I would not have paid half of the rates posted to stay at this resort. Some of my personal disappointments: 1. The front desk first offered me an "ocean view" room. However, when we entered the room, the view, if any, was COMPLETELY blocked by the foliage of a big tree. After we went back to the front desk to complain, they then changed us to an "above the tree line" room with views of the ocean. Mind you, the property is NOT FULL and I do not understand why they'd want to put customers in less desirable rooms in the first place when there are plenty of others vacant? 2. The hotel charges for EVERYTHING. From $250/day for a large canopy (which is 95% vacant everyday, since no one in today's economy would want to shell out that kind of money for shade), to $50/day for a smaller two-persons lounger, to $25 to clean out the in-room fridge for us to put our own drinks in there, to $25/day resort fee (which by the way, should cover those shaded canopies in the first place). 3. Hilton Honors Gold and Diamond members be aware, none of your normal loyalty perks is applicable here. We did not receive any breakfast, newspaper or spa passes. Oh, we did receive one bottle of Evian on the first day and they did offer us a $40 food coupon which is a joke because of all the restrictions it comes with, like it is only valid at the 3 most expensive restarurants on-site and only for dinner. I could eat like a king for 1/2 the money down the street at Cafe O'Lei. Oh, they did offer to upgrade us to their "Napua Lounge" for just $200 more per day... they must think we are stupid or something! 4. The housekeeping staff is not up to par compared to some of the other luxury hotels we have stayed in. They DO NOT replenish the toiletries or clean the tub everyday. We had to call housekeeping twice, during our stay, to get our coffee (one of the few "free" items in the room). Mind you, this is after leaving a nice tip on the counter every morning! To be fair, the property is grand and has a wonderful beach. However, it is an older property and its age is showing. Considering it took twice the HH points for us to redeem a stay here versus staying at Conrad Bali or the Hilton Waikoloa, I think we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort”
Reviews.Author: Welltraveled38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the G.W. resort for our 10th annivesary. We were upgraded from a "full ocean view" to an amazing ground floor suite that overlooked the pool and beyond the palm trees some limited ocean view. The suite was incredible with two bathrooms, and very spacious. We participated in the free yoga at 8am on the lawn overlooking the ocean. Their were about 15 people. The breakfast buffet is awesome and worth the $28 per person (no kidding!) The food is wonderful and if you can sit and relax and enjoy the best view in the house (overlooking fountains and dolphin sculptures and the waves) you are doing what you came there for. The fresh fruit is delicious. We did the whole spa thing-the hydrotherapy and couples massage. If you are thinking of doing it, you should. When else will you be at one of the top ten spas in the world? Experience the luxury. All the spa prices on the island are high (and within 10 bucks of each other), you may as well do it at one of the #1 spots in the world. It is, indeed, an "over the top" spa experience. We ate at the four seasons (Ferraros) the meal was good, as I would expect, but not "exceptional". (I am a foodie.)The portions are on the smallish side and the price is consistent with the four seasons. View of the sun setting on the ocean is great though. Mama's fish house (on the road to Hana) had the best food on the island (and the largest price tag). It really is $16 for a cocktail! The desserts were amazing though, as well as the fresh fish caught locally. We did breakfast at the Maui Prince, the food was equal to the G.W. but the view was not. It is $20 if you stay at the hotel, $25 if you do not. The gem in Wailea was Tommy Bahama's cafe at the Wailea Shops. The food was great, the service was fine and the price was reasonable. We returned several times. The snorkeling in front of the Prince (Mekena Beach) had some great fish, and a turtle, but not as good as Black Rock in front of the sheraton in Kaanapali. Big beach is beautiful, and is a nice "walk" with your loved one if you are a good walker. I did not to leave any valuables in my car, but the parking lot is large, free, and the beach is powder sand. Skip the sugar museum (unless it is raining and you are bored.) It is below average. The G.W. was very expensive, but did deliver 5 star service. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant just too expensive”
Reviews.Author: alohaluv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as you expect for how much you pay for. We went to Japanese restaurant which offered only Buffet or Sushi bar. My husband is not so crazy about sushi, so we picked the buffet. For $54 they offered so little. Sashimi quality was good, but the rest were just like regular Chinese food. A big dissappointment for a restaurant in such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: badger06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days of our ten-day honeymoon at the Grand Wailea, and it was, quite simply, the best place we've ever stayed. Upon our arrival, the management informed us that we were being upgraded to Ho'olei, the brand-new complex of $3.5 million condos across the street. The condos at Ho'olei are nothing short of amazing - two levels with marble floors, glass walls with views of the ocean, upstairs and downstairs patios with seating and dining areas, fully stocked kitchen with granite countertops, elevator, garage, and private pool/hot tubs/workout facility. In addition, every condo is unique, and it is obvious that much care that went into furnishing and decorating these spaces. (However, we still had full access to the grounds of main resort , and visited frequently during our stay.) The grounds at Ho'olei and the Grand Wailea are breathtaking - everything is clean and extremely well-maintained, with luxurious greenery and beautiful statuary. The main activity pool is warm, spacious, and brilliantly designed so that you never feel crowded. (And we weren't the only adults trying out the water slides, water elevator, and rope swing!) The adults-only pool is continuously heated (like bathwater!), has incredible views of both the hotel and the ocean, and staff scrupulously maintains the 18+ age limit. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs. The beach is sparklingly clean, and chairs are readily available. The staff, both at Ho'olei and the Grand Wailea, was friendly, knowledgeable, and fully accommodating. I wonder if we were staying at the same resort as some of the other reviewers ... we commented several times at the high level of service. (For example, we visited the adult pool late at night, and Housekeeping was more than happy to find us poolside and bring us towels within 10 minutes of our phone call.) Given the enormous size of the resort, we were impressed at how frequently we ran into staff who went out of their way to make our stay wonderful - giving directions, sharing recommendations for dining or activities around the island, or stopping to pick us up in a golf cart to take us down to the beach. This is not a hotel where staff will continuously be at your elbow to assist you (we got lost on the way to the restaurants several times), but staff were readily available -and always knowledgeable- when we stopped to ask a question. And please don't forget your manners, or hesitate to strike up a conversation with staff - we got some great advice (and heard some great stories) from the bartender at the swim-up bar! The only "downside" we saw is that the resort is so beautiful and accommodating, you may forget to explore the Maui outside its grounds ... remember to get off the property and explore! However, this is an amazing destination for a luxury vacation to Maui - expensive, butworth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel but Worth the Price?”
Reviews.Author: erdocdrummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for 6 nights and stayed in an ocean view room in the Chapel Wing. The room overlooked the small chapel at the hotel where weddings take place. It is surrounded by a pond with giant fish that my kids loved to feed. We could also see some of the ocean. The gardens of the hotel are the highlight as they obviously spared no expense in landscaping the grounds. The hotel is a masterpiece. The open air lobby is magnificent and the fitness center is the nicest I have ever seen in a hotel. The problem is you pay a heavy price to stay here and I am not sure it is worth it. We booked our room through an opthalmology meeting that was there in order to get a meeting rate. We still paid 400 dollars a night, plus multiple fees were added on including an 18 dollar a day "resort fee" supposedly to cover our access to the swimming pools and fitness center. The food and drink prices are prohibitively expensive. They charged my children 8 dollars each for a frozen lemonade at the pool restaurant. A minimal lunch for 3 was over 70 dollars (at the pool). We ended up eating every meal at restaurants in Kihei. They even charged us 25 dollars to rent a small fridge for the week as the rooms have a fridge, but it is full of high priced snacks and drinks and is locked unless you opt for the "self service bar" option. The rooms were nice, but not exceptional for the price. The swimming pools were so cold that it was unpleasant to swim in them. There were no organized pool activities and no drink service at the pools. The beach was great and well maintained. The staff was pleasant but not overly friendly. The nicest person I met there was the maid for our room. They did respond quickly when or toilet clogged. The whole place had an air of pretentiousness about it. I think the only people who can afford it are foreigners who's currency is strong against the dollar. I struggled daily to find a parking place big enough for my rented minivan in the under sized self park garage that was quite a hike to my room. The garage by the front of the hotel is valet parking only. When I return to Maui I will stay somewhere more reasonable as the main attraction to the Grand Wailea is the many pools and its location. I think there are other hotels that would offer the same for less.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and average at best.”
Reviews.Author: reddyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for a conference that was being held here. Fortunately, we received a discounted rate because of the conference. I read some of the reviews before we went and I agree with the majority of them. The resort really charges for every little thing. They charge $25.00 daily as a resort fee. However, if you want to use an umbrella on the beach or sit by a covered area by the the pool you have to rent the umbrella for $35.00/day or pay $50.00 to sit under a covered chair. I would think that should be included as part of the resort fee. We all found this to be incredilbly tacky. In most resorts umbrellas are available on a first come first serve basis. Most of our friends found ourselves sitting on the grassy lawn which had numerous flies but happened to have shade because none of us could stomach the exorbitant umbrella fees. In general, there seemed to be a charge for every little thing and prices were excessive. The service and the people who work here were cordial and friendly but that doesn't compensate for the the excessive prices and poor policies the hotel operates under.

Reviews.Title: “Spa with coachroach! Rude Management, Poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Justiceshop
Reviews.Content: Took our own bags out of the car. No help with directions to the restaurant. Unsanitary spa. Force to look up at large cockroach during treatment, repeatedly requested a robe for my modest guest and repeatedly refused, be fore warned to wear your own bathing suite or be in an area naked with women with them on, told we were in an exclusive area for women then lead into a co-ed patio without warning. Poor service from spa & pool personnel. Pool employee looked into my private purse and asked for a cigarette. Insulted my appearance. Company attempted fraudulent charges on my credit card in the amount of $3333.33. I broke my cell phone when hotel blocked my account to use the phone over declined credit card which was declined by the credit card merchant over suspected fraud. Waken up with loud call from and off-site accounting at 0800 while a â€œprivacy pleaseâ€� was on my door. No toilet paper in the bathroom. Rude management. I was offered the following apology from the Managing Director, Mr. Matthew Bailey , â€œwhile my regaling you explanations for some of the incidents you raised might make me feel better, it will have little if any effect on your last impression of the Grand Wailea.â€� There was nothing to regale about the level of poor service we received. The Managing Directors response added insult to injury. My sister and I had to make many arrangements to be there. I had to get child care as I am a single mother of three, for 2 night and three days (34 hours), my sister and I both had to juggle to get time together with our jobs, I paid her flight from LV, lost data on my phone. The gall of such a response. It was more then an issue of money it was an issue of priceless personal time. The Fours Seasons next door is 10000 times better and the Marriott is way better too. I will NEVER stay at the Grand Wailea, at least under it's present management! A free (2) night offer from management to compensate me is like asking someone to return to a horror show for a second viewing when they bought a ticket to a romance. They really put a great name like Hilton & Waldorf to shame! Aesthetics are beautiful at the GW but management leads by example which makes the service behind the scenes rude and unprofessional. By no means a representation of Maui or the true Aloha spirit that does occur at other service providers. Free to walk the shops and take pictures of the grounds of the GW but book your stay at a hotel that cares about you, just about any place but the Grand Wailea. I've stayed at Westin, Marriott, Ritz, Four Seasons, Hyatt, Sheraton, Royal Hawaiian, Hana, Kannapali Alii... too many to name on Maui let alone the whole state and they all treated me fantastic, only the 4 Seasons was the very best, giving credit where it is due, with the Sheraton taking a close second! If you want to stay at a great Hilton property in Hawaii, stay at the Hilton Waikaloa, 5 stars, it's on the Big Island, incredibly breath taking, swin with dolphins and will most certainly be a time you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Spa w/ Cockroach! Poor Managment”
Reviews.Author: Justiceshop
Reviews.Content: Took our own bags out of the car. No help with directions to the restaurant. Unsanitary spa. Force to look up at large cockroach during treatment, repeatedly requested a robe for my modest guest and repeatedly refused, be for warned to wear your own bathing suite or be in an area naked with women with them on, told we were in an exclusive area for women then lead into a co-ed patio. Poor service from spa & pool personnel. Pool employee looked into my private purse and asked for a cigarette. Insulted my appearance. Company attempted fraudulent charges on my credit card in the amount of $3333.33. I broke my cell phone when hotel blocked my account to use the phone over declined credit card which was declined by the credit card merchant over suspected fraud. Waken up with loud call from accounting at 0800 while a â€œprivacy pleaseâ€� was on my door. No toilet paper in the bathroom. Rude management. I was offered the following apology â€œwhile my regaling you explanations for some of the incidents you raised might make me feel better, it will have little if any effect on your last impression of the Grand Wailea.â€� There was nothing to regale about the level of poor service we received. The Managing Directors response added insult to injury. My sister and I had to make many arrangements to be there. The Fours Seasons next door is 100 times better and the Marriott is great. I will NEVER stay at the Grand Wailea again even with a free (2) night offer from management, like asking someone to return to a horror show for a second viewing when they bought a ticket to a romance. They really put a great name like Hilton to shame! Aesthetics are beautiful but management leads by example which makes the service behind the scenes rude and unprofessional. Free to walk the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings?”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My family last stayed at the Grand around 4 years ago. We go to locations all around the world, and have always compared our resort stays against the Grand. This year we decided to make the trip back to Hawaii (from Atlanta), specifically to stay at the Grand Wailea. We knew about the pool closing in advance so booked after construction was finished, so the pools were great. The grounds, and the Wailea coast is drop dead beautiful. Unfortunately, the service thru out our stay was lackluster to say the best. The checkin was awful (I have never experienced such terse hotel personnel at checkin), pool service was off/on, when the parking attendant thought I was a local he treated me like trash (although I parked a van there everyday paying my $20/day fee), pool security took our belongings off the chaises while we were swimming with the kids (something about leaving your chaises for 60 minute chaise policy?). It just did not have the same "feeling" regarding the service we experienced 4 years ago. I am not sure if the Hiltons managed this hotel back in 2004, but it speaks volumes when Paris visits she stays at the Four Seasons next door? and swims in the pools at the Grand? If just the service got better (someone needs to be fired)...the facilities in my point of view are still fantastic, and the coast of Wailea cannot be beat. The kids had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service for the Price”
Reviews.Author: seenf44
Reviews.Content: This place is stunning, and absolutely massive. The service, however, was consistently poor for a hotel of this supposed quality. A rude waitress who forgot to order one companion's entree, and then delivered it 10 minutes after the others with no apology or comment. At Sunday brunch I was seated in the first seating to a filthy table including a stained, used napkin lying on my place mat. We had to request that the hostess clean it up, and despite the great spread of food, the waitress was pleasant but incompetent (for buffet service no less.) Save your money, stay elsewhere (or at the Four Seasons next door if you want quality service,) and just visit the place, act like you belong there and wander around. It's over the top, but worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Definitively not worth it”
Reviews.Author: JeanMars
Reviews.Content: Ok, let's start by the nice things : gardens are wonderful, the hotel itself is great; there are many arts (Botero...) all over the hotel. Rooms are big, nice and beds are very comfortable. Restaurants are expensive but of good quality. Now the dark side of this hotel: - Be prepared to pay for every single move they make : - Arrive late after a long trip and didn't pay attention to that nice guy saying he will park your car for you? Later on the ticket he gave you, you can realize that will cost $20 per day (without gratuity...) ! - Your luggages are late? No problem, they will move them to your room as soon as they arrive from the airport...and they don't tell you will get charged for $10... - You find a bootle of water nicely arranged with 2 glasses around? Be sure to check the (hidden) side of the label : it costs you $6.5 just to get some water! - Don't know where to find material to get a bath? Just look at the bathroom shelf, oh my God! This costs at least $20 the bottle! If you don't take care of these details, this could easily increase your bill by 30% a day! I. Thinking of the existing high room rate, this is similar to robbery! - Service is not proper for the standing they claim : - I asked the lobby if they could call the airport for my late luggages; answer : I give you the number, YOU call... - Due to pool renovation, room was very noisy. Being awaken at 5:30 AM on every morning is NOT acceptable for this class of hotel whatever the discount is. - Think that noise is only due to renovation? Bad bet: in the middle on one night, a familly arrived in the room next door and settled up : we had the impression they were unpacking in our room! - Internet was not working on my computer, but it worked on any other hotel - I complained about all of this when check-out; response : "Sorry". Translation : "We don't care". If you plan to stay at this hotel for whatever reason, I highly suggest you consider booking elsewhere. The best thing to do is a walk inside the hotel for the arts and gardens, that you can do by booking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jend1215
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for a romantic vacation. The hotel is not the greatest for romantic getaways because there are kids everywhere. The entrance and grounds are exquisite! We were stunned when we pulled up to it. The hotel is VERY expensive! The food is great, but this is not an all inclusive, so watch what you spend because everything adds up. The room was gorgeous and so was our view of the ocean. The pool area was stunning but WAY to crowded, screaming kids everywhere. There were some nice swim up bars but $15 for a drink? Come on...I know this is Maui, but really? The beach was nice, the water a bit cold and rough but overall very nice. The sand was not white and actually had a weird red tint to it and everything costs extra here, we were jumping on a water raft in the ocean later to find out that jumping on the raft for an hour costs $10!!!!! Beautiful resort, but not worth the price, would be worth it if it was all inclusive!

Reviews.Title: “Spa is getting very OLD”
Reviews.Author: sosehaku
Reviews.Content: I didnt stay at the hotel this time as the pool was being redone ( and I am glad I didnt). This is a case of " what used to be". It used to be thee place to stay and spa but not anymore. The hotel along with the spa is getting very tired. My Massage was great ( thanks Dawn) but that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea on Maui remains my family's favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyrockNy
Reviews.Content: I have gone to Hawaii with my wife and family several times, and we've been fortunate to have traveled over the years with my now teenage kids to some nice hotels, but The Grand Wailea on Maui remains my family's favorite hotel. The service was the best we've ever had anywhere, the hotel is beautiful and the beach was excellent. It's just a great spot. My only minor complaint is that the gym is relatively small - it does have 2 rooms but I found it a little claustrophobic. If you go, either stay on the floor that offers breakfast on your floor - Napua? - or try one of the residences just off the hotel's main property if you need a kitchen; my friends did this and said it was great and cost effective. By comparsion, we went The Grand Hyatt on Kauai a year or two ago and we did not like it. It was too man made, too fake and they did not have beach chairs on the beach, which was a huge drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, service was dismal”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review a year later but feel the need to do so since I found this site! Last December, I was in need of a getaway and several friends of mine had stayed at the GW years ago and said it was amazing. So I booked 10 days. The property was amazing. The spa was gorgeous but if you get a massage they get you in and out of there like a factory, fyi. My beef was with the lack of service! Checkin was fine but things started going downhill once I got to my room. There was -- I'm not making this up -- a piece of chewed gum stuck to my headboard. I don't know if it was the past guest or the maid's herself. Then I paid $50 for a mini cabana by the ocean only to have no service whatsoever. I had to keep getting up to walk to the bar -- through the kiddie pool, mind you, and over a bridge -- I had to REALLY work for those margaritas! Everything I called from my room for I had to wait for the phone to ring 10 times, sometimes it was never answered. The place seemed very shortstaffed and I was disappointed overall. But here's the FUNNY part... So finally the fifth night i was getting pretty unhappy and took a walk down the beach path and realized that next door was the Four Seasons. I walked into the gorgeous property and up to the front desk and inquired about a room. For just a $100 more a night then i was paying at the GW I got a gorgeous room with ocean view much closer to the ocean than at the GW and they treated me like a QUEEN. The service there was incomparable. So I go back to the GW and tell the front desk person "I'd like to check out early" with no explanation. ***She didn't even ask if I was leaving!*** ! She didn't ask how my stay was. She didn't care! So then I asked if she would get me a car please. She did ask if I was going to the airport. "No," I replied. "I'm moving next door to the Four Seasons." She didn't say anything then either. I wanted to shout "Does anybody here give a [--]" Anyway my stay at the Four Seasons was AMAZING and I'm writing you from there right now as I am here again this December. They have won me over for life! (PS -- I just walked by the Grand Wailea for old times' sake and the pool looks like a nuclear war zone! People are stacked on top of each other on the lawn in chairs and they look pissed!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea was Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Hell0maui
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Wailea was fantastic and made our first trip to Hawaii very memorable. Upon check in, we were upgraded to the Napua Tower, without even asking! This exclusive room came complete with a free continental breakfast each morning and open bar and appetizers every evening. The spread of food was unbelieveable at each meal. The room also included a wonderful ocean view. The property was immaculate and we noticed staffers cleaning day and night. Our room was very nice and felt clean at all times. We didn't spend much time in the pool, but the beach was awesome. The only downside that I can see was the lack of affordable food service on the property. Wailea in general does not have a lot of affordable restaurants, mostly upscale. Although, the parking garage is quite a bit of a walk, it is free. The parking stalls are very narrow, and don't take up 2 stalls, or you will be ticketed! In general, highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay if deeply discounted.”
Reviews.Author: TippyGirlTwo
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Wailea since 1993 and have always wanted to stay at the Grand Wailea. This year my conference had it's meetings at the hotel. Usually I have always stayed at the now defunct Renaissance Hotel 2 hotels north. For all the hype I've heard and the prices, I was expecting to be wowed. Unfortunately I was underwowed. I am a Diamond member within the Hilton Hotel system and the front desk notified me that I was upgraded to a deluxe ocean view for which I am grateful. When I asked where self parking was, they told me "a quarter mile down the road". This wasn't as bad as it sounded as you can walk most of it through the hotel. The bad part is there is very little parking and the spaces are sized for Mini Coopers. I was glad I turned down the upgrade to a Cadillac as I would never have parked. Vallet parking is $20/night. I arrived to my room on the 7th floor of the Wailea wing at the distal third of the wing. Nice view of the ocean and quiet until last night when a noisy family arrived above me at midnight. The room was spacious and has a nice marble bathroom and tub. 2 robes are provided, but no slippers. I've never been to a Hilton here in the states or around the world that didn't have slippers. When I called housekeeping they said slippers "were only for VIPs", but they brought me some anyway. Being a diamond member (which is the highest level of Hilton's frequent guest program) apparently didn't count. The Waldorf-Astoria collection is part of the Hilton Family. The coffee in the room and at the Grand Dining room is truly awful. The second worst coffee I've ever had after a Holiday Inn in Souzhou, China. My next problem was the internet connection. I spent about 3 hours with Lodgenet (the hotel's internet support in Atlanta, GA) and 2 of the engineering employees here at the hotel. Finally, we took my computer to the next room that worked perfectly and the engineer took that modem and placed it in my room and I finally had service. The engineer here at the hotel didn't seem to understand computers very well, and the support staff at Lodgenet couldn't figure out the issue. The breakfast buffet came with my room and the setting is beautiful overlooking the grounds and ocean. A egg bar is there for personalized eggs of any sort. There is a Japanese bar with miso soup, rice and condiments. Hot foods with sablefish alternating without another fish which are both overcooked and dry. Sliced potatoes alternating with hash browns, Bacon, and a meat hash. There is also waffles, fruit selections, salad ingredients and some really good smoked salmon daily. Breads are massed produced and taste like it. The buffet is $28/person.The day I arrived the major pools were shut down for renovation and only the Hibiscus Pool is currently open. There are 2 jacuzzis with this open until 10PM. The beach is one of the best on Maui. Unfortunately, being at the front of the property from the pool down to the beach is also the area that you can hear the generators for the workers. They are there everyday during all daylight hours. If you want to enjoy the beach and not hear construction noise you can walk to the Fairmont further south (the Four Seasons next store shares the same beach and has the same noise pollution). Otherwise, you can go north to the beach that was in front of the Renaissance. This is pretty deserted because the hotel is now closed. The staff is friendly and the housekeeping staff is cleaning my rooms well. As the previous reviewer noted, I also haven't received bar soap since my last one was used. The scented Mango/coconut lotion/shampoo etc smells good, but the shampoo made my hair feel "rough" and not clean. Overall, I am enjoying my stay after getting around all the hiccups, but to me the physical plant is similar to what the Renaissance was, not anything better. I checked out the Marriott next store and was disappointed. They had sold the Renaissance and moved here, but the rooms, amenities, quality is not at the level the Renaissance was. The Grand Spa they say is rated the best spa in the US by Conde Nast. Once again I was expecting to be wowed, and wasn't. It is very similar to the California Burke William Spas, but more expensive of course. The terme room is a nice concept, but when you think about 5 or 6 bathtubs with different solutions (like mud, seaweed etc) into which multiple people get in and out of after soaking for any length of time, it's like sharing your bathtub at home with multiple people you don't know.

Reviews.Title: “convoluted layout”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: stayed here 5 nights as part of a medical conference. we were warned in advance that the pool would be renovated and only the Hibiscus Pool would be available. rates were adjusted accordingly and breakfast was included. Found the layout of the resort to be unnecessarily convoluted. It takes at least 10 minutes to get to the beach or the parking structure. The free parking is a difficult facility with very narrow parking spots and no elevator. Getting luggage to your room is strenuous. t There is limited food and bar service--few eating choices. the Kula is open until 1pm. It is necessary to leave the facility for meals. On the plus side, the beach is beautiful and excellent for watching sunsets. The rooms are well maintained and the bathroom is spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Great Wailea”
Reviews.Author: DashaDumov
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my Thanksgiving vacation from Great Wailea and it was just perfect! I do agree with every word in the previous review: I had nice, very clean and very well furnished oceanview room; bathroom was very clean and big; nice balcony overlooking the Japanese garden; hotel staff were very helpful and friendly with many requests me and my friends had. The kids pool area has 7 pools, connected by water slides and it's an absolute heaven for kids and it was even fun for me too. Grand Wailea has a separate pool area just for adults so if you are not traveling with children you would not be annoyed by somebody else's kids screaming and running next to you. And don't forget a very nice and easy access to the beach right from the pool area (don't be fooled by great pictures from the hotel's websites, Marriott for example - even though this hotel stays right on the ocean it does not have a beach! Instead of the nice and soft sand they have huge rocks and it's impossible to take a swim - you would have to go someplace else). I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends! The only thing I did not like was a daily resort fee in the amount of $25.00 and I hope they will get rid of that somehow.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissBigDee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Grand Wailea Hotel. I was very worried before we left, because there are quite a few negative reviews about the property and I was afraid that our trip to paradise would be a bust. It absolutely was perfect. I found the staff helpful and friendly. Whatever request we had, it was cheerfully and quickly granted. The property was very clean and well maintained. Our room was large, and we were extremely pleased with the upgrade to oceanview. The hotel grounds are expansive and it can seem overwhelming at first trying to figure your way around. I was concerned that being there over Thanksgiving would yield a big crowd of screaming kids, but the pool areas and the beach were pleasant and happy - family oriented to be sure, but not annoying. No trouble getting beach chairs, towels or with finding a space to sun yourself for the day. We did self parking and had no trouble at all - I thought from reading the reviews that the parking would be miles away from the hotel - self parking was an easy thing to manage, even with luggage and lots of towels and bags. One of the best travel experiences that I ever had. We are planning to return for our family vacation soon! My only gripe is the 25.00 per day resort fee. I would like to see that somehow absorbed in the cost of the room - it mars just a bit of the gracious feel of the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools!”
Reviews.Author: airstreamfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great pools, which our small children really enjoyed. We spent a lot of time in the pools, as they preferred them to the beach. The beach was calm in the mornings but as the wind picked up in the afternoon it became a little rougher. The waves were really small, in May, so they weren't able to boogie board. But, the small waves made it great for them to swim and wade about. The staff was very friendly. There were always staff cleaning the hotel. There were lots of staff about in the evenings, when we were outside, which made us feel safe. But, the concierge wasn't helpful for planning outings off of the island. It was obvious that they wanted us to stay in Maui. We upgraded rooms to an ocean view in the tower. We left a recently renovated room to an ocean view room that was outdated. It had a lovely view but was in need of some renovation and TLC in general. I swear the towels were nicer in the original room too! The lobby is outstanding. I cannot think of a more beautiful lobby than this one. My children loved watching it rain into the lobby. It rained one day, and the rest of the days were perfect. We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel but often went out for dinner. We ate room service once for dinner and it was okay, nothing incredible. The fruit at the hotel restaraunts was very fresh, and the pineapple was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kara77
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and had a terrific experience! Great pool area especially for kids. The spa was amazing, a must do. The rooms were large and spotless! We loved EVERYTHING about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WIll it ever get better?”
Reviews.Author: vacation123123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10 years ago when we got married. Even back then the service wasn't very good. This time we renewed our vows at the chapel but stayed at the Seasons. We still spent on the spa and renewal ceremony about 5000. We asked if we could swim in the pool between are rehearsal and our spa appointment even offering to pay. They said no but we could eat at one or their restaurants and stare at it. I'm not making this up. I went to the desk to see if this was for real. I was told all the managers were in a meeting. The same meeting they were in 10 years ago when I had a problem and needed a manager. Maybe after another 10 years of this meeting they will be able to fix the problems with this hotel. Stay at the Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: MaJolie72
Reviews.Content: We were in Hawaii for two weeks and wished we could've stayed at this property for the entire time - not just the five days that we were there. When we arrived, we were surprised to find we had been upgraded to a beautiful suite with an ocean view. We spent the first evening just relaxing in our room! The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. If we had a request, it was met in short order with a smile. In fact, I left some items in my room after we checked out and they were mailed to me without me having to ask (in fact, I had forgotten I had left them.) We had dinner on the property once (a restaurant surrounded by a koi pond), appetizers and cocktails at the bar, and one full breakfast. All meals were very well prepared and, again, the service was excellent. A less expensive, yet tasty, option for breakfast or lunch is the little cafe located amidst the hotel's many interesting shops. In addition to all this, the hotel hosts daily free activities (i.e. yoga on the beach) and the concierges are very informative. They sent us to Mama's Fish House on the North Shore for lunch. It was very pricey but we enjoyed the best meal of our entire vacation here. We also rented surf boards and tried paddle surfing. That was lots of fun and the rental staff was very helpful! The pool at the hotel is great - we felt like kids again going down the water slide and swinging from the rope swing - and the beach is really nice too. You can see sea turtles and tropical fish just a few feet off of the shoreline. There is also a shore walk that offers great views of the coast in either direction from the hotel. We hope to revisit this wonderful spot again someday. We stayed in three higher end hotels during our vacation and this was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - best place for families”
Reviews.Author: mskrisanda
Reviews.Content: The pool was the best. Best for families with kids - mine were 6, 11, 12. It's a little crazy for little ones with multiple levels, slides -- we spent a lot of time chasing our youngest, but for older children it will keep them busy all day. Room had a few small issues but overall very nice. VERY expensive. Recommend going to the grocery store up the street and stocking up. Spa was amazing. Loved the kids packages. Couldn't think of a better place for families to stay. Next door to this is the Four Seasons and Fairmont -- we walked over and they were very boring compared to this hotel. If you have older children and are comparing don't even think about staying at those other hotels. The Humuhumu restaurant was fantastic as was the sushi restaurant. Fun kids club -- they took the kids out on the beach at night to catch sand crabs and have a huge movie theater.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: PolishPrincess81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not cheap, but you get what you pay for. When picking our hotel we noticed a huge difference in what you would get for $100 or $200/night less. It's like night and day. If you're going to Hawaii, you have to know that everything is expensive. You also should plan ahead and decide where you want to spend the bulk of your money. For us, we wanted a beautiful place to stay and to be able to do lots of activities. We stayed here on our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we automatically got upgraded to a nicer room. Our room had that nice Polynesian feel and backed onto one of the pools. We were on the ground floor, which turned out to be really nice because we could leave our room and head to the pool right from our sliding door. The hotel grounds are like nothing I've ever seen before. They have multiple pools on different ground levels with slides going from one pool to another. They have beautiful flowers everywhere and tropical birds chirping all the time. There is not enough space to describe it all so I'm going to post a few of my pictures. They have a few restaurants at the hotel but we only took advantage of the Cafe for breakfast. They have muffins, toast and typical egg breakfasts there. Aside from that we didn't eat at our hotel because we saw the prices online and we didn't want to spend a lot on food. Instead, we took advantage of some local places. The room was nice but we didn't want to spend all of our time in the room. We used the pools and slides a lot, and spent a good deal of time on the beach. The water is really warm and the sand is very fine. It's beautiful. We spoiled ourselves and took advantage of the spa there. We got a couple's massage. It was pricey, about $400 for the both of us but well worth it. When you book it, they ask the both of you to come in an hour earlier so that you can take advantage of their soaking spas. They had a mud bath, a papaya bath, aromatherapy bath and two other that I can't remember right now. It was so nice and relaxing. I know people think that staying here is going to cost a lot, and they are right but you really feel that you're getting what you've paid for. We didn't feel guilty at all for indulging because everything was so worth it. I would go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bubbaF16
Reviews.Content: I took a party to 12 to the Grand Wailea for a three night stay. I do not have a single gripe and I do not have room to write about all the great happenings at their hotel. We received a free upgrade to a suite which was unbelievable. The pools could have satisfied us for recreation the entire time. The food was scrumptious. The concierge set us up on a snorkel trip that blows Hanauma Bay out of the water. The best part was the staff. The staff is the most polite and accommodating that I have ever seen. Oh, I did think of one negative...both my wife and sister cried the first night back home in the real world. TRIP OF A LIFETIME.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: sillygit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea during a conference he attended. To be honest, was dreading staying there based on reading the horrible reviews all summer. After a very long and arduous journey from Boston, arrived and were a bit disappointed to not be given the requested ocean view room--as well the room we were given had 2 queens instead of a king. However, upon seeing the gorgeous room we were given, we were immediately delighted with the room we got. It was one of the newly remodeled rooms and it was really beautiful-large, nicely decorated, extremely clean with a fabulous bathroom and a lovely balcony. The beds were very comfortable---loved the feather beds on the mattress. We were in the Molokai wing facing out toward the guest parking lot yet still having a slight view of the ocean. It was a perfect location because it was convenient to get to our rental car in the parking lot as well as a very short walk to the beach, pool, lobby and even gym. The hotel is stunningly beautiful--the entrance lobby is open to the outside and ornately decorated, and filled with lovely fountains and pretty gardens. As well, the hotel has an impressive art collection out in the open--loved the Legers! The outside gardens are just as beautiful. The pools, the beach everything is just lovely. Sept. must be the best time to visit as the hotel was not crowded in the least. You never had to hunt for a place to sit around the pools or on the beach. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the housecleaning staff did a wonderful job. While at the hotel, I took an intro diving course which I really enjoyed--it enabled me to join my husband on a boat dive. We also snorkled a lot, and there was a lot to see just snorkling off the hotel's beach. We also drove to Makena and snorkled off the beach in TurtleTown which was awesome. We also took advantage of the gym--a really nice facility--excellent equipment and spinning classes. We didn't eat at the hotel--aside from getting coffee and muffins at the Kula cafe in the morning. There are so many fabulous restaurants in Kihei and much cheaper as well. Our favorite was Sansei--best sushi we've ever had. I can understand how a visit the the Grand Wailea could easily turn wretched--it appears in the busy months it does turn into a Disney World of sorts and if one had to put up with huge crowds and screaming kids, I don't think it would be so pleasant. Particularly when it is so extremely expensive. As well, while we were there, the staff was plentiful and constantly around, cleaning or tending the gardens etc. I can see the staff being overwhelmed with a full hotel. We got a considerable discount because of the conference and a weeks stay still ran us $3000.00--this is not a cheap place to stay. Luckily our experience was a wonderful one. For the money it costs to stay there, everyone's visit should be as wonderful. So if you go, don't go in the busy season, make sure you get a renovated room and enjoy to the fullest! Also--skip the drive to Hana--it is very boring!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: julian0819
Reviews.Content: The exterior or the grounds of Grand Wailea is beautiful! The moment you drive up you feel that you have arrived in paradise as you watch their mini waterfall. The hotel has all the amenities you need, just a walk to the pools, beach, nearby hotel restaurants, spa, & water activities. With all these positives the negative would be the price and the room. I think the price you pay should be relative to what you get. The hotel is overrated. It seems like they put all the money, near $500 a night they charge the customers with the upkeep of the exterior of the hotel and fell short with the actual rooms. We were assigned a room that was a bit of a walk to the beach and pool area. Our room's view was facing the self parking. If you are a very light sleeper like I am, try not to get a room assigned on this side. In the morning you can kind of hear the trucks making their deliveries around 6am! The room itself, looks outdated. It is not terrible, its just descent. We expected more for the price. The hotel should put the money renovating their rooms. In regards to food, the only time we ate at the hotel was for breakfast from the cafe. The food lacked flavor. I ordered a waffle and my husband ordered a breakfast platter. It consists of eggs, sausage, bread roll, and a cup of rice. We didn't even order any drinks and we paid about $38. Again, the price is definitely NOT relative to the overall stay. My suggestion is to book a room at a nearby hotel and walk over to Grand Wailea to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: jmbatl
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to add a review of this grand dame, as there are so many negative reviews here. I, too, was a bit nervous about what to expect after reading about all the bad experiences. Our five nights at the GW were courtesy of HHonors (250,000 points). When you use HHonors points, the resort fee is waived. As a Diamond member, I also received an upgrade from a terrace view to a deluxe ocean view, and a $40 restaurant credit (which we ended up not using). I believe the fact that I was not paying for this hotel changed my perception of it, but I can tell you that our stay was amazing on so many levels. We were told by many that September is their slowest month. There were no battles for pool chairs or long lines or loud youngsters. The weather was absolute perfection. I don't think I'd ever stay at the GW during the high season. September, however, is a perfect time to plan a trip. The lobby and lobby bar is so overwhelming and absolutely beautiful. We did NOT receive the welcome lei. Just seemed like no one remembered to do it. At check in, we were told the only rooms available had two queen beds. We wanted (and I thought I had guaranteed) a king. After some back and forth, the front desk agent told us the two beds could be pushed together and they had special linens to turn it into a 'California king.' Okay. We'll try that. This ended up being one of the funniest and most memorable parts of our vacation. The combined beds were absolutely enormous! One huge, supersized bed in the middle of the room! It was unusual at first, but very comfortable and by the end of the trip we were spoiled by such excess. The room was very comfortable (although we were not in a newly renovated room). We had a beautiful, big lanai with the most spectacular view. The bathroom was huge and luxurious. Did the room show its age? A bit, I guess, but the room seemed well cared for and not particularly worn or dated. In fact, we didn't even realize we were in an older room until we saw the flat-panel TVs in the new rooms. The bath gel, shampoo, conditioner was wonderful. The pool and common areas were also really amazing. We enjoyed time at the pool almost every day. There was no pressure to arrive early. We would get to the pool at 11a, or sometimes even after Noon. Chairs were readily available. We always sat near the adult pool and it was a calm and pleasant oasis. Service was prompt and friendly and the drinks were potent! The slides were fun, and worth trying once even if it's not your thing. We did not have any meals at the hotel. Too many better options outside. We did have a small breakfast at the coffee shop one day, and it was fine. We might have had a snack by the pool. We drank plenty, at the pool and the lobby bar. The bartenders were real friendly and talkative. We enjoyed their company -- not too intrusive, just the right mix of professionalism and friendliness. Also, we enjoyed $5 mai tais at the Humuhumu bar between 5p and 6p. Great for sunsets. We did enjoy an amazing afternoon at the spa. Everything said about the spa is right on. The terme treatment was really different and was an added value. My massage was great and totally worth the cost. We ended up canceling a second round of spa appointments later in the week at the Four Seasons because we were still so relaxed from our Spa Grande experience. Never had a problem getting the car from valet. We called and it was there waiting for us by the time we arrived. Asked a couple of simple questions to the concierge, and they seemed friendly and competent. We rented snorkel gear one day and swam right off the beach. The staff was very friendly and at $8 for an hour, it was a pretty good deal. One key to enjoying your stay is to use your feet and walk to the neighboring resorts. We visited the Four Seasons a couple of times. We had a nice breakfast there and the most AMAZING dinner at Spago (followed by drinks at the bar). We walked to the Shops at Wailea for breakfast at Longhi's. We drove into Kihei for the most amazing sushi at Sensei. The hotel's own dining options weren't really appealing in the face of so many other great options outside. Another key to enjoying your stay is to EXPECT everything to be very expensive. I get the sense that a lot of reviewers have a negative experience because of the cost of everything. Yes, everything costs a LOT -- it's Maui! If paying $12 or $15 for a drink will ruin your vacation, this is simply not the place for you. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the GW. Visit during the slow month and use HHonors points, and you'll really have a once in a lifetime experience at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “showing its age”
Reviews.Author: stray1001
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference so we did not pay the usual rates. Although it has beautiful pools and lovely scenery (especially the beach-side sunset), I would not go back if it weren't for business, for a few reasons that are probably impossible for the hotel to improve on without a major makeover: firstly, the rooms are very very noisy -- thin walls (I could hear the couple next door planning their itinerary, as well as their television; even the wheels of the bellboy's cart were audible, and I am not usually a light sleeper). Secondly, the place is showing its age (mouldy balconies, bird-dropping-stains). thirdly, you need to walk a really long distance to get around -- the front desk, the eating areas, the pick-up points (more than one), the pools -- are all far apart, and confusingly not on the same floor. That's tiring if you have children and / or elderly parents. Service was by and large impeccable (except for one concierge who couldn't answer even basic questions about touring, whom I never identified because he wouldn't give me his name on the phone), although, as everyone else has mentioned, there are about seven items that appear on your room bill each day (tips for the staff are taxed!). However, that does not make up for the poor sleep and long travel times (within the hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “Impressed Overall”
Reviews.Author: orca106
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived there were cars waiting to pull up to the valet. We knew that the garage was free so we were just waiting to pull up to find out where it was. They did look at us as if we were crazy because we didn't want to pay the specfy $20 valet charge but so what. So we pulled around just enough to let our bags out so my boyfriend could park the car as I wait and we got hounded to give them our keys.
