We told them what we were doing but didn't want to listen, just wanted the keys. I got annoyed at this point, just listen!!Geez, he made it a bigger deal then what it was. So if you want to avoid all that just got up to the street light after the sign to the hotel and turn. You won't get you lei greeting, but even getting dropped off in the front I dfidn't get mine and everyone I saw coming in after me didn't get there's either. They were to busy to notice. The check in was fast and our room was ocean front view. Not bad I suppose, i would have perferred to go higher but those were different class I heard. Besides that wasn't sure but they were updating all of the rooms. So maybe they weren't available. We stayed at the pool. I am not so much a pool person but really enjoyed it. The lazy river to the slides and the the bar pool. It was all really impressive. The best on the strip of hotels I would have to stay. We went walking past a few other hotels as well as stoped in the Marriot for the Luau and the Prine for Snorkel and all there pools were NOTHING in comparrison to this one. Kid friendly. I was a bit word reading about that thinking was my romantic vacation going to be ruined by a bunch of out of control kids. No, not at all. It was down season so I am not sure if that polay a part but it was perfect time for us to go out of the year. I read about how hard it is to get a seat at this pool, it was not so hard at all for us. We ate at the Humuhumunukunukuapua'a, there food was really delish! It was off the chart but nothing to complain about either. They also make you pay a $25a day fee for cleaning which I was already aware of from reading reviews previously. So I made sure to take advantage of them cleaning the room everyday. No problems with that and they did a good job. The bed was super comfy but the pillows really sucked. I hated them! Also, FYI...around 5AM every morning the birds out front would all chirp their hearts away. It was so bad I seriously couldn't fall back to sleep. SO if your a light sleeper you might want to find a way to not have your room where the tree's are. To be honest, I don't really see so muhc of the point of wasting mor emoney on a ocean view. The ground is cheaper, closer to whereever you want to walk to (especially the pool) and you get a nicer TV. Don't know how that worked out but they had way nicer TV's!! Prices are high here...but you have to let that go and just enjoy it for what it is. I did afterall get my lei. I wanted it so I walked up to them and asked for it, lol. Whatever, I was happy again once I got it. Overall, I know this was a great hotel to stay at. Especially if your paying with a deal to get in. If all at regular price then I would have paid to stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sep 2nd to Sept 8th as our first leg of our honeymoon. We booked the hotel with my Hilton Honour points (300,000 for 6 nights). We did not have to pay the 25/day resort charge as it was included in the points. Check in was easy - we got upgraded to an deluxe ocean room (as the points get you a terrace room) - not sure if the upgrade was b/c of the Hilton Diamond or b/c of our honeymoon but either way, I was happy. We got room 8081 - and it has a perfect view of the ocean - it was smack dab in the middle - we had one of the best views I believe - the room was spacious and the bathroom huge! You could tell it was a bit dated but it was clean and still very elegant. The pools were amazing - since we were there in low season, the pools were basically empty everytime we went. My husband loved the slides, lazy rivers, tarzan rope, etc etc. We were like little kids going on all the "rides". We usually spent part of the later afternoon as during the day we went out to explore the island. We ate at the Humuhumu restaurant one night - we were given a 40 coupon for being Hilton Diamond members - the meal was pretty good - nothing exceptional but nothing horrible either. The total bill after the discount was about 70 which was one appetizer, 2 main courses and dessert. I dont think the prices were that crazy. I have travelled a lot and you come to expect that hotels do you charge a lot so i dont think they were out of line for the prices. I almost found them quite reasonable, except breakfast....26 per person??that's crazy! We did rent a fridge for the week at 25 for the week so we could have breakfast in our room on the balcony. It wokred out well as we bought cereal, milk, yogurts, fruit and plastic bowls and cutlery and we were able to have awesome breakfast right in the room. Room service was awesome. Our room was always cleaned by 12-1pm and it was done well- for one of our turn down services, they filled our tub with bubbles and flowers, had towels in the shape of swans and also made a heart with flowers on our bed. I suspect this was b/c of our honeymoon and it was a great surprise. We also had 2 sessions at the Spa grande. We had body scrubs and duo massages on a seperate occasions. We were then able to enjoy the therme baths tiwce. Overall it was nice. It was VERY expensive and I dont know if I would pay for that again. perhaps I dont really enjoy the "spa" as much as other people but it was a great treat I suppose anyway. The internet was included - but it was PAINfully slow. I gues you don't go on vacation to be on the internet but when I wanted to look something up quickly, it was very annoying. We did the valet parking on one night and then decided to self park - our room was equal distant from the valet and the self park so walking to the self park was not a huge issue. The card slider in the self park doesn't work very well so something we spent 5 minutes just trying to get in! But it worth saving the 20 bucks +tip a day and spending it elsewhere. Overall, I thought we got a great deal out of the hotel as we didn't really pay for another other than the spa. I was pleased with the upgrade and that we were treated well even though we weren't really paying customers. I dont know if I would pay 500-600 per night for this hotel - at that price I would stay at the Four Seasons as I have heard great things about them - I would maybe pay 300 per night for this hotel but that's about it. I can see how people complain about being nickled and dimed everywhere - I mean you can basically avoid a lot of it but with a resort of this size and "prestige" and price - I would expect more.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trvlbg123
Reviews.Content: This resort was absolutely amazing! We were curious after reading other reviews about how the different elements of the resort would be compared to other visitors experiences. We travel often and we were VERY impressed. We were welcomed as we stepped out of our car with a Lei greeting. Our room was beautiful. Service was great. Valet always had our car ready (we would call a few minutes ahead of time before we needed to leave). Granted it is not a brand new resort- they are updating various areas (the Asian restaurant was being remodeled, so it was closed), but overall the hotel did not look rundown at all. Maybe someone who really really looks for details could tell certain things, but as normal everyday travelers- we can't complain! We never had to wait to eat at any of the restaurants, and although they were expensive, they were all very good, and the service was fantastic! And, there were always chairs at the pools and beach available. I can see that if someone travels during the very busy times (peak vacation times) that may be a different case, as could be expected. We seemed to practically have the place to ourselves, and it was wonderful. I would recommend the Grand Wailea to anyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: I was beginning to wonder whether we had made the right choice after seeing that this hotel had fallen so much in rankings. I'm not going to say we are exceedingly well travelled, but we have stayed in many nice hotels, have made numerous trips to tropical locations, and like upscale accomodations. We are empty nesters, so we have travelled with kids of all ages but this trip was for us alone - for our wedding anniversary. We took the advice of close friends who stay here often, and gave it a try. We LOVED the Grand Wailea. Here is why. Accomodations: Some people say the hotel needs updating, and perhaps so. But it doesn't feel "aged", it is being remodeled wing by wing, and it is still quite beautiful. Our room was lovely with lots of room, wonderful bedding, a large and lovely bathroom (I LOVE that) with both a large glassed in shower and a jacuzzi tub. Our balcony was roomy and comfortable with an outstanding view. The room was always clean as can be. Service: Was outstanding. Every single person we ever walked by who was on staff said a friendly "Aloha". This was literally without exception. We never had one single negative experience. We had rented a Cabana at the pool for a treat and would you believe it was the only windy and rainy day. What a disappointment. We called front desk manager thinking that even though they can't control the weather they should at least give us a discount on a different day. They took the entire charge off our bill. I asked for an ottoman for our balcony like I saw on the lower floors and it arrived in minutes. By our 3rd day there, without really having significant interaction staff was already calling us by name. In this huge place! Staff was just very attentive. From our Lei greeting to our bellman to valet to the gardeners and on and on. Special touches: They knew it was our anniversary so the first night instead of normal "turn down" service our bath was filled with bubble bath and fresh flower petals, and our towels made into 2 swans ending in a heart shape! Location: the beachfront location cannot be beat. The sunsets are gorgeous with lots of people sitting on the lawn to enjoy them at night. It is just a beautiful setting, with the grounds kept emaculately. Pools: Beautiful. We spent our entire time at the adult pool even though the other pools and swim up bar are lovely. We worried about reserving chairs but it was never that crowded. Granted, times are tough economically and we ended up being there JUST as everyone was returning home for the school year, so the occupancy wasn't high. Still the pool was so fun, the service there outstanding, the people friendly, and there was lots of room. We spent the majority of our time at the pool and loved it. And the nice lawn stretches straight out from the pool to the great little beach and the ocean right there. Spa: We have been to a few spas and this is probably the nicest one. It is expensive no doubt, but the "hydrotherapy baths" ahead of your appointment were really great. Didn't know we would like that but it was really cool. A sauna, steam room, several jacuzzis, 5 japanese soaking tubs with different purposes, and on and on. Food: We really didn't eat at any restaurant except Bistro Malakini (sp?) and it was great. We'd read all the negative reviews so we went off property for dinners. However we stayed in the Napuaa tower and it was worth the extra cost. We had complimentary breakfast each morning and open bar/appetizers each evening and it was outstanding. We were too full for dinner several nights. We also had room service and it wasn't outstanding but pretty good. Concierge: Not so great, but we only used the service in the Napua tower. Maybe if we'd gone to front desk where there are numerous staff on hand to help you we would have had better luck. We asked for 3 things of the Napuaa Conceirge service and got 1 of the 3, the other 2 just didn't get taken care of. Our only complaint is that this hotel is still awfully high priced. Even for the level of service and the nice accomodations, given the occupancy I would think the price would be a bit lower. We had a wonderful trip to Maui, and whether you have kids of all ages or are empty nesters like us, you are going to have a fantastic stay at the Grand Wailea. Just relax and enjoy. And we recommend Napuaa tower.

Reviews.Title: “Love and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Travelrwiter
Reviews.Content: Well, the title is Love and Fun. We had fun and Courtney Love was by the pool while we were there. Funny, Love didn't look like she was having fun - maybe it was the break-in period for her new carbon fiber permalip implants. The hotel was EMPTY (I was told 30 % occupancy by hotel staff). Two entire wings of the hotel were closed. We stayed there the previous year during the same week and the hotel was at 80%. Must be the gas prices as it's a looong drive to Maui from California (FYI: a California driver's license is required when checking into the Grand Wailea) ; ) I have been coming to the Grand Wailea since the first year it opened and have stayed at a multitude of other hotels and condos on the island over the years. Whenever I have complete financial amnesia, I find myself wandering into the Grand Wailea and staying for a few nights. The rooms start at about $400 and go wayyyy north from there. If you live in Hawaii, you can get the locals only discount at $300 per night. Since a gallon of milk costs $9 and a frozen lemonade by the pool costs the same, the locals are cleaned out well before they arrive in Wailea. Now to the review: Check in was a breeze, the pools were warm and clean and the slides fast with no waiting. The waterpark is still the best. The lazy river slide was under repair for a day and after the repair, I slid down and burned my thigh on the newly repaired spot, a little pain lets you know your still alive you know. The staff was very friendly and I only saw one skirmish. A gentleman - Morty we'll call him - was complaining that he had his towels and book removed from the lounges that he staked out at 3am while dressed in his Ninja outfit (the hotel has a 1 hour limit on unoccupied towels in order to keep the place tidy). Mort really got into the face of this young Hawaiian kid working there - poor kid could do nothing but listen to the blathering. The kid finally removed his headphones and found the guy two more chairs that were suitable out of the couple hundred that were still available as nobody was within 3000 miles Maui that week. The place still rocks even though there were a few years where maybe the service and the cleanliness was in question. Our room was newly remodeled in the Molokai tower and the hallways were kept clean and clear. If you want tranquility, go to the Four Seasons, if you want fun and frolic, the Gdub is the bomb.

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort but watch out for the food prices!”
Reviews.Author: Snealie
Reviews.Content: I work for another Hilton hotel on the mainland, so I can't complain about my room rate. I thought our room was a nice size with a giant bathroom that included a tub and a walk in shower big enough for two, a desk and a comfortable seating area. The balcony was nice and faced the ocean, but there was a smaller building in front of us that partially obstructed our views. Being forced to valet park when we got there was annoying, especially when I knew there was free parking available. We were greeted with leis, which was really cool. Check in was easy, but I did have to remind the front desk agent that employees do not have to pay for the resort fee twice. I asked where the free parking was and it was pointed to on a map that was the size of two business cards. Tiny! I thought our agent could have been a little more welcoming. When we retrieved our car, the valet guy drove extremely fast in the parking garage. I did not like this one bit! The hotel has great pools and a GREAT beach that has been voted one of the best in the world in previous years. We didn't spend much time here as we were traveling around the island most days. The one day that we did spend at the beach the umbrellas were $35 for the day - a bit excessive, but they were huge and the chairs were complimentary. The beach seems private and it wasn't crowded. Great views of the sunset can be found here. My suggestion about the cost of the umbrella - buy a $10 one at Walmart near the airport. The grounds of the hotel were huge and I loved all of the different foiliage around. It seemed to be kept up. If you are a light sleeper, I would not recommend this hotel to you. The hotel is set up with the doors outside like a motel. The hallways are all tile - very noisy when suitcases or bellman carts are going over them. We also could hear our upstairs neighbors open and close their balcony door (at 5am!) everyday. What I was shocked about was how high the food was at the hotel. We never ate at any of the restaurants because of prices, but we did visit the Cafe Kula for coffee and a few light meals. I ended up getting a cold while we were there and got soup from the Cafe two nights for dinner. That wasn't horribly expensive, but when they charged $4 for a 20 oz. bottle of soda, I was stunned. It's probably the cheapest alternative if you are looking to not spend a fortune at every meal. No vending on the floors either. No fridge in our room either. Free parking lot was a 10 minute walk which wasn't bad. We'd probably have waited that long to get the car from valet. There was free internet (dial-up) which I was surprised, but very happy about. Overall, I like the hotel. I work in a very high-end Hilton, so I was able to see the pros and cons of this property. I thought the grounds were pretty, the beach was great and overall we had a nice stay. Service was decent, but could have been better. Like many resort hotels, they do nickle and dime you. But if you can afford the room rate, you probably aren't worried about spending the extra money for the extras.

Reviews.Title: “all cash - no class.”
Reviews.Author: funseekers88
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try The "Grand" this trip to Hawaii and upon arrival we were greeted by a snotty "twenty something" clerk who was rude, disrespectful and very matter of fact that they did not have the room I booked for the first night of our stay, a room that was NOT updated like clerk assured me it was. The second room we moved to was beautifully renovated and spacious with an outstanding view. The pool is huge just like a full blown water park but it just doesn't seem right to have to panic every morning to get one of the crowded DIRTY chairs on the garbage strewn pool deck. The stores and lobbies are like a ghost town. The hotel says it's at 90% occupancy but their own newsletter clearly states that half of the rooms and "Kincha" the sushi restaurant are closed so the don't have to lay off a lot of staff do to the slow down in bookings. They must have let go of the higher paid more experienced staff to save money which has left them with staff unqualified to deliver 5 star service. One would think a resort with a slowdown in bookings would make sure the service and surroundings were exceptional to encourage favorable word of mouth. Overall I felt let down by the CHEAP atmosphere at the Grand Wailea, my family will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: kahalabeach
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Grand Wailea previously (about 5 years ago - good experience), we were excited to return with our 2 1/2 yr old son. Needless to say, it was disappointing. The main attraction is the pool and slides. While we enjoyed that aspect, the grounds and pool need some overdue maintenance and attention. Management should take a dip and go down the slides and floating river (trash and missing tiles on the slides). The hotel is incredibly large (700+ rooms) so be prepared for long distance from your room to meals, etc. Also, meal prices will compare to Disneyland - they're high and it's difficult to go anywhere else. The rooms are okay, but again need attention. Between the pool / rooms / mediocre service / and public areas, the hotel just looked a bit tired and unkept. Given the prices and amenities, we'll opt to try The Four Seasons Wailea on our next visit (next door to The Grand Wailea).

Reviews.Title: “Resort has definite pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: sjalex20
Reviews.Content: Ok so I went here with my family back in December 2007 for 7 days but I thought I would post real quick as when planning a trip any information is appreciated. My husband, daughter (3 years old) , son (8 months) and my husbandâ€™s mother, grandmother and brother and his family were also there. We had a room far away from our other family members which was both nice and a pain at the same time. Unfortunately for us we arrived in Maui smack dab in the middle of a 2 week tropical storm and pretty much spent the week in clouds and lots of rain. This however was ok and hey it is Hawaii so it canâ€™t be that bad right? We survived a major tropical storm that pounded the resort and knocked out electricity for one and a half days. Half of the resort was flooded, some ground floor rooms started taking in water, the pools were closed almost the entire stay and the sand at the beach was totally gone during this day and a half. As you can see it was a very brutal (and uncommon) storm. Pros: The hotel is located in a beautiful area, to me Wailea is much more quiet and nice than Kannapali (sp?). The beach was beautiful (pre storm and post storm once the currents brought the sand back) and the water is a beautiful color. Our room was on the 2nd floor and had a gorgeous view of the ocean. We loved to sit out on the lanai and watch the ocean and listen to the waves. Our room had a king bed (very comfy) and a pull out couch and the bathroom was really big and nice. I loved the complimentary toiletries and usually I am not into these. They just smelled really nice and the lotion was great, like I said not a big deal to most people;) We ordered a fridge for the week (cost $25) and before driving to the resort we stopped off at Costco and stocked up on water, soda and snacks. This was so nice to have cold drinks for everyone and this is a resort which obviously means not only Hawaiian prices but resort Hawaiian prices:) Just come prepared for the cost of food and you will really enjoy your trip. The first day we had sticker shock and towards the end of the vacation we would get our lunch bill (for 2 hamburgers with fries and 2 sodas) and say oh good that meal was only $40- bargain! Cons: Valet parking is very expensive if you are staying the week, I want to say $15 a day plus tip but the self parking is ridiculous! It is really really far away and there are not that many spots available so you are sort of forced to use the valet. The hotel definitely needs some freshening up, it looked outdated but we were told they were in the process of renovating. The breakfast buffet was a nightmare and there was always a line wrapped around the courtyard (in the copious rain). We always ended up eating at the cafÃ© for breakfast and the food there was ok. They had a really good pizza deal there for dinner- 1 large pizza, 2 drinks and cinnamon twists for $25. The pools were only open the first day we were there and they closed a few hours after we arrived and due to checking in and me watching my baby I never got to use the pools. Boohoo. My husband took my daughter and said the slides, swings and water elevator were fun. Unfortunately with all the rain/flooding the pools remained closed for the rest of the week. The service at this hotel was not so great, all the staff seemed surly. They of course were surprised by the severity of the storm and the power going out but they could have handled it much better. It was kind of chaotic at best and many guest were irate and left the hotel. In conclusion I loved Wailea, storm and all, but if I returned I would probably stay at the Four Seasons. The rooms look nicer and their pool is built up higher, so if there was another storm the pool would not have to close for the week. The Grand Wailea has beautiful grounds, really it is just gorgeous, but for sure I would like to try out another hotel, that has a reputation for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rssort...will return!”
Reviews.Author: HawTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews would make you think there are two different parts of the hotel...while we haven;t stayed in every resort in Hawaii, this is the best so far out of 4 resorts at different islands...the place was immaculate, room was very clean, no signs of wear and large enough for 2 adults with 2 adult teenagers. Didnt see the problems others claim and were at the resort at almost the same time. As a Diamond VIP, we were upgraded to the 9th (top floor) with a full ocean view...was a great view, the staff were very nice, place was very clean...grounds were well kept. Like any other resort, food and drink are pricey but unlike other resorts you get free parking, free internet, no daily resort fee which can be anywhere from 10-25 dollars per day. I normally wouldn't say that I would like to return to a particular place just cause we like to explore others but will return to this resort as one to go to in Maui. We stayed at the Hilton last year in Hawaii...nice but way too big and hard to get around...these grounds were laid out nicely, short walk to pools and beach, nice water front paths for daily walks..just a great place to relax... like any other place, there is a costco nearby so loading up on drinks and snacks is worth it... if your booked don't let the bad reviews get you down...you will be happy with your stay...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: malibugypsy
Reviews.Content: I truly hated this place, so much, in fact, that after two days here i ate the rest of the money and went to a different hotel on Maui. Why? Because it felt like I was living in a mall. If you like malls, or you like Vegas, and you like giant waterparks full of screaming, shoving people and you don't mind paying $17.00 so your kids can have two lemonades or paying another 10 bucks to jump off a float in the ocean, then this is the place for you. My kids loved it. It is kind of neat to swim up to a bar in a grotto through a fake waterfall, or go down a bunch of waterslides. If you like spas, it might be perfect, because your kids will be exhausting themselves while you spa it up at this giant tacky spa they've got. Me, I missed Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better pool in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Let's just say WOW! How else to discribe this place, its open grounds make you feel welcome. The entire pool area is one big playground. Start in the water elevator and swim down the four slides to the lazy river, stopping in the cave bar along the way for a drink. The food was expensive but worth the price. The way this place is set up you cannot help but have fun. You can plan on parking your car because you wont want to leave. With the mall next door you have plenty of dining choices. Do not miss this place, it is an experience your family will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic vacation at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTahoe
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (one son, 10, and another son, 19) stayed at the Grand Wailea from 8/10-8/16. I had done extensive research on the hotel and read countless reviews. I was somewhat wary having read about the mediocre food and rooms. I came away very impressed and was exceedlngly happy with our vacation at the hotel. We stayed in the Napau area of the hotel. We arrived at about 1:00 pm, and were told by the very polite desk staff that the room would be ready in an hour. We hung out at the bar until then - and were unpacked and ready to enjoy the place by 3:00. Our room was beautful with a giant bathroom - very clean and well maintained. The balcony with ocean view was perfect. Staying on the Napua level allowed us to take advantage of the morning breakfasts and the afternoon 'happy hour'. The food was always good with different selections every day. The pool is the main reason to come to the Grand Wailea. It is the best, period. Nothing else can compare. Only dig is it gets hard to find chairs quickly - so you need to scout out and find a good spot early. But it pays off. My wife and kids would sleep in and I'd walk down to the pool by 7:00 and grab our chairs - then just read for a bit until they were ready. The other outstanding feature of the hotel is the Spa. Not to be missed. Make sure you book a massage. Just soooo worth it. Extremely dedicated and professional staff. Also tried the facial and that was excellent. We ate the first night at Humunukunukuaua's and really had a good meal. Excellent fish. You will get bored with just eating at the hotel, so make sure you venture next door to the Wailea Shops. Tommy Bahamas was very good. There are other great restaurants as well. And there is an ABC Store right in the mall so you can pick-up goodies and not pay huge resort prices. Drop by Costco or Walmart on your way to the resort from the airport. We bought a case of bottled water and went through the whole thing during our stay. We did try out the hotel's luau one evening and had a very good time. The entertainment was wonderful. I would also highly recommend eating at Mama's Fish House over in Pai'a near the airport. It's very expensive - but the food is amazing. Best fish I've had almost anywhere - the Mahi Mahi was out of this world. The beach at the Grand Wailea is really awesome - beautiful. We rented kayaks and snorkeling gear a few days and just had a ball out in the ocean. Well worth it. And don't miss the wonderful walkway that meanders in front of the hotels along Wailea Beach. Excellent for night strolls or a quick jog (make sure you don't go in the late afternoon - you will get covered in knats). The gym at the hotel is top notch anwyay - lots of cardio machines - and the free weights were well maintained. The Grand Wailea pretty much has it all - we pretty much hung out at the pool and beach all week....extremely relaxing. If you have a family with kids, they will definiitely love the pool. If you are honeymooning or just a couple on a relaxing holiday, probably might want to check out the Four Seasons or Fairmont. The G.W. is more family oriented with lots of kids so that might drive some folks who want more 'quiet time' crazy. But we loved it. I look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow- What a let down”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: We traded in 250,000 Hilton points for quick and inexpensive trip to Hawaii. Let me tell you, this property all around is BAD. I'm a Hilton Diamond person, so I've stayed a lots of Hiltons, from NYC, to Buenos Aires to Omaha! This was the worst Hilton property I've ever stayed in. They advertise rooms at about 650 sq ft, which is really large for a hotel room. Their standard rooms aren't anywhere NEAR that size. We found the hotel to be filthy. Lobby area tables littered with garbage. The tile floors chipped and in bad condition. The baseboards were not only filthy but almost black from the wear and tear. I did let the management know how disappointed I was and they put us in their $1300 per night suite for $200 bucks per night. While it was roomier, it was still outdated, worn down and tattered. We walked out the next day giving up our points to pay $650 a night at the Ritz Carlton and I'm so glad we did. What others wright about having to fight for pool chairs at 7 AM is absolutely true. This hotel was sold out while we were there. So they can definitely fill the rooms- maybe that's why they don't make changes. But, if you are expecting luxury here, run away fast cause you won't find it at the Grand Wailea. The Rizt Carlton on the other hand was aboslute perfection. Sorry for the bad news here, but what I say is 100% true.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing Grand is the size of the place”
Reviews.Author: KatieDavis
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed. Years ago, this place looked sharp. It really needs an update. The pools are good for kids, but that's about all I have to say that's really nice. I had a broken, lumpy bed. It took about 20 min to walk from the room to the pool or beach which was a pain. For the same $, the Four Seasons and Kea Lana are way better, both for different reasons. The food was only average. There is really no service for drinks, etc at the beach/pool like other resorts. Hmm, what can I say that's nice? The bathroom was big, but room was big. The gym is fantastic. Wailea is beautiful. I still give this place a 3/5 because it is Hawaii and by that fact alone, it is paradise. I would only stay here again if it was for a conference at a big discounted rate. Otherwise, next time I would go back to the Kea Lani or go next store and try the Wailea Beach Villas which are beautiful inside. oh! in the ocean there is a trampoline that is very fun. It's harder than it looks!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort (I hope money is no object though!)”
Reviews.Author: Tizbit
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference in Honolulu and flew over to Maui and spent four days with my parents at this resort. The resort is gorgeous. We pulled up and were greeted with leis, something I had been waiting for, for a week. I was under the mistaken impression that you were greeted with a lei when you got off the plane in Hawaii. No lei at the airport, but yes here, and they even have a nonflower one for boys. We had an oceanview room with two queen beds. The room was very nice. Beds were soft. There was a great chez lounge and a flat screen tv. The bathroom had a large tub and separate glass shower, and a potty closet. Our balcony had a beautiful view of the ocean and molokini crater. The bath products that they give you are fabulous, but they are $28 per bottle and up if you want to buy them. The pool at the Grand Wailea is the best pool I have ever seen! It is insane. There are all of these pools and you can start at the top pool and slide your way down to the large pools at the bottom. They are a ton of fun and great for any age. My parents even enjoyed them. They have a small lazy river, a tarzan rope swing, two large slides, and a water elevator (worth checking out, but not that exciting). There is a place to play water volleyball and a special pool for scuba lessons (though that will cost you extra). There is bar in the pool which I thought was awesome. I had always heard about those, but had never seen one. Now I've seen one, but it was so busy that I never got a drink there. There was only 1 bartender that day and we waited 15 minutes and he never got to us to take our drink order, so we decided we didn't need a $12 drink in the pool that badly. There are lots of hot tubs, a couple hidden in the grotto and two by the adult (hibiscus) pool. The pool is open 7am-10pm, but the slides and stuff are only open 10-5 which sucks because the pool is packed at those times. We regularly went before or after dinner b/c it was peaceful. Please note: It is very difficult to get a chair by the pool during high time. We saw some guy flip out on the staff b/c his stuff was moved. If you leave your stuff on a chair for more than an hour without coming back they will clean off the chair and put your stuff away. You could rent a cabana to avoid this, but it is $250, so not worth it unless you are spending the entire day there and have a party of 4 or more. If you are planning on spending the day at the pool and there are 4 of you then I would spring for the cabana. We only ate 1 meal at the resort b/c the prices were insane. We had $18 burgers at Bistro Molokini. I wasn't wowed. I had an $18 burger in Lahaina, but at least it was made with Kobe beef. We did find across the street at the Wailea Gold Golf Course Club House there was an excellent restaurant that was more reasonable and had excellent views of Molokini. It was about $10 for a full breakfast there. It was peaceful, beautiful and yummy. Definitely better than paying $11.50 for a sausage biscuit at the hotel. The spa at the Grand Wailea is the best spa I've ever been to and with the terme is actually the best bang for your buck on property. This was my favorite thing about the resort. (See my separate review of the spa.) The only thing I did not like about the resort was the walking. Our room had a great view, but it was super far from the lobby and ridiculously far from the parking garage. This place is not for those who cannot walk long distances! My father said this was his favorite resort ever, except for the parking. He couldn't believe this place would charge almost $1000 a night and make you walk over a mile to the car. Yes, I checked, according to my pedometer it was over a mile to the car. Do yourself a favor, suck it up and pay the ridiculous $20 a day for valet. I wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea, Read Carefullu Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTracy88
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is for some and truly not for others. It was NOT for us. If you are the traveler who becomes agitated in densely populated theme and water parks, if you find coach class when flying similar to a Greyhound bus experience or if you have little patience for cattle call style meals, DO NOT STAY HERE. My husband and I have found salvation in chain hotels such as Hilton, Hyatt and Marriott during other trips when we were booked at hotels which didn't meet our standards. We are certainly not hotel snobs. However, we booked our 2 week long vacation at GW based on it's Waldorf Astoria affiliation. How can a hotel with a Waldorf Astoria affiliation be run like Disney World? How can an affiliation with such high standards be associated with GW? I don't know but I will explain in the following exactly what to expect when you stay at GW to help you determine if it's for you and your family. (I say family because you shouldn't dare stay at GW unless you're A. traveling with kids. B. a fan of other peoples' kids C. crazy.) To begin, I spent 45 minutes the day prior to our arrival in an effort to arrange for champagne and a cheese fruit plate as a surprise for my husband. We traveled 18 hours with our infant as well as the added fatigue of my pregnant status. I thought he would be pleasantly uplifted and surprised to find a treat in the room. After calling the hotel, being told they were busy with a breakfast rush and to fax my request- I did. I included my credit card number and the specific wine off their menu as well as my menu selection for cheese. No can do, it wasnâ€™t there. And yes, I called on my way to confirm they received my request. Next stop, breakfast. Two people, total, $80. Buffet, mediocre at best and cold. Enjoy the sparrows while you dine. Itâ€™s like Hitchcockâ€™s The Birds. Enough said. It was literally a 15 minute walk to and from the beach/12 from pool. EACH WAY. Want shade? PAY. $50 for a beach umbrella, a day. $250 for a poolside cabana. Who knows how you get them, I heard itâ€™s actually a lottery. The pool reminded us of a water park in our hometown. Itâ€™s bumper to bumper and there are so many kidsâ€¦ I have 3, donâ€™t misunderstand me but this was not relaxing. It was CHAOS. My husband calls it Wally World. Our room was an â€œupgrade.â€� We had a room booked for $499 with the 7th night free and we were put in a partial ocean view which would have been in the $600â€™s. LOL It was supposedly recently renovated but it was definitely not. It was mildew-y in the bathroom, older looking tilesâ€¦ the carpet smelled and it was cramped. There was a lot of nickel and diming going on there. Aside from the resort fee, there are charges for a refrigerator in the room (for babyâ€™s milk), a crib, shade by pool or beach as mentioned above and anything else you can imagine they charge for, they do. I had visions of majestic views from my shaded poolside or oceanfront seat, being waited on all day and soaking in my tub at night. Well, the view was of 1000 kids running around, no servers in sight and I wouldnâ€™t dare soak in that tub. We left after the 2nd night and checked into the Four Seasons next door. We paid slightly more, $640 a night plus $18 in parking but it was worth every cent. Cabanas, shade, umbrellas- all included. Service is 5 star all the way. There was always somewhere to sit by the pool. The kids pool was nice enough for adults to use! The rooms were amazing and the extras were a nice touch: The included some diapers and Little Swimmers as well as all the necessary infant toiletries in the room. They spelled out our sonâ€™s name in little sponges in the bathtub. They provide cribs, changing tables, diaper genies, bottle warmers, strollers, infant tubs, whatever else you can think of free of charge. Frig in all rooms. What a switch. Like I said, GW may be for some but it wasnâ€™t for us. I appreciate the finer things in life but also live on a budget. When I travel, I donâ€™t want to be exhausted by the accommodations I have chosen, I want to unwind. GW wasnâ€™t providing that for us and I am glad we left when we did. Do your research and if youâ€™re working on a budget, carefully consider some hidden costs you may incur before making a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but nickeled and dimed to death (via $20's and $50's)”
Reviews.Author: family2008
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a beautiful and large facility. Since the lowest priced hotel room cost more than our honeymoon suite in Tahiti, we were unpleasantly surprised at how extreme the add-on fees are at this hotel. We felt they easily could have added another $1,000 - $2,000 to our one week stay (and that's not counting any food) had we not been vigilant about them -- and being vigilant about them made our relaxing stay simply less relaxing. Some examples: - umbrella for your chairs at the pool: taken by 7 AM'ish (see more below) - umbrella for your chairs on the beach: $50 per day - pair of chairs with their own shade cover: $75 per day - cabana: $250 per day - in-room rollaway bed for your kid: $20 per day - in-room refrigerator for your kid's food / milk / whatever: $25 per stay - daily resort fee: $25 per day (happens at many hotels) - hotel food: ridiculous -- $50-75 per person for basic dinner is normal (happens at many hotels) Particularly noteworthy if you want some shade by the pool or on the beach... The hotel has literally 5-10'ish umbrellas by the pool (I'm not kidding) and none on the beach. Each can provide shade to a small number of chairs. The pool opens at 7 AM. If you are not there at 7 (not 7:30 or 8:00), you will almost certainly not get a seat under these umbrellas. That means that you need to pay between $50 and $250 per day to get shade. For a hotel of this class and price range, that was unpleasantly surprised. We were frustrated when to get to the pool at 8 or 9 AM and have no chance of sitting in the shade all day -- and it's a hot day. Additionally, there is ongoing construction in the hotel in the main lobby, the pool area, and one wing. The noise was bad enough (waking up our three year old during nap time two days in a row), that we changed rooms -- after a lengthy discussion with the hotel staff (who were genuinely friendly). If you love lazy rivers, there is one at the hotel. It's quite short. We misread the advertisements to think it was 2,000 feet long, which would've been great. It's the entire pool complex, including all pools, that is 2,000 feet long. Lots of pool to be sure - just not a super long lazy river. We likely won't stay here again -- despite this being a nice, large facility. For this much money, we expected more for the cost of admission.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashley1508
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, The kids loved the pool. The room was very nice. Awesome beds, very comfortable. We had a great view of the ocean and gardens. The Grounds were amazing. When we spent the day at the pool. we would rent a casabella(two lounge chairs with a large awning over the chairs, much more afforable at $75. for the day. We would be right between the beach and pool, great ocean views . The kids would spend the entire time in the pool. My son did get stung by a jelley fish one day at the hotel beach, he didn't go back in the water at the hotel beach after that, luckly it was towards the end of the trip. Great hotel but yes it is exspensive! We checked out the pool at the four season on our last day and the kids took one look and said we are going back to our pool, this one stinks! If you have kids, you need to try this hotel atleast for a night or two. Also the day we left we had a late flight, so we spent the day at the pool, at the end of the day they gave us a room for about 40 minutes, and we all showered and changed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheIsleman
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely wonderful experience at this beautiful hotel- our room was upgraded & just perfect in every regard- short walks to everything, nice views, clean & fresh. The staff was all exceptionally friendly and helpful, even though the hotel was pretty full. They work hard at keeping it clean & special. The pool areas, spa & beach are the highlights- we left the hotel only once in 5 days. One of our best vacations ever! With that said, we did meet friends who weren't having quite the same experience- problems with the front desk, causing her to break down crying (our clerk was awesome, but we have experienced persnickity help there in the past)- the rooms in the Molokini wing are remote & many view the parking structure. They've gotten carried away with placing $300/day cabanas (awnings) around the pools, tieing up 8 lounge chairs each, leaving few chairs for the rest of the hurd, virtually none of which are in the shade. Probably trying to keep the pool from getting too crowded, since there seemed to be alot of people running off with sunburn after about 2 or 3pm each day. There also seemed to be alot of people bussed in from who knows where & large familes of locals fighting for pool space, mostly between about 10am & 3pm. If you want a couple of lounge chairs anyplace close to shade, you need to grab them by 8am or so & guard them the rest of the morning. Kindof weird. But I did notice the main pool attendant (walking around) helping people who couldn't find anything, especially those with babies. Watch the charges- we got charged for minibar items we never took. Tip- if you get tired of the hotel food/costs, you can take the stairs (between the valet garage in front & the waterfall), then walk 2 minutes to the Shops at Wailea- several good restaurants & the best deli on the island inside the Whalers Store, lower level middle. Also think about buying water-shirts (board shirts) at one of the shops there to wear over the upper half of your body for when you're stuck out in the sun, it's practical in cutting back how much you burn or suntan lotion you have to use, but also gaining in style now, believe it or not. Anyhow, this is certainly a wonderful place to spend a few days & having stayed at most of the Wailea area hotels, can't understand why this doesn't rank even higher with this site's reviewers. I'd favor the Grand Wailea above the overrated Four Seasons or the Marriott- the "Wailea Villas" is kindof a joke- fenced off, overpriced, errily quiet & all but abandoned outside of christmas break- the Kea Lani is nice with it's suite-like rooms & elaborate pools, but the Fairmont doubled the prices the minute they bought it- the Maui Prince is a bit remote & caters to tourists from Japan. None of these are really practical for the first-timer to Maui, except maybe for a honeymoon, as it doesn't make sense to pay this much & then abandon the hotel to do other stuff that one will want to do on the island. A good plan is to stay here for the first or last couple of days on a trip, then rent a nice condo (anywhere between Wailea & Kaanapali or Napili) for a week- so you're then free to enjoy the local flavor, drives around the island, snorkeling or diving, activities, & stocking up at the Costco (right next to the airport) for your breakfasts & lunches, bbq or cocktail hours or whatever, along with having more space to spread out. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Maui ...perfect for kids!”
Reviews.Author: dreaminparadise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea our last two days of our vacation in Maui to treat the kids to their grand pool area. It was a treat indeed! We all had so much fun at the pool. We decided to go stress free and rent a cabana ($300) but felt it was worth it. We were served chilled water and frozen grapes and a fruit plate at the cabana. The pool side food was great and not horribly expensive. The kids had a blast on the tarzan swing, water elevator, lazy river and slides. There was enough to keep them busy all day. We even did the same things as the kids and had a blast. Just looking out at the beach from our cabana with a lava flow was paradise for me. Suggestion: cabana 16 is great location. You are next to towel desk, restroom, restaurant and incredible view of ocean and surroundings. We loved the fact that you can go back and forth from the beach to the pool in a matter of a minute. The beach is great for swimming and the kids even go to jump on a trampoline on the ocean and jump off into the water. Alot of fun for only $20 for the day. The grounds are beautiful and the room was probably average, but that was ok with us, because we were not in it very much. However, I would say it is not worth it to pay for the ocean view room like we did @ $750 per night, because we never stayed in it. Overall, we would say the Grand Wailea was our favorite part of our trip to Maui, and are looking forward to coming back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is an unbelievable resort! On this trip it was only my wife and I. Next time i will bring my two children. I have never stayed in a resort as completely overwhelming in class as The Grand. Do know that it would be really tough to stay here on a budget. Everything, especially the food, is pricey. We checked in on Sunday, July 20th, and took advantage of the Sunday Brunch. It was $48 per person. It was amazing. The next day we ate Sushi at Kincha's. Two buffets and an additional Rainbow Roll, plus a tea and glass of wine and we walked out the door for $160. The sushi, even for a buffet, was as good as I have ever had. For lunch another day we ate at the pool and for two wraps, two bottle waters, one smoothie, a mixed drink, plus tip and we signed a ticket for $70. In case you are wondering, all of the food and drinks are tops, but you get what you pay for. The view from my 8th floor room was breathtaking of the grounds and ocean. My advice is to request a room on an upper floor. I have included pictures of the room and restroom and our view. The beds, pillows, and linens are very satisfying. There are no rooms in any of the buildings that don't face the ocean, but the lower the floor the more trees to look over. The Spa Grande is well worth every penny. For a 2:00 appointment they have you arrive at 1:00 to take advantage of all the other amenities that you have available. There are different baths, whirlpools, etc that are intended to help you relax before your massage or other. The service is very impressive. The pool is tremendous. If you are thinking if your children would be entertained at the Grand, you need to know the pool is like a miniature water park. There are slides, one as long as 180 feet, a rapids slide, a water elevator, zero entry for the little ones, and a volleyball net in the larger pool. Thre is a lazy river but bring you own floatation devices because they are not provided. Some comments about the pool being crowded made me fear not getting a chair. There was never a problem when my wife and I were ready to find a place. Reference my pictures for some views of the pools. By design the hotel's rooms are a comfortable distance from the pools. Upon my check in, while looking toward the back, you can't see the pools. It isn't too far, just hidden a bit. I will be going back to The Grand Wailea. I stayed three nights at a condo prior to my checking in to The Grand and the difference in overall experience was like winning the lottery. As a whole, my experience in the area stores and shops was not the friendliest experiences. I would say most tourist places employees get tired of people. The Grandâ€™s employees are there to serve you. The only inconvenience in staying here is that you have to go down to the 4th floor, walk across the lobby area to get to another elevator to get from the 4th floor down. Not a huge deal, but a little time consuming. I am posting pictures so you can see some areas of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to say the least”
Reviews.Author: kdoh1928
Reviews.Content: Where to begin..... I am not one to complain and have never written a negative review but this one is a must. The value for this hotel is not worth the accommodations. I recently stayed for my honeymoon and was extremely excited upon arrival but unfortunately my excitement didn't last long. Upon arrival my husband and I were greeted with flower leis and the valet took care of our car and bags but didn't even take the time to point us in the right direction to the check in desks. Check in went fairly quickly although the bell man who assisted us with our bags could have been a little more friendly as some of his colleagues were. Upkeep was not were it should be for a hotel in the "Waldorf Astoria" class as the paint on many of the doors were chipped, scratched and looked very worn. Upon reaching our room, we were welcomed to a musty/mildewy smell and so-so accommodations. Upon mentioning it to the bellman he just shrugged his shoulders and said to talk to the desk. Being on our honeymoon, we tried to stay positive and freshened up, headed down to the desk on our way to explore the hotel/pool/beach. The desk sent housekeeping to "freshen up" the room while we were out which lasted for a couple of hours into the evening but ultimately the smell returned. To make a long story short, the musty/mildewy smell was so prevalent that it permeated all of our clothes and regardless of whether or not we wore an article of clothing during the honeymoon, we had to wash everything when we got home because they smelled like the hotel room. After my third trip to the front desk I was finally afforded the opportunity to speak with management but the only thing that was offered to us was a late check out which we had already arranged for. This was another annoyance... our keycards were deactivated despite the prior arrangements made so we had to go back to the front desk anyway and once we were back in the room, housekeeping knocked on our door multiple times to find out when we were leaving. Not everything was a negative though, the pool and beach (although crowded) were very nice and lots of fun! The Humuhumunukunukuapuaa restaurant was pretty good. I travel often for both business and pleasure and am a Hilton Hhonors Gold VIP member (I didn't receive any of the benefits I should have), when I'm paying $615/nt plus taxes and $25/day resort fee I expect the service and accommodations to be excellent which this stay definitely was not.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: travelop
Reviews.Content: My family spent 2 nights in this hotel last month. Everyone who arrives is greeted by a Hawaiin greeter- I was given a Plumeria Lei and my husband and two teenage boys a tea leaf lei. Parking is free in self park or you can park with Valet. Our Attendant gave us free valet services as this was our third trip to this hotel. Our room was a beautiful garden room- newly renovated facing the pools and ocean. The first night we drove to Mama's Fish house near the airport (about 30 min drive- expensive but worth the trip!!!) The next day we had the breakfast buffet ($28 a person). We didn't need lunch that day! After walking around the ritzy shopping center next door, we headed for the pools! You must have a colored wrist band to swim and the colors change every day. The hotel warns of not "holding" chairs and being away for more than 60 min. The pool security will remove towels and free up chairs if there is no activity for over an hour. there are 7 pools all interconnected. We tried to find 4 chairs closer to the beach but all the chairs were taken. A hotel employee advised we go to a higher level pool as chairs were more plentiful. We found two chairs and a pool security person materialized with two more chairs right next to the pool. There was also a pool/food porter taking orders for drinks and lunch. We spent all afternoon riding the water elevator, going down slides, playing water volleyball and my husband and I swam up to the Grotto bar for a drink where the bartender laughed and joked with the swimmers. Scuba lessons were offered at the activity desk. They have a 10ft deep pool for learning the trade. Shell and Bead necklace classes were being offered for all ages. The drinks are expensive but you can bring a cooler from your room. The slides and life guards portion of the pools close at 5 but you can still swim until 10- We had dinner in the Japanese rest.- Incredible Sushi! We had a King room with a pull out couch and a roll-a way and still had room for 4 people and luggage. The bathrooms are large and have all the amenities from the Spa. We did not go to the Spa, but have in the past and it was perfect. My older son said the gym was "awesome" for working out and the indoor raquetball ball court was always in use! Our last day, before flying out of HAwaii, we were going to have a quick breakfast at the deli but after buying two coffee's and two muffins for 23 dollars, we decided to eat on the way... They had a great place to store bags, and play in the pool for those with late night flights out. All in all it is a fabulous place but the food and drinks are expensive. You can eat next door in the open air shopping mall for much less or drive to Kehi for meals. There is a beautiful chapel with amazing stain glass windows on the lawn. It seats 40. We saw one wedding but we were told they are going to tear it down to make room for more lawn cabanas.. that is too bad! However, We definitely will come back, the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel beautiful as always.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Perfect family place”
Reviews.Author: ckpsangabriel
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, the pools and slides are perfect for various age kids. We loved it so much we are going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Tired old Lady”
Reviews.Author: travel2much08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Wailea in the past and we were very dissappointed in our most recent stay. We paid $735/night for deluxe ocean view accomodations x 2 rooms. By the time you add the tax and resort fees the amount was over $1,600/night for 2 rooms! Needless to say, when you spend that kind of money you should expect Four Seasons/Ritz quality. We spoke with the hotel manager and we were advised that there have been many owners of the hotel lately. This must explain why very little money is spent on upkeep and service. The room was marginal at best. For the same type of money it is much better to stay at the Cove at Atlantis in the Bahamas. I read the one review that stated that the Grand Wailea had the best pools...while great....they don't hold a candle to the Atlantis!! Everything was dated. The pool chairs were stained and the paint was all chipped off of the frames. The pool deck is not cleaned at night. Many times we would see menus, flip flops, etc from the previous day when we went out to claim our chairs in the a.m. I must admit that the chair game is frustrating. All of the good spots have been stacked out by 7-8 am. The overall impression (if you have stayed at a top resort elsewhere and know what to expect) is one of a tired old lady. Very rough around the edges. The slides were very dirty. There were water lines and scum on the ropes in the water.....again, it simply looked like no one within the organization was tasked to keep those areas/items in a fresh condition. I can go on and on (this is the first review i have ever taken the time to author, but i thought it was worth the time because i would hate for someone who travels less than we do to stay at this hotel and get deeply dissappointed)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but pool is getting very crowded”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: Live on the island Played tourist for the night. The Spa here is amazing, been going for years, highly reccomend terme. The pools are like a water park, however they are very busy and you need to get chairs early. Gym is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great pools, Not for Budget Conscious”
Reviews.Author: noslengnow
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is a luxury hotel in a very exclusive area of Maui. The property is large and many of the rooms have been renovated (some renovation is still taking place). The pools are the star attraction here and definitely what brings more of the families to stay here than say the neighboring Four Seasons which caters more towards couples than families. Of course, with a luxury hotel also comes a luxury price. Those wishing to stay here should also make sure to plan to spend extra for items that may be part of the normal room price at other places. For instance, if you have kids and want a microwave in your room, you can request one but at a $25 charge. If you want a refrigerator in your room, you can also request one at a $25 charge (they don't like you emptying out the in-room fridge of the stocked items). Valet parking is $20/night. Internet usage is extra as well. In a way, you feel like they are nickel and diming you to death for what you may already think is a fairly expensive stay for your family. If you are like us and the idea of a $2.50 banana or a $3 can of Coke seems outrageous, do yourself a favor and take a nice evening walk over to The Shops at Wailea and pick up some snacks and drinks at the ABC Store where you'll pay more standard HI prices. If you've got a rental car, drive 5 minutes to Kihei and you'll be able to find grocery stores there as well where $2.50 can get you a bunch of bananas rather than a single one. Outside of the on-property prices for food and goods, the property is a nice one. Our kids loved the kid's pool which wasn't too crowded while we were there in late May. Overall, a great place to stay and if you watch the pocketbook, it won't get out of control.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Beauty, Luxury and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Enjoythemoment
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™re staying at The Grand Wailea for the fourth time. It is our favorite resort destination in the world. We have been bringing our family here since they were little and this time we have our teenager plus her friends. Everything about the resort is just right from the friendly concierge (Richard) who set up our activities before we came here (He made 8 calls to make sure it was right)â€¦ to the startlingly beautiful setting, to the best pool in the world â€“ rapids, slides, water elevator â€“ nothing else like it. All other pools at other resorts are boring. One of our girls said â€œWhere else could a pool entertain you for a week?â€� There is a rapids which we could go in all day, fast slides, little slides, caves, waterfalls on and on. The spa is luxury and the therapists Iâ€™ve had are among the best in the world. You come in early for your treatment and relax in 7 different exotic baths, a waterfall shower, complimentary loufa treatment. Between the pools, spa, incredible setting, beautiful art, Mauiâ€™s other activities, the ocean and palm trees out your window youâ€™ve truly got your ideal destination.

Reviews.Title: “A lot like a Vegas hotel...”
Reviews.Author: enmo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the presentation was great, but it was a bit overwhelming and chaotic when you moved beyond the lobby area. If you have kids and want to stay somewhere that balances resort pleasures with kid friendly activities, this is the place for you. If you are on a relaxing and romantic trip, don't stay here... stay next door at the Four Seasons. The pool area felt very cramped and chaotic - much like a water park! The adult pool was calm but not very inviting. One morning we woke to a horrific screaming temper tantrum child in the hallway, which happens when a property has lots of kids. The rooms are very nice and newly renovated but the walls and doors are thin, which means you hear lots of hallway and bathroom noises, including slamming doors. The food on property was good, but not amazing as we expected. It was far more expensive than can be found nearby. We spent a lot of time at the Four Seasons - awesome dining, calm and relaxed atmosphere and superb service.

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: After months of research on where to stay on Maui, my family and I chose the Grand Wailea and we were completely thrilled. The property is impeccably clean, service was over the top friendly, and the facilities were overwhelming with choices for all members of the family. I would go back in a heartbeat. I did NOT find it to be overcrowded at all. We never waited for any of the pool rides, and we never had any trouble getting a chair around the pool. Yes it's expensive but no more than any other luxury resort. Yes there might be a few peels in the wallpaper but really who cares! It's a gorgeous oceanfront resort with exceptional amenities and great service. If you are worried about peeling wallpaper then you are wasting your time in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: heckster
Reviews.Content: We got our room through a "friends/family" deal and were booked to stay in a mountain view room. We had called ahead to let them know it was our honeymoon which was noted on the record and she immediately congratulated us. As we were checking in, my husband mentioned it was our honeymoon and as he was requesting an upgrade we were politely told that she was looking for a better room for us. She feverishly punched away at the computer and after a few minutes found a fabulous room on the top floor with an ocean view. The bathroom was huge with a seperate shower and nice big tub. The toilet is in a seperate room and there's plenty of room to get ready in the bathroom. The room was quite large and had a nice lounge chair and a desk in addition to the comfortable bed. The view was amazing! Service was good all around although we arrived at 10:40am for breakfast and they were switching to the Sunday Brunch at 11:00am. When we went up to the buffet, there was no one at the omelet station, most of the food was gone, and they were taking away the waffle warmer. We were dissapointed since they said it was open until 11am and told us we could have the buffet. We ordered from the menu instead. The only bad comment I have about this hotel is the food prices. Everything seemed to be $26+ no matter which restaurant we ate at. However, they have wonderful views, and you can always leave the property if your budget gets blown too quickly. The resort is over-the-top gorgeous. I was highly impressed and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but can understand the frustratation..”
Reviews.Author: oceanview18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GW for a few nights last summer. We stayed in the Napua Tower (our stay was free due to some connections). The room in Napua was lovely. Very clean and large. The bathroom was gorgeous and I LOVED the shampoo and conditioner they provided (I actually went and bought some in the little mall). We had turn-down service every night with a little flower and Hawaiin prayer. Breakfast in Napua was provided and it was very good. The pools are obviously the attraction here and they were amazing. You could spend all day just seeing all of the little nooks and crannies throughout the pools. We felt like kids on the water slides :). One complaint is that they really nickel and dime you with the chaise. A large tented lounge area would set you back hundreds of dollars and even an umbrella on the beach for the day was pricey (I forget the exact price and don't want to mis-speak). Also, there wasn't any internet in the hotel and to use the office space internet was $5 per 5 minutes if I recall correctly. The fact you can stay in a Holiday Inn and get free internet but the GW makes you pay $5 for 5 minutes is a bit ridiculous. So overall it is a great hotel (at least Napua is!). I think that kids would really enjoy it because of the pools and slides. But I do see where people feel nickel and dimed with the food costs, the chaise costs, the internet costs, and all of the little things that are so often free at much cheaper hotels. If I were staying at GW for a long stay I would definitely rent a car and eat off the hotel for most dinners. There are some FABULOUS places in Maui that are much less money and that have better ambiance. Plus, there is so much more to Maui than the GW's pools. We met a few families that literally hadn't left the resort in a whole week. And with the amazing hiking and sites to see, that is just a darn shame!! My bottom line: If you have a family with kids, GW is the way to go. If you are on a romantic honeymoon or getaway with your significant other, I say Four Seasons is best.

Reviews.Title: “Former Glory”
Reviews.Author: California3
Reviews.Content: One can tell that this used to be a special place. But now the construction crews are roaming around and corridors here and there are closed for repair. The wheels of the housekeeping carts rumble loudly early in the AM on the tile floors. The food is ultra expensive (even for HI standards) and run of the mill. Feels like a Vegas hotel (one in need of a few million $ in upgrades) planted in a pristine spot. We were there for an awards trip and the lobby bar closed before 12 each night. When it was open, we found the informative and friendly help there the highlight of the stay. Other staff couldn't be bothered, for the most part. Upon arrival after a terrible delay en route the bellman asked "do you really need help with your bags?" Would never pay to stay there when the outstanding Four Seasons is just up the road - a bit higher in rates for Ocean view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age, but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: Edge_In_Oregon
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea Resort was not one of our first choices for Maui. We stayed on previous trips up in Ka'napali and Honokawai, and as Hilton Honors Diamond members, we were somewhat surprised by the lack of anything Hilton except for the GWR as a choice. But as it was the only choice for Maui if you wanted to use points, we considered it. After seeing that it was a Waldorf-Astoria collection, we decided 70K points a night was ridiculous and we started looking at various options. As we were sorting through the condos in South Maui, Hilton popped up with a 50K for 5 night special on the internet and we jumped at it with a couple of paid days added on to round out our week. But as I was suspicious of all things related to award travel, I contacted the Hotel directly and talked to the reservations manager and discussed the need to link the award with the paid and asked to assure we didn't have to move. When we arrived, we were treated to prompt and courteous valet staff, a lei greeting, and a simple and flawless check in. As the points stay did not guarantee room "View" we assumed the worst, but on check in the staff said they had upgraded us to full ocean view if we didn't mind the older wing. We didn't and the room itself, although aged, was clean and very quiet with a great view of Molokini and Kaho'olowe. The grounds of the Grand Wailea were meticulously kept, but some of the things we found annoying were carts running around at 6:00 AM, clanking tools on the carts, and the construction noise although minor from the building in front of us. But you couldn't fault the staff as they really tried to keep the place well maintained, despite the fact that the GWR is showing her age. But it does so gracefully. The pools were nice, but the kids/activities pools were way too crowded and busy for adults like us and the adult pool is really very boring but has nice tanning areas with uncrowded lounge chairs. Very average, but with the Wailea beach 100 yards away, who can complain? But there were downsides. One of the really annoying aspects of the pool complex is having to walk down to the activities pool to get towels and a ridiculous little plastic wrist band to show we are guests before we could just lay around at the adult pool. For a place this size, a towel area up at the adult pool wouldn't be asking too much. I understand the issues, but maybe even a gate with a room key access and an attendant would be a bit more classy? But it was nice to be able to use the pools at night and the evening swims were so relaxing a way to bring a close to the day. The Wailea beach is stunning. Not that great for snorkeling, but for just being lazy, walking at night, splashing about, etc. it was fantastic. Beautiful sand and water, and even when there are a lot of people on it, never really seems crowded. There was also excellent snorkeling was just a mile or two to the South at Polo, White Rock, Po'oulenalena, and off Secret Cove. The Makeena area was really nice as well. Going north, Keawakapu beach is spendid to be on, but not much for snorkeling. But for a view without having to go north so far as the three Kama's where obviously you get quite a lot of local crowds, it was a very nice locale. For food, Kihei had several nice local places of every food type and many small local bars. But for the resort, the coffee shop is very limited for those that just want a light continental, and the atmosphere and quality wasn't better than your local Hampton Inn's free breakfast, but unlike your local Hampton, you pay for this one. The Molokini Bistro was pretty lousy with high prices and very mediocre food. The view and atmosphere wasn't much and the whole experience was not memorable at all. However, Humu's was much better than most of the reviews had led us to believe it would be and the view, atmosphere, staff, and food were all excellent. And it helped that the hotel management gave Honors Gold and Diamond members a 40.00 credit. There were really no complaints from our one dinner there (we aren't into big dining, so we went to local places in Kihei, the old Lahaina Luau, and both the two main restaurants in the GWR. We didn't try the Sushi Restaurant. One of our main complaints was the guest free parking. The valet was efficient, but with drop and pick tips and a ridiculous 20.00 a day fee, for those like us who come and go all day, the valet wasn't an option and even if you disregard the economics related to using it, just too much of a pain. But the parking was ridiciuously difficult until night. The employees apparently can share the free parking structure, but guests can't share the employee parking. So in the day, you grab whatever you can, and many times there are NO parking places at all. This is atrocious and needs to be fixed. They had half the top level blocked off for line painting while guests had no area to park in. We fought it every day, figured out the patterns, and adjusted our activities to come in after the 7-3 shift was leaving. The walk in, with a bottle of wine, water, and other miscellaneous items assured us our caloric intake would not be an issue during our stay as you had quite a little hike from the south end of the complex up to the Molokini Wing. But in a nutshell, our complaints were limited, we definitely enjoyed the stay and would go back again. The run down wing we were in is slated to be remodeled and that will be a good thing. But the conditions were very clean, comfortable, and our maid (Lolita) was meticulous. She even ordered our shoes as between my wife and I we probably had 10-12 pairs (mostly hers) laying about. She would have them perfectly lined up, our flowers on the bed, and everything perfect each day. The tip was generous, but sometimes we felt guilty because of her attentions. Very friendly staff, beautiful place, fantastic beach. Tough to be too critical even though the GWR may be past it's prime it is still the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: LTownsendMD
Reviews.Content: OK, let's be fair about this....I'm a Maui Prince for the adults kind of guy, but finally my teen begged to come here instead. I DO understand that with the incredible pools and activity, teens would love this better. She adored the sushi...she and my wife felt it was the best they'd ever had. She LOVED the pool with the water elevator... This is the Giant, crowded, bustling place to go....if that is what you want (teens and kids over ten would.) The South End of Maui is an absolute tropical paradise. MAKE SURE you take the Catamaran from the near-by Maui Prince.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Traveljaq
Reviews.Content: Service from this hotel was arrogant and unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Grand" Wailea”
Reviews.Author: bcnixon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Wailea for business for a week. I work in the travel industry and was not impressed with this hotel. While it does boast a fantastic pool and luscious tropical landscaping, it is desperately in need of a serious renovation and could use a little kick in the pants when it comes to servicing groups. The truly disappointing aspect of it all was that their occupancy was only at 60% and so was their service. The Cons: - Weathered and outdated furniture -Old 27" TV -Dirty bathrooms, the shower and tub were dingy and moldy, there were holes in our towels -We did not receive turn down service two nights in a row -Our room was generally not cleaned until the early evening -The minibar has a ziptie on it!!! -Our front door was located directly in front of one of their waterfall lagoons which smelled like a dirty fishbowl every morning -They close their cafe called "Cafe Kula" every day from 1:00-4:00pm, forcing you to either dine in one of their overpriced restaurants or venture off property in the middle of the day The Pros: -Great, large pool -Family friendly -Great beach front location -Staff is generally pleasant Final verdict: Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on your perception”
Reviews.Author: pyruvate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Napua Tower Club section of the resort during our recent week long vacation. The Napua Tower is an "elite" level of rooms with the requisite bump to an already substantial price. The rooms were spacious, clean (with the two notable exceptions) and had good views of the garden area, pools and ocean. The staff at check in was courteous but not as helpful and informative as one would expect. We were pointed to an elevator with assurance that our luggage would follow us. An hour later I called down to the front desk to remind them that I did in fact expect the bags to arrive sooner rather than later - which was promptly addressed. The room: The toilet in our room did not flush as the chain in the toilet tank was broken. Six hours after requesting to the front desk for the issue to be fixed I simply stuck my hands into the tank water and fiddled for three minutes to fix the problem.
