If you want a really good lunch, try Cafe Ole in Kihea. It was very good and reasonably priced. Camp Grande for kids is also expensive, but the women who work there are nice. The only complaint I have re: Camp Grande is that they told me two women would be watching my children and when we went to leave them, they said it was just going to be one man. I didn't like leaving them for the 2 hours anyway, and this made me really uncomfortable. When I communicated this to the women checking my kids in, she told me she would stay instead. She didn't stay, but she did get another woman to come stay in her place. My kids said they had an okay time. So, overall it was a good stay, but I would research other options before returning to The Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Storybook Stay at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: JustaTravler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at the Wailea Seaside Chapel and couldn't have asked for a more amazing day...of course, we had to fight for it. I booked our stay and wedding through the resort about a year and a half before the wedding date. In that time, I endured a number of Customer Sastisfaction dissappointments which I diligently documented. Over the course of a year and a half, I was erroneously charged two times, experienced poor customer service over the phone and was highly dissappointed in the Weddings Department. For the reputation of the hotel and the high cost associated with getting married there, I was extremely dissappointed in the level of attention I wasn't receiving and the high turnover of Wedding Coordinators (I had a total of 4 different coordinators!). Armed with documentation of all that went wrong prior to arriving on the island, I was extremely impressed with the staff for rectifying my dissappointment. My husband and I were upgraded to an Ocean View room that overlooked the Chapel and were subsequently happy with our decision to stay at the Grand Wailea. One obvious not of distinction regarding this hotel is their ridiculously priced food and beverages (true of most of the island), and the hotel's ability to attach a charge to everything. For instance, a charge of 5 dollars was attached to our bill because our half-eaten wedding cake was delivered to our room. Along with another 5 dollar charge when we requested utensils to eat it. Be prepared to shell out the big bucks. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, especially the pools and lovely grounds. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BeachHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, My wife and I just got back from vacation in Maui. While researching for hotels, we noted that everyone hyped up two hotels: Grand Wailea and Four Seasons Maui. The two hotels are located side by side, so we decided to split our vacation between the two hotels. We stayed at the Four Seasons and then moved to the Grand Wailea for the later part of our trip. In summary, my wife and I were very disappointed with Grand Wailea. Below is some information that we hope could help others in making a decision if you are unsure between the two hotels. Check in (1): Normal check in is around 3:30 pm. Four Seasons (FS) - We arrived at the FS from the airport at noon. Even thought the hotel was fully sold out, they were able to find us a room without any waiting time. Grand Wailea (GW) - We arrived at the GW from the FS at noon. We were not checked in until 3pm. Supposedly there were no rooms available, while we knew by looking at Hilton.com that there were availabilities in all room classes. Check in (2): Front desk FS - Very polite and welcoming. Great to deal with. GW - Very cold and unwelcoming. We felt like they are paying us to stay there even though it was costing us $700/night. Room: FS - Beautiful rooms with the best bathroom i've seen at any hotel (and my wife and I are frequent travelers) GW - Outdated rooms. Outdated bathrooms. You feel like you're back in the 80s. Pool: I give the edge to the GW just because of the waterpark for kids. Many slides that adults could even enjoy. Pool service: Edge to the FS by far. Very bad service. Cold staff. Cost:(we booked 5 months in advance) FS - $400/night GW - $700/night Overall, our experience at FS was amazing. We'd go back to that hotel any time. We really loved it. Our experience at the GW was pretty bad (even through we paid $300 more a night), mostly as a result of the bad service and the room condition. It was obvious that guest service was very weak at the GW and we just did not feel welcomed there. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Not for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: offwego5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three children just returned from the Grand Wailea. One of the reasons for writing the review is to warn honeymooners that this is not the place to be. We've traveled extensively and usually stay at the Ritz. Friends suggested the GW because of the kiddie slides. All I kept thinking as I searched for a lounge chair near the slides (don't be scared, you can find them) is why would a couple without kids stay here? The spa is beautiful. As a matter of fact, my young daughters and I had treatments together. But after viewing the Four Seasons next door and the peace and serenity I would stay there. A week before we left I found out that you could purchase day passes for the GW slides yet not be a registered guest, that may account for the crowds and dirtiness in the slide area. Be prepared to spend $$ at every turn but we usually just chalk it up to vacation. Service is accomodating but certainly not warm or overextending. The place was probably beautiful in its day. The rooms just need refreshing. Be prepared for a musty smell when you arrive in the room. We had two rooms and both were the same. Overall believe it or not we had a great time. We did a lot of sight seeing to avoid the crowded kids pools and I do have to admit that dinners at the GW were very good. Breakfast buffet is fair and for the 5 of us each morning it was $125. Best restaurant was off property in Pai'a at Mama's Fish House. If you have small kids skip the road to Hana no matter what anyone tells you. The stops don't have "parking" and you're squeezed along a narrow road which wraps around and there are lots of winding turns. Luckily no one was sick but we had a few who were close to it. This is my first review. Hoped it wasn't so negative but I feel that when you make that trip you should have the cons and not just the beautiful website photos of the hotel. I absolutely love Maui and would go back tomorrow...I would just stay elsewhere...even my kids agree that the water slides were not worth staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Grand!”
Reviews.Author: SBH55
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel and beautiful property situated on one of the best beaches in Maui (shared with the Four Seasons). The staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. Lovely room - with a direct ocean view and breezy lanai. The spa is not to be missed - some of the best treatments I have ever had (comparing against the Bliss/Red Door type day spas and other resort spas). The pool is magnificent and the waterslides are a MUST - even for adults. One negative point - they do "nickel and dime". Valet parking is extra, there is a resort charge, charge for beach umbrellas, and no free water or beverages in the room (although available around the property). This gave the resort a bit of a cheap feeling. I would have preferred to pay $100 more a night and have everything included. Overall a beautiful resort and a great holiday destination!

Reviews.Title: “Wow... impressive place”
Reviews.Author: andrealee
Reviews.Content: We were quite amazed by the palatial-ness of this hotel. The room was beautiful, and the hotel itself very grand-- full of statues, flowers, fountains, beautiful sitting areas -- and then you get to the water park. Oh my goodness. They have GREAT waterslides, a water volcano, waterfalls, a pool-river that you can float along WITH rapids, a rope swing, and more. They even have a "water elevator" (which we did not try). We were there during the summer, so all of these attractions were quite packed with children (especially the water rapids slide, which was like a bowling alley of 9 year olds)-- but we 30-somethings managed to squeeze in and partake... It was fun! They also have one adult-only pool (which has a lot of adults lounging in it with Mai Tais)... so that one was pleasantly low-key... One thing I would say as a problem is the premium you have to pay for shade on the pool deck ($150 for the minimum two-chair accordion umbrella coverage, and goodness knows how much for a cabana). The sun is very hot and strong-- or at least it was when we were there in August. Down in the children's area, there are a few free thatch umbrellas (though people seemed to take the chairs under those quite early in the morning), but it's noisy down there-- not a super relaxing place to sit if you're a couple without kids. On the beach area you can rent an umbrella-- not sure how much that is, but I just think, if you are paying that much for a room, they shouldn't be so stingy with the shade. We have stayed at less expensive beach hotels elsewhere in the world (Mexico, Bermuda) where beach umbrellas were part of the deal... Anyway, we just stayed here one night, as we wanted to move around Maui and spend our days out touring and snorkeling, etc (if we are paying that much for a hotel, we didn't want to be out doing activities all day). One day/night was good to experience the "oh WOW" factor, but of course, two nights or more will be more relaxing... All depends on your budget!

Reviews.Title: “great framily resort”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at begining of August with husband and 2 daughters (age 18 &16). we booked 2 rooms both with un obstructed views of ocean (9th floor). Arrival was easy. took the advise of another reviewer and went through hertz number 1 club so our car was ready and waiting. Stopped at costco right outside airport and got 2 cases of bottled water, some wine and other stuff. Drove to Grand Wailea. check in was quick and easy. rooms were great. not big but wonderful views. would have stayed on club floor but no rooms available. Everyone who works at the resort was wonderful. We mainly stayed on the grounds since the girls wanted to sun bath. We were always on the beach rather than at pool. Lots of families and kids at pools but the beach was wonderful. You pay for everything. 50 dollars for a beach umbrella for the day. they have cabanas that sell out so check when you make a reservation if you want to spend the 175 a day. We would eat at the buffet every morning (pricey at 24/person) but very good. lunches at the restaurant by the pools and beach is good but we tired of it quickly. we went out to dinner every night (mateos pizza, thai and sushi in Kehei - lots of choices 15 minutes drive away). Walking distance to small shopping. had 2 great meals at Longi's. One day we drove out hotel and turned right towards 4 seasons to find a small truck by the side of the road selling fish tacos (valet had recommended it). sat on the side of the road and had a great meal. Overall I would recommend this hotel for families but you need to shut your eyes everytime you sign for anything since it is very expensive. Our rooms were 800/room and every meal for 4 people cost at leadt 100 dollars except when we went off resort. The girls loved it since they only wanted to hang out on the beach. the beach is wonderful and ocean was great. I would certainly recommend this hotel but remember to clear your credit card balance and just enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids, not for couples”
Reviews.Author: JB33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui, where we stayed 4 nights at the Grand Wailea, 3 nights at the Hyatt and 1 at the Marriott Vacation Club (see other reviews). The Grand has beautiful grounds, great for photos, and excellent customer service. The pools and slides were tons of fun for us as well as the kids. We also loved the swim up bar. For our purposes (traveling with 3 young kids) it was a good choice. We were able to go out to the nice restaurants (also very good) with the kids, because everyone else had theirs with them too. That being said, we would never stay there without the kids, and probably wouldn't again with them. It was difficult to find chairs to sit on and very crowded. The food was also very expensive on property (go to the nearby town of Kihei, Lulu's was great). They claim to have the adults only pool for people without their kids, but unfortunately they did allow noisy teenagers. It is also right in the middle of a main pathway and not quiet and relaxing as it should be. The room was very average, nothing special. Better than the Hyatt room, but the Marriott Vacation Resort was 5 times nicer and more than half the price. All in all, a good stay, but too crowded and pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravleHelper
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice, and yet family oriented hotel (thats what my family and I look for most importantly). The nearby restaurants were nice, and our stay overall was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Wailea in Maui is truly Grand!”
Reviews.Author: DessertFirst
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea was wonderful! The resort is conveniently located, beautiful, has the best beach access and has a great pool complex. We had a deluxe ocean view suite that was large and had a great view. The staff was generally friendly and helpful. The concierge service was especially good. There was one employee in the business center who was borderline rude, ignoring my questions while she popped her gum, but otherwise everyone there was very friendly and eager to please. The ONLY drawback is the policy to charge for everything. When you go to the Grand Wailea, you go in knowing that you are in a very upscale resort and that you had better be prepared to spend some serious cash. The Grand goes too far. You feel that they are taking advantage of you. A breakfast at their main ballroom for three was just about $100 with tip. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but you just felt like you were being over charged. A light lunch at the Kula Cafe will cost you about $15-20 per person. The worst restaurant on site was the Bistro Molokai. The food was very disappointing to all three of us and the cost was incredible. An appetizer, a salad, a pasta dish and a mediocre lobster sandwich with drinks for 3 was over $100. To round off the terrible experience, this restaurant was loud and the service was poor. (Offsite, we found Ashley's for breakfast and lunch. About a 10 minute drive, the food was fantastic, the service friendly and the prices very reasonable. A little local place that did not disappoint. Excellent breakfast and one of the best cheese burgers around.) The final blow at the Grand was when I needed to print out my boarding passes at the business center. It cost me just over $21 to print them out. A service that most hotels will offer for free. Hint: Make sure that you enter the resort by the second entrance (marked Ballroom) so that you can go into the free parking lot. They don't tell you about that and the valet is $15 a day. There is also a daily $25 "resort charge" that we couldn't figure out what it was for. Even with the gouging going on, I would definitely go back because the rooms, the view, the location, the service and the facilities were great. If only they didn't nickel and dime you to death this would be a 5 star review.

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: Saku_Koivu
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Lots of lounges, chairs, pools, staff, beach & booze. We came here at the tail end of our 2 week honeymoon. Cruised the first week and stayed here the second week. Received an ocean view upgrade on arrival and loved our room. Comfy bed, spacious, huge bathroom, and plenty of towels and great spa products. Had a lanai on the ground floor on top of a lagoon and sat out at night watching the sunset behind lit hawaiian torches. Absolutely fantastic.....and a hot new wife to cap it all off! We ate the pool restaurant for lunch....and the cafe for breakfast....but after some poor reviews of the high end restaurant at Wailea....we didn't chance it and walked down the beach and has some equisite dinners at the Four Seasons (5 minute walk). This place is all class....but relaxing and fun. Great for romance....with not too many kids when we were there....so I had the waterslide all to myself!

Reviews.Title: “Open minded review”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird6676
Reviews.Content: I went to the Grand Wailea for my sisters wedding in Maui. I had a room in the towers and was happy with the room and view. Pool and beach were excellent. The resort is great for little ones and can be enjoyed by the adult crowd as well. I had read some reviews before I left and became concerned until I arrived. When coming to a hotel like this you have to expect you will be charged everytime you turn around its not an all-inclusive deal. My only complaint during the stay was clean up after I ordered room service. If food is left any where in this enviroment expect un wanted guests if it is not cleaned up promply. I was instructed to leave my food tray outside the door when I was finished and when I left the room an hour later there was ants everywhere and that was on the 6th floor. If you are staying in Maui this is the only place I would stay and I look forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND and priced accordingly”
Reviews.Author: horns72
Reviews.Content: We just spent one week at the Grand Weilea and had a fablous time. (Children ages 13,12,9 - they may try and tell you you need 2 rooms but don't buy it or any 'fire code' mumbo jumbo. We stayed in 1 room and it was fine, just be persistent. and the rooms are large). It has one of the grandest and most hawaiian lobbies of any hotel in Hawaii I've ever stayed out. We have lived on Kauai for 2 years previously and this was our 2nd trip here to GW. Also stayed at the Kei Lani next door on 2 occasions on previous trips. Prior to having our family, we'd stay in Kanapali at Hyatt, or condo's in the 80's. I'm saddened to see how ruined Lahaina has become with cheap tourist stores, hard rock cafe, etc.. There are 2 worlds on this part of Maui -- Wailea and Kehei. Kehei is for the economy traveler with a family. Nothing wrong with that. Staying at any of the 3 major Wailei hotels vs. any of the Kehei hotels is like -- well staying at the Plaza in NYC vs. Holiday Inn. When I travel I stay at H.I. but when I vacation I stay at the Plaza!. So I agree it's very expensive and they charge you for everything which is annoying. Staying in Kehei or Kannapali is more economical and come have a $12.00 cocktail at the lobby of the GW. :-) . Most come here w./ families for the pool system -- it is one of the worlds best as someone commented. Your children and you will have a blast. It's annoying to have to be in line at 7am when the pool opens to 'stake out' your 'free'(paid by the $25/day 'resort fee' they stick you with ... :-) ) lounge with 'free' shade. Yes, they charge $200 for tented cabanas, 50 for umbrellas, and 75 for 2 person lounge with top. So, come here but throw away the budget or you'll ruin your time for yourself and your family. All these 'extra' charges add up quickly -- smoothies (they are wonderful and you'll never be able to drink just one!!), $10-12 drinks, $15.00 hamburgers (but a very big and decent hamburger I would add). Don't come if you cannot afford it. Little Johnny didn't need to go to Stanford after all now did he! :-) My only negative is it's a very large hotel, and even though it manages the the number of guests exceptionally well, it's still big. I've checked contact ok if anyone has addl. questions. I read/skimmed the a few of the previous reviews and I think they are accurate. p.s. I've reviewed Hilton Waikoloa on Big Island and Kahala on Oahu as well as we stayed there on this 3 week trip. My Little Johnny DEFINITELY ISN"T GOING TO STANFORD!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: meroSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the hotel. The other two visits were pleasant and fairly relaxing. This visit, however, was very disappointing. Our room was not ready until an hour after the check in time. We were not able to use the room allocated to guests who are waiting for their room- this was "full". Instead, we changed into bathing suits in a closet. The main problem with our stay was that the resort was overcrowded. The adult pool (guests over 18 years old) had numerous guests under 18 who were loud and playing football. There were no chaise lounges available after 7:30 am. Everyone "reserved" the lounges with towels but never showed up. This also applied to the cabanas. They were reserved but no one ever used them. The sushi restaurant was the most disappointing of all the restaraunts. The service was poor and the sushi was fair at best.

Reviews.Title: “my family loves this hotel! Our favorite hotel in all othe Hawaiin Islands”
Reviews.Author: jadejared
Reviews.Content: This is a grand hotel, but be prepared... if you stay at the Grand Wailea and play, you will pay. If you can afford to stay here, this hotel expects that you can afford to pay. This visit was a return visit for us. My children are older ages 11 and 14 love this hotel as much as we do. After our return visit this time, this is still our very favorite hotel. Our kids did not want to go to Maui, if we could not return back to this hotel. So it is number one with our family. The food is very expensive for what you get. We had breakfast buffet in main dining room $125.00 per each morning. drinks are $12.00, mixed, we thought very well, though pricey. The Volcano Bar was expensive and the morning Caffe was also over the top. We ate at hotel a few meals and drinks and went off property during the day for dinner. We do not go to Grand Wailea for the food, WE GO FOR THE GREAT WATER AREA FOR THE KIDS, lazy river, water slides, water elevator, several pools, etc. and THE FABULOUS BEACH BY THE WATER ACTIVITIES, and THIS HOTEL IS LAID OUT NICER THAN ANY HOTEL WE HAVE EVER VISITED WORLDWIDE. (We travel) The adult pool is picture perfect and done just right. This hotel is very peaceful and I always feel relaxed and rested when we are setting there looking out at the ocean in our room. We had an excellent view, 8th floor, above the palm trees looking directly out at the beautiful ocean. WE WILL DEFINITELY RETURN TO OUR FAVORITE HOTEL when we get lucky enough to find time to return to Maui. The hotel is showing some wear, the very large soaking bath tub had some tile wear and the beds could have been more plush. but the rooms are still grand and the maid service did come into the rooms periodically, I will say that the cleaning was not as good in the rooms as the two previous Hiltons that we had stayed out during our vacation on the islands. We found the staff very accomodating and very friendly everywhere we were and all request from our family were taken care of quickly and efficiently. The best thing I can say to readers is if you are can afford to stay and play at the Grand Wailea expect to pay. Is is worth it? We obviously think so, we will always go back to this wonderful hotel any chance that we get. I have never stayed at the Four Seasons, next door, we did walk over and look at it, it looked great also but it was not the Grand Wailea, there is something wonderful about staying here just don't over expect a great value for your dollar. We will always return back to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “goods and bads”
Reviews.Author: sfdiver
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, for our trip to the GW, we used Hilton points and stayed for free, so I can't compain too much - it was great and we had a fabulous time. We also went knowing how extremely expensive Hawaii is. And its true, the location, grounds and pools at the Grand Wailea are fabulous, but I'm not sure I would be able to justify the $550 - $650 a night they charge if I was actually paying for a hotel room. The rooms are getting a little older and need a bit of rennovation. Wall paper is starting to peel from the walls and much of the grout in the tile in the bathroom has gone brown and black from use. The carpet often feels damp from humidity...I would suggest tile flooring rather than carpet. All in all, they need to update the place if they are going to continue to charge those prices. Food at the resort - as all resorts in Hawaii are are overpriced and not very good. We payed $12 for 2 lattes each morning, cocktails are $12 a pop - some strong, some very weak, and a burger costs $15. We ate offsite alot at Sensei Sushi, Cheeseburger Paradise, and Kehei Cafe. MUCH better food. I did appreciate the fact that children's food items at the resort are reasonable. $6-$10 per item, even at the higher end restaurants. The pools and beach are fantastic and is the biggest reason why I would return to the GW (on another free trip :o). They have water slides, roap swings, beach pools, volleyball, caves etc. and the kids were in heaven. But be prepared to get up at the crack of dawn and seek out your chairs right at 7am, or you will be left empty handed. There are too many people, not enough room for chairs and the staff do a lousy job of monitoring those people who show up at 7 to stake out a spot and then don't return until 2 in the afternoon. Also, there's also not alot of "free" shade. Shade costs you $200 a day for a cabana. All in all, I do like the GW and I would go again, but I would certainly reconsider my desination if price was a consideration. For $550 a night you could find many more spectacular places in the carribean or mexico for the same or much less.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience (Even If the Pools are Slightly Overrated)”
Reviews.Author: bradyrama
Reviews.Content: While on vacation in Maui, we took a vacation from a crowded timeshare unit with extended family for a night at the Grand Wailea. We had heard raves about the pools on a Travel Channel program and wanted to experience them for ourselves We had a fantastic time. We played with our infant daughter in the pools, floated down the lazy river, had C-List celebrity sightings, rode the water elevator, and chatted it up with the other guests for a couple of days. On the other hand, the rim of the pool was extremely crowded. You need to get there early to claim a spot. The water elevator is one of a kind, but there are reasons for that. It takes a really long time to reset, and it really isn't all that exciting. The lazy river is on the short side. There really aren't nine different pools. The really big pool just has very distinct areas, some of which are passed off as separate pools. On the minorly annoying side, people accumulate wristbands as a status symbol to show how long they've been at the hotel. Maybe they keep them on because they have nothing to remove them with, and I was just bugged because I didn't get the chance to get more of them. Good water parks offer better water attractions, but the Grand Wailea is unique because it offers exceptional water attractions in the more mellow and sociable environs of a hotel pool. Yes, Discovery Cove in Orlando has a much better lazy river. On the other hand, I don't hang out, soak, and talk with strangers in water parks. Of course, the room was amazing. The bathroom was spectacular. My lanai had a little grassy patch, which was nice for my daughter. Service and food were all outstanding. Personally, I loved the Botelo sculptures in the lobby. Like most nice Hawaiian hotels, you get leied as you enter the hotel. The Grand Wailea was a great experienced. If I was staying there, I would limit touring the rest of the island and just enjoy my time there. I have to say I would love to get a few more of those wristbands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: tanfam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui where we planned to spend 10 days at the Grand Wailea. The setting is beautiful but the rooms, the staff, the cleanliness and the service left us wondering what we were paying so much money for. Our room suffered from deferred maintenance; the bedding was not clean; the mattress was broken down on one side; the tile in the bathroom was stained and often not cleaned well by housekeeping; the shower head leaked more water from the valve than it sprayed. When asked to leave extra towels, housekeeping simply took the tip and moved the note to the nightstand, ignoring the request entirely. We reserved and paid $275.00 in advance for a cabana at the pool and had to spend the entire day policing the chairs that were included with the cabana because the hotel does not provide different towels to indicate that those are reserved chairs. When we asked for a different cabana location after our third day in the same one (we wanted a change of scenery), we were told that we could have that same cabana or none. The food was mediocre at best, and very expensive, although the wait staff at every place we ate was friendly and helpful. On the fourth day we sought the assistance of a manager for the smelly bedding and inability to get enough towels for each of us to have just one. The solution was to remove the feather bed and down comforter and leave us with a lightweight blanket and cheap mattress pad. The attitude was "if you don't like it we can make it worse for you." Our bill was in excess of $1200. per day with the standard room in the lagoon wing, cabana and food we charged to the room-not worth it for that kind of attitude! We checked out on the fifth day and moved to The Four Seasons where we had exquisite service, food and our room was clean and free of deferred maintenance. Our bill was much lower and our vacation was revived.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - not a Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: julieSanDiego_Ca
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day stay at the GW. Like the previous entry, we were "nickle and dimed" for everything! With the expensive room rates and overpriced, mediocre food, you would still expect outstanding service. Not the case, service was horrid. Even the conceirge and Grande Spa front desk staff were unpleasant and unaccomodating. At one point in the middle of the night, staff was dragging what sounded like furniture across the top of the room waking us all up after midnight and for over an hour. The waterpark was out of control and not relaxing at all. A staff member even hurled a football to his co-worker and nearly knocked down my young child. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty - but very crowded!”
Reviews.Author: TxTxAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the G.W. for 3 nights, zipped over to Kauai for a week, and then back to Maui (stayed at the Fairmont). I guess you have to see the G.W. -- and everyone told us we "had" to stay there. It is pretty - the landscaping is great - the pools are over-the-top, etc... My teens didn't think the water slides were that great at the G.W. - but they've been to The Atlantis on Paradise Island many times and the water rides there are truly amazing. My teens spent most of their time at the beach. My 13-year old really had a great time at the teen dance club!!! That was the highlight of his stay at the hotel. The rooms were just fine at the G.W. They're not nearly as large as others nearby. However, they're nice and clean. You must be prepared to walk a LONG way from your room to the shops or to the beach. This is a huge property. The shops are nice - the restaurants are OK - but everything is pricey. We enjoyed the art gallery one evening late. The employee was super sweet with our teens and told us about the local artists exhibited. The G.W. is nice and clean. But the crowds -- sheesh -- it's just busy all the time. We searched for ONE chair by the pool/beach and knew it would be impossible to get four. We finally sat by the garbage bins, facing the bar. The last day, my husband punted and paid the 75.00 for a casabella - the little lawn chairs with the pull-up shades. Definitely do this if you have to have a chair by the pool/beach. Reserve these in advance!!! The beach is jam-packed with people....and not just hotel guests. Many locals use this beach and can also use the hotel lawn chairs. My kids had a hard time finding a stretch on the beach on which to play frisbee for all of the crowds. This situation is completey different down the beach a bit at the Fairmont (I have posted a review of that hotel, too). My kids used the beach, pool, and had no difficulty meeting other teens at the Fairmont....but it's LOTS quieter there. Overall, I don't think I'd book again at the G.W. it's OK....and it was good to see it, once.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families but with downsides”
Reviews.Author: Bay-Area-Foodie
Reviews.Content: My wife, our two kids (4 years and 18 months), and I spent a half day at the Wailea and Four Seasons deciding which one to stay at for the second half of our trip (we extended our trip and just showed up at the hotels). We literally walked the properties, asked questions of the respective staffs, etc. And while we chose the GW for the kids, we had meals at several locations (including three at the 4S). Notwithstanding a lot of the gloss in the other reviews on this site, there are vast differences between the GW and 4S. If you have children, the pools and water park at the GW are compelling. Two big slides (kids must be at least 46 inches tall to ride at all) and plenty of smaller pools and slides for others to try out. There is also a baby beach area, which is a sandy part of the pool that is just like a real beach, but without waves. It is a great place for little ones to be watched by their parents (and nannies), without some of the stress of playing on a beach with waves. Another plus of the GW is the grounds, which are sweeping (the property is huge). At least from where we were staying, one can look out over an expansive lawn to the beach. The 4S is on a bit more of a hill (maybe 30 to 40 feet), so the feel is more of being at an Italian resort overlooking the water (without the beach being immediately visible from most spots). Downsides of the GW: 1. The service can be impersonal. A valet drove over an inflatable tube that we had, leaving a tire imprint and (later, we found out) putting a leak in the tube. The bellman and valet just kind of shrugged. This would never happen at a 4S. 2. In rounding a corner en route to our room, the bellman clipped my daughter's boogey board on a corner, causing it to emit a cracking noise. He just looked at us and then ignored it. 3. Our room was fantastic and subpar. We were in 0016 (0010-0017 are all similar). Ocean view, ground level. We had a terrace a foot above a fish pond. It was fantastic for the kids to be able to throw bread in for the koi. It was a morning and evening ritual. Downsides are that the room was very musty / moldy and the carpet very dirty. Literally, we would get out of the tub or shower with clean feet and then our soles would get very dark just walking around the room. Would not happen at 4S. 4. Food is not just a notch, but two notches below the 4S and the prices are just about the same, with the GW higher in many cases (particularly for items from the children's menu). If you are a foody and decide to stay here, just have all of your meals over at the 4S. 5. The pools / water park are madness. Very loud and teeming with people, hundreds and hundreds of them. Screaming bands of kids. Kind of reminded me of that Mel Gibson movie, "Mad Max". This is okay if you have kids and are there for mayhem. But it is not relaxing, if that is what you are looking for. It is important to note that hotel staff can have birthday parties for their kids at the hotel, with tons of kids packed into normal hotel rooms for sleepovers and then invading the pool the next day. Another thing to consider is that the GW also sells admission to the pool to non-guests. $150 per week for adults and I did not check on the kids rate. So, as a result, some savvy folks who want a more refined atmosphere will stay at the 4S and then buy weekly passes for their kids to go next door and descend on the GW pool system. 6. The hotel is big and can get crowded. To get good chairs, I had to go down to the pooly by 7:00 a.m. each day, which wasn't that bad because we like to get an early start anyway. But it is something that one does not have to do at the smaller 4S. 7. My biggest problem with the GW is that, much like a cruise, it is designed to separate you from your money. Wailea is expensive, which is fine. I have no problem paying $40 or $50 per entree at the good restauarants, because that is the going rate. But I really hate being nickle and dimed by my hotel: a. Pool cabanas: 4 chairs under a cabana + 4 exterior chairs. One of the few ways to get shade. No real amenities. There are maybe 15 or so cabanas. The cost? $275 per day. That is not a typo. I was floored. So, I asked the question at the 4S, which had almost the same number but for a much smaller # of guests -- the answer was "no charge." Needless to say, we didn't pay for this. Nor did we pay $175 for the use of a two-chair "cassetta" for the day. b. Their are two tiers of in-room internet access. The better option, which is the only one that will replicate what you are used to, is $15 per day. More nickle and diming. c. Printed a 75-page document at the business center. $1 per page. $75. Okay, so far. But then they were going to charge me $0.50 for a binder clip. d. It is actually more costly to have kids at the GW than at the 4S. For example, breakfast is free for < 5 guests at the 4S; not so at the GW. And the rest of the meals at the 4S for kids are far superior (and less costly) than at the GW. Also, the 4S puts out corn dogs and mac and cheese at the pool for kids -- again, at no cost. The ironic thing is that the rooms at the 4S are somewhat more expensive, but when you factor in all of the ways that the GW will separate you from your money (I have only listed a few), they must net out to be about the same. Finally, the atmosphere at the 4S is much more distinguished than at the GW. There is no comparison. The pool is much smaller (though still of a respectable size). It has a refined Italian resort feel to it, instead of a water park. In sum, I do not know why a couple would ever choose the GW over the 4S. For those with kids, the GW makes sense (with knowledge that you are consciously making some sacrifices), but just remember to have your meals over at the 4S (it is a short walk). Or alternatively, stay at the 4S and buy passes to the GW pool for your kids so that they can go run around somebody else's pool.

Reviews.Title: “Careful at the Grand Wailea Resort”
Reviews.Author: Michiganlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: It has been a while since we were at the Grand Wailea, but the experience is one I should have shared earlier. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea several times as part of a business group, and until our last visit, have had good experiences. At a nearby jewelry store, my husband purchased a bracelet for me for our anniversary. It disappeared from our safe, and we got little help attempting to get it back. It was obviously an inside job. Enjoy the Grand Wailea, but be aware that you can not keep any valuables on the premises--even in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: Glamgal52
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea exceeded our expectations. We went there recently for our honeymoon and were extremely pleased. They have agents working full time to help you book bike trips, hiking trips, dinner and other activities. The food was delicious. They went above and beyond our expectations of service. Nice workout facility, close to restaurants and shops. The only negative thing I could say is don't expect anything to be cheap. The hotel is expensive for everything. Although, we found this all throughout Maui.

Reviews.Title: “It's a hotel with a water park!”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: Maui is an interesting place. I had a worker tell me that there are more Caucasians in Maui than Hawaiians. For a few times during our stay I really had to remind myself where I was. There is no luau or type of Aloha spirit evident except from the lei greeting at check in or the telephone operators who always said "Aloha" and "Mahalo." Interestingly enough there was a very large fireworks show (and it wasn't 4th of July) that was put on by one of the convention groups who were there. That certainly didn't remind me of Hawaii! On several occasions we passed employees who just walked by with their head down, not even smiling. Well, with that out of the way, here goes. We have stayed at this hotel before and knew what to expect. We had a garden view room which is very large by hotel standards. The king beds actually face the window. How intelligent is that? The bathroom is plush and large. I love the adult pool and cabanas. One of the things that I really hate is the people who go to the hotel and then complain about the prices. Heard a few of those conversations, but quickly figured out that these folks were vacation winners and freebie conventioners. (Saw a lot of people eating pizza and sandwiches on their lanais.) We had a cabana for every day of our stay. Definitely cheaper than a sunburn. I laugh at people who complain about the cabana prices. There's always the chairs and umbrellas on the beach for I think $35 or something like that. Sit there if you don't want to spend the money for the cabana or stick a towel over your head - towels are complimentary, you can get as many as you want and you don't have to sign them out. I'm also amazed by people who complain about the breakfast. We went to Cafe Kula every day. My breakfast was hearty and never cost me over $11. The water park is amazing. The slides are great and the pool is always kept spotless. With 700 rooms it amazes me how they can keep all the pools and slides so neat and clean. Bottom line: if you want peace and quiet stay next door. If you want a place with a lot of fun, but quiet areas as well, then this is the hotel for you. Oh, we did have several problems with our air conditioning. Room never seemed to get really cold. Not sure about the negative reviews below. We didn't see those type of problems. Saw basic wear and tear, but that was about it. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay...for a price”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Wailea for a conference for 3 nights. It was a wonderful stay. The landscaping on the property is well done, and the level of service, in general, is extraordinary. However, there are a several things that were not up to par. One, some of the doors inside our room was either broken or in need of adjustment. The self parking was not very convenient. Everything in the hotel was overpriced. Obviously, we don't travel to find perfection in every aspect of our travels. Just being in Maui was good enough for us. I would recommend this resort if you are willing to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing, Amazing”
Reviews.Author: leslieinphoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea June 2-6 for an awards ceremony for my work. This was the second time I have stayed at the Grand Wailea and it is nothing short of amazing. The rooms were large, and comfortable. We had two queen beds and there was a chaise lounge for reading in the room. The bathroom had a bathtub big enough for a family, separate shower, very large bathroom and huge closet. We never heard anyone above us or next to us and our room was very quiet. We ate at the hotel almost the entire time. We were on business and so the meals were served to us in groups but was great. I traveled with my 9 year old son and my husband and they were also very impressed. Being from Phoenix, I am use to hotels with great water parks, but the Grand Wailea is right up there. However, with that being said understand that it is expensive. One morning I got two lattes and a cup of milk for $16. Keep in mind this was an espresso machine and not a person making the latte! The important thing to know about this hotel and Maui in general is that it is expensive. If you understand this going in, then you have no problem spending it. The beach itself is warm, and usually calm. There are no shells on this beach, however you can swim out a ways to snorkel. I highly recommend going to the beach in the morning and spending the afternoon at the pools when the ocean is a little more ruff. If you are a traveler that has a hard time spending money and goes away from the hotel to do tour things, I might suggest looking elsewhere. The Grand Wailea should be a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but terrific”
Reviews.Author: SFPete
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Grand Wailea, and we liked everything about it. Beautiful setting, attractive rooms and lobby, great beach and extremely fun swimming pools and waterslides--perfect for kids. The staff was uniformly helpful, too. Downsides? Well, the cost--the rooms were so expensive we could only stay 3 nights here. And incidentals, from breakfast coffee to the $25 resort fee, add up, too. But it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review from a GWR longtimer”
Reviews.Author: bugsy4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel close to a week each summer for 7 years in a row. The hotel has a beautiful location and grounds with a great pools for the kids. We are resort members as well as Hilton Honors Diamond level. However, it seems over the years as the resort has changed management (now owned by Hilton) it is not holding steady, or getting better but it is going slowly down hill. This trip they put us in the worst room that we have ever stayed in at this hotel. We asked to have our room changed but they would not/could not do it. The room looked dirty- dirty grout around the tile, moldy picture frame in the bathroom, peeling wallpaper and a musty smell to the room. The room overlooked the parking lot and was not a garden view as described when we booked it. The hotel is also buiding residences across the street and this room received all the construction noise. It woke the kids up every morning. Even though the pool is great, it is hard to find a chair at the pool unless you are at the pool when it opens. Although this is a small thing, we do not like the stress of circling the pool waiting for someone to give up their chair so we can sit. This problem will likely get worst when the folks from residences across the street begin to use the property. It also seems that over the last several years the staff at the hotel have become less friendly and less trained. This resort was a great place- it fact the best we have ever been too. But now it seems the resort needs spruce up the rooms and better train the staff especially since this is a very expensive resort and its customer's expectations are high because of the price they are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our suite”
Reviews.Author: JJJTC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I came to Maui to get married. We had enough points for a free regular room for the week, but at the desk they asked us if we wanted to be upgraded and he pointed to the room rates for the $6500 suite. Of course we said yes, I don't know why or how but we took it! The room was fantastic. Huge rooms and a large balcony over looking the chapel and ocean. There is a private key area upstairs. We love the pools too. Great wedding present!

Reviews.Title: “6th Trip to GWR”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: We just completed another stay at the GWR in late may early June and we had a great time. What the Grand Wailea is: Very expensive, cannot be mentioned in the same sentence with Four Seasons, Ritz and JW's in service; mediocre in food and has the audacity to charge handsomely for shade at the pool. Why do we keep coming back? The resort itself is amazing. The pools are the highlight, the beach is one of the best anywhere, the offshore reef is an easy swim to see the sea turtles, and the artwork and gardens make you feel like you've found paradise. We were guests in 1991 when the resort opened and again shortly after the hotel was award 5 Diamonds so we are dissapointed that the hotel has becom indifferent to all the small things that differentiate a good resort from a great one. But let's face it, this place is fun, beautiful and if you are a business person who spends significant time away from the family, the GWR allows you to have fun together as a family and reconnect. To maximize your enjoyment of the resort you need to go in understanding that you won't have the personal service of the 4S, yes a drink will cost $13 at the pool and this is an activity based resort, lot's of kids and adults who are acting like kids. If you want quiet this is not the place for you. My last advice is eat offsite when you can. We had great meals at Joe's at the Wailea tennis club go at sunset and order the pumpkin seed coated Mahi. If you're in the mood for a steak, Ruth Chris is next door. We had a poor experience at Nick's at the Fairmont (dry Mahi and a very stingy poor of Sonoma Cutrer for $15).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MariMouse
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and beautiful property. Excellent pools for adults and children. Very good food at the grill by the Hibiscus pool. Nice spa. Room is just slightly musty and decor is mildly dated, but that is to be expected of a beach property. Highly recommended. Our best accomodations based on four trips to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: HayleyMaiden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this resort for our honeymoon from June 1-6th. We absolutely loved it! The staff there was outstanding. Anything we needed they were there to provide and always with a smile on their faces. The spa was the most amazing spa we've ever been to. Of course the food was expensive, but that is to be expected at such a nice resort. Our favorite meal of the day was the breakfast buffet enjoying the most wonderful view. The grounds were kept absolutely immaculate, which is amazing due to how huge the resort is. We went to Oahu after Maui and it was almost a let down because we had such a fantastic time at the Grand Wailea. This resort is everything anyone could ask for. I would definitely recommend this resort without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Perfect Vacation! Beach and Spa”
Reviews.Author: SandPro
Reviews.Content: If you want complete Luxury this is the place! Beatiful beaches and lots of paths for walking. Pools are great and the grounds are fab. There is an art collection that left me speechless! Lots of sculpture and prints. The food is great. We had room service every day for breakfast. The hash browns were yummy.My fav part was the Spa. I went every day for 5 days in a row and had a diff.service each time. I soaked in the tubs and became totally relaxed by the end of our vacation. By far this is the best resort I have ever visited. Spend the money and stay here. The rooms are complete Hawaii. The service is just top notch. Hope you get to go you will LOVE it! I just can't properly explain the total perfection! In addition.... rent a jeep in the lobby from the car rental company and drive across the island to Mama's Fish House!!! You won't believe it! Great Lunch. Then keep driving for more fun. Take a map.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: This place does live up to it's name... It is GRAND. Very large resort, beautiful grounds, lovely room with plenty of space and huge bathroom! Our room overloked the pool area and we could see the beach as well. Staff was very friendly. This resort food/drink, etc is pretty expensive. The pools (many of them connected wtih slides, lazy river, water elevator, pool bar) are wonderful. There were many families with children but I was not bothered by this (I am not a huge fan of children either). The resort is plenty big enough for everyone and we were always able to find some chairs in a more peaceful location. Beach was very nice as well. Soft sand, blue waters. Beach area is pretty large. Sand is soft with no need for water shoes when walking out into the ocean. Does get a little too windy some afternoons (around 3-4 PM) for the beach. Sand blows around a little. Humu's restaurant was good, again a little pricey though. Overall, would highly recommend this resort. I didn't want to leave. Will definitely return if I ever make it back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for kids!”
Reviews.Author: feather8
Reviews.Content: I just had to write following our trip to the Grand Wailea this week. Before our visit (with a 7 and 3 year old), I scoured this site for recent reviews, which I felt very helpful! Anyway, after reading those reviews, I was prepared for the following: rude staff, rundown rooms, no pool chairs and overpriced food. I found only one to be true--the expensive food. However, every single hotel has high food prices--this would be no different elsewhere! The rooms were super clean, very updated and spacious, and the staff pleasant at each encounter. During our visit, my son hurt his foot, and they were very helpful as far as calling doctors and driving us to the urgent care center vs. taking a cab. The kids just loved spending mornings at the beach (8-ish) before the sand got too hot. Then headed to the kids' pools for the remainder of the day!!! We never once had a problem getting a chair by the pool or beach! We brought breakfast in most days, from the Kula Cafe, and ate on our deck. They keep the entire grounds spotless, which is no small feat considering the size and # of people who stay there. We are already talking about our trip there next June (-: Oh--and no need to rent a car! We did just for a day trip, but were never bored just being at the resort!!! Have no reservations about planning a trip here, you will not be disappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: fletch3742
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location, awesome for kids 16 and under. VERY EXPENSIVE! Luckily we stayed the week for free on Hilton but our bill was still $2000.00 for the four of us. Kids had a blast at the pool. Didn't get to see much of Hawaii because all they wanted to do was hang out at the pool with their new found friends. Rather expensive trip to not get them out sight seeing or snorkling. The Luau next door at the Marriott is excellent! can book at the Wailea and walk over. --- Fyi, it's also expensive but worth it. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmite
Reviews.Content: Maui- The Grand Wailea Resort & Spa- Wonderful Trip!! June 4, 2007 C. Richardson- Baltimore, Maryland My husband, daughter, son in law and myself stayed at the Grand Wailea from May 20-27 and I might add we had a wonderful time. After reading some of the other posts I was a little concerned about what I might find. I found the place to be very nice, yes it was a bit expensive but I had also prepared myself for that. This was my families first trip to Hawaii, I lived on Oahu when I was a child for about 2 1/2 years, needless to say it was quite different from what I recall. The Spa was the best ever and oddly enough I did not find the prices for this to be too far over the top comparing it to a cruise ship, we cruise quite often and all of the spas are owned by Steiners of London and the large difference I found was that there was no hard sell! Those of you who cruise no what I mean, no one was shoving over the top priced products in my face at the end, It was wonderful, my daughter & I were treated like royalty. I found the staff to be very friendly, our rooms were cleaned twice a day, all amenities replaced daily and they were very nice, the same as used in the spa. On the first night we had room service, my husband had a bowl of french onion soup, fries & a burger, we each had a coke and I had a turkey club with bacon and some fruit the total $63.00, including service fee and tip & tax. Now that was exspensive but..the portions as my daughter pointed out for everything we ate at the hotel was a very large serving, you make your own decision. The pools as you have heard were all great, a little crowded but we had no trouble getting a lounge chair. The learn to dive program is free which my husband got my son in law to do since he dives and he had a great time, the $99 fee to dive after the class was not too bad.We ate breakfast at the Buffet 3 times $27 per person, but I liked it very much I thought the view from the Lanai was lovely looking out onto the ocean, they could probably use some new furniture and if you don't keep your food close by you the birds will take it if you are seated outside! On the last day we went to the Sunday Brunch, this was the highlight of the day , very ,very lovely. More than enough food, prime rib to mahi mahi to spicey shrimp. I work in the industry and the presentation of this jazz brunch was very nice, I tried a new twist to a moomosa, guava & champagne, very nice! This set me back about $50 per person. All in all we enjoyed our stay on Maui and at the Grand Wailea , we will return next year. If you read enough reviews as I did there is a lot of good information out there I combed this site daily before we left, it was a great source. Try the Grand Wailea, yes she could use some updates but she is not outdated, I did not find (1) staff member who did not try to please, they were all very good and very friendly. Also I would like to add if you go to Maui you must see Ulalena, this show is exquisite!! A must see! Sometimes I wonder what some of us are looking for when we travel and go on vacation, do we leave human kindness at home because we have paid hard earned money to have a nice time, some of us nick pick at the littliest of things, don't get me wrong if there is a problem I would like to have it fixed as much as the next person but I will not forget that I am speaking to a human being, they are there to serve you they are not your servants, just a thought. Thank you trip Advisor readers & writers for all of your imput, it helped to make our trip WONDERFUL, and I went to Maui well informed. Please email me if you would like more information. debbyrich@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Fun but expensive”
Reviews.Author: sued2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from May 26th through June 1st for a total of 6 nights with hubby, 19 yr old brother and 13 yr old son. Shared a room with two queen beds that overlooked the parking lot! Nice view, huh? The hotel was completely sold out due to three large corporate events being held. I was hoping to get upgraded as part of the Hilton Honors program, but no such luck but that didn't bother me too much. This was my 2nd visit as I stayed at the hotel in 2002 with my spouse during the slow month of September so going in May was a different experience (much busier now). I remember the hotel being absolutely wonderful, a little pricey but worth it. After this recent visit, I wouldn't stay there again. It is just too expensive. Maybe it was because we had two extra people but I just couldn't stomach paying 20 for a deluxe hotdog and drink for my son. A hamburger ran 16 before tax and tip. The food costs were just too much! In our earlier visit we reserved a cabana for 150 for the day and it included snacks and food. The cabanas were now 250 per day! Yikes! If you wanted a chair with an unbrella attached, that was 45 per day. None of the water activities such as boogie boarding or snorkeling was free, there was a charge for everything that most hotels at this level include. A Hobie Cat was 55 per hour and boogie boards were 8 per hour. At the Wailea shops, you can rent a boogie board for 15 that covers a week's rental. My son had a blast with his and I liked the price! I agree the hotel is gorgeous and incredible as are the pools, but the sheer nickel and diming of everything little thing took the joy out of being there. I wouldn't go back there again, not at the prices they charge. I think my disappointment lies in the fact that last year my spouse and I went to St Thomas and Virgin Gorda and stayed at hotels where a lot of the water and beach activies were included in the price of the room and I was not prepared for the extra costs at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Friendly Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: rmg421
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 6 wonderful days at the grand wailea!!! We were there with my parents and our 3 children under the age of 3!! We had a room on the ground floor so the kids could run around the grassy area and it worked out very well!! The pools and beach are fabulous!! My hubby and I enjoyed going down the 2 big slides, and our whole family loved going from pool to pool via slides!! Our favorite was the rapids and our 2 1/2 year old twins could not get enough of it!! We also rented a cabana for the week next to the baby beach and it worked out great!! Our kids were at the perfect age for that pool!! Even though the cabans were expensive, they are worth it!! We had a big one that seated 8 so it fit us all!! It looked like others had to get down there early just to find a shady seat! Every morning our cabana was already set up with towels and water, and throughout the day, we got fresh fruit, cold towels and even popscicles!! For our 9 month old, they brought down a pack and play which worked out great!! If you want close to the baby beach, cabana 6 is the best one!! The spa was amazing!! They have therme baths, roman baths, japanease baths, etc!! It was the best experience I have ever had!! I got a tropical flower wrap and a 80min hot lava stone massage and both were do die for!! Highly recommend the spa!! As for the food, it was just ok. I had expected more out of there breakfast buffet, and our service and Humu's was not good!!! If you really want a special romantic meal, go next door to Spagos at the 4 seasons! That was the best meal!! Overall, it was a fantasic resort and we are planning on going back in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelHonolulu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for the weekend. Other than the pool - which was a ton of fun - the only word to describe this hotel is MOLD. The room smelled of mold. The shower door and tile grout was covered in mold. Even the pictures on the walls had mold inside the glass. We asked to be moved after the first night. Although the staff was polite, it took until after noon to move us and the new room was moldy too. It was slightly less moldy than the first. We enjoyed the pool but if we ever stay there again, I plan to bring some Lysol and Clorox cleaning products. I expect cleanliness at a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good for your kids”
Reviews.Author: HappytravelerAlabama
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the GW for 5 nights. We arrived on mothers day weekend and found the resort to be very busy and somewhat dirty. After the weekend, the property was cleaned up and our initial impression was changed. It is a beautiful and huge property. Be prepared to walk a good distance to the beach, pool, restaurants, etc. The pool was awesome for our kids. They couldn't wait to get back so they could swim. Be aware that the slides and water park part closes at 5 p.m. so if you take a day trip and then plan to come back to swim, it closes early. We found our selves rushing to return each day. There are lots of activities available, just be prepared to fork out some money. The accommodations (rooms)definately need some updating. The bathroom was spacious but our shower had black mold spots. The carpet was stained and the room generally worn. We checked 3 other rooms before keeping our original one. They are all about the same condition. We had a deluxe ocean view room and the view was pretty. I don't think it's worth the price. The beds are very comfortable with cozy linens. The cleaning staff did an excellent job-clean each morning and refreshed the room at night. It's worth it to book a room in the Napua Tower section simply because it includes a continental breakfast and cocktails/snacks in the afternoon. We ate at the cafe frequently which was the spot for the kids to get their own food. The Grand dining room had the best pancakes we've ever had so don't miss those. We also ate at the Bistro which was mediocre. The food is expensive no matter where you eat. There is a Safeway in Kihea so stop and get water and snacks to save yourself a bundle. All in all, it's a great place to take your family. Everything is extra so plan to spend for everything. We didn't find complementary coffee, papers etc. that are offered daily at the Four Seasons. We toured the 4S and found it to be a definate notch above the GW but it depends on what you're looking for. The kids would prefer the pool at the GW and we would prefer the spendor of the 4S. Places to eat: Best meal-Mama's Fish house in Paia. Stella's in Kihea. SanSee's for sushi in Kihea. Tommy Bahama Cafe in Wailea. Best Day Trip: snokeling on the Trilogy. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: JJPCheers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea with our 10 yr old son May 5-10. We all loved it. The grounds are very well maintained and the pool is great fun. The only somewhat negative factor is that the hotel is located somewhat far from the main cities/areas of Maui. There are no waves on Wailea beach so we had to go to Lahaina for surfing and that was about 45 minutes away. We stayed in the Napua tower and enjoyed the morning breakfast and afternoon appetizers and cocktails. I also went to the spa and it was amazing. I have been to many spas but none quite as pampering as the Grand. My husband said he enjoyed the gym and that is was large for a hotel gym. We did not have any problems getting chairs on the beach or by the pool as others have mentioned. I guess we went not on a peak time for Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGalTx
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Our room was spacious and beautiful! It was an 8th floor "partial ocean view" but we had a GREAT view of the ocean and Lanai. The beds were very comfortable and the room had recently been renovated. The bathroom was very spacious, but was a bit dated ... The remainder of the resort was in various stages of renovation, but overall gorgeous! The downside, the food at the hotel. Because it wasn't in high season, two of the five restaurants were closed for the season, leaving only 3 choices for dining (not including the grill at the pool). The food was OK... nothing exciting, and nothing to validate the astronomical prices, especially at the Humu Humu Restaurant. Extremely expensive and very bland.

Reviews.Title: “4th Time, still great”
Reviews.Author: PatrickRU92
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4th trip to Maui, stayed at the Grand Wailea which has always been our favorite resort in the Islands. I think this is now the 3rd review I've written on this resort. I still have to laugh at some of the previous complaints on this resort. Well at least some people can stop harping on one thing......they repaired the tiles on the Hibiscus pool....not one out of place! Anyway on to the positives 1)The resort still looks tremendous. The grounds are the BEST in all of Hawaii, bar none. Beautiful and they keep the maintenence up as well, constantly wiping the brass rails, constantly pruning trees and bushes. I honestly have not seen any drop off since I first stayed there 8 years ago 2)We had a great room with a tremendous view. 3)Our bed was insanely comfortable. 4)Service was ALWAYS with a smile, be it from the bell men, to the valets, to the maids, to the landscapers. 5) Although I'm in my 30s, I can't get enough of the waterslides. Too much fun! 6) yes lots of kids at this resort but less so then at some other resorts I've been to in the Islands, and if you stay around the hibiscus pool, the screaming kids might as well have been on Mars because you don't see or hear them. 7)It's still insanely expensive. But this is Wailea. Any of the big resorts in this area are roughly the same price. You ARE going to spend a lot here. If you are budget-constrained for vacation, you probably should look elsewhere. We splurge once a year on vacation and we don't really care about the cost (within reason, of course!) 8)compared to it's 2 main competitors on the same stretch (Four Seasons and Fairmont) I would pick GW every time. The Four Seasons does trump GW in service (water spritzing, etc) but the grounds of the FS aren't even in the same league--not even close. Fairmont is also beautiful but again, aesthetically not on par with GW. In addition the adult area of GW is MUCH bigger, which at least to us was important. 9)The restaurants at GW are a notch below the FS's (and Fairmont's), but that was easily remedied by taking the short 5 minute beautiful walk on the beach to visit the other resorts. All 3 of these large Wailea resorts are unbelievable and pricey. You will not go wrong by choosing any of them. But pound for pound (and no, I'm not from the UK) GW is the best. We will return again!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, relaxing resort! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Grand Wailea for my birthday. It is a fantastic hotel. My room overlooked the wedding chapel and had an ocean view. I arrived to find I had been sent the fruit, cheese and wine gift from room service. It is fantastic and you will end up snacking on it for a couple of days. The rooms are huge. The bathrooms have both a large soaking tub and a stand alone shower. A bubble bath in their mango bathing gel is fantastic! All of the amenities are top notch. They smell incredible and the bottles are very generous. The terrace is roomy enough to invite a couple of friends over for pre-dinner cocktails. The beds, linens and towels are all fantastic and cozy. The sofa was equally as comfy and a great place for an afternoon nap. The internet was not wireless, but the connection was fast. The spa is not to be missed. Don't forget that any spa treatment also comes with standard "spa extras". Some of the extras include wonderful aromatherapy soaking tubs that are really relaxing. They also have different kinds of jacuzzi baths. They also give you a body scrub treatment complimentary. You want to arrive with plenty of time to try all of "free extras". After you finish all of your baths, etc. they invite you up a beautiful staircase. At the top of the staircase they spritz you with some delicious aromatherapy spray. It is a lovely touch and gives you an idea of the attention to detail you will find in the spa. They have a lovely terrace, overlooking the water where you wait for your treatments. This area is co-ed and a great place to meet up with someone before or after appointments. If you can score a treatment room on the oceanside...you won't be disappointed. I recommend the basic massage and facial. The pool area is lovely and can also get very crowded. The signature pool with the slides, etc. is obviously a magnet for families with children. If you are looking for a quiet place to sunbathe...you will probably opt for the grass area or the beach. There are plenty of lounge chairs and towels. I'm not really a fan of having to wear a bracelet to get a towel, but there is no choice. Plus, the kids seem to enjoy collecting their wristbands in different colors each day they are at the hotel. The slides and the lazy river are fun. You won't want to miss a trip to the pool bar in the cavern. It is worth a swim over there for a "Chi-Chi"---a "Chi Chi is a vodka version of a Pina Colada...and my new favorite drink. :) Room service was quick and the prices are as high as you would expect. It is worth the expense to have the pancakes with coconut syrup. The Spago at the Four Seasons is a lovely restaurant. You will want to be sure to get a table outside. For a reasonably priced meal that is DELICIOUS...try Joe's Bar and Grill. It is a friendly place with terrific food and it is about 4 minutes from the hotel. It is a good place for two people to sit at the bar. There are a million things you could say about this resort. It is beautiful. It has everything you could ever need. The service is fantastic. The location is fantastic. It is worth the flight and the expense. I love the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Resort and Spa - Paradise Found!!!”
Reviews.Author: rongerimini
Reviews.Content: Aloha, My wife and I (we are in our early forties) recently returned from a ten day stay in Maui at the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa. Where to start? We had never been to Hawaii before but found an opening in our calendars and decided to take a trip (at our Travel Agent's Advise) to the Grand Wailea - Maui. We were not disappointed. The Grand Wailea is indeed GRAND. Before diving headlong into my review, I would like to comment that what I remember most about the Grand Wailea are two things: 1. How genuinely friendly all the people who work there are and 2. How professional the service is. I have read dozens of Trip Advisor Reviews and have learned that good and bad experiences hinge on two key components; 1. Service -and- 2. Hospitality. The Staff at the Grand Wailea get extremely high marks from me in both categories. First, a sampling of the level of service the Grand Wailea provides from end to end; -THE VALET AND BELL STAFF are friendly and don't monkey around. I don't think we waited more than a minute when we drove up to the grounds before we were greeted by the Valet person. They are as efficient as they are pleasant, and they are over-staffed. What a pleasant surprise. EXCELLENT. -The FRONT DESK staff are all professionals. There are no waiting lines. This is a customer-focused shop. They are all tastefully dressed and very composed. These folks set a fabulous tone on behalf of their property. EXCELLENT. -CONCIERGE SERVICES. Like their aforementioned colleagues, the Concierge Staff are outstanding. First, The Grand Wailea does not offer the all-too-familiar and painfully understaffed Concierge "Desk" that is hidden somewhere on the premises and is too often staffed by a polite but uniformed young person who seems completely out of place and can offer no help. The Concierge DEPARTMENT at the Grand Wailea is a team of professionals who are well schooled at their craft and endlessly helpful and courteous. They are prepared to handle a wide range of requests and all seem quite comfortable in their roles. As an example, I plopped down at one of their stations on one day and explained to the Concierge that I would like to do some Sport Fishing. The sage gentleman behind the desk interviewed me to learn in detail what would make for a memorable fishing excursion for me (it was my birthday present from my wife) and in no time had me hooked in (get it?) with a Captain and Vessel that best suited both my needs and my personality. That's what I'm talking about. Yes, I got seasick as did my poor non-fishing wife but I did manage to land a very solid Mahi Mahi and we got to get up close and personal with a tandem of Mother and Calf Humpback Whales. For a knucklehead from the mainland, that was AWESOME! EXCELLENT THE ROOM was located in the NAPUA SUITES a gated (private) tower adjacent to the main hotel. Something about a gate and FREE Breakfast and Happy Hour always makes me feel like I have gotten my evens with the hotel. The guilt I felt as I loaded up my Happy Hour plate with Rumaki's and Mini Quiches really felt decadent! Just kidding. It was great to have free breakfast every morning with piping hot Starbucks Coffee, Fresh Fruit and omelets. The evening fare (Happy Hour) was not quite as scintillating but (naturally) it is hard to beat FREE. VERY GOOD The room in the Napua Suites was very, very nice. It seems like one of the key barometers for measuring the quality of the room is whether the carpets are worn and/or soiled. I am happy to say that our carpet was new and smelled great! The balcony is spacious and the furniture is top of the line. No Wal Mart stuff in this place. I won't even talk about the view. Suffice to say that it is like being in a postcard. The view of the property and the ocean is absolutely breathtaking. I mean, gorgeous. Beware of poaching birds when you have your breakfast on the balcony. Their kamakazee skills are well honed and their sense of entitlement to your left overs is not open for debate. Bring your food tray/s in your room when you are finished or you will have bird dew all over your outdoor furniture. EXCELLENT The bed (while elegant) was the only disappointment. I don't know if two eight hundred pound people slept in it before us but the mattress was pretty bogus. It was really riding low in our two sleeping "valleys" and was very high in the middle. The Grand Wailea fails in this department. If you have a fickle lower back and/or you like a firm mattress - you'd better bring lots of Advil. Even the addition of two pieces of plywood under our mattress did not improve the condition of the mattress. NOT EXCELLENT The room is spacious and the appointments (art, furniture, lighting...) are all extremely tasteful and soothing. More importantly, the couch and matching chair are genuinely comfortable, another sure sign of a top notch hotel. The room was also outfitted with a 32" Flat Panel HDTV which made me feel right at home. High Speed Internet Access is FREE and their data pipe is BIG. I was surfing the internet at 2 and 3 mb with no interruption of service. I might also add that my Sprint wireless data card (for my laptop) worked wonderfully (and wirelessly) from my perch on the balcony. BIG BONUS for you business types (like me) who need connectivity. EXCELLENT The Bathroom (I am being serious) is the highlight of the suite. It is gigantic and is absolutely heavenly. It boasts a luxurious oversized tub with jacuzzi jets and a separate shower with one of those shower heads that make you feel like you are standing in the rain. The water pressure (another sign of a great property) is outstanding. When you put the shower head on the massage setting you will really relax. This feature surely saved me a grand in massage services at the Spa and enabled me to overlook the lameness of the spent mattress. The oversized vanity area with double bowl sinks and tons of mirrors is a woman's dream. One warning: Watch out for opening and actually using any of the native toiletries in the baskets. They aren't free. I opened a bottle of hydrating botanical rose hip moisturizer and learned (too late) that it was FOR SALE. EXCELLENT Room Service does a very efficient job, which is rare for such a large resort. While I can't recommend any of their specialties, I will say that their $100 Bacon Cheeseburger with French Fries is delicious. Just kidding. It was probably $15 US. The key to Room Service is speed and The Grand Wailea (thanks again to solid management and sound quality control) delivers, literally. The food was always on time and the wait staff was courteous, professional and HONEST! No double tipping in this joint!
