Concierge - very helpful, selected nice places, was not there to sell you time shares (Westin big on this) *Housekeeping - came twice a day, (12pm and 7pm) - helped us keep the room nice and neat *Rooms - deluxe garden - was located right by the pool, nice view, clean, fresh * Beach - this is the best hotel beach on Maui - sand is soft to the touch, water is clear as glass, snorkel by the point is awesome for young kids, waves always tame, nice running path -needs improvement- * Rooms are a bit out of date -- bathroom could use a double vanity, new tiles/grout, paint job etc....also could stand to have a bit more space - another 100 sq ft in the sitting area would make for a nice gathering spot * Pool chairs/decking - the family/activity pool deck is quite small for the size of the hotel. 50% of the chairs are pre-reserved for cabanas (had one for one day - not worth the money - service is not on par with traditional FS/ritz cabanas) Rumours were circulating that the hotel is planning to take out the chapel and add more pool space. Would be much appreciated. It is also true that by 7:15am most of the pool side chairs are taken up. * Pool service - there are not enough service attendants for the amount of guests, with 700 rooms - you need at least 6 folks working the pools. Each day I didn't notice more than 2. Contrast that to Bellagio in Vegas where you look up and see 10 service folks at any given minute. * Beach service - once you are set up - don't expect anyone to come by and take a drink/food order * Health club - nice size, but many of the machines are broke/old/worn out - they also only have a few of the more modern machines with TV's built in. * Another adult lounge would be nice - the only evening lounge is the lobby bar which is a bit serene -good restaurants- *Ferraros - FS > very nice setting, decent Italian - pricey * Pacific Grill - FS > great setting, great service *Longhis - Shops - typical Italian, decent food, close to the hotel * Cheeseburger - Shops - nice casual change of pace - burgers are just ok - not my favorite fries - * Roy's in Kehei - always a good meal with great kids service (price fixed kids meal that keeps the pace up) *HumuHumu - just OK - same menu as Spago, Pacific Grill, Nicks etc... (hawaiian fish is the staple) - preperations and seasonings were bland and the service was slow. Good for kids since it's outside and they can self entertain with the fish in the ponds. I echo the comments of others - go to safeway/ABC etc.. and get yourself some snacks for the pool/room. On a weeks trip you can save yourself at least $500 bucks vs the pool service costs. -Overall- The good far outweighs the bad. The location is just awesome. Best beach! The pools are a blast. The service is 3 stars and can easily be improved with some focus. It was tough to leave, and I plan to return year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: funkdoctor8
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely awesome. Expensive, but I believe that "Maui, Hawaii" means "expensive as he$%" in hawaiian. Seriously though, the hotel was immaculate, all staff was extremely attentive, and the grounds were impeccable. The thing that struck me most was that it didn't seem that a blade of grass was out of place, every brass banister was polished on the stairs, all floors were polished. My only gripe was the ice maker on the floor was on the fritz. If that is my only complaint, obviously I would highly recommend the establishment to others. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype: this hotel is worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: 1TheIceman1
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is truly a remarkable hotel. The service, rooms, staff, grounds, pool, restaurants and bars are all top notch. I would recommend that anyone stay here. Even adults can be kids again at the pool. Don't worry ...everyone goes down the waterslides, you're on vacation so you can leave those feelings at home and have a cool drink at the grotto bar after you take the lazy river. The one complaint I have is the astronomical price of the restaurants. Breakfast will run you $30pp (the Grand Dining Room has the best view in Maui, hands down, so please have brunch here), dinner $60pp excluding alcohol and tips. A bottle of sun screen runs you $23 and a 20oz bottle of water is $7. There are watercoolers all around the property so you only need those water bottles for the room. Hint: take the path behind the waterfall to the Shops at Wailea. Here you can find an ABC and The Whaler's General Store. Oh, and hold on to that rental car so you can drive to Kihei for dinner, otherwise you are limited to the restaurants Kincha (Japanese) or Humu (fish). Kincha is unbelievable, get the bento box! You pay high end resort prices at this world class resort. If you stay here it is not to save money, so see for yourself and don't miss this experience. Enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Past its' prime”
Reviews.Author: LuxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 20 or so times in the past 15 years since its opening. For the adult luxury traveler looking for service and sophistication this property is not for you. The service is poor, the housekeeping is poor and the property is CROWEDED and overrun with kids!!! Now, if your a family and that's your thing, you'll enjoy the property. The pools are fantastic and that is the appeal for families. My problem is that there was a time in the early 90's that this property catered a high-end guest and that kept the occupancies and crowds to a minimum. Then the infamous KSL hotel holding group bought it for a song in the late 90's and with a "heads in beds" attitude sucked the life out of this beautiful place. KSL destroyed the flavor of the grand. Anyways, Hilton bought it earlier this year and might improve things but as of late Sept nothing has changed yet. Go stay at the Fairmont Kei Lanai or the Four Season next door...you'll thank me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful one day stay”
Reviews.Author: califcari
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night at the Grand Wailea because our private cottage was already booked that night. We checked in smoothly. The service was great. They automatically upgraded us to the gated Napua Tower, ocean view room with Lanai (we didn't even have to ask). Included free cocktail hour and appetizers for Napua Tower guests, as well as delicious continental breakfast in the morning. By the way, I read a review that said internet access was an additional charge. It was free in our room. Super comfy bed. Large room. Great bathroom with large tub. Check out was smooth also. Easy access to the beautiful beach. If you stay here, try walking along the paved trail at around 6:30pm (follow the sound of the live music) and you can see a hula/firedance show put on by an adjoining hotel. They didn't seem to mind us plunking down on the grass next to the beach and enjoying the show. Loved the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea managed, but not owned by Hilton”
Reviews.Author: hyperchickmom
Reviews.Content: Ok, here's the scoop...You know from the time you book it..it is EXPENSIVE! So why complain about the prices..buyer's remorse?? Even a great deal..is still a fortune..unless you are Trump or Jennifer Lopez! Staying here is like going to California and staying at the Beverly Hills Hotel....The Hotel is amazing! They bring the beauty of Maui to you! Everywhere you look is a kodak moment waiting to happen.... However, no hotel is perfect. Problem with this hotel is that your expectations are so high, you can only be disappointed.... We arrived early, and they held our luggage until room was ready so we were able to enjoy the pool...ABSOLUTELY FUN! I had a spa appointment (booked weeks earlier) and it was very nice! We booked a Napua Tower Oceanview Room MONTHS ahead of time ($573 per night). The breakfast was very good. Don't like starbucks coffee, though..Wish they had Maui Kona Coffee instead...but the room includes coffee and we kept our packets to bring home with us. The COCKTAIL HOUR was the best! Top shelf! Food was good too! You can bring your food out with you and enjoy the sunset from the beach or your room! Here is my only complaint.... At time of reservation, we advised them we were celebrating our 14th yr anniversary and were told: "We will make it as special for you...Possibly upgrade you to a suite"....well, we could not wait to see what this GRAND hotel would do for us on our anniversary....Upon check-in, the clerk stated we are recvg a suite, but then she said no, it is only connected to a suite,...hmm, big difference! It occured to us that the Grand did nothing special, we got the room we paid for. So I spoke to hotel front desk the next day, she asked "Who promised you somehting special? Reservations?" as if that explained it... She stated there was no notation that it was our anniversary and why are we complaining..we got this room for almost half what others pay.... She handed us a coupon, and said this is what we give all our honeymooners and anniversary couples. A free bottle of champagne when you dine in one of their restaurants...Thank you Grand, but we do not drink champagne... but we did have dinner at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a....it was delicious...but expensive! All in all, I would say try it if you have kids, like the feeling of ritziness! But I would also recommend staying at a more simpler place so you venture out of your hotel and visit the truly remarkable jewel, Maui itself! Going to the grand is an experience in itself and almost takes away from Maui.... because you may not want to leave once you arrive....

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it in the Napua Towers”
Reviews.Author: siliconwafer
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed given the cost ($998/nite). Started off with no one available to help unload our car then gave us bad info about parking. The exclusive gate to the Napua Towers did not lock so many people were walking through. Evening buffet was crowded with people/kids from everywhere dripping wet with beach tubes still around their waists knocking over trays/dishes. They did not enforce the no beach attire rule. The buffet itself has been downsized. No coffee or tea available. Morning buffet full of half awake bedhead kids in pajamas. Electrical outlet did not work in our cave like room which made it even darker. Room service could not supply the good smelling lotion we used to love even though we saw it on their carts. Pool was so crowded on the weekend that we could not find available lounge chairs. Women's restrooms at the pool did not work the entire day of Mon. Oct. 23rd. We could not use the pool for fear of where everone was really going.... Beautiful grounds to walk through and art work to look at but not worth it to pay the price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the family”
Reviews.Author: wes1856
Reviews.Content: We took a trip here with the whole family over fall break and couldn't have had a better time. The rooms were spacious and although there were a few small mechanical issues, these were resolved quickly. We stayed in the Napua Tower rooms and felt that they were worth it for the concierege service and the free morning and evening snacks -- often these were enough to tide the kids over so we didn't have to spend a fortune on meals. The pools are perfect for the kids and fun for the adults as well. I did notice that a number of non-guests were at the pools which was disconcerting, but the staff did actively check wrist bands if you tried to use any of the slides. I would not recommend this hotel to couples during a busy family travel time such as spring break, holidays or the summer. It would be overrun with kids and not exactly the most romantic, secluded vacation. For this kind of money go to the Four Seasons instead. That said, the hotel is big enough that you don't notice the crowds. Overall, we had a fabulous time and would highly recommend. Well worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fun, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TripAGoGo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled all over the US but this was by far the best place we have stayed! From our bed we could see the ocean view layed out like a picture postcard! The breakfast buffet was fabulous! The Grand Wailea is close to attractions and restaurants as well. The staff was the best. They greeted us with lei's (as most places do), remembered us by following up on our outtings, were very helpful and friendly. They reccommended restaurants that weren't just the touristy places but "real local" places to eat. The pool was great, tastfully done. We liked that there was an adult pool area separate from the family area, and that there were also pool activities. We also were able to go to a Luau at the Grand Wailea which had a great show and delicious food. The Grand Wailea is next door to the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea's beach was by far better! We will definately stay here again and again! I was concerned by other reviews but we will come here again! We left with great memories of a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!! *****”
Reviews.Author: 34theroad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful.... you will love the many pools and a one of a kind water elevator. When we arrived our 1st words were "it is GRAND" Pros: Stunning landscape, gorgeous views, luxurious bathrooms, oppolulant bedding, kind staff, best pools ever, nachos at the swim up bar, kalua pork pot stickers at Humu Humu, real Picasso's and Boteros. Cons: Choppy water, pool tile needs work, food more expensive than most, room service was boring (no hot fudge even)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - with a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five days after the close of the summer season. Things change dramatically at this resort once kids go back to school, since it has attractions that very much appeal to families. We found the atmosphere to be wonderful, and the facilities were very nice as well. The best things about it: 1. the pools. There are many different pools, and there are water slides connecting them together. It has very much of a water park theme to it. 2. the ocean. we found the beach to be very nice to walk and swim at, and it's only steps away. By contrast we stayed at the Hyatt at Kanaapali last year and essentially nobody goes in the ocean there because the beach is inhospitable. The worst things about it: 1. the water slides close at 5pm. This is probably so parents can get their kids out of the pools and ready for dinner, but I found it to be irritating since we typically went out in the morning and then tried to enjoy the pools in the afternoon or evening. 2. on our last day there they had a massive plumbing failure in the pools, requiring them to close essentially all of the pools for at least 24 hours. Apparently there was a pipe that burst, releasing a massive amount of dark brown water into one of the pools. Because they are all interconnected by water slides, this immediately caused all of the pools to be closed. I don't think it was a sewage pipe because it didn't smell, but it was clearly unswimmable for at least 24 hours. They didn't offer us any compensation to make up for the loss of swimming facilities. 3. the more expensive restaurant (Humuhumunukunukuapua'a) definitely wasn't worth the premium, either in view or food. My wife and I have very refined tastes in food, but frankly this place wasn't up to snuff. The other restaurant (Bistro Molokini or Bistro Molokai, depending on which sign you read) was much less pretentious with food that was just as good. We ended up walking next door to the four seasons for two of our dinners, since they had Wolfgang Puck's and another nice restaurant. The room we stayed in was on the 8th floor with a slight view of the ocean, but also facing a construction site across the street where they appear to be building either a hotel or a condo complex. The noise was tolerable from this, and the view of the ocean - while distant and slight, was still pleasant. I've never seen much point in paying for an ocean view room, since the whole point of going to these places is to be in or next to the ocean so I don't stay in the room that much. The bathroom was very nicely appointed, with marble and wide expanses of space everywhere. The closet was pretty tiny and inconvenient. We found the service to be quite good uniformly throughout the resort. This included the wait staff, the pool staff, the valet parking, the hotel operator, and the front desk. We never saw any evidence of sullenness or boredom (as we did everywhere in French Polynesia). The bottom line for a vacation is whether you would consider returning. If I compare this place to the Hilton Waikaloa on the big Island, or the Hyatt on either Maui or the Kauai, I like this place much better. All of these places have huge variance on what they charge for a room, and we found a package on Expedia that gave us the equivalent of about $400 per night. I considered this to be reasonable, though I'm not so sure I would go over this for such a big hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Rating”
Reviews.Author: urhnestyisapreciated
Reviews.Content: Grand Wailea - 10/03/06-10/10/06 We just got back from our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea in Maui. All I can really say about the hotel is it was average. Staff: Very friendly Grounds: very nice, but a bit too big for a honeymoon couple wanting a little romance. I could see how it would be good for a family with kids. The grounds are very pretty, but we did see a dead koi fish in one of the ponds and a large roach walking around. Restaurants: The Humuhumu... restaurant was expensive, but was not very good. The Kincha Japanese buffet (fri. & mon. - $50 ) was very good. The mini-burgers that can be ordered from the Botero bar were delicious, but kinda pricey at $20. Room service was served quickly, but the food was just average. Housekeeping: The rooms were kept very clean. When we returned from our daily excursions, the rooms were always cleaned and new amenities were provided. We did however find one roach in our room and we were occasionally visited by a few ants. Recommendations if staying at the Grand Wailea: Go to the ABC store located next door at the Shops at Wailea, to puchase essentials (water, soda, snacks, etc.), it'll save you A LOT of money. If you like sea food, you must try Mama's Fish House, located in Paia (about 30 min. drive from hotel). Confirm that there is no construction/renovation being done to the rooms surrounding your room. If you have questions regarding The Grand Wailea and you want non-biased answers, feel free to email me at qrious_2@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: blharris77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea from September 11th through September 18th. As soon as we pulled up to the main entrance all worries melted away. Having read the reviews from previous guests I was a little apprehensive at first. I hadn't even removed my seat belt before the valet attendant said, "Welcome to the Grand Wailea Mr. and Mrs. Harris". Slightly surprised that he knew my name, it took me a second to figure out how he knew who we were. We were in a convertible and he read the nametag off the luggage in the back seat. They also offered us free valet parking for a few hours while we got checked in and we received our Hawaiian leighs. Check-in was a breeze. Absolutely no one in line (we arrived on a Monday evening). Our bellman was waiting at the elevator with or bags to show us to our room (8080). It was in the Haleakal wing on the 8th floor about half way between the lobby and the self-parking garage. It was a deluxe ocean view room and was absolutely wonderful. The view was amazing, as you will see from our pictures. The bellman told us about the resort, took our picture on the Lanai for us and was very helpful and courteous. We had a refrigerator brought to the room ($25 for the whole stay, not too bad). The adult pool was very relaxing, we preferred setting up on the grass lawn below the pool facing the ocean. It was much cooler in the grass then on the concrete by the pool. Service was a little slow and I could see how it would be a real problem if it were crowded but once you ordered a few drinks (At $10 a pop plus tip!) they were generally more attentive. The majority of the pool staff were adolescents who had the "I don't care attitude" but we were on our honeymoon and didn't care at all. The activity pool was really fun. It had lots of water slides, a water elevator (worth doing once but not that great), and a lazy river. Luckily for us we timed our stay perfectly and there weren't many kids (which I read had been a problem in other reviews). There were some people who would save chairs by the pool (even though the signs said not too) but since we wanted the grass lawn anyway it didn't bother us. The room was large and well appointed. The shower was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable. It wasn't overly impressive but still quite nice. They are beginning renovations very soon if not already so that won't be an issue soon. The room was always cleaned in a timely manner and the bed was always turned down every night. The grounds were beautiful, waterfalls, choi ponds, and lush gardens and expensive art everywhere. There were a few rails along sidewalks that were in disrepair but you'd have to be a nut to let something that small bother you. It was truly a Grand resort. It was quite large and could take some time to get to the beach from the room, as well as a few elevator rides. The only negative we had was the one time we attempted to eat at the hotel. We were goin to try the breakfast buffet the Sunday morning before we left. Supposedly it was open until 9:30 and we got there at about 8:45 AM and everything was already being removed. The server didn't inform us of this so we were walking around trying to find something to eat with little luck. All we ended up having was a cup of coffee which they didn't charge us for since the breakfast buffet was removed so early. If you plan to try it make sure you go early. We never attempted to eat at any of the other restaurants because of the bad reviews they got in the book "Maui Revealed" (Highly recommend this book!). We did have breakfast at the Country club in Wailea (Sorry can't remember the name) and it was wonderful. Had a beautiful view and the staff was impeccable! I recommend the mimosas. Overall we were very pleased with this resort although I wouldn't recommend going when it's crowded. Early September was perfect. All of the U.S. kids were back in school and the Asian tourists hadn't started arriving in mass yet.

Reviews.Title: “5 star outside, 3 star inside”
Reviews.Author: Xioujet
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the Grand Wailea we immediately were impressed with the waterfalls on the drive way. Everything was beautiful. But then we get our room. Its an 8 minute walk from the lobby to the room. The room was run down, chippped paint on the moldings, mold in the shower, carpet was dirty and smelled a bit...it just seemed like any other hotel room. We were in the terrance rooms which face the mountain and if you stood out on the balcony, you could see a good part of the ocean. But damn! This place nickle and dimes! $2.60 for a banana! If I had to do it all over, I would choose a hotel known for nice ROOMS. This place definitely lacked 5 star room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: mygirlscats
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea has become my family's gold standard against which all other vacations are compared. The property is very large, with gardens which range from manicured to charmingly wild. You can pick fruit from the banana or papaya trees, if you wish. We took a tour of the grounds with one of the gardeners, and he pointed out (among others) cocao trees! There are large koi ponds connected by flowing streams. The property's premier restaurant floats over a pond filled with a variety of tropical fish. You can wander out into the restaurant in the morning before it opens for lunch, and sit and watch the fish to your heart's content. The room itself was very nice; it had a featherbed over the mattress and superb linens. The bathroom was enormous and marble; the whole room gave you a feeling of spaciousness and luxury. The lobby area has side walls which are rarely closed, leaving the entire area open to tropical breezes. Beautiful artworks -- particularly sculptures -- are situated throughout. This property has an exquisite little chapel on the lawn near the ocean, perfect for weddings. The spa looked gorgeous, but I never actually made it there...I was too blissed-out by the pool. Actually, that's no excuse because the spa has a setup right beside the pool that offers pedicures, massages, manicures, hair braiding and the like. As we have a child, we were very happy to find the family amenities. There is a children's facility that charges by the half-day and is largely geared toward child care for younger children (ours was 10 when we went, and she was a bit too old for it). There were some specific kids' programs offered that were shorter in duration and focussed on a particular activity, and they were more her style. The pools are unbelievable. You will never find anything like it anywhere else. The adults' pool is comfortably distanced from the main pool complex, and it is lovely -- elegantly tiled in a floral design, deep enough for a proper swim, and surrounded by lounge chairs (free) or private covered cabanas (charge). The main pool is phenomenal. It has a series of small pools which are connected together -- and to the large pool -- by a maze of water slides and "rivers". One waterslide is adrenaline-pumping, and the other is much gentler. For those who like their water adventure more calming, you can just float along in a current underneath the bougainvillea bushes. If you want some social time, water volleyball and the like, you can hang out at the biggest pool. If you are seeking a little more quiet time -- or if you have small children who aren't ready for the big pool -- you can ride the water-powered elevator or walk up a series of stone steps to any of the smaller pools which are placed at higher levels in the complex. As I recall, there are at least three or four of them and they all have their own sets of lounge chairs and relaxing areas. The property has a variety of places to eat; we went primarily to the casual restaurant in the main building. If you are looking for a change, you can walk (either along the road or down a paved path that follows the oceanfront) past two other hotels to a shopping centre, which has a few restaurants. We had visited this resort several years back while staying in a Lahaina condo, and made the Grand Wailea our "some day" destination. After all that time, it did not disappoint at all.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return!”
Reviews.Author: AllieBrookie
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 20s without children who stayed at the Grand Wailea in mid-September. Like other reviewers have said, we were skeptical after reading other reviews and almost changed our reservation to another hotel at the last minute. We're so glad we didn't! We are used to staying at 4 and 5 star hotels, and the Grand Wailea met all of our expectations. The rooms were large and clean. We had a deluxe ocean view king, and it provided a great view of the ocean and the resort grounds and chapel. The carpet in the room looked new to us. Bathrooms were large with a shower and separate soaking tub. The bed was cozy with a down mattress topper and white duvets. Our room was serviced twice a day. Yes, the rooms may need a little updating sometime soon, but they are definitely not in disrepair. The pool area was fantastic. You don't have to have kids to enjoy all the fun water slides and rapids! We usually sat at the adults-only pool, which had a great view towards the ocean and was always peaceful. Poolside service was always available and always friendly. Chairs were always available, but we rented a cabana twice and thoroughly enjoyed it. Other reviewers have complained about missing pool tiles. Yes, I did see a few missing tiles, but I don't think I would've noticed them had I not read the reviews here! Don't worry -- everything looks beautiful. We only ate breakfast at the hotel one morning. We had the buffet and found it to be just okay. We highly recommend dinner at Ferraro's next door at the Four Seasons. We ate there twice and the food and the atmosphere are incredible! All in all, we were very happy with our stay and will definitely stay again when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “25 year anniversary in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Daddio7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25 year anniversay on September 6th of this year. We wanted our trip to be special, and the Grand Wailea Resort did not disappoint. Upon arrival the GWR staff acknowledged, without my prompting, our anniversary (I told the reservation clerk via the phone months ahead of our stay). Our first night we strolled along the beach and swam in the many pools and jaccuzi's. When we returned to our room,(thanks to our bellhop, Ryan) a hot bath had been drawn for us and flowers placed in the tub. (they even placed flowers in our toilet). Towels were shaped into the figues of swans kissing, also making a heart shape. (see attached picture) They second night they gave us a complementary bottle of champagne as we dined at the HummaHumma. Since it was after the Labor Day Holiday (The Best Time to Go!) we felt like we had the whole Resort to ourselves. The Maui Dive Shop is right next door to the Hotel, and we snorkeled for 3 days. Ulua Beach is a great beach for snorkling. We saw every possible fish . we were able to camp out right in front of the Resort, where we had access to the Resort staff, bathrooms and bars. Who could ask for anything more?! We enjoyed our time so much just being at the resort, that we blew off the road to Hana. The Old Lahaina Luau was great and strolling around Lahaina was fun too. We needed that time just to walk off the effects of the many Mai Tai's we had at the Luau. They kept the drinks flowing all night. The GWR was the best, and we are saving up to take the whole family nex year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Tcmill
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading some negative reviews but so glad I kept the reservation. I absolutely loved this hotel! My husband and I had a fabulous vacation and would definitely stay here again. Checking in was a breeze. The hotel lobby and grounds were stunning, well maintained. Pool was amazing!! The only negative thing I can think of about this hotel was the room was a little musty.

Reviews.Title: “Two Yuppies- No Kids”
Reviews.Author: mastergan
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently stayed at the Grand Wailea from Sept 20th-25th. We read the many reviews below and did not let ourselves be cared off by negative comments. I have to say though, that many of the comments below regarding the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff are right on. To start, we arrived at about 2PM and the valet was empty, so got our lei's and other welcome necklace and proceeded to check in desk. I was amazed to see that as a Hilton Gold member, I was not able to be upgraded, considering I booked at Deluxe Ocean View room. In fact, once I pushed back on the check in guy, he "spoke to the secret non existent" manager in the back room and came out and actually asked me to pay the upgrade cost to move to a upgrade. I explained that I was a gold member and they were supposed to upgrade me should a room be available and he then completely lied to us and told us, the next class of room, Napua Tower, had no rooms with any ocean views. I, being a moron, believed him and just stuck with our Deluxe Ocean View room, but would later look out our balcony and see the Napua tower and notice that almost every room has some sort of Ocean view. The bellhop took us to our first room which was cramped and in a corner, near where the hotel turns and the next wing jets out. The room was not to our expectation, especially for a "Deluxe Ocean View". I asked him to call down and find us a different room, with a direct view of the ocean and not a view where I needed to turn my head to see water. We eventually were placed in a better room, but lower floor, 7 now instead of 8. We rented a cabana ($175 a day) for a few days and the service is very hit and miss. The waitress comes by often, however, the pool/cabana staff is not friendly at all and does not do much to make your stay enjoyable. In fact, the fruit tray and water that come with the cabana are brought out right away, no one asks when you would like it, plus the water is two Evian 1 liter bottles and a plastic bucket of ice that melts right away. If youâ€™re lucky, they may add some ice midway through the day. You do get a cold towel and maybe a Popsicle 1x during the day, but for $175 a day, I expect a smile. The staff is all local younger people, ages 18-25 and they seem to have a real issue with non local people. The pools are nice, however, the activity main pool broke (Pipe issue) and they closed it for a day which sucked big time because without that pool, I might as well stay at the Four Seasons next door where the service is very high quality and everyone is friendly and where the cabanas are free, just first come, first served. The food is average at best. Humahuma, the "signature restaurant" is very average and over priced, plus the service is average at best. We ate here our first night and have to say, very disappointed. At least the food got better each night as we ate off property. The places we ate and I highly recommend are Longhi's and Tommy Bahamas right next door at the mall and Spago at Four Seasons (Next Property over- take the path by the beach). The best food we had was at Mama's Fishouse, make a reservation, but this is the best food I have ever had in Maui. The breakfast (Grand Dining Room) is average; donâ€™t get the buffet at $27 a person, order off the menu for an average cost of $17 a person. It is the same food, cooked to order. They do however take forever to bring the food out, even if you are one of 5 people in the place. I believe the kitchen is also the kitchen for room service, this backup. The property is beautiful, lots of art and plants...... The property is huge, everything is a walk, but that has to be one of the reasons you choose this property over the four seasons next door. The four seasons is smaller, more compact and more adult oriented. All in all, a nice stay, but make sure you are aware of the lack of service issues that surround the property. Being a"waldorf" property is deceiving; this is nothing like the service level you receive at the original Waldorf in NY. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, soiled carpets, tired fabrics, way over priced”
Reviews.Author: menace7
Reviews.Content: I've read most of the reviews in here before leaving and some are exactly on target. Now here's the skinny from our one week stay in September. I will kind of break it down into some categories. ARRIVAL. Excellent, timely, professional. It was better than arriving at most Ritz Carltons. VIEW. Excellent! For the first time in my life I got what was promised. Room 9080 was on the highest floor and we were in the center of the "U" shaped hotel complex. Yes, I agree that if you are on a lower floor, then you will have some palm trees blocking your water view. But the water is so far away, it really doesn't matter. Sitting on the balcony you could occasionally hear the ocean, but that's about it. Everything is drowned out by the man-made streams and fountains down below. ROOM. Filthy. I'm an engineer so lets talk observations and some form of empirical measurement. I walked around the bed in white socks and within about five minutes, the bottoms of my socks were filthy black. The carpeting was heavily soiled and in the week we stayed there, it was vacuumed once. The bedspread was threadbare and tired. The upholstry on the seats looked par for a Sanford & Son show. The floor on the balcony was also filthy. HOUSEKEEPING. I travel a lot and have found that generous tipping up front usually guarantees my family will be treated well. I gave $100 to the housekeeping manager to be shared by those working my room. Nothing changed. In fact, it might have gotten worse. They come in, make the bed, change the towels, hit the tables tops a swipe or two, empty the trash and hit the trail. It's probably the worst I've seen in any Hilton. The room was simply filthy. POOL. We are not sun worshipers, but the place looked fine to me. There also seemed to be plenty of pool maintenance. BEACH. Nice to walk on and seemed to be groomed about twice a week. FOOD. Had dinner at the nicest restaurant on the property- I can't remember the name because it's a way long word with all those mumbo jumbo Hawaii sounds: moona-moona-humma-humma... you get the idea. It was reasonably priced, the service so-so and the food so-so as well. It's a Hilton, what do you expect? The restaurant sits on a little man-made lagoon and the view was nice. The place was somewhat empty when we were there and I couldn't help but come away with the feeling the place was going out of business soon. I got a refrigerator for our room and we mostly snacked. Also, the Jura cafe on the main floor serverd great foods at stateside prices. Their hot breakfast was GREAT! The lady running it was the nicest employee I met anywhere on the island. DEPARTURE. Smooth at the front desk, then waited 45 minutes for the valet to get our car. Ouch! I'd go back, but would take my own cleaning supplies and do my room the first day. The view was that good.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: wednesday1
Reviews.Content: I am suprised to read negative reviews of the Grand Wailea Resort. This place is truly breath taking. I have nothing but positive things to report about the Grand Wailea. The resort grounds were stunning, the staff was friendly and accomodating, and my delux garden view room (with a bonus patial view of the ocean) was wonderful. Since September is not "peak" family vacation time, the pool was not overrun with kids as some reviewers complained. There were plenty of seats in the sun and shade by the pool and the beach had space to spread out and enjoy the beautiful blue water. The pool was relaxing, especially at the grotto swim up bar. My king room and bathroom were spacious, comfortable, and nicely decorated. The bed was almost as comfortable (if not more) as my bed at home. Room Service breakfast on the lanai was the perferct start to each day. The food was expensive as previous reviewers noted, but the prices were comperable to most resturants in Maui so I can not complain. The food quality was good and there were no watered down Maita'is here. You absolutely MUST schedule time at the spa during your stay at the Grand Wailea. You will not be disappointed by the baths or your treatment. Valet service was quick - my car was always waiting if I called down ahead. Though we received notice of some repairs and work being done on the resport grounds, I did not hear any construction noise. There was a small amount of work being done in the pool area, but it did not interfere with use of the pool or the overall beauty of the resort. The time I spent at the Grand Wailea helped make my trip to Maui a dream vacation! An additional recommendation for your trip to Maui...be sure to eat dinner at Mama's Fish House. This was by far the best meal I ate in Hawaii (and I ate very well the whole trip).

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: jenntl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/8 to 9/18/06. The resort is gorgeous and the rooms are quite large. We had no smells whatsoever. We had tiny ants in the bathroom but they seemed friendly and didn't bother us so we didn't report them. We were given an ocean view/front room in the Lagoon wing. We talked to another couple that were over by the Chapel wing that did mention a smell to their room but it sounded like they reported it and were moved. We understand a full renovation is coming and the rooms could probably use it but nothing was detracting at all. Maid service came at least twice a day to tidy up and check the room supplies. One couple mentioned their room got missed one day but 1 phone call got them taken care of. We found the entire staff to be extremely friendly. Always smiling and saying "hi". Those that complained that the staff was rude or unfriendly probably walked around with scowls on their faces not offering up smiles or greetings of their own. We said "hi" to a number of people and got the cold shoulder back. It's a large resort so you're going to do some walking. Anyone complaining about that failed to do any research and should stay at a small, boutique hotel. Likewise, those that thought the beach was too far away and the hotel should be set closer are not only lazy but impractical. Probably the same people that complain about kids but stay at a hotel that clearly advertises water slides and a camp specifically for kids. Common sense, people. We don't have kids but found the water slides and pools to be quite fun and clean. The hotel was nearly deserted for the first several days, which was quite nice. It was booked full by the end of our stay and it did seem pretty crowded but big resort = big crowds if they are doing something right and it wasn't bad. We always found the right amount of shade and chairs around the pools. There isn't any shade at the adult pool unless you rent a cabana but again, we always found shade at the other pools. There were always servers at the main pool but service was much slower at the other pools. I think the amount of servers depended on occupancy, which would make sense since there is a lot of ground to cover. There was some wallpaper coming off in the main pool bathroom but considering the moisture in there, I'm not surprised. We walked over to the Four Seasons and were surprised at how cramped it felt. Nice but the pool was a joke compared to the Grand and the main fountain wasn't even running. Wouldn't stay there. Sure some of the Grand's beach chairs and equipment could stand to be replaced as the elements have been weathered quite a bit but nothing that would detract from one's vacation. The one thing we continually bemoaned were the food prices. Maui's expensive - no matter where you go. Expect to pay double if not triple what you are used to back home. $7.50 for OJ in the main dining room for breakfast. We bought snacks for the room at the grocery store. We enjoyed Roy's, Fred's and Sansei. (All in Kihei). We ate at Kimo's in Lahaina twice. Really enjoyed Joe's Grill at the tennis courts just above the Shops at Wailea. They have an early bird special from 5:30 to 6:30. (buy 1 get 2nd entree free) Great views of the sunset. Also really liked Kincha's at the hotel. Didn't have reservations but were seated quickly at the sushi bar and my husband enjoyed his cooked dinner as much as I enjoyed my raw food. Ate twice at Tommy Bahamas early on and wouldn't recommend it. The one "gripe" we had/have. Turn off your stupid cell phones!!! Whether it was poolside or in restaurants - people fail to realize how loud they are talking or are too rude to care. People are not staring at you because they are in awe of you or your conversation. They're giving you the stink eye to get a clue and shut up! We had a wonderful time and would stay there again if we have kids. Nothing against the Grand. We just like to try different places. We shook our heads at the older couple that didn't like the table they were offered for breakfast in the Maui Dining Room and stood disgruntled in the middle of the room while the staff quickly cleared the table they deemed fit for them. As if there is a bad seat in that restaurant! Our order that morning was slightly wrong and the waitress immediately offered us both the full buffet at no charge and apologized profusely, which we thought was a very nice gesture and a nice end to a perfect vacation. Don't let all of the negative "glass is half empty" people scare you away. Some obviously go with a chip on their shoulder just looking for things to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded, Costly, Constrcution at the beach, Convienent”
Reviews.Author: OVRSAX
Reviews.Content: We go on one major holiday a year. This year we spent a week at a condo at the Grand Champions in Wailea and a week in the Grand Wailea. The condo was a 10 minute walk to the beach. So was our room at the Grand Wailea was a ten minute walk to the beach by time we snaked through the hotel and the hugely crowded pool area. The best beach in the area is Big Beach at Makena State Park just south of the Grand Wailea about 3 miles. The rooms at the Grand are very Grand and worth the price but for the price I would like a little more than direct beach access. We had an amazing view of the ocean and all the weddings, and the pool crowds, and the beach. I recommend you get your chair early in the morning or pay big $$$ for a private cabana. That was not in our budget. As it was at the end of the week there we had racked up more than $3000 in room charges in addition to our room charges. You pay for everything here when we were done we had spent close to $11,000.00 We had as much fun in our condo the second week and the whole week including meals cost way less than our room charges. I searched, "vacation rental by owner" and found several sites that catered to vacation rentals. The one really big plus of the Grand Wailea is the effectiveness of the pool area to keep children busy all day long. The kids meet other kids there and they form "instant life long friendships" that really gave my husband and I some alone time. I must recommend the adult Hibiscus Pool......stunningly beautiful. We did a seaside private dinner which they set up for us to watch the setting sun. Had it been a little more remote and less busy it would have been perfect. I would definately go back to the Grand Wailea but I will also book more vacation condos in the future. We may be able to do more vacations per year with what we saved.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Jabanobacka
Reviews.Content: I've been to Maui a few times and usually stay at the Fairmont in Wailea. A few weeks ago, we decided to try the Grand Wailea since we heard it was the best hotel on the island. From the outside, the hotel looked very promising. The exterior was beautiful, the pools spectacular, and the beach access unbeatable. But from the moment we pulled up to the valet, we realized that the hotel was simply a body without a soul. As we pulled up, we had to wait a minute or so before we were "greeted" by a valet. In fact, we had already unloaded our bags before one of the valets finally showed up. As we walked into the lobby, the female greeter uninterestedly placed leis (sp ?) around our necks. She didnt even bother smiling. I contrast this with the warmth and friendliness that greeted us everytime we arrived at the Fairmont. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 3:30pm, which is about half an hour past the official check in time. However, our room was still not available and we were asked to simply wander about the hotel and were told that we would get a call on our cell phone when our room was ready. Half an hour later we still had not received a call and decided to go back to the front desk. After waiting a somewhat lengthy time to finally speak to a front desk person, we were told that our room was ready. Where was that phone call? When we got to our room, we were fairly unimpressed. The bathroom looked dated and the overall size was smaller than the rooms at the Fairmont. The pool area is truly the gem of this hotel. There are something like 10 pools and various slides and water attractions. However, if you're an adult, you might find the number of screaming kids a bit overwhelming. The hotel had a feel comparable to your average waterpark. Nevertheless, my friends and I still enjoyed the pool. The easy beach access was also a positive as it was just a few steps from the pool area. My biggest complaint about the hotel is the service, or lack thereof. There was none of the island love, or general hospitality that you would expect from a 5 star resort, or more importantly a hotel that costs 500-900 bucks a night. The staff members rarely smiled, they seemed bothered when you approach them with a question, and generally seem out of place at a high-end resort. None of the little touches were found at the Grand Wailea. For example, at the Fairmont, smiling pool side employees would frequently walk around handing out fresh pineapples. At the Marriott Ihilani in Oahu, they had a jolly guy walking around the pool spritzing cool water on the feet of hotel guests. Those little things are so important when you pay the kind of rates you pay at the Grand Wailea. The capper to our 5 day stay was the jack hammering that started at 7:30AM during the last 2 days of our stay. Imagine if you will, waking up in paradise to loud jack hammering...at 7:30 in the freaking morning. When we complained during the last day, they told us that they had left letters in our rooms telling us of the jackhammering. First, we didnt get a letter. Second, who cares if you they left a letter? Why not wait until a more reasonable time to start causing that kind of noise. Fortunately they decided to comp us one night which made the experience slightly more bearable. My last memory of the Grand Wailea was back in the valet. After the valet pulled up the car for the final time, he sat there and watched as my friends and I struggled to place the bags in our trunk. No offer to help. Needless to stay, I will never again stay at this hotel. I've warned my friends who are planning trips to Hawaii to stay away from this place. If this was a normal 200 dollar a night hotel, I really wouldnt have cared. But paying Grand Wailea rates for Motel 6 service is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “In need of room renovations!”
Reviews.Author: yupoldbull
Reviews.Content: The grounds were magnificent, service was wonderful, but the rooms were just fair. Our room was in terrible need of udating. The room needed to be painted and wallpapered. The carpet was smelly and sticky. Our shower had a slow drain problem and the sliding louver doors got stuck off the track. (Maintenence was there within minutes of the call!) They were in the process of putting mattress toppers on the beds during our 7 day stay. The first 2 days neither bed had a topper. On the 3rd day one bed got a soft new topper. We called on the 4th day to inquire about the other bed. On the 5th day we got the other topper. Poor implementation. Room size and amenities were very good. We had a chance to inspect some of the other rooms on the island. We found that some were not as nice (Sheraton) but some were much nicer. They need to invest in some room renovations to get the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Grand Wailea was magical”
Reviews.Author: phworld
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea and were overwhelmed by the service (Ritz Carlton comparable) and resort property. The service from the door captain to the reception to the housekeeping was excellent. Our wedding was on the same day as our check-in and they went out of their way to get us an early check-in. Their service throughout was fantastic and the property was impeccable. The pool was even more amazing with a Raging Waters-like slide and swim up bar. I highly recommend this astounding resort for honeymooners and vacationers!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea Awesome! $300-how?”
Reviews.Author: huladolz
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome 8 day stay at the Grand Wailea! We were a family of 4- kids 9 and 5. We had a deluxe garden view that faced the pools and part of the ocean, we couldn't believe it. I got goosebumps and chills when we saw our view, the kids were ecstatic! Heaven! The pools- A+, my kids loved all the waterslides, the tarzan rope was my son's favorite, the water elevator was very cool. Yes, this is a FAMILY resort and for families, it is awesome! If you are on your honeymoon, I suggest you stay on the chapel wing away from the pool area and kids and hang out at the adult pool. We went into the 4 seasons and that is a nice place to stay for a honeymoon but not as entertaining as GW for the kids. The food at hotel- Cafe Kula B-/C+, great since it is close to the pools but lunch items are fair in quality. Breakfast was better. We ate lunch and dinner at the Wailea shops or in nearby Kihei where prices and food quality were better. Housekeeping, Valet, Check in- out- A+ When we came back to the room one afternoon, the maid had arranged my daughters American Girl dolls in a cute fashion holding hands. She was thrilled! We also LOVED all the art that was displayed throughout the hotel and gardens, just gorgeous. The beach was also great and my kids had a blast making sand castles and burrying themselves in sand. It is a little pricey but as the below review says, if you know that ahead of time, then you will be alright. Those who have negative reviews, I believe they did not educate themselves about the resort and had different expectations. Again, it is a FAMILY resort and every dollar was worth it as it was the BEST vacation our family has had yet. We plan to go every year, we were all so sad when we checked out that we HAVE to go back. :) To the below reveiwer, how did you get a room for $300 a night? Do you have a membership? that is a great rate, can you please post on tripadvisorforum. We will definitely be back each year if we can get rates like that! Grand Wailea Dreamin' Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Big bucks in paradise”
Reviews.Author: WhiteTower
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for six nights, July 28-August 3. This was our second visit to this property, the first being in January 2005. We are in our early 40s and we did not bring children. Overview: The Grand Wailea is a Hilton-owned hotel (as of August 1, 2006) located in the Wailea resort area on southwest Maui, which is the sunniest part -- and hence the most expensive part -- of Maui. The hotel is approximately 30-40 minutes from the Kahului airport; it is just outside the town of Kihei. Renting a car at the airport is a necessity as there is no â€œshuttleâ€� service or public transportation to the resort area. Price/Value: We paid $656/night for a â€œfull ocean viewâ€œ room, this being the high-season rate. It is difficult to make a distinction, however, between the â€œfullâ€œ and â€œpartialâ€� ocean view rooms in that most rooms are set back several hundred feet from the beach and are to some degree blocked by palm trees. Our supposed full-ocean view room only obliquely viewed the ocean. To see the ocean required standing outside the room on the left side of the patio: â€œAh, THEREâ€™S the ocean!â€� In our opinion, there are very few genuine â€œfullâ€� ocean view rooms -- as in dead-on, sight unobstructed views of the ocean. Upon check-in we were delighted to find out that we had been upgraded to a Napua Tower room, which is closed off from the other floors by a card-activated gate and includes complimentary continental breakfast (eggs, breads, and fruit, no meat) each morning and a complimentary (!) â€œhappy hourâ€� in the evening. Additional charges include valet parking of $15/day and a â€œresort feeâ€� of $20/day. Taxes ran about 4.5%. Accommodations: The Grand Wailea was built in 1991 and in some respects the rooms need upgrading, such as the low-end bathroom sink and shower fixtures that would not have looked out of place in an interstate motel. The air conditioning was the biggest issue -- the rooms do not have digital thermostats but rather the cheap dial and switch controls -- you donâ€™t get to set the room temperature. Further, although not intolerable, it seemed if the a/c was having some difficulty cooling the room. This being said, the room was otherwise very tastefully appointed, comfortable, with ample space. Our room had a roll-away couch and coffee table. Each room has bathrobes and high-end toiletries and towels. There is an in-room high-speed internet connection for your laptop with unlimited use, the cost of which is covered under the resort fee. Service: The best part of the hotel, it seemed to us, was the staff. Everyone, from the valet to the maids to the poolside waitresses to the front-desk to maintenance (after checking in we found our plantation doors stuck) was efficient and polite. The one exception the whole time was service one afternoon for lunch at the Bistro -- the server was incompetent, but still pleasant. Oh well. Restaurants: The Kincha Japanese restaurant was closed for two of the days we visited (it is always closed on Tuesday and Wednesday) and the seafood restaurant, Humuhumunukunukuapuaâ€™a (not making that up), was booked both times we tried to get in. Consequently, the only Grand Wailea restaurant at which we ate was the Bistro, for dinner one day and for lunch another. The Bistro overlooks the pools and is essentially bar/grille type food: sandwiches, pizza, salads, and some basic seafood selections. We paid $17 for a hamburger, $16 for a personal pizza, $9 for soup, and $24 for a seafood salad. The main restaurants will run roughly $60/person, exclusive of alcohol, for dinner. Amenities: There are two very large and well-maintained pools at the Grand Wailea, one of them being adults-only (which evidently is actually enforced) and the other being all-ages, highlighted by a water slide and grotto. We were able to get good location pool lounges only because I went down each morning at 7:00am and â€œsavedâ€� two lounges with beach towels. One good thing: the towels and chairs are included in the resort fee. I understand that some resorts charge for chairs/lounges and towels. A cabana, however, will run you $225/day. The less crowded beach is shared with the adjoining Four Seasons and was quite scenic and enjoyable. Other amenities include snorkeling, a â€œCamp Waileaâ€� for kids, and an attractive chapel for weddings, with an actual Sunday morning service here for guests . Clientele: Most guests ranged from the 30s-50s, with a good number of families with young children, some retirees, and, of course, honeymooners. We saw very few singles, teens, or twentysomethings. The resort is definitely not a â€œpartyâ€� atmosphere. Other reviews have bemoaned the large number of children. While there are lots of kids, we didnâ€™t feel that it was a Disney-like atmosphere or that children were overly obtrusive. Area attractions: Adjoining the resort are the Shops at Wailea, containing high-end shopping such as Tiffanyâ€™s and Yves-Saint Laurent but also containing the obligatory t-shirt shops and two convenience stores. Within the Shops are four restaurants: Tommy Bahamas, Cheeseburgers in Paradise, Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse, and Longhiâ€˜s Italian/Seafood, at all of which we ate and enjoyed. Literally minutes away in the town of Kihei are fast-food restaurants, pharmacy, and a variety of â€œlocalâ€� restaurants. We had some excellent Mexican food at a Moose McGillycuttyâ€˜s. There is also a Safeway in Kihei, located on the Piliani Highway on the way to/from from the airport. My wife and I stopped in to stock up on soda, juice, munchies, and some alcohol -- doing this saved a lot of money. (And itâ€™s the principle of the thing: we take it as a personal insult to pay $3.50 for a Snickerâ€™s from the mini-bar.) The town of Lahaina is about 30 minutes up the coast from the resort. The drive offers a striking view of the Maui coastline and of nearby islands. The town of Lahaina itself used to be the islandâ€™s primary port and was the royal seat of government, and currently is something like an â€œold townâ€� downtown area, offering a diversity of restaurants, shops, and entertainment fronting the ocean. The town is nearly all walkable. Forget the â€œroad to Hana.â€œ It is literally an all-day drive, is unnerving and decidedly not relaxing, and is mostly all green forests. On our first visit to Maui, we started on it but ended up turning around and coming back. A better drive (shorter, safer, and more scenic) is to the crater atop the 10,000 foot Haleakala volcano, under whose shadow the Wailea area is located. Summary: We plan to continue vacationing in Maui and will likely stay in Wailea again, although we may give either the Four Seasons or the Fairmont a try. Depending on what time of the year you go and in what type of room you stay, understand that at the Grand Wailea you will spend something around $1000/day total, excluding airfare and any shopping. Bottom line: The Grand Wailea is indeed wonderful, but horribly expensive and not without flaws. Hope this helps! Feel free to email with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler2006
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here after all the bad reviews but we had a great time. We would definitely stay there again We chose this resort for 4 reasons 1. When we were in Hawaii last and we visited it (it was a Grand Hyatt then) we loved the hotel and said that if we ever go back to Maui we would stay there 2. Friends of ours moved to the Wailea area and we wanted to be close to them 3. We knew the kids would love the pool 4. The price was right at $300 per night compared to other hotels in the area for the same dates (Aug 18-27, 2006) We had a terrace room which was great we had a view of the mountains on the left and to our right a slight ocean view through the palm trees. The rooms is large and comfortable with plenty of space for 4. We did notice that the room was starting to show a little wear but not enough to bother us. I do know they are going to start renovating them soon For anyone that has stayed there on their honeymoon I hope your travel agent didn't steer you there as it is a family resort with a lot of kids but it depends on your style of hotel. Friends and family of ours that have stayed there without kids also loved the hotel because they liked the large pool area and the slides. I am sure if you are going when school is in session you will have a lot less kids at the resort. Also if you don't have any kids why not utilize the adult only pool? I spend some time there on my own and loved the piece and quiet Restaurants - we tried Kincha's for dinner and Bistro Molikini for lunch one day. Both were very good, even though they are overpriced. We didn't like the food or quality of food at the casual Cafe Kula at all and only got fuit, snacks, etc there. We stayed away from the hot foods Yes the service at the pool was slow or non existent at times but since we only really needed it when we had lunch we went over to the tables at the pool area instead of eating at our seats. We actually preferred this as there was shade and they always had ice cold water available if you wanted it Do I think all the food is overpriced? yes definitely since cheeseburgers were $15 each but I have to tell you that the quality of the cheeseburgers at the pool area was a lot better then the Cheeseburger restaurant at the Shops at Wailea and theirs started at $11 each. No we didn't eat cheeseburgers each day I am just using this as an example We did go to Safeway and purchased water, soda and a few snacks for the rooms so that we didn't have to purchase it at the resort. I find that the kids are always hungry after getting back to the room from the pool or beach and having snacks in the room for them was definitely worth it. Unfortunately we didn't get to go into the ocean a whole lot because it was pretty rough and the kids really couldn't handle it for long so we were glad we had a large pool to enjoy. Check in / Check out - both were fast and everyone we dealt with was courteous Valet / bell service - Both were quick and no problems whatsoever. We were there for 9 nights and after a couple of nights the valet people knew us pretty well. Valet always asked us if we needed directions or recommendation for restaurant, sights, etc each time they brought our car around. The only time there was ever a wait for the car was during peak dining time when a lot of people were leaving the resort but after the first time experiencing this we would call for the car at least 30 minutes before we were ready to leave the room and it was always waiting for us when we reached the front of the resort Botero Bar - was a lot of fun but I think a lot of it had to do with our friends that live in Maui knowing the bartenders there, which made it more fun and personable The only thing that I noticed is that pick up of room service trays people left outside their door was left out for quite a long time but the one time we ordered a snack from room service, we called for pick up of the plates and they were there within 5 minutes. I do have to say that the food through room service was very good, arrived piping hot and was presented beautifully Things that bothered me, this is not the hotel's fault, is the people who let their kids run all over the place without being supervised. Again the people who leave their trash everywhere including the edges of the pool. Yes they nickle and dime you to death at this hotel but being from the NYC area most hotels in NYC are the same where they charge for everything. If you don't know that going in then you haven't done your research. If the high prices of everything at the hotel will bother you then this is not the resort for you. They bothered me a little but I knew it going in and went out for breakfast instead of eating at the restaurant and only ate one dinner in the hotel because we wanted to try Kincha's. Maui is not cheap in the least even eating breakfast at Denny's is a lot more then what you would spend back at home and we eat at Denny's for breakfast maybe once every two years at home so it isn't a place we utilize often We did find that most of the lesser expensive restaurants in the area didn't have good service at all. If you wanted better food with good service you had to eat at the higher end places. We found through our friends of ours that the reason for this is the lower priced restaurants have a higher turnover of wait staff then the higher end restaurants where people tend to stay put longer Other places we ate at Cafe O'Lei - twice - first night great service and great food, second night service not good at all but food was still great Tommy Bahama - twice - very good food and service Spago - anniversary dinner - great service, great food, well worth the price. Joe's Wailea at the Tennis Club - great service, food was good. Stella Blues - twice for breakfast, once for lunch - good food, good service, priced resonably for the area

Reviews.Title: “Didn't really dig it!”
Reviews.Author: Girefamily
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand was a disappointment. After spending 6 amazing nights at the Hyatt, we were excited to get the the Grand and see what the fuss was about. As it turns out, it's much ado about nothing. Valet service was non existent (perhaps because we weren't in a Mercedes), and overall the customer service was marginal at best. If you have the money to stay anywhere, but would prefer a bit of hospitality and friendliness over glitz and glamour, try the Hyatt. The hotel was a bit overstated and didn't feel much like Hawaii at all - my 9 year old son observed "This a place where rich, old people would stay". If snobby Newport Beach is your thing, you'll love the Grand - if you want someplace to stay where customer service isn't based on your perceived annual income, try the Hyatt. That being said, the room was OK - we had a good view of the ocean, the bathroom was beautiful with separate tub and shower - a great feature for familes after a day at the beach. The pool complex was like a shrunken water park, but was really chaotic, and crowded with unsupervised spoiled kids running rampant. The Tarzan swing was a huge hit with our kids, but not enough to make the Grand some place we'd ever go back to. The beach is really nice, but we were plagued with big surf from an approaching storm that kept us from snorkeling anywhere in the south part of the island. That's not a knock on the Grand, and I'm sure during better weather, this beach would be near perfect - but you could stay elsewhere and go to Big Beach for the same sand and spend MUCH LESS $$$'s! Our bell hop, and three of the lifeguards were the only employees who showed any enthusiasm for their work. Lee who works at the pool was a real kick, and his personality seemed to embody what the resort was missing! Friendly, good natured, and easy going! Everyone else seemed to going through the motions, or waiting for a tip One girl at the pool desk couldn't even stop text messaging on her cell phone long enough to give me a dry towel!! At the Volcano grill, I paid $15 for a dried out burger with a cold bun and a sack of chips, and had to wait to be seated in a puddle of sandy water!! We ate the rest of our meals off property in Kihei where it's quirky, seedy, and much more down to earth!! I'm no snob, but if I'm going to shell out big bucks, I expect big service! Overall, the good bathroom, and fun pool, was not enough to win us over. We found Wailea to be too high end and pretentious to really feel like the laid back - casual Hawaii we know and love. In our opinion, this resort can't touch the class and intimacy of the Hyatt Kaanapali where everyone smiles, and after two days, they all seem to know your name!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED Grand Wailea!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Grand Wailea Resort for the second time! Overall, I am shocked because of so many bad reviews on thiswebsite! Grand Wailea doesn't deserve that. This hotel is for active people, people with love to explore and with love of art! Pools there are the best I've ever seen-2 waterslides, great giant "Lazy River", many small slides connecting Lazy River parts and perfect pools(Hibiscus-very warm one for relaxing, Canyon Activity-includes all slides,"river", and big pool for water volleyball and swimming)!This hotel has fantastic beach in just two steps-Wailea Beach.In fact, we walked to other hotels(Fairmont, Renaissance, Marriott)-there are no beaches at all or just poor ones-except Four Seasons, which shares the same Wailea beach! Hoitel is very beautiful, I reccomen to ask for a room in Chapel Wing-you will have the best view in the hotel. There is fantastic buffet breakfast, but for dinner I reccomend nearby Shops at Wailea-shopping center with great eateries-check out Cheesburger Island Style-the cheapest and the best one. There are many activities in Grand Wailea, for example, nighttime slide races!They are free and the fastest racer wins a coupon for ice-cream!I won 2 times.There is also night disco for teens and the best-Teen Spa (access to all Hydrotherapy for 2 hours for 35$(otherwise, you may visit it for 200$)-fantastic, and you get a gift too!!) This hotel has the best place there-5 minute walk to shopping center, greatest beach, superb pool!Don't believe bad reviews-if you like to be in the center of everything, there is no place better than Grand Wailea resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “"just what we needed... liked it alot!"”
Reviews.Author: ranchomom
Reviews.Content: The reviews lately at this property have been so up and down that I had some concerns before we got there. Rest assured this is a beautiful hotel, on a gorgeous beach with wonderful pools and the staff was nothing but kind and helpful the entire 7 days we stayed. I should start by saying that this was a family vacation, two boys ages 12 and 9, my husband and myself. We enjoy a vacation once a year and usually stay at 4-5 star properties. The best advice I have is to relax, and enjoy yourself. No hotel is perfect and if that is what you are expecting than I am sure you will find something to be disappointed in. First, the disappointing and then on to all of the good stuff we enjoyed at this hotel. We got a great package thru pleasant hawaiian but booked a terrace view, the least expensive since I know we do not spend a lot of time in our room. We were disappointed to be on the far south side of the molokini wing overlooking the self parking structure and a construction site across the street. I was determined not to let the view bother me but the noise from some sort of generator down below was constant and did bother us as we had breakfast out on the lanai every morning. Luckily with the door closed we couldn't hear a thing. I did not even attempt to change rooms, didn't want the hassle. There were people in the lobby who had been trying to change their room for days and were not having any luck. It's hard because there are only so many perfect rooms at every hotel and the hotel was full the entire time we were there. I think the big difference is that when you pay a premium for your room the hotel had better live up to your every expectation or you are going to be very upset. Booking a terrace room saved us that headache. The rooms were large, the bathroom huge and the bath products my favorite. The beds however were quite uncomfortable with a lumpy pillow topper and pillows that were stiff and hurt your neck. I won't say much about the price of food except that everything is riduclously overpriced. We used Maui revealed to find some great places off site that were still expensive but much more reasonable and with better food than the hotel ( Maui tacos, bada-bing, and Antonio's were favorites. skip the hamburger place at the Wailea shops, worst service I have ever had in my life and the burgers were dry) Now to the part we really enjoyed. The hotel is drop dead gorgeous. Art and flowers every where. We took so many beautiful photos here. The pools are every thing you could want and more. Our kids loved them. Yes, they were crowded but we always found chairs and since we are from southern california we didn't bother with renting cabanas and such. Some broken pool tiles, who cares? The pools were very clean every morning and yes by late afternoon they are not so clean. Whose pool is with that kind of useage? We enjoyed the sun and the cool afternoon tradewinds. The beach is lovely, we snorkeled in the morning and boogie boarded in the afternoon. My 12 year old really enjoyed the complimentary scuba instruction in the pool. Jeff his instructor was so good with the kids that I let him take the optional beach dive. I am sure that was a memory of a life time for him. How cool is it to see huma-huma's every morning off of your hotel beach? Service was tops for us. Everyone single employee greeted all of us with smiles and a warm greeting every single time. Check in was a breeze, there were not any incorrect charges on our bill upon check out. The concierge was quick and helpful with directions to many of the out of way places we wanted to try. We had a late flight so we got a later check out time and a complimentary suite to shower and change in with out any problem. Checked out at 1pm, enjoyed the pool and beach one last afternoon. One last lava flow for me, one last frozen lemonade for the kids. Call front desk from house phone at the pool one hour before you need to change. Complimentary suite ready after waiting about 15 minutes at front desk. Everyone fresh and ready for the flight home. What a way to end a great vacation. Go and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular grounds and pools but mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend our 20th wedding anniversary at the Grand...the grounds, lobby, fountains, and pools are truly magnificent and opulent! It is full of flora and fauna everywhere...truly beautiful. Upon check in we asked for an upgrade due to 20th anniversary but to no avail. Our room was on the 7th floor on side of building where we can hear road construction Mon to Fri as well as a pump station on the property. It is very loud when you are sitting on the balcony. The room is nothing special...it also had a musty smell and nothing was done to fix it after reporting it. The balcony was a little dirty (some ants) but the bathroom was great however it needs a face lift...it has had its wear and tear. It had an enclosed glass shower large enough to fit 2 or 3 people as well as a large jacuzzi tub for 2 people. Both showed its wear and tear so it's time for a new shower and tub. Air conditioning was good but it gave off a musty smell when it's on ; advd mgr of problem but nothing was done about it. The glass elevator and slides and pools were exceptional...truly a paradise for the kids. There were many kids and teenagers while we were there 10aug to 17aug. Many of the teens had terrible snooty attitudes and we found the guests at the hotel UNFRIENDLY...I guess they think they are better than others because they can afford MONEY...would we go again? for that type of money and its value....NO...if only the rooms were updated and kept up more , then it would be worth it....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of 4:30 pm check in time!!”
Reviews.Author: minn1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for 5 nights in an ocean view room. The room was nice and we did have a view of the ocean. The gardens and grounds are very pretty, lots of art and fountains. However, we arrived around 11:00 am and were told the check in time was 4:30 pm. They did nothing to make us comfortable or get us into our room sooner. As guests began to arrive all were told the same thing and the lobby was soon filled with angry, tired guests. Service at the hotel continued to be sub standard. When we asked for a later check out time due to a late flight they refused with no offer of a hospitality room. The activity pool is nice, full of kids, could be cleaner and there are not enough chairs to accomadate the guests. There isn't alot of shade and they charge a premium for umbrellas ($35) and cabanas ($275/day). Unless a large activity pool is important to you go somewhere else. Grand Wailea charges 5 star prices for 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel! A complete dump! Save your money people!”
Reviews.Author: hollywood-girl
Reviews.Content: I cant believe I paid $700.00 per night for a deluxe ocean view room and was given rooms twice with nothing but palm trees. They refused to give us a room anywhere above the 6th floor for a better view of the ocean (which we had paid for) and said if we wanted to be above that floor, we would have to PAY MORE! The hotel is completely run down and needs an overhaul. No ambiance whatsoever. Pool area is DISCUSTING! Poor upkeep and if you don't reserve chairs for yourself by 7 a.m. you won't have a seat anywhere all day. Absolutely ridiculous not to be able to get a chair when you are paying that kind of money @ a hotel. Food and service is grotesque at best. People @ the front desk paid much more attention and hovered around a woman next to me who was carrying a Black Centurion Amex card, while they made me wait next to her for over an hour just to change my room to another "palm tree view" room (but then again I'm only a Platinum Amex card member, what would they care!) Spa needs a redo. The place smells of mold, and there are WAY too many obnoxious teenagers running around, smoking in the elevators, yelling and screaming.
