I agree with the other post; their products are the best I have ever used and I also bought big containers of the honey mango bath gel and lotion and shipped them home. Amazing stuff. There are a lot of great restaurant choices on the island and we also ate at Mama's Fish House and it was also the food highlight of our trip. Amazing location, fabulous food and the Macadmia Nut Banana Crisp with the Vanilla Ice Cream was the best dessert I ever ate :-) This place is truly paradise and we actually looked into joining the vacation club because you can get some great discounts on the rooms but we live in Florida so that did not seem like the best choice being so far away; if we lived on the West Coast we would have done it in a heartbeat. We can't wait to return. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy-jane
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at the GW, courtesy of my husband's company. We had a great time and I can't think of anything to complain about. The hotel is huge and it's easy to get lost! After a couple of days we got our bearings. It is a long walk to the pool but you need to work off the food and cocktails somehow! The room was a nice size, the bathroom large, and both were clean. No problems with noise and the staff were polite and helpful. We used the self parking and always found a space. Great view of the ocean, gardens and West Maui from the balcony. We weren't in the room much as I'd planned to see as much of the island as possible on our short trip (see Maui forum for details). The breakfast buffet is expensive (but we weren't paying!) but there's loads to choose from - fruit, yoghurt, cooked breakfast, freshly made omelettes, pancakes, pastries, waffles etc etc. Or you can order a la carte. We ate lunch in the Molokini Bistro 3 times - again expensive but great views of the ocean and occasionally whales (a personal highlight for me). We didn't get to try the Humuhumu restaurant as our evening meals were provided. Previous posts have mentioned the pool lounger angst - we didn't have our children with us so I chose to sit by the adult only Hibiscus pool and got a lounger on the grass facing the ocean with no problem. Get your wrist band and towels from the pool kiosk. The water elevator is OK but you only need to do it once. The lazy river and slides are great fun, but again we only did them once. We snorkelled off the beach, but didn't see much. Heard the whales though! We had a massage at the spa plus the hour beforehand in the different baths - very relaxing. Our trips out included a helicopter tour, whale watching cruise, ATV at Haleakala Ranch, sunrise at Haleakala crater (we drove ourselves - left GW at 4.30, sunrise 6.35, back for breakfast by 10) and snorkel trip to Molokini and turtles with Kai Kanani off the beach at Maui Prince hotel (10 mins from GW). A fabulous holiday at an amazing hotel, very over the top and not our usual choice, but great to see how the other half live!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from The Grand Wailea Resort.....”
Reviews.Author: shelleyr25
Reviews.Content: Stayed from March 1-6, 2006 with my husband and a large group from his company. The resort is really beautiful just as almost everyone has already posted. The only issue I had, but it is a personal one, is that the place is just so darned big!!! No location is ideal as far as rooms go. We were in room 6085 and although we were a short walk from the meeting rooms, ballroom and nightclub, it was a hike down to the pool, gym or spa. If you forgot something in your room and needed to go back it was a huge inconvenience. Anyway, on with the review...our check in went smooth and besides the fact that there were no rooms with king sized beds left (heard that complain alot on this board) there were no other problems. Our room, although starting to get a bit outdated, was clean and was kept that way throughout our stay. We were with a large group and had many arranged meals that were paid for by the company which helped out alot because the food at the resort was on the pricey side but certainly no more than any other resort of that type. Yes, drinks at the pool were $10 a pop but coming from the NY area its nothing that I am not used to. We did eat at the breakfast buffet one morning and found it to be very good but once again, it wasnt cheap. We had lunch almost every day out at the pool and found the food to be about average....burgers,wraps etc... The pool itself was very nice, clean, etc.. There were not too many kids there so we spent most of our time at the main pool area. The adult (Hibiscus) pool was a bit too quiet for me. My spa massage was wonderful and I must say worth every penny. I have been to many spas all over the world and found that one to be by far the best. If you are headed there dont miss it!! All in all, my experience at the Grand Wailea was very nice but I would not go back simply because I prefer a smaller resort. That is obviously a personal opinion and it may work just fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Aloha is GONE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The aloha is gone! What used to be a fabulous resort has turned into an overpriced average experience. The staff was anything but cordial from arrival to check out. We reserved an ocean front room in the Napua Tower. When we checked in, we were told that we had been "upgraded" to a suite. When we arrived at the very roomy suite, we realized that there was no ocean view-- the only view was of the gardens and someone's discarded underwear in the bushes in front of our lanai. Management was unwilling to move us to an ocean front room in this section, but rather downgraded us to a "partial" view- at the same rate- no concessions! The rooms are average in size and decently appointed for a supposed five star resort. The food continues to be severely over priced- hamburgers $14, hot dogs $12, fruity drinks $9... all served with an attitude that is not Hawaiian. Since Hilton's announcement of take over of management, attitudes seem to have slipped to all time lows on the islands. I certainly hope that Hilton can return this once heavenly resort to its once celestial status. Until then the Four Seasons will have my business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlEB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Grand for a few days while in Maui with our children, 9 and 5. This hotel is great for families with children, no doubt. There are slides, activity pools and the best of all, lifeguards, more than one! I am not convinced that my husband and I would not have enjoyed it as a couple. I did walk through the adult pool/area and it looked amazing! It is so much bigger than the Four Seasons, so if you are looking something smaller and more intimate, this is not it. The food was good and yes expensive, but not anymore than most resorts we have stayed at. In fact, we thought it was competitive. Our favorite place to eat cheap was a cafe (in hotel by the shops) where you could eat a la carte....coffee..bagels...donuts...cereal...eggs...bacon...yogurt. It was great. We did not spend a fortune for breakfast eating at the buffet with children who usually just want some cereal or a muffin. It was open late so you could get chips and sodas or snacks to take to the room. As for poolside service, very slow. The spa was one of the best I have ever been too! It is worth every penny. The amenities in the room are from the spa and we loved the soap so much, we bought some to take home with us. There is a walkway from the hotel to the Wailea shopping area which took about 5 minutes or less to walk to and was a nice break. The shops are high end, but they also have tshirt shops, surf shops and a Gap. The room itself was just average. I agree with most reviews, for the money it is just not as nice as it should be and that is the only reason I did not give it an excellent rating. All in all..we would bring the family back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Grand for a weeks vacation by myself. I found the hotel extraordinary. I called in advance to book a few days at the spa, and the staff was able to put together on short notice several days intineraries for me. Fresh floral lei upon arrival. I mentioned at check in that I was here for a relaxing escape, and was upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room in the quieter chapel wing. Chatted with the bell hop, he recomended the sushi restuarant and told me to speak to a certain chef there and mention his name. I was lavished with extras during dinner. I found all of the staff wonderful. As the week went on and I got to know my staff, the extra perks continued. Housekeeping was kind enough to leave many bottles of water (not charged on my mini bar bill) and plenty of toiletries, all which smell like heaven. A problem with my toilet was fixed within twenty minutes of when I called. The bartender at HumuHumu was delightful and refused to let me pay for my drinks. Room service was prompt and delicious, and always double checked if you tipped over to make sure you knew that tip was included. The spa exceeded all expectations. I went each day of my trip and enjoyed the hydrotherapy terme before hand. All of my services(thai massage, crystal energy massage, shiatsu massage, volcanic ash facial, etc) were far above avaerage, and I was lucky enough to get some of the best employees. I got to know all of the spa staff by name and was treated supremely. All of my needs were anticipated. After completeing a massage one day, I was relaxing by the sauna. My terme attendant, noticed that I was chilly came and wrapped me in towels and spritzed my face with aromatherapy spray. While I soaked during my bath, the attendant braided my hair. After talking to the staff, I began to notice a pattern. Everyone I spoke with had worked at the hotel for years. No one in the spa has been there for less than two years and most had been there ten or more. You can always judge an establishment by how they treat their employees, and the Grand clearly cares not only about their geusts happiness. I suggest this hotel for any group of people, and suggest getting to know a little bit about the place before hand so you are well equipped to navigate and ask for what you want. If you know what you want from the Grand and ask for it, they will give it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Families and Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (me + wife + 14 month son) just returned from a one-week stay at the Grand Wailea Resort and Spa in January 2006. We were booked in an ocean view room on the 8th floor of the Molokini Wing, which conveniently is the closest wing to the Makena self-parking garage. This worked out very well for us, eliminating a $14/day charge for valet parking without introducing an unbearable commute. Our room was of adequate size with a very large and nicely appointed bathroom. The room had a late 1980s feel to it; with obvious worn areas around the carpet, wallpaper, and bathroom shower tile. The wear was minor and didnâ€™t quite warrant a room renovation, but in a few more years it will probably need a facelift. We also noticed a very slight musty odor in the room, likely due to so many beach-goers returning to their carpeted rooms while still wet. An air freshener we purchased at Longs Drugs made short work of that. We rented a mini-fridge from the resort for $25 and used it to store milk, yogurt, and other baby essentials â€“ very worthwhile. The lanai was roomy and afforded an excellent view (see picture). All the public areas of the resort are spectacular and virtually without flaw. The beach is great, the artwork is impressive, and the pools are unparalleled! The staff was friendly and casual. If you come to the Grand Wailea with the right expectations, you wonâ€™t be disappointed. DO expect to pay $25.00 for a few minutes of Internet usage in the business center. DO expect to spend at least $50.00 per person for dinner. DO expect beautifully lavish beaches, artwork, and public facilities as well as the best pools and spa in all of Hawaii. DO expect only average to above average rooms and service. DO expect to pay $12.00 for a pina colada. DO expect a mandatory 21% gratuity AND service charge on room service orders. Finally, DO expect to see a lot of families and younger people whose clothes, behavior, and mannerisms; I am sure; will cause you to wonder how they can afford to spend $500-$1000/night on a hotel room. If you think that spending $500/night on a hotel room is enough to isolate you from kids and seemingly middle-class travelers...you will be disappointed. The Grand Wailea is truly a family-oriented place; as long as I am traveling with children, I wouldnâ€™t consider staying anywhere else. If traveling with just a significant other, however, I would probably try the more formal and polished atmosphere at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, see and be seen when money's no object”
Reviews.Author: Chiqui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over the top. The rooms are good sized but not enormous. It would take about 10 minutes and two elevators to get from our room to the pool, so we had to think about whether we really needed to go from the pool back to the room for that little something we'd forgotten. This is important to keep in mind if you have a disability or difficulty walking great distances. Pros: Vast and beautiful grounds, many pools, waterslides and other water features to keep the kiddies entertained. You never really feel crowded though the complex is very large. There's a tiny chapel for weddings or vow renewals. A separate, adults-only pool allows you to escape the kiddie-generated noise and activity. The high prices keep out the frat boys and graduation celebrators. The clientele seemed to be mostly families. Activities. Just a few: fish feeding (not to be missed, kids loved it), garden tour, free yoga though you pay for other gym classes, a lovely but pricey spa, squash court. This place has everything and you'd need weeks to really take advantage of all it has to offer. Surroundings: Wailea is not as built up as other parts of this side of the island. There are some great isolated beaches a few minutes' drive away, and turtles off the hotel beach. A very quiet area, no traffic or partying noise. It seemed that all rooms may be ocean-view, though I can't be sure. Cons: Extremely expensive and you're reminded of it constantly. The mini-fridges in the rooms are sealed shut, if you break the seal you have to pay, so there's no way to store drinks or food. A small bottle of water in the room costs over $6. Apart from very high food prices, there are daily resort fees, parking fees, gym class fees, cabana fees, etc. You really feel that at every turn they're squeezing the last drop out of you, which is not conducive to relaxing while on vacation. Apart from the hotels' boutiques, it's a 15-minute walk to the closest shops, which are in an upscale mall. If you need anything you'll pay through the nose there too. You must have a car to be able to go into Kihei to a grocery store if you need anything or to eat anywhere outside a hotel or the mall, which only has expensive restaurants. The hotel is very large and service is anonymous -- cheerful but not excellent. Because it is so big, things like valet parking can take a while. They do a good job at not letting you feel crowded, but this is not the place for anyone looking for personalized service or an intimate hideaway. There is a great deal of seeing and be seening and networking around the pool. The kids' pools and waterslides are like a water park. Four Seasons is a short walk away, we ate there twice and it had a more discreet feel. The Grand Wailea is flash, while the Four Seasons seemed more sedate, though I didn't see the rooms. The Grand Wailea does a good job considering how huge it is, but it is definitely for people for whom money is no object and who like their hotels on a big scale.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: chenson
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stop on a 14 day vacation. The hotel was very nice, the room was average and could have been a little nicer for a $500/nt hotel. Your obviously paying for the water slides and the ocean view. The bathroom was spacious, only one sink and the shower looked like it needed repare. Room cleaning was only top serfice. Our shower floor/glass walls were not cleaned well. When I arrived there was hair all over the floor of the bathroom. The resort was large, the workout faciltiy was 3 rooms - very nice. The food was good and the beach was quite large, the water was a little rough you would definitely have to watch kids. All in all, nice, spacious, good food, nice pools, nice beach - but dont over pay if you dont have too!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific - Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Tara14
Reviews.Content: Based on the negative reviews on Tripadvisor only planned to stay a couple of nights at the Grand Wailea as thought there would be too many children and the rooms would not be that nice. The bad reviews were simply wrong. Stayed at the Grand Wailea the Saturday after Thanksgiving for 2 nights and then was supposed to stay at the Four Seasons for six nights. We checked out of our room and went to the Four Seasons to check in but when we were brought to our "Prime Ocean View Room" we were very disappointed. After looking at several rooms at the 4S and not being happy, I called the Grand Wailea and asked if we could be put back in our Deluxe Ocean View Room, 9034, for the rest of our stay, another 6 nights and we were accommodated. I am so glad they did. We were on the 9th floor of the Wailea Wing at the Grand Wailea and the room and view were spectacular. Ocean, mountain and resort views from way up. What turned out to be really nice was our lanai didn't get the hot sun directly on it during the day and was always comfortable for reading and relaxing at any time day or night. What I also loved about the room was that the bed, a king bed in our room, faced the lanai and ocean so that when you opened the doors in the morning you could sit in bed and look directly at the ocean and the view and it was magnificent. That is one of the things I did not like about the 4S. Our "prime" ocean view room had a bed that faced the TV and the entry to the bathroom. You had to sit up and crane your neck to the side to even see the view and really only could enjoy the view if you were on the lanai. Once on the lanai the view was spectacular but I didn't plan on sitting out there all the time. I also found the room to be dated. Our room at the Grand Wailea was not musty as others have written but was terrific. It was right around the corner from the elevator and very convenient. The resort was terrific. Everyone was very helpful. We had no issues about lots of kids but also spent most of our time at the adult pool and rented a cabana. It is an added expense of $150 a day but worth it. You can typically have 2 chairs outside the cabana to sit in the sun and then use the cabana to just relax, read, nap and take it easy while enjoying a beautiful, relaxing view of the ocean. You can reserve a cabana but typically cannot reserve one specific cabana although all at the adult pool seem to have a great view. I think we had cabana K. You get lots of water and a fruit plate during the day. People have complained on this site that the additional charge for the cabana was annoying and was included at the 4S and not extra. While that may be true you also have to figure in that a comparable room at the 4S is also more expensive. I do agree that the resort fee per day is a bit much as well as valet parking, but that now is also a cost at the 4S as well. The Grand Wailea spa was also one of the best I have been to and I have been to a number of spas. The waiting area on the lanai has chaise lounges looking right through the fountains to the ocean. It's beautiful to relax there while waiting for a treatment or even afterwards. We had the romantic interlude with a sandlewood wrap, bath and then massage which was icing on the cake after enjoying the terme hydrotherapy (several baths you can enjoy beforehand, where you can also use steam and sauna and they give you a complimentary scrub before your treatment - you can spend one hour there before any treatment). The spa at the Grand Wailea is one that absolutely should not be missed. I also enjoyed the food, found Humu's to be very nice and the Molokini Bistro also nice. Kincha was also nice. Did not like Cafe Kula but did enjoy the breakfast buffet or off the menu and the view from that restuarant is also excellent. Room service was good. Was the food spectacular, probably not but it was very good. The resort is very large and so you do a lot of walking. You can go off the resort to eat, can walk to the four seasons along the beach and go to spago's which we found very nice. The prices in the stores were also good. We had seen a pair of Tommy Bahama swim trunks in Lahaina marked way up. The store at the Grand Wailea had the same trunks at their normal price, much lower than Lahaina. I also bought a bathing suit at the hotel when mine tore that was also reasonably priced. I did have a dispute regarding our bill at the time of checkout which soured the experience somewhat but I was contacted by a manager who resolved the situation to my satisfaction which was greatly appreciated. We had no problems with the valet and used our car to go to Lahaina to see Annabelle and Warren's which I did not enjoy the appetizer/drink thing beforehand. Very boring. If you go at all, only go to the magic show which is simply what it is, a magic show......Loved the Festival at Lele, good food and great show but also booked really early and had a front row table right in front of the stage.... Ali'i Nui for snorkeling is a must. Great catamaran that is not too crowded. As we left, saw one of the more touristy boats just jammed with people. Yes, we paid a little more to be on the Ali'i Nuii but when you spend hours on the boat, what is another 30-60 dollars for 2 people for more room and better service. Lastly, if go to the Big Island, that Four Seasons, unlike Maui, was absolutely superb and I would recommend that as well, you will not be disappointed. All in all, I'd recommend the Grand Wailea Resort very highly and would recommend a non-smoking deluxe ocean view room which we had on a higher floor. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an amazing stay at the Four seasons for 3 nights, my boyfriend and I decided to give the Grand Wailea a try for a night on Dec. 18th for a change of scenery...big mistake. I specifically asked that we not be given a room facing a parking lot or the construction across the street when I made the reservation however, that's exactly what they gave us and had the nerve to call this a mountain view...it was directly over the parking lot! When I complained they did nothing. We could also hear the construction going on across the street in the room. The grounds are huge and interesting to walk through but the carnival like atmosphere created by what seemed like a hundred kids running around didn't make for a great stay. This resort is best for families and is not recommended for childless couples looking for a quiet/ romantic vacation. PS. don't expect the same service as the FS..not even close!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: The_Stig
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of visiting the Grand Wailea in early December of 2005, and to call it a revelation would be an understatement. I have been fortunate enough to stay at some excellent island hotels in my lifetime, but the Grand Wailea stands head and shoulders above the others. This hotel had everything that I could have wanted in a beachfront hotel. After a long day of travel, we were greeted by cheerful attendants that leid us as bellmen wisked away our luggage. The front desk was also quite welcome- upgrading us to a deluxe garden room along a quiet wing of the hotel. As the bellman took us to our room, he gave us a great tour of the hotel and we took in the grounds as best we could in the middle of the night. Our room was fantastic, with a huge terrace and an amazing bathroom with whirlpool and stall shower. They say garden view, but in a rare bit of humility (a rare thing in the hotel business), this room had garden, ocean and mountain views. In the morning, we paroused the grounds and my suspicions were confirmed- the inky darkness that we looked out on the previous night was a paradise come morning. I really enjoyed this hotel because of the SCOPE of the hotel. It is a large hotel, but never did we feel cramped or inindated with noise. It had cuisine ranging from a simple breakfast place to get pastries to fine dining- it had pool areas for families AND adults. This hotel had taken into consideration EVERYONE that visited it. Whether you wanted a $10 or a $40 breakfast, whether you wanted to play in the family pool on the slide complex (do it at least once, its that impressive) or slip into the quiet hibiscus pool with a drink and a private cabane waiting for you when you get out, this place was perfect. *****- a wonderful combination in a package that doesnt overwhelm, the Grand Wailea is a keeper, and should be higher on this list of Maui's best hotels. A couple of tips: the water slides close 5pm and there is no shuttle service to anything on the island, so seriously consider renting a car if you wish to leave hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTripper
Reviews.Content: We loved it. We stayed 4 nights in December and were apprehensive after reading all the reviews and were torn between the Kei Lani, 4 Seasons but the Wailea was a little more reasonable price wise. The resort is very grand/large and it was a "haul" from our room to the adult pool everyday. A 10 minute brisk walk each way, so you really made sure you brought everything you needed. We ate at Humuhumu and loved it, it was our anniversary and upon check in the front desk gave us a certificate for a free bottle of champagne at any resort restaurant. Valued per the menu at $45. We had lobster bisque and seared tuna and shrimp and loved it all. The resort was 40% occupied at our time of stay Dec 11-15 so we got great service and great seats - we could see all the fish in the lagoon swimming around. There is definitely pool chair anxiety at the adult pool which is where we camped daily. People come out at 7:00 am claim chairs to show up at 12:00 and after. The resort should remove belongings and let others use chairs that are "saved". I happen to get down early at 8:00 and read and hang out but I felt for those who were chairless and had to go to another pool because of hogs. The room was nice, nothing really fabulous but nice. The spa was absolutely fabulous and I would definitely recommend it. I was just at the Peninsula in downtown Chicago which paled in comparison to this grand place and the most amazing sports massage by Joette from Glen Ellyn, IL. The baths and hot tubs are great and very relaxing. We did have great pool service daily, Jaimie was terrific. Perhaps they only have service at the adult pool, not sure. We did go wandering to the kids pool and spend a couple hours everyday in the slides and lazy river. Water is a great temp and it is a lot of fun. The grotto bar in the pool is the best, Richard the bartender has good tips on meals and things to do. We took the helicoper ride via Sunshine Co ($600) for the two of us and well worth it. Could see Hana and parts of Maui you cannot travel to easily on foot. Great waterfalls and views. Go early in the morning though as it is clearer and wear dark shirt as the glare of your shirt will mess up photos. It is an addt upgrade to get front row (next to pilot) we didn't but wish we did. Kind of a once in a lifetime thing...at least for us. We did get upgraded from Mountain view to Garden room upon request at check in. I think we would have been really bummed with Mountain as it looks like townhouses are going up and it would be loud. Our room was super quiet and was concerned initally after reading reviews that the tile hallways were loud with wheelie bags day and night. Our hall was carpeted and we never heard anyone at all. The grounds are fabulous and we did venture to the Kei Lani and the 4 seasons and I would really be freaked at the limited chairs at the 4 seasons, people were on top of their neighbor so to speak, all yapping on phones....nightmare if you ask me. I think Kei Lani and Grand at least if you wanted more privacy the grounds allowed for it, many folks had complete privacy on the lawns overlooking the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At!!”
Reviews.Author: heras
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some pretty fancy hotels in my time (Waldorf, the Montage, Princeville, etc.), but this one takes the cake! I'm a frequest visitor to Maui (twice a year or so) and ususally stay at the Hyatt over on Kaanapali. This time I decided to split my time and try the Grand Wailea out and I think I found my new home in Maui. Pros: Grounds are immaculate. Everything is well kept and the lobby is gorgeous. The pool is awesome! Almost makes you forget about the beach! (but see below). The rooms were nice as well (but see below again). Staff was awesome as I was upgraded to a full ocean view without charge---of course I went during a slow week so dont think this is common. The Spa was amazing!! We used the gym first (free) and then got a couples massage. Never been to a spa before so maybe I'm not the best person to be rendering an opinion as to the spa, but I thought it was great. Cons: The rooms are nice, but are not what you'd expect for paying $450+ a night. Yes its clean, but nothing fancy. You dont walk in and say "whoa!" Bathroom was nice, but again the tile looks dated. The poolside service is obsolete. If you dont have the prime seating, you'll get ignored. We had to serve ourselves. They need the lounge chairs at the Princeville were you raise a flag when you need service. While I loved the pool, I could see how it would get annoying to adults and people who want to unwind. I was there during the off-season and the pool was swarmed with kids. I didnt care though, but some people might. Also, the pool got pretty crowded and so I can only imagine what its like during xmas and summer. The price of everything is obvioulsy high and you shouldnt be surprised given the fact that 1) you're in maui and 2) you're at the GW. If you can afford to stay here, you probably can afford an $8 oreo shake. Lastly, while we didnt dine at the restaurants much, we did have the breakfast buffet. Sadly, it stinks. The food is ok and the selection is mediocre, but what was awful was the fact that its an open air restaurant meaning bugs are flying around. That means that anything that wasnt covered at the buffet had flies on it. I expected more from a 5 star hotel than seeing flies on the fruit, the lox and everything else. So while it seems like the cons outnumber the pros, its only because people care more about the cons then the positives. I'll definitely stay here again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Vacation Resort (Detailed Review)”
Reviews.Author: folsomplanner
Reviews.Content: Aloha, My family (Mom, Dad, 8 yr old, and 4 yr old) and I just returned from a one week (December 3rd through 10th) stay at the Grand Wailea with our neighbors. We have previously stayed at the Four Seasons Wailea so we had a pretty good perspective on what to expect. Overall, we had a great time at the Grand Wailea and it is an excellent resort in a fantasic location on Maui. I have given a more in depth review below for those planning on a vacation here. Resort Grounds/Setting: The word "Grand" is appropriate for this resort, the resort is very large and spread out, which is nice considering there are over 800 guest rooms. The lobby area has fantastic artwork and is open and airy, allowing the ocean breezes to flow through. Bring your walking shoes, it does take some time to walk from your room to the main lobby, or to the pool, or to the beach, or to dine. The grounds are very well kept, considering the scale of the resort. The pool area is excellent, especially for children. There are six or seven pool areas you can set up camp and let the kids play. The "Water Elevator" is a little overblown, and cost 1.2 million dollars to build as they will tell you everytime you go in it. The beach in front of the Grand Wailea is one of the best on Maui, or in Hawaii in my opinion. Very fine sand, very few rocks or seaweed, big enough waves to boggie board but not too large to scare the children. Rooms: We had a room on the third floor of the southernmost wing (Cheap Rooms) of the hotel. We had a nice view of the mountains and the Four Seasons Resort to the south. The cheap rooms at the Grand Wailea have a much better view than the cheap rooms at the Four Seasons by the way. The room was a good size (650 SF +/-) and had a decent sized outdoor balcony area. The decor and maintainance of the room was just adequate, it could have used some updating. Some of the wallpaper was peeling a bit, and some of the rug areas were worn. The bathroom was very large, a little smaller than the four seasons, the bathroom also could have used a little updating but was acceptable. Service: This service at the Grand Wailea is just ok, not bad, not great. My main comment here is that with a resort of this size, it it difficult to provide top quality service. In my opinion, they are understaffed, especially around the pool areas. I should note that the resort was very quiet when we were they, some of their staff mentioned that during Thanksgiving and Christmas the resort is a real zoo. So if the service is a little suspect when the resort is quiet, I can only imagine what it would be like when the resort is busy. On a service note, we visited the Four Seasons on a few occasions to shop, eat, etc, and the service was perfect. Food: Food and dining is the one area where I feel the Grand Wailea needs to improve. We had meals at Bistro Molikini, Cafe Kula, and Humuhumu...The Bistro Molikini is a nice place for lunch, the good was pretty good and the atmosphere was nice. Cafe Kula was a good place to pick up snacks and nick-nacks, more of a cafe type setting. Humumum... was a disaster, the setting is nice with a pond surrounding the restaraunt, but the service and the food were poor. The place was absolutely dead at night, very little activity. A resort of this size needs to focus more on dining options for its guests. We did dine out at some nice places including Ruth's, Tommy Bahamas, Spago, Roys, and Ferraros, but none of these are on the hotel grounds. Roy's in Kehei at the Safeway Shopping Center is about a ten minute drive from the Grand Wailea. Roys is a top notch restaraunt and a must eat-at place everytime we visist, excellent service and awesome food. Ruth Steak House in the Wailea Shops was good, a little formal for Maui, but good food. Tommy Bahamas was a nice setting, good food, and live music at night. Spago at the Four Seasons was one of the best meals I have ever had, worth the money. Ferarros in the Four Seasons provides a nice outdoor setting for dinner, good quality food as well. Summary: We would stay at the Grand Wailea again, great place for families and those who love pools. The beach cannot be beat. Best Feature: The beach and the pools Worst Feature: Lack of good restaraunts Best Food: Spago at the Four Seasons Comparison: If I were traveling without children, I would stay at the Four Seasons without a doubt, much more intimate resort with incredible service. For children, the Grand Wailea wins hands down because of the pools and childrens program. Another tip, get a babysitter through the hotel, there are very affordable and allow the parents to get out and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is Grand!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Grand Wailea. Stayed from Dec 3-10th. Upgraded to Napua Tower club level. The hotel is amazing. We do not have children either, but enjoyed the pool area very much. Lazy river, slides, and rope swing. The hotel staff was great, the Humu resturant was great, and the Spa is amazing. After reading all the postings on this website prior to visiting I was considering changing our reservations to the Four Seasons, but ended up staying with the Grand Wailea and was soo pleased I did. We went to Spago's for dinner and it was nice, Ferraro's for lunch offered poor service, and Nick's Fishouse in the Kia Lani Fairmont was by far the best. Down fall of the Grand Wailea there is no pool service (the Ritz Kapalua and Four Seasons Maui do!) but there is a swim up bar for an afternoon beverage. Most of the postings on this site are about the cost of the trip. If you are looking for a economical trip, don't go to Wailea...or Maui for that..but if you are looking for a great time in a beautiful place the Grand Wailea is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh my god,I love this hotel!! My cousins and I went here with a few of our relatives and my cousins and I LOVED IT! It's sophisticated enough for the adults and it's fun for the kids at the same time,and the employees are so friendly!And the adults can have fun besides the kids! I always go here for the winter break and I NEVER want to leave!The Grand Wailea is one of the best hotels around!At least to me it is!! o.-

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mogulman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea from Nov. 12-17. It was one of the best vacation hotel stays we have ever had. My 4 year old loved the pools. Food and sunset at the humuhumunukunukua'apua restaurant was very good. Housekeeping came in a serviced our room 2-3 times/day. We got a great rate on Hotwire (<$300). Only bad thing was that restaurants in the hotel were very expensive (Maui in general was expensive but Grand Wailea was more expensive). Also, when we checked-in they tried to charge us some kind of $20/day fee for newspaper, parking, high-speed access, phone, etc. This seems like a ripoff. I was able to get out of paying this.

Reviews.Title: “Extra friends not welcome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to arrive at the Grand Wailea. The bellman and people at check-in were very nice. Our room was not ready, so we walked around and were amazed at the grounds size and beauty. Once our room became available we were also surprised and amazed at the amount of hair and ants on our bathroom floor. We started to clean up the bathroom, but since we were paying $300.00 a night we decided to call housekeeping to do it. Once housekeeping came up, they cleaned the floor with a couple of washcloths. Now I'm no expert, and possibly someone else had the vacuum, but it may of been nice to actually use the vacuum since the washcloth did not do the trick. We should also say they were kind enough to upgrade us when we arrived. However, if I had a choice I would just as soon have the room I paid for than the room with extra amenities.(i.e. see hair and ants above) Not to sound totally down on our Maui trip, on day 4 we really felt that we finally did get a clean room. However, I am not sure they are affilated with the Four Seasons. To be completely honest- nice resort, bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Grand Wailea is a great hotel. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms need some updating but kept very clean with every amenity. The resort fee includes bike rental and there is a nice bike path. The beach is awesome and provides a good breeze for sunbathing. One note - the birds in the resort area are singing at 5 am - bring some earplugs so you can get some sleep. I was as a little disappointed with the food in South Maui but Spago & Sorrento's were THE BEST ($150 for 2 with 2 drinks)!! I always seem to forget how expensive Maui is. The prices of drinks, food, snacks is ridiculous at the resort so some advice - stop at Costco and load up on drinks and snacks. The lobby bar charges $7 for a Heinken - again stop at Costo!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Grad Wailea”
Reviews.Author: diovan
Reviews.Content: This was agreat hotel. I loved the pools (waterpark). With a 4 yera old I can not imagine where else we would have had as much fun. Highly recommend it. Only a bit expensive but worthed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from six nights at the Grand Wailea and couldn't be happier with our stay. The best aspects of the hotel were the great staff, stunning grounds, and awesome spa. We found the staff to be the upmost professional and sincerely friendly of any hotel we've stayed at - they really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate and located right on stunning Wailea beach. We spent a morning at the spa, with a three-hour baths/massage/facial combo, and have never felt more relaxed. The next-door Shops at Wailea offer shopping and restaurants, and the hotel is near some of Maui's best beaches and snorkeling. We really felt we'd landed in a tropical paradise at the Grand Wailea. The only complaints we had were the following: The beds and pillows are poor quality, just way to soft for us to get a comfortable night's sleep. The mattress was in fact so soft that I was tempted to sleep on the floor one night. We were suprised to find this at a hotel of this cost. There is not much choice in dining. We found the sushi restaurant, breakfast buffet and pool bar to be good quality (waitstaff at all were awesome!), but in terms of "fine dining" the hotel is a distant second to the next door Four Seasons (Spago there is a must if you're in Wailea!) Humu was really a disappointment. We waited 15 minutes for our table, even with a reservation, and ended up leaving without eating due to the slow service. Lastly, and this is not the hotel's fault, there were way too many noisy kids everywhere. Fortunately there is an adults-only pool area that people respected, but we had a hard time escaping very loud, poorly behaved children in other parts of the hotel. Again, the waitstaff at restaurants were very gracious and seated us as far from noisy kids as possible. We found hotels at Kaanapali, and the Four Seasons, to be more adult oriented. All in all, we loved the Grand Wailea - it's in a beautiful location, and with the Shops at Wailea and other nearby hotels and beaches, offers a great variety of activities and dining on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools!”
Reviews.Author: daveWoodlandHills
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got from spending two nights at this hotel. We reserved a room on the top floor in the conceierge level. The room was average with a nice size balcony. A continental breakfast and light snacks in the evening along with drinks were part of the deal. Nothing too special about breakfast, but fulfilling. The evening drinks were something much more enjoyable. The hotel is very large and the landscaping is breathtaking! We spent most of our time at the pool which can not be missed. Pool service was almost non-existant. The staff were all friendly, but were average.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: JLPBergenCounty_NJ
Reviews.Content: While I've never felt compelled to review a hotel before, I felt the the expectation of this hotel was far enough from the reality that I had to warn potential visitors. First of all, the room that we received was dingy, in major need of an update, and an enormous disappointment in general. I went downstairs to request an upgrade and they did accommodate us with a room in the concierge tower. The bellhop who took our luggage from the old room to the new explained to us that the room was handicapped accesible and in the area that had not yet been renovated. I got the strong feeling that they try to pass this section of rooms off to people who might otherwise not complain and just accept it - much like a bad table in a restaurant. While the new room was an improvement, it was still not what I expected from this hotel. The room was merely average at this point as far as I was concerned. The next thing that struck me was the clientele. Not a refined bunch to say the least. This was surprisingly a very tatooed, twenty-something, roudy type of crowd. Very small on manners and big on implants. Looked more like spring break in Fort Lauderdale. Staff not too polished either. Last complaint is the food. Mediocre at best. We did have a nice (not spectacular) dinner, however at Humu. If I were to do it again, we would stay at the Four Seasons. Much smaller and less impressive grounds (the reason we chose not to stay there in the first place), but much more refined clientele and staff. More in line with what we were anticipating from Grand Wailea. The beach has nothing on Kannapali - where we went next. Very happy that we only had two nights at Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: George_Plano
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Our stay was Oct 1-7. Bellman said it was Â¾ full, but seemed less than that, no crowds, no elevator waiting, but to claim prime chairs under the few (free) palm umbrellas around the pool we headed down at 7am. Enormous property, be prepared for lots of walking. We found staff attentive and cheerful (unlike other reviewers), maybe because off-season. Very tropical, lush grounds, maybe not quite at the standards of Hyatt and 4 Seasons. Elegant chapel with beautiful stained glass, many wedding parties. Our weather was virtually the same every day; sunny mornings, clouding up in the afternoon, no rain, clearing before sunset, around 82-85 F high, although my car registered 90-92 on drives inland, with refreshing light winds. The pool complex is all its cracked up to be. Two big water slides, a rapids section and 4 short slidesâ€¦water elevator good for a try or two- more of a curiosity than a rideâ€¦lots of little kids, especially in the lazy river sectionâ€¦the canyon pool, which is enormous, was virtually deserted, as was the adult only poolâ€¦swim up bar is in a cave, a must do, thereâ€™s even warm water piped in along the submerged stools. Overall, kids rated it better than the Hyatt Kauai and Maui pools, which is high praise. Only complaint- pretty good at taking drink/lunch orders, but slow in picking up empties/trash/wet towels, messy by 2pm. The wide sandy beach is steps from the pool area, very clean with light to moderate surf for boogey boardingâ€¦enough for my teens (15, 17); although they found the beach in front of the Fairmont (12-15 minute walk south on the picturesque walkway) had more powerful wavesâ€¦good snorkeling along the rocks at the edges of the beach. I found the water very clear, except where waves crashed. For walkers, the beachside walkway extends at least as far north past the Marriot and Renaissance. Somehow we got upgraded to concierge level- great continental breakfast - also had 1 hot item each day- plus happy hour (5-7pm) including hot and cold snacks, all complimentary. More than made up for the annoying daily $18 resort fee, $12 valet parking, and $30 rollaway fee. Hamuâ€™ restaurant is very romantic setting, food good, not great (fish overcooked); Kincha- Japanese- was very good, sushi excellent. Next door at the 4 Seasons , Ferraroâ€™s had excellent food and views of sunset with a very reasonably priced (Italian) wine list. Wailea Shopping center next door has variety of high end shops (think Gucci), beachwear, two general stores, ice cream and restaurants. Nice break from the beach. Thereâ€™s a new 5 story condo complex that blocks the oceanview the restaurants in the center used to enjoy. We tried Longhiâ€™s (where the waitress said condos were priced in the millions and Oprah bought the whole top floor- may not be true but believable for the views of Molokini and Lanai) and Tommy Bahamaâ€™s for lunch, food was excellent. Overall, excellent, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “We have no complaints (like many others have had)”
Reviews.Author: EP
Reviews.Content: I had read quite a bit here before booking our Maui hotels. I'm glad we gave the Grand Wailea a try. We loved it! (My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights, with no kids.) Perhaps because it was the first week of September, but we sure didn't see (or hear!) gobs of screaming kids while we were there. Not did we find the pool area dirty when we went, which was always mid to late afternoon. Had no problem finding lounge chairs to use, either. As far as that went, the biggest problem was deciding just WHICH part of the pool area we wanted to lounge at that day! We found the grounds to be absolutely gorgeous. Such a beautiful place to stroll around! They keep it wonderfully maintained. The hotel personel that we encountered were all friendly, and seemed happy to be there. The service was just fine. Always referred to us by name, as well. I've read so many complaints about being 'nickeled and dimed' the whole time they were there. We didn't seem to have that experience, either. As I said, perhaps the timing was particularly teriffic, because our experience at The Grand was grand! I'd go there again during the first week of September. However, because of all that I read here addressing so many concerns about the crowded aspect of the resort, I'm fairly certain that I wouldn't go during the peak times. We especially enjoyed our meals at sunset at the Humuhumu restaurant. Incredibley tasty food served there, in the most romantic atmosphere. (Gawd, I still dream of the meals we had there!) We travel extensively, and stay in some of the nicest accomadations that there are in each place we go. As far as beauty, location, and activities, The Grand Wailea is one of them!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is Grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 great nights at the Grand beginning Aug 17. This was our third trip to the hotel, and we plan to go back every year as long our two daughters insist on it. With this in mind, we became members this year which made it affordable to stay in the Napua Tower which we highly recommend. The rooms are slightly larger than the standard rooms and afford a mixed garden and ocean view. A good breakfast buffet and drinks plus great pupus in the afternoon are complimentary. When these benies are factored in, we thought we got great value for the $$ expended. Becoming a member requires a $2500 refundable deposit plus a $100+ annual fee, but in return all rooms are 50% off the rack rate. In addition, we received a $300 resort credit which can be used for any voluntary charges at the hotel. Jill Sullivan, the membership director, also sent us a bottle of champagne and food goodies to welcome us as members. We think of the Grand as having three components--a beautiful lobby and grounds, an elegant and spacious adult pool area, and a noisy and crowded family pool/water slide/beach area. If you don't have kids, avoid the later and you will have a great time. If you have kids, or are a kid at heart, you're going to have a great time in the family area. This is where we camped out every day. Unlike others, we had good pool service for lunch and drinks. The key here is to set up at the lower pool by the pool grill where the waiters seem to make more frequent rounds. The main problem we encountered at the pool was messy, verging on filthy, conditions by the middle of the afternoon. Many guests of the hotel seem to have the attitude that for the prices they are paying, they shouldn't have to lift a finger. Consequently, the cleanup staff seems inadequate to keep up with the trash and used towels on vacant lounge chairs. Otherwise, service at the Grand was excellent, from check-in, to the bellhop, to room service and maid service. Our room was clean and nicely appointed with a huge closet and super roomy bathroom. One minor glitch at check-in--our room wasn't readt at check-in time, but the staff readily accomodated our request for a "transit room" to change into swimsuits so we could go to the pools while we waited. We were called on our cell phone as soon as the room was ready. In summary, if you are selective in how you use the Grand, you will have a wonderful time in a beautiful facility.

Reviews.Title: “Completely overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Maui today and I thought I would write a review about this resort since there is so much "Hype" about it. It does not live up to any of it. I stayed at several different hotels on the island and loved the western side of Maui, the main town, Lahaina, is there. There are lots of shops on front street in Lahaina, and surfing conditions are good here. If I was to stay here again, I would stay at Kapalua Bay Resort, the Hyatt, or the Ritz. All of the beaches are beautiful here, especially Kapalua Bay. On the Southern side of the island, where the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons are, it is over an hour drive just to get to Lahaina(which is where you will be going every day for shopping, dining, prettier beaches, and all attractions. The beach in this area is not near as pristine. The water is kind of, well...murky! I was so dissapointed at the Grand Wailea Resort. It reminds me of a water park( a bad one). There are so many white lawn chairs layed out all over the place, it was overcast every day I was there. And I didn't go all the way to Maui for a rope swing and 2 slides. On their web site, they make it sound so "Grand" when the whole thing consisted of 2 small slides, 1 lazy river, a water elevator I never got to ride on because the line of kids was so long, and murky water. The rooms were mediocre at best, and for $600/night, this is ridiculous! Don't stay here. The western part of the island is breathtaking! Stay in the Lahaina, Kapalua, Kaanapali area and you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby and Ignorant Workers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel to visit Tsunami and were dressed for it. After finding no 'self' parking, we tried valet. They took our car and parked it. We went inside to Tsunami, but we were turned away because my husband was wearing Tiva's, but otherwise was dressed nicely. Then, a few days later, we call ahead to clear our 'dress code' attire. This was on a weekday. We weren't aware it was closed every day except Fri/Sat. The person confirmed that what we were wearing was appropriate (over the phone) and said NOTHING about it being closed that night. We arrived to find no valet parking for the club, so we went to the hotel valet and were told that Tsunami was closed. There was no "I'm very sorry that the person you spoke to didn't tell you" or anything like that. He just walked away. We initially had booked this place for our honeymoon, but after reading the reviews about the staff, the management, the snobbiness, etc., we are so happy we cancelled in time. Wouldn't ever go there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't fall for the hype!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our honeymoon on Maui. We stayed at the Grand Wailea, and it was WRETCHED! I was truly astonished at the rude staff, the absurd prices, and my personal favorite.... the screaming kids outside of our door at 7:00 a.m. (every morning) I complained to the front desk three different times, and was met with apathy or worse. There is an adults only area that was overrun with smoking teenage girls, and mommies thinking it was very cute to watch their children swim the distance of the pool splashing everyone in sight. Yes, I realize it is a swimming pool, but come on..... There is a huge area for the kids to play to their hearts content. We asked security to remedy the situation and were once again given the disdainful look. I would highly recommend to anyone considering this hotel to NOT DO IT! I could spend all night speaking to the ridiculous policies and terrible service, but you get the point. On a closing note just for those of you who are still considering it, the cost of a bottle of water is 7.95. I swear! ps we had fabulous service at the Four Seasons that is located right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “OK....NICE..BUT NOT WHAT SOME MIGHT EXPECT!”
Reviews.Author: CTSLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for 7 nights in late August. The Hotel is OK...the service is just OK....it is a major convention hotel......you are able to obtain upgraded accomodations for 50% off rack (full) rates if you join their membership club at $2500. My son (7) enjoyed the pool for the first 4 days...then it kind of got old. Don't get me wrong...the grounds are very nice...the pool is fantastic for kids....but seriously....if you want a chair with a mix of shade and sun...you had better have it scouted out before 7am or you are in the sun for the day. Lounges were all taken by 830am. Service is so-so. I guess it is what you expect from a mega hotel. I have stayed at the four seasons....there is no comparison. If you are staying here....stay here for the kids...maybe a few nights...then move on...you'll save yourself some $$$ and you can enjoy other fine properties on this island (four seasons) or other islands for the same price or less. So...all in all...on a scale of 1-10, i'd give the Grand Wailea a 4 1/2. It's really...just OK...and I don't think worth the $$$. P.S. If you stay here...budget an additional $300-400 day for all of the extra things that you will be nickle and dimed for.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to the Grand Wailea for our honeymoon. Not sure if it is the best place for a honeymoon. The reason I say that is because of the crowds of families and kids. They do have an adult pool, but chairs are hard to come by especially after 12noon. We ended up hanging down at the beach, which seemed to be less crowded and more serene. The restaurants are ok, but the great part about the GW is you are just down the Beach Path from the Fairmont and 4 Seasons, which both have good restaurants. I would suggest this place for families in a heartbeat, but if you are looking for a more tranquil restful place, I would recommend the 4 Seasons next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose1414
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our family vacation to the Grand. First time staying there- we joined the membership beforehand. First the good- incredible grounds, pools and beach. My 10 year old had a blast for the first 3 days in the pools and slides. Beach was great for morning snorkeling and afternoon boogeyboarding. Service was great everywhere- no complaints there. We knew going in that we would be gouged everywhere so were not surprised by all the extra fees-personally I find it tacky that they nickel and dime you to death, but once again- not a surprise. Was kind of torqued when we tried to check in at 3:30 pm and our room wasn't ready- we had stopped at a grocery store and bought milk and some breakfast snacks- they were good at putting it in a fridge for us while we waited, but our room wasn't ready till 4:30- had an unhappy 10 year old, wife with baby by this time. We were scheduled to stay 7 nights- we left after 5. Not the Grands fault-traveling with an infant doesn't make for a relaxing vacation. My 10 year old was bored by the 4th day- he can only go down the slides so many times. We will come back, just think it is perfect for a 4 days- anymore and it gets old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wailea from 7/21 to 7/27. The beaches are beautiful, the pool is great and our 3 kids had a blast. Lots of water slides and sandy beach area. Is everything expensive here, of course it's a 5 star resort in Maui. The rooms definitely need a little maintenance as well as the corridors. Chipping paint in rooms and dirty carpet in corridors. The spa is awesome but a little overpriced as expected. It was crowded at the pool. All the cabanas were already reserved for our entire stay so we got up at the crack of dawn (6 am) to get one of the few umbrellas by the pool so my 2 year old would not fry. Four Seasons next door has a Spago that has excellent food and wine. The four seasons breakfast buffet was far superior to GW. Customer service was great. We originally booked for only three nights and three nights at the Hyatt Regency. When we drove to Hyatt and saw how crowded and tiny the pool area was we called back the GW and asked them if they had a room for us for another three nights. They were fully booked and only had one suite in Napua tower for 1,100 dollars a night. We took it but when we got back to the hotel it was only available for one night so the second day we would have to move to a Molokini suite which had an incredible ocean view (1200 sq ft) for the inconvenice they would cut the nightly rate in half. GREAT we paid $650 the first 3 nights just for a garden view room with two double beds. What can I say they handled the situation the way you expect for a luxury resort. Would we come here again, definitely. When the kids get bigger we will stay at the Four Seasons instead but just not anything for the kids there as far as the pool goes.

Reviews.Title: “I was ready to go home at the end of the week...”
Reviews.Author: kbiviano
Reviews.Content: We spent the second week of our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea (GW). Our first week was spent at the Hyatt in Kauai (AMAZING!). The week started out well (we were upgraded to a concierge level room in the Napua Tower...which meant free continental breakfast & apps in the evening). And the resort itself (and the grounds) is gorgeous. The room was spacious, but our 'ocean view' was a bit disappointing. We looked out at an angle, and had a lovely view of the construction next door. The concierge staff was kind enough to send someone to our room the first night there to decorate our room w/ orchids. It was quite nice actually. She also made all of our dinner reservations for the entire week upon our arrival. We ate at Humuhumunukunukuapua'a our first night there. The food was good; service was mixed (our bread & water server was excellent...his name was Eli). That is the only restaurant on-site we considered eating at however...menus at the other restaurants did nothing for us. By the third day or so, the wheels started coming off though. It had lightly rained, and the pool deck was soaked. I nearly fell at least a dozen times b/c the stone they used for the pool decking has to be the most slipperiest thing I've ever seen. People were sliding all over the place. Also, you just start to feel like they are nickel & dime-ing you at every turn. $40 for lunch at the pool for the 2 of us...when I only had a pepsi and my husband had a salad, a water, and a Pepsi. I was charged $10 to make a 4-minute call to Pizza Hut which is right down the street (supposedly 'long distance'???). I did fight them on this, and I think they could tell I was getting pissed, so they took it off the bill. Also, there are SO MANY families there...very few honeymooners. My husband & I love children so much, but it would have been nice to have a little peace and quiet around the adult pool. Also, I found many of these children (and quite often the parents as well) to be very spoiled and with an air of entitlement to them. It was so unappealing to see so much money wasted on bratty, unappreciative children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but going down-hill”
Reviews.Author: jeffmill94520
Reviews.Content: I've not only stayed at the Grand Wailea but I was also a member. I used to stay there almost every year but every time I went, the maintanence of the hotel seemed to be going more and more down-hill. Also, the water in the pools is not heated so if it's not really hot, it gets ridiculously cold. So cold that one year, not one person was in the pool during most of my stay!! The hotel is very beautiful but can get very crowded with conventions and then it becomes overly busy and soon your serene vacation is ruined with kids running around like maniacs. Also, one year, the valet damaged my rental car. Wailea is my favorite area on Maui because it stays dryer. I recommend staying at another hotel in the Wailea area and going over and visiting the Grand Wailea and see if it's for you for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay. I will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay at the GW. I had taken my family and booked two rooms in the Napua Tower. Service in the hotel and the Napua Tower were excellent. However, you can forget about ANY type of service around the pool area. Yes, the pools are the best. But if you don't mind fetching your own food and drinks, leaving your room by 8:00am to scout chairs and being packed liked sardines, this place is for you. Prior to arriving at the GW, we spent 4 days at the Hyatt Regency and had no problems getting chairs at ANY time of the day. Their service was far, far better. Next time in Wailea I will be at Four Seasons. I chose GW this time because of the pools. But I will not repeat because of the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a repeater”
Reviews.Author: Nicinann
Reviews.Content: My family and I , children 10 and 11 just got back from a 7 day stay at the Grand Wailea (nicked-named the "Grandiose" Wialea by my 10 year old). Great rooms, large bathrooms and our room had a patio that lead out to the pools. If you have kids ask for a room in the Lagoon Wing. Close to pools and beach. The water slide and pools are great, but he service is average. The hotel seems to be very understaffed. 10 minutes to get the car parked by the valet, 15 minutes to get checked-in. This seems excessive for a hotel that charges 500+ for a room. Took 3 calls to get our toilet repaired (they did have to replace it) and the valet crashed our rental car! But all that said the pools, beaches and grounds are beautiful. The slides and kids pool are a parents dream as the kids are occupied and having full the whole day. But if I didn't go with kids I would stay at the Four Seasons which looked much more sedate and just as beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Expected a much higher end clientele (or at least, higher end "looking" clientele. Sometimes felt we were at a Holiday Inn or some such hotel instead of a high end property. Nothing average about the prices, however. Hotel is spottily maintained and often floors are dirty; rooms are clean but tired looking. Walking around you would pass sloppily dressed individuals with poorly supervised kids. The girl at the pool activities desk told me to return the towels at the end of the day; I informed her that for > $900/night (for the Napua tower room) the staff could get the towels themselves. Smoking allowed at the pool despite almost every other lounge chair occupied by a child. Hotel has a rule that you are not allowed to claim lounge chairs which is ludicrous; eveyone does it. Cabanas are $200 /day and for that you are given a map as to it's location; no personal escort by a staff member. Complaints are endured by the staff but don't appear to be taken too seriously. Pool staff looks bored and un-interested; concierge staff is hit and miss as to the type of help and info you will get. Beach was beautiful; you get your own chairs and non one bothers you. Pools/water slide system, giving credit to the the hotel, were clean, considering the vast number of users. Saw a staff individual at the coffee shop mixing salad with her bare fingers. My daughter slipped on a marble stairway going to the ballroom (it was wet) and almost seriously injured herself. Staff did nothing after I informed them of the incident. If you want personalized, "customer comes first" attitude, with a high class, spotless environment, stay at the Four Season next door.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymooners!! Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: klvaile
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here enormously! In fact, we cannot wait to go back and tell others about it all the time. It was our perfect hawaiian experience. Even better than the Princeville on Kauai (very stuffy and snobby and UNfun). The room was beautiful with an awesome view, we had turndown service with a flower every night, they cleaned our bathroom and replaced our towels about twice a day. Our items were never touched and the valet service was fast and nice! The restaurants are a rip-off, BUT everyone has to try just one. The pool was amazing. There is an adult only pool (the hibiscus pool on all the postcard pictures) perfect for honeymooners or active, friendly adults, alike. The breakfast in the mornings was okay. It was good and the food changed everyday, but they didn't have anyone making special pancakes or french toast (that is sort of being spoiled though). Good jam on the tables. The beach is great. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING IN THE KIHEA AREA!!!!!! We went to Kihea every night - there is great night life there. The beaches are best in this area too, and there are NO TOURISTS from CRUISE SHIPS like on the western shore. WAILEA ROCKS! The whole lobby is open concept with marble floors. There is water and waterways throughout. The lush gardens and walkways are neat, filled with the sounds of waterfalls. THIS IS THE BEST EXPERIENCE WE EVER HAD! We paid for it, but it was well worth it 100%!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: davsuze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea for a family wedding. We had several rooms in the hotel and you can tell that at one time this was a four star hotel, but it is not at the moment. The grounds and the lobby are beautiful but there are problems with the rooms and the service. Our room had a smell of mildew and it wasn't until the third call to housekeeping that they really addressed the issue. There was never an offer of moving us and we had to indure cleaning the carpet and a carpet dryer and it still did not fix the problem. My sister had a plumbing problem in her room and they were slow to fix it and another person in our party had their room robbed. The staff in the spa and the bell staff were very nice. The staff in the food areas were slow and not always friendly. It seems that they are not spending the money for enough staff and for basic maintenance of the hotel. My sister's wedding in their chapel was beautiful, but that did not makeup for all of the other problems. I would never stay at this hotel again there are too many other nice ones to stay in in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A little taste of heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: BUTTERFLY9115
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Grand Wailea for 7 days and absolutely felt like royalty. From the moment we arrived, the staff was very professional and courteous, always referring to us by Mr. or Mrs. and our last name. The grounds are just beautiful, full of lush landscapes, vibrant art, statues, water, water and more water!!! Everywhere you look, there is water in some form, whether it be a waterfall or one of the beautiful pools. If you have young kids, stay on the ground floor near the pools. Near the pools is where the kids will want to be, and that's the best location if you want quick and easy access to the pools. We stayed near Humu Humu restaurant. The room's patios open up to the beautifully landscaped grounds. You can walk right out the patio sliding door and over to the pool area within minutes. We were in room 0052. I recommend a room numbered in the 0060's. They were even closer to the pool areas. Our boys are ages 4 and 10. There was plenty for both of them to do. They were never bored. They wanted to be at the pools from the time the waterslides opened, which is at 10:00 a.m., and they wanted to leave when the slides closed, which is at 6:00 p.m. I was really impressed at how well the staff monitored "outsiders" getting into the pool areas. There are pool attendants posted at most of the pools and waterslides, and they really monitor those who are not wearing the bracelet of the day. Each day all guests using the pool areas must have a colored bracelet on. Anyone found not to have the colored bracelet on is immediately asked their room number, and if they don't come up with the right number they are asked their last name, and if that doesn't match up with their computer's data they are asked to leave the pools. I saw people from other hotels sneaking in to take advantage of the pools and waterslides at our hotel, only to be spotted without a bracelet and asked to provide proof of residency. All the kids really seemed to enjoy the bracelets, most of them displaying a different bracelet for all the days they'd been at the hotel. Some of the kids' arms looked like little rainbows with all the different bracelets lined up. The bracelets also sort of make you feel as though you belong to a private club for the time you're there. You can spot the Grand Wailea folks a mile away with the bracelets lined up their arms. The bracelets are a really cute idea, not to mention it really keeps the crowds down at the resort. We were literally asked by "outsiders" if they could have our room number so that they could swim in the pools that day. Of course we said "sorry, but nope." As far as meals, we enjoyed breakfast at the Grand Dining Room. The buffet was excellent, very convenient location, a great place to fuel up for the energy it takes to run after the kids all day at the pool. Lunch at the Volcano Bar was pretty good. Pretty pricey too!!! A small salad was $12.00. The smoothies at the Volcano Bar were all yum. Dinner was our time to go out and explore the island. We ate in Kihei a lot. Kihei is a cute little town with a lot of restaurants all in a row. Maui Tacos was a hit with the kids, very tasty. We tried Mama's Fish House in Paia. Very good, but very expensive. We did not try Humu Humu, after reading a pretty bad review. Had our pixs developed at a place in Kihei called Paradise Photos on Kihei Rd. If you have a digital camera, go there. They know what they're doing, if you're just trying your camera out and need a little tutoring. The pixs were great quality. Try the fried ice cream at Maui Sweet Spot in Kihei. Hawaiian made ice cream was really tasty. Back to the subject at hand. The Grand Wailea was a special treat, a great place to wash away the world's troubles, if only for a week. Time flew, and before we knew it we were back in Orange County, California. Glad to be home safe, but treasuring the memories made at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Wailea Grand was almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Darthmom
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this in appreciation of all the posts that helped us have a wonderful vacation in Maui last week. The Wailea exceeded our expectations as a property. The gardens, art and pools are all first rate. I will forever be a goddess to my 8 and 10 year olds for booking the room. We too ate at the Grand shops, loved Cheeseburgers, Maitais and Rock and Roll for a quick lunch and to get them out of the sun. We also visited the ABC stores there for a few snacks and bottled water. The cafe was great for a pre-pool breakfast, my son loved the pourtugese sausage burrito and the fresh fruit bowl was amazing. The beach was beautiful. Some minor complaints, our bill had a $30.00 charge for a roll away bed we never ordered. It was easily fxed with a call to the desk. The room, smelled of mold but it wasn't unbearable, honestly, I'm not sure if this is "acceptable" because of the humidity or not. We were in the ballroom wing if that helps you avoid this in the future. All in all, it was a dream vacation and I'm glad we stayed at the Grand Wailea. For others planning a trip, we also enjoyed Mama's Fish House. We took the Four Winds Molokini cruise, for inexperienced snorklers it was perfect. The only other mistake I think we made was renting snorkle gear, we could have bought it for less and we didn't use it as much as we thought (the boat supplies equipment so it was only used for beach snorkling).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am in the hospitality business and have stayed at some wonderful Hotels & Resorts around the world over the past 20 years. This was my first visit to Grand Wailea and it is one of the most beautiful and all encompassing resorts I have found......It has lovely gardens, numerous peacefull waterfalls interwoven with unique artwork and great pools with lots of watersports....The property is large and spread out, but it never felt as there were alot of people around.....and the kids that were running around seems to be having a great time.......wish I could have stayed longer......but, I know I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: andrewjm
Reviews.Content: OK, it's expensive. Let's get that behind us. Everything at the Grand Wailea is expensive and if getting a deal is your primary concern, no need to read on. But having said that, the Grand Wailea is a fabulous place to spend time on Maui and I would recommend it, especially to families with kids, in a heartbeat. The hotel and grounds are magnificent and well kept. Yes, there is a large construction project next door, but we hardly noticed it during our stay and we were in the wing closest to the construction. Our room was beautiful, with no trace of peeling wallpaper or mildew. Housekeeping staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. There is an incredibly large and well equipped fitness center. The pool complex is just unbelievable, a kids dream. We were worried about cabana rentals and reserving space near the pool after reading some other reviews but this turned out not to be a problem. The beach is just a few short steps from the pool so we cold have one of our kids doing beach and one doing pool with no problems. The kiosk on the beach will rent you everything from a boogie board or a snorkel to a Hobie Cat. Never cheap of course, but convenient. The restaurants were mixed. Bistro Molokini had indifferent food, indifferent service and a hopelessly muddled menu. Kincha, on the other hand had superb Sushi and excellent service. We didn't try 'Humu.....' after reading to many negative review. Probably the best restaurant in the hotel is the poolside Volcano bar which served great burgers, chicken sandwiches and ahi sandwiches grilled right there. Very fresh and tasty. The good news is that you don't need to eat at the hotel--- you can walk next door to the awesome restaurants at the Four Seasons or the nice restaurants at the Wailea shops for a much better dining experience. Anyway, if saving bucks is not a primary concern, the Grand Wailea is a wonderful place to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1 night with my brother the night before his wedding, but spent all of my days at their mini water park. Place is amazing. I stayed 3 resorts down the road, but found myself spending all of my beach and pool time here at the Wailea for the week.
