Service was amazing, concierge a huge help for restaurants, valet parking in minutes, and exclusive shops a block away. The pools were great, and they have adult only pools to get away from the hundreds of screaming little animals. This resort has my vote for my next stay in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every grand dollar paid!”
Reviews.Author: Beachal
Reviews.Content: This was our family dream vacation. Eight nights in Paradise.(May 27 - June 5, 2005) After much searching and reviewing of various destinations in the world, I decided on the Grand Wailea. (I used trip advisor, conde naste and others to find the perfect place) We had two adjoining rooms (clean and always serviced) with a beautiful view of the garden waterfalls near Kincha and the mountains and ocean in view. It was a beautiful sight to awaken every morning to this view. We had wonderful service in all areas and were treated as if we were regulars on the property. This was our daughters graduation trip for our family of 5. The ages of 18, 15 and 8 are very diverse in their interests. Our daughters enjoyed the pools, beach and especially the day at the spa. We all visited the spa enjoying complete packages that were worth every penny of the GRAND amount that was paid. The girls will be highly disapppointed in any other spa that they visit after this one. Our 8 year old son, lived in the pool all day and then attended kids camp at night. He loved the crab hunts, scavenger hunts, tie dying and puca shell necklace making camps. We ate in all the restaurants and enjoyed KINCHA the best. We made our reservation early so we could sit at a traditional japanese table. They truly enjoyed every aspect of the meal. We found that we enjoyed our breakfast the most at the shops of wailea next door at Cheeseburger in Paradise. Alot of food for a little money was hard to find on the island. We loved the Tommy Bahama restaurant as well visiting it twice. Marcos Italian Grill on the way to the airport was a wonderful place before tackling the long night flight home. We have been many place and truly loved the beauty and comfort level of the island. We had a beautiful day on a catamaran/snorkel cruise and a private Leisure van ride and an air maui helicopter ride in HANA. We enjoyed a day in Lahaina and visited many places along the way. This was a trip that our family will remember forever. The expense was well over $25,000 in all for our family of five, but was one that we will never have again with a child off to college.

Reviews.Title: “If you're into burning $$$, this place is for you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stays at 5 star/apple resorts every year so we have apples to compare with this apple. To put it succinctly......the resort is outrageously pricey and does not provide the services the guests should be entitled to after already paying for overpriced rooms. Examples are the $14 hamburgers (not gourmet) at the pool side and a $26 breakfast buffet that is just so so, paying $120 or more per day for cabanas. ( Shade around the pool is at a premium). Customer service was stretching to make average. The spa was nice, but customer service in the spa and spa shop were surprisingly poor. Guest should not have to pay an $18.00 resort fee. The list goes on. The size of the room for the price was just okay. The bathroom is very nice, except we noticed that there was mold moderate mold in grouting between tiles in shower. The maid service did not clean the room well each day and we were tipping $7-8 each day. To worsen matters, the hotel put a hold of several thousand $$$ on our credit card even though, we had prepaid for our 8 day stay there. This turned out to be a major problem that took up too much of our vacation time to straighten out. In all fairness the manager, in the end gave us about a $500 credit for the inconvenience after I insisted they credit us for one nights stay. This was a compromise. It took them 3 days to get the matter corrected. Then we had smoke from the adjoining room coming through the cracks of the door between the two rooms. I have a serious lung condition and notified the front desk about the cigarette smoking in a non-smoking area. Their solution was to offer to move us to another room. I responded no, we were not going to waste anymore of our vacation time resolving problems they create.....a better solution would be to notify the other guest and ask them to desist from smoking or to move them. Again, poor customer service. In the end they put a air ionizer in our room. Thankfully, we were leaving the next day. What's good about this place? The grounds are stunningly beautiful, a great stretch of beach connected to the resort and the artwork throughout the resort is magnificent! The bathroom area is a plus for size and design. This kind of beauty can be experienced for less $$$ and with staff that treat you like royalty, or at least a valued guest. Hint.....If you do visit this resort, try eating breakfast at the restaurant next door at the Wailea shoppes. It's very good and won't cost you an arm & a leg. Generally speaking, food away from the resort is reasonably priced and I recommend dinner at the golf course up the road. Very nice! We also ate at the Four Seasons. The dinner was was wonderful and the service was perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fit the Bill Perfectly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent a lot of time in Wailea and had walked through and around the Grand Wailea a number of times. Our impression was that it was a beautiful hotel with a fun (but overly crowded) pool area. We really did not have that much interest in staying there for ourselves mainly because it was so big and always seemed so crowded. However, we were bringing our kids and I thought it would be fun for them to spend a few nights and days there so we booked a room and crossed our fingers. It worked perfectly for us. Unfortunately, it did not start out as well as it should have. We reserved a king bed with sofa bed room in the deluxe garden view category. There were no such rooms available when we arrived but they made up for it (somewhat) with free rollaways. They also assured me that I received a deluxe garden view room even though it was not in the area outlined in the description on the website. I frankly wonder if that is the case or whether it was really because the hotel was full. It was a little dissappointing but we did get a beautiful room (it appeared to be recently renovated) and a bit of an ocean view to boot. The hotel itself is spectacular. It sunk in while staying there in ways that it had not when taking a walkthrough. The artwork, gardens etc. are absolutely gorgeous and maintained to an extremely high standard. The pools and beach were a blast for the kids and the adults. However, the pool staff is surly and acts just like the folks you would run into at a regular waterpark, not an extremely expensive hotel. Another negative is that it was the only nice hotel in Hawaii we have stayed at that did not have shower and clean up facilities available for guests who had to check out before they actually left the property. This was not an issue for us because we were leaving for the other side of the island but would have been a problem if we had a late flight. Overall, I was very satisfied with our stay and extremely impressed with the beauty of the property and the fun it provides. If it were just me and my wife, we would still probably stay somewhere smaller. However, I suspect the kids will beg us to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea was a Fabulous Dream”
Reviews.Author: ruby1027
Reviews.Content: We did lots of research before we chose the Grand Wailea, and it paid off. We went for our 18th Anniversary and it was the most memorable time my husband and I have ever shared together. We went from April 28-May 8. We never encountered any of the negative remarks that we had read on this hotel. There was plenty of chairs, umbrellas, staff and natural beauty. Our maid was fabulous and most of the time we felt like we were by ourself or with very few guest while enjoying the pools, slides, and beach. The room was not perfect, it was a little run down and the bathroom could have used a deep cleaning, but we feel we could not have stayed at a better hotel to relax, have fun and enjoy the best views. We loved the grounds and felt we had the best beach over other local hotels. We recommend Nick's Fish Market and Ruth Chris for fine dining. You can walk along the beach to get to Nicks(the best service we have ever experienced) and Ruth Chris (the best steak)is a quick walk next door. For a good deal drive to Kehei Cafe across the street from Kalama Park and beach on S.Kehei Rd and Lahele. Breakfast and lunch is quick and good(get the fresh squeezed orange juice). Best snorkeling was nearby at reserve and near the most awesome white sand beach. All free! The room service pizza is really good deal and enjoyable if you want to stay in your room. The bed was comfy and the patio is enjoyable to hang out at. We stayed in a garden view room that had a beautiful view. I recommend to go enjoy yourself and relax. We definitely will return and bring our four teenage girls next year!

Reviews.Title: “Dejavu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took the extended family two years ago. Kids and adults loved it so much we had to go back last week. It was even better the second time. Not sure that I would stay anywhere else on Maui, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mar_76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Wailea for 5 nts as part of Hawaiian honeymoon. Well-traveled couple in late 20s - early 30s. We both loved the Grand Wailea. It was elegant and luxurious without being stuffy. The grounds were absolutely beautiful â€“ such attention to detail. We probably spent half a roll of film just on pictures of the hotel and grounds. We had the lowest room category, on the 8th floor in the back of the hotel. It had a view of the parking lot and Haleakala. Really, you wouldnâ€™t notice the parking lot unless you were looking down. You could also see the ocean from our balcony, with Molokini and that other island in our view. The room itself was great -- there was enough room, it was clean and well-maintained, and the bathroom had a huge walk in shower and soaking tub. We paid $291 a night, which I considered a bargain given the prices of the other Wailea luxury resorts (4 Seasons and Kea Lani). People complain about there being a â€œresort feeâ€� at the Grand Wailea (covers use of fitness center, self parking, local phone calls, etc.), but I donâ€™t see what the big deal is. Just figure it into the cost of the room, and when your rate is as low as $291, itâ€™s still a good deal. Of course, the main attraction at the Grand Wailea is the pool complex, and it did not disappoint. DH learned to swim for the honeymoon and he could not get enough of the pools and slides. We both played in the pool like little kids, and we were not alone as far as the adults enjoying the slides (with and without kids). I had heard on various boards that the GW would not be a good place for a honeymoon because of all the families attracted by the pool, and that it was overrun with kids. Not once were we bothered or felt overrun by the families with kids. If anything, it was fun to see them enjoy the slides and all. I think the GW is a great place to honeymoon â€“ especially for a younger couple that likes to have fun. I have no idea how full the GW was while we were there, but it did not feel crowded at all, even in the pool area. The GW also has a separate adult pool where no children are allowed. Itâ€™s very quiet and mellow, and also very beautiful. The lounge chairs around the adult pool are a lot nicer than the ones by the other pool. Our favorite place to hang out while not in the pool was the lawn between the adult pool and the ocean. Very peaceful, and you could find some shade from the coconut trees. We ordered room service several times, had the breakfast buffet (once) and ate at the Humu restaurant. All of the food was excellent, and of course very expensive. But at least the quality was very good. The beach area is also very nice. Absolutely no complaints about the service. Based on my experience there, I would wholeheartedly recommend the Grand Wailea. Especially if you can get a great rate â€“ try their website and calling them directly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Grand Wailea and let me tell you, grand is the operative word. Everything is on a grand scale here, from the outstanding open air lobby, with flower beds and sculpture, to the amazing pools, to the lushly landscaped grounds. We found the service to be absolutely impeccable. Whenever we called for anything, someone was there within five minutes. I was there with a good friend for a spa trip. I have traveled extensively, but the Grand Wailea still knocks your socks off. It is one of the most beautifully decorated hotels I have seen with its fabulous light fixtures, gorgeous tile work, orchids on the lobby tables, lush landscaping and museum caliber art collection. There is a wedding chapel on the grounds and everyday we saw one or more weddings, some small and seemingly impromptu, some elaborate formal affairs. That was fun and romantic. Our last weekend there was Memorial Day weekend and the resort was full. There were more people by the pool and on the beach than we had seen, but we could still find quiet places to chill out. Every morning we walked for an hour or so on the walkway along the ocean. What a perfectly scenic way to get exercise! There were many walkers, joggers out and everyone gave a friendly hello. We had dinner twice at Humuhumu's and the food was delicious, but the sunset view was spectacular. We also ate at Ferraro's at the Four Seasons, a short walk away. The food was delicious there also. We drove into Kihei and ate at Roy's and I highly recommend that restaurant also. We walked to the mall that is five minutes away and discovered some great restaurants - Longhi's, Tommy Bahamas, and Cheeseburgers-Mai Tai's. Most of those places have great breakfasts that are less expensive than those at the resort. The mall also has general stores, national retailers like the Gap, luxury retailers like Gucci and a camera shop. A great destination for window shopping or picking up those things you forgot. We drove the Road to Hana and saw breathtaking views of the ocean, waterfalls and verdant valleys. I also went up Mount Haleakala to see the sunrise. I was blessed to have a clear day with low clouds, perfect sunrise viewing weather. I took a van there, but folks from Maui advised against one of the excursions offered that involved riding bikes down from the summit. One woman, an emergency room nurse, said they see tons of injuries, like broken ribs, from bikers who lose control. The hotel's Spa Grande, is world class. They offer hydrotherapy with most of the treatments - an hour to soak in various whirlpools, saunas or specialty baths, like mud or aromatherapy. By the time you get to your massage, you are already like jelly! The spa attendants are excellent, both my treatments were outstanding. No negatives about my experience at all. Food at the resort is expensive, even by Maui standards, but we knew that going in. Some people may be put off the by sheer size of the resort. But I had a perfect trip and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is magnificent. The most beautiful place I have ever been to. Check in was easy. Got in around 2:30PM, walked right up to the desk and in our room 5 minutes later. Our view was of the chapel, gardens and ocean, ground floor near the spa. Every evening our bed was turned down and room picked up and everyday our room was cleaned before we returned from the pools. The Spa Grande is wonderful. DO TRY THIS! It includes 1 hour pre-treatment using the baths and various hot tubs. And it includes a salt scrub. I could have stayed there all day. But alas, there are pools to swim in! The pools were so much fun. We usually sunbathed near the rope swing. It was fun watching the little (and big) kids show off. Every hour or so we'd walk up to the top pool and slide down using the connecting slides until we got back to our spot near the lazy river. It was so fun. Every once and a while we'd stop half way down at the Volcano pool bar under the waterfalls. It's a swim up bar and has tasty drinks and a very friendly bartender. The beach was also inviting. Once a day we'd take a dip in the Pacific to refresh. Beautiful beach. Overall, I would say this is the best resort I have stayed at. It never felt crowded at all yet it was a full house. Last year we went to Atlantis in the Bahamas... I loved it there too, but for the money, I'd choose The Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Grand Wailea from April 8th to 15th 2005. I was awestruck with the beauty of the grounds, it is absolutely gorgeous and luxurious. Expect to pay an arm and a leg for everything, but if money is not an object, then this is a great place to splurge on your kids. One word of caution: if you don't like kids stay away, you don't belong here. On the night I arrived the uptight jerk next door complained because my kids were making noise. Of course they were going to make noise, they just arrived from an 8 hour plane ride to this fantastic place, and were really excited! That put a damper on things from the beginning, so I must stress that this is a hotel for families with kids that have lots of money, plain and simple. The pools here are awesome, they have great slides, a fantastic beach (and man-made kiddie beach for the really small ones), and it is geared for CHILDREN and their wealthy parents, and kids will always make noise! Now that I have finished venting, the service was great in almost every occasion. The restaurant/bar by the adult-only pool had a very rude waitress (black girl) who completely ignored me and was too diva-ish for my taste. At the sushi place, I had to return an order of teriyaki beef three times because they undercooked it each time. Those were the only two problems. Everywhere else, the service was amazing. I loved Richard, the waiter at the one-of-a-kind swim up bar. I loved that bar, god I wish I was there right now. Richard is awesome, he will treat you right. BTW, there is a "hidden" jacuzzi above that bar, I didn't find it until my last nght there. The rooms were great, they were huge and I loved them. I didn't care about a little peeling of the wallpaper in the bathroom, to me it made it feel more like a tropical resort, where things aren't 100% "perfect". Me and my wife had an awesome time at the spa, I can't wait to get that wacky water therapy thing again, and massages. You get treated like royalty. Humuhumunukunukuapuap'a (or someting like that) provided the most amazing dining experience of my entire life. Oh my god, it wasn't just the exquisite three pound spiny lobster I ate, but the view while eating it. You see, there is one particular table (table 71 I think) which you have to walk down a short wooden planked-walkway to get to, and you have your dinner out in the open, in the middle of the fish pond, with a gorgeous sunset, palm trees, lit tiki torches, drinks served in enormous coconuts, etc. It is paradise, probably one of the most special dining tables in the entire world, if you catch it at sunset. I will be returning next year. Hopefully it will not dissapoint me, but even if it does I will always cherish that one week I spent in the most luxurious tropical hotel in the world. Aaahhhh....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grounds, Beautiful Beach but the room needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want an honest opinion of this hotel from your "average joe" then keep reading. Before I booked our trip to the Grand I read all of the reviews. Alot of them seemed to be written by people who have stayed in every 5 star hotel possible and were comparing this one to all of the others. Well, my husband and I just wanted to go on a "dream vacation" to Hawaii. We ended up choosing the Grand and we were very pleasantly surprised. The grounds at this hotel are beyond description! They are so beautiful. We booked a garden room and ended up getting the most spectacular view of the grounds, wedding chapel, and the ocean. It was perfectly beautiful! Yes, I do agree with some of the other reviews as far as the rooms are concerned. They do need some TLC! Our room wasn't as clean as I expected it to be. We also had some wallpaper peeling off and the floors were pretty dirty. Honestly, it wasn't a huge deal, it just needs some extra attention and it would be fine. We were still very impressed with the size of the rooms and the bathroom. The grounds, pools and the beach made this all worth it though! This was our first trip to Hawaii and this hotel was everything we expected Hawaii to be. I loved the little notes and flowers that they left on our pillows every night when they would turn down our bed. It was a cute little touch. I've also noticed that alot of the other reviews were complaining about noise from children and construction. Well, in my opinion this again is not as bad as they are making it sound. Our room was actually on the end of the hotel that is by the construction and we heard nothing. The only time we could hear it was when we were walking down to the beach, and it wasn't loud. I was never bothered by the sound of children laughing and having a good time either!! We ended up renting some snorkel sets for the day and had a great time out in the water. It's amazing to see all the different kinds of fish that are right underneath you! I would suggest trying this if you have never done it before. It's very interresting. All in all I would have to say that this hotel is for anyone! Whether you are a newlywed or have children this hotel is great! It's beautiful, tropical, and very relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “We cried when we had to leave the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: seinenb
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is most beautiful resort I have ever seen. We stayed at the GW for 7 days / 6 nights in early may for the second half of our honeymoon. We researched for months agonizing over whether to choose the GW, the Four Seasons, the Fairmont Kea Lani or the Hyatt in Ka'anapali. We wanted everything to be perfect for our honeymoon. After consulting guidebooks, tripadvisor, looking at pictures, talking to friends, etc. - we decided on the Grand Wailea. When we got there we were floored. The place is magnificant. You feel like you are in a palace. We are both around 30, but have done a fair amount of travelling for both pleasure and business, and nothing compares to the Grand Wailea. Our room (which was upgraded from the cheapest - Terrace - to a deluxe ocean view) was large, clean, well appointed, had a balcony plus a large grassy area where we could relax with coffee or wine and gaze out over the ocean. The bathroom was huge with a two person tub (c'mon it is our honeymoon), a separate shower with a bench (which I guess is nice for shaving your legs) and very soft towels. The room was always cleaned promptly and well. Despite how nice the room was, it couldn't compare with the grounds. The gardens/pools/beach were incredible and far surpassed their counterparts at the 4 seasons, Kea lani, or the Hyatt (we had to make sure we did in fact choose the best place). I will admit that there are a lot of families, but the place is so huge, plus there is an adult only pool, so we weren't bothered by it once. A close second to the grounds was the spa. Spa prices may seem expensive (well, everything in South Maui will seem expensive), but each treatment includes an hour in the bath area. Even if you aren't a spa person, you should splurge - it's well worth it. We only ate at the hotel once - having the breakfast buffet at the GW dining room. If there is a breakfast buffet that can justify a $25 pricetag, this is it. I would recommend the GW to almost any traveler. Families, Couples, whomever, there is plenty for everyone. If you are demanding in the area of service, you might want to opt for the 4 Seasons which staffs at much higher levels. We never had a problem, but we are pretty low maintenance. I never thought I would be one to stay at the same resort twice - in my opinion there are too many options out there to stick to just one place - but when we return to Hawaii there will be no question that we will be back at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools for kids no shade unless pay 150 $ cabanna”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pools were outstanding. My son of 7yrs old loved them. But to find a chair or shade was not easyly done. I had to pay 150 a day to have a cabanna with service, which seemed alot since we paid alot to stay there, with a 35 $ service fee for the resort. The rooms were large and nice seperate bath and seperate shower but smell of mold through out the room. The rooms where very weathered and outdated linnens. The burgers were good at the pool and the beach is the best. Next year I would stay on that beach, but at another hotel with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool at Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: Kick_8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui with our 4 year old and 7 year old. (4-26-4-29) The hotel is beautiful, but so large we couldn't find our way around until the second day! It took a good 10 minute walk for us to get to the pool area where you could check out towels! The pool is incredible! A great entertainment value for the kids! The service however is OK. It seemed that most of the staff was young and not very well trained to be in a service position. They seemed as if they were just there for a summer job and their heart wasn't in it. The first concierge we contacted was useless! The second one was helpful after we asked him to book a particular trip for us. The prices here are high. (Everything was a few dollars higher than the Westin where we stayed before...and the Westin's service was better braids by the pool were 10.00 a braid instead of 8.00 and a kids fruity drink was 7.50 instead of 6.00.) We went to the Four Seasons for a meal and the service was inredible, but the pool was more for adults. If you are wanting Great service this is not the place, but if you want fun for the kids and a nice room this fits the bill. We did rent the refrigerator for the 25.00 to have snacks and drinks in our room and that came in handy. The room and Bathroom are very nice and roomy. Overall We would stay here again. Oh,if you go eat at Roy's in Kiehe, the food was awesome and they have a great kids menu too.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we remembered it”
Reviews.Author: NinoNico
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the poor reviews posted just before we left to go to the Grand Wailea, I was a bit concerned if the hotel was no longer what we remembered it to be four years ago. We did not have any of the problems noted in the other reviews. The staff was freindly and helpful and the resort is as beautiful as we remembered it. We had an ocean view across the chapel. I would think that if there is a party out there, it would be disturbing. There is presently construction next door so if you are on that side of the hotel, you may hear some hammering and the beeping of trucks backing up. We last went just after 9/11 when the resort and the island were empty. We were mentioning this to the bellman as he came up with our bags. He was with them back then and he made a point of saying that the management did not lay anyone off during the recession following the trade center attacks. All staff were instructed to come in as usual even though the resort was pretty much empty. To me that says a lot for the people who run this place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Resort I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst resort I've stayed at. We reserved a Deluxe Ocean view room, and when we arrived we were given a room with a partial ocean view, and a full view of a crane and construction sight. We were not told when we made reservation that noisy construction was going on next to all of the deluxe ocen view rooms.We were never accomadted with a better room and felt the staff were very rude. The inside of our room had wallpaper that was peeling off the wall, a broken shower head, and a broken knob on the sink. I would think that a resort would keep their rooms in better condition than this. The only upside to the stay was that the pools were amazing, but if you are looking for a quiet, romantic, getaway this is not the place to go. It is very crowded with kids and families and most of the seating around the pools are taken early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A resort or a bad frat party?”
Reviews.Author: JaneDoe29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two night stay at the Grand Wailea. If you are considering a vacation at the Grand Wailea, you should be aware that the resort allows loud night-time private parties with cheesy cover bands (A la "The Wedding Singer") on the lawn areas near the guest rooms. If you like to go to bed before 10 p.m. (which can feel quite late if you are adjusting to a time change), or don't like to involuntarily listen to cheesy cover bands during your Hawaiian vacation, this is not the place for you. The music is also too loud to hear the TV in your room, so you can't drown it out that way. Plus, since the parties are private, you can't even practice the "if you can't beat 'em, join 'em" philosophy by joining the festivities, so you're pretty much stuck enduring the noise until 10. (The exciting karaoke-style grand finale included members of the audience singing that favorite Donna Summers classic, "Last Dance." Beautiful!) We are not "high maintenance" travelers (give me a tent near the beach and I'm happy) and fortunately we were not traveling with children. But we could not believe that this pricey resort does not respect their guests enough to provide a quiet room in which to relax or sleep in the evening. In fact, the resort does the opposite. We complained to two managers (one during the party and the other as we checked out). We were told that others had also complained, that the band's volume was too loud, and that it was the "Catering Department's" fault. There was no expression of genuine concern about the issue. From what I can tell, this is normal, business-as-usual, for the Grand and not an isolated event, so buyer beware. (They were setting up for a new party as we were checking out yesterday.) As others have also noted, keep a close eye on your hotel bill. They charged us for a fridge that we did order (or receive). (No apology for the error.) There were other issues during our stay, but I'll stop here. If the Grand Wailea appeals to you because it's fancy and has water slides, I'd recommend the Hyatt on Kauai as a more pleasant alternative. The Hyatt has similar pool facilities and is a much more "Hawaiian" experience. (The Grand feels more like Las Vegas.) But if you miss those sleepless nights in college when your neighbor's band was playing while you were trying to get some sleep, and you don't mind paying $400+/night for that trip down Memory Lane, then the Grand Wailea is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunstarsun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights in April. The grounds and lobby are beautiful. I thought the room would be nicer. It was clean and nicely decorated but expected more for the price. We had an ocean view on the 7th floor and the balcony was a good size to sit and relax. The bathroom had a great shower and tub. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean. Check in was a breeze, bellman was pleasant. The location of the hotel is excellent. Nice beach and pool areas. My only compaint is that they charge $35/day for a beach umbrella!! C'mon guys. We're paying $9/drink and $16 for a hmaburger as it is. I don't mind paying more for quality but this was a bit much. Walk down to the Marriott next door for lunch at their pool. A little cheaper and much better food. We ate at Spagos in the Four Seasons-fabulous! Went to Mama's fish house-very good, Bada Bing-good, Molokini Bistro at the Grand Wailea--fair, Ma'alea Grill for lunch-fantastic, Sorrentos-fantastic. Overall a wonderful stay and I would reccommend this hotel. The spa was great too. It seemed a bit overcrowded in the mineral bath/hot tub area to me. The massage was awesome. Self park in the garage and save $12/day for valet. Very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a TERRIBLE stay and the Grand Wailea and we are NEVER EVER going back, save yourself the grief (and the money) and stay somewhere else! It should be called the Grand-Why-Staya as there is no reason to stay at this pitiful hotel. The first room we were sent to was a dingy little room right next to the construction site (there is extensive construction going on next door regardless of what the Hotel Staff says) with no ocean view, we paid for an ocean view, so back to the front desk to get a room with an ocean view. The front desk personnel were poorly trained but checked our reservation and agreed we were supposed to be in an ocean front room and after an hour we had a new room. The bellman who approached me with my key became irritated that I did want my bags moved until I checked out the second room to make sure it was O.K., realizing there was not going to be a second tip to move bags (until I checked the room), he threw the room key at me and stormed off! Unpleasant and unprofessional for supposed â€œluxury hotelâ€�. My wife and went up to the second room on the fifth floor and there were beer cans mini-bottles on the floor, the beds had been slept on, strangely the bathroom had been made up. I stopped a service person in the hall to ask about the condition of the room and she mentioned that some of the staff like to â€œpartyâ€� in the rooms after guests check out, open the mini-bar and help themselves, which is then billed to the guests account (nice story, and itâ€™s from one of the hotel employees!) Back down to the Front Desk for a room that has been cleaned. Another hour wait and I got to watch the bell staff rough-housing and generally acting like a bunch of unruly teenagers, where is the management at this place? Back up to the seventh floor and finally a room that has been serviced, the carpet was stained, the shower had big masses of hair on the wall, and the toilet was dirty, and the wall next to the toilet had brown spots that I did not want to investigate. I have stayed in nicer Holiday Inns, but it was getting late and I did want spend anymore of my vacation at the front desk, so my wife suggested we go down stairs to eat. While walking down to investigate the restaurant with my wife, and we had to jump off the path into the bushes to avoid being run-over by three hotel employees â€œjoyridingâ€� a large service cart on the walkway. At this point I had had enough, and went next door to the Four Seasons for dinner, the Four Seasons is the hotel the Grad Wailea is supposed to be, I would have moved there but they were booked up. When I got home and the bill arrived there were charges for valet parking everyday even though I did NOT use valet parking due to another couple warning us they had their camera stolen from their car while it was being valet parked. I asked the front desk for my charges at check-out, and there were no parking charges, they waited and billed me later for the charges, what a scam! Unprofessional and rude staff, poorly kept rooms, unsafe grounds, disgusting food service, and the list goes on and on. There are only two types of people who stay at the Grand Wailea, those who donâ€™t know they got ripped off and say it is O.K., and those like me who know they were completely ripped off by the scam artists who run this hotel. Do not ruin your Hawaiian holiday staying at this horrible hotel (if you want luxury, stay at the Four Seasons next door)

Reviews.Title: “Perfection For Two Fussy Travelers!”
Reviews.Author: eightydegrees
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from Hawaii where we stayed at several upscale hotels. The GW was absolutely breathtaking. We were in a room on the 9th floor and what a view we had. The staff at check-in were some of the best we have ever encountered. They were friendly and upgraded us even with our first stay there. We had in-room dining due to the both of us contacting severe colds and it was wonderful and very tasty. We has breakfast in the Grand Dining Room and it was the best french toast and eggs benedict we have ever had. The wait staff was extremely friendly and right there if we needed anything. This hotel glows from all the brass banisters being polished constantly. The grounds have wonderful nooks and crannies to just sit and be. The adult pool was wonderful. We had padded chairs right at the edge of the pool and the pool attendants came around often to check on us. The only problem we encountered was with housekeeping. When our room wasn't cleaned by 2:30 PM we called the hotel management and were treated to dining on our lanai that night at the hotels expense. Very classy indeed! The hotel was not very busy while we were there so that made it all the better. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Gate
Reviews.Content: Since this site helped us pick the Grand Wailea, I feel compelled to share our thoughts about our week at GW. In a word, outstanding. We booked two of the least expensive rooms. When we checked in, they had automatically upgraded one of the rooms to an ocean view. That was great but it put our children in another wing. By the next morning at 9AM, they had our children upgraded as well right next door. The staff was superb about it. We are even in the wing closest to the construction going on next door at the Wailea Beach Villas. It never bothered us at all. Ask for a refrigerator so that you can stock up on waters and snacks. (we bought ours plus wine at the General Store at the Shops of Wailea next door; very upscale - has a Ruth Chris Steakhouse and a Tommy Bahama restaurant). We asked for one for each room and they gave us the kid's one gratis. We have had two amazing breakfasts at Longhi's at the Shops of Wailea. Had breakfast at the hotel buffet which is very good but Longhi's is better. Get your chairs early at the pool as it will fill up by mid morning. Love that they have an adult only pool which is a great temperature. Lemon ice water available at the pool all day long. Only annoyance are folks on their cell phones at the pool thinking that other folks care to hear them. There was a corporate recognition event going on so lots of folks hobnobing at the pool. Husband and kids liked the slide. Walk the beach walk and it's a great 3 mile workout. Had two great dinners at Humu and Konshi in the hotel. The best was Nick's Fishmarket at the Fairmont Kea Lani two doors down. You can snorkel right off this beach. Went into Lahaina to see the show Ulalena. It's OK if you have small kids. Our 18 year old was bored. Ate at David Paul's in Lahaina which has the most amazing bread. Rest of the meal was very good. Went into Kehei to see a movie and ate a very low-key (bordering on dive), authentic Mexican dinner at Fernando's that one of the waitresses told us about. The Spa here is the best I've been to in a while. The prices of the manicures and pedicures are ridiculous but the treatments are reasonable when you consider that the hydrotherapy is free with any treatment. (if you need a manicure or pedicure, go into Kihei to the Nail Shop). That is an amazing set of different baths and showers that sooth and massage. And an attendant will loofah you down for free with a body scrub. Very well done. I treated my 18 year old son to an acne facial and he said it was very good (not great) but he loved the baths.

Reviews.Title: “Something is lurking in the room...only the Shadow knows!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Wailea. My wife and I were very impressed with the size of the rooms and the bathrooms (I think it was room 6203 or 6302). However, after the euphoria of not being at work had subsided, upon closer inspection we found the following issues with our room: paint peeling and rusting in the bathroom (i suppose from the shower) stains on the carpet stains on the ottoman in the sitting area wallpaper peeling throughout the room. The ottoman was never replaced and therefore, it could only be used if all "infected" surfaces of the ottoman had been covered with towels. Obviously, the rust and the wallpaper would have to be addressed after we left. Most disappointingly, the carpet was never "fully" cleaned. Even after the housekeeping cleaning attempts, faint hints of the stain were still visible. On another note, we were a bit disappointed with the wait staff in the main lobby bar. We were constantly having to chase after the waitresses to get our checks so we wouldn't be late for our dinner reservations. On two occasions, our waitress was standing sloppily at the bar reading a newspaper instead of paying attention to her customers. For a hotel of this cost and supposed caliber, my wife and I were disappointed. On another note, the grounds are nice, but not stunning. and there are two seperate pool areas for adults and children - we were able to escape schreeching kids at the adults only pool. That was heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Theft at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: dennisan
Reviews.Content: After spending a 7 days at the Grand Wailea in Maui we had over $8,000 worth of jewelry stolen from our bags while they were in the possession of the bell staff of the Grand Wailea. What a way to ruin a nice vacation! It was the last day of our stay at the GW. We checked out of our room around noon. Our flight wasn't until later that evening so we checked our bags with the bell hop and spent a few more hours at the pool. When it was time to leave, we picked up our bags and headed to the airport. As soon as we arrived, my wife checked her jewelry and found her one caret diamond necklace, a Mavado watch and a diamond tennis bracelet were all missing. We spent the last hour in Maui filing a police report at the airport and the entire flight home sicken by what had happened. After several conversations with the GM at the hotel (Mr. Johnny So) they refused to offer any compensation for what had happened. If fact, they claimed that we made up the entire story. Not the kind of treatment I expect after spending over $4,000 at a 5-star hotel! Word to the wise... Be on guard - especially at the Grand Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea is best on Island!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the GW for the last 4 years. We absolutely loved the hotel and its surroundings, and I would highly reccomend this hotel to couples with children -- NOT HONEYMOONERS-- My 3 children absolutely adore the various pools and slides, and we have never seen anything like the pool in 15 years of family vacations. The staff is very friendly, especially the poolside waiters and bartenders. The breakfast buffet is delicious, with something for everyone to enjoy. The on-site restuarants are very nice, especially the bistro - however, I would reccomend that you try Nicks Fish Market, located at the Fairmount Kee Lani, for a meal to remember. The spa at the GW is one of the best on the island, and they have many various treatments, and they even cater to my young daughters. I strongly reccomend bringing your golf clubs with you, because the onsite course is one of the best I have ever golfed on. There are many different rooms at wailea. For best ocean views, try and book a room in the napua tower. WORD OF ADVICE -- last time i visited, a new condominum complex was being built, so I reccommend not staying in the Chapel wing Overall, my family and I absolutely adore the GW and cannot wait to visit again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: margo8461
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay in Maui with 3 boys, ages 6, 10 and 12. We stayed at the Four Seasons for the first night and spent the rest of the trip at The Grand Wailea. Depending on what you are looking for, I would say The Four Seasons is the better property of the two. The room was larger, nicer, less expensive and so many of the amenitites considered "extra" at the Grand Wailea are complimentary at The Four Seasons. That said, my children had the most wonderful time at The Grand Wailea and we would definitely stay there again on any return trips. We never even used the Children's Camp as the pools are like being at a Water Park and they wanted to stay there all day. The hotel is huge and the grounds beautiful. Our room was very nice and close to the pool (a must if you have kids). We were there over spring break and the hotel was 100% booked, but the slides never had very long lines and the pools never felt over full. It was hard to find chairs the one day we went out to the pool in the late morning, but we just walked to the beach and set up out there. The food at the pool is very good and convenient. We rented a refrigerator ($25.00 for the week) and kept milk and cereal in there for breakfast. I would definitely say this is the place to stay with kids, and we had a wonderful time. The hotel let us check out late, stay at the pool after we did check out, and made a hospitality room available to us so we could shower and dress before heading to the airport. None of us wanted to leave and when asked what were their favorite parts of the trip, all of my kids had The Grand Wailea as one of the top 3 (right behind snorkeling and a helicopter ride over the Haleakela crater!!) One caveat, I did hate being charged for every little thing (when you are paying $650.00 a night, it just seems like some things should be included). This was especially irksome because we had just come from the Four Seasons where are children were greeted with gifts in the room as well as a snack and where beach cabanas, umbrellas, roll away beds and even the children's program are all COMPLIMENTARY - AND where we had a larger, nicer room with an ocean view for $200.00 a night less. The Grand Wailea needs to up their image just a tad and stop charging their guests a resort fee as well as make roll away beds complimentary. It just feels like you are being "nickel and dimed" and at such a beautiful resort, that's a shame. Still, we had a great time and will return - but we will spend a night or two a The Four Seasons next door for the parental pampering offered there!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous pool for the kids (and the grown-ups)”
Reviews.Author: hyacinth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 children and had a WONDERFUL time in the pools--they were absolutely fantastic. There were several levels connected by shorter slides, including one with a "rapids" effect that the kids particularly loved. There were also 2 giant (and fast) slides for the bigger kids and a water elevator, which I found a little boring, but the kids liked. They also liked the rope swing, and we all loved the "lazy river". We have a toddler as well and the only water type activity he really enjoyed on Maui was the baby beach pool area at the Grand Wailea--it is a sandy, shallow area of the pool, very gentle and non-threatening for timid kids. The older boys, who are not the least bit timid, loved having the run of the place. The hotel is also on one of the best beaches on Maui--we went nearly every day (best to go to the area halfway between the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons where it is not so crowded). I took advantage of the spa and enjoyed a very indulgent massage along with the complimentary hour of hydrotherapy--great fun for someone who rarely gets a break from motherhood! The only thing we were not impressed with was the food--it is exorbiantlly expensive with so-so quality. We will definitely try to return to the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but one tiny problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As part of our 10 day stay in Maui our first 2 nights were spent at The Grand Wailea. We thought everyone who worked here had a superior customer service attitude. The food was good though we never did eat dinner here (ate at Ruth's Chris..ummm). Just lunch at the restaurant near the adult pool and breakfast. I thought the lunch at the pool was excellent, and the service was great! Our room was located on the first floor very near the pool with a lovely view of the chapel and gardens. You could see the ocean if you really looked, but that was ok as I knew our next stop had a complete view of the ocean so I wasn't going to be missing anything. I loved it...totally serene and even saw someone getting married. Very pretty. Very easy to get to the pool! The bathroom was large and decorated tastefully. I thought everything about the hotel was worth the price. Just beautiful and the pools looked like a lot of fun. The disappointment for me was that our room smelled like mildew and with the fan blowing overhead all night the smell gave me a horrible headache. If you are like me and have a sensitivity to smells, this might bother you too. I felt sick most of the day after our first night so I could not do all the fun things I had wanted to do (especailly go down the water slide!!! Darn!!!) When I woke up the next day, same thing...headache. So, that pretty much ruined everything. As soon as I could get fresh air (which I rushed out of the room and didn't enjoy relaxing in it at all) I was better, but really disappointed that the smell was in the room. I did not mention it to the hotel staff....I loved where the room was located, I did not want to have to pack and unpack while feeling so poorly and I knew it was only 2 nights. My husband thought the place had an unfriendly air to it....not due to the staff but more the guests. Too many people on cell phones non-stop gabbing while laying out at the pool! Come on guys! You're in Maui! RELAX! Guess we are more "kick back" as we loved staying in Kanapali. Seems a little more relaxed to us. Anyway....the place is a dream but.......ask about the mildew.....I swear the carpet felt damp. I have no idea how they would have handled the situation had I complained but I hated to start out my vacation complaining. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by the entire family”
Reviews.Author: bzmtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grand Wailea and our only complaint is that we had to come home. The accomodations were outstanding and the staff did everything to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. The resort offers plenty to do for both adults and children. It definitely caters to the family, although we saw many couples without children enjoying themselves just as much. We've read previous reviews on the high cost of the shops and restaurants at the Grand Wailea but you also have the option of walking 3 minutes to the Shops at Wailea. This shopping mall offered restaurants, cafe's and wonderful shopping. We highly recommend this resort. We will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand "Beep-beep-beep" Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for eight nights in mid-February 2005. Having spent our honeymoon in November 2003 down the beach at the Fairmont Kea Lani, we feel like we have a good basis for comparison. I should point out that we both have very high expectations of such accommodations (very "high maintenance" travelers!). Grand Wailea is without question a beautiful facility. The grounds are lovely and our room met our expectations. The view from our balcony was spectacular, and we were able to watch both whales and sunsets without obstruction (bring a pair of binoculars if you're going during whale season). The adult pool was very nice, as was the lawn spreading down from the pool to the beach. We spent most of our lounging time on the lawn (only downside was when you found yourself focusing on the near-constant "beep-beep-beep" of construction vehicles at the new condo site next door). In fact, while we're on the subject, be very careful if they try to put you in the Chapel or Walea Wings, since they're closest to the construction, which will undoubtedly be continuing for many, many months. The kid's pool was also nice (we enjoyed the slide as much as the kids, I think), and the kids are definitely separated from the adult pool area, so that's not a problem. Hotel staff was pleasant enough, although there didn't seem to be enough servers at the adult pool/lawn area. Biggest problem for us was the incredibly high prices of just about everything ... they really do hit you with alot of extras. Personally, I can't understand why a hotel that charges you $399 per night also has to charge you a $20 "resort fee" every day ... I mean, why else would you BE there except to use the resort facilities? Even prices at the lower-end dining facilities were high ... one dinner consisted of a club sandwich and a personal pizza, no salads, no liquor and no dessert, and it cost us $62! We went to the grocery store and stocked up on bottled water, juice, sodas, chips/salsa, etc. A bit of a pain to keep re-stocking the little space allowed in the mini-bar, but an extra refrigerator for your room is available (at a price, of course). We saved by parking ourselves in the garage, which was actually closer to our room than walking to the lobby for the valet service. My wife used the fitness club and found it satisfactory, although sometimes crowded. Our stay was lengthy enough that I wanted to get my goatee trimmed ... was told by the salon that they would be happy to do it ... for $30! I ended up stopping by a barber shop in Kihea and had the trimming done for $5! In general, we love Kihea and Wailea, and we would love to return. Not sure we'd spend the extra dough for the Grand Wailea ... our next trip, we'll probably explore the condo options. All things considered, we enjoyed our stay and found the hotel (on the whole) to be both beautiful and luxurious. Our expectations were met, but it comes at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but the Four Seasons is better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I (age 30) just returned from an 8 night stay on Maui. We split our trip between the Four Seasons and The Grand Wailea. We have also stayed at the Kea Lani on a previous trip. Out of the 3 resorts in this stretch of Wailea, the Grand Wailea is 3rd on our list. The property is gorgeous. The pools are fantastic and the fact that there's an adult pool is wonderful. The cabanas are $130 per day- if the pool service was better, it might have been worth it, but we very rarely had a server stop by to ask us if we needed anything. They were understaffed and overwhelmed and it was disappointing. Humuhumu was a great meal, but rushed. We shared a '97 Jordan Cabernet that wasn't even half gone by the time we were ready to finish our meal and therefore wasn't worth it. Kincha is very authentic; excellent sushi. I wouldn't go back for the full meal, though. The overall service just didn't compare to the Four Seasons. Our oceanview room, though nice, wasn't worth $800/night. It was really small and cramped. We paid a bit more at FS and Kea Lani for suites and in the future, won't do it any other way. The room service was poor. It never felt clean. Four Seasons blows them away in this area. We did take advantage of the onsite photography services and were very pleased with the quality and professionalism. The art that is displayed throughout the resort is fantastic. Check out the original Picasso lithographs- they're very lucky to have such a wonderful collection. Wailea is the only way to go, in my opinion. Shopping and golf is the best on the island. The restaurants are top-notch. Expensive, yes...but what do you expect? Sea Watch at the Wailea Gold golf course has an unparalleled view at sunset and the food was incredible. Sarento's on the Beach, which is run by the same company that owns Nick's Fishmarket, is also a great seaside dining experience with excellent seafood dishes. Both of these restaurants take you off the properties and still have great service and cuisine. Longhi's at the Shops at Wailea was also good food, however the view left a bit to be desired. The Four Seasons restaurants that we recommend are Ferraro's and Spago. Before leaving, I booked dinner reservations at a few restaurants for 7:00pm. After arriving, I changed most of the reservations to 6:00 so that we could watch the sunset. Most of the restaurants in Wailea have sunset views and it's worth it to take advantage even though you're dining earlier. With the time change, particularly if you're on the East Coast or CST, you'll be happy you chose to dine early.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive But Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cityplaner1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in February. The grounds are beautiful with lots of terrific artwork throughout the complex. The service could not have been better, never took more than 5 minutes for our car, never a line at concierge or front desk. The location is ideal - a terrific 3 mile jogging/walking path along the front of the hotel, 4 golf courses within minutes, a firstclass shopping center next door and fabulous secluded beaches less than a mile down the road. At first a little concerned, wanted an adult atmosphere - and there were lots and lots of children at the breakfast buffet. However, happily discovered there is an adult only pool. Yes, food and services are very expensive - but that's Hawaii for you. The resort's deli is very good - so you don't have to spend $$$$ for a good breakfast sandwich etc. Had a couple spa treatments....mixed reviews. Talked to several folks with same reaction. One day it seemed very rushed and an ok treatment the other day had the best ever massage from Tony. Our rooms were beautiful and clean - housekeeping was terrific - twice a day service. The only downside is that the size of the hotel makes it dificult to snag poolside chairs. People go down at 8am and lay stuff on them but don't show up for hours. It would be helpful if attendants were there to monitor that kind of behavior. However, there are always lots of chairs available on the lawn and beach. Overall the experience seemed very "Disneyesque" to me. If you love a big resorts with perfectly manicured grounds and lots of staff and spa facilities - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CeeMe
Reviews.Content: I've read thru some of the negative comments posted here, and I can't believe they are talking about the same place I know. Next month we are going to the Grand Wailea for the third time. I have never found this hotel to be anything but wonderful. The beach is gorgeous, the Spa Grande is incredible, the pools are lots of fun, and the rooms are beautiful. As for the slam to the general manager, when we lost something (not expensive) at the hotel on our last visit, he personally followed up with us, and though we did not ask for it, he replaced the lost item with a similar one and a personal note of apology. We love staying at the Grand Wailea. Sure, it's "over the top," but that's exactly why it's such fun. Experiencing all that this resort has to offer is indeed something that one should put on a "must do" list--if you can afford it. Yes, it's pricey, but this is the place in Maui to spend it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea-Worth it?”
Reviews.Author: cecelia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from nine nights in Maui. We were here in February and had a great time. The weather was awesome (which was not the case for the majority of the island) and were so glad to be in beautiful Wailea. In our opinion, especially in the winter, Wailea is the only place to stay. Now for the resort,,,As everyone else has said, the resort is beautiful. The grounds are lush, the beach is fabulous, the spa is noteworthy and the pools are great. But is it worth it? I am not sure. The service is poor. What I mean is that when you pay a large amount of money to stay at a "luxurious" resort, the service should match. It just doesn't. Part of the problem is the size of the resort. It is just too big. If the hotel had 450 less rooms and was on the same property, maybe then it would be as fabulous as it should be. The food is just ok. This was our 6th trip to Hawaii. We know how good the food can be. It was not great at the GW and bordered on poor in a few cases. It is way too expensive too, for what you get. A burger is 16.00--oh- but it comes with a bag of chips. Cocktails, which were weak, were about 12 dollars AND COME IN PLASTIC CUPS. A salad around 9-10 dollars. Just ridiculous. We ate away from the resort. We were lucky to go in Feb. and there were hardly any children there. It was packed, though. Several companies had functions there during our stay. And they "took over" the property at times. Others who stayed at the GW all day noticed it more than us who were out exploring the island. The construction nextdoor is visible but was not loud. But---of course we did not stay on that side of the resort. We stayed on 4 Seasons side. Those that did stay on the other side were bothered by it. . . and had no where to go since the hotel was 100% full. Don't believe it if they tell you it will be done soon--no way!!!! They were telling us March. I believe March if they mean March 2006. All in all it is beautiful. Will I go back? Not sure. If I have the kids, maybe. If I don't I'd go next door to 4 Seasons or to Big Island 4 Seasons or to Hyatt in Kauai (our fav. Hawaiin resorts).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea in Sept 04 for seven nights and had an absolutely amazing experience. We were upgraded to an ocean-view room for free and treated like royalty throughout our stay. The dinner at Humuhumu was definitely a highlight, as well as the magnificent spa within the hotel! We would most definitely recommend the Grand Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, but not the best place for a honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: CookieGalore
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a luxury resort before, so I decided to splurge for my honeymoon in June 2004. I saw the Grand Wailea featured on the Travel Channel and thought it looked like a fun place to stay. It was absolutely luxurious without being gaudy. The tasteful artwork and manicured gardens overflowing with vegetation and water elements (koi ponds, salt water ponds, waterfalls, fountains) created a lush environment, all while maintaining an air of sophisticated elegance. It was quite a romantic setting. However, the other resort guests took away all that romance - 90 percent of them were families with young (loud) children. The big draw for families is the miles of pools and waterslides. I admit, the on-property water park is what sold me on the place when I decided to book it. The pools are fun for about a day and then the abundance of children and high doses of chlorine grated on my patience and sense of tranquility. I made the mistake of practicing my snorkeling in the pool - I encountered a discarded hot dog! It was a good thing they had a wonderful spa, which offered free use of the hydrotherapy baths and showers with every treatment. I must say, those baths are like none other! 7 different warm pools with fragrant, brightly colored water. The showers were also a treatment within themselves with their massaging jets. Bottom line, the Grand Wailea is a great family resort. It tries really hard to be a honeymoon destination for adults with its wedding chapel, spa (great place to get away from the kids), night club, fine dining; but can't help being a water park with expensive rooms. I give it an above average rating because it is truly gorgeous with terrific service, but must warn all hopefull couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty, Class, Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the suggestions I had read here, I asked if I could receive an upgrade as we were celebrating my wifes birthday. I had booked the terrace room (least expensive) and was upgraded 3 categories to an ocean view room. The room was gorgeous as was the entire property. The Humuhumuhumu..... restuarant was very good and the superbowl was fun in the restaurant by the pool. The pool and slides were great. The temperature of the water was perfect. The beach was very nice also. I walked down to the 4 Seasons and Kea Lani to compare since I had read so many reviews here on all three places. I hadn't planned on doing so before heading that direction, and was in my swimtrunks towing my snorkle gear. Both places were happy to show me a room and the bellmen at both properties were very gracious especially seeing they would not be getting a tip from me in my situation. I toured comparable categories of rooms to the Grand Wailea. The rooms were layed out very similar at the 4 Seasons and the Kea Lani had a small living room plus a bedroom. Both properties were very nice but I paid almost half of what they wanted and they didn't command the ocean view that I had received complimentary. I am not a wealthy person and I felt very comfortable at the Grand Wailea. I'm not sure I would've felt that way at the other two properties.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If the Grand Wailea doesn't make you happy nothing on this planet will! To call the decor guady is to grossly misrepresent this gorgeous - elegent - understated beauty. If you are inclined to whine about the price, if you are looking for cheap you are in the wrong place. There is nothing "cheap" about the Grand Wailea. During my stay I occupied a terrace room over looking the wedding chapel floating in the koi pond. The room was tasteful and well appointed. Outside our door was a waterfall and pond in which sat one of the incrediable bronze sculpture which are woven into the fabric of the landscape thru-out the grounds. She was a mermaid child sitting half submerged in the pond ... I have never forgotten her. The main swimming pool is a delightful mix of cleverly concealled water park and deserted romantic grottos. While waiting for check-in we sat in the gorgeous open air lobby and partook of the complimentry pineapple and guave juice ... which served ice cold tastes like nothing else on this planet. You must walk the grounds and beach to fully appreciate this resort - around every corner is something unexpected and wonderful. We found an "unofficiall" footpath at the back of the resort that led us to the shopping complex next to the resort and in so doing found beautifully laandscaped "jungle" which we would never have known was there had we not wandered around a bit. All in all - worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently took a vacation and stayed at the Grand Wailea Resort instead of the FourSeaons, because of a friend's high remarks about the resort. Indeed, the pool was nice and my kids had great time riding the water elevator. But other than that, nothing we experienced was somewhat satisfying. The room had nice oceanview, but the condition of the room was poor. Paint was falling off from the bedroom ceiling, the bulb of the lamp was burned out without being replaced, and the tile was dirty, needed some serious scrubbing, just wasn't worth the amount of money we were paying. Dining experience was worse. Our first visit to Bistro Molokini, took 15 minute for a server to even approach us (the restaurant was only 1/3 full), the server seem to have no knowledge about the menu at all??Our entrees took about 45 min, and the pizza my kid ordered was terribly overcooked. Next day, took a diving trip in Lahina, came back found the room was in the same condition when we left. Gone for six hours and not a single housekeeper came up? Thinking of eating off property, but kids were hungry, so we went to the floating retsaurant which was recommended by the front desk staff. The restaurant was uniquely designed, somewhat elegant. Upon arriving, we noticed the restaurant was 90% full. Informed the hostess we don't have reservation, she asked us to wait for an opening. An asian manager greeted us and was very accomodating in finding us a table. Not a very nice table by the water, but the lobster tank kept the kids busy. The manager was very polite and calm, asked us if we would like to start off with drinks while waiting for our server. Knowlegable about the menu and wines, he made few suggestions. The server seem to be a little overwhelmed, he took our orders and rushed back. The food was above average, my wife loved the snapper and prawn, my $120 lobster dish had nice presentation but a bit chewy. My two kids had great time when the manager took the time and showed them the lobster and kept them busy feeding the fishes. Thank you very much for your hospitality!! The camp grande was also a neat place where your kids can lay on the hays and watch movies, but the staff was a bit aggressive. We wouldn't recommend the resort, but we would give definate thumb-up for the floating restaurant and its unmatched service!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned today from having spent 12 nights in Maui, the first half of the trip in Kaanapali and the last part at the Grand Wailea. Our reservation was in the cheapest room category (terrace level); however, we were upgraded to an ocean view room, an exceptional room with a great view. The staff bent over backwards in granting whatever request we made. We enjoyed the Hibiscus Pool which is for anyone 18 or older. Servers were constantly attending to guests at the pool. The last day we stored our luggage and enjoyed an entire day in the sun before using a hospitality room to shower and change for our evening flight home. We are already discussing the date to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I hated to leave this place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am blown away by the few bad ratings I have read recently here on the Grand Wailea. This place is UNBELIEVABLE! I took my wife, my 8 yr old and my 14 yr old (it usually takes a dozen friends, an xbox, a laptop, a dvd player and an ipod to make him happy) on Jan 12 through the 17th and we LOVED it here. My 14 year old had a blast and NEVER took out his electronics while we were here even though he had no friends with him! My 8 year old was amazed by the rapids and slides as was my 14 yr old, my wife and myself!! We have been to quite a few hotels and live in OC where we are constantly entertained and keep very busy but we missed nothing about home. The Pool.......What can I say about a pool that almost compares to an OC waterpark! The rooms are very comfertable and clean. Get a room as close to the pool as possible! The beach.....the best I have ever seen.....the water, the sand, the atmosphere, the view........I want to go back right now and I have only been home for a few days. All of my stays in Maui from now on will be at the Grand Wailea. The only problem I had there was with a valet the first day I was there. The guy was a ------- and told me that if I was going to self park that I would have to move my car within 30 minutes of checking in. When I complainedto the manager they gave me free Valet for the rest of my stay. I can go on Forever....Highly reccomend. Go check out the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family travels to Hawaii frequently. We stayed at the Grand Wailea in June 2004. The rooms were incredibly expensive, but we decided to splurge for the grand finale of our trip. We were sadly disappointed and left the hotel a day early even though our entire stay had been prepaid. The ocean view was nice but you must look over other buildings as the rooms are set back a significant distance from the beach. The water elevator (which was the reason we chose this hotel) was broken during our entire stay. The shower in our room was covered in mold and the room was not well maintained. The pools were overcrowded and the slide attendants were bragging about their exploits the night before as my young children waited in line. When I requested a discount due to dissatisfaction, the manager was rude and implied that it was my own fault the shower was moldy and would have been fixed if I had brought it to his attention sooner. In my opinion, the shower in a $600 per night room should not have been moldy in the first place. We completed our trip at the Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach which offers a friendlier staff, much better room rates, and nice (less crowded) pool with fun features for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and it's so worth the money. We got married in Maui and we stayed in Lahiana the first few days and I was a little disappointed but then we came done to Wailea to stay here and it is beautiful. The service is excellent and they are so kind. They asked if we were celebrating anything and I told them it was our honeymoon and they upgraded us to an ocean view room. The room was perfect and bathroom was incredible. We spent the whole two days in the awesome pool and on the beautiful beach and I still didn't get enough of it. The restaurants here are great and the dance club was fun. I hope to go back soon! PS if your thinking of getting married in Maui, get married on a beach in Wailea. The beaches down there are much more beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our family vacation at the Grand Wailea May 16-21, 2004 and took our 5 year old son. We could not have asked for a better vacation experience. Our five year old loved the pools. The grounds were gorgeous and well maintained. To make the entire vacation perfect we had a room with a great view of the resort, pool & ocean. Staff was very accommodating. Great family vacation for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: rfums2004
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for 8 nights during our honeymoon - it was awesome from the very second we arrived. The lobby was massive, open to the outside air and had tons of flowers and fountains. We had a "garden view" room that gave us a view of the chapel and also a glimpse of the ocean. I didn't think I would like staying on the first floor, but it was pretty nice to be able to sit out on the lanai (porch/balcony) in the early morning when no one else was around. The pools were incredible. I'm a big kid when it comes to waterpark stuff, so I had a blast doing all the water attractions. My wife and I splurged $125 for an all day cabana on the lawn with a direct view of the ocean - it was great - we just sat there all day in the shade, had lunch in the cabana, and left late afternoon after a nice relaxing day. The dining at the Grand Wailea was a bit overpriced, but the convenience of not having to drive somewhere made up for it. Humu Humu was probably more remembered by me for the atmosphere rather than the food, but I am glad I went. Molokini Bistro was an excellent restaurant and we had a great view of the ocean as the sun was setting. The volacano cafe/grill was also a great place to get some nachos during the day. We paid the "resort fee" and just parked our car in the self park which was no problem. I would recommend the Grand Wailea to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Near-Perfection for Family Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's provide context here so that readers with different needs can read on elsewhere: We're a family of three, fortyish, with a six year old son. We travel frequently and try to find the highest quality hotel or resort when we go. Travel is special to us, so when we go, we spend freely because we want what we think is the best we can find. So, were we childless, we'd go next door to the Four Seasons. Were we on a honeymoon, we would flee the Grand Wailea, flapping and hollering because the megalopools/slides/connecting canals/rope swings/hot tubs can be with shrieking, squealing kids, all having the time of their life. So, having said that, we all absolutely love the Grand Wailea and will go nowehere else on Maui until our son grows up. Even then, we may return to relive the wonderful memories we've had there (and, despite the caveat, the grounds and feel are tremendously romantic). OK...and the big slide is really, really cool. It is a huge resort on lavishly lanscaped, sloping property. Art, tikis, pools, streams, koi, hidden nooks to sit and zone. No cost was spared in the construction and maintenance of the grounds. Thus, for adults, get ready for a drilling on the cost, but if you're looking for a deal, go elsewhere. Maui's expensive. Reality. This was our second stay here. The rooms are large, airy, and comfortable, a substantial lanai is in most (or all?) rooms, as I recall from previous stays. We were upgraded to a suite that I don't even want to think about the cost. We're picky about beds and pillows and found nothing to criticize in anything on this count; same with towels and other personal amenities. The service was always, always prompt and friendly. Breakfast is $65 for 3 at the buffet (which we all like, despite our extreme aversion to buffets), lunches are kind of tough because the poolside cafe is relatively limited-salads, cheeseburgers, pizza. The restaurant choices for dinners are...OK. The main restaurant, Humu Humu, is situated on a very large salt water pool filled with native fish and is an excellent choice for a sunset drink, sashimi, tossing bread bits into the pool to trigger a feeding frenzy (probably shouldn't do that, but can't help it), on your way to somewhere else for the evening meal. The beach is perfect, if you don't want to body surf. Very good snorkeling is available on the reefs on either side of the beach. Rentals wound up being most cost effective if done for the week. I think it is $45, otherwise it was $5 per hour. We found moray eels, green turtles--huge thrill--the usual other reef fish suspects. Chased puffer fish and goat fish until exhausted (we, not the fish). The pool system contains so many interesting things it's silly. They're all landscaped as lavishly as the rest of the grounds. The top water slide causes screams in adults. The smallest ones interconnect one pool to another and are a pleasure to drift through. If you don't have kids and are still reading, this is the time to stop, because their kids camp deserves mention. It is teriffic. Our son hates kids camps. Always. However, the kids camp here was what he lived for everyday--actually night.
