They have a ridiculous number of the most current computer games and, if you don't want your kids to play computer games, their activities are creative, fun, and keep the kids busy and interactive until the movie time in the late pm. Our son did the camp more nights than we'd care to admit, at his insistence. Beach crab hunts, gecko hunts, crafts, kickball, scavenger hunts, all supervised by a teriffic staff. In summary, we happily give the Grand Wailea five stars for excellence. This is a resort that is structured toward pleasing all tastes, and doing so on a grand scale. Despite some of the volume-oriented necessities, such as colored wristbands to utilize the pools and such, it still pulls it off. While pleasing all people at all times is impossible, given how well it does so many different things, we really have no criticisms to level on the property, service, staff, fun, etc. It IS a place where there are a lot of kids, so factor this into your plans. We look forward to our next return.

Reviews.Title: “Still my top resort worldwide!”
Reviews.Author: asuwandee
Reviews.Content: The Grand Wailea is by far our favorite resort worldwide! It's gorgeous and the service is excellent. My husband and I love to travel (3-4 trips a year) and we always stay in luxury resorts/hotel. We were at the Grand Wailea in September of 2001 and we still rave about it! We've been to gorgeous locations and resorts in the French Polynesian, the Carribean and Thailand since and nothing beats it yet! We make it a point never to visit the same hotel twice for variety but we're making an exception for the Grand Wailea. I recommended the Grand Wailea to a friend for her honeymoon last year and it's become her favorite resort as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lvgiants10
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! Pictures do not do it justice. The lobby and the grounds will take your breath away. Ate dinner at Humu's, food was terrific, service was a little bit spotty but you can't beat the atmosphere. We paid $297 for a terrace view room and were told at check in that we had been upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room. The pools can't be described, but I have never had so much fun at a hotel before. Yes, there were plenty of kids, but it was still an incredible experience. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Go, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “definatley worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. It is beautiful! The buffet breakfast is fabulous. Complete with handmade pastries, fresh fruit, custom omelttes, and more. The restaruants at the resort were great. My husband and I looked at the other neighboring resorts like the 4 seasons and they are not as spectacular and they were more expensive. THe beach is one of the best in Maui and the gardens are a vacation all on their own. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is an expensive resort but it was worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “BREATHTAKINGLY BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: IT IS AMAZING!!!! The rooms are beautiful, the staff is friendly and courteous, and the food is excellent!!! You can go and relax in the spa or have a great massage under a tent outside by the pool. At night, if you're a guest at the hotel, you can get in free at their night club which is located within the resort. Also a good place to take the kids. The kids will love Grand Wailea's own water park and arcade area. The Grand Wailea has been on the Travel Channel for one of Maui's best resorts. Trust me, you WILL fall in love with this place!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous resort and vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a truly first class resort. My wife and I spent a week and we hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: jalapenojuice
Reviews.Content: Traveled in mid-September. Had an absolute blast. Pictures don't give this place justice. Resort was immaculate. Comfy bed. Huge bathroom. Service impeccable. The food and wait staff at Kincha was first class. Just a recommendation for the girls, if you plan on a spa treatment (which was awesome) plan on wearing a bathing suit, even if it's just a facial. You will have to disrobe!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh.......Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GinaBina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 12-day stay at the Grand Wailea... It was everything we imagined and more.... Being "DINKS" (Dual income no kids), we were a little worried that there would be tons of kids running around the whole time, but found traveling in the month of Sept (after most had gone back to school) was in fact a great choice for us. The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous.....just when we thought we had seen everything, we would stumble upon yet another sight, a winding path, or a piece of art that we hadn't seen before. While the resort is VAST in size, we appreciated the fact that getting from one place to another within the resort was a beautiful experience. On our nightly walks, it seemed as if we were the only ones there....it was truly wonderful!! The food is just fine as far as flavor and VERY pricey........(Think $30 for breakfast for one......, $6 for a bottled water, $15 for a hamburger, etc etc...) we found ourselves leaving each night and going out to dinner at the local places... If you like Sushi, be sure to visit "Sansei"....best sushi I have ever had! The drinks at the Wailea are pricey as well ($9 for frozen, $6 for a beer). All that to say remember your at a 5 star "resort" and not a convienence store, so be prepared to pay what they want to charge you for these items. On our 6th night there, three rowdy teenage girls moved in next door and were making tons of noise....think ........"Like I'm sooooo trashed"..(giggle, giggle, scream scream)....."Look a MINI BAR" Whoooo Hoooo....let's get wasted man"..... we were not going to spend the rest of our vacation listening to underage girls trying to handle their alchohol intake, while there parents were not around.........so, I went downstairs and asked to be moved...The Wailea outdid themselves on this one!!! Clarissa was absolutely WONDERFUL, completely understood our complaint and promptly found us another room. The 1st room we had was great, but the second room was absolutely gorgeous!! The lanai overlooked the pool and you could see the beach, sunsets.... everything!! It was the highlight of our trip. My husband and I will definitely be going back to the Wailea as our overall experience was truly wonderful..... Here are some tips for those of you who will be visiting in the near future: 1) Rent the refridgerator ($25 for the duration of your stay)...go to the grocery store and stock up on bottled water, beer, snacks, etc. It will more than pay for itself!! 2) Visit Cafe Kula in the resort for breakfast and save the room service charges or visit "The Big Wave" in Kihei for great banana pancakes. 3) Some more local restaurants to visit (More affordable and taste wonderful): Maui Tacos, Sansei, Longhi's 4) Buy a beach unbrella at one on the local shops...shade is very limited at the pool and beach area...a cabana costs $140 a day, and an umbrella costs $40 a day....it will more than pay for itself. 5) Be sure to take a morning stroll along the 3 mile Wailea walk path along the shore...truly gorgeous. 6) If you want to attend a luau, make it the "Old Lahaina Luau". It's the best, just make reservations early. See you next time Grand Wailea!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Paradise at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Huneyb8
Reviews.Content: Visiting the Grand Wailea was an absolute joy! I visited on my honeymoon in May 2004 for a week. The staff was very friendly. We were upgraded to the beautiful Napua tower where the views were breathtaking. The concierge was very helpful in planning our days, so don't be afraid to ask. There are several restaurants on site, pricey, but worth it! The beach is beautiful. During the evening, just as the sun sets, we watched turtles on the beach front near the Marriot side of the hotel. Nature truly abounds. It is true that there is some construction going on next door, but it's only in swing during normal hours so it's not a big distraction. The grounds are beautiful. Flowers everywhere, koi ponds, torches at night! The pools are gorgeous and fun. Don't be afraid to ride the water slides and act like a kid. If you have kids, they'll never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: cornich
Reviews.Content: THe Grand Wailea definately lived up to it's name. It was truly a grand vacation. We spent from May 28th through June 1st and had a wonderful experience. The staff was warm and friendly and very accomodating. We were given a beachfront upgrade after booking an inside room. THe rooms were very spacious and roomy, the beds extremely comfortable and the bathroom fantastic. We walked to the shops of Wailea several times during our visit. Very upscale shops. THe beach at the Wailea was very nice. Several times we walked down to the end (not very far) to the four seasons beach (in hopes of catching a glimpse of the California governor or someone equally important) but never did see him. THe pool is fantastic. We took our 11 and 13 year olds and they had a blast with the rope swing, the current slide and the lazy river however the water elevator is overrated. All in all I would definately reccomend this resort to anyone. I am ready to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Wailea from 8-21-04 to 8-28-04 and had a great, memorable family vacation. Thank you Grand Wailea and all the staff. We researched this hotel before we made our reservations. We read the web site and could see that this was not just a pool but a waterpark. That was one of the main reasons for staying here. We swam everyday (ocean and pools) and loved it. What a beautiful hotel...we loved the open architecture, the art and the relaxing atmosphere. A favorite place to sit and see the beautiful Maui coast and hear the waves crash was on the grassy area by the Hibiscus pool. The Pohaku (lava stone) massage was very, very relaxing. The cardio and nautilus equipment and weights in the fitness center were very nice. The 3-mile round trip path along the beach is another great way to exercise, relax and enjoy the natural beauty of Maui. We had a wonderful time and would return to the Grand Wailea without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and fun at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at the Grand Wailea in May 2004 and found the Resort to be excellent in every way. The "crowds" at the pool did not bother us; in fact, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves on the water slides, rope swing, water elevator, and lazy river each day we were there! (I should say that we are a fairly young married couple, with an eight-year-old and a two-year-old, so we're used to kids being around. We did not have the children with us on this vacation.) If you choose, peace and quiet are only a minute's stroll away at the Hibiscus Pool, an adult-only area that was quite tranquil while we were there. The resort's architecture, artwork, landscaping, and facilities in general are nothing short of stunning. The Spa is phenomenal - book your first appointment for early in your stay, because you'll want to come back! The fitness facility was outstanding, far exceeding that of other hotels and resorts, and included a juice bar, along with complimentary iced towels and mint face mist. Plenty of cardio equipment & plenty of free weights; you won't have to skimp on your workout. We had the opportunity to eat at two of the resort's nice restaurants during our stay; Humahuma and Kincha were both excellent. The poolside cafe is very good as well, and they will take your order and deliver to you in your lounge chair (although it is definitely faster to pick up your order yourself). It's kind of fun to have a drink and lunch at the swim-up bar as well; the warm water that's pumped from under the bar will keep you warm while you eat. If you're into manicures & pedicures, you can have your cake and eat it, too - in a cabana poolside. There is excellent shopping on the premises as well, and the Shops of Wailea just outside the resort entrance are wonderful, upscale boutiques if you choose to wander further. All in all, expect luxurious surroundings, great food, exquisite artwork, beautiful views, attentive staff, and endless pampering... just don't expect to have it all to yourself. There WILL be others at the pool, there WILL be some noise, but there are definitely worse things than being able to afford to stay at a resort as wonderful as this one. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but a bit of a circus!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyarvizu
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Grand Wailea and had a lovely time. The service was beautiful, the hotel truly incredible. The pool was awesome, though I have to say I agree with another reviewer who said to be aware that it is actually a waterpark. It also was a bit deeper than an average pool, (even in the shallow parts), so taking my young children who do not yet swim alone in was a workout for me, as I was on my absolute tip toes as I toted them around the pool. My kids loved the slides, but again, they are intense...I am actually surprised that they allow very small children on them at all. The pool area is intensely crowded and there is outright competition for seats. The prices of the poolside services were downright laughable...we expected the hotel to be pricey but 150.00 poolside hair braiding for CHILDREN and 85.00 pedicures gave us a giggle! The views from the rooms were lovely and the food was very good in the restaurants, although we enjoyed going over the The Shops at Wailea for dinner because there was more variety. (Tommy Bahama Cafe was awesome!) Overall, the stay was a delight. We broke the trip up and went over to Kanapaali for the second half, and I think it was a good plan. The experience at the Grand Wailea is wonderful, but also a bit overstimulating. We found ourself more able to relax when we got away from the crowds and the amusement park atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Puffjelo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Wailea for our Honeymoon in July 2004. The property is large and beautiful, the rooms were very nice. We were originally in a deluxe oceanview room, which was beautiful, with a HUGE bathroom. Unfortunately, the room was all the way at the end (the right, if you're facing the ocean), and was right next to a huge construction site; starting at 7am, the trucks roll in, and no more sleeping is possible. We complained, and the manager moved us to a HUGE suite with master bedroom, living room, wrap around balcony, and 1.5 baths. This was a great room. The grounds are very nice. Wailea beach is nice, though not as perfect as we had imagined. The river pools/slides/water elevator were much fun, though there were lots of kids. However, the resort also has a separate adults only pool with its own sitting area; we sat there, and it was nice and quiet. Here's my biggest complaint. There is virtually no shade anywhere near the pools. NONE. So if you have a fair complexion, you're in trouble. The only option that you have, which seems like a bit of a scam, is to hope that you can rent a cabana for like $140 a day. After the immense price of a room, charging for shade seemed unreasonable. We did breakfast and lunches in the resort, but went elsewhere around Maui for our dinners. We were given a coupon for a bottle of champagne if we went to one of the restaurants for dinner, but passed it up. Overall, I still recommend, but be careful of what room you end up in, and take LOTS of suntan lotion...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and fun, but too crowded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights here and it was everything we had heard it was: great fun-extremely crowded. My kids really enjoyed the pools and I'll admit that I did as well. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. The bad news is the crowds. Get to the pools early because the chairs will be gone by mid morning. The crowds on the beach are nearly as bad. Loungers and umbrellas the width of the beach and 100 yards long make a ghastly sight on such a beautiful beach. I advise getting your own umbrella and making your way to the far left side of the beach where it is less crowded and far prettier. Be prepared for the $15 a day resort fee and the $12 a day valet parking fee; there is no self parking. Great fun and beautiful, but if you're looking for a Hawaiian experience, you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good place - lots of kids, though”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dec 03 and found it to be quite nice. There were, however, a LOT of children! The room was very nice and we were upgraded upon arrival to an oceanview room. The beach is nice, but the pool area is the star attraction here. Because it is crowded, we had some problems - such as: waiting over 20 minutes for the valet to bring our rental car, and waiting about an hour for our room to be ready upon arrival (although to be fair, they did upgrade us for free and we were earlier than the posted check-in time). I think I would stay at the next-door Four Seasons next time to see if the experience is different, but this hotel is definitely worth the $300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Still fun, but a little rundown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Grand Wailea in Maui. We stayed there for our two kids age 8 and 4. The kids loved the pools and the slides, but I found our room to be damp and musty smelling. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea before when it originally opened (as the Grand Hyatt), and it definately need to be updated. Maybe the condition of the room depends on the location, ours was just above the kids camp. The pool facilities were very expansive, but I agree that they do not upkeep the area well, and only clean up the trash at the very end of the day. Pool side service was okay, but only seemed to be great if you rent a cabana for 125/day. I guess I'd stay there again for my kids, but if I was alone I'd stay at the Kapalua Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: travplaces
Reviews.Content: Jut returned from 12 days on Maui. Started out in the Kanaapali area at the Ocean Club (very nice) and ended our stay at the Grand Wailea. We have 3 kids 18, 15 and 11 and they were the primary reason we chose to stay there. We were all disappointed. Upon check-in, one of our rooms smelled terribly of mold and mildew. We waited around 20 minutes before the front desk acquiesced and found us another room, still smelled, just not as bad. The kids room was fine. We ventured out to the pool area around 3:30. It was disgusting. Half finished pina coloda glasses, food trays, soda glasses etc, were strewn everywhere. It was very hard to find a seat, people just leave their towels there all day whether they are finished at the pool area or not. People seemed to be very disrespectful about the surroundings. My kids liked the pools, but were not overly impressed. The slides were always crowded and the area always smelled like a water park. The pool attendants were not very friendly at all. The flies were ever constant also. The adult pool was nicer. The shops there were great though. The retailers were very helpful and friendly. The health club is AWESOME, clean well taken care of and never a wait for machines. All in all, our stay was fine, however we walked to the Fairmont Kea Lani for dinner at Nick's our last night and decided we liked the less crowded feel there. By the way dinner at Nick's was great, pricey but for a special night, worth it. One last thought, if you go to Maui and like adventure go on the Hike Maui Waterfall and rainforest hike. We had a blast, jumping off waterfalls into beautiful pools.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just read a horrible reveiw of this hotel. They called it run-down and musty. This is not the case. Its is lush and beautiful. The rooms are of EXCELLENT quality. The sevice is wonderful, and the pools are the best I've ever seen. I would HIGHLY suggest this hotel (being that I've been there lets see 10 times). WHoever wrote that review MUST have mistaken it with another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, and celebs galore”
Reviews.Author: jeopardy
Reviews.Content: Strangely crowded for how expensive the place is. Lots of celebrities stay here.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have had the fortune of being guest of this resort twice. My sister has been five times! If there is anywhere I would go back to it is the Grand Wailea. There is no better...and we have been many places! What a treat and what sadness to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time. Our first room was near construction across the street and they moved us immediately to a much nicer location. My kids couldn't get enough of the pools, everyone was nice and friendly and the pool area was kept nice and neat. We got a refrigerator for an extra $25 per stay and loaded up on sodas and snacks to keep the kids happy, and the cost of food down. We were at the Grand Wailea for just 3 days before moving on to a nice hotel in Kaanapali that didn't even come close to the GW. Next time we will stay put at the Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on the Island!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Grand Wailea every year for the past 7 years. We just can't get enough of this hotel! It is perfect for my two daughters(13 and 16) and is ideal for my wife and I as well. Contradictary to what other reviews say, the hotel rooms and service have always been superb. Everyone is very friendly and are happy to help out in any way possible. The pools are spectacular. The water slides keep my kids busy all day, and the adult pool give my wife and I a chance to relax. The food is nothing special, but is acceptable. However, just minutes away is a great shooping center filled with exceptional restaurants( I suggest Longhi's Italian restaurant). The Grand Wailea Resort offers great activities for anyone, and should truly be refered to as a 5 star hotel. It easily beats the Four Seasons!! The expense is definatly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married August 30, 2003 and we flew into Maui on a Sunday evening to our second choice hotel. By the next evening we were unhappy and did not feel that this hotel was accommodating our needs. (There was mold on the walls in the room and they were unwilling to move us to a different room.) Tuesday morning we checked into our first choice hotel, The Grand Wailea, and that was when our honeymoon started. The moment we drove up the driveway and pass the waterfalls it seemed as though our trip had just began. Upon checking-in we expressed our recent negetive experience with the other hotel and the woman at the front desk assured us that our stay would be wonderful. She not only put us at ease but she provided us a positive honeymoon experience. Our suite was beautiful and the grounds were out of this world. After checking-in we went to the connoisseur for new plans for dinners and such and they were very accommodating. (They even scheduled a romantic couples full body massage with Regina and it was a piece of heaven.) Our honeymoon was saved because this hotel knows how to treat their guests. We would definitely return! If we were to renew our vows it would be at The Grand Wailea!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort, Improved Service, Food Still Nothing To Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4th of July week at the Grand Wailea, our fourth visit over the past few years. The hotel is as beautiful as ever, and the rooms have been recently remodeled, and it shows. We found the service greatly improved as well, with everyone going out of their way to be friendly and helpful (although they need more service at the pools). The pools are the nicest of any hotel we have stayed at, and the spa is a cut above those at other "5 star" hotels. Also, the beach is right next to the pools, so it is easy to go back and forth. The fitness facilities are first rate--great cycling classes and yoga. Also, they let older children (who are well behaved) in some of the classes, and our kids had a blast in the hip-hop class and the rebound aerobics class. There are still two areas where the hotel is lacking. First, the restaurants are nothing special. Instead, try Spagos at the Four Seasons, and Longhis and Tommy Bahamas at the Shops next door. Second, renting a cabana is a mysterious nightmare. They don't seem to have their process down. You can wait on a wait list for days, and then hear nothing, or you can go down to the pool at 7am and reserve one. We traded off doing this with friends that were there (sharing a cabana with them). At $125 per day, they should put up a few more cabanas, and make the reservation process easier. Overall, great place for families. We will be back as long as we have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Grand" Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our second trip to Maui June 28th through July 5th 2004. On our first trip, we stayed on the West side, and thought it would be great to see a different part of the island. We checked into the Grand Wailea on the evening of June 28th and were greeted with an overwhelming stench of mold and mildew, and a wet rug and bugs crawling on the floor. It was late, so we went to sleep dispite the smell. When we woke up in the morning, we were able to see clearly how run down and old this room was. I had terrible tightness in my chest as a result of a mold allergy. We called down stairs, and were offered a different room - upstairs one floor in a smoking room!! As though that would help with my discomfort. We decided to check out, and went to the Ritz Calton, Kapalua - where the room was fabulous and fresh for 150$ less per night and had a wonderful, healthy, remainder of our trip. I believe the price of these rooms at the Grand Wailea are an outrage.. I do not recommend this hotel AT ALL. They are relying on reputation, but do not nearly offer the luxury they promise.

Reviews.Title: “very beautiful and very crowded!”
Reviews.Author: punkyjohn
Reviews.Content: the grand wailea is beautiful-- but if you are looking for seclusion- this place is not your best bet. the rooms were beautiful and clean. the maid service was good- they come twice a day and turn down your bed. they had a couple of pools but they were absolutely, ridiculously packed all day long. i recommend going only to the adult pool - if you are not traveling with children because the other pool is like "kiddie-city" they have slides, a water elevator, lazy river, swim up pool bar, and a rope swing. also-- good luck finding a chair at either of the pools- very busy. the cheeseburgers were delicious at the pool grill. the spa is was the best part of the resort! my husband and i had massages and used the facilities for a few hours. ONE PEICE OF ADVICE--DO NOT GO TO THE SPA IF YOU DO NOT LIKE TO SEE PEOPLE NUDE- EVERYONE IS NUDE WALKING AROUND! it didn't bother me, but some people may feel funny. if you do, don't go. take advantage of all of the baths and showers at the spa- they are wonderful! overall- i did not think the food at this resort was very good at all. we went next door to the shops at wailea, and ate at ruth's chris steakhouse. very good. the nightclub- tsunami- is very nice. lots of drinks and dancing! the shops at this resort were also pretty nice- just plan on spending lots of $$ there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but the service just doesn't rise to the costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at this beautiful resort. I must say that the lobby and grounds are breathtaking! Resort employees were almost universally pleasant. The rooms are nice sized and the decor is tasteful. As others have mentioned, everything at this resort is very expensive. That being said, I'm not put off by paying premium dollar for premium service. That however, is where the problems with this resort start. The service is not up to the fees that they charge. The mark of quality just doesn't get met. For example, orders were lost or delayed 3 out of 4 times while dining at the resort's restaurants. Not once was there a reason given by a server or manager. On our first morning at the resort we ordered breakfeast from room service. Only one meal was brought to the room despite two being ordered. When I called room service to inquire about the second meal-they said something to the effect that "we were not sure if you really wanted 2 meals so we only sent up one. If you want another, we can have it rushed up in 30 minutes." After sharing our single breakfast, we spent the day touring the island in our rented Jeep. When we returned to our room, half emptied glasses from our morning meal were still sitting in the room. The glasses remained even after stopping by the front desk on the way to dinner and asking to have someone come pick them up. They were still present after the nightly turn down service. They were even there when we returned the NEXT AFTERNOON after spending the day in the Upcountry. Finally, after speaking to a manager, I was able to get someone to come clean up the remainder of our breakfast from the previous day. The manager was very apologetic. He even comped a gift certificate to one of the resort's reasturants. Nice touch- but having a clean room from the start would have been more appreciated. The pool areas are very busy. Chairs (which are packed around the pool like sardines) are claimed early in the morning. Unless you are traveling with kid's avoid the larger children's pool. Although we would have liked to have laid out by the pool, we ended up laying out on the public beach adjacent to the property because of the sheer number of people by the pools . The SPA at the Grand Wailea was worth every dollar spent. I have visited many spas at various resorts and this is actually ONE OF MY FAVORITES. We ended up spending 2 half days at the spa and enjoyed every minute. The facilities are beautiful. Although some of the tiles in the men's hot tube had come loose, the place was spotless during both visits. The therme baths and waterfall showers are amazing. I guess to sum it up-the resort is beautiful, the rooms are comfortable, the expense is great, and the service is only fair at best. My next visit will probably be to the Four Seasons Hotel right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful money”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Beautiful grounds. Fun pools. Nice staff. NOTHING about this place was inexpensive. Do not go if you mind spending $13.00 for a hamburger. And $10.00 for a drink. Room service? Try $85.00 for breakfast for 2 people. The resort inself is really beautiful. The lobby is amazing. The fish in the ponds are really cute. They will come right up to you as if to say "hello" or "give me 5 bucks if you take my picture". Expect to lose weight at this place. Even if you eat like a machine, the walk to the pools from your room is at least 2.5 miles each way. If you want to be away from kids, do NOT go here. They are everywhere. EVERYWHERE! But they sure are cute. Kinda like those fish. Spent most the time by the "adults" only pool. Very relaxing. Take the drive to Hana in a Wrangler. Or save your $$ and go to an all inclusive in Jamaica...

Reviews.Title: “Love it more than ever!! But its a bustling place.”
Reviews.Author: fabfinds
Reviews.Content: We personally love this place, have been there three times. The few things I will agree on is its VERY expensive, its VERY busy, there are LOTS of kids, especially during high vacation seasons. We have three kids and brought a friend for our two older kids on top of that so we had three rooms, which were quite nice but nothing to die over. And yes they are very expensive, the pools are just amazing and the nicest we have seen, our kids love them!! BUT it is indeed a very busy place with tons of people..........makes you realize lots of people can afford this kind of vacation!! The restaurants are quite good but steep and we personally love the idea of getting in a car and driving to some wonderful island restaurant. Overall I would say this is one of our very favorite places in the world and we travel frequently BUT if I was a honeymooner and was getting married over a popular vacation time, I would opt for the much quieter, much less spectacular Four Seasons.........its a very lovely hotel, much more low key and has alot less kids.

Reviews.Title: “You MUST come to this resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to this resort in August of 2001. The moment we pulled into the resort we were stunned by the beautiful gardens, and waterfalls. The valet put our cars into the garage and were very courtious to anything that we needed. When we checked into the hotel we had booked a 2 bedroom molokini suite. Let me tell you this room was HUGE. None the less that was only minor to what the resort was all about. No matter what you like to do on your vacation this place had it all. It was right next door to a beautiful outdoor mall (the shops at wailea). You could lay out on the beach, swim in one of the 6 pools, go down the water slides, shop, eat, bike, hike, sightsee, you name it you can do it at the wailea. I would recommend this resort to a family that wants to go and have fun. No matter how old you are there is always something to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort!!....but mind the construction”
Reviews.Author: Moscoman57
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui and the Grand Wailea. A first class resort with fabulous beach front. Pools are exceptional. Best restaurant was HummaHumma.Service around the pool was wanting, and there is construction at one end of the building. Only two negatives I can recall. So, be sure you do not have a room near the construction site because it makes noise all day and on Saturday. Also, for any kind of decent ocean view be sure to be on the 6th floor or above.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: sharon2288
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at the Grand Waila. Based on some of the reviews I read I went with cautious optimism. The good: Upon check-in we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom in the Napua Tower (up from the Terrace Garden room - wow). I was excited, we ended up paying $325 per night for a room with a published rate of $825 per night. Much to my dissapointment, I have to say, it was just a room (perhaps a little more spacious), but nothing outstanding and as I read in earlier posts - actually a little worn and a little dirty. If I had paid $850 per night for the room, I would have been very upset. But on the plus side, when staying in the Napua Tower there is complimentary continental breakfast and evening cocktails and snacks. The breakfast was good and even included some type of egg dish in the morning and in the evening the open bar was great and the snacks good - that probably saved us at least $50-80 per day. One of the primary reasons we booked this hotel was for the pool - we brought our 5 year old. He loved it! I have to say it was one of the best pools I've ever been in - taking as much as 10-15 minutes to swim from top to bottom. I was worred before we went that due to his height he wouldn't be able to use all slides, but it turns out it doesn't matter. They let all kids go on all the slides that connect the different levels and just monitor the two ancillary slides that don't impact getting from one level to another. It was nice to be able to get out of the pool and be right at the grill. We didn't have any problems finding shade or getting a chair - but I suspect the hotel was only half full. The other thing I thought would be great was Camp Grande. I checked it out the night before I had a reservation and was told by some 8 year olds, that everybody was out night swimming. There was no supervision there for the 8 year olds. The next night (my reservation night) was scavenger hunt night. There were a total of 13 kids that night (mostly 8+) and 2 counselors. My son told me the next morning they went for their savenger hunt out by the ativity pool. That made me feel a little uncomfortable - two people managing a group of 13 in the dark around water. No harm no foul, just be informed. Food was average, so we ate elsewhere. We did the Four Seasons overlooking their pool - which was much smaller but had a much more elegant feel to it. Definately not a kids pool. If you like Tepanyaki try the Diamond Resort - they'll send a car for you and the food was outstanding. I've never had a 4 course tepanyaki dinner before (seafood appetizer, salad, soup, sorbet and then lobster tail, vegetables, fish, beef, etc. ) Way more food than you can eat -You won't go wrong. We did learn one lesson - don't use the conceirege to book anything. You pay full price and then find it half price or less at the activity stands dotting the island. I usually expect when traveling to get taken for a couple hundred dollars, but not at my own hotel. The staff were nice, but their didn't seem to be enough of them. In summary, if you're going with your kids (remember the pool) and you get a room rate that's not too terribly high I would say it's a fine resort. But if you want adult pampering, cleanliness and intimacy the Four Seasons is a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa Treatments at the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Maui, spend a day at the Spa! Absolutely unbelievable experience!!! I had the Zen Body Treatment, and it was great. You arrive an hour before your treatment, and experience the various pools/tubs, Japanese soaking tub, massaging shower, steam room, jacuzzi, dry sauna, and have a gentle exfoliation by one of the young ladies downstairs. The downstairs gals help you with experiencing the waters and showering, etc.Some ladies wear bathing suits, but most are naked. (The spa has a ladies' side and a men's side.) You have your towel wrapped around you, but are naked in the tubs. You don't get a robe until you are headed toward your treatment upstairs. Be prepared to be naked and/or see lots of naked bodies.After being called upstairs for your treatment, you are greated by your treatment person and escorted to your room. My treatment began with a pineapple/papaya scrub and exfoliation over my entire body. Rinsed. Then a seaweed wrap. (It got a little warm and itchy, but felt good.) While wrapped, she did a lavender oil face and scalp massage. Rinsed again. Then an all-over lotion application. 80 minutes total.Afterwards we lounged on the lanai for a bit to recover, and then spent a bit more time in the water areas. The treatment was $240, and you are supposed to tip both gals. So......... that was a $300 half a day, but worth it! Didn't buy anything in the spa store as I couldn't bring myself to pay $80 for a tiny jar of exfoliation gel or lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort suffers due to lack of personal attention...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Maui where I stayed at the Grand Wailea Resort. Here are the positives: -great location -beautiful, well kept, grounds -some well designed pools -decent sized rooms. -the housekeeping staff was wonderful, they truly went out of their way and were very informative. The negatives: - Staff - Overall, I found that the staff at this facility went about their jobs in a perfunctory manner, rarely going out of their way for anyone...if they in fact met the minimum of what would be expected. For instance, I dined at both the Bistro and at Humahuma and felt very rushed by the wait staff...with no effort made toward giving any sort of personal service. I definately did not feel that they earned their tip in either instance. I found the same lack of attention on the part of the bell desk and valet/door staff. The resort really needs to do something to address their labor issues. - Rooms - For a facility of this caliber, the rooms and thier bathrooms exhibit too much wear. For instance there were MANY chipped tiles in the bathroom and the grout looked liked it needed to be cleaned. - Hours - the bar and restaurants close too early. If you want to eat after 9pm or go to the bar after 11pm, then you need to head next door to the Four Seasons...they had a nice jazz combo playing. - Construction noise - If you want to relax by the pool, during the day, then I hope you can do it in the midst of construction noise. The Grand is building condos next to the Chapel wing and, of course you can hear the sound throughout the day. Overall, this is a resort that is trading on its past glory. I believe it is overpriced for what you are getting. If you are traveling to Maui and want the type of experience that you believe that you should get from this type of resort, I would suggest that you check out the Four Seasons or the Fairmont. Otherwise, say yourself some money and rent a condominium.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as always”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went in March as part of a convention group. This was the third time at this place for me. As usual, it was awesome. Beautiful grounds, great food, and the staff is always great. I noticed a few times where litter was present this time, which never happened in the past, but other than that all you expect in a $300+ a night hotel. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 12 nights in Maui. We went to get married on the beach and spend our honeymoon. We started our vacation at the Maui Prince. That resort was wonderful, we were treated like VIP's and loved everything about it. We scheduled the next four nights at the Grand Wailea. The minute we pulled up to the resort, we both became tense and upset. We arrived before check-in and my husband ran in to see if we would be able to check in early. He didn't pull up in the very front in case we couldn't check in yet and we weren't prepared to have our car valet parked if we couldn't check in. After about 20 minutes, I became restless and began to make my way in when I was accosted by a valet who told me I couldn't leave my car there. I told him we were checking in and apparently that didn't phase him because he told me if I left the car for 20 minutes, they would take the car and park it and charge $15. Growing agitated, I told him I would be right back. At that point, he insisted that I give him the keys. When I found my husband, he was visibly annoyed. Although we were lucky enough to have been able to check in (many in front of him were turned away even with reservations as they were "just too booked". My husband informed the desk clerk that it was our honeymoon and we'd like an upgrade if possible. Apparently, the Grand Wailea must get a lot of honeymooners as the clerk was completely unphased and didn't even respond. (The Maui Prince and the Ritz made it a point to congratulate us and even sent bottles of champagne). Another thing they apparently missed was giving us flower lei's when we arrived - must have been too busy. Thought that was a customary thing in Hawaii - especially at the nicer hotels. The room was nice and the grounds were definitely beautiful. However, we couldn't enjoy it as we soon noticed that the hotel workers union was striking (some type of contract problems with the new owners of Grand Wailea) and marched out front every day until 7 with bullhorns and signs. People were driving up and down the street honking and even with the TV blasting in our room, we couldn't drown it out. When my husband called the manager the first night, he informed him that at least we weren't on the other side of the hotel because they were right next to the construction (building some new timeshares on the property). He did offer us a $200 gift certificate to one of their restaurants and promised that the picketing was only one night. Of course, the next day, it started again. My husband called and spoke with another manager who told us that there was no way the first manager would have said the picketing would last one day becuase it had been going on for a while and they weren't prepared to make any adjustments whatsoever. We managed to get two extra nights at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua where we spent the remaining six nights of our honeymoon. And the Ritz was $200/night cheaper with an oceanview! The Grand Wailea does not seem to care much about their guests. It is DEFINITELY not a place you want to go on your honeymoon - there are too many kids. We loved Maui and plan on going back many times in the future but we will never go back to Grand Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Resort in all of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest resort i have ever stayed at. as a teen, i had soo much fun with my family. i loved the pools all connected by water slides. the service was very good and i loved our room with a view of the pool. this is the best resort i have ever stayed at in hawaii. my family loved it. i wish i could go back. having stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and Hilton Waikaloa in Honolulu and the Big Island, this hotel was ten times as great. it is along the line of Hyatt Regency Kauai. you will not be dissappointed. i PROMISE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel045
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 7 nights at the Grand Wailea in Maui. This is a beautiful and elegant resort that is well taken care of! The resort was sold out while we were there and things still seemed to run smoothly and didn't feel crowded. All of the staff we came in contact with were polite and helpful...the one negative aspect is the construction going on next to the Chapel wing. Our room was located on the other side of the hotel so we didn't hear any noise, but you could hear the noise from the adult pool and the beach on that side. If you go, request a room away from the construction...it looks like this will be going on for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 2 young children to the GW for a 7 day 6 night getaway just prior to the Christmas holiday. After hearing great reviews from friends and coworkers we decided to get a membership and it paid for itself on the first trip. My wife and I love to travel and we use trip advisor a lot to preview places and the reviews I read on the GW were very random. Here is a very honest opionion of the hotel.It is situated north of the 4 Seasons and the Kea Lani. I walked to both via the ocean walk/running path to check them out. The 4 Seasons is beautiful but it had a smaller pool than the GW (remember 2 kids). But worst of all was the humorous display at the pool with a group of fat, elderly, east coasters dripping in gold and swimming in white body hair telling the Evian mister girl "that it is too much" with that soothing accent.I realized that if it were just the two of us with no kids I would still have preferred the GW. Spago at the Seasons is fantastic.The spa "Spa Grande" was nothing short of phenominal. I don't need to say anything more there.There is an adult pool and the waterslides are for the kids. If you don't like children, stay where the adults are. If that isn't enough, go to the 4S's. If you are cost concious and will have a heart attack over $8 drinks then go to the Holiday Inn. Am I one of the few that can logically put these things together?After talking with a bunch of locals we found that the most crowded times to go (the times with the most complaints) happen to be those coinciding with school vacations. Makes sense right? Our stay was outstanding. We loved Kincha, Humu Humu and all the resturants. Saw whales from the room balcony and watched our kids have the time of their lives. We booked our trip for next year before leaving and are looking forward to going back. We won't rent a car this time. We never left the grounds but once to go to Lahina and the airport. Shuttle's go to the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: djrruns26m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GW in late June early July '03. I was attending a meeting. The resort was awesome for the entire family. Although it took a little time to get used to the layout and size, the entire resort was breathtaking. The pools are almost beyond description. There is a series of about 9 pools connected by a lazy river and slides. Extra features include the famous water elevator, bars, hot tubs, saunas, rope swings etc. The pools distract you from the natural beauty of the beach. Rooms are large, well appointed and boast great ocean views. The public rooms are beautiful and at the same time open to the outside. Don't miss the collection of art work. We also found the service to be very good for such a large resort. The meeting facilities are outstanding. The catering for our private parties were first rate. We ran into so many celebs, I thought we were at the Oscars, but realized the surroundings were too nice. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had a great time!!!!...we could only afford the least expensive room for our honeymoon and they upgraded us for free to an awesome ocean view room for FREE!!!!...the food was expensive but we expected that from Maui...the staff was really nice and tried to be as accomodating as possible...we didn't eat at the resort a lot because of the high prices but the pool restaurant was good but closed early like around 3 or so...the grounds were immaculate and it was everything that I dreamed Hawaii to be like...we spent 3 days at Waikiki and what a joke that was...10 million people everywhere, like being in Manhatten!!!...but Maui and ecspecially this hotel was great!!!...I don't think you can go wrong with the Grand, 4 Season's or Fairmont...they are all incredible!!!!...stay here if you can afford it and have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for a high end family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in February 2004. We brought our two kids-ages 8 & 6. This was the ideal resort for us. Luxurious and romantic, yet fun for all. I don't know how I would feel about all the families if I was a honeymooner, but hey, I'm 36 and I LOVE a good waterslide so if you are comfortable with happy kids around you, you will be happy here. Booked a terrace room (least $$$) in the Molokini wing. Our view was of the mountain and the 4 Seasons next door. After extensively touring the resort and taking advantage of its many facilities, I think the location of our room was ideal! Close to the pool & beach and also convenient get a cup of coffee and a quick breakfast at the cafe. We didn't experience any long hikes anywhere we wanted to go. We met a family staying in the Napua (concierge) while tir room was lovely, we had to take two elevators to get there from the pool. Ugh. The pool and beach area is excellent. It's windy and split up into several areas. I think this design accommodates the crowds well because we never felt like we were swarmed by people. We got the same spot at the pool every day. If you like convenient access between beach and pool, the GW is ideal. Both the Fairmont Kea lani & the 4 Seasons wailea are beautiful but you either sit at the pool OR the beach, not both. The pool area at GW flows seamlessly into the beach, including the public beach walk. It has very good feng shui in that regard. Meals at the resort were disappointing overall. Food at the pool is way overpriced and bland. After 5 days I was tired of the same salads and sandwiches. We enjoyed two lovely dinners at Bistro Molokini where the food was good but not memorable. Our best meal was the buffet breakfast at the 4 seasons-it was an easy early morning walk and a great food. Camp Grande was great. We never dropped our children off there but you can freely use the facility at your leaisure. There are video games and computer games and two nice toy rooms for kids. It was a great place to hang out before dinner. We also took the kids to a hula class and a lei making class at the camp. They charge a ridiculous $20 for each session, but the kids had a blast. Counselors were lovely and seemed to truly enjoy their jobs. About the spa. WOW! I booked a lava stone massage. After the first hour in the hydrotherapy baths, I could have gone home happy. The massage was icing on the cake. My experience at the spa was fabulous. I thought the staff was friendlyand gracious but not overly so. I had no complaints other than the fact that I spent over $200 in less than two hours. We were all sad to leave the Grand Wailea. The thing was, while we were there, we hadn't seen Hawaii! We couldn't bring ourselves to leave the resort too long. It's really a destination resort because there is enough to do (or not do) that you are completely satisfied. All of our sightseeing took place after we left and were staying in Kaanapali. The Grand Wailea was just too good to be apart from for long. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, the ugly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is most popular with families and incentive award trips. The reason to stay here is the water park, pools and spa. Nothing in Hawaii can match their water activities or spa. On my first stay I was in awe of the property and very impressed. The original developer from Japan spared no expense. However, a decade later the resort has changed hands and not as Grand as it once was. The rooms while a little above average, the bedding, carpeting and furniture are showing wear and the marble bathrooms while large have seen better days. To be fair the new owner KSL is replacing beds and furniture but will make you no guarantees that you will get a renovated room. If you want a nice room look into the Four Seasons or the Fairmont Kea Lani next door. Nevertheless, the room specials can make the price very attractive for the expensive Wailea resort area. A tip is to look into the Resort Membership Program. You can get 50% of the daily rack rate for giving them a $2500 loan for 3 years You pay a annual membership fee of $120 and get your investment back. You must join 30 days before your stay to take advantage of the savings and they will often run a special for $500 off the $2500. This can easily pay for itself if you stay more than a week and especially if you need more than one room. WARNING- we had heard their was "renovation" going on near the Chapel Wing. Reservationd lead us to believe it was minor. Let's be absolutely clear. Their is major construction going on next door for a new luxury condo. During our stay in early Feb their were noisy earth moving tractors and trucks operating from 8AM and 5PM affecting the Wailea and Chapel Wings that could be heard form the adult pool and inside closed rooms. In addition, be aware the Grand Wailea shares the same Beach as the Four Seasons. The recent storms in mid January took away a less than half of the beach and brought in many rocks. Finally, you will spend a lot of money to stay anywhere in Wailea. If you don't need the pools I prefer the Fairmont Kea Lani over the Grand Wailea and Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay at the Grand Wailea. Some of the negative reviews had me worried but I'm pleased to say that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was consistently courteous. Upon check-in we were upgraded from our deluxe ocean view room to a suite. There were a lot of children but the adult only Hibiscus pool area is peacefully quiet. Restaurants were good but we dined more often next door at the Four Seasons. Overall, this is a beautiful resort that we'd go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Super, Excellent, Wonderful with only one complaint”
Reviews.Author: prcted
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 9-Feb13. Wonderful pools, beach, ocean setting. Very convenient to Shops at Wailea. Stafff were prompt and helpful. Yes, this resort is not a budget place, expect to spend money for things. One thing we did to try to save a bit was self park, so we didn't deal with the valet situation, but the self parking was fine 90% of the time. However, during the middle of the day, the parking is also for beach goers, and was full, we could not find a place once, and that bothered me, seems the Wialea should have some reserved parking for it's guests, but I guess that's what they consider the valet parking for. I would highly recommend those used to staying a 5 star hotels to stay here...those trying to be on a budget would find it nickle and diming. We LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Wailea - grand but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from out first trip to Hawaii and had the time of our lives. We thought the Grand Wailea was great. The staff was superb and the hotel was gracious enough to upgrade our room and also gave us a late checkout until 4pm. We found housekeeping to be both friendly and English speaking which is not always the case these days and they always made up our rooms promptly and efficiently. We thought the prices were not any higher than those of any other resort that we have stayed in. We could see that with the pool being as much fun as it was that it probably can get extremely crowded with kids during school breaks. We were there from 1/27 - 2/4 and found this not to be the case. We are already planning to make a return trip. It was the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE SPA...ACTUALLY, EVERTHING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most beautiful and opulent resort on the island. My 2 girls (2 and 4 Y.O.) really enjoyed the extensive pool area...especially the sand bottom wading area. My wife had a wonderful massage at the spa which really helped her unwind (HINT: do the spa at the beginning of your vacation so you can relax more during your stay)...very friendly staff, esp. Zach. Mahalo. The room was nicely appointed and had a nice oceanview. I really liked the poolside bar. There was a celebrity sghting on the beach. People met Arnold Swarzenneger before he became govenor. The Hibiscus Poolside food was outstanding. Try the Paniolo Burger. There are alot of beautiful statutes and shops everywhere. Especially pretty is the Wailea Chapel which is now a Thomas Kindcaide painting. We rarely left the resort. I played the Wailea Gold golf course which was basically across the street. Try to catch the sunset daily...beautiful from the beach. Overall, this resort provided friendly service, very nice rooms, delicious food and drinks, and a wide array of activities there and the immediate area. We are going again in February 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not as expected for a five star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience at the Grand Wailea was okay, but not as expected for a five star luxury resort. When we made our reservations, we asked for and were guaranteed high speed internet access by the person making the reservation. We subsequently booked two rooms for four nights with the fifth night free. Upon our arrival we were greeted with fresh leis and taken to our room. The actual hotel itself, as we walked to our rooms was in need of some cosmetic repair, paint, cracks, etc. not something you would expect from a five star resort.The high speed internet that was guaranteed at the time of reservations was now no longer avail. They said all of their terminals had been checked out.The standard room sizes are nicely sized and the bathroom has a very large shower, tub and dual sinks.During our stay the mini bar in one of the rooms did not work and one of the toilets broke. The tile in the shower looked liked it could have been cleaned a little better.The hotel has its own television channel promoting their restaurants. We saw a dish we really liked and went to the specific restaurant to try it out. After sitting down we did not see the item on the menu, and asked the waiter. He said the video we watched was three years old and the items we saw on the menu has since changed. Again, not something we would expect from a five star hotel.The pools at the hotel are expansive and very cool. The beach is located right in front of the hotel which is also a plus. Would we stay at this hotel again ? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the Grand Wailea for our honeymoon in July and never could we have imagined a better resort! The staff, food, service and rooms were phenomenal and the pools/beach were UNBELIEVABLE! We travel once a year and this resort is, by far, the best we've ever seen. The hotel is amazing to walk through and we enjoyed every minute of our stay! Our favorite part was sitting in the exciting pool using the in-pool elevator. The slides in the pool added a LOt of laughter to our trip. Everything about this honeymoon was PERFECT! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everytime I had been to Maui I have always stayed at the Westin Resort on the Kaanapali side. This was the first time I had ever stayed on the Wailea side, and it was incredible. THis hotel was unbelievable. Anyone who rated it under a 4 is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “By far our best Hawaii trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Maui every year for the last 15 years and this was by far our best trip ever. We booked our vacation through www.greathawaiivacations.com and their knowledgeable staff pointed us in the right direction. We also saved money working with them. The description of the property, rooms and beach was exactly how they described it. We had a truly grand time at the Grand Wailea. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GW from 10/11- 10/14. This was our second trip to the resort and we stayed there at the request of our 13 yr old. He loves the pools. It is definitely a kid friendly hotel, but we only go during the off season. The beach is so nice and uncrowded in October that you can really relax. The hotel was just clean and posh as it always is, the service was excellent and I was not overwhelmed with requests to join their club. We got our $700 room at 1/2 price from the travel agent, we didn't need to buy a $2500 club package to receive 1/2 price accomodations. My only complaint was the internet service in the room. The browser they use for the hotel does is not the most current and some sites that I needed to access for work emails were not available to me. When I complained to the front desk, they immediately refunded the fee. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great in October”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just return yesterday from Maui. We spent 7 nights at the Grand Wailea. In the 10 trips to Hawaii this was the best. The staff was excellent, Lani at the front desk helped us in everyway she could to have a great stay. There were no crowds and plenty of space at the pools and beach. After reading some of the reviews prior to this vacation I was a little worried. I saw done of the problems that were mentioned in these other reviews. Maybe it was the time of the year. I had heard so much about the Four Seasons and a better place to stay for a honeymoon. We spent sometime there and found they had little more to offer and not as much in views and things to do. We certainly would return again, probably in Sept., Oct., Nov. would be the best time to go to avoid the crowds at the pool. Satisfied and happy.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Wailea - A Waldorf Astoria Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3850 Wailea Alanui Dr, Wailea, Maui, HI 96753 (Formerly Grand Wailea Resort Hotel & Spa)
